name: Border post Bahrain
description:
Exit from Saudi Arabia is easy and fast. Expect some confusion over your vehicle. They don’t know how to process vehicles, which are not from the region.
Entering Bahrain: they didn’t give us a visa  or entry stamp first time we visited, but they should! Visa on arrival, 14 days for 50 Saudi Rial (app. 12.00 Euro).
(Multiple entry visa is also available, but I don’t know the cost).
Customs was a problem: They wanted to have a deposit for temporary import, I show them our Carnet. They have no idea what to do with it! It took us two hours to pass customs. Maybe only the wrong customs officer, all cars from the region just pass through. 
Insurance is mandatory for Bahrain (as for Saudi), you have to buy it at the border post (last stop). You have to show Saudi insurance as well!
Going back is not difficult, but again you have to get the stamp on your carnet at Bahrain customs!
Saudi side extremely fast and friendly: fast entry stamp, easy and fast customs control.

name: Sudanese Embassy
description:
Sudanese Embassy in Bahrain.
Small place, door is open, no problem to go in.
Sudan visas for residents only, but ...
after some friendly pushing they agreed to send our request to Khartoum. 
We waited for two weeks, but finally got our visas (German and Russian passports). 34 Bahrain Dinar per person (app. 90 USD), to be paid in Dinar only, cash only (no Credit Cards, no USD).
Better to wait in Khobar or Damman, Saudi Arabia, because it is cheaper.
There is a bus connection between Saudi Arabia and Bahrain, if you do not want to go by car. By car can be a problem, see border post entry!

name: Sadeq farhan insurance services
description:
Sadeq farhan insurance services agency
 Bahrain

name: Quran museum
description: Nice museum with a lot of Quran, the oldest and smallest ones for example. Entrance free

name: Between Water And Skyline
description:
This is a very wide area, even for bigger rigs. There are entrances on both sides of this area, but I would suggest, coming from here:
26.215388, 50.615226
The view onto this part of the Skyline is phantastic, the place has been absolutely calm, no stress whatsoever.

name: Panorama View Onto World Trace Center
description:
This is a famous place with a perfect view onto the skyline of Manama and the World Trace Center, but it's well visited. In the evening lots of people and cars will arrive, nevertheless nobody disturbed each other.
The place is highly recommended for one night or so.

name: Refill and Cylinder Shop - Andalus Gas
description:
Here we refilled our arabic (blue) 3 KG gas bottle for 0,7BD (1,65€).
The store also sells gas bottles. DO NOT buy them here. These are fake bottles of worst quality of the italian "eurocamping" bottles, which you better should buy at Al Salam stores.

name: Gas Bottles Buy At Al Salam
description:
Professional kitchen and electric store, which sells original gas bottles from Italy (eurocamping) in 1, 2, 3 and 5kg.
They also told us, that these bottles will be used in all GCC countries, therefore can be refilled everywhere.
We paid 16BD (37€) for the bottle and stove of good quality.
Btw: "bottles" they call "cylinder".

name: ZAIN Shop
description: Here we bought our ZAIN SIM card (12GB for 8,5KD, 20€)

name: Lots Of Space, Nice Skyline View
description:
Huge sandy and flat area, very close to a PCR Test-Drive Through.
Dozens of nice place with a nice view onto the Bay Area and skyline.
This area is guarded and therefore very safe. Here and there police stopped at us, asking where we are from. No problems to stay here, officers have been very friendly

name: At The Beach
description: One of the very rare and not fenced areas along the beach, appropriate also for bigger vehicles. A little bit trashy, but nice so far.

name: Coastal Place
description:
Not the nicest place, but good enough for a one night stay, if you're heading back to the KSA.
Access is very easy, but the access to the highway is a bit tricky. You could take the one way street along the highway (as we did) and you'll find a way, after you passed the police at the right.
The place has been very calm, nobody came here, but it is a bit trashy and might be windy as well.

name: The Avenues Mall
description: Walk on the waterfront or within this mall downtown Manama. Shopping of all major brands is possible here or just get to know locals, like we did!!Nice intro to Bahrain.

name: IKEA
description: Free wifi in Ikea. Sometimes works even in the parking. Otherwise you need to go up in the restaurant.

name: Manama Souq
description: Center of activity and commerce. Nice to see local shops as well as tourist ones next to each other. Great walking around

name: Bush Camp
description: Quiet beach at the sea. Some litter. 2WD no Problem. bad internet. nice sunset.

name: Public parking
description: In village at harbor.

name: Bush Camp
description: Beautiful spot at water between mountains.

name: Public parking
description: Next to picnic place outside town. Police wanted to send us away twice.

name: ITTIC Tourist Hotel Persepolis
description: Just before excavation. Site on road within hotel compound.

name: Akhavan Hotel
description: Large fenced parking behind hotel. Ablutions open 24/7. Well known spot for overlanders. Good wifi.

name: Bush camp
description: Fantastic place in the desert between special rock structures.

name: Public parking in front of Silk Road Hotel
description:
Parking at public parking in front of hotel. Ablutions inside hotel closed at night. Well known spot for overlanders. Walking distance to town center.
You can sleep in or on your vehicle in the parking of Silk Road Hotel in the old center of Yazd. Nice spot and you can use the facilities of the hotel for free. Good place to hang out!

name: Tak-Taku Guesthouse
description: Stay with family in home environment. Parked car outside yard and slept there. Daily fee includes 3 meals. Same price as sleeping in the house.

name: Guesthouse  Garmeh (near Ateshooni)
description: Parking next to guesthouse in the oasis. Use of ablutions free with use of breakfast ($3) and dinner ($7).

name: Public parking
description: Behind public swimming pool next to park and close to busy road.

name: Bush camp
description: Beautiful place in gorge next to stream.

name: No Camping
description:
Large forest/park with toilets.t toiletten.

Comment: Park is only open for picknick. Camping forbidden, you will be removed from the park (even if it's after midnight).

name: Public parking
description: Parking just outside village. Public toilets in the neighborhood.

name: El Goli Park
description: Camper site at guarded part of park. Access to public toilets.

name: Parking lot at shore
description: Parking lot right on the shore, next to a modern shaped hotel complex. The only road access to the sea on a 60km stretch. Access from main coastal road west of big hotel.

name: Empty fields
description: Empty fields right behind the beach, next to a small factory. Access: East of Bandar-e-Taheri the motorway reaches the sea front. Right here you turn right, direction Siraf. After 50m turn left towards the sea.

name: Empty lots
description: Empty lots behind the little beach boulevard, in front of a newly built housing area. The track in front of the beach boulevard gets flooded during high tide. WC in little park.

name: Asiab Waterfall
description: Bushcamp near Asiab waterfall. Busy during weekends and holiday season

name: Bushcamp Lake
description: Bushcamp at a lake near Astana, not for swimming because of snakes in the water

name: Bushcamp Picknick Area
description:
Bushcamp on picknick area with tree huts, toilets available.

You need to pay overnight stay! And they lock the gate so you do not have a choice.

name: Bushcamp Street
description: Bushcamp on the street in Tehran near Turkemenistan embassy

name: Alavia Park Bushcamp
description:
Bushcamp in Alavia park in Qom, - a typical Iranian public park with toilets. 3G irancell reception. The shrine is about 10kms away.

Tent  are not allowed,  you can park anywhere on the asphalt.

name: Bushcamp Parking
description: Bushcamp on parking of museum in Abyaneh, toilets available

name: Na'In Inn
description: Bushcamp on parking of Na'in Inn. A local organised this and camping, toilet and shower were free

name: Bushcamp Waterfall
description: Bushcamp near a waterfall 22 km from the mainroad. We showered under the waterfall. We were totally alone. Only place where we could undress and shower in nature.

name: Ghadir camp
description: Camping in Ghadir camp. A campsite in a huge public park in Mashad.

name: Bushcamp Park
description: Bushcamped near a publik park in Quchan, toilets available.

name: Bushcamp Border
description: Bushcamped on the border with Turkmenistan at Bajgiran. Public toilet nearby

name: Chak Chak Fire Temple
description:
Chak Chak, fire temple. There is a nice offroad track to this temple.
Update: 2019 no more off-road track. Everything is tarmac now.

name: Entrance to El Goli public park
description: Entrance to El Goli public park

name: Parking close to Imam Square
description: Parking close to Imam Square. OK in 2017

name: Diesel in Nurduz
description: Diesel in Nurduz not far after crossing the border coming from Armenia

name: Junction to great remote waterfall
description: Junction to great remote waterfall. From it is 22 kilometers off road towards the mountains.

name: Parking near the Historical houses
description: Parking near the Historical houses. Not suitable for big rigs.

name: Kyrgyzstan embassy
description: Kyrgyzstan embassy in Tehran

name: Mausoleum
description: Parking near Mausoleum in Ardabil, despite the sign parking was ok

name: Parking near old city
description: Parking near old city in Na'in. Bushcamping is also allowed here

name: Salt Canals
description: Salt Canals in the middle of the desert 45 KM from Khom. Coming from Khom it is on the left side. You cannot see them from the road. Just park your car and walk a few hunderd meters into the desert.

name: Supermarket
description: Supermarket in Quchan a few blocks from the army hospital

name: Consulate Turkmenistan
description: Consulate Turkmenistan in Mashhad. Knock the tiny window in the wall.

name: Turkmenistan embassy
description:
Tehran, Turkmenistan embassy.
Knock the little  wooden window of visa section. For more details, read comments and browse photos.

name: Uzbekistan embassy
description:
Tehran, Uzbekistan embassy
Tehran, Uzbekistan embassy

name: Vali's Guesthouse
description:
Very nice places to stay, friendly and helpful. We came with in Volkswagen LT and slept in front and used the facilities for 5 dollars a night per car. Prices for summer 2017 are dinner 5 dollar, lunch 5 dollar, breakfasts 2 dollar, free WiFi and Freeb traveling tips.
If you want a Nice Carpet he can help you.

name: Maharloo Lake
description: Salt lake with dry flat lake bed suitable for camping at the SE end. The further you drive out the softer the sand. Our small Land Rover had no issues in December. Other months may vary. The further you go the more isolated it gets. Access is by little dirt roads that go between farmers' fields.

name: Canyon, Behind Abandoned Building
description: On the road to Bandar Abbas as you come through tunnels in the canyon, there is a bridge then a curving tunnel. Immediately after the tunnel there is an abandoned building on the right. Behind the building is a flat area hidden from the main road. The site is visable from across the canyon but would be invisible at night.

name: Azadi Park Parking
description: Camping on the fenced parking next to the park. Very nice camping place that is also quiet at night. Local people also camp here on the gras of the park. 100.000 Rial per car. Toilets nearby. 4G Irancell signal.

name: Shib Deraz Beach - Turtle Breeding Site
description: Shelter next to a Shop. Many pitch their tents here for turtles sighting. Between March to May, turtles come onshore to lay eggs. There is toilet facility 100+M away. Big rigs can park further West ward from this site, near to where the washroom are.

name: Bush Camping Site by the Beach
description: sandy

name: Homestay near Dr Nadalian Museum & Gallery
description: Dr Nandalian is an environmental artist and has a gallery on Hormoz Island. There are not signboards directing there. Ask the locals, Doctor, they will be able to direct you. Just follow the colourful paintings on the walls and you will find it. The museum is able to arrange homestay for visitors. 300 000 rial a night with breakfast.

name: Akbar's Tourist Guest House
description:
Guest house owned by an English speaking owner, Akbar. Homely place.

Nice place set in palm tree garden. Communal area with wifi. Room with double bed and ensuit 20 usd a night. Secure off street parking. The owner is very friendly and very helpful

name: Parking for Arg-e Bam
description: At 200,000 rial or 6.50usd I wouldn't bother going in. As you are restricted to walking only a small proportion of the site and can't get far into the citidel on the hill. Save your money and just look from the outside.

name: Shahzadeh Garden
description: If the 1 Millionen rial entrance and 100,000 rial parking don't put you off. These are a nice set of gravity fed pools, fountains and gardens. Have plenty of shady spots. There is a restuarant at the top end. If you are just interested in a shady picnic then you can access the lower area for just the parking charge.

name: Copper Hills
description:
Multiple camp spots dotted along various tracks heading up into the hills.
Turn off is a dirt track opposite a communications mast when heading south on the 82 from Rafsanjan.
There is 2g edge coverage from Irancell.
2wd access is possible to some spots. Other spots need 4wd.

name: Meymand Troglodyte Village
description: Interesting underground village which people still live in. Entrance is 100,000 rial for a look in the Fire temple/muesum and a wander around.

name: Meymand Wild Camp
description: Mutliple wild camping sites just off the road to Meymand village. Most have a shady trees and a fire place. Good Irancell 2g edge coverage. 2wd access.

name: Old Quarry, Kerman
description:
Rocky quarry camp west of Kerman airport. Access is via an off ramp decending and turning under the Kerman western bypass. Its easy to miss as it surround by piles of earth. 
Follow this road up hill 500m then start looking for breaks in the earth piles which lead into the quarry.
Strong Irancell 2g signal. But Edge (data) drops in and out.

name: Nagsh Shapor Hotel
description: Clean rooms and excellent staff. Management was very nice to gave me discount when I told them their rooms was not within my budget.

name: Qohrud mts wild camp
description: High on the hill above highway 78. Access is from dirt track leaving SW bound side of road. The track roughly follows power pole steep up hill. The camp spot is a flatish area on the corner before you reach the communications tower.

name: One tree camp
description: Nice Little valley accessed by dirt track off of south bound carragway on highway 65. I only stopped here for lunch. But it would make a good overnight wild camp too.

name: Qareh Aghaj River
description: Wild camp by dry river bed close to road. Access via grave/rock tacks from road. Low trees for stand and fire wood. Low mobile signal. Difficult pitching for tents but possible.

name: Diesel Station
description:
You can buy diesel and petrol here.
But be clear about the price before you start to fill the tank! 
he wanted 1500 T/L!

name: Bahregan Wild Camp
description: Multiple camp spots along low cliff top with views of the Persain gulf. Beach access by foot and swimming. Access via dirt track from highway.

name: Haft Tappeh Museum Grounds
description: Water is drinkable and they have a hose if you need to fill up your tanks.

name: Izeh Mountain View
description: Wild camp on hill top near communication towers. Access via dirt track from highway after climbing switch backs and leaving the top village when coming from Izeh. There is an area cleared of stones with grass and a couple of fire places. The local sheppards are friendly. Edge mobile signal for slow internet.

name: Beautiful Oasis in Desert (possible camp)
description: Quite far from the main road but there is a sign board and a track. A lush green oasis in the middle of a desert. Need 10 mins walking unless driving 4x4. Sand towards oasis is quite soft. In the vincinity, I saw some small building and dome like structure which is possibly accommodation. Toilets still under construction.

name: 3 tree camp
description: Wild camp in small valley with 3 trees. Great views of the mountains. Access is via dirt track/road under construction. Edge mobile coverage if you climb the hill to the west.

name: Alamut Valley View
description: Alternative easier access from dirt track at top of hill (main road). Suitable for most vehicles.

name: Police and Foreign Affair Department.
description: For visa extension. Opening hours 07-14. officially first visa extension takes 1day; second takes 4-5 days.

name: Guest House Hussein
description: Family run guest house with one room and twin bunk bed. Wifi and breakfast included. $25 pp/pn Secure off street parking for at least 2 cars in locked compound. Contact Hossein Sheykhlou, overlandtoiran@gmail.com or through FB

name: Diesel Fuel Station
description: Get your last cheap diesel before Turkey!

name: Bush Camping in Valley
description: A quiet flat spot for camping. After the pay toll for Abyaneh, there is a pond on the right. After that pond is a flat ground and also a dirt track that leads to the valley. Great for star gazing on a clear day.

name: On the way to Marivan
description: If you turn of the main road and take the first right you need to go up a short steep unpaved road and reach this flat grass land. It is suitable for larger vehicles or just tents. It seems to belong to a local family that hapilly wellcomed us but left shortly after. There is a toilet in a non-descript brick square and flowing water nearby. You will hear the street during the night.

name: Parking lot of Gahar ranger station
description:
The guard let us camp on the parking lot and also let us use his toilet since the other ones were to dirty according to his description. There is a natural water source as well, it is very quite but a little exposed to wind. You could probably shower there as well if needed. Beware that when we were there in 5/16 they did not let us pass to the lake, since you are supposed to have a permit and a translator... The road up there is very nice 

Comment: after getting permission to stay overnight from the parkguide, the police game at 24.00 , and said we have to leave and drive behind them to the city. after discussion we where aloud to stay till 9.00 o clock. ( the were looking for an excuse, bears and bad people). perhaps the next ones are lucky, or get the same problems! the place is wonderfull!

name: Ali Sadr Cave parking lot
description: The parking lot of Ali Sadr cave, cost 100.000 Rials in 5/16. Quite and nice, but the toilets were locked when we were there.

name: Caravanserai
description: The old Caravanserai is not fully renovated and deserted. You can drive into the courtyard and camp inside, sleep on the roof or in a tent. No people around. There is some water in a well in the middle, but the quality is doubtful.

name: Salt lake
description: Entry to the salt lake plane. The lake is not really full of water but a salt plane. It is wet however, so when you go your car will be covered in salt (Varzaneh has a car wash spot). The entry is a gate with a hut and a gate keeper, he asks for 50.000 Rials fee. After you enter, follow the tires that are put on poles or your GPS. Orientation can be tricky.

name: Camping close to the dunes
description: The spot is close to the dunes, you can drive on a dirt road and then stop right before the sand. There is an aboned hotel complex right next to it which is brightly lit at night but hidden behind a dune. You will hear the street though.

name: Ransar hotel
description: Found this simple hotel via helpful locals.  paid 500.000 for 1 night for 2

name: farsi name
description: Good brake shop. good guys

name: Hotel Karun
description: Most of the Guesthouse do not have parking space. This one is hidden in the back street with parking space.

name: Mozafer - Passenger - park
description: The place can get extremely packed with local campers; but otherwise convenient to get into town (we paid 10T for a taxi ride); copy of passport is required to register; showers were closed, toilets: judge for yourself … 'English teacher': as described before: use his 'services' if you need/wish, otherwise you have to tell him frank and straight you want to be left alone

name: Corrupt police control point !
description: Known corrupt police. They try to find something wrong.

name: Beach parking, few trees
description: Ok, camp site. not the best but you can swim there. some shops around.

name: Bus Stop Dasht-e-Kavir
description: In very bad weather we were happy to camp here. Behind a busstop. At night very quiet.

name: Cafe on the way to Masuleh
description: On the way to Masuleh we ended up at this cafe/teahouse, where we camped in the garden. No wifi ( although the sign says so). Friendly owner, but....he charged us a lot the next morning.

name: Garden Mohamed Reza
description: With his permission I share this waypoint. We accidentally met Mohammed Reza when driving by in this wonderful valley. He invites all foreigners to stay at his family ostrich farm. Not sure if this works when you drive by, but give it a try. Further up the road on the right hand side he is developing a cave restaurant. You may find him or his workers there. Say hi from us!

name: Imamzadeh near Qazvin
description: On our way to Alamut Valley we had a hard time trying to find a spot late at night. A very nice gentleman helped us out and arranged for us to camp in the parking lot of this Imamzadeh. On a sunday night the sidewalk is full of picknicking families. Very special experience. Toilet block is in the parkinglot and closes at 1 pm. Quiet at night.

name: Beach Camping
description: Parking lot with the typical Iranian picnic-huts adjacent to the beach. Toilets available; free.

name: Wildspot Close To Agarak
description: On our way to the bordercrossing with Armenia we found this spot with a beautiful view. Quiet, away from the road. Remains of campfires, sp probably a picknickspot.

name: Tourist resort
description: Typical tourist resort for Iranians. By the sea. Camping possibilities as well as cabin rentals in various classes. We camped here for 50.000 Real.

name: River Spot
description: Great spot at the end of the village next to electricity building. Roaring river. Few villagers come by, very friendly. Nice view.

name: Wildspot Chelgerd
description: Great spot next to gletsjer and river. We did to camp overnight, but picknicked here. Spectacular surroundings. On the way to Saraghaseyed village ( we did not make it because of the bad condition of the road/melting snow).

name: Riverside
description: Nice place to stop with shade and river.

name: Wildspot Old Road
description: Follow the old road for a few kms to get here. Secluded spot. Nice view.

name: Wildspot Nuq
description: Great secluded spot in deep valley. Only a big herd came by.

name: Road side Mosafer/camping. with toilet
description: cooler than downtown

name: mahan
description: best place for rest And close to the sea...

name: Lake close to Damghan
description: Camping at a nice lake surrounded by mountains. Lots of places to stay, sometimes a bit windy.

name: Margoon Valley Wildcamp
description: Beautiful quite spot in a valley. Road is at other side of mountain so you don't hear or see anything. Camp is halfway between Ardakan and Margoon Waterfall. 4x4 is not required but a little bit of high clearance is. Valley is accessible via little dirt road starting 500 meter north of spot.

name: Mountain View Wildcamp
description: Beautiful spot in middle of nowhere:-). Enter dirt road via 31.07073, 53.04776 from there follow the track, you will find it

name: Parking Olympic Hotel
description: We went to a few parks in this area but locals dont overnight in those parks and they told us it is not safe to stay. Eventually we found this hotel where we could camp on parking. We had to pay 30 usd. For us this is a real backup as it was getting too late to find anyting else. Today we will continue our search for a park to overnight. Off course we will add this to iOverlander.

name: Taleghani Forest Park
description: Streetcamp on parking area at park entrance. We didn't camp here but some overlanders did and is should be safe.  Lot of picknicking locals and close to subway. Toilets in park. Parking, camping is free.

name: Khayam Hotel
description: Camping on private parking but you need to take a room to camp. We took the cheapest room (single room) and with discount we paid 24usd p/night including breakfast. In the middle of Tehran and 10 min walk from subway. Shared bathroom, free WiFi and friendly staff.

name: Dizin Parking Bush Camp
description: We camped on this big empty parking lot next to the road but you can basically camp anywhere along this road trough the mountains, locals do it too. We don't know if you can also camp on this parking during ski season.

name: Lake Valasht Bush Camp
description: Nice camp spot at the quiet side of the lake. Locals camp at this lake as well but most of them at the other side where there is a toilet as well. We had to pay 50.000r to access the lake.

name: Imam Reza Expressway Bush Camp
description: Nothing special just one of the many spots along the highway. This spot is on a unused road next to the highway, not visible from the highway. Amazing sunset view over city.

name: Sand Mining Bush Camp
description: Bush camp at (we think) small abandoned sand mining place in between fields. Access via little dirt track, only few cars passed but didn't stop and they only waved. Hardly visible from main road.

name: Sand Mining Bush Camp
description: Just a hundred meters from the road but completely invisible in this abandoned little sand mining area. On the road between Tabriz and Masouleh. Please enter or exit Masouleh via the gravel road west of Masouleh, it has amazing views!

name: Laundry
description: Esfahan Laundry 24 h Service, 380.000 Rial one machine

name: Marco Polo Rooftop Rest. In Orient Hotel
description: In Orient Hotel. Food was great. 130,000 for a small chicken curry with rice and a tasty shuli soup. Better than Silk Road hotel

name: Wild camp in small valley
description: Next to the unpaved road but perfectly hidden behind hills and pretty quiet. Nice landscape. On our way from Zanjan to Masuleh. No cell reception at all.

name: Wildcamp near freeway to Qazvin
description: 5 minutes from the freeway. Nicely hidden in what looks like an old gravel mine. Flat and even ground, suitable for pitching a tent. Access via dirt road, doable with most 2wd vehicles, as long as the rig is not too large. No cell reception.

name: Emam Khomeni mausoleum
description: Huge parking and camping area. Lots of locals tent camping here even at this time of the year. Big facilities (bathrooms and for dish washing), did not spot showers, but a sign saying "bath" so there might be some onsite. Everything's pretty new, modern and big. Subway access to Tehran available. Irancell LTE.

name: Next to a ruined fortress with great village view
description:
We only had lunch here, but camping should not be a problem. It is next to the fortress you see from the village side. Said this - you have a great view to the village from here!
You have to take the first gravel road to the left from the street to lower Abyaneh just after the toll hut. Then follow the 4x4 tracks, Google satellite can help to find the way.
Irancell Edge coverage.

name: Iran Tourism Hotel
description: Possible to stay in the car; after negotiation 200,000 rial per night; food not that great

name: Money Exchange- Rahim
description: one and only possibility to exchange Euro to Rial

name: Merikhi Mountains
description: Follow track from given coordinates; many options

name: Mashal Gas Qeshm
description: Refill of gas possible. Very fast. 5 l costs 80.000 Rial which is about 2€.

name: Shabhaye Talai
description: Parking Lot directly at the beach. Ask for Ali & Annelie at the gate. They offer basic accommodation (shared bathroom). Very nice and helpful. Kiosk to by some drinks and restaurant.

name: Hot Spring - Nayband
description:
Hot natural source. Roughly 45 degrees. Bath for woman and men are separated. 
50.000 Rial per person. (1,20€)
We went as a couple both into women swimming pool. Hot natural shower. 
Possibility to stay overnight at parking area. 
Gas station and shops nearby
Toilets available. 
Big campers will fit in.

name: Morteza Ali
description: Coordinates from entrance, follow unpaved road down to the picnic area; follow the river into the canyon to a hot spring; follow the paved road to a big parking area (no toilet), stairs down to the picnic area

name: MTN Bandar Abbas
description:
Pre-Paid SIM Card Provider

MTN Bandar Abbas

name: Visa Extensions Office
description: Here's the immigration office. They send us away 2 days before expiration of our visa and said we should come back on our final day. We did and they wanted to give us 10 days at first, had to bargain to get 30. Period allowed seems to be pretty random and depends on officer in charge that day. Esfahan should be an easier place from what we heard..

name: Garmeh - Oasis near natural spring of water
description:
Nice Spot in Garmeh. Lockres North of Oasis. Follow Track from guesthouse to North
Silent Place. Natural watersource nearby
Can camp for free and eat/shower at local guesthouse.

name: MTN Iran cell in Mashhad- good internet coverage apparently.
description: MTN Iran cell - very helpful and speak a little English. Approx $10usd for 1 month and 3gb data

name: Mountain top near Kang
description: Good spot about 100m off road to a flattish area.  Well hidden from road and very few passing cars.  4x4 required to climb to flat spot from road. No Internet.

name: Radkan AstronomybTower
description:
DAY USE ONLY!

Big old Astronomy tower. In 2018: 80,000 rials per person to visit. 

Only parking along the road. Access to the area around the tower is no longer possible.

name: Buschehr Parkin Park Beach
description: You Can Park here going to beach or hanging in the park (nice green Park with fitness area). Camping with van is no problem you have dirty toilets, but the beach is nice (you have to go the stairs down to beach).

name: Park at the beachside
description:
You can park next to the sea. There are toilets in bad condition but working. 
Iranians do camp here as they do everywhere. 
There is a little sand beach and people do swim.
The spot is at the side of a road so it mid be noisy in the night.
There is also a playground and some trees spending shadow.

name: Diesel/Gazoil
description: Diesel available. You need to find somebody with a diesel-card. Just wait a bit for a trucker. The owner doesn't have a diesel card.

name: Akbar Tourist Guest House
description:
You can park inside and sleep in the van (just small cars like VW bus). Use toilet and shower and meet other travelers 

This is not longer possible! You can only book a room for 15€/20$.

name: Diesel station
description: Diesel station

name: Tourist Inn Hotel  WARNING
description:
It's the only place to stay in Mirjaveh.
You want be able to camp outside.
Being the only Hotel they want to charge you insane prices( first 75dollars for two persons we paid 40 then) The room is a mess really ugly and dirty. 
No electricity in the room, it smells bad etc...

So we highly recommend you to stay in Zahedan and find a place there.

name: Maranjab Castle desert camp
description: ADMIN NOTE: Userreports under new management, Unverified. 100,000 Rials to enter road to castle (50,000 each person).  40km sandy road.  We asked permission to camp nearby and set up 300-400 metres from castle.  Small shop onsite and toilets nearby.  For absolute privacy you could easily camp off the road to the castle.

name: Money exchange-Tabriz
description:
Lots of exchange offices
2016.11.17: 1€=39.990 IRR

name: Wild camp next to mountains
description: Great flat spot, 4/5km from road.  Exit road here at end of barrier 31.063804 53.041452 and just find your way.

name: Wild camp up dirt road
description: Very quiet spot couple of km up a dirt road.  Windy at night.

name: Persepolis car park
description:
Admin note: user reports:"this place is very safe with a police station in front.to go far away from the entrance it is very quiet"
Huge car park near entrance.  We paid 100,000 rial.  Quiet in evening.  Suggest park at north eastern fence to avoid passing traffic.

name: Plantation camp
description: Free camp, nice and quiet, some local visitors

name: Top of valley about 1/2km off road
description: Nice spot at top of small valley - there are remains of buildings and fires.  Flat spots to camp and very private.

name: Bandar e Hasineh
description: Nice place between a small unpaved way along the seaside. Twenty meters away from the beach.

name: Izad Khast caravansary
description: Camping behind caravansary- lovely sunlit vine of village in morning.

name: Hotel Kosar
description: 750,000 Rials per night in December, twin room with shared bathroom.  Clean and friendly.  Very helpful and friendly people working here.  Secure parking if you are less than 2.5m tall.  Good wifi in reception area.

name: Visa extension- Passport and Aliens Office
description: Can park on street outside.  No mobile phones - check in at desk or leave in your vehicle.  Need 1 copy each of passport main page plus Iran visa and entry stamp plus 2 passeport size photos.  345,000 Rials (Dec'16) paid at Melli bank which is 0.5km west on same road.  20,000 Rials admin fee to police behind counter.  Opens at 8am - arrive early as gets busy.  30 days possible. We applied 3 days before expiry.

name: Beach side camp
description: Beautiful spot for sunset and sunrise.  Flat areas to camp.

name: Flat desert amongst the trees
description: Nice flat spots on hard sand.  Pick your way through the thorny trees and there are plenty of options.  Little traffic, very quiet otherwise

name: Falafel
description: Great falafel joint in an otherwise 'food limited' town

name: Desert camp
description: Flat spots everywhere- very good spot.  Suggest drive little further to avoid road noise

name: Desert camp near kalouts
description: Fantastic spot 2.5km off road.  Sandy roads, some soft sand but should be ok with 2wd if careful.

name: Old farm buildings near Chak Chak
description: Good flat spots around abandoned farm buildings.  Interesting to explore buildings.  Very cold at night and can shelter from wind behind walls.

name: Flat spots past military base
description: 10-20km past military base, very easy camping on north side of road.  Very flat and hard gravel suitable for any vehicle

name: Toyota/Lexus service centre
description: Very good service - some of the guys speak quite good English.  They did oil change and drive/AC belts for me.  Located at car wash site at far right corner.

name: Wild camp off highway
description: Good flat spots anywhere in the area.  If heading west look for the underpass then it's a dirt track all the way. Even 2km away can hear road so suggest driving little further than we did.

name: Mountain view camp in farmland
description: Flat spot next to empty cabin.  Hard to see from road but follow track down hill and turn right. Beautiful mountain views

name: Hostel Amir Kabir
description: Camping on the parking behind Amir Kabir Hostel. We paid USD 5 pp/ pn incl breakfast, free wifi and shared bathroom. It is located on the main road and you can easily walk to the popular sights.

name: Alamut
description: Just beside the road. Drive into the meadows on the left side.

name: Beach drive
description: Long drivable beach with a lots of places to set up. Few motorcycle come by. Sand is okay for 2wd with care. Irancell edge connection available.

name: lpg refill
description: garage filling station

name: Ferry Custom Office
description:
Visit this place befor boarding the ferry with passport, carnet and car papers.
Nothing to pay at the office. 
The ferry 2-way with 2 person is 700 000 IRR (~17€)

name: Alvars Mountains, Iran
description: Camp spot near nomadic camps at a small creek. Busy during summer weekends.

name: Babak Castle, Iran
description:
In the mountains next to a nomadic camp. You can buy bread from the nomads. Good starting point to visit Babak castle.
4x4 an advantage.

name: Bam Citadelle
description: Car park in front of the old town. Guarded. We asked for permission at the guard and it was no problem.

name: Bandar Abbas Car Park
description: Car Park close to town and sea. Good to stay for one night.

name: Bayazeh
description: In the street of the village. No water, toilet or showers.

name: Dandi Park
description: Noisy until mid night, lot of youngsters driving through the park with motor bikes.

name: Backpack Hostel
description: You can park right in front of the Backpack hostel, even parking behind the Hostel Is possible. Wifi and showers are available for very small Price. The Manager is really friendly and helps wherever he can. www.yazdbackpacker.com

name: Beach camp
description: Well known place for Iranians on weekends. Restaurant nearby (1.5 km). The beach is lit at night. Be careful of the soft sand & tide coming in. Litter as on every beach in Iran...

name: Enqelab Mall Parking
description: Quiet parking, close to the center. The parking closes doing the night so no more people insight and do to the office Buildings all around its quiet in the night. Toilets in the mall, but not after 10pm. We asked the security guide and it was no problem to stay over night. We payed for the parking.

name: Petrol / Diesel Station
description: We thought we are really smart filling the tank withe cheap Diesel at the last moment in Iran. But that is the last gas station und probably the only one around. Normale Diesel was 600 (withe out Diesel Card) here they wanted 1.200 we negotiated it to 1.000 but still almost double the price! Better fill up the tank in Zahedan.

name: Evan Lake
description: Beautiful lake in Alvorz Mountains. During holiday season and weekends it might be busy.

name: Gilavan2Masuleh
description: Beautiful view over Masuleh Mountains, overnight stop before visiting Masuleh. Edge with MCI.

name: Kavir desert
description: Wild camping close to the dunes. 4x4 necessary.

name: Kavir desert
description: Spot close to an abandoned farm house with natural water source.

name: Lut desert
description: One of many fantastic spots in Lut. Come to watch the stars and enjoy the silence.

name: Lut desert
description: Again one of the fantastic spots in Lut to watch stars and enjoy silence.

name: Mesr - Farahzad
description: Between the dunes in Kavir desert. Come and watch the stars.

name: Abgarn
description: Near Abgarn, close to the street, overnight stop only.

name: Chak-Chak
description: Close to Chak-Chak fire temple.

name: Zagros
description: Cool place during summer time. No service.

name: Maymand
description: Lonely place near Maymand village.

name: Nour Valley
description: abandoned farmhouse overlooking nour valley. You can park behind the building and hide your car a bit from the road.

name: Pasargadae
description: Car park in front of the monument, very quiet at night. Maybe locked, ask that someone around to open it.

name: Shadad
description: A campsite, currently closed and under construction, but you can stay in front of the camp site

name: Songor Vey
description: Good overnight spot close to the road. We have had tea with a shepherd and his sons.

name: Status valley
description: quiet place close to a village.

name: Taq-e Bostan
description: Park as usual very busy and loud during holiday season and weekends.

name: Beach Camping
description: good place to stay overnight and take a bath without chador, ...

name: Wild camping
description: beautiful place not far away from the road, very quiet during the night. Maybe during summer there are nomads around this area.

name: Wild camping
description: wild camping in the middle of nowhere

name: Wild Camp
description: wild camp not far away from road, very quiet during the night.

name: Desert Camp
description:
Empty plain desert with some hills. Good spot to sleep before border crossing to Pakistan (80 km).
Good 3G signal.

name: Camping at the gasfires
description: spent the night here with surreal view of the gas fires on the other side of the bay. something unique to perceive. locals came by night. place is quiet though. military checked the passports but said no problem to stay.

name: bandar abbas parking east end
description: Parking near the sea with toilettes on the east end of BA. A lot of locals with tents. Can be very crowded. Area is quite big. There is water available for cleaning dishes. Low water pressure though.

name: camp near quiet little harbour
description: easy to reach. quiet clean place with friendly locals. if you are lucky you meet fishermen who sell fish out of the boat.

name: transit insurance for overlanders
description: entrance across melli bank 3rd floor you find an insurance company that gives you transit insurance for cars with foreign plate (240000 Toman). was the only insurance that took us (tried 4 companies).

name: Madali Home Stay
description: Probably the best Overlander Spot on the Island if you want to meet a very nice family and dog. Food just awesome. Beautyful rural house with basic rooms and chill out places. Was under construction when we were here for 3 nights. Huge progress every day.

name: 7 hostel
description: A hostel with European standards, with a really friendly manager. perfect place for skiing in Dizin. We really liked the place!  After a month they will relocate somewhere close, but the name should be the same. So just ask in the village. They ask 20 usd (shared room) or 45 usd (private room) for one night.

name: Aftab Beach
description: About 35 km southwest of Aftab, where can get a ferry to Kish. Beautiful landscape between Aftab and this site.

name: Asalouyeh
description: Gas refill bottle to bottle, adapter needed. 100.000 Rial

name: Isfahan Exchange Office
description: You can get money with credit card here and even can transfer money before you travel to Iran and get it here. Name: Bornaee Exchange Office, Web: http://www.borex.ir Instagram: bornaee_exchange

name: Varzaneh Dunes HST
description: About 10 km behind Varzaneh a track leads to this place. Beautiful to Camp overnight. 2G available, 4x4 necessary.

name: Amirabad Mountains
description: Beautiful place in the mountains near Amirabad.

name: Jafarabad Dune
description: A few kilometers from the road at the end of a valley. Tabas is 75 kilometers away. Dunes and Mountains around you.

name: Deh-e Now Bushcamp
description: At the end of a dirt track, a few kilometer after the village.

name: Checkpoint Police
description: Iran Checkpoint they make a Passport Check

name: Checkpoint Police
description:
Checkpoint police Passport check.
Nerven behalten und auf Durchfachrt beszehen.

name: Diesel
description:
Diesel fuel station 

Big Rest place

name: Camp near cemetery at mosala mosque
description: quiet during nights. camp beside a cemetrey and small park, behind a school. can be crowded for friday prayers. there is toilettes in the park. it is a dead end. we stayed here for 5 nights without problems. good possibilities to get to jolfa and si o se bridge.

name: park near kashan
description: little park area with few visitors. you can find different camping places here. the highway is hearable but not loud. a the time of stay the area wasn't finished so roadworks possible.

name: parking near the village abyane
description: parking space close to the historical village of abyane. in winter it is empty, in summer might be crowded. the restrooms have drinking water. Restaurant is close by. didn´t sleep there but filled our watertanks. friendly villagers offered their help, shouldn´t be a problem staying there.

name: Camping at daryache namak (salt lake)
description: Don't accept the entry fee on the first checkpoint. you can bargain to lower the price. after that around 40km of dirt road. if you want to go inside the salt lake you need 4x4 or be an excellent driver. there is a road leading to a salt factory. we camped there on the roadside. just few trucks passing by so don't camp directly on the road.

name: Mir Emad Fastfood
description: Hidden little fast-food place. Serves burgers and fries, but also very tasty Italian dishes like pasta, lasagne and pizza's and Turkish pides.

name: Anaar Bar river forest wild camp
description:
Wild camp site in a little forest.
Just before the big building take the gravel road that leads to a little paved road. Go left (right leads to a locked gate)  and than to the right into a dry river bed. At the end go on the right side out off the river bed. A bit further you can go on the right into a small unpaved road into the forest. There is some noise from the main road.

name: Camp site at the Caspian Sea
description: This camp has its own beach where you can put you vehicle. The care take is extremely nice and helpful. Firewood is free off season. There is some garbage on the beach but it's generally a very nice place.

name: park with security near Karaj
description: You can asks the guard in the cabin if you can put your vehicle here. People walk by in the morning but it seems like a safe place.

name: Mahak Ciklet
description: Really good motorbike mechanic for big bikes. He has everything (motor oil, break pads, bmw diagnose tool). Mechanics are thorough and love bikes.

name: Parking Takht-e Soleiman
description:
Flat parking lot under the ruins with new toilets and picnic sites for free.
Very quiet at night, wolves? howling.  
2G with MCI

name: Parking at Al Qadir Park
description:
Huge, little visited parking place, easy to reach, quite quiet for free.
Toilet in the mosque, playground.
10 min with the taxi 50T Rial
2G with MTC SIM

name: Parking at the Park
description:
Parking lots at a recreation park with picnic pavilions for free.
2G+ with MTC SIM

name: Parking Fin Garden Kashan
description:
Parking lot at the gardens (open 9-16). Teagardens and restaurants around. 
Free, but noisy.
3G with MTC SIM

name: Wild camp in crater
description:
Above the salt lake in a small half crater with black stones and nice view.
You are seen from the road which is quite a bit away.

name: Parking at the Womens Park
description:
Small green stripe with parking places in front of a stadium (inside a park for women) for free. Extra sites for tents. Road with heavy traffic nearby.
2G with MTC SIM

name: Parking at the Mausoleum
description: Huge parking place for the recommended Mausoleum (entrance for free) in a nice, quiet village.

name: Parking at the Fortress
description:
At the entrance of the fortress, over a park with picnic- and tent-facilities and toilets for free. At the road further down are simple restaurants and stores.
2G with MTC SIM

name: Bush camp next to Kar Shahi fortress ruin
description: Wild camping next to the ruins of an old fortress. Very quiet. Access via a 23km track from Matin Abad. 4WD necessary. Irancell Edge coverage.

name: Wildcamp spot near Pasargadae
description: This is a wild camping spot next to a (atm dry) river. The eastern side of the river is quiet and you will have shade from the beautiful mountains around you. About 15 minutes from pasargadae. 4x4 recommended.

name: Soltaniyeh
description: Park with camping places. At the site of the park there are nice camp places. There is water and toilets.

name: izad
description:
Izad Khast Caravancary and abanded city 

Drive into the vally to the caravancary. You can camp around the caravancary, if you don’t have a to big truck drive behind the caravancary and you can park at the end of the road and have a quite night and beautiful view  to the caravancary and abandond city. In front of the caravancary facilities are being build.
In the morning we were invited to visit the caravansary and the abandon city. This was worth the visit, you are walking through the ruins and can imagine the past.

name: Molakhalila park
description: Parking lot park. Bit noise of the road next to the park. Not the cleanest spot, but view on park is nice. During daytime and evening park is open en has toilets with on the opposite side a place for dish washing. For the open park entrance you have to walk around, past the fuel station and turn right, +/- 200 m. The entrance close to the parking (were the toilets are) was closed.

name: Golestan National Park
description:
Large and beautiful campground within the NP. 5000 Toman per night. 
Forest with platforms for tents. Visitor Center. Small shop. Toilets. 
The campground stretches about 1 km along the road. 
Second entrance with separat toilet block. 
Wild boars - so store your food supplies savely. We had visitors there: 3 females with there little ones which came quite close to our tent.

name: Supermarket
description: Newly opened supermarket, has fresh vegetables, dairy products, cans, ... also WD40 and gas cartridges.

name: Ardabil
description: Nice bushcamp location. Close to the road and the river.

name: typical Iranian picknick Park
description: Locals sent us here to camp because it's guarded and safe. They sprinkle the grass in the morning so negotiate a bit for the time you leave, or go to the south side of the park where it's a bit more dusty. Very friendly locals. You might get a meal and good conversation.

name: Visa affairs Teheran
description:
Immigration & Passport Police in Teheran
You get your Iranian visa extension here. This authority is no longer near Metro Tehran Pars, but near Metro Shahid Mofateh (Line 1) instead.

name: Guarded parking lot next to park
description: This parking lot is safe. You can put your rig here and also put up a tent. There is a fence around the park. There are many shops and the toilet is nearby. It feels safe.

name: Karavansaray near Jolfa
description: A stop for people making the silk road, they have small houses but let you park around, at the moment of writing it was being finished.

name: Gas station in Rajae Dasht.
description: A gas station in the middle of the town with a small parking lot with simple WC facilities. We were told by locals the place is safe since the gas station is open 24/7.

name: Camping next to the river
description: Campspot with toilets, a shop and shady spots for tents or camper vans. Could be busy at weekends but is quiet during the week. 200000 riales for two people with two motorbikes and a tent. You either hear the traffic or the river, depends on the spot you choose. There are bbq places which you can use.

name: Ravar picnick park
description: This is a site for people of Ravar to go picnicking. There is room for tents.  Locals can stay until quite late. It's also possible to drive further towards the mountains. There are a few shaded spots down the road, about 5 km.

name: Rend Valley - Su Daresi
description: Beautiful hidden valley following the curves of a river and surrounded by huge cliffs and green pastures. Follow the dirt road from Danalu to Rend.

name: Qareh Kalisa - Armenian church
description: Nice Armenian Church located in an alpine area. Accessible on a beautiful drive from Showt which goes up through a nice valley to an Alpine plateau. Entrance 200'000 IR

name: Kandovan - Troglodyte village
description: Photogenic settlement of troglodyte homes and storage barns carved out of curiously eroded rocks. A smaller version of Cappadocia in Turkey. 100.000 IR per person

name: desert tourist camp haf sang
description:
USER REPORTS"When I came here we agree a high price only for parking the motorhome. 200.000 rials for 1 night 1 person, but because it was late I paid. After I arranged the car and just want to take a shower someone came and ask me 10 times more. YES 2 mil rials. I left the place in the middle of the night.."

in the mid of the desert,  nice, safe. nice camp, very  friendly, you can rent a little cabin, thee, fresch drinks

name: Zanughan, Arababad, old village
description: behind the old village, between the gardens, quiet place not far from the road, but silence

name: Eslamiyeh, road to
description: picknick spot, near the road, place for overnight, nearby drinkingplace for animal, no drink water.

name: Border Bajgiran, picknick area , behind building from " municipal touristisch camping center"
description: just for the border, we ask a police man for a place to stay. he showed us the place, a quiet picknick area and safe behind the police offices

name: border Turkmenistan/ Iran
description:
border
passport and car controll. gps for the car

name: Caravansaray
description: Just on the right side on the road, access via a dirt track. We stayed for lunch but looks like a perfect place to sleep.

name: Bisotun forest campsite
description: this place is from 1km to the rock where the bas-relief are.

name: Madani Park
description: Huge park with lots of spots for tents and parking spaces. Highway is a bit loud but bearable. We heard about this place from a local who reccomended it instead of the other park that is in the southern part of the city.

name: Qanat camp
description: Wild camping surrounded by rocky mountains. Popular hiking place.

name: Parking next to historic basar
description: This is the only parking garage next to the basar that is suitable for vehicles up to 2.4 m in height.

name: Scenic road
description:
Road from Mashhad through Kalat, Dargaz and ending in Quchan.
It is a very beautiful drive through dramatic mountain landscapes and nice vistas.
This road also leads to the Bajgiran Turkmenistan border.

name: Wild camping surrounded by mountains
description: This spot is about 1km off the highway on a dirt track up the mountain. There is an antenna above the mountain, but no-one saw us and no-one bothered. There is a drinking water spring at the begining of the track. There are a few pic-nique spots after the spring. Or for a more secluded spot take the rough left track after the spring leading up the mountain. At the end here is a kind of flat spot and the highway is out of sight.

name: Khaled Nabi
description: Magical site in a infinite​ horizon of Green hills. There is a mausoleum but the main draw are the falus and butterfly shaped tombs a couple hundreds meters walk from the parking. The second attraction is the location with a landscape of infinite green hill. Beautiful place for sunset and sunrise. 30'000 rial per car. You can sleep on the parking (the one right at the very top is best). Avoid week-ends. The drive from Tamar is beautiful and paved until the last 6km which is a bumpy pebble/gravel road.

name: Gorgan Historical wall
description:
This sight is a fortress along the wall. Don't expect much, unless you are seriously into archeology.

Update: if you look for ‘great wall of gorgan’ on Maps.me, you’ll find an actual wall and several similar fortresses. Don’t expect to see much, just some muddy hills.

name: Kabud waterfall
description: Beautiful waterfall in green lush forest. 20 minutes walk from the parking. Entry 50'000 rial per car. We slept within the parking area in the forest along the river. There are many pic-nique bays. Avoid week-ends. There are toilets and restaurants.

name: Wild camp near Zandschan
description: Nice place in a dry riverbed (at least when we were there) a bit off the main road. We drove over the small damm next to the road west of this spot and continued on a gravel track. It's located in a ditch, so probably difficult to see from around.

name: Asia Insurance
description: Asia Insurance company where you can buy insurance with foreign plates.

name: Darya guesthouse and Amin guesthouse
description: Guesthouse Darya, simple but clean. You can also stay in the guesthouse of his son Amin (we did), wich is just 100 meters far in a quit alley. There is save privat parking for the motorbikes or car. They have a garden where you can eat while ramadan. You can use the kitchen. Its in the centre close near the bazar.

name: Dry river camping near chak chak
description:
Looking for another spot we found this dry river where locals come to spend the night and do some campfires. Take a dirt track to the right when you are about 700m from the twisty routes to chak chak and follow (it leads to a fenced mobile antenna), take a right at the antenna and follow the track until it splits into two. Take the left one until you get to the river bed where the trees are.

 4x4 not needed but a bit of ground clearance is a must.

Very good shade during summer after 12pm.

Irancell Edge coverage.

name: Public free camping near Astara port
description: Public camping with WC next to the road, ideal for spending the night before crossing the border. A bit on the noisy side but very convenient. 40.000Rial for a vehicle and two persons.

name: Camping east of Kela Chay at Caspean Sea
description:
Camping east of Kela Chay at the Caspean Sea. During the day and evening, after ramadan it gets more busy with locals. There is is a private beach, you can pitch your tent or truck. They also have a kind of cabins, so you only need your matras and sleepingbag. The sanitair is old but works good. Hot showers and french toilet. Save parking. Owner doesn't speak english but is very helpfull. We paid $10 for the cabin.

They opened the door even it was looking closed. owner is living in the house to the right.

name: Small museum in Evaz
description:
Nice old house turned into a museum.   Nice short stop from Bandar Abbas to Shiraz. 
Opening hours Saturday to Thursday 8-12 and 4.30 - 20.00. Not open on Friday.

name: Anadapana hotel - Persepolis
description:
This hotel reopened 9 months ago. Normal prices are 2,3 and 2,9mln rial. We got our room at a decent discount for 1,5mln rial ($40) including breakfast. 

Can recommend if you want to escape the summer heat after your late afternoon visit of Persepolis or before your early morning visit of it.

name: Naqsh e Rostam
description: Four tombs hewn in the cliff of the mountains. Worth a stop when visiting Persepolis, but not worth the high entrance fee as you cannot get close or in the tombs. Photograph from entrance and road side.

name: Mosque - en route to Esfahan
description: Mosque on left hand side driving towards Esfahan. They are currently restoring it.

name: Bush camp, 15km from Farsan.
description: Just of the road near trees. Quiet during the night, little bit of noise from the road but possible to further away from the road. Early morning you are woken by bells of the sheep and goats.

name: Toiletblock with drinking water taps and a hose
description: Watertaps in the side of the toiletbuilding, also one with a long hose.

name: Underground city - entrance 2
description:
There are two entrances into the underground city. They are no longer connected, so visit both if you want to see different parts of the city. You can visit 300m hete. In city 1 you can visit 100m.

Entrance 250000 rial for both cities together. Follow the English signs in town to find entrance 1.

name: Wild camping near badab-e-surt springs
description: Wild camp just above badab-e-surt, 15 mintues up the mountain. Colors of spring are most beautiful early morning. The pools for sunset are dried up (June 2017).

name: Venice coffee
description: The best coffee for a long time!! Don't miss it, he has a lot of choices.

name: Bush camp on hill
description: Buah camp on hill with nice views of three valleys. In sight of one village, but far away enough. No cell phone signal whatsoever.

name: Wild camping with mountain views
description: Even though it's not far from the road, it's a quite and peaceful place to stay for two days. You can hear the trucks on the road a bit, but hidden a bit behind hill you can look over a valley into the snow caped mountains. Other option would be to drive into this valley and follow the river but we haven't tried this.

name: Wild camping before heading to the boarder
description: This spot is nothing special but we found the other spots Quchan to be too noisy. At night we didn't see the entry to the other spot around the corner. It's just looking down to the main road but you can hide well between some small hills. It's at the old road leading parallel to the new one. Some farmers in the morning around here.

name: Bush camp near Babak Castle
description:
Nice field of grass and some herbs grow here (nice smell). Very quiet place, slightly visible from gravel road, but not from main road.  

No mobile / 3G reception at all.

name: Lake view bushcamp
description: Close to the border and city of Astara. Nice view over the lake from the platform that can be reached with a small dirt road. Some noise from the road. Good 4G+ reception.

name: Iran -Azerbaijan, exit Astara
description:
Customs and immigration when you leave Iran for Azerbaijan. Google map shows a different route. 

First office near the entry gate:
Be aware that you need money to pay the difference between diesel price for the size of your fuel tank(s) in Iran and Azerbaijan. For a 80liter tank that is 280.000rial or $9 (as they use a poor exchange rate). So don't spend all your money in Astara! No stamp for carnet yet! 
UPDATE JUNE 2019: for our 80Liter tank we had to pay 2’730’000 rial (approximately 20$). 


Second office on the left with the huge antenna:
Get your carnet stamped here after you paid your diesel price difference. 

Third building on the right (exit to Azerbaijan border):
Check of car and give your exit pass here.

Fourth building:
Get your exit stamp in passport and make sure you have a copy of your passport. And your done! 

Not straight forward to cross here with your car. 

We had no money left for Iran. Only Omani next to Azerbaijan, so ended up paying norhing.  

In Azerbaijan you need to pay $20,- pp for visa (you can apply for e-visa for 80 nationalities), for a Yoyota Landcruiser HZJ78: 40 manat for insurance (30 days) and 70 manat for road tax,etc. All depending on the type of car. 

WARNING!! Don’t change money at border on Iranian side !!! One of helpers (who ask 20€ to solve carnet and other papers) insist to change money for us, I was suspicious and tell him no. He than show me some fake card and start to raise his ton. He ask me how i think to pay hotel or food or anything without money...than he take his phone and told me to check rate on google and that he will give me same rate. I check and he than start to count millions of rials...than i told him NO again and he become offended. We exit border area, stop in city, ask one lady, she write us address and send us to place where we can exchange money.. There we get exactly two times more than on google or by that guy...for 100€ we get 15000000 rials, google show 5000000

name: Wild camp next to river
description: Camping on the dry higher parts of the river bed. Flat areas to pitch tent with trees to keep cool. Cold water river with some small rapids.  small village opposite of river. quiet area small road.

name: Marranjab desert lake view point
description: Flat and level area good for camping, almost no gravel or stones, bit of a hard top layer. Plateau overlooking the salt lake and the carrevanserrai both at a distance of 500m.

name: campsite next to river
description:
nice camping location next to river.
Just follow track next to river until the bend in the river

name: Pooladkaf hotel, at Pooladkaf ski-resort
description:
It's a 4* hotel at the Pooladkaf ski resort. It offers also sleeping in a yurt or in a traditional Nomad tent. You also can stay in your own tent. When we were here it was closed due of renovation and ramadan, but it opens in 8 days. At the campsite there are showers and toilets and a kitchen is coming. We stayed 3 nights on the grass in front of the hotel. We got the key from a room to take a shower. Toilets were open all night. Mr Ali is so amazing friendly and hospitable, he charged us nothing because of the renovation. 
From the campsite we did 2 days of hiking and one day the Margoon waterfall, really beautiful. The temperature is very good in this time of year, not to hot! 
First picture are the Nomad tents, second is our tent.

name: Mohsen Qomi's  workshop
description: Mohsen is founder of the facebook group " overland in Iran ". His workshop is in the city center near a park were you can camp. He is very helpfull with finding a safe place for camp or can accommodate you at his own homestay with safe parking. He knows a lot of Iran and can give you a lot of background information. We spend a lovely evening with him.

name: Fuel station with diesel
description: Big fuel station with diesel. You also find a small supermarkt and service area for your car.

name: Shahreza: Tuning 15
description: Very trustworthy garage and mechanic store. The people that work here are professional, friendly and helpful. Our air conditioning broke down and they fixed it for a fair price. Furthermore they handmade a dashboard protector for the heat. We really recommend to go here if you need reparations to be done or you need mechanical parts for the car. If you like loud speakers or a funny steering wheel that's possible as well. We have a Toyota Landcruiser, but every brand of car they can help you with.

name: Wild camp in between Mesr and Faranzad
description: From the road you see an abandoned mud brick. Follow the dirt road, you see some burned garbage, but at the end there is a flat area. You can stay here or climb a little up for a better view. From here you can walk immediately up to the sand dunes. Really nice to enjoy the sunset and afterwards the beautiful sky full of stars. We did see a sand colored ant of about 10 cm big. He was eating / chewing the black beatles. So be careful of your toes.

name: Wild camping between Tabas and Mashad
description: We took a detour to Mashhad passing herds of camels and old castles and caravanserais. On the left there is a dirt road passing some small dry rivers. Eventually it will lead to an house but just before the road goes to the left and there we set our camp. You have a nice view over the mountains.

name: Visa extension
description: Visa extension from 7AM to 2PM. Leave tel at entrance, no queue for foreigners, English speaking officer

name: Sayya Hotel
description:
Just found this hotel on the road. Very big parking space. Private room with shared bathroom costs 27$, much cheaper than the others I found in Kashan city. Wifi is available at their front desk and restaurant on Floor 1st only.

In June 2019 we paid 19 $ per double room with our private bathroom and breakfast.

name: Hotel in Duzal
description: Small hotel at the iranian side of the border. 600000 rial for 3 person room. Very small city. Went here to wait for carnet brokers to come back from day off

name: chapaker traditional guesthouse
description: We met the owner in the middle of the desert. he invited us to stay at his place, we had tea and a very nice conversation. he organised a camel tour for us for 7€ per person. at the moment they renovate their entire building. Shower was for free, low season 10€ per person, in high season 15€ including breakfast. they hostel has a very nice yard and you can park your car right in front the house on the street or behind on a sandy parking lot.

name: Mehran Hostel
description: Very big room with kitchen and toilet included. Parking is free out of town or you can park in private lot for 120.000Rials one night. Hostel is close to center market, price 3 million Rials.

name: Better than Maranjab wild camping
description: we have been to the caravansaray which wasn't worth at all. place is not that nice, soldiers all around and running engines all night Long. between 6 and 7 you have to leave, the military sends you away. the dirt street to the caravansaray is in a bad condition. 4wd not necessary, but 40 very bumpy kilometers. we had breakfast at this spot which is perfect for camping as well. great view over the desert, perfect for barbecue and breakfast. from here it's not far to drive into the salt lake.

name: Melli Bank
description: This is the bank where you need to pay the fee for a visa extension. We paid 345.000 rials per person.

name: Riverbed in green valley
description:
This is one of the best camps we've had in Iran. Close to Tahkt e Sulyman. A wide riverbed with lots of flat space and trees. Locals picnic here. We were here in summer and the temperature droped well below 20 degrees at night. probably flooded in spring. We camped in this spot but there are many spots like it in this valley.
Its quite close to the road but it didn't bother us.

name: Yazd Friendly Hotel
description:
As its name implies. This hotel/hostel is very friendly. Good clean rooms with AC and a pretty good breakfast included in the Tarif. Free tea and coffee all day if you want along with water. The owners/hosts are eager to please. Just ask and they will do their best. They also had private parking available for our motorbike. Cars will need to use the nearby public parking.

Very lovely place to stay and relax. The owner speak English and also good German. Very very clean rooms with included bathroom. Internet and if you ask - washing of clouthes possible. Double room for two persons 2.5 Mio rials per night.

name: Bukan-Mahabad rd
description: A nice spot under the trees. Very quiet at night, but you can hear the road trafic. Lots of families having picnic during the day. The access ramp is a bit tricky if you do not have a good ground clearance. Water available from a pipe. Poor internet (edge on irancell)

name: Wild camp spot
description: Nice camp spot on a little hill above the street. Enough space for some tents or a big rig (if they have 4x4 because the little road might be difficult to climb without). No water source so bring your own. Nice view and very quiet at night (never had visitors and we arrived around 6pm and left around 10am). We have been there with our motorbikes. If you have a SIM card of Iran there is still Edge connection available

name: Apartment with parking
description: Big apartments with parking possibility, kitchen, sleeps up to 4 people.

name: Dune camping
description: Great spot on the way from the salt lake. Great for all kind of vehicles (we have been there by motorbike). No 4x4 needed only a small part of deeper sand. Quiet at night. Bring some cow/camel/donkey crap to make a fire (you can get it in the small villages). Edge connection available if needed.

name: Travelers Nightstay
description:
All the local travelers stay here over night in their tents. It's just a sidewalk with a little green stripe. We parked at the road side. It's noisy but you get some hours rest. 
The locals are intrested we got a lovley welcome.

name: Chitgar Park
description: Iranian Park, lots of local use it to camp, picknick etc. We didn't need to pay anything. Parking is available and some nice walking in the park as well. Toilets available.

name: Diesel
description:
Diesel station. The only place to get Diesel between Karaj and Caspian. 

Update 08/2019 there is another station close to the ocean. This one here ripped me off.

name: Bushcamp next to river
description: Unfortunately the other place further down is closed as a house is being built and access is closed off. But this will do the same. A lot smaller but there are other options along the riad if you travel in group...

name: Great camping spot next to river
description: Just right of the road is a flat terrain and a small river. At more than 2000m alt the night is cold but a campfire will help. The road west of here to the Karaj-Chalus road is one of the most beautiful drives in the world with a pass at 3140m.

name: Parking area to Damavand basecamp
description: This is the road/track to Mt Damavand. There is no one as it is off season so went partially uphill and found a great spot with priceless views. Don't know if it would be accessible during summer. 2500m alt and very cold at night. When the sun sets, there is a huge fog coming up in the valley beneath you.

name: Great open space with view on Damavand
description: This is actually even a better spot than the one I marked east of here. Locals use it as well to camp and picknick. Great view on Damavand.

name: Big City Park (new)
description: A new park that is a lot better than all the alternatives in Kashan. Probably one of the best I stayed at in Iran.

name: Valley next to road
description:
Large area a little lower than the road, rather out of direct sight. Some trees and natural water, not potable. Calm night, no issues!
Happy travels! www.wanderingsouls.be

name: Old fortress
description: Old fortress in which you can camp. Close to the road but not a lot of traffic not even during the day. No water or data connection.

name: Huge sand dunes
description: Epic Wild camping spot in the desert only a shepherds house in the distance except for that only sand and mountains. No water, no service..

name: Rohab's guesthouse
description: Amazing guesthouse with wonderful people. Rohab is a nice guy and offroading is in his blood. Dorm is 10euros a night and facilities are super clean. Rohab can give you a lot of information about the desert which you can explore. The place has a restaurant with affordable prices. You can also pitch a tent behind the guesthouse for free.

name: DIY
description:
If you need repairs for the inside of your vehicle, this is a small do it yourself. Ali helped me fix some broken cabinets of my kitchen. You can use his tools as well.
Greatly recommended!

name: Mellat Park
description: A city park in Rasht. It is a famous with Iranians for public sports and also camping. There is a small parking at the park entrance on the south-western side. You can't enter the park with a car. Inside the park (50m from the parking lot) are public toilets. They seem to be open 24/7 and get cleaned every morning. Irancell 4G network.

name: Wild Spot near Harsin
description: Little Forest near Harsin 40 km south of Bisotun. Definately quiter than the busy UNESCO Site. Nice views around and the little road nearby is very quite during the night.

name: Next to river
description: Great spot next to river. If you have 4WD you can also cross the river. You are seen from the road but no problems whatsoever. No cellphone reception.

name: Picknick Area
description: Typical Iranian picknick area. Camping ok

name: Forest Camping
description:
Quite place next to a small gravel road in the forest. There are a few others, this seems to be the most flat. 
Might be more busy in summer. 
Irancell has 3G/3G+ at this place

name: Sirjan Salt desert
description: Nice and big salt desert. In winter time there is water and you have to watch out not to get stuck in the mud. Less then 10min drive from Sirjan.

name: Margoon Waterfall
description: Margoon waterfall. Only paid 50.000 IRR despite the sign saying 150.000

name: Sand Dune Parking Camp
description: Nice place, just south of the other iOverlander places. A track leads here from the Hotel/Tourist-Complex gate. The guys try to get a little money upon entering, but if you insist very friendly on not paying, you don't pay. Obviously there is no charge or something for coming here. Place seems to be a local's favourite with some garbage around. there are even toilets on site, although they look as if they worked maybe a long time ago and you'd prefer the dunes anyways. Good Irancell signal on dunes. Road not visible or audible. No water. Easy to reach, no 4x4. Bring firewood or dung if you want to have a campfire.

name: Recreation Center of Fandoghlou
description: Small resort with typical cabins for iranian tourists. In the midst of a hazelnut grove. Guarded and well-kept, totally quiet at night (it was end of season, we were the only guests). Some friendly dogs around, deer park nearby.

name: Mountain Camp
description: Mountain pass drive (alt. 2.400m). Plateau beside the road (marginal traffic). Beautiful view over a valley, a big barrier lake and a small armenian church at the left bank of the lake.

name: Camp next to lake Tashk
description:
Nice and plenty of campsites next to lake Tashk and lake Bakhtegan. Close to a little town. Several trees to hide the tent. In the evening and morning we had a few herders passing by but they were friendly. At night it gotten pretty could. Small roads leading to the lake not all of them might be accessible for big rigs. There is edge coverage for irancell.

Not a lot of fuel stations on the road but there is one in abadeh tashk and you find shops who sell benzine out of bottles in the smaller towns. The road is beautiful a lot of pomegranate trees and agriculture.

name: Next to lake.
description:
Nice spot right next to a lake. Locals use it as well for picknick, camping, fishing... so you will probably not be alone. There are trees for shade as well. 

Report 01/2018  We got attacked here at night with stones and have several broken windows!!!

name: Jafar motorcycle shop
description: You can find oil, chain lube and some parts here. Also some tyres (not a lot of choice) and clothes and helmets. A lot of motorcycle shops in the neighbourhood. Price was fair 350000 rials for one liter 20w50. He has connections to ship tyres to bandar abas (vee rubber)

name: Open area next to cliff
description: Open area between the road and the cliff (river). Just follow the tracks from the road and choose any spot. Nice view of the mountains, plain and river

name: Bush camp
description:
Quit spot close to the main road. Small flat spots for tents. In the river bed nobody can see you. Houses and a gas station nearby. When dark only a motorcycle passed by on the dirt road next to it. Some trees to provide shade.

But there are nicer places to camp down the main road heading south. There is a abandoned caravanaserai on the right 25min down the road. And even better spots in the nature reserve  lots of dirt roads and trees near dried out river beds.

name: Camping on the beach
description: You can park on the sandy beach. A few trees for minimal shade. Very good water for swimming.

name: Aghaghia Park Streetcamp
description: If you approach the park from the West, there is a dead end street (Aghaghia St.) which should be perfect for a couple of days. The quiet road just north is also fine. Quiet neighborhood. Toilets 100 m away in the park. Good 4G Irancell signal. Potable water drinking fountains in the park as well as sports equipment. Nice restaurant at the corner to the west. Pakistan Embassy around the corner to the east.

name: Park at beach
description: They are building a new park right at the beach. Great location! Locals use it so you will not be aline, but very quiet at night!

name: iran insurance
description: oficial place to take your insurance for iran. we paid 40€ for one month with a camper. maybe you can get better?

name: Qareh Kalisa Armenian church
description: you can sleep on the parking of the site. Nice view

name: Kandovan village
