description: You can stay for the night at the end of the village on the parking if you find place. it is free. Until the 40 000 rials you have to pay before the village,

name: before Sanandaj
description: parking near a lake. there is a restaurant or bar and a big house but all was closed. we just saw a guardian. I don't  Know how it is in summer but in november it was very quiet.

name: Bush camp at beach
description: This place overlooks the beach and the Persian Gulf. Excellent sunsetvistas, especially if it is lowtide. Access to beach on foot, as you are on an elevated position. Nobody in the area.

name: Caravanserai ruins
description: Next to the highway there are ruins of few traditional buildings that look like caravanserai. They are further away from the highway, accessible by packed dirt road. Behind the wall you are not visible from the road, there is wind protection and some places where you can hide from the sun (or the rain - if it ever rains there...). It’s clean and feels very cozy.

name: Great View Campgrounds
description: super campcrounds along quiet track. locals also camp here

name: Caravansary
description: An old caravansary located between the Persian Gulf Highway #7 and the road #71 Qom-Kashan. It was closed, no people around aside from a farmer who welcomed us and gave us some eggplants and fresh peppermint :o) Traffic is hearable but undisturbing.

name: Hotel Negin
description: Nice hotel in the center of Ardabil. 1.800.000rial per night for a double room and breakfast. The breakfast buffet were not filled up with food unless we asked for it. The wi-fi is not very good. There is a good and secure parking lot behind the hotel but you have to manoeuvre the car well to get in there.

name: parking
description:
Good parking near the home of very good guide: Madam Manizheh Hamedi, www.hamedi.ir, hamedi1334@yahoo.com.
She help many tourists for the visit in Bandar Abbas.
Very, very kindle!
The parking is silent, and security.

name: Shushtar
description:
Parking in the park. very nice place with play for children and ping pong table.
Green and shadow, near the river and old town.
Irancell 4G+

name: Ali Sadr Cave
description:
parking inside the site, in the night close the door and security.
Big garden and very silence in the night.
The cave are a little expensive but beautiful!

name: Taftan border
description:
Process starts at the last checkpoint in Iran. Close to Mirjaveh last village before the border. We arrived here at 4pm they told us we couldn't cross after an hour of negotiation we slept in a hotel in Mirjaveh for the night (room 800000rials). Next morning they let us through but we had to wait for 30min on an armed escort. 

Border Iran side:
1. At first border check they want to see passport and carnet (you don't get any stamps here). 

2. You go to passport registration they let you cut in line. And give you passport stamp. After this you drive through the gate (which you open yourself)

3. Get to the customs office for your carnet stamp. They ask for your passport info as well and check you luggage. 

All people are friendly and helpful, but. their English is bad.

Border Pakistan side:
1. You first go to an office for passport registration. You fill in a form and they take your picture. Here you get your passport stamp (Their English is very good) a levie will pick you up and escort you to the next stop. (You can also exchange money here, but you should have done that in iran rate was 105 for 1 euro while it was 125 for 1 euro in zahedan) 

2. Custom police wants your passport & carnet information at the big gate.

3. Another passport check at the levie office. Afterwards levie brings you to custom office.

4. Get stamp for carnet in custom office. Levie escort back

5. Go back to levie office and wait for the escort. 

If you won't make it to Dalbadin on time you will be forced to sleep at the levie office (for free) the accommodation is not very charming.

Time:
Next morning we arrived at the at the Mirjaveh checkpoint at 7am and left the pakistani border at 11:05am  with an armed escort headed to Dalbadin.

name: Gardens and museum
description:
Gardens are free but nothing special. 
There is an iranian anthropology museum inside for 150.000 R
As I was alone, the guy gave ne a private tour in basic understandable english. 
Spent the night on the parking in front of the gardens, there's a little café as well.

name: Parking in front of gardens
description:
Parking in front of gardens and the food and drug administration. (This building is lit and guarded at night)
There are a few trees and a little café that is open in the evening. 
Nothing fancy but it does the trick for a night if you are in the neighborhood...

name: Camp at dam
description:
Big dam. Unfortunately at this time of the year there's almost no water. 
The guard allowed me to go by myself to the dam for some pictures. 
Camping next to the guards house, safe. 
Access is from the main road, there is a sign to the dam. All tarmac.

name: Road to camp at dam
description: After 3200m there's a junction. The main road goes left to a little village but go straight/right uphill to get to the dam. Nice climb and cool view over the valley before reaching the dam.

name: Outdoor, climbing and sports equipment shops
description: Very nice shops with outdoor equipment. Both climbing and camping gear. International brands.

name: Parking lot/gravel space close to road
description: Not the cosiest of places, but fine for a “on-the-road-picnic” or a one night stay. We just needed a place for the night while driving from Tehran towards the coast. Drive off on the road to the small town Alymstan. Just after the bridge over the river on the right side you find the area. 3G reception is bad.

name: Caspian sea marsh lookout with flamingoes
description: We camped here for one night and woke up to the sight of flamingoes. The Turkmen fishermen are taking their boats out at night and morning, so it is not totally quiet. We drove to the end of a road and stood there.

name: At a dam with nice views
description:
Pick any place around this spot. The gates to the dam were open. No water at this moment of year though. 
The abandoned old caravanserai you'll see is also a good spot!

name: Large parking for big vehicles
description: Large parking area within walking distance of the Shrine. Mostly buses abd larger vehicles. Free to use

name: Waterfall
description: Nice waterfall. Accessible on foot from parking. 45 min hike. Nice views. Had the place all for myself but by the looks of it it might be crowded in weekends and summer.

name: Waterfall parking
description:
Take the road at your right if coming from Mashad to the little village Ab Garm.
At the village take a right to go to the parking and the waterfall.
Tarmac until village. After the village it is all off road. Ok with 2wd. The parking area is flat. All alone at night. From here it's 45min on foot to the hotspring waterfall. Just follow the river upstream. If you climb to the top of the waterfall there's a little pool, to have a bath. The hike itself is already worth the effort. Might be busy in high season though...

name: Diesel fuel Station
description: Diesel fuel station. 600rial/Liter. Workers entered their diesel card.

name: near a lake
description: beautiful place. we came here with iranian family but I think you can sleep here. in summer maybe there is lot of people because you can swim in the little lake

name: bisotun forest
description: this is the free place in the forest where you can stay near the rock where there are the inscriptions

name: Recreational parc 20 km to Arak
description: quiet parc with gardian at night. not far from the road but no noisy

name: just near the dunes
description: quiet camp at night, just near the dunes. no  need 4x4

name: Park
description: Typical Irani park. Lit at night. Ok. Some people pass by.

name: Open Field Camp
description: Just a couple of meters off a dirt track. Flat ground. Highway and village in plain view in the distance. Quiet, no one around. Irancell 4G.

name: LPG
description: Filled the bottle here for 250.000 Rial. Took some time and effort as they have Iranian connectors, not EU ones but it worked.

name: camp spot near Masuleh
description:
As it's quite difficult to find a lonely spot in this crowded area we drove up here.
It's a dead end path, not a lot of space but it offers a beautiful view. No one came by and it's not visible from the street. Very windy!! We parked the van in the middle of the night in wind direction to get not blown away.

name: Tea fields
description:
park here to have a nice walk through the tea fields! 
parking is free

name: spot next to the tea fields
description:
As it's difficult to find a convenient camp spot in this crowded area, we suggest this one.
It's next to a lake, no one came by and we felt save.
We stopped here before visiting the tea fields. :)

name: copper hill lake view
description: nice setting between hills, next to a (toxic?) lake. not far from road but invisible. you can see a small house, but nobody around. bushes and wood available for campfire

name: beautiful, hidden place
description: We tagged the beginning of the dirt road. Follow it some hundred meters to the south-west and you'll be rewarded with lots of beautiful camp spots surrounded by mountains! We were all alone and felt save. No signal.

name: Park in Sari
description: The local security forces have a building here, so it is guarded at all times. I needed to leave early in the morning though.

name: Park
description: Had a good night sleep here. Typical park. You hear a little bit the road noise.

name: Hill top in a park
description: Parking in front of the security house on the top of the hill in the middle of the park. Toilets in security house (not at night). We were controlled two times: by police and then by secret police but seems like they were just interested... nice view over the city

name: Money Exchange in Ghods Hotel
description: place to exchange money within the hotel

name: nice desert camp spot
description:
W
e tagged the beginning of the dirt road, drive to the north for the spots. nice hiking possible as well. no one came by, internet signal, unfortunately lots of trash.

name: Caravansary Chah-e Karo
description: Abandoned old caravansary located in a stunning mountain scene. One can see it from the street to Ravar on the right. Access via a bumpy earth road. Quiet and solitary.

name: Truck Garage
description: Professional truck garage. Dedicated to SCANIA but they can obviously manage every type of truck, handle even advanced technology. Friendly, junior manager english speaking.

name: Truck Garage
description: Small truck garage. In the direction of Kerman on the right-hand side. Dedicated  to (old) Mercedes but in the case of need they handle other type of trucks as well. Friendly, junior manager english speaking.

name: Picknick Park
description: Typical Iranian picknick park on the outskirts of the Tabas oasis. Trees, a small brook, huts, fire places.

name: Nayband Oasis
description: Stunning. Palms, orange trees, the adobe village on a hill, hot spring... Very friendly poeple they might spontaniously dedicate themselves to show you round the oasis a whole day. You gain unforgettable insight into the daily life.

name: Next to sport complex
description: Nothing fancy, but a flat open parking lot next to a sports complex. Quiet at night.

name: Supermarket
description: Big supermarket with a lot of stuff. prices are good.

name: Sadaf camp
description: Camping with Picknick spots. Toilets are closed (off season). Nice place but unfortunately there was a guy who didn't leave us alone in the morning. He didn't speak any English but wouldn't stop talking. He was friendly and brought us ice cream but then came and put perfume on my girlfriend without asking and wanted to give her other cheap gifts. He just wouldn't leave us alone so we finally packed our stuff and left. If there are other people around it might be a great spot.

name: Beach
description: Follow the bumpy asphalt street (leading to a military base at lands end), turn left to a sandy passage through the dune. The beach is more or less clean with an very old ship wreck overgrown with mussels etc. The military might check your passport, some local fishermen around, all very friendly!

name: Wild Camping
description: Wild Camping not far away from the road in the middle of nowhere... only camels and donkeys around.

name: Welder
description: Good welder for black steel, inox, aluminium... fuel tanks!

name: Mangrove Forest
description: Good asphalt road with a parking area at the end and the typical iranian picknick huts. Mangrove view, one can book a boat trip. Staying over night possible, it‘s quite quiet.

name: Hidden place next to the road
description: Hidden place at a dead end dirt road. Surrounded by mountains. No signal.

name: Island in the salt lake
description: You can easily get here without 4x4. At this time of year it is ok with the temperatures to camp here. (We stayed at the dunes though.) Bring wood if you wish to make a fire.

name: Castle park
description:
We just stayed over night. Very quiet, cars passing by in the morning.

4 o'clock in the morning, security knocks on door, not save.
8:30 same security guy brings breakfast

name: Diesel
description: Gas station with diesel fuel and small shop

name: Apartment Hotel
description: Apartment Hotel in Rayen. Near the castle. Name just written in Farsi, entrance behind the inviting knife-display. Room with kitchen and heating (in winter) is 1.000.000 rial. BUT: it is really dirty! And no wifi. Normal internet connection in Rayen is LTE. Around there are a lot of shops. Parking behind the house (for big ricks) is possible. They've also electricity near the parking - maybe it's better just to ask for parking and shower - could be cheaper and cleaner!

name: LPG with pressure hose to fill tanks
description: LPG for cars is no more available at fuel stations. We could fill our gas tank (used for cooking) at this place. They have a pressure hose to fill tanks (not only gas bottles).

name: Office for visa extension
description: Tried to extend our visa, but it was to early. Extension only in the last two days of the validity. Friendly officers gave us tea and drove us back to our car.

name: Office for visa extension
description: Here the visa can be extended. Be prepared that they only want to extend it in the very last day(s) of the validity of the current visa. Bring 2 copies of current visa and passport, 3 photos, 345000 Rials and patience.

name: Shepherd's refuge
description:
Remote spot just 500m off the road. I found this spot because the backroad at the other spot 2km south was too muddy for my 2WD. Didn't want to stay at the hotel either. Turnoff point is about 300m past the hotel. The road is mostly gravel and there are 2-3 other spots along the way to the marked location. During summer there might be a lot of sheep around judging by the amount of poop past the site :)
Really good 3G+ on Irancell

name: Mangrove forest
description: you can stay at night on this flat parking. quiet

name: Assad bed and breakfast
description:
very nice place and friendly people. good food too. www.assadhomestay.com.
whatsapp +989362477331
mail: assad2426@yahoo.com

name: Saqez City Park
description: Parking in a nice little city park with playground and toilets. Irancell 4G available.

name: Parking lot of Kerman sports park
description: Gps coordinates of the entrance road to the park. If you take the first road right in the park there is a parking lot and a lot of picknick spots. Toilets (were clean) and water in the park. Quiet at night. We stayed two nights before and after Lut. Police came by one morning to ask if everything is okay and one night, making signs of bag over head and shot around the ear.

name: Truck station
description:
We found it difficult to find a fuel station with diesel and card here in Zahedan, but this one had it and had very friendly and helpful staff.

They have a sign saying that foreign tourista get fuel for free and it's true.

name: Coffee shop
description: Coffee shop recommended by a local as the best one. You get coffee from Brazil, Java and Peru for example. Also chocolate. Just around the corner of the German embassy.

name: Dragon mart
description: very  big chinese mall where you can find almost what you don't need! no pb to stay at night but little bit noisy. toilets, water, restaurant and wifi inside. open 10 to 10 (to 12 on the we)

name: Parking salt caves
description: You can stay on the parking lot of the salt caves. Away from the street and nobody there at night, just a dog.

name: magical red-white sandstone place
description:
Wow! One of the most beautiful camp spots we've been to! You'll be totally alone sourrounded by red-white sandstone hills.
Exit the main road ar the parking, take the small paved road to the right. We tagged the dried river bed which you should follow up between the hills. Go as far as you want (~500m), heaps of amazing spots!!
Not recommended while rain because of mud.
Internet: E signal or nothing.
Enjoy :)

name: Diesel in Qeshm
description: Here you can get Diesel, but it is a bit complicated! First you have to go to the next buildings gate and tell them you need Diesel. They need your ferry documents and passport. There it took us at least 30 min to complete all the bureaucracy and paper work. Finally we got papers for 30l Diesel and with these papers we could go to the fuel station. Pay there. How difficult it can be to get a bit of Diesel....

name: Parking next to the salt mountain
description: Perfect spot during week. Enter the street at these coordinates: 28.218003, 51.616246. at the parking you have amazing view over the salt mountain. Sometimes a bit windy. But at the weekend you won't be alone any more: already early in the morning it becomes crowded, also at night it can be busy. We highly recommend this spot during the week, then its quiet. The salt mountain is just an amazing experience, don't miss it!!!

name: Guarded parking
description: 2000 Toman for an hour. Nice people. We parked three hours and only had to pay for two. Close to the sights and bazar.

name: Picknick spot at the salt lake
description: If you come from Shiraz this is the first option to get down to the salt lake. You have to do a u-turn on the main road and then turn on the gravel road leading down. Locals come here for picknick. So a lot of garbage around. As it is very close to the road you get all the street noice if you stay at the edge of the lake. But still an option for overnight as you can hide behind a ruin and the trees. Or you drive onto the lake.

name: Parking at quiet road at mountain pass
description:
Good for wild camping for a night. It is very close to the road, so passing cars can see you. But the road is nearly unused because there is another newer road with a tunnel through the mountain. 
Beatiful view on the mountain pass.

name: SPORTS BAR STADIUM
description:
Farshid, the owner of the Sports Bar Stadium , welcomes overlanders. He speaks English, Spanish, and Scandinavian languages.

You can park vehicles up to a length of 7.50 meters at the coast promenade. Longer vehicles can stay behind the house. It is easy and safe to stay for several days. There are no fees.

The promenade has a beautiful sight and sea atmosphere. It is noisy until around midnight. Parking in front of the bar is quieter, but the street has a slope.

Farshid is really friendly and wants to help travelers. He offers coffee, smoothies, breakfast and a shower to overlanders. You should pay him by telling good stories from your trip. In the bar there is wifi, electric plugs, and places to work on your laptop. Ask him if you need any help with anything. He does not take money for the help. 

I am writing this because he asked me to. He wants to meet more overlanders.

You can contact him on his phone at +989174945478 or via Telegram (in Iran eveyone uses Telegram).

We had a great time in Bushehr. There were so many invitations for dinner from Farshid‘s friends that we never had the chance to cook for our own.

name: Maranjab desert checkpoint
description:
Checkpoint here. We spent 2 hours negotiating about entering with our own car and without guide. All the time they tell us that we need a guide because of a new law. Nobody can tell us which law and iranians can enter without problems. So finally it is NOT ANYMORE POSSIBLE TO ENTER THE DESERT without expensive guide and fee. The entrance fee (additionally) is 100.000 rial per car. 
There is a private company that controls it. We also met the manager. But it was not possible without guide. Other travellers told us the same. It is a new and really bad development.

name: Indian visa office
description:
Adress:
Indian Visa Center
Address is: Anahita Dead End. There is the Melli Bank in the corner. I updated the coordinates.
Office hours: 9 am - 12:30 am sun-thu.
We applied here for our Indian visa. Be there early! Many applicants around. You need a present adress. We stated the adress of simorgh hotel and left our contacts there. They told us to come again 8 days later but our passports weren't finished so they put an appointment 3 days later (11 days in total). We paid ~100$ for 6 Month, multiple entry. Payable only in Rial. We have german passports.

name: LPG SHOP
description: To fill your gaz bottles. The boss is a old man very cool. He knows how to safely fill your bottles, even if he does not have the best adapter for them. He has several boxes with different adapters. He didn't have the good adapter for our bottles (Camping gas) but he found the solution. Honest price.

name: GOOD BAKERY
description: Different types of bread (round, sandwich, hot-dog...), muffins, biscuits, cookies ... Good prices as in the whole country.

name: Wild beach
description: Long beach with different places to choice. The acces is more to the east and is only for high vehicles and motorcycles. Only some local people come occasionally (no tourist place). It's very calm and a beautiful site.

name: Shark diving school home
description: Diving school to get padi...the place has pool, accommodation, transport from the airport or city and very good prices.

name: Shark accommodation
description:
Shark accommodation with 3 big rooms 
00989120363778

name: Wild spot quiet and beautiful
description: Marked the beginning of the gravel road. Some meters parallel to street, then follow the red sand road right. Skip some sand blocks and then follow the road which you can drive deep inside, away from the street. We spent here 5 nights and met absolutely nobody! At the end of the street is a water source and you can find fire wood everywhere.

name: Shahre Bazi Park parking
description: Just the parking place of this park. It is besides the main road, so a bit noisy. But save, the security house is directly here. On the other side of the park is another parking space, maybe it is a bit more quiet. There are toilets near the other parking.

name: Beach Camping
description: Local picnic area, good place to sleep over night. Local Fishing starts in the morning

name: Darak Dunes
description: Quiet and remote place next to the Dunes and beach! Littel walk (5min) to the beach. Comming from Doruk take one of the gravel road after the main road to the picnic area. 4x4 get‘s you closer to the beach

name: Beach Camping
description:
Perfect big place to stay overnight or longer right next to the beach...not far from the city but very quiet. 

marked as free camping spot in maps me. follow the small roads before the funpark

name: Ancient Graveyard
description: Parking lot of the ancient graveyard in the historic port town of Bandar Siraf. Very quiet in the night beside some barking dogs. Toilet and shower in mediocre condition. The security guy is checking the scenery from his hut above the hill.

name: Diesel
description: Here you don't need to make the administration way (passports, island entry document...). Normally no possible but you say you don't have diesel to arrive to Qeshm and it's ok. We were able to put a limit of 40L.

name: Fountain of a mosque
description: The local people drink this water. Although it doesn't have a lot of pressure, it gets very good with a hose.

name: Bush wild camp
description: Flat and elevated peninsula. Very easy access and camping options without anyone seejng you. It is the westernmost point of the island, there is an old portuguese watchtower. Good views at sunset.

name: Long beach
description: Site on the beach. The track goes along the beach, you can find other places. The road is far enough to be quiet. Check the acces if it rains.

name: View point to a sheper valley
description: Elevated site on a sheper valley. You can see all the valley and mountains around. Very quiet site, the road is near but behind the littles mountains. No signal telephone avalaible.

name: Easy good water
description: The double fountain is in the parking to visit the palace. Also toilets and souvenirs shops are abailables. Local people stop here to lunch (pic-nic).

name: Azadi park
description:
Safe, clean, fast food, restaurant, grocer , toilet , tap water and police station (just between 21st of March to 5th of April and beginning of summer to the end of it because of holidays in Iran and of course it's crowded by Iranian passengers!)

Next park (Daneshjoo) is almost the same but no police station .

name: iran moein insurance co
description:
You can buy third party insurance for the car here.
We pay 4.400.000 rial for three months around €95 (5 march 2018).

name: Squarecamp
description: Right in the same square where the Uzbek consulate is. Full day but empty and very quiet at night, better if you can arrive after 7:30 p.m. / 8 p.m. There is a latrine in a corner (where the sand). Not suitable for large vehicles.

name: Baba Aman park
description:
Motel , restaurant , snacks , tap water , police station , toilet , spring , pools  and parking lot.

It's a bit crowded during summer and first 15 days of spring because of Iranians holidays .

name: Aspakhoo fire temple
description: The only remained fire temple in north east of Iran located on top of a small hill beside a nice small village . Tap water and grocery store are available near the temple .

name: Mohammad Exchange
description:
An old and reliable change shop in Bojnurd ; It's just in entrance of cell phone market .
We could exchange dollars to rial with a rate of 1$=100 000rials which is very fair. Guys whose working there are very nice and friendly.

name: Nice quiet valley
description:
Nice spot near dry riverbed, almost hidden. Follow the dirt road and continue when it ends. You can follow the river bed. Nice for 4WD but also possible for 2WD. 
irancell 3G coverage

name: Aghaghia Park
description: small park with bathroom (has hot water), drinking of water, place to Park, children Park and a fountain. the place is frequented by locals, a few meters from the Embassy of Pakistan. several friends with Caravan and campers overnight here. quiet place!

name: Merikhi Mountains
description:
Nice Spot at the edge of Lut Desert.
Excellent views all around. There's a lot of places nearby in the Rock formations as well.

name: Si Sangan Forest
description: Parking and Picknick area in the forest close to the caspian sea. Entrance fee into the forest was 100.000 Rial . Toilets and Electricity at the site. Spaciously forest where you can do extensive walks.

name: Copy shop
description: Good place to make quality photocopies, prints and copies of passport photos of you need.

name: copy shop
description: here you can make photocopies in color and b/w. this is the closest near the Uzbekistan embassy we could find. Open at 08:00.

name: Refah express
description:
A grocery store (one of the biggest in Bojnurd with permanent good discounts ) that you can find many of stuffs you need .

Sometimes crowded in the evenings and at nights .

name: car repairer
description:
for a new paint or car reparation.
the man is a good worker
he made a new paint for our truck
he don't speak English

name: jamshidi.shahreza
description:
it' s a designer shop for car seat
he made in leisure our seat and ceiling

name: BRAK YASER
description: Yaser, the head mechanical is a good man. In the place there are several mechanical workshops. Yaser doesn't speak English, We went with a Iranian man who spoke English and everything was easier.

name: Beautiful valley
description: Leave the highway at the parking place opposite of the old caravansery, follow the gravel road to the marked place. Big plain area. good spot for hiking. easy for 2wd. with a bit luck you have 3G.

name: Photos and photocopies
description: Very close to the embassies of Turkmenistan and Afghanistan. They have photography room and good photocopying and printing service. They also plasticize. We made copies of the visas ... but also printed and laminated a map in DIN-A3.

name: Red sand hills
description: Beautiful region of shallow reddish hills. Anywhere around is a good camp spot, not far from the freeway.

name: Belgheys historical city
description: "Belgheys Historical city is one of the biggest brick building in lran with 4000 years antiquity and located 3 kilometer from esfarayen, that is 180 hectare square meters. A small citadel that contains 29 tower is the most outstanding trace that remained in this city and is part of the biggest ancient castles in Iran."

name: Police Park
description: Nice Spot to stay for a night. Toilets are close by, but locked in the night. Many Restaurants in the park. Maybe a bit noisy, because of soccer court.

name: Drinking Water
description:
A water filter shop that also sells filtered water. Locals come to get water. 
100 Liters for 30'000 Rials

name: Parking at Bus Terminal
description: Paid parking in front of the bus terminal. 60'000 Rials for normal car per day, 120'000 for big rigs. Toilets, water, shops, restaurants available.Direct city bus to holy shrine for 5'000 Rials.

name: Toyota Workshop
description:
It was the only place where we could find the stuff we needed, searched weeks for it is, so we were very happy with it. For our diesel car they did not had everything we needed, because Iranians don't drive diesel.

Open sat. to wed. from 8:00 till 16:00 (close for lunch from 13:00-14:00). open on Thu. 8:00 13:00.

name: Chalus Beach Campsite
description:
A crowded and official campsite right next to the beach. There are many locals that come here with there tents  in the evening. The public toilets are for free. There is a spot for dishwashing (not the cleanest). Many parking lodges down the street. It is a safe place. It might get loud at night.

2 guys was nocking at 8pm, wanted 50k Toman money for parking?

name: Yata traditional Hotel
description: We could camp at the parking of the Hotel and paid 500.000 for using the facilities of one of the rooms. Friendly owner and a safe place. The parking is surronded by a wall.

name: Old Castle
description: Calm Place outside a big Castle, good Place to Start to the Saltlake avoid the Checkpoint, they dont let you pass without guide

name: Castle Saryazd
description: Very old Castle, good condition, Dated 3.-7.th Century A.D. One of the oldest fortress in Iran

name: Forrest Park
description: Very nice Park. You will find a quiet place.  We stayed a bit behind the official park in the Forrest.

name: Sarpoolaki Group
description:
family workshop, father (Salim) and son (Soroush), working for 4x4 offroad racing, custom made builds, years of experience.

can help for any car & model

contact Soroush on whatsapp: +989125877426

name: Colorful Mountains
description: In this area you can find the Colorful Mountains. It is very nice for taking pictures. There must be some more nice spots but without guide this was the most impressive one I found.

name: Diesel available
description:
Diesel available here. Friedly people
600Rial per Liter.

name: Nice place near river
description:
Several places along the river in this area to park and camp. On the weekends could also be used by locals. Nice gras at this time of the year. This place is not visable from the road. You can reach this places also without 4x4. With big trucks you have to check. Probably closer to the road you find a place here.
Good 4G Internet available.

name: Possible turnoff to waterfall
description: Another possible way to the waterfall from here. Road is rough. 4x4 recommended but locals do it with their Saipa.

name: VW Specialist Mashhad
description:
At this place you can find the VW specialist of Mashhad. He speaks little English.
Also several other workshops and shops for spare parts in this area.

name: Excellent car wash
description: Got my muddy car washed here behind the gate. Excellent work. Guy was busy 30 minutes and refused payment (taroofing me). I payed 200.000 Rials and it appears he was happy. So, nothing extraordinary here, but if your vehicle needs cleaning, give him a try.

name: Spring and palm trees
description: Very nice place at the end of a canyon, where a small spring creates a natural oasis. Plenty of shade. Spring gives drinking water. There is a small settlement with an ermite on a ledge above. Attention : travel in Baluchistan is not advised.

name: Wild camp on the beach
description:
Nice place but lots of rubbish. Fantastic view on rock formations. Lone tree for shade. 4wd advised although not strictly necessary.
Mud volcano nearby.

name: Shamkaahl Valley
description:
Nice stop in Shamkaahl Valley. 
Several spots during the drive through this nice valley. Accessible also without 4x4 but rough road. Your van/truck should not too big. The valley is very narrow.

name: Hossain’s shop ‭+98 936 341 7371‬ Hossain Fakouri Fard
description: I stayed at his place one night. Decent man. He asked me to add his shop to help other tourists. You can ask him. ‭+98 911 183 8461‬

name: Laft Park
description:
New picknick / camping park just north of lovely Laft. Not yet completed at the moment, but looks like it will be nice in a couple of months. Don’t know if cars can still go in by then. Life (and picknick) on the island continues until late at night (and practically stops 12-5 in the afternoon..). 
The village is the most atmospheric on the island.

name: Kong Beach
description:
Sandy beach west of Kong old town. There’s a nice picknick park next door. Funky tree trunk toilets not in use at 50m. Better toilets plus shower (in the women’s) on the far side of the park past the playground. Also possible to park up between the playground and toilet block. 
Quiet at night. Mind the tide.

name: Coffeeshop
description: not sure about the exact location, but somewhere on this side of the street. They sell real coffee, we bought some so we can make our own espresso again. So happy. It is difficult to find coffee in Iran. You can also sit here and drink a coffee.

name: Salt dome
description: You leave the road here to drive to the salt dome

name: Cliff camping
description: Tons of places to camp on the cliffs around the cape. Take any track branching off the main road. Beautiful coast. Contrary to what the map shows, you can only come via the main road from the bay side, not from east.

name: Road from Paveh to Marivan
description:
Amazing mountain road over 2.800m, Iraq within eyeshot. Completely tarmaced, in quite good condition, big rig fit. Steep slopes! Several military checkpoints, passport control, but everyone very polite. Road is busy on Fridays: picnic always and everywhere!

The pass closes in winter, at a few kilometers north of Nowdeshah, where this road connects back to the mainroad. So check if it’s open if you want to drive towards Marivan in winter. You can do a loop back to Paveh though!

name: Wild camp with wide view
description: On a hill, apart from streets and villages, with a nice view over the hilly landscape. Access via 1km earth road.

name: Caravanserai off-road
description: If you really fancy off-road driving and exploring a semi-ruined caravanserai you could head here. Road is very rocky and slow going and not easy, at least from the south. Don’t know about the north (Shiraz) side. Need 4wd, high clearance and good tires. Caravanserai front gate is locked, but back wall is easily scaled. You could pitch tent inside or on front lawn. Cars can only be parked on the track if you find flat spot. No problem because locals don’t take their cars up this road :)

name: Rest area with hot shower
description:
Rest area on the Bam - Kerman Road. 

Big bathroom with toilets (western/pit) hot showers, hot and cold watertabs, place with sinks (perfect to wash clothes) and electricity. Very friendly staff. Super clean and warm place, all in working order.
All for free, but it's worth thinking about, to put something in the tip box in the entrance hall. 
Open during the day, closes around evening prayer.

Outside:
Water tabs, big parking area, grasy area behind the building, good to pitch up a tent. Some shops and a mosque nearby.
It's a bit off the main road, but still some traffic noise.

Gasstation under construction.

name: cafe Sanam
description:
Really nice coffee place with Wifi and really good omelet and coffeeshake.
 Many choices for breakfast (pancakes, eggs), fruit juices, shakes.

name: Eucalyptus forest near Shush
description: Nice place not far from Shush but with little noise from the road. Access is via a dead-end road, so very little traffic and chances are you will be alone. Flat (but hard) ground with lots of trees for shade. Access from Shush is via a floating bridge and height is limited to 2.50 meters. 4g irancell.

name: Bisotun
description: Warning : The Darius bas-relief is still hidden behind a fence (and has been for 2 or 3 years) to do some consolidation work on the site. Therefore the carving of Darius is inaccessible and all but invisible except from far away with binoculars. The others sights are minors. So if you come here only to see that, you better save your 20000 T (plus 3000T parking) and get a nice picture from Wikipedia.

name: Flat valley near Bisotun
description:
Beautiful valley at the bottom of big rocks. Well known by locals who come here to picnic, but they all leave before the night. Totally quiet at night. Only sheeps (and shepherds) in the morning.
Irancell 4g.

name: Mehmet Café
description: Really nice place to have a coffee! It is a beautiful garden with a coffee cafe and restaurant. Excellent coffees and herbal teas. They are open every day from 10 am till midnight. Restaurant is open from 19:00 (we did not try the food, because we were here in afternoon). Great spot for a break on your way between Isfahan and Shiraz.

name: Wild camp with lake view
description: At the roadside (nearly no traffic), slightly above the lake, wide view.

name: River Camping
description: Acces over a dirt road (depending on weather conditions 4x4 advisable). Flat stripe of grass slightly above the water. Totally quiet at night.

name: Quiet & Hidden
description: Follow the earth road to a dry river bed with some trees. It is totally quiet at night and almost invisible from the street.

name: View Point
description: Mountain pass, 3000m altitude, great view.

name: Police checkpoint
description:
small Check point before the city, usual questions about route & travel reason
no problems

name: Mellat Park
description: Safe overnight place in mellat Park, toilet and water available.

name: Big Supermarkt
description: Nice big supermarkt with a lot of choice.

name: River camping
description:
Wonderful green mountainous landscape around and clear blue raging river. Several good spots to camp downstream from the little dam. 
The small road from Dorud to here is a stunning drive, all paved, but beware it is pretty narrow in places, with a deep drop next to the road. You might have to back up for oncoming traffic. I would not dare to drive this with a big truck (both for size and weight), unless you’re fearless. 

The road from here further to Bisheh waterfall is -for now- unpaved and also very scenic. 

The region north of Cham Chit (not this spot) including Gahar Lake is a nature conservation area, for which a specific permit (to be obtained in Tehran or Dorud) is apparently required.

name: Dez Valley view
description: Beautiful spot overlooking the valley. Not far from the road, but barely any traffic. Just jackals. Locals came to say hi and offer wild mushrooms. You could also drive to the top of the hill to be out of sight.

name: Laundry Amir
description: it is a laundry and you can wash for 20000 rial or 30000 rial by clothes or wash and iron for 50000 rial per clothes. Amir is very nice but does not speak english and did not charge us for underwear. there is no dryer so wait until it dries the day or recover the next day. Closed until 14h to 17h but open very later (midnight and more...)

name: Sherez Canyon
description: We were allowed to camp on the little parking lot at the start of Sherez Canyon. One day and one night for 100.000 rial. Very basic toilets. Hadi runs a little shop at the car park and serves fish kebab in the big tent. Three dogs around. It’s a great canyon for some hiking. The drive to here has some beautiful views also.

name: Viewpoint hill
description: Many spots to camp on this hill. Locals come to picknick here, but more than enough spaces. Park close to the end of the gravel road if you want to be invited, or drive further into any of the tracks if you don’t :). Quiet night. Great sunset views.

name: Diesel Station
description: Diesel for 600 toman on the east bound highway

name: Wild Camping in the Dunes
description:
Just a few kilometers out of Yast you can find sand dunes and a good track. Nice Wild camping in the dunes/desert, no 4x4 needed.

Take the main road until the sign „desert tourist camp“ and go left and follow the track. Once you come to the entry gate of the first cravanserei watch for a small entry one your right. Go on the hard sand as fare as you like :-)

name: Uraman-Takht
description: Large parking plateau just past picturesque Uraman-Takht village and the ribbon-tied trees at its shrine, with a nice view into the gorge below. Next to the road, but quiet at night. Relatively clean toilets.

name: Outdoor, hunting and fishing supplies
description: Small shop with various (international) brands for outdoor sports, hunting and some fishing equipment

name: Uraman valley
description:
Quiet spot at the top of a side road down to the start of the lake. A couple of places to park, depending on size of your vehicle. Some spots somewhat in sight of the road, but many trees around. Super nice view. Only donkeys came by. Quite a few picknick campfire spots. 
Road seems fairly recently paved.

name: Various shops in this street and neighbourhood
description: Various car part, accessory and tire shops in this street

name: Lake Zarivar hill
description: A quiet tree-covered hill with a nice view of the lake. There might be nice spots at the lake as well, but we arrived in the dark so couldn’t find access to the lake easily and drove up this hill instead. Turned out to be a very nice spot when we woke up. And likely more quiet than down below. You can also drive further up the hill. Small-ish track so if you have a larger vehicle better to walk up first. Entry to track at 35.5423, 46.087836.

name: in the forest
description: short path can be bad if it is raining but you can find a good spot here if you like forest!

name: parking near Masuleh
description: if you have a big car or if  it is crowed it is a good place to park to visit the village (5 min walking). From here you can walk 30 min by a path to see a beautiful waterfall too

name: Pallingan hill
description: Some flat picknick spots a little up the hill here, however not far from the road. Drive the steep track further up like we did (picture) if you prefer to be out of sight with less road noise. Not for big rigs though. Couldn’t drive to the top of the hill where you can look down into the deep canyon unfortunately, but it’s worth a walk.

name: Wild Campsite - Hike Starting Point
description: We stayed at this place because it is the starting point to hike up the Shir Kuh. We liked it here so much that we stayed two nights. There‘s fresh spring water from the mountains available and lots of wood to start a fire when it gets cold at night. You have to search around a bit to find a flat surface, the ground is very rocky. Hiking up the Shir Kuh apparently is quite popular with Iranians. We were here during the weekend and it got quite crowded with hikers especially early in the morning and late afternoon. Nonetheless we‘d definitely recommend.

name: Camping spots near road
description: It’s a bit close to the road but here’s small river and nice view if you have not much choice near here it’s a good option

name: Copy shop
description: Standard copy shops with some stationary and maps of Teheran

name: Copy & printshop
description: Good quality copyshop. Here you can also print documents.

name: Zafaraniey ecolodge
description:
When you arrive in the village, ask people and they open the ecolodge for you. There are 3 rooms, basic and one kitchen and toilet to share. Yaser can do lunch/diner and breakfast for you. He can visit with you the caravancerail and old village. It s quiet   But the mosquee is near and sometime the imam don t stop! 
We paid 500 000 rial for 2persons for 1night. And 500 000 rial for lunch and breakfast for 2 persons. Its indicate in lonely planet, but there is no tourist and simple.

name: Lake Churat
description:
A very nice lake in the forest. Multiple places to park northeast side of the lake. We chose and marked furthest spot with car. 
Iranians/Tehranis know this place so avoid it during weekends by all means. It was quiet and peaceful on Wednesday, but by Friday it had turned into what appeared to be more like festival grounds. 

We were stopped in Churet village and were asked to pay. It didn’t seem very official and price was not clear, no English spoken, and eventually they just told us to follow a motorbike. They escorted us 10km from the village to the lake (all unpaved) and led us via a small unmapped downhill track from the road to the lake, all in the dark.. Not for big rigs and not when wet, but locals do it in normal cars. There are more roads on the map, but they’ve all been blocked so the only way is via Churet village. 

Upon arrival they immediately started a fire for us. They asked more for their escort+entry, but accepted 100.000 rial and then brought out the shisha/hookah. The next day they walked around the lake to pick up trash.. a rare sight in Iran.

name: Diesel Kashan / Pars Oil
description: Here you can get 2 types of diesel, Euro2 & Euro4. We paid 600 toman a liter (euro4) and could use the tankcard of the fuelstation.

name: Jungle Road
description: Short dead-end side track 50m off the windy gravel road through the forest. In full sight of the road. View of the valley below.

name: Qazvin Parking Area
description:
Parking Area near the Center and a small Park.
Not so noisy at night. 
24h = 100000 IRR
we enter with our car easily (6.5m long, 3.4m high)

name: Bahman Park
description: On our way to Bajgiran we found this spot as there is nothing else nearby. Main road is close, but okay. they have toilets and even showers and small shops where you can buy some groceries. a lot of Irians had a picknick (of course ... it's a public park ;)) but everybody was super friendly and nobody bothered us. toilet use was 5K Rial for everybody (seems that this is also an official stop for trucks). all in all a good place to spend a night!

name: copyshop
description: last place before Turkmenistan to make copies. they can make black and with and color.

name: coffeeshop
description: here you can buy coffee :). lots of different choice.

name: Fresh Water
description: Fresh and drinkable natural water from a small reservoir coming from taps. Used by locals as well.

name: City Camping Yasuj
description: There is a camp ground next to a waterfall where a lot of locals camp too. We did not have to pay anything. Noisy and crowded at day and night, but a good place to meet people. Pit toilets and potable water.

name: Zanjan rest camp
description: Local rest camp (iranian are camping here overnight) in the city of Zanjan. Right beside themain street/roundabout but quiet at night and we felt safe

name: Turkey Iran Border Crossing
description: Bording Crossing between Turkey and Iran. I cross to Iran with green card but I am sure they sell insurance locally if required. Very small crossing, staff at both sides are very friendly, it took us less than an hour to drive out to Iran. Carnet required. Road on Iranian side is not as bad as google maps may show, nearest town is Khoy 40km away.

name: Riverside
description: Camping next to a bridge directly on the river banks. Downstream nice hiking trail into the valley. Use Google Earth to find the unpaved road to the bridge.

name: Dopolan
description: A place near the river where you can do bungy jumping. There is tap water. Nice view and quiet place. Village not far away so many chance you meet local people.

name: Rest Area
description:
A Rest Area near by the Highway to Teheran.
Gasoline Station with a small Market and Toilet's.
Noisy because of the Highway.

name: Camp by the Military Museum
description:
near to the Military Museum, by the Taleghani Park, a Parking Area for free, Toilets and Water in the Park, Metro Station five minutes walk,
the best time for arrival is in the morning between 3 and 8 am or in the evening between 6 and 8 pm
it's noisy in the evening, at night ok
(4G with MCI)

name: Oil Service
description: Very nice and professional oil service garage. Various oils available. But bring your own filters and spare parts.

name: Camp south of Teheran
description:
Park with Picnic Huts, Toilet's and portable Water,
busy at night (after 5pm until midnight), not so noisy

name: camping spot with great view
description: camping spot at the top before driving down into the valley to Masuleh. fabulous view and completely alone.

name: Traditional Guesthouse Masouleh
description:
Traditional guesthouse run by a friendly family in the middle of this beautiful village. They just started 5 months ago and doing a good job. There are 8 traditional rooms (sleeping on the ground), a few with AC. The rest of the facilities you share with the family. You can have dinner, breakfast & lunch with them and are really happy to show you around and give a glimpse of the Nayband life. 
The guesthouse is at the end of the road which leads into the village. Just before the guesthouse you have to ride through some sort of gate so big rigs need to park 50m from the house. We just made it through with our car (2.45m high). He made us decide what to pay. We Paid 1.000.000 for 2 including dinner & breakfast and he seemed happy with it. There are no signs of the guesthouse but you will find his contactdetails on the added photo.

name: DHL service point
description: You can pickup and send packages at this place, don't  trust Google maps for the address

name: Kalat Summerpalace
description: Just next to the entrance of the summerpalace. We asked permission to both the gardener and the police. Park closes in the evening, so toilets and water are unavailable then. Visiting palace is 40 000 irr pp.

name: Gara Soo
description: Typical Iranian campsite (so can be busy). Near the waterfall that supplies water for the Summerpalace in Kalat.

name: Temoureh National Park
description: campingplaces inside the national park next to the river. Entrance 50 000 irr for two people and Unimog. The park itself is beautiful, plenty of birds, but not very big. Gets busy on Thursday afternoon like every other park in Iran:-)

name: Bokurdak
description: diesel and petrol from TNÖ, no water or gas

name: Hotel Nejati
description: double room for a couple is 1 200 000 incl breakfast.

name: Garmeh drinking water fountain
description: Free drinking water in the desert. Opposite of public toilet, directly below the castle walls.

name: Park next to Azadegan bus stop
description: potable water next to the street. toilets nearby.

name: Camping spot near river with possibility to hike
description:
You can camp next to a river here in the Zagros Mountains. There is a fresh water spring for drinking water. Irancell only on Edge. No other facilities. The road is unpaved however it was easy to drive also with a normal car with nearly no ground clearance.

Great thing here is that you can start a hike into the valley here which is really beautiful!When you come down the road with your car around 200m before the bridge you can start the walk on the left side. Climb the little hill and from there on you will find the trail easily (no signs but the path is visable). you can walk for 2 hours along the river, through the fields and along the mountains. You can swim in the river.

name: Camping next to a big park
description:
Big Parking Lot with a little bit of shadow. There is a huge park next to it with restaurants, tennis ground and place to put your tent. There is also a little kiosk selling coffee and tea. 
There are toilets and drinking water. Cost 100.000 Rial for one person with Van.

name: Gileboom Eco Lodge
description: Gileboom Eco Lodge. You can sleep in private rooms or shared rooms or in the „treehouse“. It is also possible to park your car and sleep inside (car should not be higher than 2,5m because of the gate). Beautiful green place with veranda and tree house. Price was 500.000 Rial for one person sleeping in the car and using shower/toilet and incl. breakfast and free tea + dates the whole day. You can also eat delicious homemade dinner there. There are 4 different hikes in the area that you can do with or without a guide.

name: picknick place and camping
description: You can camp and picnic with Iranians here. It is around 5km stretch by the river in the forest. Some restaurants here also. You can go deeper into the forest for privacy

name: gravel bushcamp
description: it is just off the main road. we could hide behind the bushes with our tent and motorbike. very quiet at night. no internet signal

name: Alangdareh Forest
description:
Beautiful forest where many Iranians come to escape the heat of the city. Makes for a good camping spot as well. An extremely nice police officer insisted that I camped next to the Police Station, because: ‘Iranians are hostile’. There are many other spots (more secluded) to be found in this region. There are several water taps and toilet buildings in the forest: squat toilets with running water. If you get invited, just like me, at the police station there is also a shower. Be aware that Iranians are extremely curious people and that this place can be crowdy. 

Edit: After spending the night here I think I would recommend the parallel road in the direction of Ziarat which is cooler, probably less crowded, and has way better secluded camping spots

name: Waterfall
description: Nice waterfall at the end of the gravel road out of Ziarat, with several tea and Shisha houses near the parking area

name: Palmtree Canyon
description: shady place under the palmtrees with a small salty river. In June 50°C at day and 30°C at night. No moscitos. Quiet.

name: Rainforest with nice stream
description: Countless campings spots along this road. Further back at the three lane section there are toilets and taps for drinking water. Recommend to go into the forest, from where the stream starts. This place is much nicer than the Arangdarreh Forrest, but discovered that only the next day ;)

name: Hostel on top of the hill
description: Good place for staying overnight at Khalid Nabi if you do not fancy camping there (it can be quite windy on top). Have Persian style rooms with carpets, a small restaurant, shower to clean yourself after the drive through the desert and you can park inside the hotel grounds. Usually deserted, but it is said it can be extremely busy during new year and the end of Ramadan. The manager often sleeps somewhere so it seems, have some Iranians help you find him :) Paid 250.000 rial for a night including diner.

name: Tehran Hostel - perfect to get your bearings back
description: planned to stay here for 1 night, stayed for 3! it is a nice hostel with dormitory, private rooms and apartments. Very good value for money, beds are 10€ pp/pn (including breakfast, free tea all day). private rooms are from €20. The owner is very nice and friendly, you can ask for discounts as he is open to them. The place is superb, cosy launge, clean and comfortable beds and facilities - western toilet :-). There is kitchen and garden. Washing machine 300 000 rials per load. Hostel is on the quiet and safe dead end road, we parked our motorcycle there. The area is very quiet and at the same time central. it is a great place!

name: Laleh Park Camping
description:
Hugh Park a bit outside of the City.
you can drive in to the park. really quite at night.
in the evening a lot of locals come for picnic.
during the day you will lonesome
toilets and water available
free of charge
(MCI 3G - 4G)

name: Behind a quarry
description:
Behind a abandoned quarry and invisible from the road. Nothing special but flat and good for one night.
We had an Irancell SIM but here we’ve got „432 12“ LTE Network.
Maybe difficult road if its rainy.

name: Cyrus Guesthouse
description:
A great guesthouse if you want to discover the iranian culture and visit Persepolis or the town. They speak english and french. They are very helpfull and will show you all the aspects of the cultural capital of Iran. We stay there 10 days and it was wonderfull. Afordable prices from 20€ for a double room or 30€ for triple room. Dormitory or single room available on request. Restaurant available on demand.  One inside parking available for small vehicule  on demand.

To contact them : neo-cyrus-tours on Facebook or pouryayahyaee@gmail.com

name: Last Diesel before Turkmenistan
description:
We drove back to this gas station because in Quchan there is only one Diesel Station, but their card was defect. I think this is the last Diesel station if you are coming from the direction of Mashhad.
Normal price (600 Toman / L )

name: Copy Shop
description: Closest Copy Shop we could find to Turkmenistan Embassy. Good prices

name: Diesel/Gasoil Station
description: Gasoil for good price, something below 600 Rial. One of the very few in Teheran.

name: Flat area behind small shop
description: Just south of the tunnel on the old road. There is a small shop, behind it there is rather large flat area where you can pitch your tent next to a small stream.

name: Diesel petrol
description: Unfortunately no diesel card but ask some truck drivers to get some diesel. We got 20l

name: Aghigh Shopping Centre - Supermarket
description:
huge supermarket with prices
no fruits or vegetables, no bread

name: Beheshti Street
description:
In this street you will find motoroil and grease for car and trucks, some tool's aswell.
I added a other point where the service stations are located for truck's and car's

name: Service Stations for Trucks
description:
In this area you will find a service stations for truck's and cabins, also some parts, like bearings and so on.

for oil and other stuff, look to other point "Beheshti Street" also you can call 09132126399 vrezh 
09131198693 arvin for any help ,questions or any job for your car ,we are ready to help you dear tourists ,also we can talk english persian and armenian .

name: Near Na'in
description: fuel station with diesel, we didn't find another one in Na'in . As someone else mentioned before, they don’t have a Diesel card!

name: Headed to Shiraz
description:
Fuel Station in direction to Shiraz/Persepolis. diesel available.
600 Toman per liter without card

name: Spot over village laft
description:
We only had breakfast here but also a great spot to have a night over the village. 
4x4 recommended 
LTE available

name: car wash
description: a place to clean motorbike car after driving on salt lake. paid 100 0000r, car us 200 000r.

name: Diesel
description:
Gas station that sells Diesel. Rather expensive, 50L for 500.000 Rial. But very friendly staff and we could refill our water tanks. 

wirst rip off ever. 600.000 toman for 30l Diesel!

name: Hypermarket near Metro Station Razi
description:
a bigger supermarket with a good selection.
they have no vegetables, fruits and bread but everything else
the metro station Rezi is 50m fare away, 600 Toman per Trip (to the center) and per person. you have to buy a Chetan on the ticket counter.

name: Park near Fasa
description:
a park with picnic areas, some locals here at the evening, it's a bit away from the highway, so it's not so noisy at night. 
non portable Water available, toilets = I'm not sure
free of charge
not very nice but ok
some small supermarkets nearby in direction Shiraz. 
there is also a campground not far away, but it seems like closed

name: Bakery
description: A local bakery within walking distance. One bread is 20.000 rials

name: Badgir Hostel
description: Nice hostel. standard price of 10€pp pn. you can try negotiate. we slept outside in the patio or on the roof for 10 usd for 2, however it was hot :). parking outside but safe

name: Diesel (price scamming)
description:
diesel and dieselcard
We payed 400000 rial for 65 liter

name: Gasoil/Diesel Station
description: 600 Rial plus rounded up for station attendant

name: Messo Qali Cafe
description:
Very good coffee, tea, drinks and small things to eat like club sandwich. 
Mohammad the owner speaks very good English and French!
Don‘t miss it!

name: Campingspot with shadow
description:
Difficult to find a camping spot without lots of locals or with shadow in this area. We drove here, with two motorbikes. There’s a walking path between two rocks. You can drive quite far in and we were not seen. Also good spot for hikers. 
Dark from 22:00, sun goes down right in front of you behind a mountain. Beautiful.
More important: shadow until 08:30 in the morning. (June) 
Slept without a tent, with mosquito net.

name: Camping spot over barrier lake
description:
Nice camping spot, looks like locals walking down to have barbecue, but you can only drive down the road with 4x4.
So we were absolutely alone. Three friendly dogs slept next to our camper. 
3G available

name: Religious shrine- Nowjeh Mehr- نوجه مهر
description: A religious shrine with loads of room to rent. It a room with carpet and few blanket and pillows. You can park your vehicle next to your room. It’s 20000 toman. That’s $3. You can use the toilets outside.

name: Hotel ATA
description: Comfy, clean and reasonably priced hotel. It has a secured underground parking and serve foods too. The hotel is roughly situated opposite the hospital in Salmas and easy to find. Form here to Bazargan border crossing its about 210km.

name: Cafe kargah
description:
Really nice new Cafe by some young locals, who turned a textile workshop into a cafe. very nice western toilets :)
recommend the cucumber punch.

name: Diesel/Gasoil Station
description: Highway in direction out of Mashad, price 600

name: Milankaleh Wildlife Sanctuary
description: We could not enter the park by car- but it seemed locals on motorbikes could go in.

name: Camp near Suza
description:
a huge park between main street and the sea,
Toilets and water available, electricity at the small shop or the mosce, maybe in the toilet
not so busy during the day and quite at night, except the mosce, some dogs and cats around
very clean, security at night 

to fill up your water tanks with a hose, use the water tap after the mosce, nearby the toilets

name: Finger Ridge Track
description: On the road to the border you can take a small dirt track on the right to a finger ridge which overlooks the desert from about 800 meters up, too narrow for big rig but great photos and possibility to wild camp (may be windy)

name: public parkimg near the park
description: wc and drinking water available. parking space by the road but secure

name: Scammers - Rial Money Exchange
description: Guy on the picture ( attached), approached tourists offering stay at his home. He approached us by Couchsurfing, sent us lots of messages. We intended to stay 2 nights, after 1st night stay he made up a story that he is in need for USD dollar and can exchange offering 60% value of free market - we refused. Following day at 6pm he asked us to leave his place.  Also on the first night there were 2 more couch surfers - same story, questions about exchange for very bad exchange rate - they left. Avoid this guy or others.

name: MahBibi Hostel
description: Wonderfull hostel run by young people. It just opened and everything is clean and comfortable. The courtyard is very nice and cool. You can park your car right in front of the place. they helped us with everything, also finding a garage. We payed 30 euro's per night for a double with shared bathroom including breakfast. Love this place!

name: Arvin pro-fabrications
description:
We got a custom made intercooler! they put all their work aside to help us as quick as they could. They also helped us with our alternator and small maintenance. Their English is really good and they are very nice. We were invited for lunch and tea. Arvin, Vrezh and Pouya were very kind. You can give them a call.
2 brothers are working in workshop they can provide oil with specification of your motorcycle , and can provide also spare parts that its need , it would be better to talk and explain with them about the jobs you need before reach their work shop to bring whatever you need with parts number , as you know finding spare parts and oil for high capacity engine motorbike in iran is difficult ,and you should know the number or have used one with. they are very help full ,kind and can speak english that is very useful and better for tourists ,of course its difficult to find some one to talk and explain about problem.
can contact and reach them by whats up .

Arvin +989131198693
Vrezh +9132126399
Pouya +989132698673

name: Road towards dam
description: We were not allowed to camp at the dam or drive to the waterfall so drove to this place. Very quiet en cool at night. the view from the road is beautiful. stayed for one night.

name: up hill from forest park
description: drove uphill to water cisterns. nice view over the city. 4wd needed. some motorbikes came up in the evening but didn't bother us. at night very quiet and cool. from entrance park straight forward.  passed the little shop on the left.

name: Bandar Abbas – Sharjah UAE ferry ticket office
description:
Bandar Abbas-Sharjah: Monday, Wednesday and Saturday at 22:00
Sharjah-Bandar Abbas:  Sunday, Tuesday and Thursday at 9PM

Valfajr office inside the South Seas Shipping Company building 27°09.925’N 56°13.763’E. Take a left on the second floor, then it is the second to last office on your left. You get the option to pay for your vehicle in Bandar Abbas (in rials) or on arrival in UAE (in dirham). If you do not have a car or motorbike, you can also go to Bala Parvaz TravelAgency on Imam Khomeini Street.

More info https://caravanistan.com/transport/persian-gulf-ferry/bandar-abbas-sharjah/

3550000 per person, 12ml rial for motorcycle payable at the port. give the whole process half a day.

name: Amir Hostel
description: More of a hotel but there are double and triple rooms. Very basic: just two beds and a bathroom, no wifi but working airco and tv. We paid 660.000 rials for a double room so quite cheap.

name: nice park next to the highway
description:
park is just of the main road and full of locals in the evening. camping and bbq not a problem at all. between highway and park is the parking lot.
toilet and mosque building right next to parking.

name: Badab-e Surt Camping
description:
Campsite has just opened recently (status June 2018) it provides basic toilets and huts, shower not working yet (if ever)
A hut is 20.000 IRR (2USD at time of writing)
Food and cold water is provided.
Parking for cars and motorbikes is provided (watch out for the deep gravel though!)
At the time of writing there was an English speaking electric engineer on site - others don’t speak English, but are very forthcoming and helpful!

Badap-e Surt springs are 20min walk uphill - getting up there with a fully loaded motorcycle is not recommended (very steep and sandy road uphill consisting more of deep potholes than anything else. Also quite slippery even when walking sometimes) cars with high clearance can do it.
It is said to visit early in the morning, when potholes contain more water.

name: Beautiful Mountain Top 360 View
description: Wild camping on top of a beautiful hill, the view was amazing. Peace and quiet all night. Totally safe. You need 4x4 to get there. 10 min from the main road. You could probably choose any hill top in this area.

name: Saveh Park
description: a nice one of the typical Iranian local parks where they Picknick and camp. this one has lots of trees and if you are lucky even small water streams running through them when they water the trees.

name: Alamut castle parking or golestan hotel yard
description: visitor parking of alamut castle (of the assassins), where the little hike to the castle starts. there is shady spots where you can park on gravel park lot. few dogs around but other than that quiet. public toilets are well looked after. alternatively the owner of the golestan hotel next to the parking offered to camp in their yard, big old trees and big garden. also good to pitch a tent I assume. the hotel itself is pretty run down but the yard is beautiful.

name: restaurant on way to alamut
description: good lunch break spot,  we also parked one night in front of the restaurant and got water from them.

name: Bojaq National Park
description:
Amazing site, near the beach! An area full of wild water buffalo and wild horses. A lot of bugs and very humid. Make sure to stay on the paths while driving, you don't want to end up in the swamps. 4x4 is recommended. 
If you struggle to find the way locals will help you. It is worth seeing even though you might not want to camp. Amazing!!

name: Taha hostel
description: Budget hotel which is ok with good breakfast, after fighting the price we payed 850,000 Rial per night for a twin room with breakfast included. The place is nothing fancy but is clean enough and the owner is always trying to help, breakfast was excellent. We parked the motorbike overnight inside the hotel but i dont think a big motorbike will fit. (If you come here expect to fight the price)

name: Copy Shop close to Turkmenistan Embassy
description: Closest copy shop to Turkmenistan Embassy(around 800mts), the do good quality color photocopies. They don’t do pictures buy 100 mts from it if you ask for direction there is a photo shop where you can get decent quality passport pictures.

name: Abandoned mud house
description: Abandoned almost roofless mud house on the side of the road ideal for setting up a tent where you can get shelter from the wind at night and sun early in the morning. It has a Concrete floor which is quite clean. There is nothing miles around so bring whatever you may need

name: Excellent place for setting up a tent
description: Great place for setting up a tent, good shade, green grass, artificial lightning during the night, water source, toilets. Quite popular among locals tho, so might be quite busy on weekends, and usually they stay until late(around 1am), which might be an issue if you are planning to go to bed early

name: 4,500 YO Cyprus tree
description: Over 4500 year old Cyprus’s tree, 150 000 rial to get in

name: In the middle of nowhere - close to Khorram Abad
description: Very calm and quiet place beside from farmers land on a dirt road (which is eventually under construction). You have to find your way trough the fields. Irancell coverage LTE

name: Behind old caravanserey
description: Nothing extraordinary, but a good place to stay for one night on the road between Sabzevar and Sharood. We put our caravan behind the wall of the caravanserey to have less wind and shadow. In front there is a mosque and a little shop!

name: Baghestan Recreation
description:
A collection of beton floors with roofs (basically huts without walls). Locals come here for picnic but also for outdoor sleeping.
A lot cooler than in town. Restaurants across the street.
In summer: bring some big cloth or similar to create some shade.
Seems to be free.

name: Fuel Station
description: Diesel available here. 6000 Rial per liter.

name: Snond (+farsi Name)
description: Sells outdoor and Trecking equipment. Various international brands. E.g.: Primus

name: Negaar Guesthouse
description:
Could sleep in the car and use all the facilities of the hostel for 2.5€ p.p.
Shower, small kitchen, fast WiFi. They also offer various tours, but gave us lots of info on what to do around Varzaneh for free. How to drive to the dunes, salt lake, where the Milky Way is seen best, that yellow scorpions will kill you within 10 minutes and so on. 
Washing machine is 100.000 rial per load. 
The parking is not private at all. It’s just a parking space next to the road. We’ve put the rooftent up and no one bothered us.

name: Little Lake close to armenien border
description: good for overnight stop, little lake close to the village. In the evening locals came by for fishing and scenic driving, and the local police wanted to see passports but they were friendly and we were allowed to stay. quiet at night and we were all by ourselfs later in the evening (rare enough in Iran so we enjoyed).

name: Military/Police Checkpoint
description: They just wanted to see our passports and noted our numberplate. We were the only ones to be stoped. Many Iranian cars and Trucks passed by.

name: Hyper market with western products
description:
In Isfahan mall. You can get almost everything including car stuff like engine oil
Variety is great like Walmart

name: Shower
description: Shower in Ghadir Park. 60000 IRR. Super clean and warm

name: Bakery
description: As sometimes travelers are looking for some fresh bread , here is a bakery on the main road ; Sangak  bread ; simple or with sesame.

name: Simorgh Park
description:
Typical Iranian City-Campground: Toilets, Water, one restaurant, small shops and some trees but no showers.
Nothing special about the place or the nearby city but a good option if you are looking for a place to spend the night.
We stayed there for one night.

name: Ani House - homestay wonderfull Iranian family (private room)
description:
Private room at home stay at a wonderfull Iranian family. There is parking place in front of the apartment, breakfast and sweets are included but especially the wonderful hospitaly is what you will achieve from staying at this place. After travelling for 4 months this was our best and most memorable homestay. We stayed two times for 2 nights. The family can help you with all you may need to get you started in Iran. Their house is spacious, clean and beautiful. We payed 25euro for two people a night (very reasonable for Iran accomodation)

Family sadeghi:
Whatsapp: 00989123211563
Email: 3211563@gmail.com

Family prefers to contact them before arrival so they can prepare your stay.

name: Sarvekohan Ecolodge
description:
We just stumble on this place randomly. Beautiful garden with gazebos and pomegranate trees. Nicely decorated with local and traditional handcraft. Traditional restaurant just outside. You can park outside of the Ecolodge. We stayed with our little dog here, it was not a problem. We paid 1M Rials for a double room with AC, shared bathroom and breakfast. They also organise tours to see all the curiosities of Abarkuh. Perfect place to stay for a pause between Shiraz and Yazd.
WhatsApp : +98 913 352 5283

name: tir parking
description: There is a big parking lot behind the police station. Quiet at night. All the trucks park in the front so if you go behind you are alone there. There are restaurants small shops and a gas station near by.

name: Emad Nezam Hotel
description:
Modern, new hotel with AC and European toilet. Plenty of rooms, so probably a reservation is not needed in advance. 800k rials double room after negotiations, dinner for 5 people 1 million rials.

So far, best value for price in more than one week of overlanding across Iran.

name: at the beach
description:
There was an old gym in front of the beach. Flat, grassy spot to camp.
Full of rubbish (like everywhere here.) 
Lot of locals come to the beach after work, sometimes a bit noisy (they love to hear loud music).
Swimming for women is only possible in the covered areas (we didn´t go).

name: lpg and cng
description:
the first place in iran where the european Adapter is matching.
nice guy. good lpg

name: parking from besat park
description:
its a guarded parking place in front of the park. (belongs to the park) not possible to drive in the park. but if you camp on the left side, you can park next to the grass.
There is noise from the street. (its in the middle of the city) but its better than paying a lot for a hostel.

name: kharanaq old town
description:
first when you arreach here you see nothing special. park the car here at the road and walk down. you will be in a old silk road town. its very beautyfull.
watch your head. and be carefull, it is like a labyrinth

name: LPG fill station
description: they fill in bottles here. they can fill the tank from the car. real LPG!

name: Campsite
description:
It's an official campsite. They have tents to sleep or just to relax in iranien style. You can also sleep in your own car or tent.
Bigger trucks do not fit in. (campervan was possible 6m long, 2m wide  and 3m high)
there is a toilet.
Very nice and friendly family owners . (they are friendly but with a distance and respect your privacy)
We payed 300 000 rial for a night (campervan and 2p).

name: NO ENTRY - Military training area
description: We wanted to drive through the National Park. At some ‚entrance‘ we got sent away because apparently we need a permit from Tehran to visit. Very unfriendly personnel and military.

name: Mountain pass between Dascht-e Lut and Kerman
description:
Enjoy a cool night up on 2690mts. 
Coming from Kerman just before the tunnel, turn left into the gravel parking lot and from here you can drive a small gravel road up the hill to an abandoned house. Here you‘re out of sight and the nights are super quiet. 
No Internet, only sometimes cellphone reception.

name: Riverbed
description:
A small gravel road heads out from the highway. There are many flat spots to camp. We were here in August so it might have some water in other times of the year. 
Good for one night.

name: First or last Diesel in Iran - Siyahrud
description:
Easy to find and very nice personnel. 
We payed 600t as everywhere else in Iran.

name: Royay-e-aram Outdoor shop
description: Big Outdoor and Camping Equipment shop. Difficult to find in the street. It is in first floor. No.8 Azadi 38. Azadi Blvd. 00989155177098. You can find brands as Sea to sumit, Petzl, North Face, Exped, ...

name: Sarakhs Border
description: Tu->irn took us about 3h. Friendly guys at both sides of the border.

name: Rudkhan castle  قلعه رودخان
description:
