Rudkhan Castle (Gilaki: رودخان دژ‎; also Rood-khan Castle) is a brick and stone medieval fortress in Iran that was built by the Gilaks to defend against the Arab invaders during the Arab/Islamic invasion of Sassanian Iran. With the fall of the Sassanid Empire, this area became a defensive position against the Arabs in the then-newly established Tabarestan.

Located 25 km southwest of Fuman city north of Iran in Gilan province, it is a military complex which had been constructed during the Sasanian era (224-651), and later rebuilt during the Seljuq era by the Nizari Ismailis. The castle is built on two tips of a mount, with an area of 2.6 hectares (6.4 acres). Its architects have benefited from natural mountainous features in the construction of the fort.

The Rudkhan Castle River originates in the surrounding heights and flows from south to north.

After crossing a mountainous winding route with dense forests, the first thing that one notices about the castle is its big entrance gate.

Rudkhan Castle sits at the two peaks of a mountain at elevations of 715 and 670 metres and contains strong fortifications and battlements at a length of 1,550 metres. The castle's 42 towers still stand intact.( wikipedia )

name: Tourist Hotel
description: Bungalow style rooms (double) for 1.9 mio rial.clean, nice breakfast included, decent wifi in lobby. they let us park the bikes in front of our bungalow. restaurant at site

name: Kolum Bastak Basecamp with Security
description: Nice flat Parking area for climbig Kolum Bastak with Security, a very good View and beautiful Sunset. Very busy at Weekend (Thursday, Friday). Other days quiet an less visitors. Pretty cold at night. A good place to stay a few days for acclimate. In Weekend, a few metres down are markets where you get typical persian food and tea. Take the Road 425 from Tehran. The Road from Karaj is Closed during Summer

name: Ghasemi mechanic and spares
description: Said and English speaking Mehdi will provide spares and take you to a good mechanic. Extremely friendly and helpful.

name: beach camp
description: Directly on the beach. No police, only few fishermen walking around. 4x4 is needed to come here. No facilities at all. The next villiage is 4 km away.

name: Shourabil Lake
description: Parking in front of a park with a lot a locals putting up their tents for the night, we had to pay an entrance fee (50‘000 Rial for one Camper/two persons). Toilets not very clean but ok. A lot of food places around and also a little fun-park. The whole park is now car-free-zone (not as shown in maps.me).

name: Mohammad Toyota Specialist
description:
Foreign cars are rare in Iran. Mohammed knows a lot about Toyotas. Drop in or call him if you need any help: +989336671268

We had no big problem to fix, just a small checkup. But he was recommended by a local who owns a 4runner and a Prado.

name: Adoor
description: On our way to Bandar Abbas, about 40 km South of Dschiroft we were invited by a Farmer to look at his place. There we found a garden under trees. It has plenty of water, even a shaded swimming pool is here. We couldnt stay ourself but i think its worth to do so. Beside are the 6000 year old Conan Sandal ruins. The name of the place is „adoor“

name: River bed between Kahnju and Minab
description: Leave the mainroad beside the - in summer-  dry river and find a place under the trees. Its space enough, Its clean. Its nice and silent. irratic 3g data coverage with rightel and Irancell

name: Moein Car Insurance - most helpful!
description: extremely kind and helpful! at this small branch a bit outside the city center Yadi (+989149919032, speaks good English and some German) and his sister Sevil are happy to also help obtaining a Sim-Card. Car can conveniently park in this quiet road.

name: Siyahrud, between small army post and picknick area
description: The friendly army personal did not mind us staying just opposite their entrance gate; very quiet all night

name: dead end, no access to reservoir
description: Unfortunately dead end at the gate to the power station, so one has to stay on the street (not very romantic), but wardens are very kind and it was very quiet during the night

name: 15km N of Sanandaj: large, gated picknick area
description: While first aiming at the iO spot a bit down the dirt road, we knocked at the door of this gated picknick area (purpose/status unknown). After some ‘discussion’, we were let in by the very friendly keepers and could stay for free. There is some shade from the picknick huts; later a couple of locals came, but left around 10pm, so very quiet night. We could tap up our water tank before we left the next morning.

name: Parking at Taq-e Bostan
description:
Parking area is closed due to building works, so no overnight parking possible at this point. The nice manager of Hotel Jamshid would let us use the gated hotel parking for a couple of hours but not to stay overnight (maybe we should have negotiated …) so we decided to take a room for 3.35mio Rl., which was okayish, but not 4*. 
We paid 6T for the taxi into town and 10T back
Water available in the hotel car parking

name: Toyserkan, Habakkuk park
description: Although we did not overnight here, it looks like a quite decent, spacious and green spot some way away from the centre.

name: Reservoir outside Toyserkan
description:
A good road (but a bit small for big rigs) leads up to this spot overlooking the dam. Locals come and go, but quiet at night. Very nice and friendly guardian had no objection against staying for the night.
non-potable water should be available

name: Fuel Station Euro4-Diesel
description: Fuel station at the highway near Maybod with clear Euro4-Diesel, very helpful and friendly staff - and with fuelcard.

name: Rayan Waterfall
description:
Very nice waterfall and a big pick-nic aerea. Lot of people and cars. At entrance you pay 200‘000 Rials per car. we buyed here fresh bred 20‘000 Rials. Best bred since long!
You can‘t stay over night.

name: Park-e Shahr - Parking
description: Good point (parking) to visit intresting locations as National Museum of Iran, Islam Museum, Grand Bazar, Park

name: Espinas Hotel
description:
First big hotel when you exit Astara in direction to Tehran.
Excellent place to take a break after border crossing from Azerbaijan.
Owned by father and son, both great guys.
We get 6 bad room with kitchen, two bathrooms with toilets and with small balcony, together with breakfast for 2 millions Iran Rials
Motorcycle parked in front of reception, non stop at the eye of night guy who work at reception.
Also they have restaurant with great food for great prices.
Simply both wife and me are very satisfied with this hotel, we just hope other will be so good.

name: Tabib Traditional House
description:
Great hotel in traditional persian style.
Wi-fi works great, guys on reception speak great english, ambient is awesome.
Is 10min walk from Hidraulic system, and 15 from Roman bridge.
Double room is 1600000rials
Definitely place to recommend

name: Razi insurance
description:
small office along the road Emam Khomeini boulevard opposite of the petrol station Askan petrol
very good service insurance for 5/10/30/60 days and more

name: Little canal
description: Good place for spending a night. It's off the road and has a channel with clean water.

name: Diesel fuel station
description: Diesel fuel station. Just ask for the diesel card.

name: Parking Kul Farah
description: We did not overnight here but wished we had (picked a bad spot on the other side of the valley), but visited the historical site and thought the parking could be a good place: far away from the main road and settlements

name: Sisakht (Park)
description:
A quite nice mountain village, relatively small parking on a hill with a typical small park and (discontinued) fair ground a bit higher up
The odd local may come up, but it stayed relatively quiet.
Water possibly available in the park

About 7km to the SE, there is Kouh Gol with parking - we didnt check it out but as per locals, it is supposed to be nice

name: along #75, view into the Karun valley
description:
coming from the north, take the gravel road ca. 100m passed the entrance to a quarry, flat plateau with great view into the valley
far enough away from the main road, so quiet at night and not visible
the warden from the quarry came by to check, friendly, no problem to stay for the night
as it is all rocks, probably not suitable for tents
the gravel road leads further down to the river, but we didnt test it. There seems to be one narrow bit, so if driveable it would be only for small cars

name: Samen
description:
at the southern end of the town, take the road to the east which will soon change to a decent dirt road.
we had a quiet night behind a nut tree plantation, passing locals were very friendly
However, as we were just about to leave the next morning, the Police turned up and checked our passports, asking why we stayed so far away from the main road - the answer (we wanted to have a quiet night) seemed to satisfy them. They were very friendly, polite and correct!

name: Hotel Bahman
description: Very clean and nice hotel. Western toilet/douche. Spacious room with big chairs and comfortable bed. Staff is super friendly and helpful. They only speak Farsi, but in our case the lady behind the desk used google translate. Our car could stay in their indoor private garage.(Toyota land cruiser+rooftent 2,5m high).  Laundry service, airco and nobody around who wants to know where you from ;-)! 12€ per night for a room.

name: Shiraz, Joulep Cafe
description:
during our stay in Shiraz, we went twice to this place: excellent food and great drinks! it beats everything we had so far in Iran! Very friendly and English speaking staff.
Would go any time again!

name: Nice river by the road
description: There is a way down to the riverbank here, nice flowing river in Oct, I stopped for lunch and a swim but you could stay overnight, you would be visible from the road and have the noise of the road but apart from that a nice enough spot

name: the real RAGRUG Hostel
description:
- opened last year, designed with much love, every thing is new and clean 
- very nice, helpful and 'professional' stuff
- good kitchen and nice space to relax 
- good internet / WiFi 
- space for some bicycles or motorbikes (no cars) in the patio 
- many other travelers 
- 7 € dorm / 25 € double room (prices are flexible)

name: Cinema Café Sequence - a great place
description:
Being parked at Enqelan Parking, we got approached by Ali Bidhendi, the very friendly owner of Cinema Café Sequence, located on 2nd floor in next door's building of Sahel Cinema.
The café's open air terrace offers a nice atmosphere, a great view to Si-o-Se Pol bridge and has a good selection of drinks, coffees and dishes on the menue.
Definitely a great place to relax!

name: behind the hills - great place
description:
along the Shiraz-Esfahan highway: take the well graded dirt road for about 300m and then turn left into another smaller dirt road.
Great views towards the surrounding hills.
Here you are shielded from the noise from the main road, so absolutely quiet at night.
In the evening, we saw a couple of pickups driving towards the highway and in the morning one paid us a brief, friendly visit.

name: Nice wild camp overlooking lake
description: This is a nice wild camp site overlooking the lake with good views and quiet.  Locals clearly use it from fire settings. A few places here for small rigs or tents.

name: Stone quarry
description:
Take the gravel path on the side of the road. You will find several big flat areas hidden from the road.
No shade. 2wd ok. We barely hear the noise from the road.

name: Parking of public Park
description: I was directed here by an employee from townhall, because the place is guarded and safe for the night. Really friendly, I could park right next to the guards office. They offered me to park inside the park as well.

name: Abandoned village
description: The little village was probably abandoned because of lack of water. There is a well with the bucket and a few dozens of litters. But the water is slightly salty. The houses can be used for wind and sun shadow. Good for cyclists.

name: Nice bivouac
description: Clean and fresh little house, 100m beside the road. There is also a water reservoir next to it. But the water isn't clean and you have to climb down.

name: Water reservoir
description: Water reservoir next to a little farm. the water is pretty good, no salt just a little bit of sediment. Good especially for cyclist in need. ;-)

name: Emergency station
description: Emergency station next to the mosque. One can ask the guys from the emergency station to get some.

name: Ice house
description: Old ice house that is clean but sandy. good place to hide from the wind. water reservoir 100m away, with water and bucket. Not clean, better to filter or boil.

name: Bivouac with two rooms.
description: little house with two clean and two sandy rooms. Perfect shelter for the night. no water when I came.

name: Shelter
description: Shelter with two rooms and carpets. water was available in the reservoir behind it.

name: Big Shelter
description: very nice shelter with 4 rooms, carpets, water and toilet.

name: Dieselabad - truck service - tabriz
description:
At this place and nearby you can find many small workshops to fix trucks.

Make sure to negotiate before. 

It was very dificult to find someone who speaks english.

name: Visa extension Zanjan
description:
Passport and Visa office. Its possible to extend your Visa here, may be a bit complicated because of the language and they are not used to it, but possible. I extended for 10 days, but more should be possible.
If you enter, turn right, through a gate, then left and then enter the building in front of you on the backside. The Passport and Visa office is on the first floor on the right if you come from the stairs. you should pay a small amount in two banks, fill two documents and bring three passport photos

name: Iranhonda milani motorcycle shopping
description:
Very big shop with parts and bikes and accessories, helmets, screws, very helpful owner who rides an ADV bike as well.
They have Iran made tyres (18“ and 21“) in stock. I love the brand 'Iran Yasa', sticky like glue :-)

name: Diesel
description: Diesel available here. Many trucks! Nice guys.

name: Hotel Naranj
description: Clean hotel with big comfortable rooms. Parking in front of hotel inside the court. Doubleroom 1.4 mio rial per night. Italian/iranian Restaurant 300m from there direction Sari.

name: Nice Shelter
description: Single room shelter equipped with fuel stove, carpets and water.

name: Rayen
description:
Free parking between cemetery and fort, higher level so quiet, toilet nearby.
Driveway: do not drive to the fortress, but in the direction of Jiroft. Turn sharp right at the end of Ryen on narrow tarred road and back to the cemetery / fortress.

name: Park in Khalkhal
description: A Park in the citycenter. there's a toilet in the park and you can park your car/van/bus at the Roadside. not a great spot, but ok for a night. not too quiet

name: Dieselabad - good truck service - Tabriz
description:
Very good truck service for airbrakes and everything else in Tabriz. 
we were there with our 40years old Mercedes truck. 

see visitcard at photos.
you'll need translator.

name: Riverside camping
description:
not far away from the main road but nice place for stay over the night. No 4x4 needed. Irancell functions well.

shepherd and some cars passed by.

name: Ranji Hotel
description:
If it’s cold and raining and you are traveling by motorbike, this is the place to go:
- Safe underground garage
- Restaurant 
- shop next door
- breakfast included 
A double room with en suite bathroom is 1,5 mio. 
Rooms are so-so clean, breakfast is so-so as well, but it’s a dry and warm place for you and your bike :-
I think the garage is too low for overlander cars, normal cars will fit, 4x4 no.
No signs at the black glass doors, only one at the corner that mislead to a wrong entrance. :-( We had water kettle and small stove in the room but had to bring our own cups and tea.

name: Ahrab Hotel
description:
Nice hotel. I was charged 1.600.000 for a single room with breakfast and they let me park my motorbike inside their locked garage.

Staff speaks English very well and will help and cater to any request you have - they are really friendly.

name: Davinco Hotel
description:
New hotel with big & safe locked parking behind it. Spacious rooms with everything you‘re dreaming of. Nearly no English spoken, but friendly people like everywhere.
Restaurant a bit expensive, very filling breakfast included. 2,2 Mio for a double (13€ in Oct 2018).
When it started raining, they put our bikes inside because the parking is not covered :-)
Better take the lift, the stairs have some surprises :-)
Enjoy!
WiFi is poor, but mobile internet is perfect :-)

name: Barandaz lodge
description: Nice guest house near the dunes. In a renovated old mud house. The manager is friendly and speak English. To day is 16 euros for a room per night with breakfast.

name: Bushcamp with Valley View
description: Place close to the main road on a wide unpaved road. Good for a night, beautiful  view in the valley, quiet. There is a farm in sight and wolves are howling at night.

name: Zarivar Hotel
description:
Old & ugly Hotel from the 70s with beautiful lakeviews. Inside more 3 star than 4 star, but everything clean and well working.
Big parking in front of the hotel.
Breakfast included, 2mio (14,50$ in Oct 2018) per Double room with lakeview.

name: Flat camping land
description: Flat and clean wild camping spot with water available from smalls creeks. Not far from the road, a gravel road give access to a first open spot. If you cross the small river (may be narrow for big cars, easy for cyclist and motorbikes), just after the trees the spot is even better. Partially hidden from the road its a peaceful place. We saw some shepherd in the morning far away on the hills but nodoby came to disturb us.

name: Parking at Shahed Park - Kermanshah
description: You can park and stay here if you want to visit Kermanshah. With playground for kids and grassy spot for picnic. It smells gas sometimes (oil raffinery nearby) but okay for a night or two.

name: diesel
description:
There is diesel and petrol here.
I paid 10000 rial for a liter diesel

name: Bicycle parts shop
description: Small shop with tires, spokes for bicycles, accessories... Very nice mechanic and cheap.

name: Kalengar cottage
description: a wonderful cottage beside an island that its covered with mangrove tourist . you have view of sea, mangrove forest and mountain altogether.its a dream place for fishing and also you can bird-watching. for visit this place you should book a boat in Harra tourist complex in Bandar Khamir.

name: hot spring motel
description: a good motel in hot spring resort in Bandar Khamir . it is very good place for staying. it has some rooms for renting also or you can stay with your car for free but for room you should pay very low price.

name: HI Tehran Hostel
description: Lovely, clean and well-situated hostel. We stayed 3 night in a dorm and paid 8€ per person breakfast included. There is everything you need to be provided (laundry load 5€) and if you need something else, the friendly staff will help you. They know very well the city and they point us good places for food, motorbike accessories, and camping gear. We put our motorbikes on the patio. Really loved the place.

name: parking at the end of the village
description:
If you are on the way to esfahan and it get dark, you can spend a night here. 

Not far away from the main road and the village. No 4x4 needed. enough paved or stone ground there to park.

only barking dogs came by.

name: Abidar Hotel
description:
Basic central hotel with safe parking behind it. GPS coordinates lead to parking, main entrance is on the main street in the heart of town.
Double room with private bathroom is 110.000 (ca. 7€ in Oct. 2018), traditional iranian breakfast (cream&honey) included. Cheaper rooms with shared bathroom available.
Restaurant downstairs, many other options around.
Don’t expect luxury, it’s a 1 star Hotel offering all you need but nothing else. We loved staying in the centre and slept very well, most rooms are in the backyard and guarantee quiet nights despite being central.

Breakfast very basic. A tiny bit of cream and honey with bread. On request I got 2 more fried eggs or cheese. I chose eggs. As mentioned below we paid 110.000 or 11 dollar. Next time I think 8-10 is more than enough for 2p p night.

name: Digicom Gas station diesel
description: Gas station with diesel, we ran almost out and were happy to find this fuel station. Also toilet available.

name: nice spot upside the road
description:
you can stay here on the way to esfehan. nice view to the mountains and to the fields. upside the nice, old, historical armenian village (khoeygan oleia) with the very old 400years christian church.

No 4x4 needed.

name: Qeshm Chahkooh canyon
description: Bushcamp on cliff overlooking sea, seperated from road by cliff. Quiet with beautiful view.

name: Bicycle parts: Alamir Commerce
description: Good and friendly shop for quality bicycle parts in Tabriz, including Shimano, Zefal etc.

name: Kerman
description:
Diesel (No card, No service). Fuel station where you can get diesel. Very crowded with trucks, guess because it is the last station before going into the desert. After we convinced them we really need gasoline instead of benzine, we could skip the line and got a full tank. But we had to pay 3 times more than at other stations. (But still 6€ for 50 liter...we can’t complain)

Beware of corrupt gas station attendants! First filled and then asked the 10 times price suddenly.

name: Amazing sunset/sunrise spot!
description: These coordinates point out one of the highest Kaluts in the desert. You can park you car somewhere around it. We parked it at a small dried lake on the west side behind a small Kalut to have some shelter for the wind.  During sunset/sunrise you have an amazing view here if you climb up the super high Kalut!! You can see the whole desert from above. I think it is better to go here with 4WD, but when you follow the track 2WD might be possible. Enjoy!

name: Khayam Hotel
description: Dirty hotel, shared dirty bathroom, without breakfast. Parking available. We paid 80.000 toman, way too pricey. Only stay if you need to.

name: Camping spot at a dry lake
description: Nice place to stay overnight if you are driving from Bandar Abbas to sirjan/Yazd or the other way around. Follow the small paved path for about 800m and then follow the dirt track on your left side towards the small rocky Hill. You can park behind the hill on the lake and nobody will see you :-). You can hear the trucks on the highway, but not disturbing at all. Great view over ‘the lake’, nobody around, can be a bit windy.

name: Tabriz propane filling station
description: 70.000 Rials the filling of 12 kg bottle. It is open from 8 am to 2 om

name: Cheap diesel
description:
We found diesel here. 20L from a truck then 20 more from a guy with card. Both gave us back money to pay the price 300T/L!! 
And on the top of that we got a full bag of grappes !

name: Petroleum Station with Diesel Card
description: The petrol attendant had a Diesel card, so we could refill our tank (and a jerrycan) easily.

name: Petrol Station with Diesel Card
description: The petrol attendant had a diesel card so we could easily refill our tank.

name: Kourosh Hotel
description:
New place with everything you dream of: there is even an iron with ironing table to get your suit ready for dinner in the cupboard :-) 
Very well equipped room with aircon, two toilets :-), kettle, minibar, hairdryer etc. 4 star standard, 3 star rated.
We payed for a triple (only the 2 of us) 2 Mio (15$ in Oct/2018), huge breakfast included.
Safe parking for cars and bikes behind the hotel.
WiFi only in the lobby.

name: Truck Service for old Mercedes - Isfahan
description:
we were here with our 40 years old mercedes truck because of much black smoke and the old mechanic almost renewed our enginge. they changed cilinder head and thermostat. black smoke is gone.

farsi translator will be good. 

Mr Abassi - 0913 3881230

they also paint/varnish old trucks here!

name: Quiet place near Bandar Abbas
description: Quiet place, accessible with a dirt track. two access roads possible. Keep in mind that if you cone from the north and your vehicle is high you might have problems to get under the power lines. When I was there, the river was dried out.

name: Golshan guesthouse
description:
good value guesthouse in Qazvin.
Budget accommodation but very clean.
double bed room for 500'000 rials, shower 700'000 R. the lady at the reception doesn't speak English but is very nice. No wifi

name: Iran Zamin
description:
Comfortable hotel with safe parking and good wifi in the rooms. En suite double with breakfast 1,5 mio (10€ in Oct 2018).
Very nice and helpful!

name: Quri Gol Park
description: Campsite by the lake. Hot shower and toilet. Free for two people and one tent. There are also bungalows. Closed area with guardian, safe but noisy from the road.

name: Dolphins watching boat trip
description: Fun boat trip if you want to spot dolphins! 45k Toman(yes 1,50€ Nov'21) per person for 1,5 hours on a small boat. You can also take a private boat if you want to pay more. Ticket office at the parking. Take Passport to Ticket Office.

name: Visa Extension Office
description: Procedure is similar to other cities. Office opens at 8:00, be there early. First you have to talk to the boss. He will ask some questions like where do you want to go, where do you stay, why do you need X days,... He seems to be a really kind man, talked also about football and stuff. But he also has this aura of "don’t mess with me". Anyway, we didn’t mention that we are driving, we only said we sleep in tents in the city park. Was not a problem. Needed 3 photos, a copy of the first passport + visa page. Money must be transferred in two different banks, 345000 rial in Melli bank, 5000 rial in Ghavamin bank. After that a processing time of ~3h was needed until we got our 30 days extension. We had 3 days left until expiry (2 of that weekend).

name: Bed&Breakfast at Hossein’s home
description:
This is the home of Hossein and his wife, a nice, young couple who rent out two rooms in their house and offer breakfast in the morning. It’s a charming house, you feel like at home! There’s a garden behind and a river. They speak perfectly English, can answer all your questions and love skiing/snowboarding for those who come in winter time.
The house looks like a small chalet surrounded by trees. 2km before Dizin. Just knock on the door and ask for a price and availability. Parking in front of the house. They agreed being on iOverlander. If you want to sleep in your car, they might agree as well!

name: in the fields
description: nice spot for a night in the fields with great mountain view. no 4x4 needed. Just beside the road.

name: pass to caspian see
description:
we could drive over the pass (It is a little bit further as the coordinates above. and  at 2748m) with our big truck from alamut valey to caspian see. 

locals drive here also with small cars. so no 4x4 needed, but we are glad to have it because of rain and mud.

before we could not make it over salambar pass (3200m), it was full of snow. 

the road is bride here. only the last part unpaved. it is a little bit tricky in the dark and when it rains, but great experience and fantastic views, absolutely worth it.

name: jafarieh
description:
camping in the park or parking lot.  toilet and water available.  lots of nice grass for tent 
quiet when I was there. 
4g Iran cell

name: Jandaq
description:
Aire de picnic en construction
Eau,wc,calme

name: Camping in the Park
description:
Camping on green grass in the park, with toilet and water.
 Quiet. 
4g Iran cell.

name: SKF bearings
description: Official SKF dealer. Many other brands, but why should you buy others if you can get SKF? Not as cheap as local bearings but much cheaper than at home. Genuine Quality, no fakes.

name: City Cyclet
description:
Motorcycle Parts and Motoroil (MOTUL)
Instagram Page: ghasemshams472569

name: Semirom
description: marveles constracted hostel. Welcome was very warm. Big rooms with toilet and shower. A good place after a hard ride over the mountains. heated rooms.

name: Nice wild camp spot in the mountains
description: Nice spot out of the main road. We spent one night and it was very quiet. You can find shadow below a few trees. The ground is quite rocky but it is possible to find flat spots without rock or bush. The landscape is nice as well.

name: Good restaurant with Indian/Arabic food!
description: Nice restaurant(restaurant name:hot and spicy) with amazing food. No kebab for a change but really nice Indian/Arabic food(curries, omelets, great bread, etc) Open all day and also take away.

name: Bam tourist hotel
description: Hotel with spacious and clean rooms and friendly/helpful staff . Room is 1.600.000 rial a night included breakfast. Rooms have air conditioning, clean bathroom and strong wifi! Safe parking place for your car/motorbike on garded parking at the hotel.

name: Camping spot near road towards Zargos mountains
description:
Fine spot to stay the night when in transit from Shiraz to Esfahan via the Zargos mountains. 
Gravel road from the main road towards the spot is in good condition, accessible for most type of cars. Very quiet and dark. Some locals came to say hi

name: Kyashahr Park
description: You can drive into this park and stay for night. One sheltered area for rainy days, several camping platforms. Toilets available. No costs, guarded place. From here you can walk to the coast, there is a long wooden way to the beach. Tab water is drinkable.

name: Gisoum Beach Camp
description: You can camp inside this area. Costs usually 50.000 Rial for entering and 100.000 Rial for sleeping. We stayed for free. The area is so big, even on holiday the area was not completely full. Toilets and potable water available. Camping area directly at the sea, also you can park directly at the sea.

name: Water
description:
Water next to the diesel station
Also propane

name: Abarkuh
description:
At the exit of the village between desert and cultures
Very calm

name: Komeh
description:
Komeh Front Pass Downhill
Facing the 4000m white peaks
Super calm
Great ground clearance necessary

name: Excellent Persepolis guide
description:
We had an excellent full day tour of the sites at Persepolis and the nearby necropolis with Pouryah & Rola. 
We normally visit sites without a guide, but Persepolis is one of those sites that warrant a knowledgeable guide to make it all come alive. 

They are based in Shiraz, so try to send them a WhatsApp message a few days in advance. Fluent in both English and French. We highly recommended them. 

+98 919 292 5372
+98 938 437 7931

name: Diesel station (and petrol)
description: Fuel station with diesel. Very friendly service, no problem with diesel card.

name: Diesel and petrol
description: Diesel and petrol available. Nice guy at the station, we could use his diesel card.

name: Petrol and Diesel
description: Diesel station is behind the petrol station. We could use the diesel card from the owner.

name: Diesel station
description: Diesel station, very nice staff. No problem  filling up with diesel. You need to show your passport.

name: Khan Motors Mechanic
description: Good place for maintenance on car. Went for full service check and oil and filter change. Do body work also.

name: Big parking in Quchan center
description:
A big gravel parking with toilet. The parking is guarded and has gates, which close at night. Very friendly guard. We paid 50,000 rials for one night. 
Perfect for a night and spending your last rials before entering Turkmenistan. A lot of shops nearby.

The place is somewhat hidden, but not that hard to find. When coming from the roundabout it is the second alleyway on your left.

name: Perfect Iranian overnight stay
description: This is a great Iranian overnight place. An area with some shelters for tents, every shelter has electricity. Toilets available and a park area nearby. Also water (not drinkable) and kebab places are here - bring your meat! Seams to be saved by a guard and cameras. Some people stay here over night like us. Usually it costs money but nobody ask money from us.

name: Alibaba Hotel, Yazd
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this post was added by the owner. Has not been Overlander verified.

My name is Ali, I am manger of five hotels in Yazd its great for overlander they can park car or van or truck in front of hotel  
its my whats app ,telgrm or line:0098 9101567410

name: Amazing spot with views over the Kaluts
description: Great spot a few km from the main road. Total silence and darkness. Slightly higher, so a great view over the Kaluts

name: Gas bottle filling shop
description: A place where they can fill gas bottles, bring your own adaptor pieces

name: Gas Station
description: Owner has a card for diesel and many truck drivers with card in the night.

name: Diesel station with card
description: Very nice people with a diesel card :). We got 110 liter for 700.000 rial.

name: Zanjan Amusement Park
description:
Enter inside the amusement Park, stay near the WC. Their is also water outside. Is a little bit remote from the road so more quiet than other spot in Zanjan.
We asked to the guardian if we could stay and there was no problem. The guardian stay all the night and can watch us.

name: public park natanz
description:
beautiful park with lots of space.  camping on grass or concrete.  lots of tree's. 
good restaurant on site,  nice guy always up for tea. 
4g irancell

name: Diesel with diesel card
description: Nice and uncomplicated guys. Diesel for 600t/l and diesel card.

name: Diesel petrol station
description: Possible to get some diesel here. The staff with a truck driver will manage the stuff for you. So you have to wait for a driver which will use its card.

name: Islamic Republic of Pakistan Embassy
description: Islamic republic of Pakistan Embassy to get transit Visa.

name: Anar Guesthouse
description:
Family guesthouse run by the to sisters Mashad and Meryem. Located in the Armenian district south of city center. 

Twin bedroom, dormitory (up to 4 people or as group) and private room (2 people), shared bathroom, Wifi and amazing breakfast, price 20$ - 30$ for room. There are two locations, and one has a big yard with parking space for 1 to 3 cars (narrow street to get there!) 

Contact Mashad +989130593774 or use hostelworld for booking. The guesthouse has no sign in the street and it can be hard to find the right door.

name: Fuel Station
description:
Adjusted: no official price/ 10.000 rial per liter

We arrived asked for diesel and immediately got 54l for the official price.

name: Laundry Service
description: Nearby the old city you can find this laundry service

name: Bakery
description:
here you can buy fresh bread every morning. 
Opens 7:30AM
7500 Rial for 1 piece

name: Diesel with Card
description: All uncomplicated station to fill up your tank. Diesel card available.

name: Iran cell Sim card shop
description:
On the first floor of a building.
Selling Iran cell card for tourists. Need your passport.

name: Exchange money
description:
There is an exchange money office in Laleh Shopping Center.
Divan Exchange, on the left when entering the center. They use market rate.
See on Mex.ir for the rate

name: Hotel Parsyan Azady
description:
We could camp on the parkinglot of the hotel. Just ask after the manager, he speaks good english. He agreed tot put this spot on Ioverlander.
Clean toilets open 24/24.
You can  sit in the lobby for wifi.

name: Diesel with card
description: Petrol station with available diesel card.

name: Puppetmuseum Guesthouse
description:
Small hostel in the old town above puppet & toy museum. Highly recommended to visit the museum downstairs! Very good breakfast, very good shower, washing machine, nice courtyard, everything very clean and friendly. Doubles and Dorms available. We paid 500.000 for a bed in a dorm (heating and aircon!), other guests payd 6€, so prices seem to be negotiable. :-)
NO CAR PARKING, only for motorbikes and bicycles. Bicycles park in the yard, motorbikes must be „slim“ enough to fit through the door.
Very fast internet. Kitchen use.

name: Naz Island Beach Camping
description:
Driving on the sand (no 4WD needed).
Huge Area with plenty of space right at the water.
Entrance at parking area with toilets 26.817293, 56.10528

name: great scenery along gravel road south of Chak Chak
description: very decent and scenic gravel road leading south from Chak Chak towards the main road #68, offering various nice wild camping spots. There might be the odd car passing by, but no disturbances and quiet at night

name: wild camping next to Saryazd Castle
description:
This is a great spot: just outside the fortification walls. The 'manager' of the place may pass by for a chat but no problem to stay for the night.
Very interesting to visit this 'castle'
there is a water available from taps at the main square

name: Kerman - parking for overnighting
description:
very close and convenient to centre and bazar, reasonably quiet at night after restaurant closes
no guardian when we arrived on Sunday, paid 50k as we left on Monday late morning

name: along the road Kerman - Shahdad/Lut
description: Kind of gravel parking just a bit off the road (south). The road is quite quiet a night. We stayed here twice, had no 'visitor' on the way to the Lut, a couple of locals came by as we returned from the Lut, but no problems. No reception on Irancell.

name: off the Kahnuj - Jiroft road
description:
not easy to find a good place for the night on the way to Bandar Abbas
This one is somewhat off the road, near some bushes and palm trees ... but also rubbish
Very kind farmer came round and brought us fruits ... police came at 6am but left again without further checking us out as they realised we were only tourists

name: Valfajr Shipping
description:
Valfajr Shipping, bookings for ferry to Sharjah. Easy and friendly booking procedure, go to 2nd floor, left. For the check-in itself: consider taking a 'helper', may cost around €40 and will save you nerves
Up to now, only passengers may book (May 2022). For cars, book extra ferry via White Tern shipping!

name: Bandar Pol - office to obtain permission to visit Qeshm
description: enter the compound at the end of the parking area to the left of the check-in counters. Obtain the permission in this building. Very nice and helpful manager at the time of our visit, take your papers (passport and vehicle) with you (no charges except for copies)

name: Wild camping overlooking the beach
description:
beautiful place, very quiet, stayed for three nights, once in a while a local passing by, but nobody cared
coming from the east along the south coast and driving further north, its gravel road with some rough patches at times but no problem

name: Suza Park - Water supply
description: indeed a good spot to fill up your water tank from the water taps in the toilets just after the mosque

name: Hourvari
description:
Camping for the night, relatively quite.
--
Bivouac de dépannage pour la nuit
Relativement calme

name: Crique
description:
Small cove next to the track
Super calm
Bathing out of sight
--
Petite crique à côté de la piste
Super calme
Baignade hors vue

name: Shahdad: water tap next to mosque
description:
easy to fill water tank, enough pressure for water hose, friendly locals
also various shops in town to get supplies, although the choice is somewhat limited

name: Vegetarian & Coffee restaurant
description: Amazing place for vegetarians, the restaurant only offers vegetarian food. Mains are 200.000-450000 rials. They also have a small shop where they sell all sorts of tofu and veggie ‘meats’. Mind you, there are multiple restaurants inside the forum! Is the one on the right side of the building.

name: Walled fort abandoned ruins.
description: Just off the road set in an ochre clay desert environment is this clay brick compound. The desert is no Namib, sahara or gobi sand desert and it would be best viewed early or late in the day for photos. Some OK clay eroded hills but otherwise not worth the drive maybe if you are short of diesel.

name: Diesel
description: Diesel card available at this station. They chargd me a bit more than the usual 600

name: Koopayeh Caravanserei
description:
Beautiful hotel with traditional restaurant. Rooms with or without bathroom. Room with bathroom is 2 Mio (18$ in Dec 2018).
Motorbikes and Bicycles park in front of the rooms in the yard. They have a big parking outside.

name: Next to the river
description: Very scenic spot next to the river. We stayed in the flat gravel riverbed but 20m further there is also a grass spot where you can stay. (It was occupied by locals picnicing when we arrived). keep the path open though, as 2 cars came by while we where there. Access was a bit steep at first but doable in a 2wd.

name: Hafez traditional Guesthouse
description:
Guesthouse with safe & locked parking for motorbikes in a yard big enough to fit up to 5 big bikes.
They have dorms and private rooms all with private bathroom. We payed 14€ for a double room, homemade dinner and breakfast included. 
The owner speaks very good English, organizes tours and is very knowledgeable about the region. 
If you‘ve been riding on the salt lake, he will assist you with a watertube to get the salt from your bike :-)

name: Tochal mountain parking
description:
First parking of tochal mountain.
You have to pay to enter but you can stay the night. There is a water tap and toilets.

name: Bakery and supermarket
description: Here you can buy fresh bread in the morning and there is also a supermarket with a vegetable corner.

name: money change black market
description: lot of change here. at this moment get 110.000 rial for 1USD. much better rate than official change

name: Diesel
description: Station with available diesel card. Fast and easy.

name: Visa extension office NEW address
description:
THIS is the right address to extend your visa. Very friendly English speaking officer. He will give you 60 days if you politely ask. 
For more details read comments.

name: Shah Abassi Caravanserai
description:
Really cool and big caravaniserai. It’s in relatively good shape. Definitely worth a visit. No entrance fee.

To the south- 500 meters or so- you’ll find a very impressive citadel. Probably the best fort/citadel we’ve seen in Central Asia / Iran.

name: Imam Reza shrine & Haram complex
description:
This is the holiest place in Iran where millions of pelgrims go to every year. Its also supposedly one of the biggest mosque complexes in the world. All in all very, very impressive. Not to miss when you’re near!

We just entered and wandered around, but after the tourist police tracked us, we learned that’s not allowed. You get a free English guide at the information centre, they’re all volunteers but the ones we met spoke good English and had a lot of information. No rushed tour, they had ‘all the time we wanted’.  Unfortunatly the shrine itself was offlimits for tourists. We were allowed to take a peek inside though. The rest of the complex, especially the first court and mirror halls, still make it worth the visit.

There are three museums. They’re only open in the morning and with the English guides it’s free.

Women need to wear chador, you can pick one up at the entrances. No camera’a allowed, there are secure luggage rooms (free of charge) and they do a full body search -airport-style- before you can enter.

name: Exchange office Pasargad
description:
Pasargad Exchange Office with market rate. Bring your passport, address and phone number.
See market rate on Mex.ir

name: Rageh canyon
description:
beautiful spot at Rageh canyon. From this spot you can go down into the narrow  canyon on the left. 
road to this spot has different spots to camp with beautiful view on the canyon.

name: Checkpoint Zahedan
description: Passport check by military and registration of arrival and identification. Very friendly people.

name: chair repair + garage zf services
description:
Mr David helped us with lowering our chairs and fixing our floor carpet, he did an excellent job. There are also mechanical and electrical technicians who helped us as well! 
Perfect stop to fix a lot of stuff!

name: Shouran Cafe
description: Waterfront cafe with healthy choice of food and ice cold fruit drinks, meeting place for travelers. Nice and amiable owners and clean premises.

name: Diesel
description:
They have diesel but no card. so we waited one hour for a truck to stop. Could be longer to wait because there is not a lot of traffic. so maybe not the best station but could help in case of need. We pay it 6000rial/liter instead of 3000 for the card owners.
try to ask for 3k Toman!!!! move on!!! Asked 5k Tomans!!! don't come here

name: park
description:
normal park with toilet and water. 
green grass for camping.  
lots of light so find a place away from lanterns. security came around everything was fine. 
not crowded when I was there 
4g Iran cell

name: Gonbad-e Gabus tower
description: World heritage sight, as mentioned in the Lonely Planet. Also called Gonbad-e Qabus. Entrance is 200.000 rial and you’ll receive an English info-flyer. Really weird echo at two places in and around the tower!

name: Jungle hills campsite
description: Beautiful road from Radkan trough dense forest. We didn’t want to camp at the altitude of the next site, 11km away. So we picked this spot at 1200m. It’s a small dirt road of the road. You’re visible but no traffic at all.

name: Mil-e Radkan Tower
description: Not to be confused with the other tower in the other Radkan - near Mashad. The tower is mentioned in the Pelgrimage Itinirary of the Lonely Planet. It isn’t really on the tourist route. If you’ve seen another 10-century old tower (Gonbad/Radkan): this one looks the same. But the whole valley and route are very scenic; it reminded us of Central Asia / Fann Mountains. On a clear day you can see the caspian sea and even Damavand, on the highest point of this route, north of Radkan. The road is pretty good, mostly asphalt and around Radkan solid dirt road. The last 15k or so look like it can get muddy when wet.

name: turquiose mine
description: The oldest turquiose mine in the world (7000years) and still in use, but Don't expect much activity. Not many tourist Come here but they Will show you trough the Halls of the mine, I think they are more used to tourist coming with a guide to translate... Come betweem 9-12am as in the afternoon they use explosives and it closes! We gave them 200 000 rial as a token of appriciation...

name: parking with toilet
description: Free parking near aramgah tar monument. There is some ambience in the evening. We stayed here in the winter on a week day so I expect in the Summer it will be bussy.

name: The Godfather café & movietheater
description:
Nice small artsy movietheater and café. They have an English menu, most staff speaks English and fast WiFi. Meals are burgers and pasta: 200.000-300.000 rials.

They also show English movies, with Farsi subtitle. Nice to see a movie again, unfortunately the projector was broken when we were there :(

name: Diesel
description: Gas station with diesel, staff will help you

name: Rest up hostel
description:
This place is a gem! Campfire in the beautiful yard, safe motorbike parking in the yard or entrance or garage, comfortable beds, 4 shared bathrooms, washing machine, filling breakfast, very fast internet, rooftop lounge and a relaxing yard.
The owner, Mohsen, is a charming person who speaks very good English and will help you with everything: he knows where to buy the best engine oil, knows where iranian automobile club has their office, charms you a way to extend your Carnet de passage in Iran, knows the untouristy restaurants in town, can introduce you to a traditional iranian sports club, helps you with everything you might need! 
Don’t search for an other place, you found it!
Doubles, triple, family room and dorm available. Bathrooms cleaner than clean!

name: Café Nardoon
description:
Excellent vegetarian restaurant and coffee.
A lot of good smoothies and shakes.
The menu is not big but all is fresh and tasty. Waiters are really kind and the place is very beautiful on the rooftop with a spectacular view over yazd and mountains

name: garage
description: these guys managed to change a part inside my water pump on a diesel Ford Transit (which was impossible to find Ford part in Iran). they do it in only one night for good price (200.000rial for about 3 hours of work)

name: Delneshin Restaurant
description: Great restaurant on the outskirts of town. Great place for a nice meal. Good parking for big rigs. Open from noon till late. If doors are closed ring the bell/knock at the door. Courtyard style restaurant. Often with live traditional music

name: Street park in a dead end
description:
Street park in a dead end.
There is a park at the end of the dead end with a great parking but it closed. 6PM. If you park at the end of the dead end it's very quiet.
Toilets and water in the park.
10 minutes from the center by Snapp or taxi (50 000 IR)

name: Tandis Valley
description: Find a absolutely quiet and peaceful place in the Tandis Valley, which is Statues valley. Follow the signs from the main road (26.754251, 55.691072 or 26.756109, 55.695823) until the parking lot. Then follow the gravel road from the parkings right end side over the river until you reach this hidden place. Nobody comes by, only the ranger to see if you’re all right. Stayed here for more than 7 nights totally quiet.

name: Roshandan Ecolodge
description:
Super nice family that turned a traditional house into a guesthouse. It caters for Iranians, so only the daughter speaks English and there is only one room with real beds, all other rooms have mats you lay on the floor when it’s time to sleep. Super comfy, try it! 
Don’t miss the food the two kitchen queens can cook for you!
Shower is good, shared bathroom huge and the included breakfast filling.
Plus: they have safe parking in the yard for cars (and any smaller vehicles), no height limitation, you just need to fit through the gate. :-)
WiFi available, very quiet setting, beautiful sunny yard for breakfast or enjoying your time :-)
Washing machine available. We left our bikes there and went 4 nights out to Lut desert. 
The family lives around the corner, so if they have no guests, you need to call them or tell them an arrival hour in advance.
If not, neighbors will call them and they come running within seconds :-)
We payed 65.000 per night and person, breakfast included. Dinner was 20.000 per person.

name: LPG
description: LPG refill station along the road, staff will do their best to fill your bottle with an hose

name: MTN / irancell hq
description:
Inside Imam Khomeine subway station you’ll find the MTN / Irancell HQ. Because of new laws - not sure if it’s true - i could only buy a simcard here.  Several other shops wouldn’t sell me a simcard.

Price: 3gb for 700000 rial. No pasport needed.

name: Darband Chairlift
description: Restauration is complete, it’s working again. 300.000 rial one way. 500.000 two-way. Be sure to smile, they snap a photo half way which you can buy at the top ;).

name: Lambesar Castle
description: One of the assassins castles. It’s a 10 minute walk from the parking. No fee and no facilities or signs. Compared to Alamut, there’s not much left except for the beautiful view.

name: Rudkhan Parking camp
description:
We slept inside our Defender on the big parking. There are 24/7 toilets, camera’s and lots of lights. But you can park in the dark as well. You won’t be hidden though and there aren’t many flat spots. Entrance with a car is 80.000. We had a quiet night, no one bothered us. All in all not the most perfect spot, but good for 1 night.

Update: fee is 100’000 in June 2019

name: ITTIC hotel
description:
Hotel from ITTIC hotel group. A bit dated but clean. Wifi is slow and water cold - in winter. We paid 1800000 rial (15 euro) for 1 night without breakfast. Make sure to check if they don’t have a wedding there, we enjoyed blasting music from  a party until 21:00. 

Parking is gated and has room for 20 cars, maybe it’s possible to camp here.

name: Lut Desert
description:
If you want to see the real Lut desert with its 400m high dunes, a mysterious salt lake, white star dunes, the snake thongue canyon and much more beautiful Kaluts than the ones you can see from the road, then you should go deeeeep into the lut!
You need a Permit and you only get it with a guide and at least 2 vehicles. Once you’re in the Lut, you’ll understand why: the Opium smuggling is real and military is around. 
It’s really worth going there! The landscape is comparable with Sahara desert in Libya, but dunes are more spectacular in Lut. 
We recommend a highly professional guide from Teheran, he is going to Lut for more than 10 years (2018) and has strong new vehicles, very good drivers and high security equipment (satellite phone etc.). His name is Ali and he speaks very good English Node192@gmail.com
We did 4 nights out there and it was worth every single cent! 
I have been to many deserts worldwide, but the Lut is special...
For WhatsApp, contact Ali under +989121467242 If he does not answer in a short time, you know he‘s in the desert :-)

name: Qeshm ferry ticket office (only motorbikes and bicycles)
description:
Come here to buy your tickets for the passenger ferry to Qeshm island. Small motorbikes allowed. No cars! Ferries go from 6 am to 9pm continuously.
We payed 175.000 per person with motorbike (dec 2018).
You need your passport to buy a ticket.

name: Small cliff with view on the beach
description:
If you need to stay near the city this is a good place.
You have different spots to park with a nice view over the sea.
The beach is not really swimmable (Rocky) but it's very nice and the sunset is beautiful from here.
Better than staying in the city, 5mn from the center.
You can hear the road but nobody during the night.

name: Diesel station without card
description: It was able to get 40L Diesel for 300 Toman/L from a friendly truck driver.

name: Border Iran/ Iraqi Kurdistan
description:
Border crossing to the kurdish part of Iraq. 
30 days visa free for most countries. Check before leaving Iran. There is no turning back!

Iran immigration made me pay 20 US Dollar fuel charge before leaving the country.

IRAN: "Tourist DONOT pay any Tax!"

Iraq immigration made me buy insurance 40 US Dollar for 3 month.

Chaotic crossing with lots of paperwork and running around.
Even copied the carnet (not needed in Iraq) and try to scan my dog with all my luggage.

Iraq2Iran
44us$ for exiting Iraq

name: Carwash
description: At this gas station you can get a carwash to get rid of all the sand from the desert (150.000 Rial) and put air back into your tires after deflating them for driving in the desert.

name: Sirah Traditional House
description:
Great hostel, perfect position to explore the city, super friendly and they give you all the information you need about sightseeing... 
You can do your laundry and you can hang it in the garden to dry.
It is also possible to stay in the car close by and use the facilities, have breakfeast etc. you can also park your motorcycle or bycicle in the garden and pitch your tent on the rooftop of the hostel. Everything is on a pay what you want basis.

name: Red Rocky
description: A place near the highway, but enough space to find a place out of sight. Otherwise dark and empty in the middle of these Marsian red rocks. Quite difficult to find a good spot to get off the highway.

name: Up the Empty Valley
description: Bushcamp on the side of an untraveled track in a valley. Can see the lights from the tiny village but still a good spot to look at the stars. Altitude +-2000m

name: Oasis Hostel
description: Located in an old house this is possible the most relaxing places to stay in Iran. Built around the garden they have several rooms to stay in. Reachable through small alleys probably not suited for big rigs, but fine for motorcycles. Also space for 2 motorcycles to park inside. Friendly staff, breakfast included, price around $15 a night but I bargained and got a room for $10 a night. Also possible to book paragliding tours here.

name: Hotel Darya
description: Typical big Iranian hotel. Clean, but interior is very ‘80’s. Wifi is good only in the lobby. Secure parking - not for big rigs because of gaspipe. We paid 2000000 rial for 1 night including breakfast.

name: Zendan-e Soleyman
description: Cone shaped hollow mountain - also called Soleyman Prison - which you can climb. Fantastic views over the valley and very nice crater inside. Belongs to the nearby Takht-e Soleyman UNESCO site.

name: ITTIC hotel Zaljan
description: Standard tourist hotel. Again tacky ‘80’s design, but clean. Wifi was slow but worked. We paid 2.000.000 rial (17 euro) for 1 night. Nice restaurant across the street called Babylon. Close to theme park and visa extension office.

name: Aria Hotel
description: Large high-rise hotel in the centre 4 star. 2.9mil rials with b/fast and parking for small rigs or on street out front for big ones. Negotiable price.

name: Bivouac near the beach
description:
Not on the beach but a nice and quiet spot. 
Accessible for 2WD easily when dry.
Few locals cames at night just for sunset.
Perfect place for sunset also.

name: Small cove
description:
Small cove unseen from the road.
You can swim if needed.
Some locals came by bike but they don't care.
No 4X4 needed.
Very quiet.

name: Free water in a park
description: Here you have a sink with 2 tap where you can fill your bottle or water tank directly from the street with at least a hose of 10m.

name: Free water in a park
description: Little park with picnic table, toilets and free water from tap.

name: Coffee garage
description: Nice place with breakfast, lunch and dinner. Pizza, burgers, sandwiches, cakes. Good coffee, tea and shakes. Some vegetarian options. Reasonable wifi. English menu.

name: Saltmen Museum
description:
As mentioned in the Lonely Planet. It’s actually the Zanjan Archeology Museum. Entrance is 150.000 rial and there are signs in English. You’ll mostly find coins, pottery and stones from through the ages. 

Highlight is the saltroom where 3 of the 6 saltmen ever found are on display. Saltman nr 4 is spectacular and impressive to see. Mind you, the famous head of Saltman nr 1 is in Tehran :). Visit took us a little under an hour.

name: Soltaniyeh Dome
description:
UNESCO sight and the largest brick dome in the world - supposedly. Entrance is 200.000 rials.

Dome is not visible from the inside because of (re)construction work and lots of scaffolding.

name: Underground city - entrance 1
description:
Very impressive! There are two entrances into the underground city. They are no longer connected, so visit both if you want to see different parts of the city.

Entrance fee is 250.000 for both entrances together.

name: diesel
description: diesel but no card. Have to wait for a truck and there is not a lot of traffic, so can take a while ...

name: Diesel station "euro4"
description: Here the guy told me that it was "euro4" diesel (good quality diesel for modern cars)

name: Diesel station "euro4"
description: Here the guy told me that it was "euro4" diesel (good quality diesel for modern cars)

name: Setar-e Kavir
description: Very good hotel in an historical building. Very cheap.

name: Diesel station (local price)
description: We left Isfahan and no way to got diesel on the two previous station...they were so unfriendly and helpless people. Here we finally could have some diesel, we had to use the card from a truck driver. Normally as tourist we pay 6000 rials per liter but here they charge you the local price 3000 rials per liter. Very fair and friendly staff.

name: Pigeon towers
description: Small field with 6 towers in various ruined state. One tower is restored and now a cafe.

name: Ghurtan Citadel
description: Supposedly the second biggest citadel in Iran - after Bam. You can climb the walls and wander around through town. People still live inside the citadel, it’s like walking through history. No entrance fee.

name: Coludang Guesthouse
description:
Guesthouse in traditional adobe/mud building. All the family is involved: mother cooks, sons take care of the guests. They organize activities such as stand up paddling in the mangrove forest, excursions deeper into the salt cave than you might go on your own, dolphin watching,...
They play music on traditional instruments and serve traditional bandari dishes with shark, shrimps and some hot spices. Breakfast varies every day and is always more than filling.
Rooms with and without bathroom, half and full pension. Iced drinking water included.
Motorbikes and bicycles park safely in the yard. Long term motorbike and luggage storage in the village available, if Carnet is valid and you need to leave the country for some weeks. 
Cars park safely in the Alley. Washing machine free for guests.

name: highway stop
description: There are two almost identical fuelstations on each side of the road. They both have a variarity of opportunity's to eat something. From fancy restaurant to kebab, pizza. Toilet available. We slept on the parking lot with our van.

name: House of coffee
description:
new coffee place,  good sitting inside with air-condition or outside on the terras. 
lots of coffee choices and some cakes. 
Wi-Fi at the place

name: View point and dollars exchange
description: Welcome to this peacefull library. Here you can sit and drink something in a very relax atmosphere. No fee to go in the viewpoint if you already drunk something, otherwise it's 50000 rials. You also have the possibility to buy some books about Iran translated in many languages. Moreover the manager can exchange dollars to rials with a very fair rate (1$=100000rials)

name: Baam café restaurant
description: The view from the open air terrasse is very nice. They have good cold drinks, garlic bread and cheese was very tasty and we ate iranian food for a very good price. Some area are also reserved to smoke chicha, perfect place to relax.

name: Big supermarket
description: Big supermarket. Where you can get a lot more then in the small local shops.

name: Diesel station
description: Kind people, helpt to get diesel from another truckdriver. Bonus: we got a bag of apples.

name: Sadaf Laundry
description: Great place. Laundry brought in the morning was ready at 17.30. Real 1.000.000 for two big Ikea bags filled for 3/4. No hassel over the price.

name: Water tap and toilets
description:
Water, shower and toilets. 
For water use shower tap

name: Bread land
description: If you need some bread you should definitely go there. They are baking the bread just in front of you when you order it. Traditional one is 25000rials. Moreover it's open 24/7.

name: Big free parking
description: Totally empty parking, where we spent a very quiet night. The main road is quite noisy but it was ok. Police came at 10.00am...they probably wanted to check our paper but they didn't know how to ask for it in english.

name: Diesel station "euro5"
description: Here you can find good quality diesel for modern cars (euro5 diesel)

name: handicraft gallery
description: nice gallery with hand made wood working, copper, painting, etc... same item that which you can find in tourist shop but here you can meet the artist directly.

name: Kargadan Hostel
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner.

Kargadan Boutique Hostel is specially made by us for those who like adventure, new city experiences, love, and who made it to our mysterious city. Our hostel is managed by a brother and sister team and we try to make it like a cozy place that feels like your own home. We want our guests to feel the spirit of an old flat with its high ceiling, large terrace full of plants and flowers, vintage lamps, handmade mosaics and tiles.

Everything in Kargadan Boutique hostel made by our own hands- even a comfortable large bed, or a chocolate cake. Tea and coffee are available in unlimited quantities in the common room. We have a fully equipped kitchen- refrigerator, stove, microwave, espresso machine, kettle, pans, glasses and cups at your full disposal.
You can enjoy specialty coffee, traditional drinks and Iranian food while meeting people and sharing your travel experience with them.
Every bed has its own reading light, privacy curtain, an individual locker, a shelf and a multi socket.

In addition to well-deserved rest in our hostel, you can always get all the necessary information about Tehran and the surrounding area, we will be happy to tell you about our favorite routes, secret places, cafes and the best art galleries in Tehran.

Kargadan Boutique Hostel policies & conditions;

Cancellation policy: 1 day before arrival.

Check in from 14:00
Check out before 12:00.

Payment upon arrival by cash.
Credit Cards Not Accepted.

name: Customs Yazd
description:
Please reed comment below. No one needs such „licence“...


Here we have been given a "license" to leave our Bus temporarily (two months) in Iran, and to pick it up later. So in the meantime we can fly to India and come back to Iran. We can park our bus anywhere, doesn’t need to be customs. We thought that this would not be possible because of the 'Carnet de Passage'. But here they just do it. Very kind and helpful people. They wrote a request letter on behalf of me, in Persian. dictated by the deputy general himself. After that it takes about one and a half hour to get everthing done: the entry borderpost (bazargan in our case) must agree. The chassis number was checked. everything is processed in the system. and they print the confirmation of this for you. all items were delivered in the bus! total time from start to finish: 2.5 hours. Cost: nothing! and there is a little shop on the premises, that maken delicious hamburgers. Best customs experience ever!!!

name: Awli Gorge
description:
just outside Chakhooh village you've the paved road to Chahkooh canyon. Don't take this road but take the dirt road at the sign of Chahkooh canyon. You see the dirt road at your right between a "wall" of aprox 60cm high.
Drive this further till you come in a beautiful, colourfull valley. only 4x4 and not big rigs. 
when you enter this spot you can hike into a beautiful canyon.

name: Land rover shop
description:
Beheshti street is already tagged, It’s indeed a good area for carparts. For land rover owners: there’s a land rover shop with plenty of parts to fit a UK land rover - the engine, suspension and transmission of the iranian land rovers are different, so not sure on 300tdi and TD5 parts, but other parts should be available. 

Very helpful and they speak some English, they also found us a garage across the street for a small repair-job.

name: River camp
description: Nice quiet place next to a stream/river and a tree. It’s 200 meters from the road, but your still visible. We saw only 10 cars, so very quiet. If you have a 4x4 you can cross the river or hill with boulders for a more hidden spot.

name: Taq-e Bostan
description: With Bisotun still covered in scaffolding, this is the best place to see reliefs carved out of rock. 500.000 Rials entry fee, there are good information signs in English.

name: Pass closes in winter
description: Just an extra warning :). We took this road from Paveh towards Marivan, but they don’t clear the snow after this point going north. It basically means the pass is closed. So check in winter if the pass is passable. Other option is the long way back to Paveh, through Palegan.

name: Bashmaq: Iran - Iraqi Kurdistan border
description:
Don't pay any money on Iran side. tourists are not required to have temporary license plates for their cars. Neither is insurance obligatory (European green card is valid in Iran). you can confirm this with your embassy. Insurance broker at this post is scamming and threatening travelers.

Huge border post, biggest we’ve see since Russia. Mainly trucks though that go through a different process. Was open on friday as well. The whole process was friendly and chaotic. They’re clearly not used to overlanders, so the paperwork took a long time. From start to end: 3 hours. Iraq uses the carnet as well and we only paid 20 dollar entryfee for the car. No fee for exiting Iran. You get a free 30 days Kurdistan visa.

The inspection of the car is done in 5 mins, so no real issues there. Ask someone for help and directions, because at the Iraqi side, you have to visit 3 buildings 500 meters apart in order to get all the paperwork complete.

name: View on the beach
description: We spent a very quiet night just in front of the persian gulf. Easy to leave the main road (both side) to this dirty road no trouble to go there even with a 2WD. But maybe difficult if it's rainy...Flat ground to park with a nice view on the beach

name: cliff edge
description: Looking down on the river from a sandy cliff edge. No shade. Lots of room to park, pretty easy to get to, use satellite images on google maps. Don't go too close to the edge. 4G irancell

name: Free parking by Golmohammadi Park
description: Free carpark beside large park. No security, no payments, free and easy. 24h access. One toilet beside carpark was closed, but another in the center of the park is open. There’s a road nearby but it’s quiet at night. Good sleep.

name: wild camp
description: At  15min near the City. Quiet. Ok for 2wd car and grass area for tents.

name: Copyshops
description: Lots of small copyshops and photo shops to get all the documents copied for the Iran - or other -embassy.

name: Suwayfah Family Beach
description:
Beach with palmtrees along the road, quiet at night.
Not sure it's allowed to sleep here but we stayed one day and one night without any issue.

name: Parking by the park
description: Free and easy car park, green park beside, lots of space, no people. Toilet available but closed (January).

name: Drinking water shop
description:
Water shop where it's possible to buy drinking and filter water.
The price is 25000 Rials (2500 tumans) for 20 liters.
Possibility to buy plastic tank 20 liters on the shop.

name: Diesel
description: Diesel here. Just keep an eye on the counter. They play different tricks.

name: secluded valley
description: Great spot for camping, easy accessible from the main road

name: Parking behind Taha hostel
description: Quiet parking behind taha hostel. Stayed one night at hostel for 10 euro per room and 2 nights in the van. Paid a euro when only taking shower at hostel and sleeping in the van.

name: on the salty lake
description:
not far from the road by quite hidden and quiet. nice view on the lake.
Enter from the parking then follow the salty track. May be a bit muddy after the rain but the salt seems to absorb water so should be ok if stay on the white track.

Nobody in January but it may be different in spring or summer time.

name: Diesel station
description:
Diesel with card, hard to get the card from locals but it was time of some diesel restrictions and every driver was weary of giving their cards. 
In the end we found one, paid 200.000 for only 20L but another guy gave us 10L from his jerry can for free. 
One of the last stations for diesel before Pakistan.

name: Awli camping spot
description: The place put in as 'awli gorge' is not accessible by car but is a good kilometer trek (30 min) into the mountains. This is a good place to camp, the road goes a bit further, but is real 4x4 and a dead end in 300 m. Just one motorbike passed when I was there. No irancell. Many other good places to camp and amazing for climbing and walking.

name: Wildcamp on the beach
description:
On the beach, 5mn of Sur. Could be useful if you want to be near sur in a quiet place.
We spend one night here during the weekend and we were alone it was very quiet.

name: On the cliff
description:
On the cliff, over a sand beach accessible by foot.
You can see turtles on the beach but please don't disturb them.
Track is not very easy for non 4WD but doable (we did).

name: Beautiful sand beach
description: Spot just before a beach. Please don't park on the beach (respect the turtles). Some fisherman's sleep near the cliff and are very friendly.

name: Karim Khan hotel
description: Hotel in centre of the city. Small but clean rooms and very hot shower, no western toilets though. Wifi didn’t work and no breakfast, but we paid only 1,4 milion rials. Parking is on the busy mainstreet in front of hotel. Not recommended to sleep in the car there.

name: ITTIC hotel Ali Sadr
description: We had no clue what to expect around the cave, but there’s a village build around it, almost like a resort. Since everything was closed down for the season, we stayed in this tourist hotel. Like everywhere in Iran: tacky design, clean and 2,000,000 rials per night.

name: Exchange street
description: Dozens of exchange agencies here. Every local we met pointed us here.

name: Skiing at Tochal mountain
description:
Perfect day trip! At the ski resort there are 2 chairlifts and 2 towlifts. Don’t expect Austrian-style slopes. There only 3 of them: 1 red one and a short and a long blue slope. we had a great day skiing. Mind you, the lifts will stop at around 15h.

From Imam Khomeine square it will take 1,5 hours before you’re at the skipiste and ready to go, including getting all the gear. I can imagine it can take quite longer in the weekend. 

This Gps point is where the telecabin is. In the basement of the same building you can rent skis and ski-clothing.

Liftpass is 1.000.000 rials
Renting skis, jacket, gloves, pants is 2.000.000 rials.

name: Haj aligholi salt lake
description: Big salt lake, on of the many in Iran. There is a good 15km dirtroad going towards the shore and a bit in the lake. It’s elevated, so you’re car will be fine. The lake is an actual salt lake, crusty and salty. We also visited the varzaneh salt lake, but that one was more a dry salt plain.

name: Salt plain bushcamp
description: Coming from Damghan, some 60km north you’ll enter a huge salt plateau/plain. No life, no vegetation, no shelter and no hills. There’s only a highway that cuts through this bizarre flat landscape. We drove on a dirt track 2km away from the highway. We’re still visible but from far away.

name: Camping on the moon
description: I always imagine the moon looks like this.. Driving south from Bayazeh, the landscape turns into a colourless crusty area full with craters, rocks and small hills. Easy to be hidden - just park behind a hill. Amazing landscape! Fast 3g reception, no water.

name: Diesel without Card
description: Very nice staff. We got Diesel without a problem.

name: Diesel Card
description: They have a Diesel card here! 600T/l. They fill also Diesel cannisters

name: Wild camp with view of the city
description: Wild camp. No one came by. Sadly a lot of trash around. The city is visible from the place. The road is a little steep but okay with 2wd

name: Money exchange office
description:
Official money exchange office, near to the bazar.
Good rate at this time 125000 Rials for 1$.

name: Shur river
description: A quick drive east from the kaluts, you’ll find the Shur river. Nice small stop to wonder at the tiny salt river meander through the desert.

name: Snake canyon
description: Narrow, deep canyon in which you can drive with your car. Very scenic. It’s many kilometers long, we didn’t make it to the end and turned around. Be careful though! The sand is very soft.

name: Eye of lut - viewpoint
description: On satellite images, it looks exactly like an eye, hence the name. It’s a big crater-ish hole with a salt lake inside. Don’t expect too much water . Beautiful surroundings! Lots of view points arouns, but for some reason all the trails went here. So we followed them .

name: Turnoff deep into the Lut desert
description:
If you plan on visiting the Rig-e Yalan dunes, Snake canyon, the Eye of Lut or other sites in the Lut desert: this is the turnoff you need. Depending on your route, the first 40-50km is a gravel plateau & plain. Barely sandy. We drove 45km/h there. From the plateau you’ll either end up at the huge dunes of Rig-e Yalan or drive down into the Kalut canyon. Either way, the views of the dunes and kaluts are spectaculair. 

With some GPS coordinates and the trails on Maps.me, you’ll find your way around. There are also dozens of car trails going everywhere inside the desert - just like you see in Mongolia. Even the guides follow these routes. No point on creating a new route. From this waypoint straight towards the dunes is 100km. And towards Snake Canyon is 60km. a roundtrip drom Shahdad is roughly 500km.

Mind you, on some spots - especially around Snake canyon and the dunes - there is very, very soft sand. We only aired down our tires around the dunes and still got stuck. Make sure you know how to get yourself out of the sand and into safety. Two cars is better than one. Bring plenty of water, fuel, food; no one is there to help. No militairy, no checkpoints, no smugglers.

Good luck and have fun! It was our Iran highlight

name: View on the petrol and golfe persique
description: Goog place on the beach. View on the golfe persique. Very nice place

name: Chahkooh traditional homestay and restaurant
description:
It’s possible showers for 1$ usd / p. 
Do restaurant and hostel. Very nice place.

name: On the beach
description: great spot on the beach facing the sea, at the foot of the mosque. clean toilet and water. the Iranians come rolling on the beach, atmosphere rather happy, very quiet, nobody asks for anything and there is even some place to eat. fishermen's atmosphere. super spot right next to the shipping agency for the emirates. ideal for a last night in Iran. but a bit noisy

name: Army checkpoint
description:
At this point, the road to access to the montains is closed for foreigners!
Only accessible for Iranians...

name: Tire shop speaks English
description: Tire shop friendly guy speaks English fair price

name: Visa renewal at police station 500 m from here
description: This Location is of abidar hotel. Walk back to Azadi square, first left on zhandarmry street. Police office after 300m. Visa ready same day end of the day. I picked it up morning after. Got 30 day extension, same as my original visa. People friendly. You have to go pay at 2 nearby banks after they give you a slip, around 4 dollar at 1 bank and 15 cents (yes cents) at another bank. And make a copy of your passport and visa. I experienced no problems renewing my visa. Open 7-2pm.

name: Beach camp
description: Beach camp near the city but really quiet. Lot of flat area to camp with truck or tent. Easy access for 2wd. 3G ok.

name: currency exchange
description:
currency exchange, first floor shopping Centre , good rate , 1$=272000rial.
across the street of the marked location

name: Hayegher canyon
