description: This GPS point is the best view into the 400 meter deep canyon. Maps.me doesnt show a road, but there is good asphalt. My fear of height was roaring here 😩😩.

name: Khonj hills campsite
description:
Just east of Khonj the mainroad passes some hills covered in lonely trees and bushes, for shade and to be a little hidden. There’re no tracks and lots of big boulders, only recommended for high clearence vehicles.

I wouldn’t stay a couple days here, but it was good and quiet for one night.

name: Behind mountain
description: Good for one night. Quiet and spacious. Big rig friendly.

name: Shur valley mineral hot spring
description: You find it at the end of a 2wd dirt road. Just follow the ‘Shur Valley’ signs from the main road. It’s two small pools - one for men, one for women. More for sitting then swimming ;). Water is around 25 degrees and really salty. No one around when we were there.

name: hotel Darya
description:
simple hotel. 
receptionist speaks English  
single room with air-condition and fridge  
shared bathroom 
650.000 real. one person 
Wi-Fi is good. 
bicycle parked inside 
breakfast optional

name: Port Shahid Bahonar - UAE <-> Iran
description:
This is the actual port from where you take the ferry.

Passenger and car shipping to UAE possible from here.

name: Hoseyniyeh Moghuyeh coast road
description: Hoseyniyeh to Moghuyeh coast road is blocked here. You can go around with a 4wd. Anyway, behind the first 2 blockades the road is washed away completely at several points, but looks really beautiful thoug. Maybe you can go further with a proper 4wd and good driving skills, but we didn't want to try. Motorcycle tracks go further down the road, so it maybe possible with a motorcycle.

name: Shisha Bar and Cafe
description: Located at the first floor. Menu is just in Persian but they should be able to help you if you don’t have a Persian speaking person with you.

name: toilet and water point
description: High pressure taps, don't know if potable

name: Cool and clean spot
description: Great spot next to a small dirtroad. There are two smaller trails on the left some 100 meter apart.  We stayed at the 2nd trail, in the evening a farmer who has his hut is in the valley below came and brought us yogurt. Due to the height very enjoyable temperature. No trash and trees which offer shadow. Some mosquitos and no service. 4x4 recommended.

name: Outdoor/ Fishing shop
description: Small shop selling fishing gear, camping gas, an other outdoor equipment.

name: Diesel
description: Fastest refueling in whole Iran! 6000 Rial/liter

name: Diesel Euro 4
description: Diesel Euro 4 is available, 600t with the diesel card of the gas station.

name: Kataleh Khor
description: Big parking at the Kataleh Khor. We just visited the cave, but it could be possible to stay overnight at the big parking in front.

name: in the hills just outside Sardasht
description:
nice spot in the hills. multiple choice of campingspots. There's an old dirtroad that goes between the hills. 
very quiet at night

name: "Sweet Moradi homestay"
description:
because the hotel was closed for renovation a local guy send us here. 
homestay but you get a private appartement. 2 separate bedrooms, bathroom, kitchen, secure parkinglot..
they don't sprak english but very friendly
we paid 1 000 000 rial. very cheap for everything you get.

name: Hostel Lingo
description:
Good and welcoming hostel owned by Hajar and her husband Muhammed, both in their mid-20s and energetic. 

Parking for Motorbikes and one car (below 2 Meters high) on the property, we parked on the street in front of the house (safe residential area). Trucks/Big rigs will not fit. 

Little kitchen if you want to cook yourself, but it was more fun to cook together with them. Family atmosphere. Hot showers and washing! 

They have three rooms, all clean and cheap.
For costs contact them, because prices change rapidly in Iran because of the sanctions. 

Contact them before you arrive, because the entrance doesn‘t have a sign (See picture).

Tel: +989136554223
You can also google „Hostel Lingo“ for more pictures.

name: Western style coffee shop
description: A place that sells a variety of western style coffee beans and serves very good coffee to go. It is in walking distance from the Mozafer park overnight spot to the metro. So a very good option to start the day.

name: Diesel engine repair shop
description: Sent here by ioverlander place called ‘garage’ close by . At the place here they fixed my broken diesel injector pipe line. Don’t think they speak English

name: exchange offices
description:
some exchange offices and also people asking you for exchange on the street.
office near to the bonbast.com rates
(128 instead of 134)

name: Free parking lot for 24 cars close to city
description: Clean and free parking near city. Overnight might be possible but didn’t try

name: Hamids Homestay
description:
nice and clean homestay, safe motorbike parking. quiet, central. small breakfast. hamid.tofigh8@gmail.com
Telegram: +98 912 247 7849

name: camp with sea view
description: after the curve there's a view point and a dust road that goes to the beach. there's a few meters of stiff road but it's doable. very short part of the road. there's a house at the bottom but in the in between there's a hidden view point perfect for a quiet night near the port. we spotted it on Google maps with the terrain view. if you need to go to the port early in the morning, we found this place perfect for the night.

name: various mechanic parts shops
description: road full of shops for cars parts. from local brands to mercedes.

name: abandoned quarry
description:
Several spots in the area of a abandoned quarry. Big blocks of white stones are spread over the place. 

500m away from the highway with heavy traffic but out of view behind a hill. You can still hear the traffic but quiet enough for a proper sleep. 

Acces over a small gravel road, not visible on google maps / OSM (yet). Leave the highway at Lat 29.11667 Lon 55.73963, check out satellite picture. Not sure if you can access by 2wd (4wd with high clearence should work), we travel by bicycle.

name: Potable water, high pressure
description: We kindly asked if we can fill up and if it is drinking water. You can fill up your water canister or even big tanks. High pressure, taste is really good. Two big outlets.

name: Insurance Iran
description: We had to extend our insurance when we were in Kerman, unfortunately it is really expensive. We found another place but it was even more expensive. In the end we had no choice and had to pay 825.000 Toman for 2 months (1 month wasn't possible). It was twice the price we had to pay for the first two month insurance in jolfa... They said it's because jolfa was aras free trade zone, so maybe it's also cheaper on qeshm.

name: Peninsula at the lake
description: Seems to be an old Park for recreation at the lake. Also some new buildings, but not in use. A real "Lost Place" in the middle of nowhere.

name: pavahostel
description:
Pava Hostel is a family home with traditional Iranian design, a friendly atmosphere and affordable prices for every budget. It is a nice place to stay where you can share your experience with travelers of different cultures.

We do our best to provide you with world renowned Iranian hospitality, so you will feel at home during your stay.

The home has different types of rooms to accommodate your needs. There is an apartment suite on the lower level and dormitory and private rooms on the first floor. Accessibility is from the courtyard.

name: pit beside street
description: Flat pit near the street on the highest point between Bafq and Javadiyeh. It is hidden from the street if you go to the back of the pit. The street is very low on traffic.

name: gravel pit near railway
description:
This is a wide area in a abandonned gravel pit. There are some piles and slots to hide from the street and the railway. The railway is on service, there are cargo trains regularly, even during the night. You can hear the big Diesel locomotives but it did not disturbed us as it is 500m away. 

To get there, leave the street here: Lat 31.52324 Lon 55.46439 and follow the gravel track on top of the damm for 1km.

name: Travelers Land homestay
description:
Travelers Land is the home and homestay of the amazing Mohsen Qomi, the founder of the Fb-group Overland in Iran. He can help you with just about anything and he has fantastic stories about overlanding and overlanders. Don’t miss visiting his homestay or workshop when your around Bojnurd :).

We spent a couple of days at Mohsen’ and had a great time and Mohsen gave us a wonderful introduction into Iran.

There’s room for one car (max height 2,5 m) in his garden and motorbikes or cycles can park safely in the garden as well. You can either sleep outside in your car or in one of his guestrooms. You can use the kitchen and hang out in the livingroom. Prices : sleeping in your  car: 4 usd pp and sleeping in the guestroom 8 usd pp, all including a nice simple breakfast.

It’s best to let him now when you arrive, since he might be at his shop. His number +98 915 585 1517 - call, SMS, Telegram or Whatsapp.

Be sure to leave something for his overland museum ;).

name: parking Shapur cave
description: secure parking for start the trail of Shapur cave, the owner is stonemason, he lives and works here, you can see his creation in his mini gallery. the place is clean with toilette and young eucalyptus for little shadow. good seen on the Valley. stay for the night with truck , i think is no problem for tent , ideal to visit the different historical sites official Bishapur

name: Parking area.
description:
Large parking/recreation area on the road to Zabol. 
Flat, spacious, cel-signal, water-taps, no garbage.

name: A real Supermarket
description:
A genuine supermarket with a wide choice of "western stuff". 
No real parking-area, but street parking.

name: Pmp
description: 6000 rial/liter. Workers used their diesel card. Easier !

name: Fuel station
description: The man give his card diesel. 6000 rial/liter

name: Fuelstation
description: With diesel, no diesel card, we got 25 liter from truck driver

name: Hestooran - nice restaurant in the courtyard
description: very nicely made restaurant in the courtyard, possible to sit inside and outside, front entrance at the corner

name: next to / in park with view over the city
description: up the hill, in/next to park, noisy as local motorcycles and cars pass by until 3.00 am, probably very noisy and busy on weekends, view over the city

name: Wild camping with restaurant
description:
Green places next to the road. one site is restaurant and toilet, water. other site you can go down multiple track's for camping. further down more quiet it gets. 4*4 need to go all the way down.  
no Iran cell but quick Wi-Fi at restaurant

name: Diesel
description: Fuel Station with available Diesel Card. 10.000 Rial/liter. Can be easily reached in both directions, no U-Turn required.

name: Opposite the entrance of the citadel
description:
Rip-off. 
This small restaurant in the park, opposite the Arg-e-Bam site is a rip-off. 
The food is in no way what it is supposed to be and they add things to the bill at the end.

name: Small sheltered parking
description:
Close to the mausoleum parking. A small enclosed parking with less noisy visitors. 
Irancell has internet coverage and the restaurant on the other parking has a garden hose for water.

name: Eyvan hotel restaurant
description:
Located next to the mausoleum, this wonderful cozy restaurant has traditional dishes of Iran and some more international food. 
The owner, Nasim, is a very friendly young woman who speaks perfect english and takes all the time in the world to help you choose your dish. 
If you think this comes at a price? You are wrong. Prices are among the lowest we found so far in Iran and the food is superb.

name: riverside
description:
follow the good gravel road to the river. lots of places to camp with camper,  tent or anything. nice swimming in the river.  
quiet night.  3g Iran cell

name: small water tap point
description:
In front of the ice cream shop. Small water tap. You can park right next to it. 
Ask permission at the shop.

name: Ecotourism Hotel in Kong
description: Very nice Hotel with beautiful yard, renovated rooms and lovely people! Tricky to find, no private parking available but you can Park the car close nearby in a small Street which is save. Motorbikes and bicycles fit in the yard. We paid 15€ for double room on nowruz with Dinner (grilled fish and bread) and nice breakfast.

name: river camping
description:
most quiet spot ever.
beautiful spot with river for swimming (don't know if there is always water). 
last 5km follow dirt road from town next to the bridge. 
4*4 needed or good driving skills. 
motor or bicycle easy. 
and the end crossed the river with bike but also good camping possibility along the track  
no people around. 
4g Iran cell

name: watertap next to road
description:
Next to the road, on a unpaved parking, opposite  of a mosque. 
Good pressure, clear water. Possible to park right next to it.

name: Ardestan
description:
Ardestan Cemetery
Ideal point between Yazd and Kashan
Very calm

Cimetière d’Ardestan
Étape idéale entre Yazd et Kashan
Très calme 🤫

name: dry river bed near Kharanaq
description: Some flat areas near and in the dry river bed ~1 km away from the main road. If you go up the river, it is out of sight from the road. nice view. When we arrived, a small bus passed by (but no village around) Follow the gravel road starting here: Lat 32.25529 Lon 54.47781.

name: At a playground on a frontage-road
description:
Several water-taps on the side of the road at a small playground. 
Get off the main road on the frontage - road.

name: Riverbed behind mountains
description: Easy accessible from the main road, just follow the gravel track which goes to the (dry) river. From there you can follow the tracks which go in the riverbed and through the mountains. there are many spots to camp and even firewood. not visible from the road, we saw nobody but maybe some sheperds go there as well.

name: Abandoned old Copper mine
description:
Very interesting place between the mountains and rig-e Jenn dunes. many old buildings and great views of the area. you can even find old pits which go into the mine, but they are 10-20m deep, so you can't enter (we found 2, maybe there are more). you can also probably camp there if it's not to spooky (= 
you can either reach it from east, passing a military base or from west via the small airfield. East you need 4wd, from west it's maybe possible without.

name: Wide open space
description:
Next to the road a wide open space of a few hundred by a few hundred meters. All hard-packed. 
Nothing special but good for a night. Irancell 4G available.

name: Damghan
description: Gas station has a card for diesel. Kind and fast service. 42 liter for 400.000 rial (d.d. March 2019 aprox 2,40 €)

name: Big caravanserai
description: Biggest we’ve seen in 4 months in Turkey and Iran. Three caravanserai’s attached, and a underground water basin. Fee is 2 USD/ 250.000 rial per person. You can book a room for about 30 USD. We haven’t seen the rooms so no idea what you get. Next to the caravanserai is a big place, (seventies look with orange) where you can find a restaurant with basic food, a small supermarket, sweets and souvenirs.

name: Behind the citadel of Zafaraniyeh
description: If you follow the small dirtroad left of the citadel you end up in the middle of the fields. There’s a flat spot next to the remains of a small wall. No need for 4wd, if it’s not muddy. If you have a big van, I would find a different spot somewhere in, or at the borders of, the village. There are plenty of other options. Even though it’s Nowruz, and crowded on the highway, not a single Iranian here. Silent and windy at night. We saw verry big footprints so maybe there’re wolves, but I’m not an expert on that.

name: Ghadir park second entrance
description: We were refused at the main entrance by a non English speaking man. We guessed it was because of 21 March, Newruz and verry bussy. By accident we drove by the back entrance, and tried again: And now we could stay for the night. Price was 400.000 rial / 2,4€.

name: Tourist Tou Hotel
description:
“Villa” with parking in front of your door. Fine room to hang out. With terrace, kitchenette, couch, good hot showers, 5 beds, european realy good matrasses, and ironed sheets :-) incl breakfast. 
4,8 milion rial / 35 euro for 2 adults and 2 kids (10 and 12). Vallue for money.

name: Place to stay at customs
description: We arrived late afternoon, the day before our transit-visa started. We tried to stay the night at the mosque more uphill. The guy (verry kind and polite man) who checked us out found it a better idea if we stayed here, in the neighbourhood of his office. When we started cleaning our car he showed us a tap for more water. Later on he brought us tea and sweets. At night the gate is closed. Quiet, safe and a bit odd place to sleep. But perfect for one night on the way to Turkmenistan.

name: Hayegher canyon.
description:
Flat (well, reasonable flat) spot with some distance from the road (10 to 20 mtr). 
It does not sound like much, but on a road that follows a deep canyon, it is the best you can get. 
Canyon views: Amazing. (best after sunrise) 
No Irancell data. No facilities.

name: Parking of "Girls Castle"
description: On the parking of the "Girls Castle", close to the pedestrian-bridge, are two taps with clean water. Plenty of pressure and you can park right next to it.

name: Veshareh
description:
Rest area Maral has diesel.
There is also a restaurant with hamburgers and French-fries.

name: Vehicle Insurance
description:
Very efficient, go to 4th floor. We payed for 3 months insurance per motorbike 2,1 million. You can also get insurance for shorter time, but Iran is worth the maximum of your visa extensions - at least!
Insurance starts same day at midnight, so the day you sign is not yet covered. Drive carefully or stay a night here :-)

name: Jalal Guesthouse Khaneye Pedari (City)
description:
Very nice and quiet Hostel 10 min from Bazar. Jalal and his team provide perfect service. Also they are wellknown, reliable and educated tourguides for desert. 
Strongly recommended!
Parking outside with video surveillance.

name: Fadak Hotel
description: Nothing so special but worth the 180.000 (12€ in March 2019) if it’s wet, cold and stormy outside. Safe parking in front of the Hotel

name: Bearings (SKF etc.)
description: This shop sells all kind of bearings, SKF and other brands. Grease for bearings and everything you might need with it :-)

name: At the base of a massive dune
description:
At the base of a 100 mtr dune. Right next to the road, so no 4WD needed. It is not a pristine place as Iranians come here also, but it ain't a bad place to be. 

You can go further to the next group of high dunes, where you'll be all alone, but the road is not good enough for 2WD as there are invisible soft spots. (We hit one and sank 20 cm deep, took us an hour to get out).

name: Motorbike spare parts shop
description: They have tyres, sprockets, chains,... EVERYTHING. And if they don’t have it, they know where to get :-)

name: Diesel, no card needed
description:
At this fuel-station they can give you diesel without using a card. 
The attendant asks 1000 a liter. Good deal, easy going

name: Behind the hills
description: Quiet spot along the road ferdows - Mashhad. You can leave the northbound highway on a small dirt road and drive parallel to a dried out riverbed to the hills. there is 4g irancell coverage on the hill but not behind. 25m further behind the hill you are completely out of sight from the far away highway. We only saw one motorcycle on the other side of the river in the evening, no other person around. road could be muddy after rains so be careful.

name: service-area near Sabsevar
description:
Large service-area on the 44 with shops, restaurants, toilets, etc. 
Irancell data available.

name: Mehr Hotel Neyshabur
description:
Iranian style hotel in the center of Neyshabur. Decent big rooms, clean, wifi, breakfast. 
Double rooms around 2'000'000 Rial (April 2019). We paid 5'000'000 for 5 people (2 rooms). Car parking available, safe place for bicycles inside house.

name: Silk Road Ecolodge
description:
Traditional building with various rooms, traditional iranian beds (on the floor). Nice yard, restaurant room and roof top terasse. They provide dinner and breakfast. Parking space in front of the building, bicycle parking in the yard. 

Price April 2019: 1'000'000 Rial per person per night included dinner and breakfast.

name: passenger hotel
description:
if you really need a roof above your head go here. 
room $3.- 1 person room. 
really dirty and run down. 
owner is nice and speaks little English but will call English speaking friend. 
mattress made of concrete. 
but hot shower and Wi-Fi is fast.

name: Besh Gardash park
description:
5 km from Bojnurd. Very large park with lots of camping space. 
Not to busy and not to noisy. 
Entrance fee 70.000 rials. 
Little shops on site. 
Irancell 4g coverage.

name: Hossein Ostad Hostel in Old Deyhuk
description:
Very traditional Hostel with three bedrooms. 
Recently renovated in old town House.

name: the correct location of Mohammed Exchange
description:
the correct location of Mohammed Money exchange. 
Shop nr 211  - Fair rates

name: Diesel at regular price
description: At this very friendly fuelstation you get your diesel at the regular price.

name: Parsa Restaurant
description: Nice place  to eat traditional Iranian food like abgusht, khoresht gaimeh etc. Of course they also have kebab. The price is much cheaper than at the tourist restaurants in old town and food is better. You can sit on the roof top or inside.

name: Wild camping near a piste
description:
We took  dirt road  on the right going from Bandar Abbas to Chiraz (just after the big gsm antenna) and drove 1km in a piste on the right going behind the mountains until we liked the spot near a dry river bed. 

Very easy access (we are a 2wd campervan) and extremely calm and beautiful. 

The morning we got a visit from a shepherd and its hers.

name: playground +picknik + camp
description:
nice place to spent some time. great view. perfect for children, because there is a beautiful and big playground.
We spent one night there.

name: Arda Cafe
description: Delicious food presented in artistic way and proper coffee. Very kind staff. The pricing is very reasonable for the service provided. menu is in farsi only but I will ask manager to get it translated as it would make it way easier.

name: river camp
description:
beautiful grassy flat area along the river.
It is not hidden from the street, but there is low traffic. People from the village nearby will notice, and there are maybe sheaperds comming by. Follow the gravel road after the bridge.

name: Coffee Marmar
description:
Little coffee shop, iranian style.
They serve different style of italian coffee and hot chocolat. 

2 chocolat, espresso and latte -> 400'000 Rials (April 19),

name: Camping next to Hamion Park
description:
Park with toilets, noise level is ok. We stayed here during the week. In the morning many retired work out in the park or played cards, felt very save
Very nice, fancy Cafe (eGavan Cafe) with good breakfast around the corner.

name: Money Exchange Karaj
description: good Exchange, we had a very good rate, they advertise the rate on a board

name: Defunct side road.
description:
It looks as if this "turn-off" is no longer in use. Mostly out of sight from the main road (shielded by a sand wall)
Good for a night if you visited the ali-sadr cave late afternoon.

name: Takt-e-soleyman fuel/rest-area
description:
Small service-area with diesel (and card), a restaurant and a rest-parking-place. 
Lower and better sheltered than the site or the volcano.

name: Isuzu care Workshop
description:
No big Isuzu logo, just a small LED-sign, but they are an official Isuzu dealer/service center. 
They are friendly and very helpful, but speak little English. However, if you are mechanically minded, you can communicate.

name: Campsite with huts next to road
description:
Campsite with huts and toilets. parkingspace is close to road, so it is noisy.
everything lookd pretty run down.
Restaurant for dinner/breakfast

we paid 300'000 Rial to camp in our camper for 1 night

name: Sero border Iran>Turquie
description:
USER REPORTS:
21-09-2019 bordercrossing Iran Turkey When your camper have a hight of + 3 meter you can’t drive through the special gate and you must wait in the que for the trucks. You have to pay fuel tax, €1,20 / liter tank capacity. It doesn’t matter if it is full or empty. Custum look at your carnet for chassisnumber en registration plate, cartype and find all the details of your car on internet. Total border passing 5 hours.

---
for more facility you can contact
 Bushan: +989142749565 
speak litle english , young men, cool

don't pay diesel tax. disorganiz. no control car. just give my last rial for Bushan (~10$)

for Turquie you need Green card, frendly, no tax, scanner. 

1h30 max for all

name: Season Restaurant
description: Nice and cheap meat restaurant next to gas station. Staff is very friendly, one member has studied in the US so speaks very good English. Recommended even if just for clean Western toilets!

name: Syrch : Water tap
description: Good pressure for Filling the tank. Fresh water. Lots of locals come with bottles and drink it.

name: Highway spot next to forest
description:
Popular with locals who come here to barbecue and pitch their tents, there is a big spot where tents and cars can stay for the night. From the highway, go to the parking area and then take the small road on the right to the end.

No facilities, noise from the highway but okay for a night of sleep and mingling with locals.

name: Ribat-i Sharaf caravanserai & camping possibility
description:
This is a old and partly restored caravanserai dating back to 1114. Inside there are some nice patterns carved into the brickwork. 

The area is protected by a fence and there is a entry gate. When we visited, there was a officer there, entry fee is 80'000 Rials (June 19). Opening hours unknown.

Sleeping inside the area was no problem, friendly staff.

name: Doosti Hotel
description:
Doosti Hotel is located in Saraks 500 m away from the border to Turkmenistan. The rooms are ok clean and with private bathroom. We paid 1'200'000 Rial for a doubleroom incl. breakfast (April 19). 

There is a restaurant in the same building, serving mostly Kebab (~200'000 Rial). 
Save parking for bicycles in a locked basement room. Ask for Wifi (it is hidden).

name: Hidden in the dunes, no 4WD needed
description:
For all those who can’t ride sand or have 2WD only or don’t dare to go through sand but like to spend a night night in the dunes :-)
Flat place to camp, not far from the road but you can’t be seen.
Nice setting in the dunes - but not in the sand :-)

name: Fuelstation with Diesel
description: They have a card, got a full tank for 600 toman / Liter, friendly

name: Local wild picknick site
description: The site is a few corners away from Persepolis following a dirt road. Local picknick people visit it and stay between the rocks but don’t stay overnight. The main street sound is a bit loud but otherwise quite. Wake up from the goat herds passing by.

name: Diesel for tourists
description: Here, the workers use Diesel Card ! It’s easy ! 6000 rial/liter But limited at 30 liter

name: Diesel with card for 1000/ltr
description:
Small service-area with diesel and a card. Unlimited for 1000 toman a liter. 
Also good parking for the night

name: Water hoses all along the road
description: Going out from Yazd to Ispahan, there are many shops with a water hose with good debit in front. The trucks stop there to fill water.

name: Akbar juje restaurant
description:
Healthy and delicious , fair price.
Chicken rice and pomegranate paste 15,000 toman.
Its a chain store.

name: GermanService.ir
description:
Has BMW, Porsche and Mercedes sign in front. They said they don't work on Diesel engines.
They did a good job fixing our door. mechanic speaks some English. Boss of spare part shop at the main street speaks very good English.

name: insurance mokhtari
description:
doing any type of insurance for travellers ,for bikers campers 
so kind and helpful
WhatsApp no:+989141904745

name: Boneh Cafe Gallery
description: Wonderful and calm place for relaxing under palm trees around a fire place. They serve tea, coffee, milkshake and camburger (camel meat). The owner Payam is very friendly and speaks English. Enjoy and try the date milkshake!

name: fuel station with diesel card
description: fuel station that ha a diesel card, but charges 10000rial/liter

name: Gas station with diesel
description: After not being able to get diesel at the station in Jar, we ended up here with a very friendly staff and being able to get diesel.

name: outside abyaneh
description: nice spot outside town next to a small creek. flat place for two cars.

name: Gonbad Aali -  Mountain Camp
description: We stumbled upon this place in the rocky mountains, the view on the valley & city is great and there is an old mausoleum you can visit for free. There was no one after 18.00. Plenty of spots available for 2WD, with 4WD you can go to the end of the road leading to the top of the hill.

name: Parking in old city
description: We parked there and spent the night. In the middle of everything and calm at night. Locals said it was safe and ok to park there.

name: Diesel station
description: No problem to get diesel here, staff had a card and helped us out in a friendly way. Also there are many trucks stopping there so you could try that.

name: diesel station
description:
diesel station. we had 50 liters for 
300 000 rials

name: the golshan garden
description: nice place next to a quiet garden. there are some shops and one restaurant . there is water too.

name: Gas station with Diesel card
description: Here we could fill diesel using the card from the station. They did not want us to pay when they saw the children even if we insisted greatly.

name: Mechanic
description:
Great mechanic in Yazd. Change our breakpads, didn't want to charge us anything but finally I managed to give 2 millions rials.
They also found a way to fix a part of our roof gallery

name: LPG filling station
description: Could fill up our Swiss gas-bottle without Adapter. Very friendly didnt even charge anything.

name: abyane mountains
description:
lovely  location in north of abyaneh in nature 
have river and mountain and trees

name: Park in Khoy
description: Park with a toilet where people park around and sleep in their cars. A bit noisy but ok for a night.

name: Unofficial and pretty campsite
description:
Really nice camping areas. Roads criss cross through the area. You can find a nice spot to camp here. Acording to the amount of campfires around locals also camp here.
 You can hear the road but not much. Nice view of the mountains and a bit mosque down in the valley.
 4g Irancell

name: Diesel!
description: Card needed from a truck driver but the people are friendly and there are many trucks (when we were here). Didn't have to wait.

name: Port Bandar Abbas
description:
Cheating while entering at port of Bandar Abbas (coming from UAE)

Coming from Sharja to Bandar Abbas, we also paid fees which were either completely unnecessary or unjustified; the latter particularly annoyed us.

With Siroos, a so-called «fixer» (trafficker), we agreed an amount of USD 50, so that he helps us with the formalities for the entry into the port and the procedure goes fast. It wasn't fast then, the procedure took 3 hours. In addition to this USD 50, he and his colleague Jafar wanted another USD 30 on the grounds that this would be for Shipping Clearance, Shipping Fee and Bill of Loading, which is total nonsense or a fraud against the tourist who is unaware oft he procedure/cost. These fees have already been paid in Sharja (Al Hili ferry compay) together with the tickets. 
The only thing that has to be paid when entering Bandar Abbas is the harbour fees in the amount of Rial 500'000, which is about USD 5. Proof of this were our companions Thomi and Conny from www.mantoco.com; they did the entry without a fixer and paid only Rial 500'000. In the end, they only had half an hour longer than us. 

Hands away from the mentioned fixers; unless you make a fixed amount in advance for their services plus port fees of Rial 500'000; but as we stated, this service would not be necessary.
Do not hand over your documents (passport, Carnet de Passage etc.) or pass through all stations together with the fixer.
If the fixer insists on further fees or puts a receipt in your hand, it is quite safe in Farsi (which you can't read), or faked. 
Key point of the whole story is the payment of the harbour fees. (Unfortunately, the staff standing around that you ask for has no idea about the procedure or doesn't want to tell you anything, so you are forced to call in a fixer.) You can see the office where the harbour dues have to be paid on the photo.

Good luck and patience to complete the procedure without fraud.

name: mahallat forest park
description:
this is mahallat park in city 
lovley park with trees and safe

name: Daneshyar camper and trucks parts
description:
good place for finding parts of campers and trucks, 
Mr Daneshyar WhatsApp no:+989143917028

name: mahalat sarcheme park
description: this park is north of mahalat and have small waterfall and biggest parking

name: Gas station
description: Gas station with some other facility such as toilet store mosque

name: Valis Visa Service
description:
As of now Vali is able to file Turkmenistan Visa Application for you.
No need to hang around in Teheran anymore, just contact Vali in time and pickup visa about 14 days later here in Mashad
Worked just great for us.

name: Car wash
description: Here you can wash your car before you go to Turkmenistan. Suitable for big vehicles. We paid 2 Mio Rial for a 7,5t truck. clean vehicle needed to cross border.

name: diesel station
description: diesel station before the border, and friendly .1000tomans per liter

name: nice place for family
description: Nice place to stop or spend the night. Playground for kids and water

name: Jolfa Tourist Hotel
description: Clean Hotel with excellent breakfast. Safe parking even for big rigs included. You can pay also in Euro or Dollar, but poor rate. Room is 1.5 Rial

name: Camping in a field near a small village
description:
We looked for a nice place to camp in the area. The river close by has very nice spots but it was full of families picnicking and we wanted to have an evening buss by ourselves. So we came here for the night. Extremely calm. You can make fires.
At noon, some “village police” came by to ask for id and to make pictures with us :)

name: Taleghan
description: Great simple hotel in the mountains. Accessible all cars. We paid 7,500,000 riaals for 3 nights.

name: Waterfalls and Gorges
description: Marked the entry to a nice park near Mashad. follow the road and you can park when you hit the small village. follow the trail next to the small river..for a while there will be restaurants and places to buy stuff. after a while you'll see one of the 2 waterfalls and if you walk further there are no more shops and just small trails through the gorges. After all the restaurants it's a beautiful and peaceful walk!

name: Top valley view
description: Really beautiful  overnight stay with a great view over the green hills including Sunset. Not visible from the road you hardly hear the few Cars. We were here on a thursday. Nobody came only a herd oft sheeps.

name: 7 Guesthouse
description:
In the middle of a small village. Young couple renting 2 rooms. Anita is cooking delicious meals from local products like trout :-)
You may also sleep in the dorm which is the common area. 
Parking in the garden for cars, in front of the guesthouse for bikes. There is only a narrow way to the guesthouse for cars, bikes arrive from either way without problem. So ask locals when you are close which way by car :-) 
We payed 10€/person with breakfast with fresh milk from the neighbor‘s cow and cheese from the other neighbor‘s sheep.
Big wood fire oven in the middle of the room to warm you up and dry your clothes after a day in the mountains (or riding in the rain). 
We stayed 2 nights and enjoyed every second. More than relaxing!

name: Campsite by the sea next to picknic huts
description: Nice location at the beach close to a little teahouse with picknic houses. It was ok for him that we spent the night here. In the evening a few locals picknicking in the morning some fishers,  at night quite. A very dirty toilet and quite some garbage around.

name: toyota and kia service
description:
At this place you can find any part or reparation for your Toyota (or kia). 
fair Price. 
The manager speaks English.

name: Old school
description:
An old school converted into accommodation. Our room had private bathroom and kitchen with 4 beds. Price was 1,2Mio (8€). Kitchen was not well equipped, so take your own utensils/food. No food served. No toilet paper, but hot shower, safe parking in the gated school yard, friendly people and peaceful sleep. 
Ideal for those rainy days or when you don’t want to climb the castle with all your motorbike gear on. Entrance to castle 100m, we went up there for sunset: beauuuuutiful views!

name: Stone Garden
description: Stone Garden, big parking, possible to stay overnight

name: Shir Kuh Panoramic Place
description: Follow the road from Taft up into the mountains (crossing the highway by an underpass). After a few kilometers you reach a gravel turnoff to the right. If you follow this gravelroad, you will find a lot of camping possibilities on your left. All of them have a great view to the 4.055 meters high Shir Kuh!

name: Shir Kuh, 4.055 Meter!
description: A four hours walk and you are on the top! What a panoramic view!

name: Picknickspot in Mountains
description: Very nice view. 1 Toilet with water and paper. 30m bumpi dirt road. Some friendly dogs. Trees for shade. 70.000rial toll for the mountainstreet. Quiet and dark at night.

name: service honarkhahi
description: very nice guy.he greased my landcruiser hzj78 .oil change and repairs.very fair price

name: Police Station for Visa Extension
description: We came here at 11 am having 4 days on our visa left. At first they wanted us come in two days or go to Qom, then they said it would take 3-4 days but in the end they took our papers (original passport plus 2 copies, original visa print out plus 3 copies and 3 photos) and asked us to go to the Melli Bank and pay the fee of 345,000 rials. We brought them the receipt and they told us to come the following day to collect, got 30 days with no probs. All personnel friendly and polite.

name: lalezar lake
description:
around the lake are a lot of nice places to stay. on weekends it gets little crowded but still very beautiful option. especially if you want to hike up the vally or even go to the peak at 4300 altitide its very good basecamp. there are even more places along the way up the vally for camping... 
there is a lot of water in small creeks or out of the lake but there are sheeps grasing up the hill so filter is recommended... we got 4g irancell up here...
enjoy

name: golzar picnic ground
description: nice picnic area with creek flowing by. there is a lot of space. small town seems very nice and not touristy at all. on the other side of the road are good toilet facilities. 4g irancell

name: Rainbow mountains.
description:
In-between a couple of the rainbow mountains on an old trail. 
Amazing scenery and, surprisingly quiet. 
Only 4 stars due to the garbage-remains. (it looks like it once was a landfill)

name: Picknick next to the sea
description: We payed 100.000rial for entrance. Toilets are new and ok to use. You can choose to be on the Picknickarea or drive further along the beach where you are alone in Forest near to the sea. A lot of wood for fire on the beach(-: some noise from the street. Entrance is ca 200m before the gps but looks like they make an other more.

name: Petrol station
description:
Petrol station on the other side of the road, direction Kerman. No idea if they have card for diesel. We just saw it while passing.
Chargen you 1000toman or 2000toman per liter

name: Huge parking in a service area
description: Service area with huge parking and restaurant. Irancell 3G

name: Petrol station
description: Petrol pump, we didn’t need any diesel, but it  seems they would give us some.

name: calm place in between the fields
description: Follow the steep road from the freeway.  Before entering the little town, head right. Don't go to the quarry but turn right, the gravel road will lead you to the top of the small mountain. Not passable for big rigs. The road will be very muddy after rains, maybe not passable at all then. There are corn fields and in between untouched earth. I stayed here for 2 days, no one came by except a shepherd dog and some jackals :) You can follow the road further to the end and have even more privacy but there may be a shepherd resting there under the trees. You can see the freeway far away and will hear it a little bit when there is no wind. The place i marked has a little campfire place. Wind is coming from the west. It is not the most beautiful place in iran... but I really enjoyed no one coming along. 4G coverage.

name: wild camping near Dzordzor Chapel
description: Nice camp place by the lakeside. Could get pretty windy but the view it's all worth it. The route can be done with normal car. It is about 1.5 km from the asphalt. Place is with grass and gravel.

name: Place to camp or to make a break
description: Near the main road, 100 m to the river. Grass and a little windy during the day.

name: Petrol pump
description: Petrol Pump, no card. Very friendly and helpful people. A truck driver helped us with his card

name: Moonlight Cafe
description:
Want to have a nice evening out with local young people? The guys working and visiting this place are the best, they are so friendly and open minded. Nice atmosphere with live local music mixed with lounge music. They serve good food and fresh coffee as well. 

The location is on 166th street, on the left side (when entering from main road) there is a small sign above the gate. Just ring the doorbell.

name: Hotel cheap
description: We paid ca 10€ for a Doubleroom with bath. West toilett. Clean. Friendly  personal. Way to beach. A/C. Great Parkingarea

name: diesel with card
description: They had a card, we didn't even had to ask for it, 600 toman/L

name: raghez canyon
description: Amazing place with beautiful pounds where you can swim under the Waterfalls. We did it with a guide trough the hotel for 700 000 rial but I think it is also possible to do it alone if you are a more experienced rock climber. There is a trail with six pounds that you can reach without equipment. Highly recommended. Rock-climbing, rappelling and canyoning is also possible in this area, although we didnt find a guide/company for this locally...

name: Silk worm farm
description: here in the village you can see how the silk worms are growing and eating leaves. Ask a local to show you. they are very friendly.

name: Petrol station diesel with card
description: Petrol station, diesel with card at regular price. Friendly staff

name: Parking lot
description: Parking lot behind a shopping mall and closed to the basar. Very quite in the night.

name: Parking of Cheshmeh Ali Garden
description: Huge Parking of Cheshmeh Ali Garden. Entrance Fee 200.000 Rial for 2 persons and camper.

name: Ruar Ecolodge
description:
This place is a paradise to relax :-) Situated in deep forest, this Ecolodge grows their own organic food, bakes fresh bread in a traditional oven and supports local farmers. 
You can sleep in your car (4€)and use all facilities with breakfast or sleep in a room (8€) with beautiful view into the green from the balcony. 
Everything very clean. The owners know everything about local culture and you’ll learn a lot about this part of Iran that is so different from the rest of the country - even language is not Farsi!
We enjoyed it so much after busy and noisy Teheran and crowded coastline.

name: Fuel station
description: Fuel station with Diesel no card available any more

name: Petrol station with card
description: Petrol station diesel with card here, regular price

name: Yazd, parking at Towers of Silence
description:
April 2019, parking: Not the most romantic of all places, but convenient for big rigs to avoid the narrow streets and parking lots downtown. There are always taxis there, taking you into the center for 150k
Toilet at the entrance to the site during opening hours

name: Lonely place in the dunes north of Ashtiyan
description: April 2019: Turn right into the ‘village high street’ and follow the track NE to find your place in the dunes; we stayed for two days … not even the locals came by

name: race track for cars and motorbikes
description: Opens every Friday at 10:30h. You can watch there car and motorcycle races, pimped cars, all an overlander hearts wants to see. The location is the entrance. You have to drive through and then you will find the different race tracks.

name: Nice view
description: Continue to walk the road on the left side of the river to get the view in the pictures.

name: camp place near the road
description: beautiful place for emergency camp , specially for cycletourists and motorbike travellers

name: Dizin Ski Complex
description: Big parking of the Dizin Ski Complex. Very quite.

name: Wooden Mosque
description: There's a very nice wooden mosque. It's not very old but very rare.

name: Mohaya Laundry
description:
Small Laundry Service a bit outside of Quazvin. The owner doesn’t speak any English, but Google Translator helps.
Laundry done within half a day.
If you want it also completely dry, give him a day.

Price is very low. We paid 600.000IRR for one week‘s laundry of two people.

name: Petrol pump with diesel
description: Petrol pump with diesel, we got diesel easily but they charged 9.000 Rial instead of 6.000 Rial per liter

name: Fire temple
description: Old fire temple in the road. Sassanian period.

name: Quiet spot close to the road
description: As there are no "real“ campspots we just left the road and parked our camper a few meters away. Flat spot. Nothing around. Quiet at night. Safe place.

name: Castle Forg
description: A very nice castle in a very good shape. The village is also very beautiful.

name: Old city of Khusf
description: Looks like a nice small ancient village. You wouldn't see it, if you don't know it.

name: On top of Canyon Kal-e Jen
description: April 2019: great to walk down into the canyon and spend a dead quiet night on the large parking lot. The place is quite popular among the locals but they all leave as the sun is setting

name: Along #91 Deyhuk-Ferdows
description: April 2019: coming on the #91 from the south, turn-off here to the right into a decent dirt track; follow it a few hundred meters and you’ll find plenty of space, quiet and out of sight from the main road; a couple of trucks passed by but didn’t bother us

name: Ruins of fortified village
description: April 2019: coming from the south, take the small road immediately after the police check point to the east; you will already see the ruins, quite interesting to walk around, smaller cars may even drive into the 'village'; the occasional car may pass by on the nearby road but nobody bothered us

name: Scenic Road ... with frequent police checks
description:
It is indeed a very scenic drive on a good road from Kalat further NW via Dargaz to the border point at Bajgiran.
Be aware this is near the border to TKM, i.e. the moment you stop near a village you may well have the police next to you wanting to check your passport and a little interview. It happened to us 3x on the same day … a bit annoying but the officers were all very friendly.

name: Last petrol station before the border
description:
April 2019: if you opt for this scenic route through the mountains, here is the last place before the border where you get Diesel; friendly attendant helped us with his Diesel card and we paid the regular 600T
Also for other supplies, Dargaz is the last place with plenty of shops

name: Ecolodge Esfahak
description: Nice Ecolodge. There are three ecolodges, they belong all to the same people. Looks very nice so far.

name: Bomgardi Surt Ecolodge
description:
This Ecolodge is an organic farm with apples, cherries, walnuts, carps, sheep, bees,... you are adopted by the family within minutes and introduced to their organic farm (if you want).
Very peaceful setting, homecooked dishes, beautiful views. Very clean bathroom. We payed 1 Mio (6€) per person with breakfast (own honey, own milk & cheese) and stayed 3 relaxing nights.

name: Petrol station with diesel card
description: Petrol station with diesel card at regular price

name: Exchange office
description: Exchange office in Ardabil, rate of today 22nd May 2019: 1 Euro = 156.000 rial

name: Parking of bus terminal
description: Parking of the bus terminal. It is quite crowded in the evening, but quite after midnight. We paid 10.000 rial for the parking.

name: Sorkhdar Ecolodge
description:
This Ecolodge is the home of a Ranger. He is leading a project to conserve a tree (taxus bacata) in the forest. To create alternative income for the village people instead of cutting down the trees, he installed some interesting workshops in the village. Worth to spend at least half a day with him! His wife prepares delicious dishes. We payed 1,25 Mio (7€), breakfast included. Safe parking for cars and bikes in the yard. He loves motorbikes :-)
Note: do only try to get to this place from the south (from Abr cloud forest), when it’s dry: the dirt road is extremely dangerous steep and get more slippery than ice :-) Beautiful drive through cloud forest when it’s dry.

name: Qaem workshop
description: Car repair Workshop. The owner was an honest guy. He didn't change anything that was still working. I was here with an Iranian friend to change oil and filters.

name: Ezmeyghan oasis
description: A nice oasis in the desert close to Ezmeyghan. Follow the river up and you will come to some nice rice terraces.

name: iveco service
description: iveco truck mostly, but can handle other truck brands also.Speaking  english &  farsi. fixed a spring / shock adsorber problem with my truck.

name: Playground
description:
Kid's playground next to a lake. Many local having fun here. Discussions with foreign people very interesting. 
Last stop before Teheran when you come from the south.

name: Bandar Camp
description:
Bandar Camp. 
You can sleep in a small cabin or in your car. 
Toilets available and safari to the dunes also.

name: Persepolis near handicraft area
description:
Iranian people would say to you that it is not safe but if is ok.
Good place to have shadow all day long when you visit Persepolis.

name: near Kerman Historical Center
description: Good place near the historical center. parking near a park. Water.

name: Dentist. Dr Boostani
description: Good dentist. I paid 50 dollars for 2 interventions

name: Parking near metro and park
description: Nice parking with garden. metro at 400 meters. taxi to the the center cost 100 or 150000 rials. water. WC We paid 150000 rials for 3 nights.

name: Ali gas GPL
description: I refilled my bottle with gpl lpg here. I paid 170 000 rials for 28,5 liters.

name: Turkmen Yurt Stay
description:
This family has 2 yurts as guestrooms. Little turkmen village with around 50 turkmen horses. We stayed 2 nights in a 4 wall yurt and payed 1,25 Mio (7,50€) per person and night, breakfast included. They also serve homemade dinner (or lunch). 
This might be the first or last night of your trip to sleep in a traditional yurt! Beautiful experience not to be missed! This is a completely different culture of Iran!

name: Araz Camp
description: it's family business, beautiful and safe camp place with food

name: Mountain lake - trailhead
description: nice lake 20 min walking up. on weekends its very crowded but nice. go all the way to the top is possible too...

name: Nameless summit in the Kuh-e Kalar mountains
description: At least an easy three hours walk, mostly without a path. The 360° view is amazing!

name: Parking for hiking in the Kuh-e Kalar mountains
description: From here you start your hike. Clear water  in river. Also nice to camp.

name: Lakeshore Camping
description: Very scenic and quiet place. Very friendly local farmers at the fields around. Fresh and clear water if the river is running. Shade places under big trees.

name: Oshtoran Kuh View
description:
What a scenic place! The whole Oshtoran Kuh mountains in front of you! 
Leave the highway at Darband, after about 5 km you will reach some small ponds. Take the track on your left, just before the bridge, and you will see a flat area beside a bee-keepers place. Don't worry about the bees...

name: Photography & Photocopy
description:
Here you can take pictures for your visa extension. 150.000 Rial for six pictures. Very fast service.

Opposite door: Photocopies 500T each

name: Parking Chak Chak
description: Right in the parking area of Chak Chak temple you can park your car. Toilets are available (there were close when I was there). Drinking water at the temple (take bottles when you go to the temple) Very very quiet place, and safe. Asfalt all the way.

name: Riverside camping
description:
Multiple good campspots next to the river in the forest. A lot of shade all day. The water is clean, not safe to drink unfiltered but great for washing and doing the dishes. There are some people passing every now and then, mostly farmers or families that are picknicking. On holidays and in weekends it can get busier. Suitable for 2wd as well. Big rigs won’t fit.

We stayed 3 nights, nice place.

name: Welcome your garden
description: It is small cafe like caravan saray, with tea, watermelons, nargila (shisha). Very kind guys, they gave us fruits for free. It is very ok for sleep here. There is a simple but clean toilet. Very nice place. We stayed here for tea and kalyan, but also decide to sleep here. :)

name: Wildcamp Kantal Nt. Park
description: Very nice wild camping spot in the Kantal Nt. Park about 20km south of the armenien border sourrounded by mountains and completely out of sight from the road. There is a small dirt track leading from the tared road into the park. I am not sure if camping is permited since it is in a Nt. Park. 3G network from IranCell.

name: large supermarket with just everything
description: large supermarket with fixed prices and cashier with barcodescanner. supermarket is located in diplomat area, they just have everything.  A dreamland after seeing all those no choise minimarkets with tourist rates.

name: Dadamaan Hotel Zanjan
description:
Beautiful, old, traditional hotel. Has parking close to the hotel. If full, you can park in closed parking of the building next to. It's ok for normal car, small campers or motorbike, but i think the street is too tiny for bigger vehicles.

I paid 1 800 000 for small, single, with breakfest (first price was 2.4 mln, but they lowered it without being asked). I was also offered 4 person room for 5 000 000. (18.01.22 - 9'000'000 for 4 person in this room)

Rooms are clean and beautiful, with AC. Stuff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Nice patio, restaurant with great food (18.01.21 - restaurant not open). wifi: 6mb download, 0.8mb upload.

name: 15 km before W Trabiz
description: a vacant lot in the middle of constructions a field arounded cover us service

name: AH 1 DIESEL STATION
description: diesel without need to ask the help of a driver, they have their card we pay cash diesel kind service you CAN peace on cash without truckdriver's card

name: Sud lac Ormiya
description: small path for a place in the middle of nowhere 1 km from the dry lake bu small trail 1 km road to place without nothing

name: Caravanserai Maranjab
description:
The caravanserai is under new management and is now practically renovated; only a few details are missing. There are many beautifully restored rooms in traditional style as well as with European standard. 
From the roof of the caravanserai you have a beautiful panoramic view. 
The restaurant offers traditional Iranian cuisine and is of top quality. The Dizzy is excellent!
Unfortunately there are some bad reviews about this place, but they are older and now outdated. Note that the area outside the caravanserai is not under the same management. 
We can highly recommend the caravanserai Maranjab as a hotel as well as a restaurant.

name: Petrol station w/ diesel
description: Not many petrol stations around but saw some trucks tanking diesel here.

name: Hiking summit
description: From the dam you can easy walk in less than two hours up to this nice panoramic summit.

name: Highest summit of the Alvand mountains
description: You need five hours if you take the longer,  but nicer track. Four hours for the direkt way. So you can make an attractive loop.

name: Hiking track starts here
description: If you want to hike up to the Yakhchal summit, 3.580 meters high, you can park here at the end of the tarmac road. For big rigs it's the last possibility, with smaller 4x4 you can drive up till the last buildings. Also possible to camp there with rooftent or normal tents.

name: Street park near Holy shrine
description: We wanted to visit Holy shrine, that's why we decided to park right in the center of the town, on the street. It is nice spot for the center of the city, small green park, trees. Advice: You can visit Holy shrine only before 19.00.

name: irancell
description: Iran cell shop (yellow front). Next to entry Bazar.

name: hole next to big road
description:
1km of the main road, is a hole surrounded by local roads. In dark out off side. In day little in sight.
Bit garbage but pretty oke spot.
Is its 8 meter deep, has 1 entrance.

Very good spot if it's already dark and you look for an overnight spot.

name: Canals next to pigeon towers
description:
There are several dry canals near the pigeon towers that are wide enough to pitch a tent in. Access from the dirt road going past the pigeon towers. Well hidden once you are in the canal. The ground was dry when we were here, but the canals look like they are flooded sometimes, so camp at your own risk!

There is a toilet building next to the teahouse (the largest pigeon tower in this area).

name: Flat hilltop between Mashhad and Sarakhs
description: Large, flat hilltop just next to an old section of road between Mashhad and Sarakhs. The new road cuts through the hill, so nobody drives up the old road anymore. The old road is marked on OSM so you can check the entry points there. The new road can be heard but not seen from the campsite.

name: campspot
description: enterance here from road to some campspots... up the mainroad in 500 m and 1km are more places, even with nice view to damarvand

name: diesel station
description: they have a card, fair price and friedly staff

name: Exhaust and Cooler Mechnic for Trucks
description: Small mechanic who sells and repairs exhausts and cooler.

name: Sim card
description: Here you can buy a Ucom sim card / 1.000.000 for 10 Gb. A bit unfriendly but closest solution after the border. Better options in town.

name: Garage, Mechanic, Izmael
description: Izmael speaks some English and is welcoming. Fair price and clean garage. Hight +/- 3.3m but they do repairs outside. Look for blue and yellow front of building.

name: Parking near Abyaneh
description: It is better to park here because it is crowded near the village and it's difficult to park, or to go out later by caravan. Flat, quiet.

name: Sanandaj Village Centre
description: Paid parking to stay overnight to visit City Center. No service well. Good to visit town near blue tea mosque.

name: Madani Park
description: Drinking water at dish washing place

name: Gas Bottle Refill
description: You can fill your french gas bottle. 12000 toman for 20L. Butane!

name: Many spots for wild camping along the road
description: Many spots not far from the road. It's the best we could find on this road that goes through hills.There are some trees, not super flat but ok and there are a lot of locals coming here to picnic. Nice surroundings. No irancell signal.

name: Museum of Anthropology and Crafts
description:
Small family Museum of Anthropology and Crafts from Gilan province. Entrance fee 100 000 rls. We were shown this museum by a lovely family that hosted us for a day. Its a very small museum, only 1 piece, but there is quite a big collection of Gilan handmade objects, tools, traditional dresses etc...The owner is an anthropolist and its his passion. 
Our host (the museum owner sister) speaks english so she translated us everything.
Very lovely family, they will be happy to welcome you .
It's a good one hour break if you are nearby.

name: Esfahan Bookcity
description: Very nice cafe with bookstore, some souvenirs and very tasty Turkish coffee with the rose water. Nice modern host couple, speaking very good English.

name: MAN Workshop
description:
Please contact Mr. Madani, if you need any help with your truck! He is extremly friendly and helpfull! And he speaks german and english!!! His number is 0989121504393.
He also has contact to all other brands and workshops...

name: Camping on dirt road
description:
Easy to access, even for big camper.
Pet Shop near by.
Not so quiet during ramadan because of park nearby where there is a toilet.

name: TAP Persia - Great Travel Agency!
description:
Very good travel agency for all your needs in Iran! Run by a great team of young people who are very helpful and friendly. They can arrange everything and the prices are very reasonable. 
We had a very good experience with them and so far two friends of us also used their services when they traveled to Iran.

They mostly do everything via internet but you can also come to their office. (better contact them in advance it's a little tricky to find)

www.tappersia.com
Phone & WhatsApp:
+98 913 316 0903
+98 9103004875
Email:
info@tappersia.com

name: Parsian Esteghal International Hotel
description:
Reasonable hotel with secure parking. 
We booked online and paid $51 per night for 2 people.

The rooms are a little tired and old.

name: Picnic by the river
description: It's a nice place along the river where locals are picknicking. At the Checkpoint they write down your license plate number and the number of people. As I understood, it's not allowed to camp there.

name: Engine repair & welding workshop
description: This workshop repairs everything around the engine and does welding jobs as well. Good and modern machinery.

name: Fuel station
description: The first petrol and gas station out of Isfahan.

name: Shadow all day!
description:
Good place close to the other place. toilets and water. no for big truck here but ok to the closest one without shadow. 
bazar is 10 mns walk distance.

name: Burger & falafel cafe
description: It was the only one open place for eat. Here is vegetarian option - falafel.

name: Shisha & chai
description:
Shisha and chaj (tea) place. When you see beige buildind from bricks, just go inside (down stairs) you will see like caravanseraj cafe, where man's gather to smoke shisha (nargila, kalyan).
Price for shisha is 100.000 real

name: Camper builder
description:
Small camper builder. Mostly interior.

Very helpful!

name: Parsian Hotel
description: Nice hotel at a reasonable price for the good facilities. Underground secure parking which is approximately 2,5m high. My Pajero, with rooftop tent, fit in easily. Also has open parking on the premises. We paid approximately $40 for two people for one night.

name: Deyr Gachin Carvaneserai
description: It is possible to camp in front of, or further inside, the Deyr Gachin Carvaneserai, maintained by volunteers.

name: Eyvanekey
description:
500 m from highway. Flat area.  Not too noisy
500 m de la route une aire plate pa gêné par le bruit de la route

name: near Kanaj
description:
Near train. Shade. Few trains After 8 PM. Obtain permission from Guard. 

près de la voie ferrée mais avec de l'ombre, peu de train après 20 h avec l'agrément du gardien

name: Majan Ecolodge
description:
Dream place to escape the city! A taxi to Mashad downtown is 1-2€ and 30mins.
Beautiful Ecolodge with garden full of birds, homecooked delicious meals and nice owners.
Parking for cars in front of the Ecolodge at the very last deadend of this quiet village, bikes and motorbikes park inside.
We payed 7,50€ (1,25 Mio) per night, breakfast and tea&fruit during the day included.
This place will calm you down...

name: Motel in Darab
description:
If you search for a cheap, simple accomodation, and don't have high expectations, it will be a great choice. It's a simple motel both with private and group rooms with restaurant which serves really tasty breakfasts (60 000 IRR) and lunches (125 000 IRR with doogh). Shared showers, air conditioning, TV and fridge in the room, no wifi, no towels, no sheet (we had our own slipping bags, probably they are available here). Service barely speaks English, but they are really willing to help. We paid 400 000 IRR/night/2 persons in June 2019. 

Before we arrived here, we went to the Hotel of Government. It was completely empty that day so a guy wanted to con us and demanded 4 000 000 IRR per night for a really average accomodation. When we protested, he proposed 3 000 000 IRR, but it was still too much for us (backpackers) and - first of all - it wasn't worth that price. If you want a comfortable stay in Darab, there is another recommended hotel, also on iOverlander.

name: Hamdamo Saltaneh
description: Wonderful place with great food and friendly staff. Serve food also during Ramadan. Fair prices in a beautiful yard. Feels like being in a  oasis.

name: Qazvin tourism information
description:
office du tourisme excellentes information
tourisme office give Map town and around

name: Wild camping
description:
large clearing in the Iranian hills. good place for tents and 4x4.
exposed to the wind but very quiet to sleep.
accessed via a track on the right of the road.

name: Hills Wild camping
description:
Very quiet and beautiful  zone for the night.
Is a good place for the 4x4 car. 
No good for tent.

name: Road from Teheran to Dizin
description: This road is blocked at this point! Not possible to go up to Dizin!

name: Uraman tourist center
description: Is not a hostel. It's like a homestay. Nice place for 80.000 Toman. +98 918 375 8026 is the number of the owner. A small kitchen, balcony and a bathroom is included. I don't know if it has a restaurant, but the owner offers breakfast, lunch and dinner.

name: Neor Lake
description:
Very Beautiful place near to Neor Lake. In the night really quiet.
In the day local tourism.

name: alireza  motorcycle repair
description: Alireza is so kindley man and be helpful in motorcycle repair , he is Cycletourist too. have Iranian motorcycles part but can help you to repair and find parts

name: Park in the Fereidunshahr
description: Beautiful park with nice water cascade. We stayed here overnight. Many locals come to have a picnic, or to use carousel with kids. At night calm, safe. Very beautiful view, on the both sides of parking!

name: Jirosh site and wild camping
description: on the road to Bandar Abass, archeology site. no much to see but one of the most ancient civilisation of the world. We could sleep there. Guardian let us park inside their office parking and we could get electricity. Very quiet at night.

name: spot swim eat relax with view on the sea
description: off road. any vehicule can drive and stop here. beside the road. we just stop here to swim and have a break. noone bother us. there is a little fisher house that was open and in front a terrace with view to relax. we didn't stay to sleep so we don't know how it could be. maybe in peak season it wouldn't be a quiet area.

name: Parking near Red cross
description: Parking near the Iranian Red Cross and little Mosque. A lot of space, calm at night, safe.

name: garage for tires
description:
we had to change our tires and found a good deal here with help of iranian friends. the boss speak well english. tires found for a specific size not easy to find in this country. 225/75 R16. 116 CP.
Nice service.

name: Sefidroud river
description:
au bord de la rivière après le barrage 
aucun service lieu de picnic des locaux
River side without service picnic. for iranians

name: Road to Lahijan
description:
diesel with gas station card friendly.
.....
diesel a 600 avec carte de la station

name: Nice spot for kids before port.
description: very nice spot for kids! great playground. we could take a shower! the water is not potable. we did ask the guard. we didn't spent the night here but it seems quiet for a night before or after trip to qeshm.

name: Brothers workshop
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Location is incorrect. Place is marked for deletion.  


Brothers work shop is full equipted with machine and tools and you can order for manufactring , making , welding , milling , mechanical job , or whatever refers to car and truck and camper and motorhomes job , they can speak english with no problem that is dificult to find somebody talk in english so thats a important pont for tourists , they are very helpfull and can give a guide and information about most of the things that tourists need. 
Vrezh 09132126399
Arvin09131198693 ,you can canect by calling ,sms,or whats up app.

name: Ruir Sea Star Qeshm
description: Cheap and very clean homestead. Wi-Fi,  TV, 5 minutes walking from the Zakeri passenger port, 5 minutes walking to city center and bazzar.

name: Diesel station (and benzine)
description:
Finally diesel after the mountains.
Got 60 liter
Paid 300 a liter

name: Provincial General Administration of Customs
description: I needed to extend my Carnet de passages for my motorbike. I went to this office and managed to do it. Officers very helpful.

name: Parking Close to the Fortress
description: We paid 20000 rial for a very quiet and safe night in the center. Arrived at 7pm. The parking seems not very good at first sight but guards have been very nice. After midnight we were alone.

name: Golestan Hotel
description:
We stayed there in our tent for 1 night. You can choose between setting it on a grass or in gazebo. We chose the second option as it was not only lovely but also there was light and electricity. Regarding other facilities: pit toilet, cold water, no wifi, no signal. Yes, very simple, but we recommend staying there because of charming people who really enjoy our visit and running a hotel helps them survive in harsh mountains and country. There is a guy perfectly speaking English who invited us to join his family party and gave us free tea twice. We paid 50 000 IRR for a tent and a car + 20 000 IRR for breakfast (2 persons). 

And it's so close to Alamut Castle!

name: The Prophet Job "Ayoub" Cave
description:
South east of Dehaj city, in the middle of this great mountain is Prophet Job or Ayoub cave. Job (Arabic: أَيّْوْب‎, romanized: Ayyūb).
Ayoub cave is the biggest cave in Iran. Cave is located in Shahr-e Babak, Kerman Province, IRAN.
Ayoub cave which can be seen from far distance sit at the elevation 2876 meters. The cave entrance dimensions are incredible. Width has 68m, height 98m and depth is about 200 meters. There are some shapes like vespiary on the walls of this cave which are made by wind and sand. Ayoub cave is known as a worship place because of its unique features that attracts many visitors and pilgrims. The locals believe Ayoub the messenger been present here in the past.

name: Water in a park
description: Drinking Water from the tap in a park. You can park directly in front.

name: gazole (no card)
description:
**August 2019: No More Card on site**

no problem to get gazole here. 600 toman liter.

name: Iranian campground
description:
An Iranian campsite not very clean but shaded. Beach surrounded by canvas reserved for women.

Un camping iranien pas très propre mais ombragée une plage cernée de toile réservee aux femmes.

name: Station service
description:
Diesel with station card 10000 rial.

Diesel avec carte station 10000 rial.

name: Sina Hotel
description:
Nice hotel with friendly English speaking staff at reception. Parking space without height restriction. Rooms are clean and spacious. Bed is a little bit hard. This hotel was advised by host of Darya (and in Lonely Planet). We stayed here, because parking at Darya and Amin was not possible with our Land Cruiser with RTT due to height limitations. 

Location is good. 18min walking to bazaar.

2380000 Rial per night for double room with bathroom incl. breakfast. Breakfast is simple, but sufficient. Some salad, bread, egg, juice, tea some jams and honey. 

Wifi is relatively fast, but sometimes reception is not good. In rooms 60% of time working in lobby no problems.

name: Razhia Hotel
description:
Nice hotel, clean with airco and parking. At the edge of town with lots of parking space. Ask the staff to enter trough the gate at the back. No height restrictions over-there. Manager and some staff speaks English, others just a little. However, all very friendly and helpful!
We payed 210.000Toman for a night in a double room incl. breakfast.

Bazaar and most sightseeing is 15min walk away.

name: Cloud forest
description:
Very beautiful spot! Is possible on the fire, is quiet and very Very beautiful. 
Is ok for tent. If you need to pay 550.000 Rials for entry/transit.

name: Gaz high pressure
description:
you can fill up with gaz your european bottle, in our case french bottle.
Nice people as always in Iran !

name: Restaurant
description:
May be one on 80 km restaurant. So, good to stop here, after Chak Chak for example.
There is different kebabs, and vegetarian option - beans in tomato sous with rice.

name: Diesel station and shop
description:
No card diesel, friendly staff, you don't pay more than you should pay.
Near small shop with the nice seller, where you can buy vegetarian option - canned eggplant with tomato and onion (Iranian dish) it is really very good stuff for campervan

name: Gas filling possible
description: They will find a way to fill up your european gas bottles.

name: Badab-e surt
description:
Well, the road isn' t more than a steep, outwashed track. But we managed it with our 10t. truck without any problems.
The track starts opposite of the campsite. The entrance gate at the source is a bit narrow for big rigs, but if you follow the track right up the hill, you will find nice places to camp.

name: MTN/Iran Cell shop
description:
Shop on eastern side of Emam Khomeini St (no. 9-11). A husband and wife seem to run the store. They speak a little English and can set you up with an Irancell SIM card, if you’ve just entered Sarakhs from Turkmenistan. I paid 500,000IRR for the SIM and 450,000IRR for a 1 month, 10GB data package. SIM apparent let comes with limited calls/texts and little to no data. 

Note that you’ll need to bring a copy of your passport for SIM card registration purposes (similar to situation in many of the ‘stans). Your passport will need to be copied together with certain details to be filled in and sent to Irancell for registration. The easiest way to do this is to go to the copy shop diagonal opposite and ask for an “Irancell copy”. Then take this piece of paper back to the Irancell shop and sign it + put your finger prints on it.

name: Printer / photocopy shop
description: Small printing shop on corner of Emam Khomeini Street and Talqany Street. Can get an “Irancell copy” printed here (lady gave me mine for free).

name: Wheat Cafe
description:
Western-style cafe with espresso coffee and an excellent range of iced drinks/smoothies. Muhammad is the owner, who speaks reasonable English. Opening hours unclear- Maps.me says 24/7, but he told me he opens from 8pm everyday. Weird for a cafe... 

Door was open during the day so I walked in and Muhammad was happy to make me a delicious melon smoothie, followed by an iced mocha, and talk about Iran. Nice outdoor space at rear.

name: Money exchange
description:
Informal money exchange in car park opposite Sarakhs border post complex. At time of writing, it was a man sitting in a black Peugeot 206 hatchback with huge wads of cash on the passenger seat... Rates worse than on Bonbast, but still far better than the bank rate (only other alternatives seem to be the various banks on Emam Khomeini Street in Sarakhs town). The man accepted Turkmeni manat and USD.

If unsure, ask the truck drivers milling about or enter the security/customs building at entrance to border complex. Some men in there speak a little English and will happily direct you.

name: Excellent falafel restaurant
description:
A welcome change from the rather dull Central Asian food, this cheap, simple but delicious falafel restaurant seems popular with locals. Staff are very friendly, but have limited English. Some cold drinks available. 1 falafel wrap a mere 40,000IRR.
Look for the flashing red neon sign just south of the Talqay St/Emam Khomeini St traffic lights.

name: Park bwstan
description:
very Nice place with water and WC 
there is a gardian

name: Parking of Azadi Square for visit Tower
description: Parking 50.000 Rials near To Azadi Tower and To visit this Tower.

name: Lahic hotel
description:
at entrance of the village nice establishment. not camping but we can ask home average wanted 20 AZN negotiated at 10 expensive but washing machine expensive also good in troubleshooting entrance village has beautiful not a camping goal. After bargain we paid 10 expensive Wash machine expensive so welcome not very good --- a entrée du village bel établissement pas camping mais on peut se poser accueil moyen voulait 20 AZN négocié a 10 cher mais machine a laver cher aussi bon en dépannage
entrance village a beautifull établissement not a camping but After bargain we paid 10 expensive Wash machine rxpensive so
welcome not very good

name: Taleghani Inn
description:
Sweet nice hostel in the city centre of Qazvin. The men (the owner) speaks a little bit English but is very helpful and kind. Double room without bathroom is 800.000 IRR. A room with bathroom is 1.000.000 IRR. The WiFi is working, pretty fast. No breakfast included. The shared bathrooms have an Iranian toilet but everything is clean! A/C in the room. 


Note: The red coloured entrance is in a small alley.

name: Highway rest area
description:
Highway rest area including 3 shops, a restaurant, toilet block, mosque, playground and shelters. You can pitch your tent under the shelters for free. Bank of powerpoints outside mosque, where you can charge your phone etc. Shelters/mosque good distance from highway, not much noise.

Since my visit, I’ve read about these 2 Australians and their less pleasant experience. Solo women beware of the Imam: https://foonsonbikes.com/2015/03/26/iranian-impressions/
