name: Baba Babr Khan Camp
description: a nice place at the end of the road (Big trucks wont go thought, good for cars and bicycles). there you will find Nader's place. He is on Warmshower too. he owns a place with carpets to rest and restaurant. We could sleep here. there are many spot to camp nearby it is an Iranian tourist area with jungle and river and waterfall

name: Money Exchange Espadana
description: Nice clean money exchange - Espadana. Today I changed money here. Exchange rate for today 127.000IRR for 1$. Fast, no fees, no hustle.

name: Dolat Sara
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Description provided by owner.

we are a Traditional Iranian hostel with more than 360 year of age from Zandiye dynasty which has been repaired several times .
 we have a big and beautiful yard where you can have your meal and enjoy or relax after a day of visiting the interested parts of city. this house is located in the center part of the city, behind Vakil Bazaar and you can walk easily to go for visiting the sight seeings. more than 20 attractions are near to our house for tourists.
we love to chat with guests and drink tea together. also we prepare traditional shirazi foods for our guests and wish them to have great memories in our traditional house.

for more information and reservation you can call me : 00989172424199
or send me message on whatsapp : 00989172033697

my name is Mohamad Hossein Hamidi

name: Sohrab Traditional Hostel
description:
It's a new hostel, only three months old. Inside everything's new. You can park your vehicle in front of the door. It's very close to all sightseeings, but the area is calm. There is a safe parking space two minutes away. You can ask the owner.
The owner is a very guy with very good englisch. He showed us some places on a public holiday when everything else was closed.

name: Lake of Bazangan
description: A nice lake with covered picknick places. You will find several places to camp around the lake.

name: Sarakhs Diesel Station
description: Nice stuff, filled up completely, wanted first 800 Tuman/Liter, at the end we payed 600 Tuman/Liter.

name: Sarv Restaurant
description: Delicious traditional Persian restaurant, just after roundabout on way into/out of Ashkaneh. Ahmad the restaurant owner speaks perfect English (lived in Sweden for 30yrs). Great food, cold drinks, espresso coffee & excellent company

name: parking in the center
description: plenty of spaces and parking to pay in this street. very close to mausoleum.

name: fazeli hotel yazd
description: Fazeli Hotel is a newly established facility founded in 2016. The whole building includes the main yard, rooms, restaurant and the coffeehouse which enjoys from its Islamic traditional design and architecture. The restaurant with its professional staff serves you Persian traditional foods along with western foods. Besides, the hotel is located at the heart of historical texture of Yazd which locals call old town. It's truly an honor to be your host in a city whose people have been famous for their hospitality especially with foreign travelers. 24 hour front desk, daily housekeeping

name: Upholstery shop Sajjad
description: Great place for making your car look great. Sajjad is a great guy who speaks a little bit English, but he understands his job. He made curtains and floormats for us but he can do everything you like. Like most Iranians he's extremely friendly and gave us a free ride trough town and treated us so well. High recommended

name: Money exchange - good rate
description: Better than with the guys on the street. It is official and has a good rate.

name: Garage mechanic truck and off road
description:
Joseph is a very good and helpful mechanic gars. We change the bled socks absorber on our Toyota Land Cruiser. 
He his doing some off road and truck mechanic.

name: Traffic police station
description: Traffic police station for getting temporary license plate. Opening hours Sunday till Thursday from 8am till 12am.

name: Copy shop
description: Copy shop about 10min walk from China embassy

name: Jalal Guesthouse
description: Nice guesthouse with 2 bedrooms in the house of the friendly owner Jalal. Fenced parking in a very quiet area. Rooms have AC, shared bathroom and are very clean. Including breakfast €15 per room. You can do laundry, use the kitchen and garden. Open all year. Jalal’s other guesthouse Khaneye Pedari closes in low season. Jalal speaks fluently German!

name: Bahar St. Parking
description: Bahar Street Parking, suitable for parking your van. Good choice if you want to stay at Hi Tehran Hostel. This parking is close to carwash

name: Water Shop
description: As far as we understood: Because there is a higher groundlevel water in Bordjoud, there are microbacteria in the water. So specially at Bordjoud they installed a water filling station. You can fill up your tanks for 1000 Rial / liter.

name: Gas bottle refill Amir
description: I could refill my bottle here. They had the adaptator for French bottle

name: Sim Card
description: Mohsen guided us to this place to get a locale sim card. You need a passport and your fathers name. You can choose any tarif. We payed 270 000 Rial for 30 days and 5 GB. Sometimes it needs a while.

name: Taha Hostel
description: Great hostel in Shiraz. The hostel is spread across multiple buildings, all within east walking distance of one another. A dorm room was about 5€, privates also available from 8€ (single). Breakfast and limitless tea included. All staff are very friendly and eager to please. Great communal atmosphere. Short walk to bazaar and major sights. Possible to park a camper, van or motorbike in car park immediately outside. Big rigs may struggle with narrow laneways. Strongly recommended!

name: Adventure
description:
First clean your hands at an All Terrain Tire sink by watcčer out of a pump nozzle. Come together around one of the outside Mud Terrain tires tables or relax on suspension spring seats inside by front lights of Landcruiser and Landrover. Don't forget to wash your hands at the lavatory gear box sinks after flushing toilet by jerrycan. Of course there is a Lut desert driving video shown on the obligatory TV.

Great Burgers. Upmarket prices but still affordable.

Enjoy exploring!

name: Sardar Bozorg Cistern
description:
underground water reservoir. Mentioned in Lonley Planet, but has a different name in osm map.

We could not visit it inside because it is open on friday and thursday. Sometimes in between if some special groups made an arrangement.

name: Border to Turkey
description: Large fenced place near to the border. I payed 2€ for one overnight.  Truckparking. Dirty watertub in dirty toilett. Friendly people.

name: Daneshjou Park in the north of Yazd
description: Byside the park, it is a quiet and save place for sightseeing in yazd. With  40 m  hose big rigs get water from toilettehouse.Please note: Wednesday is market there - no parking!

name: Fish kabab
description:
Very good fish Kabab and so kindly ,food price is about 400000 rials ( 3-4$)

He allowed us to Tent camp here also

owner: Mehdi WhatsApp: +989145819073

name: Uphill Shabil village
description:
Flat grassy spot just a bit uphill the Shabil village. Near a busy dirt track, but ok if you don’t mind waving at enthousiastic Iranians. Might be windy. Beautiful view on Mt Sabalan. 

If you want to climb the mountain, you best ride up a very bumpy road until the eastern shelter (3660m) or hire an old 4WD in Shabil (300.000IR for one seat). From there it’s a 3 to 4 hours hike/scramble up.

name: Isfahan Traditional Hotel
description:
Traditional hotel in the city centre next to the bazaar. Nice and quiet rooms, relaxing courtyard, friendly staff and a good breakfast buffet. Free private parking behind a gate which is always locked and a 1 minute walk from the hotel. Plenty of parking space. 

The hotel is located at a small shopping street leading into the bazar but you can reach it with the car. The parking is 50 meters further down the street. 

We paid 3.000.000 rial per night incl breakfast.

name: Ferdows Kooshk
description:
Wonderful hostel in Kashan. Owners Ramin and Narges will spoil you with tea, good conversation and tasty breakfasts. If occupancy permits, they will also gladly join you to show off their adoptive city of Kashan (they are originally from Tehran). Ramin is an architect and the hostel is a labour of love for this young couple. As it was low season, I got a double (15€) for the price of a single (8€), breakfast included.

Bicycles could be brought behind the high fence; motorcyclists, cars and rigs best left in car park nearby. Ask Ramin & Narges if safe to do so.

Highly recommended!

Contact email: ferdows.kooshk@gmail.com

name: Sina Hotel
description: Basic but clean hotel with friendly staff. If you’re lucky the coffeeshop they are building now is finished :-). No wifi available but Irancell is working fine. Big fenced parking behind the hotel (height of gate is over 3.3 m). We paid 1.800.000 rials for a twin including breakfast. Little bit out of the centre (2,5 km from the bazaar).

name: Koohestan cafe
description:
Very nice place to stay! Great view on Mt Damavand. Clean beds and clean shared bathroom. The very friendly owner, Amir, is also a mountaineer and can give you good advice about climbing Mt Damavand. On request he can cook delicious diner (basic 300.000IR, middle 600.000IR and high 900.000IR).
Parking: There is one parking space for bigger car inside the fence. 
Laundry: You can do laundry in the bathroom but no washing machine.

Price: 10€ per night per person (or 1.500.000IR). Including breakfast.

Contact: the place changed recently from the highway to inside the village of Polour. Best call him beforehand +989123189437 or camp.polur@gmail.com. He speaks well English.

name: Municipal hotel
description:
Cheap hotel near the border. 10€/ night for 2 people. It is a little bit dirty and the place is damaged but beds are good. The guys who receive us are nice and they gave us something to eat for dinner. For a hotel near a border it is quite ok! 

Just be aware that you may have to call them because it could be closed.

name: Parking (2,5m height)
description: Indoor parking which is high enough for vehicles up to 2m50. Security during the day, closed off at night. We stored our car here for 4 nights while visiting Tehran and paid 42500 Toeman, +-3€, in total (10 000 toeman a day).

name: mazdagerd, traditional house/ guesthouse
description:
Close to Hamadan city. Very pleasant house with inner garden. Beautiful decorated. Tasteful food. For us a big plus that our dog is welcome too. 
Diner 3$ per person
Night 15$ per person incl breakfast

https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g672716-d16815200-Reviews-Mazdagerd_Guest_House-Hamadan_Hamedan_Province.html

name: Arian Hostel
description:
Brilliant Hostel with amazingly helpful staff. We had an awesome time here. 
Rooms are very clean and breakfast is tasty and rich.
They made us feel like home in Tehran.  We paid 8€ per night per person.

name: At the top of a mountain with a view over valley
description: Beatiful spot at the top of a hill with a great view over the valley. We spent 2 nights here. Quiet at night, just few people passed by during the day. Hidden from the main road, accessible via an easy dirt track for hundreds of meters. It is however exposed to wind so check the weather forcast before. It's fresh here so during hot days it's perfect  !  We stoped here before and after visiting Alamut castle. We found this place the best solution on this road. 4g/3g irancell.

name: A secured public parc
description: A huge parc surrounded by a fence. You need to pay an entrance but very cheap. We asked and they let us stay overnight. A lot of people come here to picnic but they left late in the evening. At night it is quiet. There is a lot of space to park, the difficulty is that there is not a lot of flat areas. But we spent a good night here with a view over the city. Toilets are near.

name: Diesel station
description:
Brand new station.
Driver kindly gave us card.

name: Riverside
description: Close to the road. Not invisible but possible to “crawl away” under the trees. During summertime (August in our case) blissful shade and option to cool the feet in the water. We crossed the river, the water was low enough. At night some noise from the road but to us not an issue. Very few locals so you might have an evening alone.

name: Near Shahrak-e-Qaem
description: Gas Station with free WC and potable cold water. Some shops and a garden with a Mosque. We could camp in our 2P tent in this garden with the permission of the nearby shops owner.

name: Steel and aluminium welding
description: Narrow shop but you will find there a craftsman able to weld any part made of steel or aluminium. Very fast and affordable (not to mention Ta'rofs...).

name: Bushcamp, view on mountain
description:
Lot of trees, lot of options to park smaller and bigger cars, put up tent. You can hear the road but it is out of sight. View on mountains is nice. 
From the road you wil see a tower (looks like castle tower) take the road up. On top of the hil is a big flat area incl trees. 
Nobody around during our stay.

name: Kate Kebab Azimi
description: Very good with high quality Iranian food , The owner name is Ali - so kind man and has discount for travellers because he is a biker too.

name: Ecotour Guiding Service (no office, contact details in picture)
description:
Very nice guide. Make you feel comfortable and knows a lot. Speak good English. Not only for long tours. But also for example a part of the day or specific buildings you want to visit with guide. 

Also provides:
- Trekking or Mountaineering guide tips (Damavand mountain)
- Desert and Sand Dune Camping Adventure
- Off Road Tripp’s across Salt Lakes
- Road trip Service across Iran

name: Esfahan Pet
description: Pet store with quality cat and dog food. Also royal canin for example.

name: Spring
description: Fresh, clear, cool water. Some small shops and souvenirs available too

name: Siena.cafe
description: Very nice place. Very good coffee. Owner told us the coffee beans are straight from France. His aunt sends the beans. Nice little place. Nice music, air conditioning, friendly owner.

name: Irancell SIM Shop
description: There you can find a Irancell SIM Card Shop.

name: Flat area, out of side, great view
description:
Just of the main road take the dirt road up (there is also a dirt road down). Drive up and you have several options. Big flat areas. Even in mid august temperature during the day are pleasant. The evening and night are cold. But that is welcome in this hot season in Iran. Only the 2 cars drove by on their way to their sheeps a bit further. 
Amazing view.

name: Quiete place near ده جلال
description: Small distance to street 47. Very quiet with view from a hill to ده جلال. Nice farmers who bring fruits in the morning.

name: Iranian numberplate in Tabriz
description:
Go here to get your Iranian numberplate in Tabriz if you want to stay longer than 10 days in the country with your vehicle.

Once you found the right person he will guide you through the whole process, make copies of the required documents, join you to the right desks for payment etc. whole process took about 2:30 hours

The want your passport, car papers, carnet, drivers license (didn't ask for my international driver's license), car insurance and 1.250.000 rial

name: Green spot behind a gate
description: Take the dirt road till you see a gate. We had to pay 50.000 toman to enter. At a moment the road splits. We kept left. You will find a big “open” space. Lots of flat areas. When we where here (sunday in August) nobody around. Little bit of trash.

name: Diesel station with card
description: Diesel here. Ask friendly drivers to use their card. Be mindful that there can be no selling of petrol and diesel from 8pm - 8am. This happens a lot in all the petrol stations around Sistan and Baluchistan.

name: Gas station with Diesel card
description:
Very friendly. They have a Diesel card. The last ones on the way from Tabriz didn’t.

Last chance to get Diesel before Ardabil.

name: Modern supermarket
description: Newly built market. When I was there only one floor was ready but second one is in progress. Fresh vegetables and fruit, fresh meat.

name: Caravansary
description: Old caravansary, renovated, but people stop here very seldom obviously. No trash around, just traces of a herd of goats. Quiet, hidden from the road and the air at night is fresh enough to sleep well in the hot season.

name: coffe Diba, water, restrooms
description:
Great coffee in this place with great people!
the coffee is really nice.

Close to this coffee there is a mosque with toilet and water.

name: Military Premises
description: Do not enter! Driving and parking prohibited.

name: Godean Guest house
description:
True hidden gem of a place. Plenty of gated parking space (good up to Sprinter size, enough for 3-4 cars), huge shaded garden with a variety of fruits to stuff your face all day long, WiFi not reaching the rooms, super nice and cozy rooms, amazing hospitable family. Peace and quiet should be the second name of this place. 
30€ for double room, options of staying in the van for aparking fee, external toilets with shower and washing machine. 

This place is a paradise for overlanders. And if you’re coming from India and Pakistan - this is what doctor ordered - relax and unwind in silence. 

You can make booking through Hostelworld (like we did) or reach out to Anna at 00989136991408

name: View over Qazvin
description: Very nice place on a remote pass road. Beautiful view over Qazvin. Very quiet. The road is barely used and the place is very fast and easy to reach. There are many good places on this street.  The position in the map shows one of the first.  If you follow the road, there are other very good ones.

name: Truck Tyre Repair
description: We were there with a flat tyre, got a patch, very good work. Balancing machine available.

name: Tezerj Oasis
description: Oasis with palm trees and typical water distribution system. Passing the waterfall (it's running even in the hot season, great fun for kids!) you see a wide picnic area, trash everywhere unfortunately. But other, nicer camp spots follow when driving on.

name: River camping
description: Driving through this valley you'll see a lot of camp spots alongside the small river. The air at night is fresh enough to sleep well in the hot season.

name: Mountain Pass
description: A beautiful pass road.  It is partly unpaved, but with two-wheel drive and some driving experience feasible.  On the way up as well as on the way down, there are a number of great places to stay.  The most beautiful is probably on top of the summit above the clouds. Perhaps, it gets colder here at night.  This road is breathtaking.

name: Beach
description: Typical iranian campsite with huts, camping and parking space. Filthy toilets and washing facilities. Dirty and littered beach. Lifeguard with whistle, who "prevents" you from going further than 5 m into the water.

name: Air-Con Specialist
description: Experienced mechanic. Shop for spare parts.

name: Riverside
description:
Next to river in valley. Over the bridge, take the dirt road downwards. Then take first left towards the river. It looks like a bit further there is a fish farm. 
Okay spot for one night. Suitable for tents and smaller rigs. As you can see on the picture, we just fit. When we were here nobody was around. But there were some leftovers from bbq’s.

name: Camping in border control area
description:
We had to stay over night in the middle of the border control area on the iranian side. It was not possible to cross the border in the late evening because of the islamic weekend. It was a very interesting experience. Santiary facilities available. 

Infomation for border crossing from Iran to Aserbaidschan: You have to pay for your fuel in your tank. The entry to the border with car is hidden. Near to the kaspian sea you can enter the area.

name: Route via Malakut towards Caspian Sea (or other way around)
description:
We thought this was one of the most surprising passes in Iran. From forest to over 2700 meters. Down, up again through very little villages, very remote villages. Some parts almost felt like Mediterranean environment. Stunning views. One vehicle wide dirt roads. NOT for big rigs. Some parts are narrow (trees or houses). Our Landcruiser was a good fit. 
You might want to take a whole day for the trip from Qazvin to Malakut. On the way we noticed several wild camp options. So you could make it 2 days, not a punishment. 
No fuel stations on the route. 
We drove in summertime. In more wet seasons it might be more difficult terrain.

name: Best sandwiches in town!
description:
We stayed over a week in Mahan to do some work and I can tell you - this is the best food place in town. 
Choose from variety of sandwiches and wash it down with local drinks. No English menu but owner speak a bit. Try bande (mix of local sausages) or hamburg (hamburger meat). 
You’ll get double baguette (one inserted into another) - first one stuffed with meat, second stuffed with veggies and salads. Free sauces. Lots of locals dine here too. Enjoy!
Cost - 100.000 rials per sandwich. Less than 1$! ;)
Look for the shop with big french fries at the door. :)

name: Old abandoned road
description: At this location and old abandoned section of the road goes off from the highway. It's about 8 km long, is winding through the hills and eventually reconnects with the highway a bit further east (yet the access there is blocked). There are several spots along the road. In three days one motorbike came by but didn't bother us. Nice views. Almost no coverage with Irancell.

name: Flat spot out of side. Good view
description: The lake a bit further looks beautiful but not possible to reach (also hard wind). We found this spot. Take the dirt road in the corner. After that take the first dirt road on your right hand. Short steep climb will make you reach a flat peace of land. Good view option to park a bit protected from wind. We had a peaceful night.

name: Karimi Park
description:
A nice place before Tabriz city for rest and tent. 
WC and the roof is ready.
Also the place is safe but close to the highway and a little noisy.

name: Yadeghar Park
description:
nice place in South highway of Tabriz with very good access.
free parking for every kind of motorbike and also big cars.
WC and the roof for tent is available. 
safe place but noisy because beside highway.

name: Peyvand Park
description:
The nice place for camping. so many roofs for tent and WC is available.
This place is safe and has park guard.
small supermarket shop.
This Park is beside of highway and a little noisy but very good and fresh weather spacial in summer because of this area is first of Tabriz mountains.

name: Markar Park parking
description: Huge parking lot in front of the park, perfect for big rigs. Lots of space, medium people traffic, relatively quiet at night, road nearby, toilet at the other side of the park. No shade. Good for a night.

name: Spring
description: Freshwater spring coming out of the mountains. Locals fill up their supplies here.

name: Kalhor Cafe - hidden gem restaurant
description:
Forget all the other overpriced tourist traps restaurants around. This is the coolest cafe/restaurant on the main stretch in front of the mosque. 
Hidden in a small alley, it’s very cosy, with outside seating, shaded area, fountain, singing bird and awesome owner. 
Good prices, food as always in Iran amazing, choice of western coffees and a must try - rose water ice cream. 
Relax, unwind and cool down in this awesome place.

name: Oak Hostel
description:
Very clean and comfortable Hostel 100 Meters from Basar. 
Cheapest room is 6 euro.
Honestly it is the best Hostel in Iran and Turkey together so far. Nice atmosphere, safe place for motorcycle. Pets are allowed. Even the water is potable. The owners can order food and special drinks

name: petrol
description:
petrol station with WC 
good and accessible location

name: Copy shop
description: Nice Copyshop. You can send documents to him via Telegram. One copy costs 10.000 Rial

name: Tabas
description:
Good hotel for the night or rest. Big room with facilities for 1,600,000Rial. Friendly management but no English. Couldnt see an English name for hotel. 
Ducted a/c. Midday checkout. 
Restaurant shops and fast food within easy walk.

name: petrol station
description: Petrol station on the way to South and Kandovan village.

name: Cheshm Andaz Park
description:
Good and accessible place on the way to Tehran, Turkey border and South of Iran.
Place for parking vehicle and making tent .
WC and water available.
BUT noisy place beside of main road but safe.
near to some supermarket shops.

name: PARK
description:
before Tabriz city and near to airport there is the Park with running water,WC, and the place for Parking for vehicle also for making tent.
a little noisy near main road. 
some shops for eating

name: Motor Bike Fixer
description:
The good proffesional motorbike fixer named Ali.
Don't hesitate for visit him for solve your motorbike problems.

name: Restaurant Moslem
description: Great place for Persian food while visiting the grand bazar. Local people, some waiters speak some English. Cheap, and fast service. Huuuge portions (can feed 2). 2nd floor. Decent toilet in 3rd floor.

name: Sedaqat Hostel
description: Little hotel in the center of Rasht, very good location. Small room for two persons 550.000 rials, biggest one with A/C 870.000 rials. Shared bathroom (clean and hot shower 180.000 rials). No breakfast but a lot of things to eat in the neighborhood.

name: Diesel
description: They have a card  We could not get more than 50 liter. Price per liter 600 toman.

name: Diesel. No card
description: Borrow card from truck drivers. Paid 600 per liter

name: Shams Park
description:
the big and green with good facilities.
inside of city you can camp and also you can park your motorbike or camper inside of Parke near your camp place. WC and the supermarket shop are available.
a lots of lights of Park are shining.
very calm and a little far from main Street and good place for enjoy from the good sleep. 
many Street dogs are living here but all of them are calm and not dangerous.
so sleep and enjoy.

name: Park
description:
drinkable water and WC at the small mosque are available
but not sure for camping

name: Irancell
description: Official Irancell if you need sim or add data

name: Diesel pump
description:
They dont have card but are friendly and truck drivers helped out. We got it twice here (few days apart). Paid 600 and 1000 per litre.
No Diesel available.

name: Shaded campsite with fresh water
description:
This is the place if you’re looking for some cooler temperatures. It’s higher than the main road, at 2250m rather cold at night 20-24*C, even in summertime. 

Surrounded by private gardens, this is a public spot with a source of fresh water. Cool shade during day time. Some people come to collect the water, and they are super friendly. Throughout the two days we’ve got a full stock of vegetables and fruits. Classic Iranian way, gotta love them!

Good for longer stop if you wish to relax and don’t mind a few friendly souls wandering around. 
For 3G you need to walk back to the main road, only good for checking emails though (see the photo with X mark on the road :D)

name: Bahestan castle
description: Along River. At the foot of Bahestan castle. Can buy fish nearby.

name: ganjhnameh
description:
Wild place about 1km from the reliefs and the parking of the recreation/ski resort, away from the crowd. Au plaisir

Long sleeve a mountain river. with mountain view.

name: Na'in
description: propane refill station in sububs of Na'in

name: Next to children playground
description: A bit noisy in the evening because of children at play but quiet for the rest  of the night. The location was advised by policemen.

name: North road to Mashhad
description: diesel. They have cards. We paid 600 tomans/liter the regular tourist price. Friendly staff.

name: Best dizi in town - Azari Traditional Restaurant
description:
If you’re fan of dizi, or how they call it in Azerbaijan - Piti, this is the place to be. Best dizi in town. Seriously addictive 2-in-1 dish that will leave you craving for more. 
Good prices, super fast service, traditional Azeri vibe, shisha available. Happy days!

name: Petrol Station
description:
Petrol, Gas Station
WC and supermarket shops and something to eat and drink and also drinkable water are available.

name: Zahman Restaurant
description: Good address in Marivan, restaurant full in the evening. You'll find a lot of kebabs with rice and other traditional dishes. Good and cheap food, we paid 500.000 rials for two persons (several meals and drinks)

name: Newroz Hotel
description: Big hotel 2 kilometers from the city center. Double bedroom, clean, hot shower, fridge and A/C in the room, little balcony. 1.950.000 rials the room for two persons, breakfast included (egg, tomatoes, cucumbers, cheese, jam, tea). Parking inside.

name: Hotel and parking Safir
description: Decent and central hotel. Picked this as it has free secured underground parking nearby with at least 2.8 meter height clearance and near exchange offices and bazar. Rooms are about $25.

name: Morateb khodro mechanic
description: These guys helped us out very well and quick. They have multiple specialties available. Just make a call to this number, they don’t speak English but there’s almost always a son/daughter there who can translate: 0413_6373499 and 0413_6373498

name: Akbar Hotel
description: Basic 2 star Overnighter with faculties. Clean. Fridge in room. Secure bike parking. Restaurant on site. Friendly helpful staff

name: Khorram Hostel
description:
Great former family house near the city center. Clean, nice owner. one Night costs about 8 dollars in dorm, 12 in private room.
Breakfast in the morning. 
safe place for cars and motorcycles.

name: Azadi Hostel
description:
Very basic room and bed only. No shower or fan. But clean enough and good location. 
Ample secure parking for big vehicles. 
Only 400R

name: Lost Paradise
description:
Large flat space with some trees. Close to the road to Lost Paradise, but no traffic at night. You can choose a place a little out of sight to avoid too much curious Iranians. We stayed the night on Sunday and were not bothered. I would avoid Thursdays or Fridays as it would be more crowded.

Lost Paradise is a small natural reserve which is a paradise in Iranian standards. Meaning, there are a lot of nice picnic spots under a roof of old plane trees with water flowing nicely down from place to place. There is even motorcycle service to bring your picnic stuff 500m up from the parking lot to the waterfall.

name: Zarin Desert
description: Sand dunes 15km from the highway between Yazd and Tabas. Take the exit for Moghestan village (small oasis with mud brick houses and palm trees), pass through the village and take the dirt road to the dunes. Depending on your car you can go all the way into the dunes. The first part of the dirt track is doable with 2WD.

name: Sadoon Exchange
description:
Cash exchange. For $100USD - $1.4M Rial. Really easy. Slight negotiation.

*Been denied change many times. Had a note from "friendly guesthouse". No problems.

name: radiator hoses/rubber parts
description: radiator hoses in every size and length, also has original radiator hoses and lots of different rubber parts/sheets etc

name: leafspring workshop
description: The Name of the shop is Iran spring. They sell a large variaty of new leaf springs and there are several work shops in the backyard for repairs. They can do all different work, mainly focus on heavy trucks. Got Springs and work on chassis done and were very happy with the result. They went to the city with us to get parts and translate, which was really helpful.  As work was not finished in one day we were invited to their home to eat and sleep there. In the end we got other things repaired and stayed three nights with the family also during ramadan festivities. They did not allow us to go to a Hotel - so be sure to bring a small gift if you plan on repairing bigger things, as they will invite you and you have no chance to say no :) Ask for Petram, he speeks English and will help you with everything, not only springs.

name: Rolling hills
description: very nice Place to stay going to mesr or coming from there! many places to camp, this exact spot has a magnificent view over the valley towards east. windy and nice and cool! ground is very rocky, so maybe not the best option for tents. H+ irancell internet

name: green spot next to red mountains
description:
Pretty nice place to camp, next to beautiful red mountains with cool sandstone formations on top. close to road between Mesr and Jandaq (which used to be gravel/sand but they are working on a new road here. Actually it already is in way better condition than the other road to mesr). you can hear the road but not too much traffic, and if it bothers you it's possible to go further away, plenty of space to camp, just without the bushes. 
Kind of sheltered in between bushes and Sandy ground so good option for tents too! Lots of Insects if its not windy though..
4g irancell
4x4 not needed, some ground clearance will help 

beware of the hyalomma tick which is present almost everywhere in central Iran. bloody big and as fast as ants, actively sprinting towards it's potential host. found one here as well..

name: car wash - rip off
description:
we didnt ask for price beforehand since we got told you pay less than 150.000 Rial for a car wash anywhere in Iran. Usually we pay a bit more and give 2-300 for a  very dirty landcruiser. 
here the guy in the office asked for 800.000 after the car wash! We denied and they got angry, finally got to 500, payed and left. then the two guys cleaning the car asked us to also pay them some money, not only to the office. really unfriendly and annoying! don't go there.

name: Diesel
description: Diesel for 600 Toman, they have their own diesel card you can use

name: Bazargan border crossing
description:
Bazargan border crossing - Iran side.

When exiting from Iran to Turkey - they will charge you for any fuel that you have in your fuel tank!
Going price is 7200 Rial per 1 liter. Everyone pays it equally - locals and foreigners. Here’s the process:

Before getting exit stamp on your Carnet you need to pay for fuel and get a paper confirmation. They call this process PETROL. 
Start from the far right. When approaching the customs terminal, there will be a road barrier on the right. Park there, walk on foot under the barrier and climb into second office on the right. Bring a copy of your CDP with you, they need it here. If you don’t have one - go to the shop with cigarettes, they make it there for 1000Tomans. 
In this petrol office they will ask you how much petrol do you have. Say as little as possible. I said 40L, although I had a full 80L tank. THEY DO NOT CHECK THE CAR TANK. They just take your number. In their system they will check how big petrol tank is in your car. So play smart. I had no dial left so I negotiated down to 30L, and they say they cannot put less than 30L on the invoice. So even coming with empty tank won’t help you - they will still charge you for 30L minimum. You can pay only by a local card. There’s always someone to help you with that, that person seems to be with the customs. They will take $ or € equivalent in cash from you. I paid 34$ (mix of $ and €), I think about 3.5mil. I saw other receipts and it varied between 4.5 - 9 mil rial. So it seems it’s a legit process. 
Once you have the petrol invoice - go the the far left entrance in the terminal. This is Departure. Go as far as you can and show them Carnet and Petrol invoice. Then normal process starts. They’ll check your car, stamp CDP, you go through Passport control, go back to the car and drive through the barrier to the other side. Turkish side everything was quite easy, except 1h extra for full machine X-Ray of our van. Apparently lots of vans smuggle drugs from Iran, so expect lots of police and military stops on Turkey side asking for cigarettes or drugs. 

All the process on Iran side took 3h, and maybe 2h on Turkish side. 

No one will speak English to you, forcing you to use the touts. As usual customs folks just get a kickback. Just stand your ground. If in doubt - look for uniform officer and ask for help, they seemed most helpful. 

Be wary of the touts. They swarmed me like flies. They speak good English and promise to help you. They surely will, I don’t know what’s the price. If you wish to avoid the hassle - pay whatever they ask, and they’ll do it for you. But I always avoid the whole scam process and do it myself.

name: Clutch Service
description:
Great clutch service in Tabriz. They saved our clutch, although it was completely burned. They even used a CNC machine to replace some parts. They speak also some English and are very friendly. 
You can put this to your GPS: صنایع کلاچ صدیقیان
You can call Bijan: +98 912 833 4681

name: Parking in park with toilets and playground
description: Very big parking inside the park. We asked the guardian if we could stay overnight with our truck. It was no problem. Our children loved the playground with trampolines and inflatable bouncer. Not the nicest part of the park but good for a night. We first tried to enter through the main entrance (also on iOverlander) but the guardian told us to go to this parking.

name: Gorgeous River Bed
description: The GPS coordinates are the start of the "road" just continue until you got through the "gate" (2 piles of rocks). Camp anywhere you like, or if it's dry, you can cross and go as far as you like. Beautiful spot. Still light sound from traffic. 4G still at river. Pic 1 shows the rock to indicate the start of the road. Small city 10km away. Fairly cool for the area. Oh...and no trash ;)

name: Irani Hotel
description:
We stayed in this hotel.
The room is big enough for Lot of Bagage. 
We could bring our bicycles Info the hotel.
We payed 1.100.000 rial for the room for one night.
The room and the bathroom are not new,  but clean.

name: Silk Road Hotel
description:
Nice inner courtyard with a fountain. Traditional Iranian dishes from 100.000 to 500.000 rials and buffet for 600.000 per persons (choice of salads, 2 types of rice and 3 different meals, fruits , ice cream and biscuits, 5 sort of teas, coffee). Good location, near Jameh Mosque.
I don't know about the hotel, we went there just for the restaurant.

name: Iveco service & repairs
description:
Original Iveco garage, very professional and efficient service. They have computer program for the diagnostic to our Iveco Daily. The owner knows very well his job, we also slept in his garage. Price in the medium average.
mobile number: +98 915 116 3516, Mr. Hooshmand.

name: Restaurant Hajj Hassan
description:
In the 3rd floor, big salat buffet, freshly baked bread, yummy shashlik, many different fish dishes. All fresh and very tasty!
Basic English only.
Portions are big, ideal to share. 
Open daily from 12-16 and 19-23.
A lot of business men come here for lunch. Fast service. Prices from cheap to expensive :-)

name: Julfa Hotel
description:
An hotel in the middle of the very lively and nice Armenian quarter. Many restaurants and shops around. The river and bridges are in walking distance. Main attractions can be reached by foot in 40 minutes. 

Parking is possible in front of the entrance on their premises, behind a barrier.

Rooms are decent: good and clean bed it only seems the laminate flooring isn’t always vacuumed. But with a price of 2,5mln per night for a double room and private bathroom including breakfast, we found it acceptable to walk on flip flops in the room. 

The hotel also has a nice coffee shop with good cakes.

name: Hotel Hatam
description:
The rooms are okay. Wifi is ok too. Shared bathrooms. Room for 1 person cost 800.000 Rial per night.
An underground car park is just across the street. 1 motorcycle cost 10.000 Rial per night. It’s too low for camper vans though.

name: 3rd party car insurance
description: In the office space on the 2nd floor (street side) there’s the option to arrange a 3rd party liability insurance for your car. We paid 3.2mln Rial for 180mln Rial coverage during 1 month. Moshen helped us setting up the insurance which was really valuable. Should you need assistance, do not hesitate to contact Moslem at +98 9155851517.

name: Aylinmotel
description: Small Hotel. Clean rooms. It cost 2.000000 Rial one night with breakfast. Shower and toilets are on the floor. Motorbikes can park in front. Cars on the street. You have to pass a small street to come to the entry.

name: Delicious Dizi Sara Restaurant
description:
Serving «Abgoosht». Totally traditional.
Only one menu, but absolutely totally incredibly yummy. Only open at lunchtime, closed in the evening. Get seated, wait for the food and enjoy (especially the sweets for tea!)
BTW: the door is not very well marked, but it is light blue and there are blue chairs outside.

name: Salt Lake Mine
description:
Beautiful, out of this world place in the salt lake. From the entry gate follow one of the big tracks. No 4x4 needed. Some big trucks also drive here. I wouldn't enter when it has rained. We were advised not to go further east because the track gets bad. Also don't go off the track, you never know where you will find a soft/wet spot.
The man at the gate asked 200.000 rial to enter. Probably not official but we didn't care.

name: Mehrab Park
description: Park near the city center and the bazaar. Trees, toilet. Different place for parking.

name: Roadside
description: Nice spot not far from the street but very quiet. No one drove through the street while we were there. Good view for the sunset as well.

name: cafe type
description: very very nice cafe, modern stile, with good selection in the menu for food, coffe and so. nice atmosphere and good music. wifi . a bit pricy but it worth

name: Kharanaq next to dry riverbed
description:
Small spot at the end of the track behind the old Kharanaq town/ruins.

Follow the track behind the old town. At the junction keep right. The track ends at the dry riverbed. There is place for two or three vehicles. No 4x4 needed in dry conditions. You can also drive into the riverbed but this would require 4x4 and high clearance. Quiet place, remote noise from the road. You are visible from the road but the road is far away.

name: CNG Station
description: Really big fueling station with a lot of buses / euro 4.  Paid 3 times real price but easygoing.

name: Jungle Park
description: Park with entry, guard, place for tent, big van, toilet, water, place for fire, picnic, trees, playground, little shop, restaurant.

name: Stadtpark
description:
Nice place at the city park. 
Trees provide shade. Seats and garbage bin.

name: Oasis valley
description:
Beautifull little plateau between the track and the rocks. At night the jackals come out with their cries. We could see them circling our little camp. The next morning we saw the traces of the jackals entering the camp so don't leave any food or waste outside.

Take the track along Boneh Cafe and at the junction take the most right option of the three. The entry to the plateau is a little bit challenging. We did it with a Mercedes Vario 814 2x4, a VW LT28 2x4 and a VW T3 4x4 without too much problems.
Don't go here when it's wet or raining.

name: diesel with card
description:
fuel station with card reader. 1 Liter/600
Diese Tankstelle hat die Dieselkarte. Der Liter für 600.

name: Water tap
description: A water tap close to Teeda Hotel. Good to fill up before you enter the sand dunes.

name: Diesel
description: We got diesel here. The staff do not have a diesel card and were not very helpful. Two truck drivers were very friendly and helpful. They found a driver that could help me fill up. Paid 200.000 rial for 73 liters. Life doesn't get any better (at least concerning diesel).

name: Near Road
description:
Nice flat pitch away from the road. Almost not visible from the road. Access to the slopes.
A lot of possibilities. Quiet.

name: Carnet de Passage
description:
The border itself is pretty chaotic, but everyone is helpful. Just smile and be patient.

1. Passing the gate, go to the first building on the left, get a white paper without paying anything.

2. Go to the first building on the right, through a closed door (knocking, blue key hangs on top right of the door). Pay for your tank filling (benzin and diesel, depending on your car). Euro, Rial and Dollars accepted. We payed 30 Dollars for 70 liters. Get a green paper.

3. Come here to get your Carnet stamped. Ground floor, right side at the end of the room. They want to check the chassee number, be sure to know where it is in your car! No need to pay anything, even if they are trying.

4. Drive to the gate. Hand in the white and the green paper, the stamped carnet (they rip off the exit part here) and your passports. 1min-car control, than you can drive throgh the first gate. 

5. Go to the first window and wait. Not sure what he is doing there.

6. Go to the second window, police. Get your visa stamped and you are done!

name: Diesel euro 5
description: Here we got diesel euro 5 with the card from the petrol station , we paied 850 per liter instead of 600.

name: Irancell office
description: Little bit hidden, looks like a post office, but you can buy a SIM card here. Some people even speak English. Paid approx 550 000 rial for s card and 10gb

name: Aluminium welder
description: Here we did our custom made spare diesel tank. They did it in 24 hours. Good work and very smart guy. We payed 150 euro for 200 liters capacity tank. No English spoken, only Farsi.

name: Burning water
description:
Drinking water. Hold a lighter on the top and enjoy the fire :-)
It's called Yanar Bulag.
Lot of locals fill their tanks here.

name: Farmer's Kitchen
description:
Delicious, fresh and organic food.
Not the cheapest choice but worth it, main dish around 10-20Manat.
Comfortable atmosphere, good music, super good lemonades, attentive service and home made schnaps.
Very recommendable!
View to the Baku Flame Towers with nice lights at night.

name: in the river bend, behind a rock.  totally quiet at night.  Nice view over the valley and the river.
description: In the river bend, behind a rock.  totally quiet at night.  Nice view over the valley and the river.  This is a dead end, thus no passages, but different deposits of building rubble and excavated earth. No FM radio, GSM reception sometimes H+.  Here it is good for a night and much quieter than in the city!

name: Temporary number plates
description: Here you can get the temporary number plates. We came too late in the afternoon (2pm thursday) so they told us to come Saturday. But it should be possible here

name: Diesel Card
description:
You can get Diesel here, they use cards.

---

Hier bekommt man diesel. die haben eine karte

name: Schatten am späteren Nachmittag
description:
A place in the shade in the late afternoon with a great view of the dunes. Absolutely awesome. Approach via some sandy passages.
---
Ein Platz im Schatten am späteren Nachmittag mit tollem Blick auf die Dünen. Absolut genial. Anfahrt über einige Sandige passagen.

name: Schattenplatz
description:
I arrived at 13:15 and already had shadow, on October 23rd.
In front of me, the width of the Lut. Dreamlike.

---

Ich bin um 13:15 angekommen und hatte schon Schatten. 23. Okt.
Vor mir die Weite der Lut. Traumhaft

name: Sarv
description:
Opened just 3 weeks before i stayed there. 
Very nice and friendly staff. Hostel is operated by the same staff of the Mahbibi just a few meters away. 
Parking inside possible, height is approx 2,5m now.
Fantastic breakfast, nice interieur, clean rooms (Double + Dorms)
Just a few minutes walkway from city center. 
Payed 25€ Double/Night

name: 300 meters away from the road well hidden
description:
The place is good for one night. The street is almost impossible to hear. Something hidden.

Der Platz ist gut für eine Nacht. Die Strasse fast nicht zu höhren. Etwas versteckt.

name: On the road Kerman - Sirjand
description:
A small track leads to a little "valley" so you are hidden from the road. Little
noise from the road. Nothing special but perfect when you are in need for a place before darkness.

name: Esfahan Gasfillig bottles
description: Esfahan Gasfillig bottles, but you have to bring your adapter with you!

name: Iran Motor Service
description:
Workshop specialising in KTM, Suzuki and Kawasaki. Lead mechanic has numerous certificates and photos on the wall with the above brands. Very knowledgable and professional workshop space. Good parts availability and uses MOTUL oil.
No English but uses google translate.
Full service cost me 3,500,000 excluding oil and parts.

name: Veterinary near Nashvan park
description: English speaking young veterinary doctor with all services you need for pets.

name: small park, ban on big trucks
description: Pitches on the outskirts, in the center it is very difficult to find a place, driving ban for trucks.  Here is a small park, hardly any visitors.  Very noisy during the day, at night it works.  Many trucks parked, but no parties at night.

name: Chupanan Petrol Station
description: We got diesel for 300 rial. Officially no card but there is a card available in the garage behind the station. First it was a “ no” but after a sad face the guy helped us and took the card of the garage.

name: Fuel station with card
description: Fuel station with card, very friendly and helpful

name: Vaaay Sibzamini
description:
Best sandwich-bar in Mashhad.
Try also the French fries.

name: Mechanic/welder
description: Small basic garage. it was recommended to me by my local host. The mechanic however knows his job very well and was able to help me with suspension/shocks problem

name: Filband viewpoint
description: Beautiful view of valleys on both sides. With a lifted 4wd you can drive little bit further and possibly camp on a flat spot by the viewpoint. On the way to Filband village there are some beautiful meadows for picnic popular by locals

name: Diesel Station
description:
It was no Problem to get Diesel here.
240 l  600 Toman/liter.

name: Beautiful meadow in the mountains
description: It’s a popular picnic spot amin locals, but empty at night. One side is steep, but other side is quite flat. On the way to Filband village /viewpoint.

name: Parking for 10 to. Camper in the old town
description: if you don't find the silk road parking with a big rig of 10 to. and 3,6 m high, then come here!

name: Volkswagen service
description: This service takes care of Tehran Police vans - mostly LT45. They had some spare parts for our T4 as well. Parts are expensive (but apparently original), but iťs maybe the only place in Tehran/Iran where you can find spare parts for VW.

name: Howzak Boutique Hostel
description:
Howzak Boutique hostel is located in old isfahan neighbourhood. you can park your car near hostel. There is big space available next to the place which you can use to park your vehicle. If you are coming with motorcycle they can arrange parking place for you somewhere near which is safe. The hostel itself has 5 rooms which are traditionally decorated. They also offer local food that you can order beforehand. Ourstay was fantastic. we could park our car near the place. 
About the location, there are tons of attractions nearby Famous Jame mosque is steps away. From there you can walk inside corridors of Isfahan bazaar which is similar to tradiotional bazaar of Iran in other cities like Tehran Bazaar. By 20 Mins walking you can enter Naghshe Jahan Sq. from Qeysariyeh Gate. All in all this place is highly recommended because of its service, location and super friendly staff.

name: Parking Space
description: Parking place suitable for cars and vans

name: Coffee Shop
description: Real Coffee, Yapur, the owner is so kind, minishop and eat is possible too, the place is just next to the petrol station if you are going to Teheran.

name: Aras Nomad Tourist Camp
description: Great restaurant and friendly owner. You can stay in their car park, enjoy food in big tents. They also have a shower you can use. Close to St Stepanos monastery and town of Jolfa. Perfect !

name: Diesel
description:
We have got 100 L for 600 T/L.
it seems to be, that they have problems to give more.

name: Shiraz!
description:
one of the best Petshops in Shiraz!
good quality and prices, for example dry food for dogs 13 $ for 10 kg!

name: Level area, off the road
description:
Level area, off the road, nothing special, but a quiet place in the middle of nature for one night. 
After rain, it may be some slippery, but can be made with a two-wheel drive!
Cellphone coverage between nothing and H+ fluctuating.

name: laundry
description: good laundry in city center in a side street between several weapon stores

name: SIM card shop MTN
description: SIM card shop. We were helped finding this place by a friendly local who is also a tour guide. His name is Mazdak and his number is +98 911 139 0918, moonmazdak1977 on Instagram. He knows many great places and although we had little time so couldn’t do a tour with him, we would def recommend to call him if you want a tour in Rasht or need help. He speaks English very well.

name: Secured parking place in city center
description:
We stayed here for 1 night. It’s just a park spot with a fence, nothing fancy but ok for a night and perfect to explore the city from here! The security guy was not sure it was ok to sleep there, but a friendly local helped us and then it was allowed, we could also use the (basic) toilet. We payed 100.000 rial for a night.

The local who helped us is called Mazdak, and is an official tour guide in Rasht. We would def recommend him if you need a tour or help: +98 911 139 0918. We had a tea with him and he helped us finding a SIM card shop (see other check in place).

A nice Breakfast spot in the neighbourhood is called Kenareh. Just walk outside and turn right on the big street. After a few 100 meters you see a sign ‘Kenareh guesthouse’. Turn right in the little street and the Breakfast restaurant is under the guesthouse

name: Rest area
description: Easy acces to water tabs at the Rest area. Good quality

name: Diesel
description: we got 75 L Diesel from truckers and good drinkingwater here!

name: Level area, off the road, quiet.
description:
Level area, off the road, nothing special, but a quiet place in the middle of nature for one night. 
Upstairs in the Krete you have a wonderful view of the whole valley, but you also hear the noise from the valley. 
If it has rained, it may be some slippery, if it is dry - it can be made with a two-wheel drive! 
Cellphone cover between nothing and H + fluctuating.

name: Fuel station
description: We got very easy diesel with card from the station. Also extra for our jerrycans. Perfect!

name: Schatten in den Kalut
description:
Great place, parking in shade in the evening and morning. Only access with 4x4. Space for more than one vehicle

Ein toller Platz der je nach Standplatz Schatten am Abend oder am Morgen bietet. Beidseitig hohe steile Wand.
Zugang nur mit 4x4!
Traumplatz und flach. Platz für mehr als ein Fahrzeug.

name: Bahar Hotel
description:
Two star apartment hotel with 1 or 2 bedrooms, kitchen and living room.

Price: 
2,6mio rial (21€) one bedroom (2 adults).
3,7mio rial (30€) two bedrooms (4 adults).
Breakfast included.

It’s okay for the price.

Located in the city center.

name: BB Hostel
description: Perfect hostel. Clean, nice and good beds. Good breakfast. €18 for double room. Parking motorbike safe behind gate. Very friendly English speaking host; Marjahn.

name: Volkswagen T4 garage
description:
This service specializes on T4. They were able to fix our car and even get the spares (rear cv joint boots) for a good price - for changing springs and boots we paid 34$ including the parts. 
Tea and sweets included :)

name: Exchange office
description:
At least 5 exchange offices side by side.
Also changers in the street.

name: Tecno mobile - Phone paradise
description: 6 floors of new and used phones, spare parts, accessories and repair shops for phones.

name: Iraninsurance - new location
description: This is the new location for Iraninsurance Co. I paid 5.000.000 IRR for 2 months for 12t truck.

name: Euro 5 Diesel Station
description:
Euro 5 Diesel available

There are lots of trucks. We waited for one driver and didn’t need a card. 

Price 3000rial / Liter (0,03€ / liter) 

We paid nothing for 25 liter.

name: Lovely place on the River Zarrine
description: Nice Place on the river. Near the street but very quiet. No other people around

name: Peri Ecolodge
description:
The lodge is 3km to the Tahkt-I soleiman Tempel. It is styled typical oriental with Perser carpets and colored windows. In the big dining/kitchen room you can have wonderful evenings. 
One bedroom with separate beds is available and one living room with also can be used for sleeping on the ground. 
Toilet and bathroom are available outside. 
Rooms can be warmed.
No WiFi available, Irancall don’t work. 
Typical Iranian dinner was served after extra booking. 
Price 30€ including Breakfast and Dinner.

name: Safe parking in the yard
description:
Safe parking in the yard of tour guide Ali. Toilet and hot shower, possible to arrange laundry and breakfast/dinner. Also possible to stay in his house. Safe neighbourhood, height limit 2,20m
Price 5$ per car. 
It’s a great place if you want to experience traditional Iranian lifestyle, Ali also helped us with everything we needed (shopping etc.). 

Better to contact Ali prior to your arrival on WhatsApp: +98 913 815 7429

name: Miremad Hotel
description: Excellent Hotel. clean warm location is just perfect. Very Secure, locked bike parking. 1.8 M Rial for one room two pax. Breakfast inc. 100 k Rial for bike

name: Hotel Iran
description:
Clean rooms with AC. Some of the staff speaks english.
Safe parking for cars and bikes inside.
I paid 100.000 toman for one night in a double room.

name: Great Falafel Bistro
description: Huuuge and delicious falafel sandwich as long as your arm. Just for 6000Tomans

name: Beach
description:
Flat, hard gravel place right on the beach. all the other places around this town have been crowded already on Thursday afternoon, so we found this one!
Good for a night, kilometres of gravel beach, a lot of place south of this point!

name: Motorcycle Repairs
description: Ali is professional in motorcycles repairing,  especially in cross and trail motorbikes.

name: Strand von Stausee
description:
Nice pebble beach at the reservoir. Some fishermen come by car. Very quiet. Some dogs, however, are peaceful


Netter Kiesstrand am Stausee. Einige Fischer kommen mit dem Auto. Sehr ruhig.
Einige Hunde die jedoch friedlich sind.

name: Soro Beach Park
description: Soro Beach Park. Lively park, especially from Thursday to Saturday and holidays. We were easily here for 3 days and 4 nights. Toilets available, but cant say anything, because we did not use them.

name: Diesel with DieselCard
description: We got 100 Liters here but they was ready to give us (much) more

name: Overnight Camping behind Gasoline Station
description:
Camping behind gas station on a clean rest area with a hard surface, so no dust. Because enough away from thoroughfare, relatively quiet.
Toilets available, but we did not check them because not used.

name: Overnight stay behind Gas station
description:
Overnight stay behind gas station on a clean rest area with a hard surface, so no dust. Because enough away from thoroughfare, relatively quiet.
Toilets available, but we did not check them because not used. IranCell 4G.

name: Diesel
description: Diesel, no Card but helpful staff. They organised a truck driver which gave us 100 Liter of Diesel

name: Refah Supermarket
description:
Good quality supermarket. You find all you need (probably). Cheese (Edam and Gouda) and wonderful fruit yoghurt. Some fruits and vegetables.
Good accessible / parking for Big Rig.

name: Water Tap with good pressure
description: In the Park / at the mosque of the cemetry several Water Taps. We dont know if drinkable or not but with a good filter system should be ok.

name: Entrance into one part of the Kaluts
description: Here easy access to oner part of the Kaluts, also for 4x2 cars

name: Wild Camping in the Kaluts
description: Relatively level place in the Kaluts with view into three Kalut valleys. Beautiful sky line for astrophotography and time laps. We stayed two nights here. No internet reception - luckily.

name: Wild Camping "The Window" in the Kaluts
description: Relatively flat place in the Kaluts. Slightly elevated, so view across the Kaluts west and through a "window" to the east. The track continues, but did not explore it. 4x4 recommended.

name: Overnight Parking on Hospital Grounds
description:
The police guardian allowed us to stand in the guarded parking lot for one night.
The night was relatively calm here-

name: Diesel with Diesel Card
description: It was easy to fill up 100 Liters here. Helpful staff.

name: Refah Quality Supermarket
description: Refah supermarkets have a full and reasonably good range. Usually also some fruits and vegetables. Meat. Often also cheese and fine fruit yoghurt.

name: Water Tap to refill tank
description: The guard allowed us to drive behind the entrance gate and refuel there the water tank at a tap.

name: Parking behind 5* Hotel Parsian
description: We were allowed to stay for free in the parking lot of the hotel Parsian for one night. If you want to stand here, you have to ask at the reception. If not allowed, below the hotel is a park where you can stand overnight.

name: Guarded Parking near Daniels Grave
description: We were brought here by people from the Susa  Historical Site. Guarded parking lot at Daniels grave. In the middle of the old town. Suitable for big rigs up to 8m in length. Attention, low-hanging power cable.

name: Overnight place in a small valley
description: We stood here for one night. You reach it by a small dirt road. The place is located about 600m away from the road. Very quiet. In the morning, two shepherds came by with their herds. Everything was very peaceful.

name: City works Kermanshah
description: We were allowed to empty our gray and black water tanks here but you must ask the workers.

name: Refah Quality Supermarket
description:
The refah supermarket has (maybe) everything you need. In particular, cheese and fruit yoghurt. Fruits and vegetables.
Parking also for Big Rig! From here it is not far to IranCell.

name: IranCell Service Center
description: They speak english and we had a good and fast service at IranCell

name: IranCell
description: They speak english and we had a professional and fast service at IranCell

name: Big Rig Parking for Truck Camper
description:
The employees of the bus terminal allowed us to park here during the city sightseeing.
Maybe they would also allow an overnight stay. The reason was the joy of our truck expedition mobile.

name: Diesel with Diesel Card
description: Here we were able to fill our tank completely (165 liters).

name: Water Tap of drinking Water
description: After we were able to fill our diesel tank completely, we were also allowed to fill our water tanks.

name: Visa Extension
description: We extended our Visa in Hamedan today (Swiss passport). The original visa was for 11 days and they extended the visa by 30 days. They asked a few questions and needed one passport copy and one photo (any size, women without headscarves was fine). 500.000 per person per extension and 100.000 for copies. The officers were very friendly. After 1.5 hours, we got the extended visa. Definitely a good place to extend the visa!

name: Park in Bijar
description: We spent one night in the park of the provincial town Bijar. Basically pleasant. People friendly. But in the evening we were checked three times by different police, one of them by the secret police. In the late evening many mopeds of young people. The place is a bit off the main road, so relatuq quiet in the night.

name: Khani Brazan bird sanctuary
description:
Wonderful, remote bird sanctuary with various ponds and canals. We have seen pelicans, bee-eaters and other birds. The ponds are full of life. You can camp in the parking lot of the visitor center or in front of it. Absolutely worth a visit, if you like birds. 
Nobody speaks English. Communication very difficult. We wanted to film birds here and take pictures and stand for a few days. But the supervisory officer was so complicated, guest-friendly, and worried that we were not allowed to take a step without him. That's why we drove on the next day.
Access via the village Khowreh. Pass through the village and then ask for directions. They say, that there were Wolf's in the area.

name: Turkmall / Refah Supermarket Big Rig Parking
description: Large vehicle parking for Turk Mall and Refah Quality Supermarket, where you will (probably) get everything you need.

name: Overnight stay near the bridge
description:
Iranians recommended us this place because he is not completely lonely. Sufficiently quiet at night.
This year, due to good rains, the lake was over a meter more water than normal.

name: Shallowest place in El Golie Park.
description: We camped for four days / five nights at El Golie Park. IranCell 4G. Pleasant park, but also very busy. By taxi to the city center from about Rial 150'000. Tabriz is a well-kept city and we liked it right away. Deb Bazar must have seen from our point of view, the Blue Mosque not necessarily. In Tabriz we bought a SIM card from IranCell and a car insurance company at IranInsurance.

name: Overnight stay at the Park in Khoy
description: Coming from Kapikoy, Turkey, we spent our first night in Iran here. The only flat place, not directly on the street. Directly opposite the police headquarters. We asked the police if we were allowed to stand here and we were allowed to, but were meticulously checked (driver's cab and living room!)

name: IranCell Service Center
description:
At this coordinate one floor down the stairs, after the stairs right through the glassy door. Or at the coordinate around the corner and into the shop and down the stairs.
We got here quite uncomplicated and fast our IranCell SIM card. However, an Iranian escort is an asset as it will then complete the forms written in Farsi.
Note: without registration of the smartphone, the SIM card is only valid for 30 days and will be blocked afterwards. We could use the SIM Card for about 40 days, until she was blocked. Changing the smartphone helps then, to use the SIM again for one to three days. An other change (also back to the other smartphone helps again for one to three days...

name: Computer shop / sim card
description: Mobile phone sim cards available at this shop. Bring a passport. Easy, just sit and wait they do everything.

name: Quiet place in the gravel desert.
description: Quiet place in the gravel desert. Away from the traffic, no wildlife, up to a few camels. Irancell 4G +, if no protests take place in the cities. FM Radio Oman.

name: Health Certificate for Export pets
description: here you will get the healthcertificate. bring all your papers for the pets and your own passport with you!

name: no access to the lake!
description: you need a special permission to go to the lake!

name: CNG station
description:
Diesel available for 10.000 Rial/l.
The attendant has a tank card.
Price of diesel is 3000 Rial, but this depends on the attendant.

name: Abbasabad caravansarail
description: Complex of 2 big caravansarail, one old and one new. Nice to explore.

name: Nashtifan windmills
description: Complex of windmills constructed side by side from Safavid era. Really nice.

name: Maymandmoon eco-lodge
description:
If you want to have a true cave- experience and want to learn about the local culture, this is your place. A few young people from Teheran decided to start an eco lodge in Maymand and they did/ do a great job! (It’s not the cheapest option- 20 euro pppn, but def worth it)

The eco lodge consists of several caves. You sleep in one of the caves, where they created cosy rooms. There is a shared toilet (squad and European style) and a shared hot shower, both very clean and in another cave on a 2 min walk.

In a central cave they provide dinner (€5,-) and breakfast (included in the price). Laundry service available as well (€3,-)

You can make beautiful hikes - the nature is stunning! But they also organise nice tours where they work closely with the locals. Ie we joined for a sunset tour and had a super nice evening at a shepherds place where we watched the animals, played games and eat with them. Nothing ‘touristic’, you just join them :)

The owners will make you feel at home. It’s def recommended to stay for a few nights! We payed €20,- per night per person, incl breakfast.

Note: we arrived in the dark and there is no ‘lodge’ kind of sign. Ask the locals or otherwise call 912 371 51 20. The central cave is near the road at your left hand side.

name: Mechanics for 4x4, many Toyota’s
description:
Good place if you need a mechanic. Lot’s of Toyota Landcruisers are fixed here (before going into the desert). There is no official sign/name; It’s a big dark red garage door with a small door in it, see picture. Helped us with our winch and did a great job. The name of the owner is Abdul Reza, +989103050762

Nima helped us translating. You can call him if you need anything; +989373393806

name: LPG refill between Persepolis & Shiraz
description: in this courtyard we could refill our swiss LPG bottles, with an adapter from the euro filling set. the gas tank was empty, so the filled our bottles with the gas from another big bottle. it was a bit adventurous, but the guys knew what they where doing. one bottle was filled exactly and the second bottle was overfilled, although they were using a scale. 200'000 rial for 10kg of gas.

name: Spring and suspensions problems
description:
If you are in Mashhad and you have any problems with your car or truck, contact "Shah Gholam" at his workshop.
Perfect work for any welding or repairing springs and suspensions. Good price.

name: Bakery
description: They offer perfect bread, make it on hot stones. Just a few minutes walk from Akhavan Hotel.

name: Chah Dashy
description: Diesel with card for 6,000 rial without problems

name: Hotel Delvar
description: Excellent location in the old City, close to the beach bazar. Very nice and helpful staff. Secured parking.

name: Hotel Kasra
description:
New hotel incredible helpful staff.
Very good location to Queshm ferry.
Good parking but our bike was “ locked into the wedding banquet room!”

name: Immigration - visa extension
description:
Extension takes about 1-2 days. At first they told us 5 days, but we argued and they put it down to 2, because they needed at least 24h. We came the next day and it was ready. You need 1 passport copy, 1 visa copy and 1 photo (girls have to be covered on the photo). You pay 345000 Rials right here, cash accepted. 
They wanted us to fill the form in Farsi, but some locals helped us.

name: Diesel for regular price
description: Guy at the gas station has a card, gave us all we needed for an official price - 600T/l

name: takhereh seafood
description: Realy nice seafood restaurant. We were bit fed up with the kababs and this was a good place to have something different. There is a sign on the fence and when you enter trough the fence it looks a bit closed but go either left or right purlins the building and you are welcomed by the owner and his wife. If you do t like fish they have other options to.

name: Shadnaz hotel
description: Clean hotel, R2000000 ($18) reception doesn’t speak any English but they call someone who did. A lot of food and supermarkets around the corner. We stayed here because we we sick and wanted a good hotel for one night. But I would not recommend this city to anyone.

name: Refah
description: European standard supermarket really bigger and better then the smaller shops. Good to fill up your truck before going to Dubai. Allot to choose from. The staff speaks English and is happy to help.

name: Bandar Siraf
description:
Very friendly staff. He helped us in organizing diesel card from truck driver. 3000Rial/liter 

A small shop with water and other goods is there too.

name: Meydoon cafe
description: Best cafe and cakes in Iran, best carrot cake in the world:-) Perfect for breakfast!

name: Nice SPOT in the city
description: Guarded parking place Right in the midle of Jolfa. The gate close at 24:00. The guard sleep in place. The guy want me to pay 500.000 Rials

name: LPG Refill
description: place to refill bottle of propane. But you must have your own adapter.

name: Eppco Gas station
description: Drinking water low pressure. at the Eppco Gasstation.

name: Cafe Woul
description: Cafe Woul is run by friendly Navid in Bideh village. He has great stories, real coffee and can give you useful info and advice about the mountains if you’d like to go exploring off the beaten track.

name: Fuel station with diesel
description:
Fuel station with diesel at the edge of Izeh. They have a card.
There are no more fuel stations, if you drive from here to Shoushtar (secondary roads).
Don’t stay in town, if you can avoid it.
Hotels are overpriced and filthy.

name: Bozorgmehr parking
description: Parking of Bozorgmehr mausoleum. Flat with nice view on the city, the mausoleum and the fortress. Was quiet off season. Toilet and water available. A restaurant and a small shop but don't expect too much from it.

name: Old Korit village
description: It is a sad story but a beautiful place to explore. An earthquake destroyed the village of Korit and people had to move to another place. Now the village is desert and you can explore the collapsed houses. In some of them goats are resting during the night. A nice guesthouse has been built behind the big water reservoir. Nice pictures at sunset.

name: Sand dunes
description: Big sand dunes. Easy access even with 2WD. Except the last km, asphalt road all way long from Deyhook or Tabas. Lot of space to camp here. There is a painting on the road at the turning point.

name: Camp near the dunes
description: Big sand dunes near.  We marked this point but plenty of other opportunities here around to camp. No shade. Nobody off-season on weekdays.

name: Fuel station with diesel
description:
Gas station with diesel and card.
10.000 Rial/l.

name: Hotel Royal
description: Very nice staff! Hotel in good location sea view from the room

name: Hotel Parsagad
description:
Nice hotel with big and comfortable rooms for a stopover between Shiraz and Shouchtar. 
We paid app. 26,- USD w. breakfast for two.

name: Hyper Keeper supermarket
description: Big, western-style supermarket with everything you might need.

name: Diesel station
description: Guys have a card and gave it to us for a regular price - 600 T per liter.

name: Hotel Amin
description:
A bit shabby hotel but very nice staff. Very good location.Bike parking just outside the door camera surveillance.
1.800.000Rial for two inc breakfast.

name: Forough Boutique Hotel
description:
Nice hotel in a traditional house. In my opinion a bit better than the other ones nearby (also a little bit more expensive). 
You have to negotiate, we paid app. 29,- USD for two per night in a room w. private bathroom, in low season.
You can easily shop around and compare prices and rooms, there are several hotels/hostels in traditional houses nearby.
Parking is possible in front of the hotel on a public square, but they have cameras and a security guard.

name: Money change
description: Here you can change money, the guys shop is in one of the side streets of the round about. Speaks little English.

name: Head office Irancell
description: Go here to get your SIM, 11,5 Gig Internet package for 6 € for 30 days, it a official SIM on your name. Don‘t buy at little Shops, they are illegal and expensive. We tried several times, but way to costy. Ladies here st HQ speak perfect English and were lovely as whole staff. The also warned us not to take illegal SIM on someones elses name. Much cheaper and safe here. They have a tourist sim. Bring passport, cash and be connected again -:))

name: Nice local place for Pizza
description: Very nice imbiss to eat local made pizza and also the chicken is great. Very small place, great place.

name: Water tap on the side of the road
description: Water tap on the side of the road, seems to be good quality.

name: Water tap on the side of the road
description: Water tap of the side of the road, seens to be good quality.

name: Desert wild camp next to road
description: Nice, safe and quite wild camp in stone dessert. Only one k from road we found this place to hide. Nobody can see you. But only for 4x4, the sand is difficult to drive out next morning.

name: Wild camp along road
description: Nice wild camp, 2 k up in the mountains, very quite and hidden, easy and fun drive up, take entrance here 31.541193, 56.444865 and follow the tracks to the dead end, flat area

name: Trail to Rageh Canyon
description: Here you enter the trail to Rageh Canyon, easy to drive, 4x4 not necessary, but good. You can drive all the way thru to the north Highway 84 to Kerman. We stayed overnight at the canyon.

name: Trail to Rageh Canyon
description: Trail to Rageh Canyon. Turn here to the Canyon. Easy and fun drive. From here you can drive all the way tru. Trail is not marked on OS map, bit on google Earth you find it. easy to navigate.

name: Mountain View
description: Very nice flat spot for 2 cars, better with clearance, some parts are rough, if you drive up the gravel road from the wild camp marked below, you see this spot with a fire place. Hidden from the road, noboday came by, very quiet, but cool at night in the beginning of November.

name: Water at gas station
description: Here you can fill up your water. But no Diesel card.

name: Camp up Telegraphtower
description: Turn left at the Telegraph tower on dirt road up into the mountains. Path is on some stretches rough to drive, but short. On the left side you will find a spot for two cars, not so flat, but you can level with rocks. Not seen from the road, very calm, safe and beautiful view. 4x4/ high clearance is better option.

name: Candy Mountains
description: Very beautiful sight on the way to Rayen. Worth stopping here for a picture.

name: Wild Camp with offroad fun
description: Wild camp in a wash right next to the highway, turn on path here 28.235111, 57.860127, for us it was the only late option , its hard to find a hidden place on the road to Bandar. path 4x4 recommended, its a bit sandy and some crossings. Offroaders will love it. Drive a bit further down into the wash, you can hide behind bushes, lot of flys, we left early, that place is quite and safe. Nobody was around except two of these blue trucks passing on the path to the village.

name: Next to the Zayandeh river
