description: Quiet place in a quiet neighborhood. No noisy street around. But maybe not a good place on Friday evening.... You can come here with a big rig but you have to ignore the forbidden sign in the street coming from Motahari street. We spent 3 nights here.

name: Bakery
description: Here you will find different kinds of Iranian bread

name: Money exchange
description: Good rates to change Euro and Dollar. Today 1 Euro for 140.000 Rial

name: Free calm parking close to the Sialk hills
description: Calm place to park your van and rest in silence, very close to the Sialk hills. Is a big flat surface, very easy to park and arrive. Is not especially beautiful but is very useful to visit the city. 12 minutes driving to the city centre.

name: Iranfood 16
description: Very stylish restaurant with really good food. Super fast service, good price. Recommended

name: Traditional Guesthouse “ Light and Ssalt”
description:
Beautiful home stay in Hormuz. Dorna is an amazing lady with a real traditional house. She made everything herself with a lot of love and passion. She is a really great cook and breakfast is included. Only 7 dollars a person - worth every penny. In the evening we were invited for grilled fish on her campfire. It’s just magical!! She is a bit hard to find so better whatsapp her when you arrive at the Island. 

WhatsApp: 0098 9372161699
Call: 0098 9902430327

name: Parking Lot
description: Big parking area in the city center next to the holy shrine. We camped here with our truck one night. The gates closes at 23.00 and opens at 07.00. Good spot for one or two nights. Price 200.000 Real/ night.

name: Street Parking
description: Stayed here for one night. Multiple water taps next to the street and mosque. Drinkable, also a small park nearby.

name: car and bus service station
description: Sprinter repair. Specialised for the most european brands. Well english speaking staff. Opening 10am - 9pm

name: Professional LPG Factory
description: Professional LPG factory. They were able to fill up our swiss gas bottle within 5 minutes. No adapter needed. It's a real factory and the do not fill from one bottle to the other. 40'000 rial for 5kg LPG.

name: Park Saadi Hotel
description:
This 4 star Hotel has bright, spacious, modern, cosy, well equipped and very very clean rooms with comfortable beds. It’s not loud if you sleep with open windows.
There is guarded parking inside the hotel area and you can sit outside on their terrace.
The staff is super friendly and speaks English very well. The breakfast is very good (best we had in Iran) and they have a sauna (but it seemed to be quite old).
They have a restaurant that offers tasty food.
We paid 3.9 million rial.

name: Laundry
description: Great laundry, they washed all our clothes including underwear, all ironed and folded. They managed to clean oil stains from our technical outdoor clothes without damaging it. We paid 150.000 Toman for approx 8 kg clothes

name: Diesel
description: We got Diesel here! Card is available in the office next building. The friendly man at the gas station will help you. He speaks english. 6.../liter

name: LPG Station
description:
Possibility to fill  Gas Tanks and Cylinder                    
                                                 .

name: Consulate of Pakistan
description: Consulate of Pakistan in Zahedan only for people with Iranian passport.

name: Quiet park
description: Park outside the city center, large and quiet. There are toilets, but apparently closed off season.

name: Money Exchange
description: Here in the street you will find the guys for exchange.

name: Mountain Park
description: Near the City Quchan, it’s a quite place whit a nice view over the City. In Quchan you can get Simcard and all other thinks what you need. Water arrivebel

name: Dowlat Abad Garden
description: Just an unkempt garden with windtower to visit. Nothing else to see. Not worth 500000 Rial/Person.

name: Deh Sheikh
description:
Behind the mosque a good place after heavy rain. We didn't want to go offroad because of the soft ground.
it is a very quiet place with nice view over the village.

name: Farafar_Saryazd
description: Very nice Hostel, new build and very nice owners. It is in the center of the town abd close to the castle. Recommended.

name: Fish and Farmers Market
description: Stock up your fridge here. You want to feel the real Iranian market /bazar flair and buy good and cheap fish fruits and vegetables? Go there ;)

name: Good Laundry Service
description: We've been here with four machine loads of clothes and paid 180To. It was done in 2 Days also ironed!

name: camp near Caspian sea
description:
beautiful place on a large flat beach. When you reach the carpark, just follow the dirty track starting on its left. Quiet night. Just some motorbikes in the morning going to ... Actually, I don't know where they are going?!?
I think it is more crowdy on weekends.

name: Money exchange
description: Money exchange, not far from Jumah Mosque

name: diesel
description: they had card for diesel. paid 600000 for 60l.

name: groceries
description: got e everything you need apart from fruit and vegetable.  wide range of products.

name: Sefidkenar Grand Hotel
description:
Beautiful and peaceful place to relax at the sea!
The hotel is directly located at the beach, surrounded by a nice garden.
It has a restaurant and there is a cafe in the lobby. The WiFi is really fast.
The rooms are comfortable and you can choose sea view!
The staff is very friendly and polite and speak English very well.
We paid 3,6 million IRR in off season.

name: LPG GPL
description: Possibilité de remplir son réservoir LPG si vous avez l'adaptateur ACME, il n'ont pas d'adaptateur pour les bouteilles françaises. Dans une rue de terre portail sans inscription

name: Konaar Guesthouse
description: Relaxed, beautifully decorated and clean guesthouse. One of the only places on Hormuz with real beds and western toilet. The owners Faz and his wife Maryam are very friendly and helpfull. Faz is perfect English speaking, one can have nice and interesting talks. They cook delicious Iranian food if you like. They were great with our kids! We enjoyed very much beeing their guests! Contact Faz on Whatsapp +989162031508.

name: Bandar Abbas Vet
description: Veterinary for your pet, where you get the health certificate for UAE as well as food. Recommended.

name: Douz Douzan Gas Station
description: Guy had diesel card when I asked. We paid the local price 6000 IRR.

name: Police Station for Number Plates
description:
Got this address at the Saray/Razi border to pick up number plates.

No english at all ;) I was lucky that a waiting guy spoke some words.

You come here with the envelope you got at the border. Then you receive a little paper with two IRR amounts which you have to pay at melli bank. (1.2M IRR in total)
After paying you need to go to another place (38.589887,45.052446), where you finally get the plates (copy of carnet, passport, insurance needed)

All public services only open from 8am-2pm!!

name: Iranian number plates
description:
After you paid the cheque at melli bank you come here. Come early (8am) as it is chaotic!
Bring copy of carnet, insurance, passport and some time.

name: Big Supermarket
description: Big supermarket with many choices of goods

name: Boat to Hormuz
description:
Check in point for the boat to Hormuz, you can also buy tickets here (we payed 300.000 rial for 2 persons). They advised us to arrive one hour before but we arrived 20 minutes before and that was ok as well. 
Departure times 6x per day, starting 6:45 9:00 12:00 14:00 17:00 and 21:30 but check because you never know for sure :) (our boat left at 11:30..)

name: Restaurant haji
description: The foods are fresh, very delicious and have good prices. Everyday they cook food and serve Cola and soup on your meal freely. You can take boil water freely too.

name: Falafel Baradaran
description:
They serve very nice falafel and hotdogs. They serve just for dinner. from 19 to 1 am. Try it. I promise you like it.
Falafel is about 5000 tomans
Hotdogs about 8000 tomans

name: Tohid 24h Clinic
description:
Its open 24/7 and next to the pharmecy.
Phone 07633701280

name: NewNajmi Bike Shop
description:
It's a bike shop and sells many things you need for your trip. Mechanic really professional.
open 9-13.5 / 17-22

name: Fuel station with diesel
description: Diesel available, card from a truck driver.

name: Restaurant and Kiosk
description:
Here you will find a nice restaurant with good food and an enclosed Kiosk.
Especially for bicyclist from Teheran to Isfahan this place is a good spot.

name: Dry Pool to camp inside unseen
description:
Here you will find a dry pool which was formerly used for watering the fields.
It is no longer in use and an on ground pool. So you can camp inside.
Outside is enough space to lock and hide your bicycle.

name: Camping in the hills
description:
Here you can find a nice and hidden spot for your tent.
Also the view from this highest hill is nice.

name: High sensitive military security area
description:
As a foreigner you may want to avoid the surrounding streets of that spot.

At this place you will get stopped as a foreigner, when you are spotted while passing here.
Probably the highest change is as cyclists or on foot.
You will be asked questions and you have to hand out your passport for a control inside the police station.
It took me 1,5 Hours to finish the procedure.

Despite I got treated nice and with iranian hospitality it was a unnecessary delay.
They are not used to tourists there.

name: Yaam Caravanserei Hotel
description: The Hotel ist situated in an old caravanserei of the 14th century. The rooms are comfortable and spacious. The hotel has a nice courtyard and garden on the back side. There is a restaurant and a coffee shop.

name: Oliva Italian Restaurant
description: Nice place to have delicious pizza, pasta and other food. The menu is only in Farsi, but to order a chicken or meet or vegetarian pizza their English is good enough. We can highly recommend this restaurant. Opens at 7:00 pm.

name: diesel with card
description: they have diesel card.  fuel for regular price

name: Abandoned house for cyclists
description:
Here you will find two abandoned houses. The bigger one is faced to the north.
In both you may tent or sleep in.

Mostly hidden and quiet enough.
Probably most interesting for cyclists and hikers.

Parking a car may draw attention.

name: An inearth Well
description:
Here you can find groundwater in quality good enough to boil, or drink on the worst case.

But better filter, boil or use tablets. Handy for cyclists

name: Mtn Irancell shop
description: Place to buy or recharge SIM card. Front of hospital.

name: Chahkooh canyon parking
description: Large parking at the entrance of Chahkooh canyon. Can be busy during the day, especially on fridays, but quiet at night (winter time). Entrance fee to canyon allows access to parking. IRR 200.000 pp. At night we did not see anyone to collect fee. No shadow. Toilets close at night.

name: Service Area
description: Got diesel for 600T. They have diesel card

name: good for a night
description: very nice spot off the road. Drive in on opposite side of parking area. was able to access after heavy rain. No 4WD required. Several flat spots. if dry you can cross wadi and be further away from road, otherwise you might be visible from road.

name: Organic Shop & Coffee Shop
description:
Two shops next to each other.

Organic Shop offers a variety of food (no fresh stuff), soaps, washing liquids...

Coffee Shop has different types of beans which can be freshly grounded. You can taste different mixtures, the guy (no English, but super friendly and knows what he is doing) makes very good espresso :)
We got 1 Kilo for 1.7M Rials

name: Ruins of a village
description:
Here you can find lots of ruins to camp inside of you prefer not to stay in Marvast.

Protected from the elements and sights of the local habitants.
But no place with some sort of rooftop.

If you go more west that track you find a house with a roof. (pictures 4/5)

name: The damm of Marvast
description:
Here you can find the damm of Marvast.
If you are interested in having some water around you and a cool bath, this is the place to go.

Outside of the raining season or before it is just a dry desert inside.

name: Abandoned building
description:
Here you'll find find the one and only building to sleep inside between Abbas Abad and Marvast on the road from Yazd south to Shiraz.

You may need to clean up a bit because/in summer time it may be frequented by shepherds and/nomads.

It is possible to fit many tents inside and park two cars, motorcycles and bicycles unseen.

Big Rigs are not possible to hide but to park.

name: Sub e Sabulan
description: Very quiet. No traffic nothing, only nomads crossing this camp... For overnight of 2800 mh it’s perfect.

name: Siir Roof Top of Urmia
description: Very clean place and still new. You can stay overnight and you have many Restaurants and Cafés here. I was here overnight and it was very fresh in the night!!!

name: In the Highway
description: This place is directly on the highway, I stayed here only for sleep. No one bothered me. At night a little bit noisy about the trucks but good for sleep.

name: Aftab Hostel
description:
When you arrive Marvast you can find a place to stay at the Aftab Hostel.

Your car and motorcycle can be left in front of the entrance on the parking space with a camera (no 24/7 surveillance) and your bicycle has enough space inside.

The owner is very friendly and eager to help every traveler. So even more if the rooms are full you will get help and a private place to stay.

Make sure you tried to call anyway.

0353 258 5270
0913 255 8529
0913 356 7510

If you want a place to tent you can also ask me get a safe one.

ASK THE PRICE BEFORE!!!

name: Teachers House
description:
A very cheap accommodation with lowest standard.
Price about 3 € per night. Nothing to expect.
But warm and comfortable beds.

If you need persian - english translation call:
Mansour Naghibi
0991 110 3182 (private)
0913 156 3640 (during summer time)

name: English Speaker
description:
If you are around and need help, call:

Mansour Naghibi
0991 110 3182 (private)
0913 156 3640 (in summer time)

Speak clearly and slow. He is an retired teacher and a very good man.
In summer he is living in Yazd. But you can call him if you need help around.

He can offer a place to sleep and is in contact with the bus driver from Harat to Shiraz.
The bus is next to his house. (Marked spot)

He helped me a lot and even showed me around. He is not taking money.

name: Bus Harat - Shiraz
description:
Here is the bus from Harat to Shiraz.
He drives once a day. 7 o'clock in the morning.
The driver lives next to the parking of his bus.

But it is better to call the english speaking Mansour. He is the friend of the bus driver.

Mansour Naghibi
0991 110 3182 (private)
0913 156 3640 (in summer time)

It is best to call and let Mansour organise everything.
Just be there maybe half past six and the first helping the driver to load.

For cyclists: In winter times use the bus to go to Shiraz! The route offers less supplies and places to sleep protected from the chili wind.

name: Petrol station with card
description: Petrol station with diesel card, 600 tomans per liter.

name: Falafel sandwiches and more
description: Delicius and cheap (90000 rials) falafel sandwiches, samosas (vegetarian or not), and more by the very friendly Iraqi employee in this very very basic restaurant.

name: Khondab Nuclear Facilitie
description: The area around the nuclear reactor is strictly restricted for foraigners. There are no signs on the road, we were stopped by the police, had to come with them to the police station, they copied our passports and we had to leave the area. We don't know how big the restricted area is, but at least 10 km around khondab! So you can't pass this valley!

name: Some buildings for protection from weather
description:
Here you can find some building that provide protection from the elements.
Not sure if they are not frequented by locals.
But it is a good hideout.

More buildings in the area.

name: Wild Camping
description:
Great overnight spot with a view close to Highway 62.

Easy access with 2WD (VW T3)! There is a yellow sign next to the highway (33.496769,54.026388). Follow the convenient gravel road on the right for 5.5km. Then follow a smaller track on the left towards the mountains.

Perfect to stay one night, as it is close to Highway, easy accessible, quiet, no one around, great view.

Also possible to drive deeper into the hills, but sand gets slightly softer there.

name: Irancell Top Up
description: Place to top up. We paid 33.000T for 10GB

name: Iran Insurance + Asia Insurance
description: We extended our insurance here and paid 5.733.000 IRR for 2 months.

name: Monument-Hill over Kavar
description:
Accessable from the road leading out of Kavar, over the bridge to the south-west.

Here you can find a place to park, and rest. Also there is the possibility to pitch up a tent (almost unseen on the south-east).

On daytime or Fridays (holidays) there may be people around. At sunset they left. I had no visitors at night.

The road is hearable on the south-east. On top of the hill not. But here you have no cover.

name: Iran Insurrance
description:
Office for car insurrance.
Opening hours 8:00-13:00 / 17:00-20:30
Thursday afternoon and Friday it is closed

People speak English.

Also in google maps.

Parking in front is possible.

name: Lut_eco_camp 0098/9139970962
description:
you'll find a very nice camp! with lovely and helpfully people.you can stay in the protected Garden of the camp! Facilities, like hot showers and toilets are clean and if you ask the owners Farzaneh or Moein, you'll get water aswell. For using the facilities,  it's fair to give a Tip for them😍they will also offer you breakfast or other meals if you tell them. And when you want to do a Tour to the Eye of lut or to the snake canyon,  Moein will organize it for a really fair price!
By the way, dogs are welcome😍👌

name: Green River Bed
description:
Here you can find many places to stay, park and camp.
Just get off of tj the road somewhere and follow any track south to the mountains.

The area may be frequented on holidays.

name: Quiet wild camp on green meadow
description:
Here you can find the quietest spot for wild camping. A green meadow and now traffic hearable. Only birds singing and the wind breezing.

Perfect for bicyclist and hikers.

Several spots may be found near.
Motorcycle possible with skills and ground clearance.

NO 4-Wheelers !!!

name: Cham Tower of Silence
description:
Parking of the Zorostian Tower of Silence in the village of Cham. The ticket to visit the tower is 15000 toman. The guard was very friendly, he let us sleep there and he even bring us some wood :)
Very nice spot and great views.

name: Hasara Ecolodge
description: Its a beautiful traditional place to stay in a traditional kurdish village. You have a cozy, warm room, get delicious breakfast and dinner made from local products and you can enjoy a hot shower. The owner Hanna and her husband are super kind and they know everything about the best places and roads to visit.

name: Private stay in furnished rooms
description: Here you can get furnished rooms from a family. They offer bedroom with bathroom, toilet, double and single bed, dinner, lunch, breakfast. Next to the beachside. Dinner is yummy. Phone Nr. 09175920271

name: Khondab
description: The area around the nuclear facilities is restricted for foreigners. We don't know exactly from where to where, but at least 5 km around. You can't pass here on the way between Hamedan and Arak. You can go from Gynrjh to Saruq.

name: Axor Atego Actros Mercedes Benz
description: Here you get almost every spare part for your Mercedes Truck. Very friendly and helpful owner. Recommended

name: Hidden behind the mountain
description: There is a track behind the mountains next to the main road. Follow the track and you will find several good places quiet and not visible to others.

name: Armin Jahankhah Electrical and Mechanical System
description: This is a very good workshop. We had a broken engine in our Renault Master (timing belt, a few valves and so on....serious problem) and Armin got it managed to repair it. He is super friendly and efficient, has always a smile on his face and stays relaxed and the work shop is in a very good shape. We were so happy to find him after we almost lost hope to get it done in Iran. Although he doesn't speak that much English he uses Google Translate or can call somebody to translate.

name: Hotel Kahkeshan
description: Ok hotel for a night. The reception does not look welcoming, but the rooms very recently renovated and were clean. New bathroom, but with iranian toilet. Hot Shower & WiFi. Secured parking, suitable for big rigs. Hight limit about 4 meter. Good breakfast. We paid 2.6 Mio (17$) for a double room.

name: Diesel
description: we got 50 liter diesel with the help of a friendly truck driver.

name: Diesel station
description: we got diesel here with the help of a truck driver. regular price.

name: Ardestan Tourism Hotel
description: Old hotel, but ok for 1 night ond the way to Kaschan. 1.45 Mio. (10$) for a double room incl. breakfast. Hot shower. Secured parking (hight limitation about 4 meters). They have Wifi, but it was not working.

name: Diesel card
description: they have a diesel card. we could fill our whole tank. 10'000 rial per liter.

name: Shiraz
description:
Moderator Note: Please read all Check-ins, The User below had a bad experience.
.....
Good mechanic but a rip off. Agree to price before anything is done. Check all work is Done. Found out later he didn't do what was claimed.

name: Station Coffee shop
description: If you need to kill time waiting for your visa extension take a 15 minute walk up the road to the coolest coffee shop in Isfahan. If you like rock music and good coffee then chill here until the bureaucrats finish doing what bureaucrats do.

name: Hamsharif Food
description: Best Cheeseburger and Pizza in town. Great price and nice people. Highly recommended.

name: Water Shop
description:
Easy fill up. Price is 1000T for 20 Liter.
May 2020: We payed 90000 IRR for 150 L.

name: Money exchange
description: On this street you can find several exchange offices. Rial/Manat/Euro/Dollar. They are even open on friday.

name: Kolbagili Traditional Residences
description:
A small collection of Traditional mud houses with bathroom, air conditioning, firewood and small kitchen area owned by a local family (Saeed and Azadeh).

Just off the main road as you pass through Daland. 

There's a place for communal fires and the owners are very kind and friendly.

name: near the river
description: very nice and quiet place near the dry river. beautiful scenary

name: Candy Mountains
description:
Very nice and quiet place. Not to be seen from the road. the coordinates indicate the track. Follow for 200m.
21.05.20: no mobile phone reception.

name: Green surfaces between the hills.
description:
Green surfaces between the hills. Herbs, flowers and a fine scent. a quiet place to stay, or just to rest.
2wd with good ground clearence, no Internet.

name: Riverbed camp
description:
beautiful quiet place in the mountains. 
No internet. good ground clearing! necessary.

name: Desert Camp
description: Quiet place with beautiful view. Above the plateau over the canyon. Because Ali Morteza was closed due Corona, we found this place.

name: Ali-Abad
description: For overnight stay.15 km south of Ali-Abad. Cool at night. Noises from the Highway.

name: Abbas' campground and goats farm
description:
Private property of 80,000 square meters, farm with 400 goats and 2 Afghan shepherds, several fire pits.The entrance is marked with two vertical, brown steel tubes.
The access roads are usually closed off, so it is better to make an appointment beforehand.
Telephone Mr. Abbas +989164356237, WhatsApp +989170327480.
After the entrance there are a few shady trees and grass on both sides.
At the top of the hill is the water reservoir, the best view, mostly a little wind. A tandoor (clay oven). Simple rooms with a separate, simple toilet, would also be suitable for cyclists to stay overnight.
Drinking water from the cistern (low pressure) can either be filled with canisters or with the pump you brought with you (1/2 “thread). Disposal of garbage, dirty water and toilets the pit of a dry cistern. In the evening there is fresh goat milk. Heshniz village, 30 min. on foot, there are several small grocery stores, fresh bread daily, fresh fruit and vegetables come twice a week (Wednesday and Saturday). Larger purchases can be made in Parsian (50 km).

name: Arda restaurant and camp
description: Restaurant with camp place for campers and tent ,with toilet and shower

name: lake shore camping
description: Hidden from the road, decent trails to get there, nice green scenery right near the lake

name: Kilometer long fine sandy beach, many shells, hardworking yellow crab, but also a lot of garbage!
description:
Kilometer long fine sandy beach, many shells, hardworking yellow crab, but also a lot of garbage! At west wind it stinks. No controls, no visitors. 500 m to the little busy road is not to be heard at night. From West to East 50 km street without asphalt to this place. 
In the village is a small supermarket (without vegetables & bread).
Sometimes Internet.

name: Armand River
description: By the river, flat spots for tent and camping cars. Small tribal village on the other side of the river

name: Berenjgan waterfall
description: Great little spot on a secluded road near the waterfall. Hidden from the main road by some trees

name: Absolut quiet beach, offroad
description: You can reach this place via a small dirt path. Nature pure. No visitors, no control. 4G.

name: Mountain Camp
description: beautiful and quiet place. Good hiking possibility

name: The man for everything: Mosayeb Bagheri
description:
Mosayeb Bagheri, the man for all kind of help in Bandar-Abbas!
Tel./WhatsApp +98 917 763 5721. 
He speaks a good English. Knows a lot about history and all the interesting place in Southern Iran. Do you want to fill up all your dieseltanks for low price, to buy a Fiskars saw, to rent one of his Appartements, truckparking in the town 
27.20179 56.29845. 
He can help you with nearly everything, just call or write him!

name: Misho
description: Very beautiful wild camp. We camped here with motorcycles, most on time, out of city life, very good water coming from mountain, road is not asphalt but most of cars can ride

name: Beach front wild camp
description:
Beautiful beach spot, view to Hendorabi Island. Not visible from road. Easy 4WD access to beach along dirt/sand roads, adventurous 2WD access. Extremely soft sand on beach meant our Landcruiser sunk to its axels in the first 10 metres, but just behind the entrance to the beach there is space beside a patch of trees to set up camp. 
Only heard one motorbike pass by one early morning, spent two relaxing nights here - can get very windy but behind beach is more sheltered.

name: Sefidrud Dam - Climbing Area
description: Very nice spot close to Sefidrud Lake. Very nice views over the lake and very nice climbing spot, you can park directly where the routes start. Some shadow at afternoon. Very ,very windy at evening!

name: Miles of sandy beach!
description:
Miles of sandy beach!  lots of shells, colored stones, fossils, little rubbish, lots of driftwood.  
Great for swimming.  
A few locals at sunset, totally quiet at night, fishermen in the morning.
sometimes 4G.

name: Miles of sandy beach!
description:
Miles of sandy beach!  
Lots of shells, colored stones, rays and crabs, hardly any garbage.  
The beach is easy to drive on with low tire pressure.  
Great for swimming.  
A few locals at sunset, totally quiet at night, fishermen in the morning.
4G (sometimes).

name: Public beach with sand parking lot.  Few people, quiet at night.
description: Public beach with sand parking lot.  Few people, quiet at night.  Beach full of garbage, as usual, water clean.  Powerful surf.  4G.

name: Rocky beach of Beriz.
description: Dauh port with an incredible view, very quiet! No Internet.

name: Under palm trees at river
description: In the afternoon shadow under palm trees. Do not use this place when rain is announced because these palm trees are standing on the edge of a riverbed! You hear the road from the other side of the river a bit. Over the palm trees are a few houses, the natives are curious but not intrusive. The children like to throw stones on alerting dogs. No 4x4 necessary, but good ground clearence. Sometimes 4G, H+ and sometimes nothing.

name: Parking behind the hills.
description:
Parking behind the hills. 
You hear the road, but you are well hidden on this old street that is no longer in use. Good for a night. 
At night calm, in the morning you will be awakened by intense birds. No internet. Admitted: This is not the ultimate parking space, but still much better than the official rest areas on which the truck drivers stay with running motors!

name: LPG station
description: You can fill up with LPG with euro adaptor here, owner doesn’t speak English but very helpful.

name: Quiet camp in the fields.
description: Even between airport and highway a very quiet place in the fields! 4G.

name: Hypermarket European standards, hyperfamili.com
description: here we got Gouda chees, even after Corona!

name: At the quarry, with desert overview.
description: At the quarry, with desert overview. Here you can choose between hills, hidden, or a fantastic desert view. At night total calm. No Internet. No workers in the quarry.

name: Customs and Police control
description: They asked to see the inside the camper, took a copy of the Visa. Games about 20 minutes.

name: Gas Station
description: No diesel card, but 50l for 300000 IRR from Truckdriver.

name: In the middle of nowhere
description: Only nature. Twice the day a farmer passes by, he invites to his home, but we told him, that we have everything with us and we enjoy the quiet nature. 4G.

name: A hidden place between the cereal fields.
description:
A hidden place between the cereal fields. From the road you will not be seen, but you hear it. 
At night Total calm and always better than the mausoleum parking in Qaen! 
A wonderful herbal scent. 
No internet.

name: Mountain camp at the river
description: Good place to stay over night. Locals like this place for picnic. Very quiet at night. We filled our tanks with the clean water from the river.

name: Diesel for 1000T/L, all Tanks filled!
description:
Diesel for 1000T/L, all Tanks filled!
First he would not give, but after discussion, he agree.

name: In the ruins of the old Caravanserai Abbasabad.  2 km west of the main street.
description:
In the ruins of the old Caravanserai Abbasabad.  
2 km west of the main street.  
No visitors, absolute calm, very windy.  Wonderful herbal scent of the Iranian steppe.  
It is the largest system of this type that I have ever seen, from different eras.  Unfortunately, all building complexes are left to decay.  But this seems to have been a very big resting place on the old silk road.
4G

name: Drinking water from the firefighters
description:
Drinking water from the firefighters, free!
Good pressure 3/4" thread.

name: Wildcamp miles away from the streets
description:
A very quiet wildcamp place with farsightedness. Miles away from the streets. 
In the evening, the shepherds come back on their donkeys with the huge herds and peaceful hut dogs from the pastures. Bettering herbal scent, ideal for herbal collection. 4G.

name: Air pressure Specialist
description: Air pressure specialist. Repairs a pressure leak in grammar seat within 5 Minutes!

name: On the roof of Kang.
description:
On the roof of Kang. 
Great street area, artificially created, above the village. 
As it looks like it is a public picnic area with fireplaces. 
We had a quiet night here. 
Shortly after the pandemic Lockdown we were the only tourists here. 
No mobile phone reception (Irancell).

name: At the field path, a plane space.
description:
Good to stay when you want to visit the clay villages of the surroundings. 
Very friendly farmers who like to invite you, but just speak Farsi. Sometimes H+ with Irancell.

name: River spot with water
description: Nice picnic place with a good parking just by the river

name: Between the fields, rest in front of the city.
description:
In the morning and evening, a few farmers come over, all of them are friendly greeting. 
We are here on a mown meadow, this is an agriculturally intensely used area, it can be, that next year this place is planted with fruits. Changing crop rotation.
4G.

name: Turcmenistan silk carpet masterpeaces
description: Handicrafted masterpieces from silk and Camel.

name: Hidden place on the hills in the clay pit.
description:
Hidden place on the hills in the clay pit.  to anticipate it: do not use this place when it is wet.  
You are not seen from the street, but you can hear them during the day.  
Totally quiet at night.  
Lots of turtles and birds.  4G.

name: Police Checkpoint passports
description:
Police Checkpoint passports.
it takes about 20 minutes!

name: Drinking water in front of the mosque, 1/2" thread, good pressure.
description: Drinking water in front of the mosque, 1/2" thread, good pressure and good water quality!

name: Diesel after discussion 120 L á 740 T/L
description: Diesel after discussion 120 L at 740 T/L.

name: Wild camping near or by lake
description:
Coordinates are of the dirt road leading to the lake, we camped behind the hill leading up to the lake next to one of the adobe ruins but you could camp by the lake also. Lots of locals drove by but no one bothered us, quiet night. Seems to popular picknicking spot. 
To get to the lakes edge, you would need to drive down around the hill after the ruin. Very pretty area.

name: Yazd Badiyeh Desert
description:
A place in The dessert for tourist.
You can play in The sand dunes.

There is a possibility to park for The night.

There is a small coffee bar, hotel rooms And restaurant.

A lot of tourist attractions, Safari, Camels And quads

Parking for The night is free of charge.

Maybe also water filling possible. (Depends on water level)

name: Parking at Jan’nat park
description:
Parking space, suitable for big rigs. Nice park. Some shop around, taxi to city center around 100-150000 R
We payed 100.000 R per night 
Water available, even toilets

name: In the hills
description:
Close to Bijard in the hills with beautiful view. Very quiet even on weekends. 4G Mobile access.
coming from Bijard take the first left on 35.900203, 47.564736 follow the road for 2.9km  turn right on 35.908716, 47.537730 and follow the dirt road up tp the hill.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Police checkpoint, official but friendly. They asked to see our visas.

name: Firuz Abad Road
description: Hidden but on the hills. With magnificent view. Total calm, but pretty windy. E-H Reception.

name: Silvaneh
description: Huge open space near the lake, great views on the road down

name: Laundry place
description: Nice, friendly and efficient 1,500,000 Rials for 2 huge bags of clothes

name: The frog pond between the irrigation channels.
description:
The frog pond between the irrigation channels.  
We spent a quiet night here, but you have to tolerate the croaking of the frogs!
Bright view. 4G.

name: Right after police check - drinking water
description: The guy will fill your water tank with potable water

name: A small green area next to the gravel square.
description: A small green area next to the gravel square. That's nothing special, but still much better than the Customs area or the Tir parking in Bazargan with hundreds of running motors! Time-off Internet.

name: Flat area at dead end road
description: Well hidden, off the main road, flat area and large to make uturn. Great views of rolling hills

name: On the hills between Sangar and Maku. Locals Call it "Mr. George village".
description:
A Lot of spots here, very quiet! Great view to the Ararats. 
If you don't want to get unexpected passport-control, call Mr. Pacham, the village sheriff of Sangar, +98 914 164 9031 and introduce yourself. He is very kind and speaks a bit of English. Nice to walk over the hills. Most time 4G.

name: Alasht
description: Very nice green flat area. Nice views, you can see all the clouds above you. Close to a little village but no problem, people is very nice. road to here it's not asphalt, but it's no problem for 2w. the entry its little bit tricky, but if you put some stones it's easier.

name: Bakery with the best bread.
description:
Bakery with the best bread.  
His sesame rings are sensational too, but his confectionery items beat everything we know!

name: Excellent food!
description:
Restaurant with excellent food!  
It really doesn't look like anything from the outside, but their cuisine is excellent!  To take away too.

name: Where locals get their water
description:
drinking water where the locals get their water. 
no thread!

name: The monastery Sankt Thaddäus
description: The monastery Sankt Thaddäus () is a former Armenian monastery in the province (Ostan) West-Azerbaijan of Iran, 20 km south of Maku near Chaldirian. In the folk murmage is known as a "black church" (Azerbaijan and). The area was once an old raw tors. After convincing the Armenian Christians, the monastery and church were founded in the 66 of Judas Thaddäus as the first church of the world.

name: Basalt rocks with parking
description:
Basalt rocks with parking.
nice view with several parkingplaces.
possible to stay overnight Night.
near road, no Internet.

name: Foreigners police (passport and visa)
description: The boss doesn’t speak English but one guy did the translation, relaxed people

name: beside the river
description: Nice and quiet spot just beside the river. It's little and not very flat, but for just one van it's ok.

name: Mecanic garage
description: Very good place for overlanders vehicles...Mohamed is very good person and VERY good mecanic....He is even an iranian overlander......He can repair everything!!!....He has put a new cluch in our Toyota Land Cruiser and many things else...We are very happy.....

name: Irancell Shop
description:
They don't speak English.
If you want to Call Irancell service nr. 700, you have to have something in your account, the Emailadress on their homepage is not available, on instagram they don't answer: that's Irancell! 

I've sent an amount on my account, Irancell confirmed the receive by SMS and Email, but the amount is not available in the App, so I could not buy a package. So I bought a new amount, but during the day it för "lost". Nobody could explain that.

name: Foreign police and visa office
description: The boss doesn’t speak English but one guy did the translating. Relaxed people

name: On the Bari hills with a fantastic view!
description:
You can overlook almost the entire lake from here!  Totally calm.  
The shepherd even speaks a few words of English.  
Good ground clearance necessary, 2wd sufficient.  
Turn left at the entrance to Bari, follow the dirt road through the cemetery.
4G

name: on the supply line pipeline.
description:
on the supply line pipeline.  
this is probably the pipeline route.  
You cannot be seen from the main street, but you can hear them.  
Good for a rest or for an overnight stay if you can't make it to the limit.
sometimes 4G.

name: lpg and other gas filling stations
description: Street with several  stations to fill up gas lpg enz

name: Maku laundry
description: Small shop, quick service, next to the mosque

name: Canat Ardakan
description: You can visit the canat from this house. And walk through the Canats. Very special to see how this old system works in real.

name: Sim Card Buying - MTN Irancell
description:
Official head office from MTN Irancell in yazd.
Here you can buy SIM card with passports
and extend your Data Package

name: Mammut Scania
description:
The company is mammut Scania. Mammut is a big Carosserie organisation in Iran. Working together with Scania.

We let them repair our door of our Cabin.
And while we were there also greased all our grease g points...

The price was not negotiable but very cheap! Beautiful people in Iran!

Open till 17:00

name: Diesel with theyr card 100 L / 600 T.
description: Diesel with theyr card 100 L / 600 T.

name: Ghadamgah temple
description: historical Temple about 12000 years ago, have a very nice view , and good energy

name: Diesel stop with card
description: Have own diesel card, got 100l @ 6000 rial, nice and easy, friendly attendant who spoke some English. Hassle free after previous stations trying to charge 10000 rias.

name: Titibaran
description: Very friendly, specially if you find Farrokh, he is awesome man and so helpful, nice view of sea

name: Supermarket
description: Friendly supermarket, very helpful, lots of products and reasonable prices (eg saffron). Two entrances, one on Main Street and one down small alley you can see from Main Street.

name: Little lake
description: Little lake next to little village in the middle of nowhere. Water, lots of shade and almost no people! What else you can ask in Iran in middle of August. Also nice road (no paved, but in good condition) to go from Damghan to north.

name: Riverside
description: Nice place just beside the river but lots of trash and few families in the afternoon going for picnic. it has some shade and you can swim so its nice for one night stop!

name: rezvanshahr campsite
description: good place , you can camp and use shower and toilet , have good sea view, have hotel too

name: Diesel with card
description:
Station has own card, 6000 rial per litre. 

Nice and easy.

name: Mr. Painter hostel
description: A nice and cozy hostel with private rooms and shared bathroom. We paid 700,000 Rials per person per night, the price includes breakfast.

name: Dezak tourism complex
description: Nice hostel for night stay with hot showers.. mr.Malekzadeh is the manager, friendly and warm. we stayed 3 days and 2 nights. 60000 per person per night. You can cook or order local food. 4G coverage for all major operators.

name: Gandow guest house
description: Mr. Shajareh is the owner. very welcoming but a bit overpriced for baluchistan province. short nose crocs can be found here. worth visiting after all.

name: diamond of Alamout
description: it's a suite in Shahrak village ,Alamut, Qazvin, Iran. it's clean and has the great facilities (oven ,dishes, pillows and blankets, bathroom and WC ,...). capacity of facilities ( 4 to 6 people). the village has great weather and so beautiful. it's near to river , near to HASAN SABBAH castle , and near to other beautiful villages.

name: Change dollars
description: Here , in this chair small shop, you can change dollars for 110.000rials. It looks like the unofficial change office of the town

name: Iran cell
description: Here you can buy your sim card. I pod 550.000rial for 5gb

name: View point
description: Nice view of the town where locals use to drink and chill out

name: Omidvar museum
description:
This museum is about 2 Iranian brothers that in 1954 started with 2 motorbikes and after with a Citroen 2cv a 10year travel around the world. Inside many “souvenirs” of their travel. If you are doing the same experience, you must visit it!!! 

Close at 4pm

name: Parking
description:
If you stay at Arian Hostel here you can park your vehicle. I paid 10.000relal/day for my motorbike 

Ciao

name: Bazar
description:
For sure one of the place you MUST visit if you came to Kashan, especially the old caravanserah 

Ciao

name: Niayesh cave restaurant
description:
Unusual restaurant in a cave. Food is good.
Ciao

name: Steve mc’Carry exhibition
description:
Wonderful wonderful FREE exhibition of Mc’Carry, in a wonderful location! Really a big surprise!

Come!

name: Camel mill hostel
description: Basic hostel but in a great place! There are two rooms with no beds, but very rural authentic style. They ask about 10$, but you can try to reduce the price

name: Self service restaurant
description: Good easy restaurant where truck drivers use to stop. Enjoy

name: At gas station
description: Next to the port, where you cannot sleep, you can ask here a spot to camping. They gave me a small cabin. Bit noisy but perfect

name: Park camping
description: It’s a good spot to pitch your tent, with shadow and toilets. It Can be bit noisy in the night, but it’s ok. If you have caravan you can stay in the parking

name: Tourism police
description:
If you can avoid this office.
Me and others 5 foreigners people had to come the day after our first visit.... because they had to check / call Tehran offices first.

Ok.

The day after we came back and wait 4,5hours for only 1 month extension visa, at 1,5ml real!!!
(Two guys of us had to come back after 5days to get extensions because policemen told them they already extended the visa, but not true... because a third guy had already an extension but got in the same day like 4 of us... probably the two guys argue too much with the policemen, so... keep calm and be polite if you don’t wait 5days). 

That’s all.


Ps they told us it was 1,5ml per one month because we had to pay the past two months stuck in Iran for Corona...  not sure at all, even comparing with other cities. 

Apparently they accept  payment only by card.

name: Friday park
description: Here the locals spend time on Friday making barbecue and take rest. Very shadow place next the river with some attractions (small aquarium, chair lift, etc)

name: Custom for your vehicle
description:
Here you can extend your carnet (previous get the visa extension), or doing other things about car/motorcycle. 
It’s quite easy going, not too much pain.
 
Open hours: 8am to 2pm

name: Ghalamkar cloth
description:
I think you should come to visit this old original shop where mr Ebad makes wonderful and REAL Ghalamkar stuff. 
He is very friendly man with very very honest prices! 
Enjoy

name: Panahandeh: Famous Iranian breakfast
description: Here you can enjoy a very known Iranian breakfast. Cheap and good

name: YEMEN COFFEE
description: Nice western coffee, where you can even eat. No Wi-Fi

name: Sea side
description:
Nice area , with nice guard. not busy
If you are lucky, you can see phytoplankton (phitoplangtons)

name: Drinkable water
description:
Can fill your water tanks. Need Iran bank card.
Can ask locals to use their bank and help you. They are friendly

name: Auto service ,
description:
High roof shop. changes engine oil.
They have all kind of oil filters and well known engine oils.

name: Arash
description:
This place is an independent furnished accommodation unit with full facilities.
Includes a double bed, a single bed, 4 extra mattresses, refrigerator, proper cooling and heating, furniture, TV, cooking utensils, dining table and ...
Do not worry about costs because monetization is the second priority!

name: Darbehesht
description: good place for camping free water and water ok

name: Velenjak
description:
Very good fuel station. (I live in Tehran but i cant find my country in your app.)
...
Moderator Note: Iran is listed in the app!!

name: Tricky road
description:
We made all the way from Qasvin to Tonekabon via the Almut castle and it was spectacular. One of the best road and tour ever. 

BUT: It was really challenging with a big truck like our 6x6 (18 t, 3 axles, wheelbase 4.20 plus 1.40) in dry and good conditions, so take care and be aware there are many pointed bends on the way. Especially down to the sea it is a small windy road. Bigger rigs might not be able to master the challenge and reverse for a long way.

name: Beach
description:
Very nice place to Park and sleep.
Road is very good. 5m to the sea.

Bakery, shop 150m. Restaurant 250m.

name: Mountains
description: This is an absolutely beautiful place. We think it is normally used for picnics or for shepherds. A tree gives the place something romantic. Mountains around. Totally quiet. You can see a short part of the street (and the other way around) but no problem. For us much better than the other places nearby in iOverlander. No irancell signal.

name: Off road
description: Great place in the hills with a fantastic view over the salt lake and into the mountains. The light, when it is a bit cloudy, is beautiful. Quiet. The place we had was levelled. Other places which are levelled were harder to find.

name: Money exchange
description: Office in a calm street,  good parking....

name: Shahdad Park
description:
behind the park at a street. 
No one sees you from the main street. Traffic is just locals coming home after sunset. 
There is garbage, water and toilet in the park.

name: Hidden Beach Harbour
description:
about 50m away from main road.
10m to the sea for swimming.
shade in the afternoon from the cliff

name: Mafakher Park
description: All parks for overnight parking seem to be closed this time of the year in Rasjt. We visited all of them. Also parking spots were not an option for us, since we have a rooftop tent. This was our last option. Not an official camping. However, we could park the car right in front of the porch of the park (next to the road) and next to the office of the security guys. They let us use the toilets in the park. The next morning we were asked to leave at 8am.

name: Euro 5 Diesel
description: We got euro 5 Diesel with the card of a truck driver . The price was 3000rials/L

name: wild camping
description: very nice flat place near the red mounts on the way to Qazvin. we sleep one night was very quite.

name: Intensive Check
description:
Checkpoint with intensive checks of all the belongings in our Sprinter 4x4.
They opened every single cabinet and even watched intensively our asian noodles and baking powder, as well as the fridge and all the documents in our file folder.
They also checked all the papers (Passport, Visa, Vaccine Cards), they did note all our telephone numbers and asked us about our route.

name: At A Small River
description:
Halfway hidden place blow the main road, at a small river.
Easy to access, but a bit higher ground clearance would be good.
Place was tidy so far and Irancell worked ok.
Quite idyllic here.

name: In the mountains above Dizlli
description: Surrounded by mountains. Beautiful views. Ground clearance needed. Almost not visible from the road. No shade but probably cooler in summer as at 1700m altitude. A bit muddy in winter but still doable. No cell phone reception.

name: Guilan Pet Hospital
description:
Pet Hospital with a high standard.
Open 24/7
At least two doctors speak english.
Ver nice and lovely team.

name: Guarded In The Park
description:
A fairly new kinda Park-area along the river. It's a paved area with several picknick sites along the ways. The area is guarded and very tidy.
Irancell works well here

name: Night spot protected by kaluts
description: Once you have left the main road and are driving offroad through the desert, this the first good spot to spend the night. We had driven through flat terrain for about 3 hours and a guide told us it was better not to park there for the night due to opium smugglers. This place is protected by small kaluts, but we assume they don't give that much shade.

name: Sim card store
description: Since Corona it seems very difficult to get a Sim card as foreign national. Here you can get a Sim card.

name: In The Park
description:
Lots of leveled and paved places here in the park. The park is tidy and here and there locals come and make fire or picknick. 
Irancell works well.

name: Technotar Fuel Station
description:
Here we were able to fill up our tank with Diesel on the card of the owner.
60 Liter for 1,49€. The owner speaks a little bit English.

name: car and truck wash
description: Don't ever go to that place. They rip off foreigners on washing their car / truck. They charged us 5.000.000 Rial for a truck wash.

name: Hourak Guesthouse
description: Nodoushan is a treasure that I discovered on my bike trip to Yadz. Definitely worthy to stop and walk around the village that bringing you to the past. The GH Hourak is running by Rasul, he is a nice local Iranian that makes our stay easy and comfortable. Good and local food on demand, very very worthy.

name: mechanics and parts for light motorcycl
description:
in this street you will find the motorcycle shops, and bicycle.
mostly local bikes gear. 1 mechanic seem to be working on bigger bikes.

you can find oil but mostly are iranian and for iranian morores not for heavy bik like our bik ,honda700 or ktm650 , 100%synteyic oil price is double.  the main thing is that all shopes are selling iranian bik 100 to125 cc and max250 , and the last and main problem is that nobody can speak english in this area that's difficult to communicate.

name: Car Workshop
description:
Preface: We only (!) recommend this workshop, if you're going their with Vrej from "Bothers Overlanding", which are located a few hundred meters from this garage (see here on iOverlander, too)

These guys here are more or less well equipped and are not speaking any english. They're very friendly and hospitable and are trying to do their best, to help you.

We've been there with our Sprinter 4x4, as it had problems with both front axle shafts. The wheels got loose all the time and therefore our ABS kicked in very often.
Without main knowledge about car mechanic related stuff, I wouldn't go there, but if you know, how things should be done: tell them and they will do... because they do not know.

First tool is always (!) the hammer, which is, what I did forbid to be used!
With Vrej by my side, I was able to tell them exactly, how they should or could fix a specific problem, so they did.
They understand and will follow your instructions.
If you do not watch them for every single second, they will mess up things and put the parts together in a wrong way, which will cause problems, when you're on the road again.

Long story short: You can go there, if you know what has to be done and if Vrej is by your sight.
Better don't go there, if you're dependent on your overlanding vehicle.

The prices though have been VERY fair.
For the work of 2 people and 8 hours, parts (washers, nuts'n bolts), we paid 51€, which is way less, than expected.

But: see my images, what happened, when they wanted to wash the car!

Take care :)

name: Iran Pet Hospital
description: Offers high standard health service for pets

name: Huge Parking Lot At The Soffeh Mountains
description:
Nice place for a few nights with a beautiful view onto the Soffeh Mountains and Esfahan.
The fee has been something about 42€ct for two nights (20.000 Toman) and over the day it has been very calm.
Starting with sunset it has been getting more lively,  losts of people arrived here for celebrating.

The place itself supports huge rigs as well, but the entrance-gate is very tight. Irancell worked well so far

name: Perfect View Onto The Valley
description:
The place is on the side street to the highway and offers a stunning view.
It has been very calm here. Here and there other tourists came along, but trucks (for which this road has been made) didn't use this road.

name: At The River
description:
This place is in one of the small parking lots, which you'll find along the river.
Do not trust google maps images, as they seem to be very old.
It's very tidy here and some lots are paved, others are sandy.
Of course there's traffic along the main road, but compared to other cities or villages, it's less and didn't disturb us so much.

name: Gorgeous wild camp spot, surrounded by mountains
description:
The first spot on our journey through Iran, where nobody came along.
Completely calm and tidy spot with a beautiful view onto the surrounding mountains. Irancell also worked well enough.

name: Hidden Spot
description: Not the most beautiful spot, but fairly hidden, easy to access and good for one night.

name: Bandar Imam Hasan
description: Picknick place near the sea where it is allowed to have an overnight stay. Quite at night and some people around in the day. Don't know how it is on the weekend and in high season. There are formal BBQ places around.

name: LPG
description: We didn’t have a adapter and it was the only place which refill our German tank

name: gas station and fastfood Restaurant
description: Gas-station. Fastfood. Restaurant and a small Supermarket.

name: Wild camping near dumes
description:
Nice, near the dunes, flat area everywhere, you can see very far away. No need 4x4 to came here. 

From this place, to big rigs, is better return in direction to the caravanserai maranjab you can get stuck. To small car is good maybe from here one 4x4?

name: Bakery
description: Very goog bread, like this one in Georgia but less salty.

name: Diesel
description: The employee station in very good. He give us 50L for 6000 r. Not too much but in this zone some want 30k t per litre.

name: wild camping between the plantation
description: Nothing special, just a place to park for the night. No noise from the main road, quite.

name: Khorramshahr pelgrim campsite
description: Campground for Iranian pelgrims going to Karbala in Iraq. Open for everyone. With facilities.

name: Restaurant, gasstation and Supermarket
description: whole complex of gasstation restaurant (fastfood) and small supermarket

name: SIM Card - MCI همراه اول
description: Place to buy a MCI SIM card. Bring passport.

name: station with card
description: The employee station is very friendly and has a card.  He also give us water.

name: Car Wash
description: They wash your car. Ours was full of salt and very dirty. They charged us 1.5 mio rial (~5€). In the meantime we had a chat with a friendly person and were offered some tea.

name: tap water
description: in a picnic place there are a lot tap water.

name: Overnight spot in the dunes
description: Good spot for the night with great views into the Lut dessert. Just follow the small track from the street uphill for 200-300m. Hidden from the road and quiet.

name: kebap, market and fuel station
description: small restaurant(kebap), small shop with a loot of sweets and drinks and fuel station next to the highway

name: very good food speak English
description: Very good restaurant, traditional Iranian food and very good price. The owner speaks very well english.

name: Wild Camp in the Kaluts
description: Nice spot with sunset view and hidden from the main road. We followed the tracks from the "Entrance into the part of the Kaluts" at 30.83816, 57.79060. Last part needs 4x4 because of soft ground.

name: Diesel without card
description: They have no diesel card but asked a truck driver. We didnt ask for the price and paid 6000/l and rounded up.

name: Water tap
description: Water tap with medium pressure. It took a while to filter it.

name: LPG Gas bottle filling
description: Easy and with lots of adapters. Friendly guys.

name: Laundry
description:
Professional laundry service. Modern machines, washing and drying. Pick up the same day. Price between 5 and 10 Euros. 
Very friendly and the boss speaks some English. Preferably pay in Euro if you can, because the boss safes money for new machines...

name: Turning point towards Rig-e Yallan dunes
description:
If you don't want to drive the big loop and just want to visit the dunes - here is the turn of the main road. 35 km, and you reach the northern parts of the dunes. You can drive more to the south and stay were ever you want. 
In good weather conditions, no 4x4 is needed.

name: Desert
description:
good spot, along the road to marvast. You are hidden from the road.

some trace of usage, fire spots, trace of animals (probably goats)

Cyclist friendly

name: Iranian toscana
description: very green spot with a lot of trees to hide behind

name: Minab Tourism Hotel
description: Simple Hotel with parking area in 80s style. Park around the corner and restaurants and shopping in walking distance. Room was clean but someone used to smoke inside. We paid for a double room 4.5 Mio. Rial with private bath and breakfast.

name: Thursday Market Minab
description:
Big Market with fresh fruits and vegetables, local clothes, animals, household goods, ...
Only at thursday, starts in the early morning until around 14:00 o'clock

name: Parking in street near historical centre of Meybod
description: Quiet and shady street.  No more than 200 meters from the castle, Karavanserai, Ice Tower and the historic center.

name: small minimarket in the middle of nowhere
description: a small minimarket in the last vilage driving direction busher. after about 30 km nothing

name: chicken and rice
description: A kind of fast food. A portion half chicken, a big rice plate, salad, coca and differents sauces for 400.000Rials. Good quality and very fast.

name: Bandar Abbas, Dabaghiyan Park
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

Car parking spot in a green park in the Center of Bandar Abbas. In the evening there were some motorcycles and at night a dog was barking but apart from that we had a quiet night without being disturbed. Of course the streets can be heared.

name: Safe spot
description: Dinner by the lake and was escorted here by Police to sleep. They pretended it is dangerous by the lake and here it's safe. There is a prison nearby so might be true. Very friendly police officers. Wonderful sunset view over the small lake

name: Picnic area
description: Picnic area with smalls restaurants. we stay for 1 night. there is a gate and the guardian  asked 500mil Rials . security place. quiet night

name: Chahibakhsh Exchange
description: Good rates to change Euro and Dollar and UAE dirham .

name: In front of Mausoleum
description: Water in front of Mausoleum. There are shops, please ask them.

name: Sea View Camp
description: Nice hidden place. A bit further than the 26.59447, 55.45358 and more hidden. Nice sea view with sunset and sunrise. The military came by twice but just to say hello and check who is here. A lot of wood from the sea to make fire. A lot of flies. No service for Irancell and MCI. We saw some desert foxes.

name: Beach Camp
description: Remote place to camp at the beach near the cliff. Only accessible with high clearance and smaller caravans. 2wd ok if it is not wet, otherwise 4x4. Looks like it is very muddy in wet conditions. Easy access for swimming.

name: Hossein nejad
description: Dentist،She listens to you well and explains the best treatment to you very well, my toothache went away very quickly.

name: Wild camp in Kaluts
description: No far for the gravel road. Sand road is not difficult. Fantastic views

name: Water Tap and Toilets
description: Water tap at the toilets with good pressure. There is also a tap outside of the toilets. Not sure about the quality.

name: Ghasemi Gas Station
description: Small gas station. Don’t go there for Diesel! The quality is horrible and our car had no power anymore afterwards. Not recommendable at all.

name: Laundry at Qeshm
description: Laundry with cold water at Qeshm. 500'000 Rial for one machine. Maschine takes around 40 minutes. No dryer, but can get dried at the air within 24-48h.

name: Boat to Hormoz
description:
Here you can take a boat to Hormoz Island.
Boat will leave at 07:00, 10:30 and 14:00. Ticket price for one way is 1'250'000 rial (4€) per person.
To take the 07:00 boat, be there at 06:00 and go to the counter. Tell them, that you dont have a card and they will let you buy a ticket there. Bring your passport.
The boat will take around 1 hour.
To go back, there is a boat at 08:00 and 15:00.

name: Kheshtomah guesthouse
description: A beautiful gem, situated in the old town of Ardakan. Samaneh and Habib are two lovely hosts who will make your stay unforgettable. Upon request they can also serve dinner. We parked the car safely in the alley before the arch (take the south entrance).

name: Sandy beach
description: Near the way , 2wd car can go near the sea , suitable for children sand play.

name: Drinkable water shop
description: Drinkable water factory shop , can feel up the tanks , because qeshm water is salty.

name: Old barrage
description:
nice spot next to an old barrage. Many local come here during the day. Calm during the night

good for cyclists

name: Top of the hill
description:
Nice camping spot on the top of a hill,

acces by a steep gravel road, good for 4wd, motorbike and bicycle. we also saw some regular cars.

some local came for pic nic

beautiful sunrise and sunset over the sea.

name: Police checkpoint
description: Police checkpoint on intersection Nain/Jandaq/Khur. Friendly officers, wanted to have a chat and check passport and visa. After that, all good to go.

name: TORANJ Diesel for foreigners
description: They asked for a passport copy. Made a note of our number plate. Gave us 200l max.

name: Wild camp in front of sea
description: Nice and quite spot in from of sea. Dirty road to access

name: Quiet place out of sight
description: We went to the salt flats and found this place along an unpaved road. No people, no cars, just some animal footprints (goat). Out of sight from ‘main’ road to salt flats. Several flat spots here to park all types of vehicles. Irancell phone and internet reception.

name: silent wild camp with great view
description: The spot is not far away from the main road, but you can not see it from there. We enjoyed the view here for two nights. No one else was here. Just two hunters were up in the hills on one day. When the ground is dry you need no 4x4 but ground clearence. Acces is  from dirtroads. If you go on to the north/Isfahan you will find more places like this  in the mountains. With MTN Irancell we had always 3G or better at this place.

name: fresh water from a spring
description: We took 150 liters from the spring and drunk it without tablets or filter etc. We got no problems and the lokals did the same. Up of the spring is a place for parking. The area around the spring is used for picknick.

name: spring of Kor River
description: The spring for drinking is below the rocks  under the blue farsi letters. The locals used it for drinking, but we drunk it filtered (ceramic filter), because of waste and animals in the area. The filter becomes a bit brown after this, but the taste of the water was good. We got no problems after drinking 150 liters of this water. There is enough space for parking nearby and the locals come here for washing clothes, cars and carpets. At the end of very dry years there is sometimes no water they told us.

name: Authorized Toyota workshop
description: We were here today because we had two broken studs on one wheel and they had to be replaced. Very friendly staff, helpful and professional. Rate is fair, especially for an authorized dealership.

name: Beach
description: Beautiful and slightly dirty beach with many places to park and camp. We spent 2 nights here. On the first night, the police stopped by two times. Just to know if we are ok. On Friday there are some locals doing picnic or camping.

name: Big Tank
description: Water tank with drinking water. 1'000 Rial per liter. You can pay in the store next to it.

name: Iranian number plates
description:
We returned here our number plate. Duration was 30 minutes and they will give you a paper for the border (as far as we understood). They will check your chassis and engine number.
Office will close at 14:00 o'clock.

name: Diesel without card
description:
Here we got Diesel without a Diesel Card.
Go to the office (right door) and ask for it.
After a short call you get your daily approved Qeshm dose of Diesel.

one we got 30 Liters once we got 40 Liters. Both totally stress free.

name: Sengar Hormoz
description: Very nice Restaurant, they offer Fish, Shrimps or Mixed in nice sauce with rice and vegetables im a nice Atmosphere. Super tasty!

name: Informal campsite on the beach
description: Several sites along the beach for camping.  Don't worry, there are only a few fishermen's boats that go out to fish in the morning

name: Bandoo beach
description: Very scenic road to arrive here. About 500 metres of dirty road. Busy at day, but very quite after sunset.

name: MTN SIM card
description: Very easy, passport not needed. 1.750.000 rials for 15gb

name: Petróleo station in Shiraz
description: We have to wait a little. Paid 500.000 rials for 50 litres

name: Setayesh House
description: Hidden Gem in Shiraz. Very nice coffee, restaurant and also guesthouse. They have two rooms, which we did not check out because we were staying in another place. The local food was great, the atmosphere is very relaxed and the ownercouple speaks good english and is very kind.They offer also massages and are artists. It is a feelgoodplace.

name: Ecologe Nomadic Tourism Center
description: It is a very beautiful and calme place. The owners are very friendly and helpful. You got a lot of information about the region and his old culture. Nice Rooms with everything you need, shower is top. Beautiful common area and garden.

name: return number plates here
description: This is the traffic police of Maku. We gave back our iranian number plates here. At first you have to knock at the door often, because they were not very motivated to open. The process was quick, without any fee and it needed 20 minutes. You need for it the entry document of the car. The confirmation of give back the number plates is controlled by entering the Bazargan border area. The opening hours of this police station seems random, because we were here on Monday 21.03.22 02:20 p.m. iranian time. To other travellers they said it is closed when they asked on Wednesday noon. Maybe it was a problem because it was Nouruz time (Iranian New Year).

name: Drinking Water Fuel Station
description:
We paid 50'000 Rial for 80L
High pressure Drinking Water Fuel Station!

name: Mellat Park
description:
Parking lots beside of a park
Good for a night stay

name: Bakery 🤤 - sports bar stadium Cafe Nan
description:
If you are craving for real delicious European bread this is the place to be! Farshid, known from the former sports bar, is making this irresistible dough. 

Also for the sweet lovers, try the chocolate cookies. He is using only natural products and lots of love 🙂 A must visit if you are in Busher. 

Stock up on your bread, especially if you have a freezer / fridge. 

Farshid is also an amazing host, Overlander father & very kind person. 🧡

name: Next to the old fortress
description: Some flat places to stay overnight near a fortress.

name: Luna Park Parking Amol
description: We stayed at this parking for one night, it is perfect to visit Amol. The parking is next to a busy road and inside of the Luna park so it is very noisy. We asked one of the restaurants in the park and they said it was no problem to stay here. It is one of the few places where we weren't checked by the police somewhere during the night. Inside the park and at the start of the parking there are toilets and there are taps for water. We used it for drinking but we're are not so picky. At night it gets busy, so if you're traveling with a big car try to arrive during the day.

name: Local picknick place near a Dam
description: We came here only to check out a waterfall which was gone since they built the dam. The road leading up to this place leads through small streets so big rigs might have trouble getting here. There was a nice flat stretch of gras where maybe two vans can park. Off course there was quite some trash laying around and people came here to picknick. We didnt spent the night here but if we had the time we probably would have tried to do so.

name: With a Flamingo view
description: Perfect parking place for overnight camping without any facilities.  Along this edge of the wildlife sanctuary there is a lot of space for vehicles to park. Iraniërs come here to picknick and stroll around in the marshy area near the water. We stayed here for one night and weren't woken up by police. There is offcourse a lot of trash laying around and you're protected by several stray dogs. In the water there are a lot of flamingos :)

name: Around the Castle
description: We parked here during the day while visiting the city of Birjand. If we had to we would have stayed the night here. Besides this parking there are multiple large parking areas around the castle. The parking of the castle is a bit difficult for big rigs since the streets are quite narrow. There are also toilets, but they were closed when we were there. Since we didn't stay here for the night, just check with the castle if it is oke, otherwise there are plenty of options down the road, you'll pass them on your way up.

name: Shevi camp
description:
If you fancy a nice off-road ride and 
 hike to a waterfall, this is the place to be. From the main road it’s 25km on a gravel road (1.5-2h).The road is fairly good, but take it slow at some places. With our 4x4 it was very easy (dry conditions). No 4x4 needed, have a look for yourself if you feel comfortable. The road offers stunning views. 

We camped at this place for the night. Locals told us it is ‘dangerous’ to wild camp. Not sure what the danger is. It’s a remote area. The owner asked for 1.000.000R. They have lots of goats & sheep, maybe you can even learn how to milk them 🙂

From here you can do a nice hike to the Shevi waterfalls (1h). It’s a beautiful environment.

name: Cloud forest
description:
Cloud forest is good for camping in summer time , the weather is cold most of the times 
There are some roads crossing the forest tree you have couple of choices
Here is the guest house with nice foods and super cheap

name: On the elazig way
description:
This is the place about 1 hour from elazig 
From van to elazig we could camp here only because before here we searched many places but because of snow or stony ground we couldn’t find good spot 
Here is behind the city and safe place for stay , not wild camping

name: Dez Hotel
description: The friendly hotel owner who allowed us to stay at the parking lot. It’s a nice place in the middle of a green park / garden. It’s secured, you will need to pass a guard at the entrance of the street. You will be surrounded by birds, the smell of flowers and some curious hotel guests. In the evening you will hear noise from the nearby road.

name: Dez lake view
description: Paradise! Wonderful place with a magnificent view over the Dez lake. From the main road you take a gravel path. Need high clearance. Deflate your tires, you will have to take a few challenging corners. But it’s all worth it! Locals come here in the weekends or holidays. We were there with Nowruz, the lake was packed with people but up here only a few other cars. Nice place to do some hiking. Iran cell, good reception.

name: Bita Banoo Ecolodge
description: pass good time with rest and stay in bita banoo ecolodge abd enjoy of the clean weather and beautiful views of nature with local food and visit site seeings around the village and arak city with transfer and tour with english tour guide.

name: Jngly Park
description: Big park with a lot of space to park. Busy at day. There are some fast food at the top. Water taps and public WC

name: FerGas supply
description:
Hi
At this place, you can fill almost any kind of gas cylinders

name: Carvel waffle & icecream
description: Best waffle shop with amazing taste of gelato in Tehran

name: Between Mountains
description:
Great area with a lot of places to stay. Between great Mountains. Not far from the road (cannot hear the road). 
In the afternoon a man on a motorcycle came by. But we don’t speak Persian and he didn’t speak English. So he just left. 
We had a very quiet night with a nice temperature to sleep.

name: Vali_asr public parking(free)
description: This parking is near the fire temple, the free toilet is in next alley(59) and you can find free drinking water end of parking. You can buy fruits, herbal medicine, saffron, traditional herbal store, clothes, etc, from shops here.

name: Saffronbourse (traditional herbal store)
description: You can find some herbal medicine, Saffron, Cardamom, Cinnamon, spices ,etc. They can speak English in morning turn(10-13).

name: Money Exchange
description: Got a good quote here $-280.000 IRR €-300.000IRR

name: Bishapur Eco Lodge
description: Great place with very nice people. Sleeping is in traditional room with mat on carpet floor. Go there for the great atmosphere and traditional food.

name: Calm valley near Karkas mountains
description: Nice and calm place for overnight stay in a valley near the Tameh village. we took a wrong road and ended up at these coordinates. only jackals roamed around at night. there should be another road more south from herr that leads further to the valley.

name: Diesel and car mechanic
description: there is a gas station with diesel and friendly staff. it's not a busy station but trucks pass by quite often. we tanked here twice both for 600 toman/l. next to the station there is basic car service where you can fix minor things or pump or tires. very friendly owner.

name: car wash and water tap
description: there's a car wash with fair prices. we washed our car after visiting Maranjab for just 80000 toman. there's also possibility to get water.

name: Rooftop Cafe
description: Nice cafe at the roof. Entrance at a small side door. Very Nice view! They charge 100mio rial p. P. as entrance - but included one drink.

name: Almas Gas Station
description: Beware of this gas station! Filled up first, promised 300 toman a Liter, then came up with 7000 per Liter

name: Gas station
description: Got diesel here with the help of a truck driver

name: Darvak ecolodge
description: We are an Ecolodge nearby mountain in Gilan province. Welcome to visit us for a night stay, cup of coffee, experiencing genuine Gilaki cuisine or even  for a friendly talk/travel guidance.

name: Shib Deraz Turtle sanctuary
description:
Protected beach where sea turtles come to lay their eggs. You are not allowed to enter the beach at your own, but you can wait at the terrace and the guards will call you, if a turtle shows up. However no guarantee to see one. 
PLEASE if you come here RESPECT THE WILDLIFE!!!
Follow the guards. No camping, no light, no littering. Thanks.

name: Desert Beach Camp
description: Nice hidden place in a little bush forest. Close to the road but hidden. Access gets really sandy after 20m so I was stuck 3 times. Beach is about 100m behind the dunes. At night some fisher boats and a few cars were heard. Nobody came by, even though I had a bonfire.

name: Sheghenestan
description:
Parking area for 30-40 cars and all the facilities for camping. Bathroom equipped with paper towels and water. Attractions such as fantastic mountain scenery and  extremely clean cool air compared to Yazd. Clear night skies for astronomy. Mountaineering. Very refreshing drinking water that comes from a spring (mountain). Rural life and local food such as fiery tea.
......
