فوق العاده زیبا بکر و دست نخورده جایی میان کوهستان بسیار آرامش بخشو همچنین جایی 


 برای کمپینگ زیر درختان گردو بادام الوچه و....

name: Caspian Hotel
description: nice hotel for a stop over in Tabriz. we paid 25 Euro per person and night. breakfast included. the owner speaks good English. there is a secure parking at the back, but our 2,76m high car was too high. so we parked at the back entrance in a little ally next to the door which has video surveillance.tel +984135253266

name: Ater Eco Resort
description: Nice hotel  at one km distance from the Takht-e Süleyman site. price was 25 Euro for two persons incl. breakfast. The owner is Mr. Jahani +98 935 726 8851. The last 200 m are a bit difficult to find, so better call the owner to guide you.

name: Hotel Amiran
description: very good 4 star hotel. we paid 36 Euro for one night two persons. Spacious and safe parking without any height limitation.

name: Visa extension
description: Here you get you paperwork prepared for the visa extension. you need your passport, visa and 2 photos. They do the copies for you and prepare a pink folder. 20k toman (80 cents) for 1 person. police office is on the opposite side of the road.

name: Reghz Canyon car park
description: you can stay overnight at this car park for 500000 , it is secured with lights and cameras. some locals come in the evening. they are all very friendly. Contact Mehdi in 00989021893245 or Elahe on 00989391706148, to organise tour of the canyon, either canyoning or normal walk up to 6 waterfalls. they both speak English

name: close to Masiri in a Valley
description: as we couldn't find the other Spot on ioverlander, we went, go through the village, at the top turn right, go through fields, and carry on until you reach a platform. no 4x4 needed. slight noise from the road. local shepherd comes and say Hello and brings some milk. some other locals came by to see if everything was ok, last visit at midnight! (we stayed 2 nights). beautiful surroundings. irancell 4g

name: car wash / water
description: car wash with 4or 5 bays. no english (not self service). Hoover  available. water alsi to fill up your reservoir. around 60 cents, we didn't want to dry the vehicle

name: lake view
description: little place with beautiful view on the lake and the mountains, next the hiking place

name: The Hub supermarket
description: Luxurious supermarket with both import and local products. Wide selection of drinks. Very friendly staff. Quite affordable as long as you check what you are buying. Prices in farsi.

name: Diesel fuel station
description: Very friendly staff helped us to find truck drivers to provide some diesel on their card. We got around 40 liters from 2 truck drivers. They didn’t want us to pay.

name: Free toilet
description: Free men and woman toilet. You can use morning till night. No shower.

name: Restaurant
description: Good restaurant with local food (Kebab…) Also for lunch open during Ramadan!

name: river spot
description: only 4x4, small way going down, but steep hill so 4x4 recommended... beautiful view and flat spot

name: Asareh Hotel
description: Very good 4 star hotel in the center of Teheran. we paid 45 Euro for a double room plus breakfast. safe parking for not too high rigs. our car is 280 cm high and we were able to pass.

name: Karaftou Cave
description:
Big cave and tunnel system. Nice to see and the scenery around is amazing. 
500.000 Rials per person entry fee. 
The price is mentioned at the entrance. But they think we couldn’t read the numbers and wanted to charge us double price. So be aware and tell them that you can read the sign.

name: Supermarket
description: Supermarket which is s bit better than the small shops. Nearly everything you need except fruits and vegetables.

name: Quiet and protected campsite
description: We chose this site because the weather was turning bad and we wanted protection from the wind/storm. Beautiful and very quiet. Close to the road, 2 WD accessible. In the morning 2 policemen came to check our passports. No uniform, no policecar, no English. Guy on the phone translated. Whatever. No Irancell reception.

name: dez lake view
description: Beautiful and peaceful place clise to the shore of the lake.  locals must come here  as traces of fire. Needs high clearance for sure, no need to deflate tires, not suitable for big rigs, narrow lane and some very tight bends full if holes.. Here are the coordinates for the turn of point from the main road before arriving into the village 32,6219170, 48,4973058

name: Over Keshar-e Sofla
description: Flat Parking in a Turn. Great view. Road goes down to a small village, therefore not a lot of cars in the night. A car with teenager came around midnight and stayed an hour (was a festival day). The rest of the night very quiet. Close to Teheran.

name: Fuel Station
description: Small fuel station with Benzin and Diesel. Less truck traffic so a little difficult to get diesel.

name: away from shirz canyon during eid
description: We wanted to stay at shirz canyon during eid, and we couldn't park anywhere, so we carried on until this spot next to the river. Have to cross the river 3 times, but irs nice and easy. Very peaceful and plenty of wood. No internet

name: in the middle of fields next to a rock
description: We went to the little lake just before mentioned on ioverlander, because of eid, it was packed, so we carried on on the road. Little track goes up in between house, not many flat areas, but some stones to level up if you wish. Nice view of the different fields. Noise of tractors until 8 or 9 pm. Peaceful night. Iran cell coverage. Probably not good if it has been raining

name: Near Kandovan
description: On an dry river... In the middle of the mountains. A place in calm nature in the middle of sheep herds. In 4x4...

name: Kashan
description: Near the old town… Next to a park… Quiet…

name: Barahestan Hostel
description:
clean rooms, showers, host speaks good English, cheap In May 2022 we paid 1,500 Toman for 2 people.

We were told by owners that theft from bikes happens all the time here, but they have secure parking through the white doors in the left of the hostel.

name: Sarabi Traditional House
description: Beautiful location, close to anything that worth seeing around, professional staff, english speakers, medium breakfast, not so good internet, nice rooms, air conditioning, nice interior! Big cars do not have place beacause is a narrow street, bikes are welcome!

name: Hotel Apadana
description: Nice & spotless clean hotel with western toilet, fridge, TV, fast wifi and complimentary breakfast. Cheapest room is IRR4,450000 (USD16) for double/twin room. Its a good price given that hotels in Bandar Abbas are expensive. Reception speaks good English and very helpful. Parking space at the basement for about 20 cars/van. Location is strategic. Near to money changers and insurance company.

name: Customs Razi border
description: After crossing the Kapikoy- Razi border you have to come here to get the documents (for travelling around the country) or the documents for the Iranian license plates.

name: Teachers house
description: Excellent place. Basic but clean. I got a whole room with 3 beds and a couch for 2,5 million rial. Safe parking. Normally WiFi but not working today. No breakfast.

name: guesthouse near portugués fortress
description: nice basic guesthouse. owner does not speak English. aircondition available. good location with European toilette.10 Euro without breakfest. Tel of driver / tourguide we used who is a cousin of the owner 09383168554. name of the driver is Ahmed Hormusi. he speaks very well English and is very knowledgeable.

name: Airport parking
description: The airport has three parking areas. Two are parking houses with limited hight clearance. the third one is the day parking area next to the domestic  airport terminal. Our car is 280 cm high and did not fit into the parking houses. as we stayed only for two days we were allowed to park the car at the day parking area for two days when flying to Bandar Abbas.

name: Beautiful but windy mountain top
description: The other spot on this road was next to the road, so with a car passing every 10 minutes we decided to look further. This spot has more space and is further from the road though still visible. Wind comes and goes. LTE Irancell.

name: Garage / Car workshop
description: This garage was recommended to us by Iranian friends.  The team and the boss are very professional and responsive.  We had major repair work on our Toyota Land Cruiser (clutch change, timing belt replacement).  Everything was done in a day and a half (ordering parts included).  They let us sleep in the garage for 2 nights for free to save us from getting a hotel room.  We recommend them without any hesitation.  If you visit this garage, say hi to the boss Mohammed from us.  Léna and Jérémy (French travellers).

name: Nodoushan Palace قلعه ندوشن
description:
An old Watchtower that is now a guest house with numerous rooms.
Fantastic views over the city. cost us 1M Rial per person including. breakfast in May 2022.
If closed, may need to call the owner who also has a restaurant in town. Owners phone number if the place is closed is +989139531511

name: Pastry shop / Good cakes
description: Here you will find all kinds of cakes, individually or for several people.  They are all delicious and not expensive at all.  The staff is very kind

name: VW mechanic in Kaftarak (Shiraz)
description: This is a well knows VW Garage service in the south of Iran. The owner will help and support you in all you need for your VW Beetle, T1, T2, T3 and T4. he did a good job on our camper. You will find him in Instagram as shitaz_volkswagen_club . We are very, very happy with all he made for us.

name: Zanjan
description:
The owner washed and dried our laundry (no ironing), two bags for 3,500.000 IRR. We had to discuss the price because he wanted 150.000IRR per piece, we agreed on a total price. Next morning it was ready.
Hard to recognize as laundry store, you see fabrics in the window. .

name: Among the trees
description: In the middle of the trees, with shade, a water point... near the road but quiet...

name: Lovely Oasis Camping Spot
description:
We found a lovely camping spot in this oasis and a rain water collection well.

It is very quiet and you need a 4x4 to arrive.

Probably dangerous during rainy season.

IranTel 4G coverage.

Nearby amazing 1,5 km Latidan Bridge.

name: Fuel station with diesel card
description: They have a diesel card. No english. 6'000 Rial/liter.

name: Water tap in park
description: A water tap in the park with good pressure. 20 meter hose needed to fill directly into the car.

name: Kashan-Natanz Fwy
description: We were on our way to the station on the opposite side of the road, but here they also have diesel. No card, so wait for truck driver. Friendly attendant, spoke little English. No idea about quality diesel. Better check price before you buy

name: Toranj Hostel
description:
We stay here for few days. It s a real good place, fresh. There is some place to stay with a camper. They ask 10€ per night to stay and use shower and electricity and beakfast for 2. 
Nice people.

name: Small Oasis
description: A beautiful place near de water… You can swim..Near the road but quiet on the night…

name: Picknick place
description: After getting some diesel at the petrol station nearby here's a nice place where you can park your vehicle under the trees. You can relax in the park and the kids can play at the playground. You can probably sleep here as well, but it's very loud from the nearby streets.

name: Maritime museum of the sea and Persian gulf
description:
One of the nicest museums we have seen in Iran. History, natural sciences and nautics. Very well prepared and also interesting for kids. 
Outside exhibition of boats and small submarines. All worth a visit.
They charged no entrance fee for us.

name: On the beach
description: On the beach… with a tree for shade… Swimming… the best

name: Forest. Shiraz to Persepolis.
description:
We were quite desperate looking for a camping near Shiraz and found this small forest next to a park. It is not ideal, but it could save you if you don’t have a better place.
You need a 4x4 if you want to enter the forest or you could just park in the road next to it.
Quite remote and quiet during the night, in the morning there is some traffic on the road.

name: Laundry in Kong
description: Good and cheap laundry run by two brothers. One of the speaks good English, with the other we talked through Google translator. We paid 140k toman for a bag of clothes. Our laundry was ready next day morning but it could be even quicker without drying.

name: Dalanper
description:
Attractive and beautiful place 
It has 3 lakes 
2 small lakes on the slope 
1 large lake at the summit 
The best time for camping and overnight stays is May and June

name: OffRoad Tires Peyman
description:
Friendly brothers with a nice tires workshop. 
They are also off roaders themselves and know interesting routes.
They have Maxxis, BF Goodrich and many brands at a correct price.
WhatsApp: +98 91 310 33302

name: Park jngly picknick place
description: Picknick area, good to stay the night after bazargan border crossing. And close to the traffic police to pick up your number plates the next day. Toilets and water is available. Place is guarded and staying the night is allowed.

name: Guesthouse with no name in Kashan
description: Nice traditional guesthouse in the center of Kashan. Price is 50Euro per person and night incl. breakfast. the house has three floors of which two are underground, partly hacked into the solid rock. the house has an amazing traditional architecture.Access is through some very narrow allies. we have a Toyota Landcruiser which is the largest that can squeeze through the narrow streets. The owner is called Back and you can reach him via +98 912 008 9260 He speaks good English. Very private atmosphere.

name: Shahnaz Homestay
description:
Single room available with one double bed in a private house. This accomodation is really well decorated, modern, clean and well maintained.
Secure parking for cars and motorcycle within a gated community and security guards on the gates who do regular sweeps of the compound
The host Shahnaz speaks perfect English, to book just give her a call or WhatsApp on +98 915 143 2199
Light breakfast is included.
In May 2022, price is $10 USD for the room

name: Money Exchange
description: Money Exchange with good rate. Bonbast 320'000 Rial and we got 317'000 Rial.

name: camping spot
description: Nice camping spot in a clearing area oak forest arround to have a wood, Just a few shepherds pass during the day, no dwellings for miles around.  Very correct and magnificent access track Possibility of making a campfire, putting up your tent, be careful, no water source nearby

name: quiet spot with beautiful view
description: Nice spot with beautiful mountain view and trees for shadow. Accessible with 2wd.

name: اقامتگاه چندلChandal hostel
description: Wonderfully decorated quiet hostel on Hormuz Island with tasty breakfast. Owner Ehasan speaks English well and is very friendly and helpful. There are two private rooms and one dorm. Shared shower and toilette are always clean. Fully equipped kitchen can be used. Bycicles can be stored in the nice courtyard. Phone number: +98 912 638 2495

name: Beautiful quiet valley
description:
Not far from the main road. Follow the dirt road going straight to the east from the main road. Several good spots on the way. Go as far as you want and your car is able to. No 4x4 needed, but some good ground clearance.
Some shepherds and beekeepers. Really quite at night. 
You can start beautiful hikes towards east deeper into the valleys and discover pools for swimming and waterfalls.

name: Valley with waterfalls and natural pools
description: Wonderful remote and quite valley. You can start to hike from the close by overnight spot. There are several valleys to explore and you can even hike much deeper than this location. Some easy climbing on the way. Great fun also for kids, as there are natural pools to swim, small waterfalls and fossils.

name: Iran Tourist Hotel with big parking
description:
We ask to stay here with our campervan on the parking. But only allowed if you book a room, which was just 10€ for the whole family. So we stayed and enjoyed to explore the nearby sightseeings by foot.
Rooms fine and air-conditioned.
Save parking, also for big rigs.

name: Haljerd Forest Park
description:
Forest park near Tehran.
We came late at bight and it was closed so we camp outside on the forest near the entrance.

Not ideal, but it can be used on your way out of the capital.

There were some guard dogs barking and coming around that was not nice, but after the scary moment they just left.

In the morning some cars passed by, so not privacy, however the guard of the park that lives in the nearby house came to offer us to come inside the park where they do have toilets and 
 water.
I guess that if you come during the day he would allow you to come to the park itself (not a bad forest) to camp for some of money.

name: jungle hotel
description: clean nice traditional house. have dorm beds and rooms. great breakfast. very safe parking for motorcycles behind locked gate. I paid 7$ for a dorm with 2 beds, but had it to myself. owner is nice and speaks English

name: Forest park wirh shadow
description: Very large park with lots of trees and shadow.  There is a barrier at the entrance and you have to pay 100,000 rials.  200,000 rials for big vehicles.  There are plenty of places to park among the trees.  Also places for big vehicles.  During the week it is very quiet.  Let's imagine that Thursday night and Friday must be very busy.  There is a small lake with boats.  There are clean toilets with water.  We haven't seen fountains to fill tanks but we have filled them in the toilet faucet

name: Volleyball court
description:
Not great, but flat and quiet.
It is next to 2 inhabited houses.

4x4 needed.

No one came around.

We preferred this option rather than Alamut Castle Parking or the Golestan Hotel Parking to have more privacy and nice views.

IranCell 3G/4G coverage.

It was a bit windy.

name: Mayamey service park
description:
Behind the Mayamey service park is a good place for camping. Follow CNG petrol station. There are shops and restaurants.
Also toilet.

name: Beach camp
description:
Beach camping where locals camp. Separate swimming for women. Small pub and toilet.
Price $ 1,80 for a night.

name: Between the mountains
description: This place is even better because there's shadow untill 8h in the morning, beautiful sunset and you can't see the road

name: AzarBarzin Ecolodge
description:
Traditional guest house next to the the historical castle of Azarkhavaran. It's on the way to Khara and Varzaneh deserts.

Nice rooms. Private ensuite bathrooms. Hot shower and fast internet. There is plenty of space for parking too.

The price is 10 to 20 EUR per night per person.

name: Iran Cozy Hostel
description: A great wee hostel with cafe attached, which can do lunch or dinner for you if required. Nice and clean. English is spoken by several of the staff. Motorcycle parking in the Cafe courtyard after closing time.

name: Mohamadabad castle
description: Located in Mohammadabad, a city in the lower Jargaviyeh section of Isfahan city, Mohammadabad Jargaviyeh Citadel is a gem of traditional Persian architecture. This place is known as Bagh-e Mir, which includes the old palace and the castle that forms the historical core of the city of Mohammadabad.

name: Historical Castle of Azarkhavaran
description:
Azarkhavaran historical castle, located in 60km south east Isfahan (Esfahan), Iran.

Azarkhavaran is a village in the central part of Jargaviyeh city, Isfahan province, Iran. This village has two historical castles that are more than 400 years old. The village is also called A'bkharoon in the local dialect. In ancient times, the village consisted of seven castles (fortresses) which were: Azarkhvaran, Abkhoran, Dehchi, Diyeh Khoran, Kouhak, Dasht Jahan, Dasht-e Aseman. Among them, Azarkhvaran is considered the central fortress. The name Jargaviyeh is derived from Kuh-e Bacheh or Kouchak Kooh, which is located in Azarkhavaran. Azarkhoran means the splendour and glory of fire, or the land of fiery glory. Azarkhorans have always been the centre and capital of Jargaviyeh, except for the last 50 years.

name: next to the river
description:
Nice place near the river on the Dena National Park. Lots of places. Locals come also for pic-nic.
Beautiful mountain views
You can go at the parking site 1km futher to do the nice loop hike (6km) in the beautiful landscape
You have to pay 500 000 rials entrance fees for the National Park. (2 people and car) 
OK with pets

name: wild camping near beautiful wetland
description:
You can stay at this place in front of the beautiful wetland with lots of animals.
Quiet at night. Some locals during the days
You can explore the wetland in a dirt road. No need 4x4

name: Hotel Shadi
description: A simple hotel with large indoor parking. I was quoted IRR3,000,000 (approx USD11) for a room with 3 beds but after bargaining, I paid IRR2,500,000. Room has a/c, fridge & tv but toilet is outside (sharing). Reception didnt speak English. Theres a restaurant & a bakery nearby.

name: Zagros Hotel
description: An okay hotel for a night or two. Double bedroom is IRR2,700,000 but after discount I paid IRR2,400,000 inclusive breakfast. Room with attached shower & iranian toilet, a/c and fridge. Cleanliness is acceptable. Wide gated parking at the back of the hotel but unsure if big rigs can pass through the gate.

name: Hotel Asia
description: Clean hotel with complimentary breakfast. Paid IRR3,600,000 (approx USD13). Western & Iranian toilets. Theres a fridge, TV & a/c in the room with 2 bottles of complimentary drinking water. Secured indoor garage just next to the hotel. Ask for room not facing the main road (noisy).

name: Yaseen Restaurant
description: Local restaurant on the road.  They have the typical Iranian food: chicken, lamb, bread, salad... It's ok. You can stop with the car in front.  Nice to diner at their "tables" when the hot has dropped.  There is a clean toilet.

name: Best supermarket with lots of choices
description:
We find this supermarket with lots of products choices.
Affordable prices. You can find toilet paper...
No fruits and vegetables
Good bread just in front of it

name: Saholan cave
description:
Beautiful small cave with a nice lake inside. Included is a boat trip on the lake.
Entrance 250.000 Rial.
Underneath the cave in a small valley with a picnic place. For 300.000 Rial you can spent a quit night here  Water and toilets available.

name: Photographer for identity photos
description:
Friendly photographer, if you need identity photos for your extension visa.
It's quick and we paid 400 000 rials for 6 photos.
You can also do copy

name: wild camping between oaks
description:
Just in front of the Masleskooh Valley, there is plenty of space between oaks trees.
There is a beautiful view on the mountains.
We spent a very quiet night here
Easy access for all vehicles
But no water on the river

name: Saholan cave picnic place
description:
There is a picnic place close to the cave. We paid 300.000 Rial to the guard and spend a quiet night. Water and toilets available.
The cave with underground lake is worth a visit.

name: Kashan mosque
description: A very quiet parking next to a beautiful mosque

name: hoseiniyeh jajarmi
description: Jajarmi historical house belongs to the late Qajar period and is located in Bojnourd, East Taleghani street, Jajarmi alley, and this work was registered on August 8, 2004 with registration number 11051 as one of the national monuments of Iran. [1] This building is in fact  Haj Ali Akbar Jajarmi's personal home.  Hewas one of the merchants of Jajarm city and a representative of Bojnourd in the National Assembly.

name: Iran4WD
description: very professional workshop for 4x4 vehicles. They replaced  the leave springs and shock absorbers of our Toyota Landcruiser. The owner is called Vahid and speaks English. Vahid is a former Iranian rally champion and also leads tourist groups on challenging off road trips through the desert. http://iran4wd.com/ mob phone / WhatsApp +98 912 509 0823

name: Senic wild campside
description: Nice camp site for one car. Spectacular view till the Caspian sea. wind protected. bring your own fire wood. good place for short hikes. stayed here for two nights.

name: Park
description:
A park near a town like many others in Iran. Busy in the evening, especially in the weekend and holidays. But pretty big with a lot of picknick places.  We had a quiet night even though it was crowded because of a public day off. 

There is a deer park and play garden for the kids. We saw a cafe but not open (maybe later in the night) and couldn't find toilets but they might be here.

The road from the south was pretty challenging ( find your way through a little village and than a bumpy gravel road). Way from the north is easier.

name: Diesel
description:
Although we arranged the card of a truck driver, the attendant send us aside to give us diesel from cans ( he said it is the same diesel but get it like this because we don't have a card). 

We paid 500.000 IRR  for about 30 liter (so way too much. Better to set the price beforehand, if that works 😉).

name: car and bike wash
description: great place to clean vehicles. friendly owner.

name: Shanyub Hostel
description:
A nice small Hostel direkt on the Beach Siarat.
The people are friendly,the House is Clean and the shower is warm. Im Here with motorcycle,the motorcycle can stay Inside the Hostel. I paid 10 € at night includet breakfast and Tee Time.

name: Hotel Kavir
description:
impressive on the outside, run down on the inside, as at Jun 22, currently undergoing some renovations.

Has very secure parking for multiple motorcycles and a car.

just around the corner from the train station and the Pakistan Embassy.

Numerous coffee shops and food places to eat, as well as small supermarket to stock up on snacks for your journey to Quetta.

name: Private villa
description: A private villa in something like a private condominium. Several rooms with air con and two showers. Safe parking. No wifi and internet reception via phone only possible outside the building due to weak signal. There is something like a private beach belonging to the condo. Owner speaks English. We stayed four nights and payed eighty dollar per night. Tel +98 911 392 8086 . or +98 937 007 0772

name: Fuelstation with dieselcard
description: Friendly staff with dieselcard, 6000 rial / liter.

name: Diesel
description: We could use the card of a truck driver. They seemed to work out a price together with the attendant.  1m IRR for 30 litres.

name: Hotel Kadus
description: Very nice upper class hotel. we paid 13 million Real / 40 Euro for two person per night incl. breakfast. Stayed three nights. Good place if you need some place to rest and for a site from where to explore the surrounding area of Rasht. Internet is fast in the lobby but slow in the rooms. spacious secured  parking, should also be possible for bigger rigs. www.kadus-hotel.ir,    kadushotel@gmail.com, +98 (13) 3336 5070-8

name: Forest
description: Perfect campsite at a dead end dirt road. Easy access for 4wd and motorcycles. Not for huge rigs. Had a quiet night here. plenty of wood. nice reception. stream nearby for water. At 1300 meters elevation, so not too hot. only a few beekeepers on the way up.

name: Peridot Cottage
description:
Friendly guest house with air conditioning in the rooms and secure parking for multiple motorcycles and cars (possibly 5).

Cheap, clean and great host who speaks very good English.

Short walk if you need to extend your visa.

Can book through Booking.com or give the host (Nawaz Malik) a call/WhatsApp on +923061674744 or email peridotcottage@gmail.com

name: Bahar Hostel
description: Hostel, private and shared rooms, old furniture, only shared bathrooms and showers, 10 euro/night for shared dorm, but with place for bicycles and motorcycles inside the yard. 14 minutes walk from main bazar. I had a good time because of the people I have met here but the accomodation can be better. I choused it because it has place for my motorcycle.

name: wild camping
description: we were looking for place over weekend which was not crowd and littered. The location is seven km away from the highway in the hills. accessable via a dirt track. 4x4 not necessary. plenty of space also for big rigs.  very quiet place. even on a weekend we were alone. there is some kind of agricultural cooperative in the neighbourhood which did not disturb us.  surface is gravel and earth. no shade, no phone internet reception. advantage: it is very close to the police HQ where you can pick up  the Iranian number plates.

name: Hotel Selin
description: Good room, good parking, friendly staff and owner. Breakfast included. great mountain views.

name: Iran Touring and Tourism Hotel
description: Excellent bungalow style rooms with great parking for bikes and vehicles. Right across from the lake. Great place to chill for a couple of days. On site restaurant is good but expensive with the taxes added. Other places short walk away. Definitely recommend this place

name: Grand Hotel
description: Stay here ONLY as a last resort. Very overpriced. Dez was closed for renovations and everything else in town was booked up. See pictures for 2 better options

name: Teachers House
description: This is the place to stay if you want to see the Fire Mountain at Tashkooh. No signs in English but look for the road with the castle looking structure. 250k per night. Clean room but very basic. It's about 30 minutes to Tashkooh.

name: Tashkooh Fire Mountain
description: Methane gas fires coming from the ground. similar to the fires in Yanartas Turkey. easily accessible from the road. VERY quiet area at night. 45mins ride from Ramhormoz.

name: Julfa Hotel
description: Right nextdoor to the Vank Cathedral and walking distance to many other sights...a good 3 Star place with great parking for motorcycles (basement). €20 with breakfast.

name: Mahzan Hotel
description:
3+ Star hotel for €25 per night. W
alking distance to the main attractions, restaurants and cafes short walk away also. Excellent inside security parking.

name: Who Knows
description: Decent shop that can help with parts and repairs

name: Mina and Saeed Ecolodge
description: This will be a great place once finished. Amazing views of Mount Damavand and valley below. Saeed is a great guy and speaks excellent English. This place needs just a little more time before it's fully functional. Worth a visit but expect basic conditions only.

name: Parastoo Hotel
description: A throwback to the 70's! Right on the beach and with a great place to sit and just look at the Caspian Sea. Basic rooms, ok for a night. Close to shops and restaurants.

name: Masuleh Tradisional Hotel
description: Mehdi the owner speaks perfect English and is a great guy. Beautiful room's with balcony and safe parking for bikes right in front of the room. Call or message Mehdi in advance and tell him you're on motorcycles and he'll get the best rooms for the bikes. See contact details in pictures

name: Hotel Payam
description: 3 Star hotel with massive parking area, enough for 20 big rigs! Set back off the main road you'll see a security gate,  ride thru and hotel is about 300m up the driveway. USD 23 per night. Big room and nice grounds with a small lake. Food nearby and there's a kebab (of course) shop on the lake.

name: Grand Hotel
description: A nice 3.5 star place ok for a night. 27 Euro for a double room with breakfast. Parking is off street and ok for bikes and vehicles.

name: Good Food no name in English
description: Clean place with good food and picture menu in English. Friendly owner. Opens 8am till late. Directly next-door to Darya Guesthouse. Recommended.

name: Café Q
description: Almost all restaurants were closed so we ended up at this cafe and wow did they have good food, music and coffee! We really recommend the bacon fries.

name: Gilan View
description:
Off the beaten track place with a great view. Its close to the street but there is no traffic during the night. Also you are visible from the places around but no one came by.
Perfect sunset place - can be windy.

name: water source next to a small restaurant
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User states the water is potable

one of many water sources along the road. unlike at others places there is also a 8 m  plastic house for refilling. adjacent there is a small restaurant.

name: money exchange
description:
a local advised me to go here. 
1€ = 310 000 Rial
1$ = 182 pakistan rupee

name: Hotel Shayan Tabriz
description:
Great hotel in Tabriz. Very new and modern and clean. By far the best hotel we stayed in our 3 wks in Iran. Has a garage where we could park our motorcycles. People very kind and helpful. Also has a restaurant and coffee shop. Price we payed was 6.500.000 Rials. To the Bazar it is 17min in Taxi (aprox. 300.000 Rials). 
Google Maps:

هتل شایان تبریز/hotel shayan tabriz
+98 41 3443 4148
https://goo.gl/maps/mkLMw6GDC4gzQYoVA

name: Roadside
description: Wild camping with beautiful view over the mountains. Flat area just next to the dirt road with a beautiful view. Very good internet reception. You have to leave the asphalt road for 2 km in a dirt road in good condition. Very quiet at night. You can only hear shepherds around.

name: Chamkhansara Ecolodge
description:
Cozy little lodge with about 5 rooms but quite comfortable and with great attention from the hosts. Very quiet and a bit hidden. Great breakfast. 

https://www.google.com/maps?q=37.045536,50.445117&entry=gps&shorturl=1

name: River spot near Bisheh waterfall
description: We went to visit the Bisheh waterfall on a Wednesday in June.  The waterfall is beautiful but there were many people, too much.  It is a very touristic place for local people.  We had to pay 500,000 rials for the parking.  We left right away. We went to look for a quieter place to camp.  We followed the river and found this site next to the river bank.  Coming from the waterfall, cross the bridge and take the first path on the left to the river.  The path has stones but I think that slowly you get there with any vehicle. From the road they see you, but it is a road with little traffic.  We were very quiet here, nobody said anything to us, and the night was very quiet.  There are some fishermen in the area.

name: Teheran heritage hostel
description: Nice and modern hostel with alla facilities, shared and private bedrooms. Space for parking small motorcycles

name: Mountain flats
description: Nice spot, many flat parking options. No services, nobody around. Poor GSM signal. Steep gravel road but accessible 2WD. Access from the main road between a small opening in the road concrete wall.

name: Good fish restaurant and fish farm
description: It is a fish farm where you can buy trout and also let them cook it for you. They have a beautiful garden and picnic huts where you can eat and chill. Good prices. Really recommended.

name: Heritage Hostel
description: Modern hostel in great position, accepts credit cards and offers many services. Secure parking for motorcycles is available.

name: In the mountain easy access
description: Could not find the I overlander spot below. But keep driving 50m and you'll find a nice flat spot, very quiet!

name: Javad Fallah Off-road garage
description: Here you can make any upgrades to your vehicle and also mechanical work. We spent several days with Javad and his team to replace our front axle sealing and get a second tank for diesel. Javad is a great professional!

name: camping en la playa
description:
Campsite next to the Caspian Sea with a restaurant and facilities. It is fenced and has surveillance
Camping al lado del mar Caspio con restaurante y equipamientos. Esta  vallado y tiene vigilancia

name: Stork Castle
description: Here the storks have built large nests on the rocks.

name: Adonis fuel station
description:
petrol station, supermarket, wc.
پمپ بنزین، سوپر مارکت، سرویس بهداشتی

name: shurmaze aziz
description: kurdish cultural food named shurmaze , awesome food

name: kazemi car repair
description: so professional and good man , repair my truckcamper in best way

name: dinj spa and massage
description: very good place for taking massage and relax , arrived here and take massage and shower was very good , owner Reza baba is awesome man so kind and helpful

name: Watertap in Suza
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: User confirms the water is potable

Good water tap at the end of the road. You’ll find it on the right side opposite the fire station.

name: canyon Reghz
description: The previous coordinates that says parking is the begining of the road. Here is the actual parking place. Just for your information, you can hike a part of the canyon on your own, there are some natural steps and handelbars to help you climb, it just stops at a point where you really need climbing equipment. If your not comfortable with this you can take a guide. Watch out that they don’t ask too much because they really want to push you for a guide. It’s perfect if you want one but if not they don’t really get it. And then ofcourse you can do the real canyoning. It takes a full day and there are 2 guides that do this. Prices are very different so is the quality of materials.

name: Lake camping
description: It’s a nice spot at a lake. We were here on a Friday so it was busy with locals doing some fishing, bbq, the usual. We had a quiet night here, in the morning all the locals were gone so they didn’t sleep here, just picknick. There were also young militaries having a ‘trainingcamp’ (doing kayak and stuff like this) here but nobody bothered us. We don’t now if the camp was temporarily or not.

name: Majanan
description: very beautiful place , friendly family , good iranian food , you can stay with family or your camper or tent here , with different prices , you can ride horses and training

name: Save parking Dorud
description:
This is the safe parking of Hamid. Short-term or long-term, overnight and sleeping possible. 

We left the van here while we took a trip with the train from Dorud to Andimeshk.

Hamid and his son Mohammad, who speeks some English, are amazingly friendly and helpful. Not many tourists come here so the whole neighborhood will take care of you. The place is guarded during the day and locked at night. There is a toilet and the train station is 5-10min walk away. It's really central so some noise in the evening but nothing too bad.

To reach, take the small road on the right side of the bridge and not the bridge itself. Nothing for big rigs. Sprinter and a bit larger ok. Gate is 3m high and 3,5m wide. You can get in touch with Mohammad through WhatsApp at +989027366925

The train ride goes thru one of the most astonishing landscapes we've seen in Iran. Look it up!

name: Vali’s homestay
description:
Vali is an open eccentric and funny guy who runs with his wife and sister this small homestay (2 rooms for 2 people each)
Vali is a tour guide and speaks perfect English,he is also a carpet seller and restorer.
His wife is an excellent cook.
12 € per night breakfast included
5 € dinner per person
Could park our motorbike inside the house.

name: Torkaman sahraa
description:
Nice spot for camping with 360 view to the edge of the earth. 
Very safe and nice people around , many sheeps and horses are here ,best season is spring because all the gross are green , in summer they are become yellow but still interesting

name: The altogether unexpected hill
description: Under the hills and over the hills the path led, through beautiful scenery and tiny villages. And then, right before this spot you’ll find an easily accessible track on your right. Follow it up the hill and voila, you find yourself in a great spot with a magnificent view and LTE internet reach. Also; no trash and lots of shade.

name: Where the sun sails and the moon walks
description: An amazing spot overlooking the incredible gorge. From the main road turn left on a gravel road (a little further than the viewpoint spot on Google) towards some sort of communication tower. Keep going (take the right path away from the communication tower) at the end is a good spot. No shade but great view. Even some stairs going a bit down into the gorge. The bridge is gone but the stairs remained. We had a beautiful quiet night here, out of sight but with many stars in the sky. Lovely for one night (as there’s no shade), doable by a 2wd

name: Dirt Road
description: Nice spot to stay for the night and escape the heat, it’s at 2300m so pretty good on hot days and the sun disappears behind a mountain at 6pm in June which also helps. It’s located a couple hundred meters from the street driving up a dirt road. There are several fireplaces and some shepherds in the distance.

name: Above Manshad
description:
Nice spot above 2600m perfect for hot summer weather. It’s located above Manshad. The place is relatively hidden from the road, but cars that come down the pass might be able to see you during the day. In our case nobody stopped. In the morning there are the usual shepherds. 
There is perfect reception with Iran cell. 
To get here drive up the pass and turn off the road in the corner with the three trees, there is a small leveled plateau for 2-3 cars.

name: Coffee place
description: There is a water tap just in front of @coffee_amin . It has the ¾” threat. We asked them and it is okay to get some water.

name: Hamedan
description: Perfect spot to get some water. All locals fill their bottles and tanks to the top, really good quality. Can get really busy at times but there are 7 taps available.

name: Baghi village tourist house
description: Small house in a village away from the city.  Iranian standard.  No WiFi.  Enclosed courtyard where the motorcycles can be parked safely.

name: kowsarinsurance
description: Right next to Zhaman restaurant. Fast, uncomplicated processing.  We have the necessary coverage for the motorcycle without an entry for Iran in the green insurance card.  Motorbike with 1000cc and for 30 days costs about 32$

name: Passport/immigration office for Visa extension
description: We got our visas extended, took us 1,5h, few questions asked (hotel, fathers name, two passport pictures) and 550.000 rial.

name: Saina Hotel
description: Apartment-hotel… you can cook in the room.  Next to shops.  Very friendly staff.  Possibility to make a washing machine…

name: On the park
description: Good tap pressure… in the park…it’s perfect

name: Saqqez
description: Saqqez hotel with closed parking garage. Price: 3000000Rial (10€)

name: Quite Camp close to Ali Sadr
description:
This is probably the best place to camp if you want to visit Ali Sadr Cave. Just 10 min drive away.  

A group of old willow trees and a walled pool/pond with clear water. Behind a quarry. Seems to be used for picknick and by Shepards.
From the main road follow the wide and good gravel road at the end of the village to the quarry above it. Don't turn right to the quarry but go straight to get behind it.

We had a very quiet night, no visitors, just a lot of wind but you are protected. Far enough from the main road, only visible from the gravel road into the valley.

name: Kalan Cottage Hostel
description: Nice traditional stay. Very clean rooms with nice inner garden. Payed 15 euros for a private room, double bed (low season). There is a private parking for up to 2 motorbikes. No option for big rigs, alley too narrow I guess. You can order meals on the site. Basic English but with any translator you will do just fine.

name: Motorcycle camping on meadow
description: read comment on spot next to here. only access by MC but a bit hidden from the road. some trees and bushes to hide behind. felt safe. locals are also camping higher up on similar meadows.

name: picnic place at bridge
description: was here in daytime. nobody here. local picnic place with several  flat spots. easy access. not completely hidden, but doubt much traffic on this road at night. river clean. place dirty with plastic. Not a bad spot IMO.

name: Exchange, fair rate, speaks English
description: Smooth exchange, using the accurate rate. No discussions necessary.

name: Hotel Eram
description: Very overpriced hotel but near the center. Price 600000Toman (20€).

name: Next to Trafo station
description: Tap with water, ok pressure, directly at the corner underneath the street lamp.

name: Siniz Hisar Residence
description: An interesting concept with room and bathroom, like a cabin.  Built in the old style with natural materials.  No beds, people traditionally sleep on mats on the floor.  No WiFi.  The motorcycles were safe in the yard.  The host is extremely friendly and accommodating. Food can be ordered.

name: Not far from the highway
description:
We went off the highway to a gravel road and turned at the first option left. It’s good to stay the night wide open landscape. A small hill blocks off most of the noise, it’s well hidden from the highway. There is Reception with Irancell every once in a while. 
A little to the right there is a small water hole where shepherds water their animals.

name: Niayesh Hotel
description: Nice hotel with private parking. One person room = 17€

name: Kooh Mehr House
description: We stayed here to visit Persepolis.  Is a small complex with 3 rooms.  Our room also had a bath.  AC available and sufficient for ventilation.  The building is typical of the country, as it used to be, from original and natural materials.  The host is very friendly, drove us to Persepolis and helped us order dinner.  Alternatively, he also offered us omelets... A kitchen is also available.  But there is no WiFi! Parking with 2 Motorbikes on the yard was no Problem.

name: Best place for Vehicle Insurance / Iran Insurace
description:
The place to go to buy the vehicle insurance. 
8.6 Mio Rial (around 27 Euros) for 30 days.
Don’t forget to bring: Carnet Car Papers Visa Passport
Amazing people.

name: LPG station
description: High pressure LPG station that fills up the gas for cookers and car tanks. If you drive on LPG you need a special adapter that is similar to the German one.

name: Kabood Shopping Center
description: In this shopping center you can get outdoor gear like backpacks, tents, sleeping bags, gas and all other camping and travelling utilities. There are several shops inside the shopping center.

name: Propan / LPG station
description: You can fill gas cookers and LPG tanks for the car here.

name: Park Drh Gahan
description: There is a picknick area with is uses by locals, but also a big Parking just in front of it. It es quiet and sorounded by mountains. There is also a little creek, but it was dry in summer.

name: Riverbed
description:
Nice place in an almost dry riverbed. I dont know how the waterlevel would be in other time of the year.
A view locals came and made a fire, because it was friday. Very quite at night. No nois from the street. No mosquitos but many flies.

name: Malamirhotel
description: Perfect place near to the old town. It has safe and closed parking for cars and motorcycles. Price 1p/1n: 10€

name: At the small river
description: Nice place at a small cristal clear River. Watertrucks come here to get Water. Also locals come here to picknick and refresh themself in the water.

name: Volkswagen Mechanic specialist
description: Ali is a nice guy and has a workshop for Volkswagen cars like t2 t3 t4 golf 3 etc. Its a well equipped workshop and a nice guy. He speaks a bit German

name: kalehin
description: A pleasant place for day camping.  Water and toilets are available in the neighborhood.

name: Khorshid Hotel (Motel Sun)
description: A small Iranian style hotel.  Lots of workers in the hotel but not detrimental.  Very clean and the staff very friendly.  Necessary to negotiate the price, otherwise tourist price.  Double room about 250-350 tons.  (about 8-12 €).  WiFi only in the lobby.  Motorbikes could be parked in the backyard.  The rooms facing the street are a bit noisy but not disturbing.

name: Atlasi Hotel
description: Nice hotel in the Centre of Kashan. No parking at the hotel but they have closed parking at 500m.

name: Gas Station Diesel
description: We came down the mountain, asked for Diesel and got it with the station‘s card. We payed 6000 Rial per liter (18.Jul.2022)

name: Orosi Hostel
description: Very nice hostel in city Centre. The owner is very nice. Price 10€ dormitory. I could park my motorcycle inside.

name: Almsafir (traveler hotel)
description: Simple, clean hotel.  $25 a room for two with air conditioning with breakfast. Large guarded private car park.  Well located.  Don’t speak English.

name: Emarat Pedari (jameei)
description: it's a very nice hotel with a nice courtyard. the guy at the reception speaks good enough English and is really friendly. the rooms have ac and a western bathroom, breakfast included. He charged me 300.000 tomans. Motorbikes can park inside the garden, carpark nearby.

name: Parking Lot
description: Parking next to a park and tower of silence. Huge opening suitable for any car. really quiet at night. Beside a park and not far from tower of silence.

name: Roadside
description: Water tank on the road. Self-service water refill. big tank with two hoses. sign states 2000 Toman for 20L. Money is paid in a steel box.

name: Car Wash
description: Car Wash, 800k rials. Very good service and friendly people.

name: Deh Bala
description: Flat parking area next to a local restaurant. You can stay for free if you have a meal there. The prices are very competitive from 400k to a few million rials for a big plate of food. The menu is simple, mainly consisting of meat kebab, rice and chicken but it is fresh. You can have a shower on request and have electricity in the restaurant. The owner is very friendly and kind. Also the place is at around 3000m of altitude, so it is cool to sleep despite the season.

name: GENO Hotel
description: This is the place to go if you are looking for a Hotel in Bandar Abbas before/after shipping your vehicle to the UAE or visiting Hormuz for a day. Just finishing a full restoration and the rooms are brand new, spacious,with European toilets and freezing cold AC. They have 24hr CCTV and a spacious parking area, also 24hr front desk and the two brothers running the place are very professional, friendly and helpful. Farhad speaks a very good English. The price for a double room per night is around 6mil rials (18euros) the standard price for Bandar Abbas but you won't stay in such a nice hotel. Located right across the beach and on a clear day you can see Hormuz on the horizon. We had a pleasant stay in July (no chance camping outside, way too hot and humid).

name: Filoo Vegan Food
description: A food truck close to Shahrzad Restaurant. They serve vegan hamburgers and sides which are delicious. Very nice owner explained to me about his food creation. Being a meat-eater, this was a very refreshing experience to learn how great vegan can taste. Highly recommend!

name: Saghand
description: Diesel available without fuel card, nice personnel

name: iran insurance
description:
you can get here by the Iran Insurance office, your insurance for iran, 8-14h open
43$ for 2 month, much chaeaper than at the border.
it took 20min

name: quarry by the road
description: quarry beside the road on a little hill, bit out of view from the road, but still close. almost no auto driving in the evening. quite and nice view .there is a football field too may be good for tend

name: Eller Baghi park urmia
description:
big park, bit crouded on friday, and close to a big street. bit noisy,in the night better. but really close to downtown, where you can find, all you need.
water tabs, and toilets.

name: car/truck wash
description: good place for wash your vehicle after maranjab, we where really dirty, wash completly, with soap and bottom of the truck, 2.500.000rial, nice people and good job done. outside on street some little repair/oilchange shop. i guess you can find also place for grease your car

name: parking in the city
description:
parking place in the city of shiraz, nothing special but safe and pretty quite, next to the street but not much traffic .locals jogging or riding bicicle in the afternoon, good spot for visiting the city, and accesible for big trucks.
close by also other spot, directly nearby the municipality office.

name: Launderyservice at the Hotel
description:
Launderyservice organised by the Hotel. Perfect professional Cleaning!
They wanted to charge me 5 Mio. But the Hotelmanager got Discount so i paid 4 Mio. for about 10kg.
The Best i had so far in Iran!

name: Maharloo Lake
description: Nice Spot at Maharloo Salt Lake, Witch easy to reach. There is a small dry dirt Road Leading into the Lake. 2 Wheel Drive okey.

name: Mandegar Hotel
description:
Clean and quiet hotel with a nice lounge. Friendly staff. Hot shower with lots of water. 10€ for a double room. Private parking behind the hotel.

breakfast included: 12€

name: Mr. Fel
description: Falafel self service restaurant with other options like burgers, hot dogs and pizza. Great for when your fed up with all the kebab joints.

name: VW car service
description: VW specialized car service - apperently one of the few in the whole region. The man helped us a lot to fix our cooling fan and even had the correct parts there.

name: Off Lar Road
description: Verry quiet place with an amazing view.

name: Flat campground with view to Damavand
description: Big flat area with great view to Damavand. Apart from a shepperd we are alone, despite the weekend. A little windy, a bit further down the dirt track Iranian have their picknick. Probably not suitable in winter with snow. 4WD not necessary. 4G available.

name: Rooberoo Hostel
description: good place to stay in Tehran. They have a little yard where you can park a motorcycle, the place is very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. payment can be made in Rials, Euro and USD.

name: Quite spot at the beach
description: Beautiful and quite spot directly at the sandy beach. Water is clean, not so much waste there. Locals in the evening, but quite at night. Bakery and grocery store at the main road 200m, water at the restaurant at the entry of the lane.

name: water source
description: water source right by the street, close to a small kiosk and naan place

name: Route 72
description: Nice place under a tree with beautiful sights. Just 100 m off the road. Further down is a Nomad Tent. They came to me and said hello, wanted to invite me to visit. The sky at night was magnificent.

name: parking in the city
description: lange quite place. looks like a parking place but nobody is here. really quite and close to the center. also easy to reach for big rig. some tree for shade

name: Yavari camping garden
description: This place is located at the Heyran major road that has a beautiful scenery. You can camping in garden or there are cabins to stay. Also, there are facilities such as WC and bathroom to take a nice shower there. They support ordering food from restaurants that they know. This place is so cozy and peaceful and owners are so friendly.

name: Ali Sadoon Exchange
description: Professional money exchange company. They had good rates and let me skip the row every time I was there for money exchange (4x)

name: Nomad camp  spot
description: Very nice camp spot of the grid, only shepherds around. Calm during the night. 4WD required, 4G. River available

name: Iran insurance
description:
I renewed my car insurance here three times.
Costs round about 30 dollars for 30 days.

Enter the building, take the left elevator to the second floor. After leaving the elevator go to the office on the right. They can help you. 
See added picture for the (Farsi) name of the guy who did it for me every time.

name: shalu road
description:
nice spot for camping. beautiful view of bridges and  Karoun river. safe, we camped for 3nights in our truckcamper and kind people helped us fetching fresh water and bread and even lpg for cooking.
only for 4x4 cars

name: Behrouzi Garden
description: A beautiful apple garden with the river running and tall trees and a hill at the back for hiking. There's a spring with potable water nearby. no internet but enough signal for making phone calls. 2 wc and tap water and some shelters available. I stayed there for 3 peaceful nights. The owner (Mr. Behrouzi) is a nice and helpful man. you can stay in the garden for almost nothing (5-10$). if you have any problem communicating with the owner, just tell him to call Nima (he has my number) and i'll translate your conversation over the phone :)

name: Shah-ghasem dam
description: slope ending in a lake. but many flat surfaces built like the one in the pic. there's a small amount of entrance fee. nice view of the lake, oak trees and Yasuj city. avoid weekends cuz it would be crowded.

name: Dalan Hotel
description:
this tradioanal hotel is located in the Zoroastrian neighborhood (Dastooran) in the center of the city, and its close to temple of fire.
the place is really nice with a great atmosphere .
they offer rooms with double and twin beds and en suite with almost 20 USD/night.

name: Garage Resa very good garage
description:
We come to mr.resa with some engine problems with our fiat ducato.
They solve the problem very quick and manged to organise original parts from fiat from dubai.
highly recommend.
mis. resa was cooking all the time for us and you can take hot shower.
and in the waiting time the wife from one of the mechanic give us a free city tour.

name: Iran embassy
description: We arrived at 10:00 and walked out ar 10:25 with our new visa. We had a RN-number and they helped us fast. No extra documents or photos needed, only the document with RN-number. Payment is inside the embassy, they asked 150000 Iraqi dinar for 2 passports/visa, but we could pay in Euro or USD as well.

name: Abandoned hotel
description: It used to be a really fancy hotel in its heyday, now it’s completely abandoned. Nice short detour to or from Amedi.

name: Rawandiz canyon viewpoint
description: Best viewpoint of the canyon we’ve seen. On top of this mountain is a resort/holiday park. Entree is 2000 dinar per car. Follow the gondola or walk to the edge of the cliff and enjoy the view.

name: Neanthertaler cave parking
description:
Right after the entrance gate is a new parking area. Very quiet! Toilets, shower and water are in a building next to the entrance. They close the gate at night and had no problem with us camping. The Pershmerga guards were  very friendly and offered us to sleep in there building.

The cave itself is a short hike uphill. Entrance is free. Unfortunately not much to see because all the excavations.

name: Sulaymaniyah Tourism Park Area
description: Marked one of a few entry ways to the park area. Locals stop here for tea and rest. We followed the track up the hill for about 500m there is a big open space with nice landscape in the back. Stayed one night and no one walked or drove past. It’s close to the road so you will hear some noise but not too loud. The entry way is a bit narrow and tree branches are low so I would say not big rig friendly.

name: Grassy area next to dried out river.
description: Good overnight spot close to road. There are some houses nearby but no one cared. Road noise is almost not there. It’s grassy but with stones so not perfect for tents. Can fit big rigs.

name: Big supermarket
description: Big supermarket with quite a lot of choice.

name: Tire shop
description:
Great tire shop with competitive prices. They found our special tires quickly and half price compared to Iran. 
Very welcoming owners, offered us tea. Good point : one of the owners speak perfect english. Thanks to him, we found the right tires quickly. They can also help you for other issues. Contact whatsapp : +9647701180402

name: Lalesh village
description:
Interesting village and one of the most beautiful and authentic places that we have seen in Iraqi Kurdistan. 
One of the holiest places of Yazidism is Lalish which has a very holy Yazidi temple. 
The most peculiar thing about Lalish : You can’t wear shoes and you need to walk around barefoot. At the entrance of the village, there is a police checkpoint and they tell you to leave your shoes there. Very friendly, they offered us water on our way back. Very nice experience. It's about 1 hour ride from Dohuk, in the hills. There is asfalt till the village but a small part is in a little bit bad condition.

name: Parking next to a cafe with view on the dam
description:
Large parking next to the Abdo cafe. There is a barrier that seems to be always open (and very old). When we came there in the afternoon, nobody was at the entrance but late in the evening, it seems you have to pay. But nobody told us anything. 
There are also some trees for shadow. Can sometimes catch wifi from the cafe.
The parking is located just above Duhok Paradise, a big complexe with restaurants, shisha cafes and a small attraction parc. We stayed 1 night during the week and it gets quite busy, music till 1 am. So can imagine it's much crowded during a weekend.
It's not a peaceful place but if you want to go out, it's the prefect place to see kurdish night life. But people are nice, no troubles at all. Not only for young people but also for families.

name: Lake Dokan view
description: On a forested hill overlooking Lake Dokan. There is a large open area and a path between the trees leading to a smaller area closer to the lake

name: Dolphin Hotel
description: OKish hotel with a friendly and helpful owner and a fair price. Very good location close to the lively bazar. I paid € 18 for the first night and € 15 for the second for a 1 person private room with private bathroom. Camera controlled parking available

name: Land mines
description: Nice viewpoint, however the area outside the walls are land mined, so stay away from there

name: Old Post money exchange street
description: In this part of the bazar you can find all the money changers behind their little tables. They give good exchange rates

name: Valley near Duhok
description: Valley near Duhok. On Friday some locals picnicking, quiet after sunset. Full 3G reception with Korak. In autumn no water in the river.

name: Spring and caves
description: Down the road there is a flat area for parking, not visible from the road and quiet at night. Some road noise in the evening and morning. There is a spring where locals fill their jerrycans, so probably safe to drink. Also some caves and an unused pool

name: Carrefour
description:
Yeah for real...
A real carrefour almost like in europe.
In the  big Family shopping mall.
There is also a burger king and a lot of other fast food and clothing shops.
Also a couple of atms

name: Low Bridge
description:
Read comment. 
Only about 2,5m high clearance bridge. Dont know if there is another bridge

name: River Camp
description:
Beautiful camp on some grass next to a small river.
Between some trees.
In the 2 nights i was there 3 people came by. So very quiet.
There are some old fires so maybe sometimes some picnicers
Some garbage around

name: grass field
description:
A grass field next to the road to the monastery. There is a toilet building. But the toilets are full of garbage but there is a sink you can use.
If you come to the village you will meet police man Ihab, he speaks good english and can show you around and help you. Nice guy. Nice place.

name: river camp
description:
Some flat grassy/pebble area where the locals come to picnic.
But very quiet. To get down from the road its a bit tricky but ok.
A lot of space and really nice views. 

This camp is in PKK territory! The very secure checkpoint is about halfway between the roundabout and the given coordinates. Passing through is not possible, at least in the spring!

name: Fields
description:
Quiet place a bit further from the road. End of the gravel path. Only sheep and cows in the area and some people for picknick in the distance. You can drive further in the direction of the river.
Path can be a bit muddy and bumpy, but maybe doable in normal car if you go slowly.

name: Picknick spot
description: People picnic a lot here just next to the main road. There is a gravel path through the fields that leads to this spot. You are a bit further from the road (still visible), which is nice. People were picknicking here as well. Everything quiet at night. Beware: no shelter from sun or wind. Nice walk down the hill to the river.

name: In the hills
description: A lot of picknicking going on next to the road. We drove a bit further into the hills. Stayed there for two nights. Very quiet. Not visible from the road. Had to leave because the farmer wanted to plough the field and we would get stuck. It was no problem that we had stayed there, he said.

name: Hill view
description:
The whole area can be really busy on Friday's with good weather, with people picknicking. This spot is relatively out of sight and has a nice view of the hills at the other sight.
No trees for cover. Road is visible on maps.me
We just parked on a spot that is not being used by farmers. Stayed two nights without problems.

name: Water source
description:
Water source in a village. Can't connect hose to, so bring a jerrycan. According to locals it is potable. Be aware: if you drive further on to the mountains (direction east), you maybe also get stopped by the police. They said the president lives in the area. Police was friendly though.
Road to the village is on maps.me

name: Picknick hill
description:
This whole area is used for picnicking. Alongside the river and up the hill are a lot of places for picnicking and camping. Can be some trash from locals.
Coordinates are for the dirt path leading you there.

name: Pirmam area
description: Pinpoint is not exactly a checkpoint. This is a warning for the whole Pirmam (Massif) area. The Barzani family lives here, so they don't like foreigners to stay in this area. We've got sent away somewhere on the road to the water point more east, after two nights of very nice wildcamping. So beware, camping in the Pirmam area is allowed. But don't stay to long or expect to be sent away by the Asayish (homeland security). They are very strict in this area.

name: Tree camp next to river
description:
A nice spot next to a (brown) river. There are a lot of spots there, so probably a popular place for picknicking as well. There are trees for cover, ideal for hot weather. The surrounding hills are beautiful and nice for walking. The road is close by, but still you feel a little hidden.
Stayed here for 2 nights without problems. Only few locals came by for fishing and picknicking. And we saw some horses and a donkey.

name: Immigration
description:
The office of Kurdistan Immigration. Exact location according to satelite is 36.202174, 43.964846.
The free 30 day visa you get at the border, you can renew here with 1 month for 100.000 IQD pp. Also possible to extend longer.
When trying to renew after Corona lockdown, it took us 1 hour and 15 minutes to complete the procedure. Everybody was very helpful and always pointed us to the right room. You have to visit several rooms, but there were no problems. They speak English.
No phones aloud inside, you have to hand them over at the entrance (you get a card with a number on it, while they hold your phone). Didn't need to bring any documents or pictures to renew with one month, only your passport.
Opening hours normally until 13h, closed on Friday and Saturday.

name: Der kohk
description: An old monastery and able for camping needs 40 minutes hiking to get to this place

name: Grand Hotel Zakho
description:
Great place if you just crossed the Turkey/northern Iraq or planning to stay overnight. $30 for a King size bed and a single bed. 
They allow my motorcycle to be parked inside the hotel with security cameras that is being monitored by a dedicated security. Also there’s a security guard stationed right at the entrance.
Big rigs can park on the street ring by the entrance.
Room and washroom were really clean and the owner made sure that you have everything you need. Also breakfast is included, they even cook the eggs the way you want.
Very generous and hospitable owner.

name: Azadi Park Parking
description: Public parking of the Azadi park in Slemany. They charge 2x a dayticket for overnight stay. Parking is near the musea and the bazar is on walking distance. There are several parkings for this park and we did nit check the other lots. 2021 price is 2000 dinar. Try to park as far from the enterance as possible. If there is a power outage the generators near the entrance will start with a lot a diesel smell and noice.

name: Ahmad Awa picknick parking
description: Flat parking near a cave gallery. No services. We where here in winter time and no people around. Maybe it will be more in weekends and summertime. Nice view into the valley.

name: Haybat Sultan Qashtiyaree Forest
description: Nice place in the uphill forest of Koya.  comming from Koya you can enter the forest via a gravelroad on the lefy side after the first turn. Go a litle bit down into the forest near some ruins. No services. Not big rig friendly.

name: Careffur
description:
Here you can find all you need, SIM cards included (10$ per week.....)

Enjoy and feed french economy :-)
Ciao

name: Car repair Shop
description:
It's a truck workshop, but they fixed our awning, they probably fix everything here. Very nice people, no one spoke English, but we had someone with us who spoke Kurdish. We were not even allowed to pay anything.
really helpful!

name: Car repair
description: Fan was repaired here. Very nice people, but they don't speak English.

name: Dore valley view
description: Silent and clean place with view to Dore Valley. We stayed here with three cars for two nights.

name: Gali Sherana
description: Good place directly on the river, costs for two cars per night 50000 dinar. Highly recommended.

name: Shady place in the valley near Akoyan
description: If you drive from Rawanduz towards Akoyan and after approx. 5 km turn right onto Regay Faqiyan Road and then after about 150m turn left on the dirt road, you will come to the place after about 5 minutes. It is very quiet and clean here.

name: Near River
description: Shade. Nice quiet place by the river.  there is a little rubbish lying around.  Ideal for visiting Lalish village the next day. use Google Satellite to find the place.

name: Flat area in the mountains
description: There are many different places to stay here. Far away from the street. It is very quiet here. There are shadows in the morning and in the evening, during the day only sun. A 4x4 is necessary to achieve the spots.

name: Fields
description:
Large meadow with shade off the road leading to Gome Fellawe.
Very very quiet. Nearby lives a family with their animals. Super view of the mountains!

name: Bike / motorbike bazaar
description: In this region you will find everything for 2 wheels: bicycle and motorbike.

name: Dilnia Insurance
description:
Tower 3, 16th floor, office 6
Jasmin speaks fluently English and will issue a third party or full coverage vehicle insurance for Kurdistan only or the whole country Iraq.
She is from Syria, so her coffee is the best :-)
We payed 40$ for 3rd liability in all Iraq and 30 days. Cash only, $ preferred but Dinar is also possible. 
Parking in front of the door for all kinds of vehicles possible. 
They also have a branch in Sulaymaniyah, if you come from Iran.
E-Mail Contact was easy, they are working on a new website with the possibility to buy online insurance. All in English.
Closed on fridays and saturdays.

name: LPG gas station
description:
A bit hard to find LPG in Iraq :-) LPG is always a bit away from the main petrol station.
Same Adapter like in Turkey, Bulgaria etc.
You are not allowed to operate it yourself, so wait or call for an employee.

name: Place with a view
description:
We found it hard to find an overnight spot with no people. The fireplace shows that from time to time there are people, but we found it quiet and peaceful. A bit windy, but we appreciated that in the heat.
No 4WD needed, went up there with a Passat GT :-)

name: Korek Telecom
description:
For Internet SIM Card and help.
Just go there, where helpfull, very good Service. Speaks English
You can get 5GB for 1000/week

name: Mosul/Kurdistan
description: end of Kurdistan , no was to go on, Mosul is closed

name: shrine of Luqman al-Hakim
description:
Nice place in the open air you can cook in it there is water and mosque for prayer near it. The shrine of Luqman al-Hakim, peace be upon him
---
مكان جميل في الهواء الطلق يمكنك ان تطبخ فية يوجد فية ماء ومسجد للصلاة بلقرب منة

name: Wedding Island Tourist
description:
Beautiful garden where you can cook outdoors - Day Use Pick nick area for families next to the bridge  


حديقة جميلة يمكن ان تطبخ في الهواء الطلق

name: Razzaza Lake
description:
Nice place on the shore of the lake you can do some sports
---
مكان جميل على ساحل البحيرة يمكنك ممارسة بعض الانشطة الرياضية

name: Habbaniyah Lake - بحيرة الحبانية
description:
Nice beach, you can play some water games
---
شطى جميل يمكنك ممارسة بعض الالعاب المائية

name: car repair place - مكان تصليح سيارت
description:
Car repair place of all international models comprehensive industrial
---
مكان تصليح سيارت من جميع الموديلات العالمية
صناعية شاملة

name: Hills
description: Large flat area at the end of the path. Nice views of the surrounding mountains. Some shade available for smaller vehicles (for example VW T4). Quiet. On Friday very friendly locals came to Picknick. We spent a nice afternoon with them. A small water source is available but most likely not drinkable. 50m below is a pool in which you can swim. It had water in November.

name: Grand Auto Service
description:
Great mechanic where some of the staff speak really good English. We had a transmission problem on our VW T4. Although this car is virtually nonexistent in Kurdistan-Iraq they were still able to help us plus they knew a VW spare part shop. We had no appointment but they took care of our issue right away. Their garage is well equipped, modern and clean. They worked on our car for about 3 hours. We found the price we paid really fair. 
They have a separate waiting room which is pretty quiet. They have hot tea and fast wifi. 
They also have a cleaning service (which we did not use)

name: Gravel road
description:
After entering the northern Iraq, it got a bit late and we found this one here.
Easy to access, along the grave road, which goes a bit uphill.
It's not really tidy here, but this is usual in Iraq.
Nevertheless it has been calm and nobody came along. Good For One Night

name: Between Trees
description:
Not easy to find places without military in this area, but this one has been very calm and you're nearly invisible, as this place is surrounded by trees.
The view to the other side is spectacular at sunset, only thing which is a bit disturbing is, that the air smells like sulfur, when you open the door.
But the place has been very tidy, just a few bottles have been lying around.

name: Riverside
description:
On our way to Erbil we found this one here. At the weekend the Irakis as well spent their days here, so here and there it has been a bit crowded, but every single person has been very nice. No problems whatsoever.
The only thing, which is a little drawback are the trucks, which are driving the gravel road along the river. Seems to be kind of a highway.
Therefore, in the daytime it's pretty dusty here, in the evening it got very calm.
The police came along one time, checked our passports and were wondering, why we are staying here (don't know, if they didn't liked this place ;) )
Nevertheless they wished us a good travel

name: Lakeside
description:
We stood here for a few days, as it has been super quite, the evenings had wonderful sunsets and nobody - except one person, which is a friend now - came along.
The place is easy to access and there might be several place like this in this area.
To drone flyers: Always wait for a GPS Signal. A DJI Mavic 2 Pro WILL NOT start once it received GPS satellites, but if you started before a GPS Signal is received and you're above the water, the drone immediately lands, when there are enough satellites.
So it will NOT come back to the home position, it rather lands where it is.
By the way is this happening in the most parts of Iraq.

name: Professional Welding Service
description:
Initially you should expect "Iraki Style" welding (no rust removal, overlapping sheets etc), but once you told him, how it's done, he is able to listen and does what you need... and he's very fast and a friendly guy.
He won't speak english, but translating works (arabic).
So we gave him Phosphor-Acid and Zinc-Spray, for removing the rust and the Zinc for preparing the sheets before welding. He cut out the bad parts and put in new ones - edge on edge (important for german TÜV).
Do not forget to bring Wax or something for rust prevention from the inside, as the guy does not have these things.

For 5 bad areas and 2,5h of work we paid (after negotiation) 142€ (100.000 IQD). Do not forget to heggle... it's common here!

At the end, it turned out as expected, therefore a recommendation from us.

PS: Metal is very expensive here, he gets the material from a nearby company... go with him and also heggle with the metal-company ;)

name: Good Painting Service
description:
We brought our Mercedes Sprinter here with 5 welded areas, which needed to be treated.
The manager is a young and friendly guy, who speaks good english and the painter itself is also friendly, but just speaks arabic.
It's more a bit of "Iraki Style", but he does a halfway good job (we didn't spent so much attention on the details as it hasn't to be too fancy for us)
Nevertheless he's fast and reliable.

At the end we paid r.a. 60€ for everything.

Side-Info: The painting of a complete Sprinter would cost approx. 700 USD and takes 10 days (Info from the manager)

name: Good And Safe Place At A Park
description:
We had lots of car-works to do on our vehicle, so we spent several nights here. Don't be fooled by google maps images, as they seem to be very old.
The area is well developed, in the middle of the surrounding houses is a park (with trashcans), where you can safely park. The side we parked is a bit wider than the others, it has been well lit and nobody felt disturbed by us.

name: Huge Parking Lot
description:
Well lit and huge place, perfect for one night and nearby point of interests.
It's very tidy, flat and leveled as well as guarded by the friendly Police, which came along twice to check, if we are ok.

name: Petra Petrol for Eurodiesel
description:
This station is new and offers - as the only one in Iraq yet, as we've been told - Eurodiesel.
With the standard Diesel you might notice, that it stinks horribly, the car loses power and we had our doubts about our Diesel-Heater.
So this Diesel here is quite good, even if a bit more expensive.

name: Gas and Workshop(s)
description:
