We only stopped here for tightening our axle sleeve. The guy (left garage) speaks a bit english, is very friendly and took a new metal cable tie (gave me 2 in spare) and tightened the sleeve (cost 500 IRQ, 50€ct)

The guy on the right fills gas bottles and was easily able to fill our turkish "ipragaz" bottle (3000 IRQ, 1,80€).

I also asked him, if it's possible to fill up our german bottle and showed him my 6 Euro-Adapters.
He asked me to take the bottle out, so probably he could have filled also this one, but it was nearly full, so we didn't fill it up.

Along the whole street there are lots of little toolshops and the english speaking guy can support you with everything.

name: Iran Embassy
description:
Not easy to find, but here we got our Iran VISA.
It's located on a hill and the roads are very steep.

name: Safe Place At The Police
description:
Not really "Wild Camping", but for overnight stay at the border, we recommend this police station. Friendly officers who're taking lots of car about you. Just ask them for the possibility to stay, as it is not allowed directly at the border (we asked, they denied).
At the Police they offered us using water and toilet.
Wide and calm road, lots of space, even for expedition trucks and bigger rigs.

name: City of Imam Hussein, the trendy visitors
description: Ask the guard if you can park on the parking fir the night. there is an administrative burden but after a half a hour they gave us clearance to park.  alternatifly it is easier and more standard to use the onsite dormitory bedrooms (man woman seperated) over there. This place facilitates loging for the pelgrims. The parking is along the busy Hillah Karbala road but after 23.00 is is quiet till 6.00.

name: Martyrs Monument in Chabaish
description: Guarded parking of the Martyrs Monument in Chabaish. From here you can get also boot tours into the marshes. Ask for Achmed, tourist security, to get permission to stay. Achmed speaks english and escort tourists in this area. He is not a tourist guide! You can use WIFI from the guards.

name: Coffee time
description: Coffee place with good Wi-Fi. Coffee around 3'000 dinar.

name: Grocery store
description: Western style grocery store. Expensive but might be useful if you're looking for specifics.

name: Habanija Lake Tourist City
description:
This is a place in the Tourist City.
You are protected by double Security. Have Toilet, can swim and nice walk.
Parking is free.

name: Uruk
description:
Just in Front of Entrance gate of Uruk, close to Guardhouse.
Ask for permission to stay (like always in Iraq).
Quiet, 4G coverage (Asiacell).

name: Salmanche - Guarded Parking
description:
Large Parking Area for Trucks waiting to go to Iran, Guarded. Directly (left) after the border post. Good spot for the first night in Iraq. 
Ask the Guard, if they deny, ask them to call the manager. He will allow (most likely). All facilities. Quiet at night.

name: Korek Telecom SIM Card Shop
description:
Korek Telecom shop for SIMkart

one of the oldest providers 

or choose Fastlink from the small shops

name: Money Exchange
description: Money exchange from us$,€, tr and Mastercard

name: All kind of car mechanics
description:
It's a district full of all kind of car mechanics. You just drive around and stop at any place that draws your attention. They have many spare parts outside garages here so it's easy to notice who deals with specific car issues. 

We repaired our car right where the pin is located. Good English speaking mechanics.

name: Ice Pack
description: Cafe/Cake shop with really nice facilities, easy street parking outside and very good wifi. Thought it might be helpful if you just arrive in Erbil and need internet to connect with people or find accommodation. Enjoy

name: Parking with a great view on Akre
description: Great parking spot used by locals for picnic. Amazing view on Akre. Very calm and quiet. It's possible to get wate, just ask one of guards near the place. Restaurants, shops and gas station nearby.

name: Korek SIM-Card at Family Mall
description:
In the middle of the mall you can get SIM-Card from Korek.
For 20GB for 1 month use I payed 19000IQD (=appr. 12€).
The guy spoke good English

name: Family Mall-Carefour -ATM
description: There is a ATM for VISA inside the Carrefour Shop. Withdrawal: USD or Dinar

name: FastPay Internet FastLink
description:
Here you can get an eSIM for mobile Internet. I payed 18 000 for one month unlimited (150GB) Internet. Can be used on other devices via hotspot.
You need your passport for registration.

Provider is FastLink

name: ATM -Visa inside the Majidi Mall
description: ATM VISA without fee (DKB) ist Insider the Mall Trade Bank of Iraq for IQD

name: Akoyan region
description: If you want to go south you enter PKK area. The military is not happy if you go there. For me they said it’s okay to go to Akoyan but not further. I stopped in the akoyan valley for lunch but already 20 minutes later some civil military came by and told me it would be safer to go back to rawanduz. They are very kind and refer to security reasons for tourists.

name: Offroadtrack leads to mine field
description: Do not try to take this off-road track going to the water. It leads to unmarked mine fields as you will receive a sms from mine agency.

name: Flower forest
description: In the far NW corner of a large field, somewhat hidden from the (quiet) road by trees. One building nearby which is marked as a restaurant in Google, but no one around. Very quiet at night. Enter field from (37.0302, 43.6965). More fields along this road. Drone circling above.

name: Lakeside
description: For 4x4 and normal Vans. No big vehicles. Private.

name: Zryan Plaza Hotel
description: Erbil is expensive but where else can you get a 4 Star hotel for a little over USD 30 per night with buffet breakfast included? Parking right out front, very friendly staff, great rooms. Definitely worth it.

name: Sivan Motel
description: Decent, clean room's. Older place and showing it's age but ok. Bike parking right in front of reception window. Best we could find, unlike Dolphin where parking was a deserted dirt lot with no security 200m away from the premises. 35K Dinar per night no breakfast. Close to bazaar and food.

name: Basma Al Safeer
description: Excellent place to spend a night. USD 14 with breakfast. Fantastic room. Basement parking for bikes. Close to food and markets.

name: Sulaymaniya.
description: The place is above the amusement park Chaviland.  There are many picnic spots.  In the evening the locals come. Great view

name: Suite Hotel Ararat
description:
6 floor hotel, probably the cheapest in town, good sized rooms, very friendly owner, has air con/heating. parking right outiside from door with visability from reception. feels safe.
Outside hotel, turn right, plenty of places to eat, change money and get Sim cards etc.
owner speaks perfect English and Dutch, plus a little German

name: Hotel Dunya
description:
Fantastic hotel, just a stones throw away from Amedi.
Parking outside, Bikes can be parked in direct sight of 24 hour reception safely.
Rooms are huge, very clean, very well decorated, very modern. large flat screen tv.

Room we had, had a 4 burner stove and fridge/freezer in the room.

name: Laween Hotel
description:
In Akra, it's the only hotel in town, not cheap, but hotels in Kurdistan are not cheap generally, very good hotel, clean, modern, some English spoken.

Parking at the front of hotel

name: Shalamcheh Borderpost
description:
From Iraq to Iran, by foot: 

Very easy crossing.

Iraq side: Phone call was made, I was stamped out. Done.

Iran side: I waited 15 min until the guard let me enter into the immigration hall. Vaccinations were quickly checked, the immigration officers were very friendly and as well stamped me in quickly, just had to show my e-visa printout

BE CAREFUL: After the border controls I got harased by hundreds of taxi drivers. I changed my money on the spot, and lost count of the confusing iranian currency. All those guys saw, that I got heavily scammed and nobody cared. (I got 10$ equivalent instead of 100$) I noticed it afterwards and went back. The police was really helpful and reorganized the missing money in "their way"

name: Entering Iraq
description:
A lot of paper work, probably you need a fixer (I paid 20$). Plus 120$ fees for motorbike 
2,5hours

name: Batifa Road
description: According to the officer, the Batifa-Amedye route is not safe and as foreigners we were not allowed through and had to turn back. 2022.06.28

name: Bekhal Waterfall
description: Nice Waterfall, Crystalclear and fresh. Many Restaurants build around. Iraqi Pool Party at 44°C. Lots of busses with loads full of people.

name: Korek Mountain Teleferique
description: 10.000 per Person. If you like cablecars.

name: North Light Rest area
description:
Big parking lot free of charge, adjacent to the North Light fuel station. Great night stop if crossing from Turkey at late evening. Coming from the border crossing, turn left and the fuel station is on the right side immediately after.
Spent one night there, it was illuminated and felt safe. There were many other travellers sleeping in their cars, or outside on the ground (it was very hot).

name: Parking garage in Zalm
description:
Small garage where it is possible to park a small/medium size vehicle for few hours or overnight. The price depends on the duration of the stay and shall be agreed in advance. Honestly I don't know how much it was, because some kind locals paid it for me.
It's at walking distance from the waterfalls, and protected from sunlight most of the day.
Nearby there are restaurants, shops and water taps. Additional parking areas are available closer to the waterfalls.
Beware that the road is steep and narrow, and big vehicles (trucks and buses) are officially banned.

name: Parking near Bekhal Waterfalls
description:
There are several private parking areas very close to Bekhal waterfalls. I spoke to a guard, specifying that I needed an overnight spot, and he directed me to this gravel parking area surrounded by rocks and shade. I paid 5000 Dinars.
The surface is perfectly flat.

name: Somerion Hôtel
description: Downtown.  Nice room.  60$ a room for 3 people.  Well located.  Fridge and kettle in the room.

name: Coast Hotel and Restaurant
description: Simple, clean hotel in the city center 10 minutes walk from Imam Ali holy shrine and 30 minutes from the cemetery.  Price for a room for 3 people: 25 $…Don’t speak English.  Very kind…

name: Hôtel فندق دار الضيافة
description: Located next to Sadeer Palace Hotel… Clean, well located… $50 for a room for 3 people.

name: Ashdod
description: The only camping were knew of was 15km south, in Banana Beach, Nitzanem. We drove to the end of the sand carpark area and hid behind a dune for free – i think in summer you have to pay. The facilities weren’t open when we were there, but it’s pretty run down and dirty.

name: SHIKMONA
description: wild camping on beech. no facilities. can get crouded during summer. grocer and gas a mile away.

name: Miami beach parking lot
description:
Parkingplace next to the sea and river. Opposite the Ashdod port.
Toilet and shower in walking distance at the beach. Closed at night.
Place can be noisy at night but convenient when you arrive or leave Israel from Ashdod port.

name: Shivta Grove
description: Nice very basic spot to camp near the Shivta ruins. No facilities as such but some shady trees. No fees

name: Wadi Araba Itzhak bordercrossing Jordan to Israël.
description:
Wadi Araba bordercrossing Jordan to Israël.

Dutch citizens without a Carnet de Passage.

Exiting Jordan:
Very easy and quick.
1) first immigrations stamp out,
2) then to the insurance for a stamp on the insurance papers, 
3) then to customs where you have to hand over the TIP 
4) and then to vehicule tax/ registration to get another stamp, we didn't have to pay any taxes.

Entering Israël:
Very friendly border with thorough checking of the vehicule.
1) Before entering you will get a borderpass and your car gets a quick check.
2) You drive to customs where you have to get ev-e-ry-thing out of the car and put it through luggage scan/X-ray. While one of you has to handle the luggage, the other one has to drive the car to another part of customs and leave it there, where they will re-check the car.
3) Once done with the luggage scan you have to  go to immigration for your free visa that is a piece of paper you'll get in your passport seperately.
4) Then you can take all your luggage and pick up the car, and while you put all your luggage back in the car, someone at customs will create the free TIP for you. We had our European (green) insurance papers and everything was easy.
5) Before you drive off they'll re-check all your papers at the exit and you have to hand over the borderpass.

name: Ein Gedi Camp
description: Good backpackers place, can take big rigs or own tent too - good bar and staff

name: Wildcamping
description:
There is a dirtroad alongside the road in the west. The beginning and the end of the road is stead but the rest is flat. In the northern part is a little water basin with goldfish.
You can find plenty little spots to camp the left and right of the road.
There can be noise from the military facility up the hill. We heard them singing till 22h.
Please take your trash with you.

name: Jordan Israel border
description:
Jordan to Israel

Takes some time but no problems. Drive to customs they will shortly check your car. You have to pay 25JD exit feet for the car. You will get an exit pass. After customs go to immigration and pay 10JD exit fee per person. Now you get the stamp in your passport. 

Drive to the bridge and show all your exit documents at the gate.

Arriving in Israel they will check your passport and car just shortly and you have to wait. They tell you when you can continue to immigration. There you show your passport and they will ask some questions (not too bad even with Saudi and Sudan etc visa). 
Continue to customs where they will search your car completely and I had to bring nearly everything to the xray. After that you get insurance or translate your insurance and you can leave with your gate pass.

name: A.Rosenfeld Shipping
description:
Shipping office in the second floor of he building. You can ship from Haifa to Limassol or Lavrio Greece. They sometimes take passengers but only a few and the price is about 250€ to Limassol and 300€ to Lavrio for one passenger (not the car).

Rasheed is very friendly and helpful. I arrived at his office one day before departure of the boat. The price to Lavrio is 750€ for a car including port fees in Greece. Port fees in Haifa are 600-1300Shekel...

name: Port Inn
description:
Nice Hostel in town. In between the Rosenfeld shipping office, the port and the trainstation. 
Perfect if you wait to ship your car and go to TelAviv airport...
Dorm is 100Shekel with nice breakfast. Parking in the street from 8pm to 9am free

name: South Beach, Haifa
description: Established public beach with toilet facilities, restaurants etc and nearby Shopping Mall. Ideal place to spend a few nights before shipping or after arriving to Israel. Can be noisy from traffic. Camp on the huge parking ground.

name: Akko Beach
description: Off the track parking directly at the beach, reachable with 2WD. With 4WD you can access the beach from here and drive directly on the beach further south to find more secluded spots. No facilities other than a trash can. Not too much noise at night.

name: Har Karmila Free Campground
description:
Official free campground on top of a moutain ridge, quite large (50+). Features a water tap, but nothing else. 2WD access.
The asphalt road to get here is a semi dead end - it continues for about 2km towards a village where it ends - but before the village there is an entrance to a 4WD road downhill on the left side.

name: Bus to Bethlehem
description: If you can't or don't want to go to Bethlehem with your own vehicle, you can take the bus from the Damascus Gate East Jerusalem bus station. Bus 231 takes you to Bethlehem, from its final station it is a 15min-walk to Nativity Church. A one-way ticket costs 7 NIS and is purchased directly from the driver. The signs on the bus station are not necessarily correct, so just look for a bus number 231 and hop on in when it pulls into a station.You need your passport/immigration card - there might be a check on the border.

name: Ze'elim Free Campground
description: Official free campground in the desert about 2.5km away from the main road. The track is rough but if you drive carefully ok with 2wd. Features fire pits, but nothing else. If you follow the foot path marked with Stones you get to a beautiful viewpoint of the valley after 15 min.

name: Taba border Esrael - Egypt
description:
Crossed from Israel into Egypt with a motorcycle. No fixer.

Israel side:
- They told me the Egyptians don't like bikes and they probably won't let me through. I asked to try anyway, they accepted
- You pay the exit fee, get an exit ticket
- You go to the customs office and give the document with vehicle details
The people are extremely friendly and will help you through

Egypt side.
- Get cash ready. You can change dollars to Egyptian pounds inside the office
- First thing is a thorough security check. I had to get everything off the bike and into an x-ray machine
- If you don't have a visa and some form of guarantee, you can buy one, they'll call a guy to come over with one, you pay 47usd and then you get your stamp + visa
- Customs is next, the guy is really friendly. I paid 300 EGP to get the carnet stamped
- Next are a couple of offices, not 100% sure what all do, but eventually you are hooked up with an Egyptian driver licence (or motorcycle papers, not 100% sure) and two plates. One for on the bike, one for in the luggage (not sure of that one he said I needed it for when I got to sudan?)
- I paid a couple of times, I think around 500 - 600 EGP total
- When you cross into the border, there is tourist police immediatly checking your passport again
- After about 400m you'll get your first military check
- 400m after that you'll have to pay two bits of taxes, 200 EGP for yourself, 400 EGP for the bike
Took around 3 hours all-in-all, people were relatively friendly, though not so friendly as in Israel

name: Ashdod port immigration (Ferry into Israel with Motorcycle)
description:
I went with Grimaldi lines, got off at Ashdod (me + motorcycle).
The process went as follows (there is a problem up which I'll explain later)
- Immigration and security gets on board (in our case in the evening and I was able to spend an extra night on the ship) to take your passport for the immigration
- Go to 'Allaloef' (Grimaldi's shipping partner) to pay for a document - Can't remember the exact name (Grimaldi doesn't tell you about this, but you'll have to pay 150 USD). This is not in the port and requires you to go through security. Taxi is around 40 USD round trip they told me, but perhaps you can get a better deal or have someone from the port help you
- Go to customs, get your paperwork drawn up. You won't need a carnet here, you will need your vehicle papers and your passport
- From customs you'll need to go to another office (near immigration) and pay for release of the motorcycle
- Within that same office there is another room where you go with your stamped / paid paperwork, the person there should be able to get the motorcycle
- Security comes to pick you up, does a security check on the bike / luggage and then they help you through the gates

In my case, there was a slight problem (which turned out to work in my advantage). As I didn't ride the motorcycle of the ferry, it was technically not inside Israel. As such, the woman at customs couldn't print her paperwork as this was one of the requirements. After much hassling / calling, they fixed the paperwork (but the bike was still on the vessel). Normally, you will hand the bike over to customs instead of it staying on the ship. For me this was a good thing because when I left it was like 8 o'clock and the customs lockup was closed.
This confused everyone greatly. Especially for the lady who was in charge of getting the bike from storage. I said I needed to fetch some stuff and came back with the bike (to her amazement).

Some things to note.
- The ladies at immigration were extremely helpful (I naively stumbled into there thinking that's where I needed to be). There was a woman named 'Rachel' (American, in hebrew / phoenetically it was like caileigh but with a G. So Gggaileigh). She was extremely helpful and spend basically her whole day missioning to Allaloef and customs and helped with the paperwork.
- The immigration office is open until late if not 24hrs
- The office where you get the paperwork you need to pay (like the invoice) is open until 17:00
- The office where you need to go to release the motorcycle and get security is open until 18:00
- The Security people are available 24hrs a day

It was a gruesome 9 hour day, but I was able to get the bike into the country the same day

name: Nice place
description:
Very nice place 200m far from the road next to the coast. Enough to be quite and empty, even in the weekend! Nice view. 

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Timna Park
description: Nice national park, the biggest in Israel. Maybe not "one of the most beautiful in the world" as written on the brochures, but very nice colored rocks all around. Entrance ticket is about 12$. There is a camping inside the park and you can cycling. And at the visitor center you can join to free wifi ;-)

name: Wild camp
description:
Good spot for one night, very close to "Good Samaritan" exit, but well isolated, even from the wind.

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

Ps there are 2 ways to arrive to the spot, one short and deep. One bit longer but better

name: Free tour
description:
Best option if you have a low budget to visit the city. It's about 2 hours. It's organized by the info point, 15m far from the meeting point. More than one tour per day, in English and Spanish. 

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Pool insurance
description: This is one of the cheapest insurance you can find in Israel. The craziest problem here in Israel is: you cannot make insurance without temporary permit, and vice versa. The only solution seems you have to go back to one of the borders and make it there.

name: Nice picnic area
description: Nice spot where you can camp. Next to a kind of monument with a crashed tank.

name: Lebanese restaurant
description: Very nice place, the Lebanese family that run it, is super super friendly. Good food at very reasonable prices!

name: Coffee place
description:
All around it's a very amazing quiete area where people live peacefully on the nature. Bit "hippy" style. And this is the right coffee for this incredible place. Must try. Just follow the sign "incense road".

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Super Humus
description:
The best humus ever. The name is in the picture.

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Nice view camp
description: Nice spot where you will be probably alone with cows all around. Many israelians come to walk on these mountains, so during the day can be noisy because not far from the road. But in the night it's perfect

name: Wonderful place
description:
It's perfect to camp. Nobody knows about it. There is even water to cook and tables!

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Nice spot
description: Nice spot, with a lot of shadow, tables and a chemical toilet, next to a small waterfall (nothing incredible). Very quiet.

name: Museum of Italian Jewish Art
description:
beautiful museum with an antique Synagogue in it. the museum have a 3D movie about the story of the ancient lost Menorah.
it is a small museum with charm!

name: Robin food
description: Located in a popular Neighborhood, Robin Food is a nonprofit organization that give food no longer salable in supermarket and shop. You pay what you feel. Open from 8pm to 11pm, on Wednesday and Thursday

name: Abu Yusef
description: Very very very good humus. The restaurant is bit in a hidden corner, but it is worth a visit, maybe while you are waiting for papers to ship your car ;-)

name: Colonia beach
description:
Quite place for camping. 
Just 100 meters from the border.
Next to bus stop. 
100 meters north there is a “shower” free to use on the beach next to
The duck

name: Me'ever Beyond
description:
Campground and Hostel. Simple and Clean. many areas to hang around. communal kitchen and fridge. 47shekel for me, tent and motorcycle one night. WiFi. Breakfast 20shekel. 
they gave me free Lunch. 
friendly Staff. Hippie Place ^^ sometimes i think there are concerts.

name: Binas Camping
description:
Great Camping. Shower, toilet and clean drinking water from the tap.
 Small Cafeteria. Perfect for tents. Ask if you can push the motorcycle inside next to your tent, without engine.

name: Palmachim beach parking
description: Large parking area right next to Palmachim beach (outside national park). Good place to free camp in, we stayed 2 nights. No facilities. Rough access road, gate is on main road, easy to miss.

name: Wild camp next to Jordan River
description: There are lots of informal parking spots all along the river in this area, no facilities but very beautiful. The road along the river is rutted. On public holidays it gets busy with locals camping all along the banks but on other days we were the only ones there.

name: Migrate Forest
description: Several places for camping between mango groves and eucalyptus forest. Some locals during holidays but quiet. We made a campfire. it’s nice!

name: Canada Park
description: Several camp spots in this National Park. Lot of shade, very quiet.

name: kushi beach
description:
parking in front of the beach.
there are a few israelians trucks and caravans here.
restaurant on the beach.
no services 
crowdy on weekends !
the beach is quite dirty and windy
not the best spot but at least not disturbed by the police at night ;)

name: Apolonia
description:
free parking lot (gravel) next to Apolonia national park. beautiful seaview.
windy when we were there
very quiet at  night except for the sound of the waves ;)
we spent 2 night there.

name: Cemetery
description: You can take water in front of the jewish cemetery.

name: dugit beach
description:
nice beach tough a little dirty
cheap parking, we paid 106 NIL (25 euros) for 2 nights.
little food truck, tables, shade

name: Haroa Parking
description: A nice grove, 80 meters from the main road (40). You camp there. There is  potable water tap. No other facilities. It might be crowded if a bus of the Boy Scouts will stop for the night. There is some noise from a big water pump situated 100 meters away and from the cars on the road. 150 meters to the east across the main road there is a 24/7 Fuel station with toilet and a convenient store where you can porches food.

name: Mitzpe Ramon Grove 1
description:
Just of the main highway (40) a nice grove. You can camp outside the woods perimeter if you sleep in your car or you can pitch your tent under the trees.
No facilities but there is a 24/7 fuel station 150 away with a convenience store and toilet. It's not the quietest place since it's near the main road. If you're looking for more privacy, see a separate entry for Mitzpe Ramon grove 2

name: Mitzpe Ramon Grove 2
description: On the western outskirts of the town a small grove where you can pitch your tent or sleep in your rig. Big rigs will not be able to go into the grove  but there is a small clearance outside where you can park with a big rig/ You have to be totally self sufficient. If you sleep on the ground be aware that there is an irrigation system that starts early in the morning.

name: adoha jerashi gaz station
description:
we filled our gaz tank (french cylinder, 12kg) for 59 NIL.
and we bought a new bottle for 200NIL (=50€).

name: ein advat national park
description:
official free campground of the ein advat national park. 
toilets available but I didn't check which kind
scenic road to reach the campsite.
we slept one  night and were the only one there. very quiet

name: eilat Sunbay beach
description:
Big free parking lot next to the beach just before jordan border. In summer a lot of local caravans (some for rent) with generators, but we were able to find quite a nice place on the beach.
The previous 2 nights we slept on the other side of eilat, before the Egyptian border, but it was very noisy.
There is water at the beginning of the parking. Shower and toilets might be possible at the fenced public  beach but it closes at night (and from what I understand there is one side of the beach for women and the other one for men...)

name: B
description: Beach & picnic area suitable for camping.  Water spots, showers, bbq ! great.

name: picnic area
description: nice spot with picnic tables and a river. Perfect for a tent. Big free parking available 10m away.

name: New marina beach
description: Good for one night before or after border crossing. Tents, caravans... are allowed on the beach but it can be very busy during week-end or holidays. (Many generators)

name: Afloka
description:
Great seafood and Middle eastern food. Big meals come with 20+ types of salads.
Near the sea and perfect for sunsets, and with lots of parking space.

name: Basha hummus
description: The best hummus and nicest people, its in the arabic city of Kfar Ka'asem. Enjoy!

name: Aminadav Forest
description:
Excellent wild camping spot in Aminadav forest a kilometre beyond the Kennedy Memorial. Pick your spot. Plenty of springs about. Probably busy in summer but very quiet when I was there in December

Follow the road from the Kennedy Memorial down into the forest away from Jerusalem and pick your spot. I can’t get the coordinates exactly right on the map

name: Tsinberi Beach
description: This is a very nicely developed parking and picnic area stretching for over 3 km along the Sea of Galilee, and camping is allowed. The GPS coordinates are for the southern entrance. There is a center and a northern entrance, but they were closed for the winter. The northern end had better parking for big rigs. Parking is free during the winter, but they charge during the rest of the year. There are trees and picnic tables as well as clean bathrooms with flush toilets and cold water showers.

name: Gas Abdo Tamra
description:
you can get propane tanks filled here. Israel tanks are the same as inner connector of a USA tank. Apparently not legal to fill someone else's tank but this place will do it. bring adaptors they don't have them.

stop in front of gate arms and they will open them. drive up steep road 200 meter.

bring Google translate for Hebrew.

name: The First Station - parking lot
description:
The First Station is a huge parking lot with a free shuttle bus to Dung Gate (8 am - 8 pm).
With a foreign registered car you are not able to pay the parking fee.
But before the paid parking area there are some free parking spaces where we stayed for two nights and slept in the car, because we found no other camping place close to the town.
During the day it can be difficult to get a free space, during night in the early morning it is easy.
Restaurants and supermarket are nearby

name: Ein Bokek - public beach
description: More information https://www.ifreecamp.com/dead-sea

name: drop off laundry
description: laundry near free parking. regular and dry clean.

name: Caesarea
description: Parking en terre du site archeologique, gratuit, calme mais sans service.

name: Free Camping Nitsamin
description: Free Campground without facilities next to the dunes. The area is environmental protected- nevertheless there are many Enduro- and Quaddrivers around. At night it is very quiet. From the place you can make some nice hikings through the dunes. At the field school or "the palace" (the name depends on which map you use) are toilets and running water available for hikers, about 500m to walk/drive.

name: By the river. Neot Mordechai
description: Well arranged day site by the Jordan river that is also allowed as a night camp-site

name: Crocoloco Crocodile Farm
description: A crocodile  farm with a small and nice campsite, 300 NIS up to 5 ppn. If you want to book: 0528666007

name: Merom Golan
description: A wild camp inside the forest. Go south from road 959 to Merom Golan, about 1 km, turn west, follow a dirt road to the forest.

name: Hai-Bar Yotvata National Park
description:
You can stay at the entrance of the national park. Cars have to stay on the parking. For tents there is a specific area. The parking is quit nice although there is no shade. But quite nice late afternoon/evening. Toilet, shower, public kitchen with fridge and freezer and entry to natinaol park is in camping fee included (15 eur per person). 
You can go on a safari with  your own car.

name: Picnic Park near Irusim
description:
Flat parking with tables not far away (<100m) from scenic Gilboa road. Almost no traffic during night. Police patrol came around 8pm (border to westbank is pretty close). They checked passport and had no problem with overnight stay.
Nice view over Jordanvalley.

name: Parking next to Hatachana Station
description: Big flat parking next to old Jaffa train station. In the back (next to train station) it is quite calm. Beach (with cold shower) very close. Clean toilets at old train station. Nice area with bars at Hatachana station. For an overnight stay on a city parking lot, it is almost perfect. We stayed 2 nights. 24 NIS for 24 hours. No height limitation. Wifi available at bar in Hatachana station.

name: Best Falafel in Haifa
description:
Next to shipping agency / port.
Best Falafel in Haifa or even in Israel and verry friendly! Recommended!!

name: Secreat lake
description: With in the area of Timna NP and away from the road this small lake at the base of what seem to be an old mine was perfect for one night. No facilities once so ever here but also although we looked for them there were no signs indicating "No Camping"

name: Ein Geti Old Spa area
description: Found this alternative to the expensive campground at Ein Geti (40€ for 2 people). This area use to belong to Ein Geti but was close down and deserted after Covid. What remains is used as a storage area. The guard Ibrahim allowed us to camp for the night.

name: Apolonia city beach
description: We were directed here by local RV owners as we were no longer allowed to camp in the spot mentioned as Apolonia here. This is a public parking that allows you to camp right next to the entrance of the city beach. We were told that you pay only for parking but nobody asked us to pay although the attendant came by to say hello. Always ask the locals for a good find!!

name: Nice opening between houses
description: It’s a nice open space in residential part with nice view. Really quiet during the night. No one told us anything. It’s a nice spot for one night when you visit this area

name: Rest House
description:
accessible via tarmac: parking lot behind the Rest House in Rum village (not too scenic).

usually 7JD you may ask for a special price which is 5JD

name: Sunset Point
description: accessible via sand (4wd only): Sunset Point, inside the Wadi, access from Rum village, after the mountain range turn left 90°.

name: Beach parking area
description: 10km before Saudi border, parking area/open space close to the beach, next to Barracuda Hotel (shower/WC for EUR 0.25), wifi at the hotel.

name: Free Entry Petra
description: nice canyon

name: Dead Sea
description:
For one night ok, fresh water near the Wadi, free swimming in the red sea is possible 

no access to water  it's not Red Sea - it is DEAD Sea the last 50m are washed away, there is a high cliff now, so watch out. lots of flys

name: Hot Spring
description:
A Wadi with waterfalls and hot springs

Very nice place

name: Wadi Rum Visitor Center
description:
Entrance and Visitor Center to Wadi Rum. 
Entrance fees are included in the Jordan Pass.

Pass by the village and pick a spot you like!

Good to travel in a 4x4

name: The Sydney Hotel
description:
It’s a good place to stay for a few nights in Amman. It’s something between a hostel and hotel, meaning there are dorms or rooms available. We had a nice double room for 30JD including breakfast. There’s parking available, they have WiFi, hot showers and they’re pretty central.


Some nice restaurants and bars are within walking distance. Walk along the Rainbow Street for example.

name: Olive Branch Hotel
description:
Nice Hotel on the top of a hill where you can either pitch a tent or sleep in your car. We were here during Ramadan, so we were alone and could park anywhere. Nice views.
21 JD including breakfast, Bathrooms looked okay, you can use the pool.
And we could fill our water tank, finally.

name: Cliff Hostel
description:
Cheap and central hostel. Sydney Hostel was full so I came here. It‘s quite busy too. They have rooms and dorms. A dorm is 5JD. The manager told me it‘s ok to park in front of the Sydney Hostel. Also a guy with motorbike was here and parked at the street in front. 
Rooms and bathrooms are not bad. You will find a lot of shops, restaurants etc. in short distance...

name: Mount Nebo
description: Place with superb view of the dead sea and israel (jerusalem and west bank)! Drive on a unpaved road leads you to the spot...4x4 is not necessary,  rocky ground makes it not suitable/ uncomfortable for tents! Great sunset and beautiful view in the morning!

name: beach number 4
description:
campsite that is also used by locals on weekends ( thursday to saturday more crowded but still fine), also mentioned on map given by the tourist information in aqaba! 
Nice snorkeling and lots of dive schools and dive sites around!

name: Pizzeria sant'Joseph Church
description:
Exactly next to the church, the Italian father, padre Mario, opened a nice pizzeria running by Iraq refugees. Italian taste, one of the best pizza in town!
Here you can buy even home made pasta or clothes (made by refugees too).
Worth a visit!

name: Hashem restaurant
description:
The best humus and local food of Amman 

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Ajloun caste
description: It worth a visit. You can visit it in 40min. Nice view all around. Entrance costs 3dinars.

name: Roman ruins of Jerash
description: It's simply a MUST in Jordan, as much as Petra. Ticket costs 10 dinar (if you don't have Jordan pass). Consider about 2hours to visit it quickly. Better to come during the morning or late afternoon (it can be very hot). Bring a bottle of water with you. Nice A/C info center.

name: Baptism site
description: Entrance fee is 12 dinar. The tour is about 1 hour. It worths a visit, especially if you are believers.

name: Wild camp
description:
Very nice place to stay. Some small farms before arriving at the end of the trail where you can camp. Very quite place

Vespanda ilario Lavarra

name: Aisha beduine House
description:
I met Aisha in petra, where she has a small shop trying to sell some souvenirs. She is very nice person, and she invited me to her house. I slept with her and her big family for 3nights. The house is ok, and the room she gave me was ok. The bathroom maybe is not the best one, but ok to take a shower. Aisha gave me food, she is really like a mom! I parked my motorbike in her garden without problems. And maybe you can fallow her, when every morning goes to her shop inside Petra for alternative beduine ways... So, if you don't look for a luxury room, and if you want save money and have a real beduin experience you can come here and help Aisha and her family. She is very nice and she asks 15dinars/Pp. 

Aisha whatsup number 00962 77647 8186. Or when you arrive to Umm Sayhoun you can ask for Aisha Jameah Alsamahin (everybody know her)

name: Changing money
description:
Very good rate to change money in Amman!
It's a western union.

name: Jordan border
description:
From here you can cross if you are by bicycle or by public transportation. It's not possible cross this border with a motorbike or car, except if you have a special permit from some minister. 
It's worth going one hour north and that's it.

name: Qusair Amra parking
description: We sleep on the visitors parking of Qusair Amra, just  after crossing the Jordan border with Saudi. We asked the permission to the guard, he said us it’s ok for a night.

name: On the road
description: Parking near the road 20, with a splendid view on the mountains. No many cars on the road during the nignt, relatively quiet for one night.

name: Park near Amman
description:
Huge park area, you can find different camping places here. Shade from the trees. Not busy on working days. looks clean, compared to other areas. 
there is a zoo, 1JD, close.

name: Near Petra
description: 3kms to Petra, a little parking area near the road (direction Aqaba) with a great view. Good for one night, very quiet.

name: Al Husayniyah
description:
Great point of view on the wadi below.
No services
We spent one night there, very quiet. sunset was amazing!
My husband spent the evening with a group of men drinking tea, very friendly.
close to 2 mobile antenna

name: Dana Restaurant
description: Very nice restaurant in center of Madaba. Very tasty food, and very reasonable prices. Serves alcohol.

name: Dana Tower Hotel
description:
Excellent community hotel in Dana Bioshpere Village. 
Comfortable bed, hot shower. 
Excellent dinner in a well heated common room (It was winter)
Popular even in winter so book ahead.

name: Moon Beach Hotel
description:
Clean comfortable hotel in centre of Aqaba within easy walking distance of all amenities. 
Very reasonable prices. 
Hot shower, fridge and TV
Office to arrange very good dives in lobby.

name: Jordan Ecopark
description:
Very nice eco camping area located at the Jordan Trail and within the warmest area of Jordan. We love the idea of an eco friendly tourism and really enjoyed our 2 days stay. 
You can camp in a tent or in your camper car, and there are also huts with shower for rent. The place is open all around the year. Some activities, such as hiking or bike rental are also offered. The entrance is behind the black door (see photo).

name: Mercedes-Benz Service Center
description:
Good professional workshop. We came in without appointment for service (oil, filters etc.) After a short talk they started straight away. And they did all kinds of extra things and inspections. Very friendly guys. Treated the kids with candy. And they even washed the car.
Highly recommended.

name: good groceries
description: all the middle Eastern basics. plus driving snacks. you need to ask for frozen meat.

name: Dead Sea Viewpoint and Beach Access
description: Follow the rock access road and turn left just before the bridge, then head toward the water. (The left side of the bluff has better views and easier water access.) It's quite windy and crowded with locals on Friday, but very beautiful. No overnight camping allowed, though, and that is enforced by the military. (We were allowed to spend the night behind the police station on the SW side of the bridge.)

name: Petra free parking
description: It is easy to miss this free parking right at the entrance of Petra due to a sharp left turn right in front of a private parking. So during the day it tends to be less busy than the others in the area. We spent a quite night here. Some horses,  donkeys and dogs around. Perfect if you want to visit Petra early in the morning (highly recommended). Toilets a few hundred meters away, only during opening hours. Huge rigs might struggle in the last sharp turn.

name: Near Dana Nature Reserve
description:
Nice spot with a great view over the Dana Nature Reserve Mountain Range. Next to a dead end road with little traffic. Can be a bit windy.
500 m down the street is the Dana Tower, Parking and Tourist information with perhaps some walking options - we haven't been there.

name: Umm er Rasas
description: Nice mosaics for a 30 min. stop on the way. Entry free with the Jordan Pass. We stayed there one night at the parking after asking the night guard. Toilets were open all night.

name: Karak Castle
description: There's parallel parking right in front of the castle and if you check in with the police station that's right there and leave a copy of your passports with them, they allow overnight camping. There are pay toilets available when the castle is open.

name: Petra Nights
description: Nice clean twin room for 14jod. AC, private bathroom and good bed. Parking outside on the road but in front of reception.

name: Yummy Bites
description: Pizza, sandwiches, burgers. One place we could find where they give you a normal/local price. Food is alright. Pizzas are decent and large one is nearly enough for two people.

name: Bank without commission
description: Jordan Kuwait bank was the only bank we found in Jordan that charges no commission for withdrawing money. Others typically charge between  3.5 and 5 JD. This is just the ATM we used, plenty of others of course exist.

name: Hakaia Home
description:
The house of stories in Aqaba
If you are looking for a clean hostel stop here.
Bah and Mohammed forming an incredible team, the place is one of the most professionell one which we visited. Chef Mohammed is mastering the hundreds of magical recepies in the kitchen. 
Dormitory or clean and comfortable apartments.
Fair price.

name: Free private WiFi service
description: Gain free WiFi access from my home plus a cup of tee if you have the time

name: Rum Planet Beduin camp
description: Probably one of the few real campsites. Very clean.

name: Hotel Ajloun
description: Biker-friendly easy hotel, after a healthy walk to the Ajloun Castle.

name: Cozmo
description:
Translation:A convenient site for shopping for food and personal needs
I advise you if you visit Jordan to shop from him.
perfect supermarket , 
موقع مناسب للتسوق من اغذيه وحاجات شخصيه 
انصحكم اذا زرتم الاردن ان تتسوق منه .

name: Near Petra
description: Very quiet and not far from the sight. Nobody bothered us and it is away from the village. Just some dogs.

name: MAN Trucks & Busses Amman
description: We have been in many MAN workshops, but this is exraordinary. They repaired our batterie box perfectly and they changed our tires. But all on Thursday afternoon, which is normal free time. They are so kind and helpful. The boss is speaking great English. Really good work!

name: Repair of cooling and heating systems
description: Great young guy. Very professional, good english, explain all clear and in detail. He knows his job. Much better then the Bosch Service we tried before. Gaith Al Koupti Tel. 0795067089

name: Between olive trees
description: Nice overnight place near Umm Qais. Very quiet. Away from the street. Nice view. On a tar road which ends in 200 m. Beautiful area and drive down to the valley. There are a lot of nice places to stay.

name: Baptism Site
description:
This is the real place. You can go with your own car.
The 12JD you can spend for people no need for the worthless Tour.

name: Parking with great view
description:
Parking space at the Road
easy to reach, tar
great view on sunset, can park over night

name: Hot Spring Waterfall
description:
15 JB for the Spa 
just parking no overnight

name: Water on both sides - free
description:
there is nice water from both sides of the road. Very good through put, good to fill your water tank.
free water

name: Lake Burqu
description: Wildcamping near the castle. No services but a magnificent location to stay for at least a night. Track to this location is not easy to follow but is drivable in a 2×4 car or van. you can find a track on Wikiloc to this location. Otherwise follow exactly the track on OSM or use GM satellite images.

name: Qasr Al-usaykhin
description: Flat and level space between de road and the Qasr. Like the rest of this area basalt  rocks and stones. Gravel road leeds to this place. 2x4 is ok.

name: Al Minshawi Restaurant
description:
local food for very good prices (3-4JD).
the Service is very good.
highly recommended

name: Large Parking Area near Petra
description: There is a large parking site next to the road with a good view.

name: Jebel Waqf as Suwan crater
description: Flat spot in the middle of the meteorite crater. Track from the number 5 highway towards this place. Just before yhe crater the track is drivable with 2x4 but the last bit just before the entrance of and inside the crater demands high clearance and off road driving skills. We did it with a merc 508. Perfect spot for the night. btw there is a Wikiloc track for the last part around and in the crater. OSM maps give you the track from the road to the crater. Big rigs could do it but it is not easy. Depends on your driving skills.

name: Qasr Tuba
description: A lot of flat spaces around the Qasr Tuba ruins. no services. Very Quiet whole day. Easiest and shortest track for 2x4 is from the interconnection road. Follow the OSM  or GM advice. There is a track available on Wikiloc witch passes the Qasr. Also posible is to get here from Qasr al-Kharranah 35km north. That track is doable with 2x4 but demands high clearance and off road driving skills. We lost a tyre. We drove with a Merc 508.

name: Trybyl border
description:
VISA ON ARRIVAL NO LONGER AVAILABLE FOR ENTERING IRAQ

Visa can be obtained in Amman at the Iraq consulate.

Time consuming border. Took us 5 hours from Iraq to Jordan.

Iraq exit:
step 1; K9 check.
step 2; passport pre check
step 3; car registration (there is a van with a guy who registrates numberplate and name.)
step 4; portacabin where you get a form with a stamp
step 5; drive further towards the more official border buildings
step 6; go into the building and fo a pre check for al the formalities for Jordan. They make pictures of EVERY document You need to enter Jordan and send that by WhatsApp to Jordan for a final aproval. 
a: passport
b: car license
c: health ensurance card
d: pcr test result
e: qrc code visit jordan covid registration
e: iraqi car registation form (blue one)
after that your passport will be stamped.

Now finalice the car part.
you get a form with a stamp after checking the car documents and the car. with tgat form you must go to a building on the other side of the border area to pay for the car exit fee (15000 dinar). this will involve a half a dozen people with stamps, forms and copies. If you are lucky they bring you with a Hilux  to this building. after the payment and formsluties the man in the Hilux will bring you back to your car. Handover the proof of payment and other forms with stamps. now you get a new form with stamp that you will need at the final police check.
Thats it and 2 hours later. drive to the Jordan side.

Jordan entry:
step 1: pcr test and check qrc visit jordan covid registration
step 2: k9 check inside
step 3: inside check
step 4: under-side check
step 5: personel check. you also get a important form. you have to collect stamps and signatures on this form.
step 6: x-ray car check
step  7: posible an extra inside check.

If you pass this timeconsuming 2 hour part you can change money, get your visa, pay road tax and insurance.
leave the border area after final police check and park outside for the night near the trucks. To avoid an aditional checks in the middle of the night prearange your stay with customs and police.

name: Moschee Wasser
description: Water next to a mosque. Only small amount of drinking water.

name: Water next to Shop
description: Cold drinking Water next to a vegetable shop

name: Al-Nawatef
description:
Bedouin style campsite with posibility to camp with your own car. 5 JD per person per night. This includes breakfast. Solar heated showers. Washmachine available. Super friendly staf and owner.
Very nice hikes in and around Dana. Posible to hike l the way to Feynan.

name: Parking  visitors center Madaba
description: Free guarded parking place of the Madaba visitor centre. On walking distance of all the Madaba touristic sites.

name: Drinking Water Station
description: Shop who fills bottles of water. With three big bottles (each 20l) we filled up our tank. We payed 2 JD. Very nice guy. A tea was also included 😉

name: Real local food
description:
Real local food for local price! Falafel, Hummus…
We payed less than 1JD for two Sandwiches. Very cheap everything. And very delicious!

name: Hallabad Visitors Center
description:
Parking of the Hallabad site. Ask guard fir permission. Expect a short interview where they will asked for (copies of) your passport, your entry and exit point. For couples expect a question regarding your marriage status :)
Nice view on the "castle".

name: New Dibbeen Reserve Camp
description: Campground of the Royal Society. Fee is 6 jd per person per night. Nice view over the valley. Go to lower terras to park. Basic facilities.

name: Dead Sea
description: Parking place for free swimming in the Dead Sea. You can park for the night. Next to a small coffee kiosk. Owner also sleeps there and stated that overnight camping is no problem. Nice panorama over the sea.

name: Alghanim Hotel
description: Very nice hotel but quite expensive. We paid 50 dinar for 2 people and 3 dogs (dogs were probably free). Huge apartment style rooms. Internet no good in the rooms. Dinner cost 15 Dinar for 2 people and breakfast cost 6 Dinar for 2 people with coffee (breakfast not included). Plenty of parking. Good for a one night if you are near the border and need a place to shower and rest. Pet friendly.

name: Vtwin Moto Center
description: Very competent mechanic for all large bikes. they specialise in Harley Davidson but have experience with and can source parts for any large bikes.

name: mostafas guesthouse
description:
Its a hotel but Mostafa loves to invite overlanders. Phonenumber is active for WhatsApp and Telegram. Around his guesthouse there is plenty of space for parking. You can use all the facilities of the hotel like shared bathroom, kitchen with refrigerator, roof terrace. We paid for the 2 of us 10$ per night. For a little extra you have a room with a fan.This is the best option instead of sending away by the police, wildcamping or not.
Some small shops arround.
It is 1km from the car ferry to Aswan city. Ferry terminates near a big supermarket on the east bank.  Mostafa can arange laundry service.

name: Water refill
description: We filled up 4 watertanks (20l) and solar shower for 2 JD. It is drinking water.

name: The Humane Center For Animal Welfare
description: Great vet doing a fantastic job for local animals. Full veterinary services available. Highly recommended.

name: Wadi Numeria parking
description:
Some big gravel area next to Wadi Numeria Canyon entrance. A bit on the slope, but ok for a night and good to go to the canyon in the morning.

Also warm place, perfect not in summer, pleasant temperature at night, quiet (only sounds of donkeys and cocks around)

In theory, you can drive in the canyon, entrance is free, a lot of rubbish. Probably better with 4WD, but might me manageable even with 2wd.

name: Cliff camp
description: Across from the zoo and on the other side of the hill there are a couple of spits to camp for free. We ask the locals and they said no problem. A bit tricky to find a level spot but other than that nice and quiet after 19:00 as locals come for picnics.

name: Rasoun Camp
description: Nice place on top of a hill. Enough space in a green enviroment. Do jot expect to much services, toilets are „ok“. We paid 14 JD per night. Temperature is comparing to the south quite low….

name: Parking next to a hiking trail
description: Flat parking area next to a nice trail in an oak forest. We did not sleep here but it should not be any problem. Marked trail takes around 45 min.

name: Old picnic area
description: Several concrete parking lots on different levels. Run down but pretty OK for one night. Forest next to parking  area. Nice view.

name: Treasury from above
description:
If you want to get a different perspective of the treasury you can climb up here. Not easy but still doable. Most of the visitors in Petra that are not part of a rushed tour they spend a second day visiting the sites.
During this visit they can pick to trek around a mountain and end up admiring “The Treasury” from above(specially in sunrise that the raise of the sun make it shine), away from the massive crowds.
Taken as a given that us overlanders like to go of the beaten track to enjoy wonders on our own, I picked to add this spot.

name: Petra Museum
description: This is a free museum at the entrance of Petra. Done together Jordan and Japan explains a lot about the history of Petra and the way of life of the Nabataean in the region. Not to be missed

name: Renault Garage
description: Garage for French cars brands with some parts. I went there for a clutch replacement on a Dacia Duster 1.5dci.

name: Cliff near Ash Shuqayq
description: A very beautiful spot on a high cliff behind a wide field where two wadis meet. With a fantastic view of the wadis, the dead sea and the opposite shore. During the day some villagers come to look for herbs, otherwise absolutely quiet and far away from roads. 2WD is sufficient in dry conditions. Can be windy. Please keep the site clean - as it currently is!

name: Purifiing station
description: Here you can feel up your water tanks with drinking water at 1 JD per 10 liters. Not cheap but we could not find anything cheaper.

name: Beach 4 end
description: Not sure if this is still beach 4 but after spending 2 nights in beach 4 camp area we had enough from the garbage and the noice so we came here. There is still a basic toilets and showers but less locals come to party here. Prior to setting up we request permission from the police and they confirm that it is fine to camp here.

name: AB Maritime ferry office
description:
Aqaba to Nuweiba one-way. Bring CDP and passport. Passenger - 85$
Car 4x4- 200$
Departure 10PM (they ask to be at the port at 7PM). Running everyday except Friday.

name: Water near a mosque
description: It’s really slow the running water but it was the only one we found in the area.

name: Fish restaurant
description: If you want to eat fresh fish that’s the place to go. We ate barbecue grouper and grill shrimps . During the time we were there was busy with locals take away.

name: Away from the masses
description: Nice, shady and calm area in a side street, close to the Aqaba Fortess and the beach. Nothing  special, but tidy and calm enough, when the coastline fills up with lots of "active" people ;)

name: Yamaniya Beach
description:
Huge and easy accessible area along this beautiful beach. Unfortunately lots of people here in the evening and through the night sometimes. It's loud, it's active , people are friendly, but leave tons of trash. In the morning everything is tidy again, as lots of helpers gather all the trash.

Nevertheless it's quite nice here and while the day it's mostly calm.
We stood here for a few days along the wall, but it doesn't seem to be forbidden, to directly drive to the water, as many people did it.

name: Camping spot with a great view on Jerash
description: Nice spot overlooking the whole Jerash city. It's on the top of a hill, so it's colder and more windy than other spots around. Plenty of places to choose, whether you like to have a view or shadow next to trees. Some locals come in the evening for shisha or picnic, but noone disturbed us. There's some garbage, as everywhere. 4x4 not needed but definitely better because there's gravel /stony road at the end. There are few roads leading to the place, you can find them on Google maps.

name: Water supplier (paid).
description: A shop where you can buy potable water. They have taps to connect a hose, too. We paid 3 JOD for 100l.

name: THE VIEW
description:
What a great spot here, with an absolutely phantastic view onto the Canyon and - at this time  - with the Milkyway in front. Whereas the temps are rising up to 40°C and still 33°C at night in the valleys, here it was 26°C at 9 pm.  What a blessing in July. The place is easy to access, but a bit more ground clearance could be necessary. We doubt, that a standard car can make it, as there are lying a few bigger rocks in the way.
There's one smaller part, which could make problems for bigger rigs, but the falt at the rime is huge enough, even for smaller trucks.

name: Wadi Assal
description: Easy to access and nice Wadi, but a car with a higher ground clearance will be a benefit. The place has been calm, nobody here, except a sheppard with his goats. There's quite a lot trash here and there and it was a bit stinky, because of animal remains, but with a 4x4 it is possible to get even deeper in the Wadi, where it might not be that dirty.

name: Water tap next to a mosque
description: Decent pressure, cold drinkable water. Next to a mosque.

name: Close To The Airport
description: We stood here for one night, as we've been waiting for a friend from Germany. The place is concrete, it was calm, but lots of rubbish is lying around.

name: Wadi Rum Entrance
description:
If  you enter the Wadi Rum from the Visitor Center, you'll be charged:
5 JD per Person, per day
5 JD for a Caravan, per night
20 JD for a private 4x4, per day
35 JD for a rental 4WD, per day
(1 JD is r.a. 1,4€/USD)

There are dozens of free entrances, where there are no signs that it is prohibited to enter from here, so we did. We met lots of guides with their offroaders and none of them complained about entering from here and driving with your own car in the desert.
If you've got the Jordan Pass, you won't be charged, but the prices for the car still apply. We don't know why, but it shall be like this.

name: Desert
description: Lots of shade here in the evening. Fairly easy to access with a 4x4. We did it with our Sprinter 4x4. From here it is 4,5 KM to the Burrah Canyon.

name: Mushroom Rock Inside Wadi Rum
description: One of the main attractions of Wadi Rum. From here you can easily access the Burrah Canyon, as well as Lawrence's house and the Khazali Canyon.

name: Lawrence's House
description: This is one of the main attractions, where Lawrence of Arabia apparently lived for a certain amount of time. There is also a kind of Pavillion tent, where you can get tea and have a nice chat with other travelers. It's a bit more frequented by other tourists with their guides.

name: Khazali Canyon
description:
One of the main attractions inside the Wadi Rum. It's very nice here, but the Canyon is really tiny. Take the steps on the right, follow the short path and see some very old inscriptions. Some of them are located above your heads.
From here you can easily get to the Lawrence's house, the Burrah Canyon and the Mushroom Rock.

name: Burrah Canyon
description: No matter from which direction you'll come, keep close to the mountain, if you do not dare to drive the dunes. The sandy road is fairly easy to drive (we did it with a Sprinter 4x4), but the sand of the dunes looked way too soft for us.

name: Water tower
description: Water tower in the town. We entered the gate and asked for water. they have a hose with strong pressure. good drinking water.

name: Farrah Carpet shop
description: We searched all Amman and finally we found Jordan handmade carpets. He is wholesaler and he collaborates even with refuges and locals to support them. The owner is really helpful and has many different carpets and sizes for every taste. He has even old Bedouin  pillow cases and covers and carpet.

name: 7 Caves House
description: An amazing place to spend some nights. Owned by two young locals who have put their soul and heart to this place fixing everything with their hands.  Both guys are really friendly and willing to share the secrets of the nearby areas including Dana and Wadi Rum.  The rooms are inside actual caves and the temperature is always cool. You can use the kitchen area for free. The place is clean and the sheets new. The rates are from 30-60, depending on size of room. It includes breakfast and dinner.

name: Near Burdah Rock Bridge
description: A really nice resting place near the rocks with shade during the day.

name: Canyon area
description: We stayed overnight, really quiet and the best part is the shade until 11 in the morning.

name: Pine Forest
description:
When coming to this spot, there's a barrier, but there's a small area on the left, where you then find a nicely leveled area under the trees. The smell of the needle trees has been awesome, after such a long time in this desert area.
The area is more or less tidy, it was very calm in the night, but from the distance we heard louder music and fireworks. Some people came here for a picnic. Mobile connection has been good.

name: Nice Spot At The River
description:
Absolutely calm and halfway tidy here. They way down is a gravel road and sometimes it's a bit bumpy, so could be a problem for a standard car.
Take care, when camping too close to the river, as we've been standing in the water the next morning.
Nevertheless one of the less spots in Jordan, along a river and a nicely grassy surrounding.



Good mobile connection

name: Jordan Customs For Foregin Cars
description:
If you want to extend your Visa, you can do it at the Police station, I already put here on iOverlander, but you also need to extend the stay of your car, which has to be made here.
We extended the stay of our Mercedes Sprinter 4x4 (3,5T) and paid:
20JD Customs Fee
100 JD Insurance (for one month)

There's no way around the insurance. You only get the extension, once the officers sees the new insurance.

name: Police and Visa Extension
description:
Even, if it is written in the internet, that the visa can be extended at any police station, this is not true. We tried it several times at different police stations and they always sent us to Amman.
No matter, from where you enter and no matter, if you have the Jordan Pass , you are eligable to stay for only one month. One more month will cost 20 JD p.P.
They ask you, to just pay the overstay fee, which is 1,5 JD per day p.P.
And they probably will tell you, that you can not pay at the police station, which is not true. We filled out a form and got a new stamp into the passport, as well as a receipt.

But this is only for the persons, not the car. For the car, you need to go to the next customs office.

name: Forest
description:
We stayed here for 5 days without any problems. It's a very shady place, but also rocky, so you'll need a car with a good ground clearance to find some places which are leveled. 4x4 is not needed though.

It has been very calm here, but from the distance we could hear loud music (from the nearby zoo?). In the evening locals came along for a picnic, nevertheless we spent some quality time here, by just chilling a bit.

Mobile connection was ok so far.

name: Hillside
description:
Such a nice place with a perfect outlook. The approach might look a bit scary, but it actually is really easy to get there. The place is tidy, but has hundreds of flies, which basically makes it impossible to get outside the van.
Mobile connection is good so far.

name: Dana Reserve Wild Camp In The Forest
description:
This one is a truly gem with a spectacular view. Shortly before getting to the Dana tower keep left and follow the gravel path until it might end. It's easy to drive, but only with a good ground clearance (4x4 isn't necessary though).
There are many places with trees, it's free of rubbish, so please leave the place as you found it ... thanks so much.
Mobile worked fairly ok.

name: No Camping, No Drones!
description:
We tried the other overlander points as well, but every time we were forced by the rangers to leave the area. It is forbidden to camp in the whole area of Petra and little Petra.
Furthermore they saw me flying with a drone and came 10 mins later. They wanted to confiscate the drone and bring me to the tourism police. Fortunately, I was able to convince them, to make an exception for me.

No matter where you are, they will see you and it won't take long for them to come along... happened a few times with us.

name: Perfect View Of The Little Petra Area
description:
After being in the valley of Little Petra and always have been sent away by rangers, we found this one here. Rangers told us, that it's not a problem to camp here, as it is outside the protected area.
It's easy to reach, beside the road on a hill. There was lots of wind and no mobile connection, but good for one night, if you won't dare to camp in the valley

name: Safir Fintas Kuwait
description: Nice hotel good restaurants and lobby lounges All food is served awesome

name: Al Khiran
description: Nice restaurants, Pizza hot, Arabic Foods, Costa Coffe

name: The Village Kuwait
description: Nice food and coffee KFC Hardes Nestelle

name: Kuwait - Saudi Border
description:
On Covid19 situation the border is working from 12 pm to 12 am
Requirements: 
PCR Results
Vaccination certificate 
You will be forced into Home Quarantine for 7 days' but you can stop that by getting a PCR as soon as you get in Kuwait.

Good Luck

name: Fuel Station
description: They accept only Kuwaiti Dinar, Debit & Credit Card

name: Camping Ground
description:
Safe And Easy Access
i camp in here every winter by motorcycle and sometimes by 4x4 car

name: Yamaha Service Center
description:
Open From 8 Am - 5 PM 
Closed on Friday's 
Tel: +965-24815517 
They Provide Winch / Pickup Service Call them on Advance

name: Camping ground
description:
Easy to access by 2wd, 4x4 and motorcycles 
old buildings that can be used as shelter in case of Rain or Dust Storm 

on Weekends the place somehow get busy with campers

name: At The City Mall
description:
Huge Parking Area for hundreds of cars, directly at a big Shopping Center. Very safe, very tidy and calm. A good place for taking the quarantine and suggested by the border police at the Iraq-Kuwait border.
2 ATM in the mall didn't work with our 3 VISA and MASTERCARDS and there's no money exchange service available, nor we find a SIM card service here.

name: "Al Mulla Exchange"
description: Good bureau for exchanging your USD (and of course others) in Kuwaiti Dinar. They only accept brand new notes, but their rate is really good.

name: At The Water Towers
description:
Very nice and huge parking area, even appropriate for bigger rigs. It's very safe and super tidy. Police came along and didn't really took notice. Wonderful view onto the Water Towers and the waterfront, as well as there's also a MC Donald (if you're starving ;) )
There's also a grassy area between you and the main road. 
The road itself is of course well visited, but we didn't care and spent our 3 days of quarantine here.

name: Green Island
description: Beautiful place, very clean, calm and lots of space, with a perfect view onto green island. When walking left and right for a few hundred meters, you'll get a nice view onto the skylines of Kuwait.

name: Sulaibikht Beach
description: Easy to access area at the waterfront. Lots of Flamingos here and lots of space for even bigger rigs. In the evening a few offroaders might come here for BBQ, nevertheless a very calm place.

name: At The Arabian Gulf
description: Quite place and less people here and one of the less areas along the beach, which aren't fenced. This area is very sandy, so be careful, when driving here. For staying directly at the beach a strong 4x4 is necessary.

name: Genuine Mercedes Parts
description:
This is an official Mercedes Benz spare parts store. The manager is german and I got 15% of discount. Many spare parts for our 4x4 Sprinter 903 have been in stock, but others would have been ordered from another location the same day.
btw: very expensive and some parts are more expensive than in germany.

name: ACE Hardware
description: Big Hardware Shop with camping gear an tools, household as well.

name: RV's next to Mall
description: We saw all the local RV's and stop to check this place out. Kuwaitíes bring their fancy motorhomes here. You are allowed to camp and use the malls facilities.

name: Breakfast in the souq
description: Within the souq this place is full with locals. Serves simple nice food in a unique environment

name: UR Offroad
description:
EVERYTHING for offroading. Suspension, Bumper, Dometic Boxes…
Really nice guys. Very tidied, clean and organized workshop. 
If you need any help, also with something they don’t have, they knew a lot of people and other garages! 
We were really happy we found them!

name: Kuwait- KSA border
description: Crossed here today. Kuwait side very slow. Could not find our cars importation in their system. Saudi as always straight forward

name: Gov. of Ports - Permit Iraq
description:
To go to Iraq crossing a landborder you need a permit (green paper). They ONLY issue it when you have a visa for Iraq. 
Enter the building take the stairs on the right to the first floor. Enter the door. The office has the shape of a square. In the back left corner you find 4-5 woman sitting in a circle on there desks. Ask them for the permit paper (green). They will issue it after showing the Iraqi visa. 
I put a permit/green paper into the pictures here. Also a picture of the office. 
You can find more informations to this border crossing process on our website: https://www.einluxaufreisen.de/2022/03/31/border-grenze-kuwait-iraq-irak/

name: Oil exhibition
description: This is a place you MUST SEE, to understand the history of this country.

name: Sacred ground to the hermitage
description:
Beautifully located in Qadisha valley just above a stunning hermitage. 
No water available. About 10mins steep walk down from the closest parking lot and trailhead. On the route for pilgrims who try to go to the hermitage so better keep it quiet and not to hang around with your tents set up all day long.

name: Societe Generale
description: Societe Generale is the only bank we could find in Beirut that has no fee for using the ATM. All other Banks charge a 3% surcharge.

name: Spinney's
description: Large, cheap, Western style grocery store.  There are many convenience stores in Beirut, but this is the only large supermarket we found.

name: The Colony
description: Nice hostel in Beirut.  Probably the best budget option in Beirut and maybe in Lebanon.  Air-conditioning in the rooms.  WiFi can be spotty.  Good location near Armenia Stree.  Cool people staying here to chat with.  Dorms for $15 or $18 USD.

name: Lakkis farm restaurant
description: Very good local restaurant, modern and clean

name: Hellani bread
description: If you want fresh topical bread, this is the place

name: In the hospital parking
description:
At the “hospital libanais geitaoui” you can find a safe place for your motorbike. I gave 1$ per day, speaking with Jean. Try your chance 

Coordinates might be bit wrong

name: Hostel Beirut
description:
It’s not an  luxury hostel, quite basic but clean and with a lot of space. For 10$ it’s ok. Good vibe anyway, Mario, the owner, is east going guy. 
Unfortunately you cannot use the kitchen.
About garage, you can park in the near hospital I pin, about 300m far from here 

Good location, very near to Armenian Street, one of the most vibrant street in Beirut

name: Gibran museum
description:
If you are “travelers” probably you read a book by Gibran (maybe “the Prophet”).
In this museum You can see even many paintings by him and his tomb

name: From Lebanon to Syria
description: Exiting from Lebanon with my scooter Vespa was very easy, just paid 30$

name: Bush camp
description: In the middle of the desert between sand dunes. Very busy during weekends and holidays. Expect a lot of traffic around you until late in the evening.

name: Turtle Beach
description: Parking at "Turtle Beach". Ablutuions next to prayer room in visitor center.

name: Wadi Indam Natural Park
description: Picnic terrain with trees next to wadi. Cosy place during daytime in weekends, quiet in the evening. Toilets closed at night. Electricity connected to ablutions building.

name: Bush camp
description: Along beach.

name: Fins Beach
description: Beautiful beach near bay. Popular camping place.

name: Bush camp
description: Beach at water with much seaweed that lights up at night .

name: Sayq (in the mountains near Nizwa)
description: At the end of a long, steep road to the Sayp Plateau at 2400 meters between mountains and juniper trees. Near picnic place.

name: Jabel Shams Resort
description: Resort at 2000 m near begin of walk W4 Jabel Shams. Swimming pool.

name: Public parking
description: At beach near picnic place. Busy during weekends.

name: Beach Camp
description: Isolated corner at beach. perfect to swim

name: camping on the beach
description: At beach, in the village, next to mosque.

name: Sawadi Beach
description: Quiet spot beside Sawadi beach even on Friday night when the beach is crowded and busy.

name: Nakahl Fort
description: Beautiful huge fort. One of the biggest fort in Oman. The visit worth it (500or/adult free for kids). We really enjoyed it

name: Nakahl Fort
description: Possibility to park for the night on the parking. Quiet spot with toilets and water tap.  Good fast food and bakery close by

name: Qalhat Beach
description: Nice and quiet spot on the beach

name: Makkah Hypermarket
description: Grocery shopping and a supermarket by western standards

name: Wadi Bani Khalid
description:
The spot is nice but very noisy at night (cars driving around, 2 mosques very very noisy, ....)

Several level camp sites with panoramic views down onto the coast line. No infrastructure whatsoever. The place is exposed to wind and there is no cover except your own vehicle. As it lies at more than 1300 m a.s.l., it’s cool up here. And very quiet. The gravel track up from Fins is *extremely* steep and winding, however, some of the trickiest bends have been sealed with concrete. Still, a 4WD is a good idea and becomes a necessity in times of rain. Not recommended for big rigs, even if they are 4x4.

name: among the trees
description: big space for camping under the acacias

name: by the fjord
description: nice area with wonderful view on the fjord and access to water tank

name: Propane Gaz Filling Station
description: Propane Gaz Filing Station 34 Km before Nizwa coming from Ibra

name: Immigration
description: Visa extention

name: Ali Moosa Fahim Auto Workshop
description: Replaced two seals of front shaft. Including adding oil 15 RO. Good and quick service

name: Bush Camp near Nizwa
description: Follow the path out of town. Perfect quit place near Nizwa

name: Masirah Beach
description: Beautiful spot at one of many beaches on Masirah island Oman.

name: hotel khasab
description: free wifi on the backside of the hotel. better ask for parking. very nice people.

name: Jebal Shams overlooking Wadi Ghaul
description: a poplar camping spot on Jebel shams over looking the grand canyon ( wdai ghaul ). rough camping spot, level and you can drive up to it. in the morning the sun rises over the canyon, nice views.

name: Sugar Dunes
description: Bush Camping close to the sea.

name: Wadi Arbiyyin
description: Beautiful spot at a pool. perfect to be quiet in a wadi

name: Saiq Plateau
description: Next to sinkhole with fantastic view.

name: bassah beach
