description: close to khasab. a parking space and beach frequented by travelers and locals. there's drinkable water at low pressure (ok for canister not for big water tank). toilettes fit for cleaning.

name: beach close to resort shangrila
description: close to the sea there are several small resting places with beach nearby. frequented by local fishermen. possible to have a fire.

name: dalkut cliffs
description: close to the cliffs of dalkut a place to stay with easy access. grand view. some locals playing cards and having a weekend but not very loud.

name: rakhiut beach
description: nice beach site with small pavillons and easy access. filtered water is available at the mosque close by

name: beyond Fazayah beach
description: one of the best places on our journey. a lot of small and big lagunas nice to snorkel and swim. no shops or water so take enough with you.

name: Wild camping at the very rim of the “Grand Canyon”
description:
Very nice and quiet site near edge of the Wadi Nakhur canyon with beautiful view. There is a little wall of stones to keep the wind away from the fireplace. Good phone and internet reach.
There’s space for 5-6 tents or 3 cars here.

name: Ghul (2,5 km west of Ghul)
description: White building with on right side 4 taps. You can use the left one. It works with gravety, so only useful to fill small tanks you can put on the ground.

name: Escavation site
description: wide excavation site with nice view, quiet with some noises of the road

name: Old Tanuf
description: Ruines of old city that was bombed by the British RAF during the 1950's.

name: Masirah Ferry Port
description: Port where ferries to the main land leave. Price for 10 ton truck in february 2017 was 20 Rial, single trip. 6 rial pp and 20 rial 4WD for return passage.

name: Dune camping near waterfront
description: Just a few hundred meters from the road, a overnight place after late ferry arrival. You have to leave asphalt road.

name: Beach Camping at the cliffs
description: Nice beach with a view.

name: Fins Beach North
description: On the dunes. A lot of places along the beach. Just pic one. Can be busy on weekends.

name: Viewpoint Wadi Bani Khalid
description: Site next to very quite road with perfect view overlooking Wadi Bani Khalid and the gorge. Unfortunately lots of noise from mosque nearby. Rocky underground, not for tents, but the Wadi itself has opportunities for camping.

name: Beach pebbles side
description: quit and nice with a lot of shelves and old coral

name: Wadi al Farain Dam
description: Next to the damn. Quiet.

name: Barka Beach
description: On the waterfront. Close to a road, but acceptable quiet at night. Nice beach.

name: Jebel Akhdar
description: On top of Saiq Plateau next to a five star hotel you have the same view over the canyon than people who pay hundreds of dollar. 4G with Ooredoo.

name: Jebel Shams
description: Close to the canyon. OK for 4x4. Quite a few sites around.

name: Masirah
description:
Laundry for reasonable price. 
Masirah. Oman.

name: Fazayah Beach
description: Lonely beach on the way to Yemen. Stayed there 2 nights, local fishermen,  few tourists.

name: Masirah island
description: Directly at the beach, good Oman Air data connection.

name: Muscat beach
description: Picnic place, might be busy at weekends, good overnight stay to visit Muscat.

name: Rub al-Khali #1
description: Breathtaking spot in Rub al-Khali also called empty quarter.

name: Rub al-Khali #2
description: stahlroth.com: another breathtaking spot in empty quarter.

name: Rub al-Khali #3
description: another breathtaking spot in empty quarter

name: Shorfet Alalamin
description: Car park in front of the hotel, have had dinner and paid nothing.

name: Al Suwadi
description: beach camping, very busy at weekends.

name: Wadi Al Khabbah
description: not the best spot in the Wadi, we arrived late, so it was good for one night.

name: Wadi Damm
description: Wadi with pools, water all year round, you can go for swimming there.

name: Wadi Muyadin
description: wadi at the bottom of Saiq Plateau. Good for hiking.

name: Wahiba Sands
description: Between the dunes, not far away from the track. Quiet during the night.

name: Beach Campin
description: not the most beautiful spot in Oman, but you can observe the flamingos in the lagoon.

name: Wild Camp
description: on the way to Jemen border, close to a little canyon.

name: Wild Camp
description: on the way to Wahiba Sands, if you come from the south and can't make to Wahiba. Quiet

name: white beach
description: nice spot. quiet and lon streched beach over a few kilometers. frequent possibilities to camp. look for higher grounds in case of rain or storm as sea and wadi waters can be rough and dangerous in oman.

name: Bush camp near Hotta Caves
description: In a small valley with some flat areas.

name: Wild camp in the dunes
description:
From the track through the sand to some small hills. 
Nice view, we found wonderful fossils of snails here. 
2G- with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp in the desert
description:
From the road on a small, firm track into the flat desert. 
Nothing around, only the road far away and 2 camels at night.

name: Wild camp Wadi Ayoon
description:
Huge, relatively even parking at the end of a track.
With a nice view into the wadi. Nobody around.  
2G- with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp in Wadi Shuwaymiyah
description:
At the end of the track with palm trees, different possibilities, only some garbage, nice view in the valley.
No coverage with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp in Wadi Shuwaymiyah
description:
Some possibilities at the end of the track. Some palm trees, a well with green vegetation around, only little garbage, nice view in the valley.
No coverage with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp on a cliff
description:
At the end of a track, appr. 200 m over the sea.
Some flat terraces, no garbage, absolutely solitary.
Only telephone with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp 3 Palms Lagoon
description:
Wonderful between lagoon and wonderful beach (with a shipwreck), many seagulls and cormorans, herons and flamingos. 
Garbage on the beach and the road is in sight.  
2G with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp over fishermens beach
description:
On a cliff above the fishermens beach (too wet to be driven on) with wonderful view on the sea.
Nice, even place, not to be seen from the road. 
Coverage with Omantel SIM only from the hill above.
Nice walk along the cliff.

name: Parking Ferry Masirah
description:
Far out of the somewhat muddy and smelly coastline, huge parking area with nice sea view, no ships at night.
3G with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp at a creek
description:
After a longer search we found this quite nice spot in a streambed with a big rock against the wind. All around are roads and houses, but not to be seen from the place. 
In the morning a nice local came and brought some presents.

name: Wild camp in a valley
description:
In a small secondary valley, some sight of the road lightning! and the new water station. Very quiet with view of the mountains.
2G with Omantel SIM

name: Dunes camp
description:
Slightly above the valley ground between 2 tourist camps (not to be seen). Easy to reach over relatively firm track.
During the day and evening many 4x4 in the dunes on the other side, camel tours an this side. You can wander around in the dunes.
2G with Omantel SIM on the dunes above.

name: Camping at the beach
description:
Narrow bay with fishing huts in the middle. Good for snorkeling.  
Busy during the day, quiet at night. 
3G+ with Omantel SIM.

name: Water station with tap/hosee
description: Filling station for the water trucks with a tap/hose to fill the tank.

name: Parking lot at the beach
description:
small parking area at the beach at the edge of the village, with a view of Al Boustan Luxury Hotel. Quiet during the day, somewhat noisy in the evening.
Toilet in the mosque in the village (golden minaret).

name: Wild camp in Wadi Al Adyad
description:
In a broad Wadi at a small creek with private pool.
Some cars during the day, but absolutely quiet at night.
Nice walking up the wadi.
Only telephone with Omantel SIM

name: Wild camp in Little Snake Canyon
description:
At the end of the track into the wadi, seems to be visited seldom.
Nice walk with possibility to bath in the spectacular canyon.

name: Water station with tap/hosee
description: Water tap outside a water filling station

name: Wild camp Wadi Al Shaitan
description:
separated by a hill from the gravelroad, best view of the mountains, flat area with a lot of firewood around.
3G with Omantel SIM

name: Wardat al Fath Traditional Coffee shop
description:
Nice turkish restaurant serving fresh grilled fish straight from the fish (ro 7 for two) market across the street. Meat and chicken is also on the menu. 

Very nice food. 

Also breakfast and small snacks available

name: Public beach, close to Radisson Blu Hotel
description:
Public Beach in Sohar, next to the Radisson Blu hotel. Across the road is a nice park. 

Restaurant and bar close by in the hotel. Strong wifi reaching this spot on the beach.

name: Fish market in Sohar
description:
Fish market with excellent selection of fresh fish. E.g. Yellow fin tuna for ro 2,5 per kilo. 

Open from 06.00am till 10.00am.

name: Beach close to Yiti
description:
Small beach, nice view, but no facilities. 

Locals visit so a little bit busy in the evenings. Quiet at night.

name: Turkish Restaurant
description:
Turkish restaurant in Hilf on Masirah Island. Fresh grilled fish for two for 4 rial including bread, salad, humus and muteabl. 

Many fresh juices to choose from, no added sugars. Very nice. 

One of the few restaurants to serve fresh (not frozen) fish. 

The Masirah Island Resort only serves frozen fish expect for the catch of the day during lunch time, in the evening it is also frozen.

name: Badar Mansoor Trading
description:
Land Rover Defender certified repair and maintenance workshop. He also covers other European cars.

The workshop is a bit outside Muscat in Ma'abila but worth the travel. Both parts and workshop are less expensive than the show room dealers" in Muscat.

name: Fort Jalaan Bani Bu Hassan
description: A nicely restored Fort and all room are decorated. We enjoyed our visit. Open from 08.00 till 18.00 and entry is free.

name: Toyota Dealer - Muscat
description:
Toyota dealer close to city centre mall. Can do service without prior appointment. 

A - service is ~25 rial
B - service is ~45 rial
C - service is ~150 rial 

They will do the A - service and will check everything but only replace what is needed, leading to either a B or C service. 

Our full service including oilfilter, oil, and replacement of front brake pads and check of all fluids incl. brakes, differential, grease all nipples, etc. we paid 75 rial. It took them 7 hours to provide service without appointment.

name: Jabreen Castle
description: Very nice castle, we thought much nicer than Nizwa castle. Highly recommend a visit. Ro0,5pp. Audio tour is available for a small extra fee.

name: Bahla Fort and Castle
description: World heritage site. Makes a nice visit combined with Jabreen castle, ro0,5pp.

name: Bush camp
description: Bush camp at 200 past the hotel. Be aware of strong winds.

name: Bush camp near Balad Sayt
description: Bush camp or stop for lunch at Balad Sayd village on route from or to Snake canyon. Gorgeous mountain scenery to get here.

name: Bush camp near AL Hayl - view of Jabel Shams
description: Bush camp with lovely view of Janel Shams early morning coloring the mountains. A 100m of the road on a huge flat area. You are 2100m below the rader station on the summit. Very quiet place, but some mozzies at night. Continue the road for a spectacular drive to Yasab (in the future the road will connect to Jabel Shams - currently under construction), so now it is a return trip driving an amazing mountain track.

name: Hot springs
description:
Hot springs near the date plantations.  Busy with locals, but a nice stop. 

Close by there are two water taps with cold filtered drink-water. You can only fill small containers due to pressure.

name: Beehive tombs at Al Ayn
description: Beehive tombs with the mountains in the background. Nicer ones than at Bat. Drive a couple of hundred metres through the riverbed, turn left and park a short stroll to the tombs.

name: Bush camp above Wadi Dham
description: Large flat area used for camping. There is a walking path down into the wadi, take the right fork for a large, deep swimming pool that is not often visited. Omantel 3G coverage

name: Nice swimming pool - Wadi Dum
description: Nice swimming pool that not many people visit as it is in a less tourist side of the wadi. Only 10-15 minutes walk from the campsite above with climbing over a few boulders to get there. A part of the pool with small waterfall is always in the shade.

name: Water tap under tree - right hand side
description: Water tap with cold drinking water under a tree on the right hand side of the road. For filling small containers or bottles. We used bottles to fill the watertank

name: Terrasse Camp near the Riverbed
description:
Deep down in the gorge flat terrasse with some ruines. 200m to a building but hidden throug some trees.
Didn't see any water in the wadi. Less windy then the more scenic places upstairs.
Omantel Edge

name: Khor Rouri
description: Nice place between the khor and the beach. Flamingo and more birds in and around the khor. 4G reception with Omantel.

name: Salalah
description:
MAN service and workshop. 
Arabia Engineering Service located in the Industrial workshop area.
Tel. +968 23211073

name: Salalah
description: Immigration office at the Royal Oman Police station. On the left side of the immigration office is a caravan like building. Ask here for the extension paper (1 OR). Go back to the immigration office and take the most right desk  for your extension. Payment only by Visa or MasterCard. (20 OR)

name: Muqshin
description: Parking area close to the Wadi at the end of the tar road. Very quiet. 4G with Omantel sim. No facilities.

name: Wadi Camp in the Trees
description:
Several Good camp sites among and under the trees on a natural terrace above the river bed. Fire places, rubbish container.
About 100m from the main track, but very quiet at night. Nice place.
3G reception (Omantel).

name: Dune Camp
description:
Tucked into some gravel dunes, sheltered from the wind but still fine views of the sea.
No infrastructure whatsoever.
Quiet.
You get here from the main road via one of two turn-offs at the “village” by the road, e.g. at 22.35249° 59.79583° which is the more northern turn-off. “Weave your way through the loosely strewn houses to eventually end up on a good and wide graded track leading down to the beach. Once there, turn right and continue south parallel to the beach for a few hundred metres until you see a sandy train to your right leading up the slope directly to the camp.

name: on hill near Zammah
description: Just beside the road on a hill overlooking the valley. Not really hidden from the road, but ok. Not very clean.

name: on top of the pass
description:
Large and even place in top of the pass. Nice view to mountains and down to the valley. Beside the airplanes absolutely quiet in the night.
There are more possible camp places towards the east in direction of Al-Hijir.

name: Limitation Al Ayjah Bridge
description:
Finally when in front of the bridge, there is a sign 2 (two) tons limitation and a heigth limit of 2.7 meters, controlled with a gate.
Possible detour is the street around the lagoon.

name: Shady tree camp above village in Wadi Damm
description: Quiet spot for 2 to 3 campers up dirt track near tree which provides shade in morning & afternoon.

name: Al Khaluf Beach
description:
Small headland in front of abandoned houses with white sandy beaches on both sides. Very quiet. 
Voice and SMS only with Óoredoo, no data.

name: Ras Sidrah
description:
Several. bays between Ras Sirrah and Niacin on hard track, reachable over graded roads. Used by fishermen, few houses.
No GSM (Ooredoo).

name: Duqm Public Beach
description:
Quiet and clean public beach with garbage bins, almost out of view of Park Inn and Crown Plaza, in "Tourist Distric" near "Rock Palace Distric" which is now fenced without gate (closed off area).
LTE with Ooredoo.

name: Ras Madrakah South-East Beach
description:
Omanische Côme to picknick, camp, fish, etc too, next to a settlement of fishermen.
Large spots with hard ground and soft sand.
No GSM services with Ooredoo.

name: 3 Palms Lagoon West Side
description:
Turn off tarmac at West side of wadi and follow graded track to Mosque. Continue to follow tracks on hard soil and keep right of the Lagoon. Several camp spots before reaching the dunes with soft sand.
Flamingos, herons and donkeys sighted.
No GSM service with Ooredoo.

name: Sharbithat Beach
description:
Beach front with six raised & roofed picknick platforms below village which is located on a small cliff behind. Access from surfaced road via hard track. 100m to sea on white clean sand.
EDGE service with Ooredoo.

name: Al-Hauta beach near Muqurah
description: Nice sandy and rocky beaches down a very steep but tared road. We liked it much more than the Rakhiut beaches.

name: Escarpment Bay Harbour
description:
Several camp sites at/near small parking lot at the end of the surfaced road. Head towards the private compound and drive around it on the hill side. Graded track beyond parking has few more spots that are sheltered from strong land to sea winds.
HSDPA service with Ooredoo.

name: Waterfall and pool in Wadi Ash Shuwaymiyyah
description:
Several spots to park in recently graded parking lots above the wadi near waterfall and pool.
No services with Ooredoo.

name: Haath Beach next to Sadah Beach
description:
Nice quiet and clean beach next to little resort with a few palm trees, playground, few fishermen's boats. Many overlay friendly mosquitoes, probably due to irrigation of plants.
No GSM services with Ooredoo.

name: Cliff
description: Beautiful spot on the edge of a cliff overlooking the plateau 250 metres below your feet. Quiet and clean. Ooredoo and Omantel have 3G and 4G coverage.

name: Ghiaj
description: Got stopped by the Military, because we didn't have a permit to do the loop around Marsawdad. You get this permit at the Military Post for free. Otherwise they will send you back.

name: Rub al Khali Crossroads
description: Near to the Crossroads this place is surrounded by dozens of trees and some medium sized dunes. During our stay there was quite a bit of firewood from the trees around and some stones for a decent pit. The trees will spent some shade If necessary.

name: Mudday spring & pool
description:
Parking at the spring and pool on the southern end of Midday where the graded track to Aydam begins.
EDGE with Ooredoo.

name: Ubar parking lot
description: Trees with shade just outside the new perimeter fence of the Ubar archaeological site, with a view to the ruins.

name: Wadi Dawkah Frankincense Tree Park, World Heritage Site
description:
Car parking overlooking the wadi. Highway in sight & hearing distance.

LTE coverage with Ooredoo.

name: Wadi Ayoon water pools
description:
Even spots next to (empty) water pools on to of the hill before the descent to the end of the road  in the wadi. Nice view into the main two side wadis, and evening/morning sun. 
No GSM services from Ooredoo.

name: Masirah Beach
description: White Sandy Beach on a beautiful stretch of coastline. This place is close to the beach. You can be seen from the road, but hardly anybody passes by.

name: Parking public fish market
description: big  flat free parking perfect to go to the fish market early on the morning. quiet at night except the mosque...

name: Bay Camping
description: Beautiful place at the bay. You have the choice of camp up the hill or down at the bay. A bit of a steep descend leads to this place. Busy during the day with line fishers but nobody at night. Probably busy during weekends/ holidays. Nice swimming and snorkelling all around with little beaches in the bay.

name: Dolphin Cove
description:
Swimming with dolphins which come close to sandy beach. Quiet, although close to road. Water tank at prayer place for washing across the road in small wadi where local taxis take small tourist groups for showers after swimming at day time.
Emergency calls only with Ooredoo.

name: small wadi with trees off tar road, near Sugar Dunes
description:
Quiet overnight camp on old gravel road off the main tar road with small trees and shade.

Farm in the neighborhood runs a white Steyr Puch 6x6 Pinzgauer as water tanker.

Erratic 2G connectivity with Ooredoo.

name: Muscat festival
description: Middle January-February great festival in this place all the evening between 4 and 11. 200 baiza the entry. Shows are free.

name: Most western dune valley in Wahiba Sands
description:
Tree on a small ridge with firm ground close to Al Areesh camp and new public toilet, only few hundred metres from tar road. Many more informal camp sites while driving deeper into the valley on the graded gravel road.
LTE coverage with Ooredoo.

name: Bush camp near Umq
description: Very quiet, only some goats for company. Beautifully surrounded with dramatic rock formations.

name: Flats on the way to Ibra
description: Huge area of flat desert-like terrain. Easily accessible from the main graded track. Lots of tracks to follow once in the area. Mostly soft/sandy, dotted with trees and a lot of camels. Strong winds with sunset, quiet night. Good reception, 4g Omantel

name: Bimmah sink hole
description: very  big hole where you can swim. better before 3 PM because after there the hole  is on shadow

name: Sandy beach
description: very  long and quiet sandy beach with somes places with shadow. we saw dolfins here

name: beach camp
description: kilometers of Sandy beaches around here. you have choice!

name: Filim
description: quiet spot not for swimming but where you can see flamingos in the mangrove

name: East coast Masirah
description: Beautiful spot on white sandy stretch. There is a track following the coastline. 2 abandoned dows make for enough shadow as well as shelter for the wind. Plenty of crab, the occasional turtle and even a wild cat on the beach!

name: Al Awabi Fort
description: Large parking around the fort with WCs outside.

name: Reserve with Olive and Juniper trees
description:
Large reserve area behind HMSQ's experimental farm with many quiet camp spots. Turn right at the "bus stop" after the farm onto the gravel track.
No GSM services with Ooredoo.

name: Saiq Balcony Walk
description:
Flat space with a view to the gardens and into to wadi near start of Balcony Walking Path WP18b.
LATE with Ooredoo (cell towers a just above the parking spot).

name: Campsite
description: 2omr per person in a tent, playground and small restaurant on site. In a middle of a town with public access to facilities.

name: Parking lot in Misfah
description: A parking lot by the road between old and new part of the town. Good for overnight stay.

name: Wild camping with a view
description: Wild camping with a view on front on the resort

name: Gasfillingstation, Salalah
description: Possibility to refill your gas bottle fast and cheap. I think they can refill different types of gas bottles. We have a Swiss system which is normally difficult to refill outside of Switzerland and we had no adapter.

name: Wadi Suneik
description: lot of space to stay in this beautiful wadi with water all the year

name: Wadi Darbat
description: large and long wadi with donkeys, goats and camels going in the river...

name: Sinaw
description: Free parking area (gravel) near old mud houses and gardens with palm trees. Slightly above the city (fresh air). Souq in walking distance.

name: Camping in a beautiful dry streambed with hills
description:
Driving behind balad bani bu ali we came to a beautiful area full of little hills rich in variety.
Directions: Drive 10 km from bani bu ali to the hinterlands, take the offroad on the right side and continue about 2.5 km until you find this dry streambed with little trees, bushes and hills. Many flat areas to set up a tent.

name: Southern cliffs of masirah
description: We camped on top of the southern cliffs. From here you can overlook two beautiful beaches that are easy accesible from the camping spot. As it is a cape, you will see sunrise and sunset over the sea.

name: Wadi Bani Khalid
description:
We tried to find a spot to set up our tent nearby the wadi in the hills. We figured it was very difficult due to rocks, narrow roads and closeby villages. We decided to camp in the wadi itself what turned out to be extremly nice. Thecrestaurant owner offered us some tea, it was Very quiet during the night and we were the first ones swimming in the pool before the crowd came. 

parking close by for cars

name: Hill above Subaykjah
description:
Close to small village and wadi on the graded mountain pass road from Subaykhah to Al Hamra and Jebel Shams, next to a brand new antenna tower. Requires 4x4 to access, has several flat camp spots near ruin of old watch tower or tomb, with a view over wadis, mountains, and villages.
LTE service with Ooredoo.

name: Parking at old Fort
description:
Quiet parking around old, restored fort overlooking gardens with palm trees and Jebel Hafeet in the background. Quiet, but still close to border crossing.
LTE service with Ooredoo. Mobile Data of Omantel also good.

name: wild camping
description: beautiful spot overlooking smaller canyons in complete solitude. very nice sunrise/sunset

name: Room to rent on a daily basis
description:
Rooms to rent in a private house.  paid 12 omr negotiated from 15 for 2 ppl
basic but with toilet and tv

name: dhofar shipping services to Somaliland
description:
Shipping agent for dhow boats from Salalah to Berbera.
private company that acts as an agent to dhow owners. price for 2 people and 1 motorcycle 400 USD. best we found at the time. other agents were quoting 1000usd. contact them in advance as boats dont leave on daily basis. sail time 4-5 days. 
0096899292439 - shipping agent.
office is located above vegetarian restaurant, on a 1st floor.
correct coordinates

17°00′49.88″N 54°05′35.47″E

name: Camping near bay & abandoned dhow
description: Fantastic off road free camping spot among all the resorts between the bay and the ocean. After turning at the round about, go until the tarmac ends and then drive until you think you've gone too far. Circle the bay until you see the ocean. Abandoned dhow and sardine fishing nearby.

name: Beach Camping
description: Very nice and quiet place directly on the sea. Swimming and snorkling during high tide.

name: Ras Abu Zabil - beach camping
description: Very nice and quiet place. Very good for snorkling, even during low tide.

name: Bayad Beach Camping
description: Very nice and quiet sandy bay. Very good for swimming, little waves and little rubbish. Dolphins close to the beach.

name: Rocky Beach
description:
Little parking place next to a graveyard. Rocky beach with a bit sand in between to have an easy access to the water. Good for swiming and snorkeling. 
Water in 2 tanks. We were there when they filled it up from a boat with a hose.

name: 2 beaches between cliffs
description: Nice and quiet beaches between cliffs. You can park on the right beach (water tank) or on the cliffs between the 2 beaches. Very little rubbish. Good for snorkling. 4x4 needed.

name: Picnic area Neal Mirbat
description: Nice place in the hills not far away from the mainroad. There are little shelters and platforms to stay with the cars or tents. First you reach a parking place. Then you can drive through an arch to find the spot under shading trees. Possibly not good on Friday because of usual Friday tourists. Quiet, no litter. Arachnophobics may stay not under the bushes, but the open platforms are spider clean. Some cows were around.

name: Wild camping along route 30
description:
Nice quiet spot, no amenities at all. No insects, surprisingly much traffic when we slept here, but they all just drive along without even slowing down. If you don’t like how close the two other spots are to the village, you want to be here :)

About 10 to 15 minutes out of the village, when taking the route where the two other wild camping spots are indicated, and following along under the highway and into the mountains. Road is really steep and narrow but perfectly doable. Continue along the route to reach jabal bani jabir.

name: Route 32 - Wadi Bani Khalid
description:
Camp site as indicated in Oman Offroad - route 32. Very large area, perfectly flat. No traffic, very quiet. Last 2,5 km after crossing the village are rather rough, you don’t want to do those at night time.

More mosquitoes than we got at other spots

name: Along route 26 - wadi Arbiyyin
description:
Nice, large area with great pools to swim in and shade from the rocks starting around 3PM. Much better and less crowded than the small waterfall at the end of the track where everyone goes.
Lots of frogs at night, only the flies are a bit annoying, but nothing a fire can’t solve :)

name: Nice Park
description:
Nice and quiet park with trees and toilets.
 Water is available but limited.

name: Jebel shams
description: For the moment the nicest wild campsite that we have use in Oman. Quiet, extra large with shadows.

name: Yiti Beach Camp
description: Nice large beach with plenty of places to camp at the eastern end. Trees set back a little from the beach provide shade. Fairly popular, especially at weekends.

name: Al Jadi Beach Camp
description: Nice long and wide beach, not too far from UAE border. Next to road but didn’t bother us at night. Spectacular mountain backdrop and sunsets. Fairly busy at the weekend but quiet during the week. Good for swimming. Playpark in middle section of the beach with some facilities.

name: Beach camp site
description: Drive down to the beach. We camped to the left in front of cliff. Popular spot

name: Self Service Laundry - Muscat
description:
3 OMR for 6kg clean and dry 
Friendly staff.

name: Bush camp under tree
description: Off tarmac, next to gravel road leading to official camp site, beautiful view in the morning, stars at night. Good option if you’re looking for a place to sleep

name: climbing spot near to Wadi Dayqah
description:
This place offers you some nice base climbs directly on the track trough Wadi Dayqah

Sun from noon to afternoon. 
Flat and shade places for tent available.

name: Al Minthar
description: Nice Place in a Wadi ,100m away from street, quiet in the Night, great view

name: In the North of al ghafat
description:
Quiet Place between little hills to protect against  wind
Less Internet

name: Above Al Hijir
description:
Nice place at a gravel route, 1050 msl , 350m above the little village Al Hijir. Great view around.
WWW: E middle.

name: Drinking water
description: A sign „drinking water“ at yellow house.

name: Al Alya
description:
Parking at the end of the village. Hike about 20 min in the Wadi Bani Kharous.
Nice Pools for swimming

name: Quroon beach
description:
quiet spot. Picknick park nearby (on the top of the hill). Toilets and water you will find there and water also at different mosques nearby. 
Sandy beach north-west of these coordinates. 
Small pavilions gives you some shadow and protections against strong winds as we have today. 
Take the street from Shell patrol station to Quroon beach.  Roughly 5 km.
4G Oredoo coverage

name: Vers Jabal spams
description:
Large solid land next to asphalt road Ideal for a quiet night


Grand terre plein à côté de la route asphaltée 
Idéal pour une nuit calme

name: Al Shorouq Hotel Apartments
description:
Spacious apartment with bathroom and equipped kitchen, very clean, friendly staff. AC and ventilator in the sleeping room. Mosquito net at all windows.

We could store our bicycles in a room on the ground floor (they don't fit in the elevator), but would also be possible to take them into the room.

Bus stop just outside the hotel with connection to Mattrah (200 Baisa) and probably continue along the coast to old muscat

name: Wadi Qtm campsite
description:
This place is near some farms. So a few cars and goats will pass by. 
There is a sandy bit in the middle of the river bank to pitch your tent.

name: Desert camp
description:
Next to the track (Ad Dawkah - Shisr) in the desert. Very quiet place with only sand!
Good place to spend the night on the way to Salalah.

name: Wild camping pink lagoons
description:
Sandy and quiet beach camp. Perfect to spend the night!

NB We also visited the other camping place (5km SW). There is a lot of garbage there (and sand driving is needed).

name: Beach camp at Eagle Bay
description: We found this camping place at 1km before the road block. In this area there are many good sites to pitch your tent (and take a swim). Perfect place to spend the night!

name: Mountain camp
description:
Quiet, large flat area. A bit windy and cool place (because of the altitude). Perfect to pitch your tent and make a fire (bring your own wood). 
Only accessible by 4x4.

name: Gorge wild camp
description: Large, flat area near a gorge (wadi Fins). Several places to pitch your tent and make a fire. Perfect to spend the night!

name: Plateau Camp Above As Sayh Village
description: Large, flat area with trees dotted around and some patches of grass too. Fossils in the rocks near the lookout down to As Sayh village.

name: park at the beach
description:
nice park with grass,  toilet, shower,  water,  parking space,  lunch benches and roof.  
also small coffee place with drinks.  
crowed in the weekend but still okay.  good place for swimming as well. 
we camped here with tent.

name: Bay with fisher Borats
description: Nice bay with fisher boats. Gravel road to the bay. 2G low

name: Beach
description:
Quiet place near sea. 4G slow 
Coffeeshop 500m

name: wadi Mistall
description: The camp site is on top of a pass towards a tiny little village which is not indicated by road signs or on the map. Getting there, take the gravel road to the north east (left) 5,9km after AL Ghubayrah driving south into the wadi. Just continue on this road for several km. Until you reach the top. Stunning views over the entire wadi. Silence all over. In the morning a local farmer of the tiny village brought us fresh fruits and invited us to come to his village for Omani coffee. This is an opportunity to see unspoiled Oman. We loved it very much.

name: beach camp
description:
big sand stretch with no houses.  sand track along the beach,  rideable with 2wheel drive,  bicycle also OK  .
quiet beach.  people if they come friendly.

name: camping in the park
description:
just a park with some green grass. 
toilet building with toilet and shower. 
the sprinkler water system goes on at seven in the morning.
we camped with tents on the grass.  
we think it's allowed, nobody came to complain.

name: Al Khalaf Beach
description:
Very Nice place and quiet on a cliff.
There is pink sand.

name: Salala Beach
description:
Beach behind empty lots and abandoned villas. There is a filtered water fountain at the big white villa a couple of lots east. 
Very quiet spot. A couple of locals met there to play football in the evening, but nobody after sunset.

name: Al mughsail
description:
Quiet place in Salalah, perfect if you need to stay one night in the city.
Near the beach and toilets.
Very quiet, nobody came here during the night.
We spent another night somewhere else under the palm trees but a lot of people came and it was noisy, here it was perfect.
You can even watch a lot of bird in the lagune.

name: Sand beach
description:
Big Sand beach.
One part with palm trees and lodges and one part wild.
The wild part could be quieter during the weekend. You also have toilets and ablution.

name: Dhofar gas filling/LPG
description:
Guys here were able to fill our LPG bottle.
Not possible at the other IOverlander spot close to here.

name: beach house
description: multiple beach house's,  with roof against the sun.  good Sandy beach for swimming.

name: Bush camp
description: small dirt track going into the mountains,  some flat spots.  really quiet at night.

name: rub Al Khali dune
description: Nice dune sheltered from the wind in rub Al khali.

name: Bimmah beach
description:
White sand beach, very beautiful.
Perfect for snorkeling, bio plancton watching, turtles.
Near the sinkhole and different spots possible.
No service.
4G ready.

name: nowhere
description: lost in the desert plains. very calm. not far from a military field.

name: Ras Al Sawadi
description: There is a huge parking area at the beach,  opposite of the islands. Shade places under palm trees. You can park also beside the main parking. Small bar also offering grilled chicken kebab. Nice swimming. Busy at weekend!

name: Visa Extension
description: Very easy at the International airport in Muskat. 4th floor at the “Visa cancellation pre-check” office. You need only the passport. Payment by Visa or MasterCard.

name: Wadi al Arabiyin Pool
description: Beautiful pools! and nobody around (at when we were there). Start at the last parking (a nice overnight spot) west of Suwayh, walk through the palm tree garden and follow the falaj; at some point you need to climb down into the wadi, follow the stone markers; takes about 1 1/2h

name: Short cut through the mountains
description: Good quality gravel road through the mountains, linking Yitti with the main road. Very scenic drive.

name: Wadi Shab park + boat + hike
description: Here you can park and take the boat to cross to the walking path (1 rial per person return). You walk through the wadi until the big pools start. From here you walk and swim through the pools until you reach the cave and the waterfall. We enjoyed it a lot. Shoes to wade through the rocky water would be nice. And a waterproof bag if you bring equipment. No facilities after the parking lot.

name: Car mechanics street
description: Lots of car, accessoires, welding and mechanic shops here. Limited English is spoken, but if you have a problem, there’s always a shop here that can help.

name: In the heart of Wahiba Sands
description:
Right in the centre of the massive dune fields of Wahiba Sand. Most tourist stick to the camps in the north, so it’s perfectly quiet and dark here: no light polution! 


Close by is a bedouin camp with a waterwell

name: Big mosque in Wahiba Sands
description: Very weird sight: over 50km from the nearest road or settlement, tucked between the dunes, you’ll find a big mosque including minaret.

name: End of Wahiba Sands Desert track
description:
If you fancy some real sand driving; you can drive the entire Wahiba Sands north to south. It’s a track used by locals and guides, so your not creating your own path. The sand is still soft, though, you definitely need to air down. Make sure you know your sand driving basics and are able to get yourself unstuck if necessary. 

The track starts at 1000 nights camp and ends at ‘Qhyd’, a small settlement on the main road and ocean. It’s 120 km between the two spots: 3-4 hour driving.

If you’re not comfortable driving the desert by yourself, you can take a guide from the camp for 90 rials. 

The track is called Desert Path on maps.me, it’s relatively easy to follow, you might have to cross some dunes if you lose your way. There are a lot of Bedouin camps with water along the way, not all of them are in use, but some of them even have a cafe.

The middle part is a bit tricky because of soft sand, side sloping, steep slopes, narrow parts or a combination of these. Up to the camp spot and from the mosque down south it’s all relatively easy.

Enjoy!

name: Start of Wahiba Sands Desert track
description:
If you fancy some real sand driving; you can drive the entire Wahiba Sands north to south. It’s a track used by locals and guides, so your not creating your own path. The sand is still soft though, you definitely need to air down. Make sure you know your sand driving basics and are able to get yourself unstuck if necessary. 

The track starts at 1000 nights camp and ends at ‘Qhyd’, a small settlement on the main road and ocean. It’s 120 km between the two spots: 3-4 hour driving.

If you’re not comfortable driving the desert by yourself, you can take a guide from the 1000 night camp for 90 rials. 

The track is called Desert Path on maps.me, it’s relatively easy to follow, you might have to cross some dunes if you lose your way. There are a lot of Bedouin camps with water along the way, not all of them are in use, but one of them even has a cafe.

The middle part is a bit tricky because of soft sand, side sloping, steep slopes, narrow parts or a combination of these. Up to the camp spot and from the mosque down south it’s all relatively easy.

Enjoy!

name: Drive Al Khaluf to Sugar Dunes
description: You can drive over a dirt track from Al Khaluf to the Sugar Dunes. The first part- 5km - of the track, just when you leave town, is on the beach, so only accessible during low tide. 4x4 would is necesary. After the beach is a graded road towards the dunes.

name: Harat al Bilad - citadel
description: The largest traditional settlement - walled city - in Oman. All 375 houses are abandoned now and most of them partly restored. You can visit the entire site and most of the buildings and towers, it’s a wonderful place to roam for an hour. Entrance fee is 2 rial per person.

name: Iran Embassy
description: German passports: Very easy process to get your visa for Iran here. No Referenz Number, no copies of passport or Carnet, no insurance. Fill up the application, one photo. And if you want, they give you also 60 or 90 days for the same price! Payment is only with credit card! 24 OR per visa. If you are early enough, you can wait for the visa...

name: Al Ain camel souq
description:
Right at the edge of the Central market is the animal souq & camel souq. Very nice to walk around and talk with the sellers.

Its closed on mondays.

name: JMK Cellars Alkohol
description:
Big Alkohol-Shop, owner are Chinese people.
Minimum 100 different bottle of red wine, whisky, vodka, beer.... you found everything on the way to Musandam.
Shop is in a (Dirty) Duty Free area (Warehouse-Area)
Under www.jmkcellars.com you found the shop with pricelist and the address

name: Between 2 dunes
description: Nice spot, out of the main road and secluded. The two dunes offer some shelter from wind, we made a nice camp fire. Great pace to stop from a long drive and sleep. Omantel internet worked fine. Be careful going there, when you leave the main road, the old paved road is washed away on few places. No signs, just drop off. Dangerous at night. It is easy to get there, just be careful where the road is washed off, detour is to the right.

name: Cliff over the turtle beach
description:
Nice place over a beautiful beach with turtles. Simple access to the beach by foot. Beach is closed from 5pm to 5am officially, but you can camp on top no problem. The area is actually hidden by a small cliff, so can't be seen from sea. We even made a camp fire as if was not a problem, not visible from sea. We had 4 friendly fishermen visiting in the evening and they invited us for a boat ride in the morning. They even went on the beach to try and find turtles for us. Not something we wanted, but they are locals, don't speak English and it is their beach.

We went for a boat ride in the morning, it was very interested and they only wanted 5 OMR for it.

name: Sallan Silver Jubilee Park (Feb 2019)
description: Sallan Silver Jubilee Park, car parking, nice green park and beach; we were here on a Thursday night, it was lively till about 11pm, after that quiet, so fine to stay for one night, no amenities

name: Wadi Abyad (North)
description: Feb 2019: easy to access from the north, right next to a pool (which is probably seasonal); locals seem to drive through but there is a very rough patch a bit further south

name: Water Station Wadi Mistal
description: March 2019: small water station with tap; friendly locals

name: Parking Kalbuh Park
description: March 2019: small parking (hence could be tricky for big rigs), near nice Kalbuh Park (with toilets; ok to stay for a night; walking distance to Suq

name: Wadi Arabiyin
description:
March 2019: enter the wadi from the East, from Thibab, good gravel road till the last village Suwayh; two spots to park and stay for the night (2nd is nicer, but possibly a bit tricky for big rigs)
ca. 1h to the beautiful pools to the southwest
PS. you may get approached from a local (name Keflan) and invited for tea .. he will openly ask for money)

name: Wahiba crossing, western track
description: March 2019: crossing the Wahiba on the western track is about 50km longer than the one ending in Quhaid; BE AWARE: driving N to S, once you are past the halfway mark, the track is not always well visible, very little traffic!; between ca. km 160 and 170 there are three to four fairly long dunes to drive up to – you shouldn’t be on your own here … but it is a great drive mainly used by locals

name: Ferry to Masirah
description: March 2019: Ferry to Masirah. One way with NFC for a 10t camper truck is RO35 plus 3.60 per passenger; there is also a private operator which is widely used by the locals and runs when its full; charge for a 10t camper truck is RO35, passengers included … the vessel is a somewhat older model :-) but we got over and back again safely

name: Masirah ‘South Beach’
description: March 2019: right at the beautiful sandy and clean beach; great for swimming!; just the occasional car passing by on the road

name: Wadi Tanuf
description: March 2019: easy to access, wide wadi with nice spots to stay, trees on both sides of the river bed; some locals picnicking at weekends; smaller cars can drive further up the decent gravel road; it is also a nice walk up to the small settlement of Qashah, where the wadi is only a very narrow gorge with some small pools

name: Mountain road from Minthar to Subaykhah
description: Decent but narrow gravel road with some steep sections, particularly coming from Minthar, requires 4x4, no problem for smaller cars, a bit of work for big rigs; hardly any camp spots en route

name: Between Slizq and Ibra
description: Great flat area! Lots of space. Depending how far you drive in you don’t hear the street!

name: Bank Muscat - Sohar Branch
description: Bank Muscat Office, ATM & CDM... located in the heart city of Sohar, Oman.

name: Sohar International Bank
description: Sohar International Bank (formerly Bank Sohar) is located in the heart city of Sohar. Bank Office, ATM & CDM..

name: Lemon Hypermarket
description: Food stuffs, groceries, clothing and many more...

name: Ras Salim
description: Turtle beach. This spot is fantastic if you are interested in watching turtles lying their eggs. The place is used by fishermen during winter time, however they rarely show up during summer time as the monsoon winds are blowing hard. It's also nice to camp over night if the winds are not strong. Exit the main road toward the little mosq(green light at night) and take the dirt road behind it that leads towards a small valley follow the valley road toward the beach. Mostly the southern end is where the turtles show up. You can continue walking along due south during low tide(SOFT SAND)

name: Ali Bin Majid beach
description: Amazing beach between two cliffs, I just saw a turtle for the first time in this location since a long long time. Very quit and peaceful spot and close by the main city Sur. Once you turn off the main road, follow the road towards a fenced place  enter the main gate (this spot was once privet but now is free for public) if you keep to the let you can cap on the cliff, however if you to the dirt road to the right you can go down the cliff towards a valley with a small creek, be careful of the mud once you are down take the path to the right and you will see a track crossing the little creek to the other side, once crossed take left towards the beach. Very soft and nice sands on a small beach between two cliffs. Might not be very private however still nice to snorkel as well.

name: Fisherman area at beach
description: Between boats and fishermen shags 5m from sea

name: Wadi Bih Viewpoint
description: Amazing spot surrounded by mountains, overlooking the road to Wadi Bih. Only accessible by 4x4. Flat rocky patch of ground just off the main track. Plenty of space. OK for tents too. Incredible sunrise and sunset. Exposed if windy.

name: Sugar Dunes
description: Camping in the sugar dunes, easily accessible on existing tracks approaching from the north. 4x4 only. Saw some camels roaming the dunes, but perfectly quiet and isolated. (Dec 2018)

name: Near Filim
description: Just off the main road, nice views of surrounding mountains but a little rubbish lying around. Stayed here instead of right on the coast at Filim as more private.

name: Blowholes Near Fins Beach
description: On the cliffs a little north of Fins White Beach (which was quite busy and not so white). Next to spectacular blowholes (no doubt only spectacular if the waves are big) with mountain views behind. You can see the track leading to the beach not too far away, but it's pretty private and lots of other similar spots along the cliffs here if this one is busy. More busy at weekends.

name: Wadi Dayqah
description: Peaceful spot in relatively narrow wadi with high cliffs on either side. Some pools for swimming, although they were a bit slimey with algae when we were there. A couple of cars passing through, but quiet.

name: Dam past Falaj Alsawad
description: There is a dam which can be reached after a 1 km very good gravel road (2WD no problem).  At the dam there is a paved parking lot. Below the dam some kind of picnic place. The paved road continues past the dam down to the Wadi where you should also be able to pitch a tent. I just put my sleeping bag next to the car on the parking lot. No mosquitoes at 5:30 pm but who knows ?

name: Local Roadside Food
description: Small coffee shop with local food. Small plates with vegetables, eggs and chapati breath for around 0.3 OMR

name: Near Bimmah
description: Round rocks beach, with some sand. very noisy sea waves at night.

name: Sur Hotel
description: Good budget option starting from 8 OMR.  Nice management. Be ok on their website and send send an email if your choice should not be available.

name: Showers at/inside Sultan Qaboos Mosque
description: If you have been free camping somewhere and need some real shower, you can find one in the toilets of the mosque. Always the last door if the row is a shower.  Check the visiting times as it is only open in the morning for visitors.

name: Near Beach
description: A lot of places between small bushes and sand. no problem to find a space for your tent. Access by 4x4. Do not camp on the beach.

name: Right under the dunes
description: Good place under the tree. Climb on the dune for sunset and sunrise. Access only with 4x4

name: Good place between the rocks
description: Good place between the rocks. Access with 4x4. The place is few kilometres from Nizwa.

name: Nice spot away from the road
description: rocky grounds, but clear spaces in between. enough to set up a tent. make a camp fire in the evening.

name: Place above the Canyon
description: Big place for the tent and car, between rocks. fireplaces already set. Nice view on the canyon.

name: North of Al Ashkharah Beach Camping spot 4wd only
description:
Nice spot close to the ocean, unfortunately pretty dirty (rubbish). 
Very quiet at night and not busy at all. Good 4G reception with Omantel.

name: Beach camp
description: Very nice place for camping. Beach is not too stony.

name: Wadi Tanuf
description: Beautiful spot just outside of the village, near water but you can park high enough so not in danger of wadi flood. Locals use it for BBQs in the daytime. Few trees here to use as shelter.

name: Checkpoint with Immigration to Oman
description: Checkpoint with Immigration to Oman. After the boarder fdom Al Ain there Europeans can get Visa on arrival. Before this point you dont get the immigration stamp. Price 10 day Visa was around 12€ or 5 oman Rial.

name: Potable Water at Mosque
description: Potable Water at Mosque, a small.one with filtered cold water like you can find a lot in this area.

name: Potable water close to shop
description: Potable Water close to shop where you can buy food.

name: Wadi tiwi
description: Perfect spot, some cars passing by, but quiet at night

name: Near Ibra
description: Hidden behind bushes, very close to town but quiet, very accessible. Flat area to put up your tent.

name: Water tap
description: Here you can get water from the tap, very easy, close to road

name: Foto Flash
description: Good shop to make copies and biometric pictures. They are helpful and speak English. Fast and friendly. The also provide FedEx Services. Its locatedin the Grand Mall on the ground floor next to cell phone companies where you also can buy Sim cards. Open from 10-10, also on Friday.

name: Beach Wild Camp
description: Nice beach wild camp, easy to reach from the road, only track on he beach is deeper sand. For 4x4 no problem, others should stay more on the solid areas next to trees.

name: Bakery
description: Here you can buy hand made bread, the store is located in the industrial area, they don’t speak much English here, very friendly.

name: Salma Plateau
description: Wild camp on Salma Plate, wonderful place, quite and beautiful views. To drive up here is very steep, but wide gravel pist, 4x4 is best for it. Would not drive the pist with a very big truck, small truck ok, the curves are sharp.

name: View Sand Dunes
description: Very nice place for Sand dunes, you can drive around to have nice views.

name: Old town museum
description: Very cool place, we loved it. Here you can see lot of old stuff from Oman. Lots of curiosities from all decades of time. Wonderful jewelry and copper pots just to name few things. The people here are wonderful also here and give you a little tour. The museum is privatly owned. Its 2 OR per person, absolutely worth. At the end of the tour they serve you coffee and dates.

name: Camel Race Track
description: Camel Race Track, meet the owners of camels here, ask for race dates. We meet some nice guys who gave is info, very interesting to see also the training

name: Field of Trees
description: We were too late to find a more hidden wild camp before it got dark, so stopped here, drove into the field of trees, seems to be ok. Villages around, but not too close. Ok, if you run late.

name: Good Water
description: Good drinking water. We filled some drinking water here and our swiss water bag. Don’t come here with big rig to fill 500 liter tank. Small amounts for drinking should be ok.

name: Water
description: Here you can get water in small amounts. Its by the block factory

name: View on mud houses
description: Very nice view on to mud houses, walk up to the tower and bring camera, nice short stop on the way.

name: Wild camp behind mountain
description: This is an even better wild camp in the same area, very quiet and flat, Easy to drive, we stayed here the night before the camel race, that starts at 6:30. If you came in the late afternoon you have some nice shade.

name: Camp near Wadi al Shab
description: Nice place to camp when you want to visit this Wadi. The wadi gets really busy in the weekends around 10. So when you stay here you can be the first to explore. The first boat goes at 7:30.  We campy on the parking on the other side of the road facing the sea.

name: Drinking water at Shell gas station
description:
Drinking water at Shell gas station.
Low pression, good quality, half inch thread.

name: Valley camp close to little snake canyon
description:
shady around some trees in a valley between nice mountains. close to wadi road but quiet at night. mountain goats.
small track off the road to the left if coming from Rustaq. 2wd possible.

name: dune camp
description:
nice place on an easily accessible dune close to compacted track. very remote and no mobile coverage. be sure to stay on established track if on your own. bedouins and camel farmers pass sometimes during day. 
not sure how long until the dune changes but similar places are everywhere

name: Oman —> UAE  border for all nationalities
description:
We came from Oman and entering UAE. We first got our exit stamp in our passport from the big building with the dome. But then we had to drive back for the CTP exit stamp. So I would do that first. You can get it at the customs on the left side were people enter Oman. (see Foto ) after getting al your stamps you drive on the the UAE side. 

Just before getting your passport stampt you have a little building that offers car insurance. We got ours there for 10 days it cost us €40,- 

After that we drove trough the scanner and got manually checked. There they also stamped our CTP. 

That what’s it.

name: Oman Bicycle
description: Larger bike shop with high quality parts and very knowledgeable staff

name: Ain Sahban Springs
description:
Ain Sahban Springs 
24.186710 ° N 56.315700 ° E
From Suhar direction W, to the mountains. Bizarre rocks, off-road traces, who demand the technique. 
Don't use OSM, it will take the wrong Valleyside, use google until you find the first brown target "Ain Sahban", then follow only this targets (not Google). 4x4 necessary!
No cellphone coverage. 
A hot sulfur source and a cold fresh water source meet here. Pleasant bathing in the middle of this lone rock landscape.

name: Ahmed Al Ismaeili Bike Service
description:
Better service point will be difficult to find in Oman! Incredible service, experts in various service jobs even spare parts and tyres.
Nizwa Bikers Club HQ.

name: Wahiba dune camp with sea view
description: Nice flat area close to quiet track (some cars in the evening) with views all around to sea, sunrise and sunset. Close to southern end of crossing. Please do not litter.

name: Beach camping
description: unlimited space for camping directly a great sandy beach. Very quiet at night, sometimes a car of locals or tourists passes during the day. Wonderful for swimming and playing in the surf. very soft sand. take care with the tide and rather camp a distance away from the water if unsure. sadly also here some litter but better than at sugar dunes.

name: water at ladies mosque
description: here you can get water at ladies mosque, very easy

name: Car Services/Parts
description: go here if you want window tinting, need parts, fuel additive, stickers, etc. The street is full of car services shops.

name: ROP Visa Extension
description: Fast and easy. You need only Passport and credit card.

name: Plateau overlooking Fins
description: Flat site. 50 Meters next to small mountain gravel road near Fins. If the beach campsites get too crowded, go here and enjoy being on your own. You might hear the highway, but will overlook the coastline and Fins. If you travel in a group: The site can hold several cars. 4x4 recommended.

name: Fish & Sea Food
description: Several shops for freshly caught fish and sea food.

name: Sim card shop
description: Phone shop where they also sell Sim cards. We payd 8 euro for 1.5 G

name: A wadi deep in the mountain
description: Perfect place for your tent bbq. New toa, and bathroom. Beautiful landscape

name: Wadi al Khabbah
description: A hidden small gem in the lush garden. Fresh water, good campsite toa and bathroom in the nearby.

name: Beautiful spot near Lima Village
description:
Beautiful bay, surrounded by the mountains and trees. Nearby the village Lima, where you can take a ferry (with car) to Dibba or Khasab. 

Nb; you can drive from Khasab to Lima with 4x4. Beautiful mountain road

name: just of the road
description: we stayed here avoiding the rush during weekends in the neighboring wadi, just off the road. easy to drive, in the waterbed, beautiful area, be aware always to camp on a higher spot not in the bed.

name: water before wadi
description: here you can fill up your ester before going into the wadi, please fill only small amounts because its a water source of the village.

name: Water station with tap
description: Filling station for water trucks with tap.

name: the lonely tree
description: wonderful spot just off the road, easy to reach with a wonderful view. you can be seen from the road, but very little traffic at night. nobody came by. also great place to make a camp fire.

name: water plant
description: here you can fill up your water canisters, the place is also good for big rigs.

name: new big supermarket
description: a big new supermarket in the Bahla Mall. Here you can stock up with everything.

name: Khwar Ruri
description: Very nice little bay just right around the corner from the Main Beach. Quiet and good for snorkeling.

name: the Guhl Wadi
description: wonderful place to drive here, we would recommend 4x4 if you want to go to the end. Its challenging depending on water level, so can be easy or difficult. very beautiful place and drive, lot of photo stops, don’t camp in the wadi as locals always advise.

name: Water source
description: Another water source in the mountains, good pressure, but only to fill small amounts, bc. villagers water, not to fill big tanks.

name: Wadi Ash Shuwaymiyah
description: Great place in the limestone cliffs surounded by palm groves. Nice Pool near by. 5 min. walk.

name: Panda Cafe
description: Nice cafe, locals all drink the Caposan (shot of espresso, milk, sweetened condensed milk and foam) ok WiFi, outlets to charge, the locals stay for hours so you feel no pressure to leave, open 24hrs and AC inside

name: Al Kauther Restaurant
description:
Dishes for 1 rial, but you can ask for more of everything if you have the assorted tray that locals get. Employees speak a little English and are very friendly. We've eaten there multiple times and haven't gotten sick.

It's located right behind the market so everything is fresh.

name: Public toilet
description: Instead of doing your things on the beach

name: Al Hawash Restaurant
description: Genuin, excellent Ománi food, very good kitchen

name: Ras al Hadd guest house
description:
Totally refurbished hotel. 
Just beside the old military airfield from WW2. Very cool site to visit!
Excellent location walking distance to the ( turtle) beach. 
New Swimming pool. 
Excellent staff.

name: Wahiba Sands
description: Safe place between two dunes. On the way through the desert from south to north. 20 meters from the main track.

name: water at gas station
description: You can get small amounts of water here. But, you cannot fill huge tanks. Nice guys and good for a quick break.

name: Easy to find, stunning sunset, quiet road
description: Pull-in just off a quiet road. Faces West so a lovely sunset.  if you have a tent you can get further off the road.

name: 20 km near Ibra
description: Nice, flat and quiet place. Sandy ground with small trees. Perfect for visiting Ibra the next day.

name: Visa Extension close to airport
description:
Visa extension with long opening hours: 07.30am to 09.30pm. When you go in, you get a ticket at the counter. Ask here for a application form, fill it up and wait.
Parking no problem, also for big rigs.

name: Muscat Gases, Sur Branch
description: they filled our swiss gas bottle, no adapter needed. first the sended us 200m further to a gas seller, but the seller could not fill the bottle. so we went back to Muscat Gases, together with the seller. Took us 10 minutes, 1.5 Rial for 5.5kg gas.

name: Camping Store
description: wonderful shop to buy camping gear, the best I have seen in Oman. They also sell gas bottle, very nice guys.

name: Sama Heights
description: Hotel with camping space. Chalets and Bungalows available. breakfast, lunch and dinner available. Comfortable. No WiFi. No Renna phone signal.

name: Water at gas station
description: here at the little mosque you can fill up your water, but small amounts, right behind gas station

name: Great viewpoint over palms and mud houses
description:
A p
ull in on a main road with a great view of mud houses

name: As Sifah South Beach
description: Nice place on the south end. Very quiet in the night, a few locals in the evening. Just at the costal Trail. Easy to reach.

name: Al Hud Hud restaurant & coffee shop
description: Turkish restaurant and coffee shop. serves Turkish, Arabic, Indian and some Chinese. Open all day. Easy to find and park.

name: Dealer in auto glass and auto spareparts
description: workshop for original or customated windshields for normal cars and trucks

name: Iran Visa
description:
Hala Travel can provide you the RN-number for the Iran visa in a very short time. 5 Rial per visa.
Entrance no. 2, second floor. Mr. Sameer Abdulla Al-Bahrani. Tel +968 99371052. E-mail: halatravel.t@gmail.com.

name: Al Aqar Shopping Center
description:
Little shopping area not far from the border. You have here an ATM (bank muscat) and you can find Omantel SIM card at the grocery store named Al Aqar Shopping  Center. Just what you need to start your journey in Oman! Has also restaurants.
Sim card : was 10 OR for card, 250 min national and  6 Gb + 1 extra Whatsapp Gb. Other plans also available.
Ooredoo sim card reseller also available in the shopping area. I didn't check the prices cause I saw it later.

name: water plant
description: here you can get water, the taps are outside on the right side

name: VWater plant
description: Here you can get water, guys are super friendly, its free, also probably possible to fill up big amounts

name: Rocky beach camping
description: Turn off and thread through the village, pass through a 'valley' of dunes and to a rocky beach. The track is hard-pack with a layer of sand over the the top. Beach is very rocky and has quite a bit of litter but there are plenty of places to choose from, including a couple of open shelters to keep off the sun. A few locals pass during the day, all very friendly. We were offered fresh lobster from one of the local divers.

name: Water at mosque
description: Here you can fill up small amounts of water

name: Supermarket
description: Good market, here you can get everything, and get also budget cards for Oreedoo, further down there is a Omantel shop as well.

name: ATM Bank Muscat
description: Here you can get money from ATM. Bank Muscat.

name: Secondary Road
description:
Wild camp on dry season between big bushes, good for cyclist; near a secondary road but very quiet and out of sight.
(4G OMANTEL full signal).

name: Among Hills
description: Quiet wild camp between hills, follow the path, very quiet wild camping.

name: Mercedes Truck Service
description: Truck Service for MB Trucks. Very friendly and fast service. Manager speaks German. Recommended

name: Uni Gas LPG
description: Easy and fast refill. We payed 1.5 omr for 12kg lpg. Open from 8am to noon.

name: Salalah Port
description:
We are two travellers on bicycle (NZ/USA) who have found that it is possible to take a boat over to Berbera, Somaliland (we were also offered Bosaso, Somalia). Keep in mind that aspects of this are technically prohibited by the Omani government, but it is still doable with persistence. 

Asking at offices in town provided no luck. Going to the port led us to one contact, which led to another and then another. After 3 or 4 days of phone calls we met with a merchant who offered us passage on his vessel. 

He tried to charge us 1000 USD. We knew this was unreasonable as the merchant going to Bosaso had offered us passage for the expense of food (~50 USD). Negotiate as well as you can. The two of us are students so used that card, which may have helped. 

To finalise the deal we had to organise our Somaliland visas and Salalah Port Passes. One of our contacts helped with both of these. The harder of the two is the Port Pass. To obtain this we had to get our passports listed on the ships manifest and then take this to the Royal Oman Police Headquarters listed on iOverlander. Our friend knew someone at the immigration department, which may have helped get our manifests stamped with port approval.

Now the fun begins. Our merchant said the boat would leave in 3 days, inshallah. This turned into 12 days (including 3 days of public holiday for Sultan Al Qaboos passing away). 

Our boat has limited hygeine by western standards. We are sleeping on the deck. Our crew is nice albeit they speak limited English.

Remember to be persistent and that inshallah means inshallah... Good luck!

name: wadi
description: nice gravel road to drive inbetween mountains, also for wild camp ok

name: Near Kizit village
description: Open flat space at the end of a dirtroad.The dirtroad starts about 500 m south of the small village Kizit. Absolutely silent. nice place between interesting rocks spreaded between the trees. GSM signal available

name: little paradise
description: A Paradies with a 9km full of sandy beach.(this spot you can reach without 4x4). Fayal is the owner of that place.so please sent him just a short message (00968/99 55 62 57), when you plan to arrive. if you want, he can cook and bring for you very delicouses fish dishes. and also he can do a crepé and a amazing Coffee for your breakfast. Fayal is a professionel Tourguide, which offers snorkeling, dolphin/whale watching and night turtle watching. the spot is also perfect for your dog. the white sandy beach and the blue sea invites you for a swim. enjoy your time! Hypermarket is nearly!

name: Sheltered, pull-in off very quiet road
description: A wide pull-in, just off a track, between two hills, next to a wadi but not part of it. Saw perhaps 5 cars pass while we were there. Sheltered so not too windy. No phone signal or 4g

name: Wadi Bani Khalid
description: Pretty good spot to camp in the wadi without camping right next to it. It’s quite high and you still have some privacy here (it’s behind the big rock to your right after passing the huge first wadi). Very quiet and peaceful place for a small (2p) tent.

name: Beautiful view en peaceful place
description:
Perfect place for camping with a tent. Lots of space, beautiful view, enough place for a bonfire and in the morning some lovely goats walking around. To get there is a little off Road, we were fine with our 2x2wd though. A “shower” is in the public bath of the village Misfat itself so a 5 minute drive away. 

I didnt know The altitude. Hope the cordinates are ok, The location is also on maps.me as ‘lovely camping spot overlooking The town’.

name: beautiful waterfall
description: on the side on the road a beautiful waterfall. Worth a short stop.

name: As Sifah Oceanfront & Mountain View
description: Beautiful spot above tide line in low scrub with spectacular views of the mountains. Definitely requires 4WD to follow the track, which crosses the wadi moraine next to the beach at least once. Private and quiet, though in afternoon a few locals passed by on a track a few hundred meters away.

name: Water tap
description: Water tap with good pressure, backside of the mosque, easy to park close enough.

name: Gas Division
description: here they fill small gas bottle, the other place send us here, because they could not fill due to high pressure of their machine. So this is the place, you better go. Also a few restaurants around.

name: quiruyat
description: very quiet place just near the sea. Big parking, no noise.

name: Protected spot for a tent
description:
Spot protected from the wind and out of sight of the road. Flat for 1–2 tent. Good for bicycle travellers.
(Omantel 3G)

name: Parking lot near small fishing harbour
description: Not really the nicest place but very convenient to spend the night.  The  parking lot is completely empty. (when I was there). Seems not to be used by anyone. Not far from the road. Sometimes a car passes. At night quiet. View on the sea and the dhows leaving the harbour

name: water at mosque
description: here you can fill small amounts of water, ask locals around if ok to take. Should be fine, but please no big tank filling.

name: near Mudayy
description:
A bit more than 1km away from the well known picnic area above Mudayy. 
Alone, more Camps around here, also good for hiding of it is windy.
2G runs well... Or a bit faster
Keep the place clean, please.

name: coffee nation
description: IT's the first coffee shop when you enter Oman coming from the border.They have good coffee, free wifi, private rest  room and money exchange next door.There have spécial discount for travellers. The owner is very friendly and can give you a lot of informations.

name: Quiet wild camp
description:
Quiet spot near of a town, not far from the road but out of sight. Good for cyclists ;)
(Omantel 4G)

name: Water tap
description: Toilets and a water tab with filter. Low pressure, only recommended for small tanks.

name: Beach Salalah East
description: nice white beach with some picnic huts. Beautiful sea. Not far from toilets and water tap. Locals come at sunset and leave when it is dark. nice and quiet at night.

name: Seeb Beach
description: super beach, has toilet and shower. If you want a quiet night don’t stop here, if you want to have good chats and fun with nice locals, come here. we loved it here. Don’t know if its legal, police was around, did not say anything.

name: sandy hidden beach
description: You definitely need 4wd and maybe to release air (big rig). Its a small lonely beach. Reachable thru the same way to Arabic hotel.

name: Wakan, Picturesque mountain village
description: Picturesque mountain village with palms and fruit gardens. Well known by locals. In February the apricot trees are allready blooming. There is a nice walking path through the gardens. You need 4x4 for the last 3km, the road is unpaved, very steep and a bit exposed. There is a small parking at the entrance of the village. Otherwise no possibilities to stay overnight untill you get back to the valley of Wadi Mistfal. Not suitable for big rigs (trucks).

name: Difa village
description: Beautiful quiet place in the wadi.  Waterwells around. nice to take a shower in it. Only mosque is nearby so you can hear the prayercalls. Nice scenery between the mountains. Sound of frogs at night

name: Wadi ali Kabbah
description: Great spot for camping next to running water palms and quite

name: Drinkingwater high pressure 1/2 " thread
description:
Drinkingwater high pressure 1/2 " thread .
Official Water Treatment company.
nobody there, but locals told me, it's free for everybody!

name: Swiss Embassy
description: Swiss Embassy and Embassy of Netherland.

name: Embassy of Netherland.
description: Swiss Embassy and Embassy of Netherland.

name: Wadi Dam Parking
description: Tourist attraction, big parking but not for overnight! A nice and clean park with some picknick lots. nice view, but a lot of tourists!

name: On the balcony over the wadis.  With a breathtaking panoramic view of the valley and the Wadis.  Totally calm.
description:
On the balcony over the wadis. 
With a breathtaking panoramic view of the valley and the Wadis. 
Totally calm. 
Not visible from any street at this point.  Locals probably also come here based on the fireplaces. We were here alone.  
Cell phone reception H +.

If in a 2 wheel drive vehicle, best to avoid. We had a few hair-raising moments before having to reverse. Wound up staying near water filling station. Area is quiet and beautiful.

name: Drinking water from the factory
description:
it is not the best, but ok.
ask the guard, in his the backoffice is a tap with 1/2 " thread and good pressure!

name: Strategic overview of the medieval defense tower.
description:
Strategic overview of the medieval defense tower.  
Direct view at the tower, 4G +, but you can hear the road, be careful when it rains.  
50 m south total calm, H +.  
It is apparently being built on a street, already registered on Google, this place may not be as quiet in the future!

name: On the football field without grass.  It's not exactly the most attractive place, but it's quiet at night.
description: On the football field without grass.  It's not exactly the most attractive place, but it's quiet at night.  Even on Friday no party, no visitors.  Good for a night if you are late in the region and do not want to search long. Omantel 4G+.

name: in the middle of nowhere!
description: About 1km away from the highway, if you have wind from west, you will hear it, otherwise absolutely quiet. Omantel H+.

name: Road direction to Al Aka blocked!
description:
Road direction to Al Aka blocked!
Use on your own risk!

name: Omantel Shop
description:
Omantel Shop 
to pop up your SIM Card.
very Quick!

name: Wadi Al Maawil (don't use it when rain)
description:
we found a very quiet and hidden place here, with a lot of wood for fire!
Omantel H+.

name: Drinking Water high pressure
description: Free Water 1/2 " thread, direct at the entrance house.

name: Bridgestone Workshop
description:
Bridgestone sale and mount tires.
More expensive than in UAE!

name: In the stone desert with 4G.
description:
In the stone desert. 
Not a special place, but totally quiet.  
In a former gravel mining area you stand approx. 1.5 m lower than the grown terrain, between hills and trees as a perfect privacy screen.
Omantel 4G.

name: Wadi Bad Ar Rahman. 4G
description:
Wadi Bad Ar Rahman, no special place, but at this point no buildings. 
Kilometer of sandy beaches with an exceptional shell selection. 
The next buildings are abandoned. 
A few fishermen who spread their fish nets on the beach with their no more completely new Tayota off-road vehicles. Omantel 4g. 
Of course, the usual garbage.

name: Turkmenistan Embassy, tkmemb@emirates.net.ae
description:
Very kind lady, helped us to fill the forms.
we had to pay 2x10 $ (for 2 pets.) to The First Abu-Dhabi Bank for the apply and can take the usually transitvisa in two about two weeks, when we come back from Saudi-Arabia.

name: Golden Oasis
description:
Cheap but good hotel, free parking outside the hotel, CCTV Monitored so we had the motorcycle there without problems, free fast wifi, 24 h reception, lobby with wifi to sit and work, elevator, bath with bathtub, big bed, TV, chairs and table, cabinet, AC. 
Use an App to book it (Hotels.com), got a doubleroom for 12 OMR /29€ without breakfast.

name: Filim Beach
description: Drive in the direction of the beach and take the well established track to your right. You will pass a lot of suitable camp spots near the path. At this one there is enough space for your car and tent. We barely had any wind at night. No car passing at night. 2WD possible. Unfortunately there is garbage lying around behind the rocks.

name: Public Shower
description: public shower near the beach at ras madrakah (definitely go swimming before showering, the beach and sea are amazing!)

name: Al Ya
description: Nice spot to watch mountain goats during sunrise. Only a few cars driving by, but be prepared to engage in conversation with friendly Omanis.

name: WiFi for free & fast
description: Opposite of Golden Oasis hotel you can still access their WiFi, no password needed, Network Name is: "Golden Oasis". Don’t park directly at the hotels parking lot (no signal), but next to the trees and grass are some shadowed parking lots alongside the street. From there you can connect.

name: Tyre Plus - Michelin workshop
description: A good place for tire repair and replace, alignment, balancing and other tyre stuff. Trucks and cars.
