name: water at water tab
description: Got drinking water here before going to desert. Not good pressure.

name: PDO oil museum
description: Should normally be nice with activities for children but right now closed for renovation until further notice. Stay tuned on their social media.

name: Road to Qayat
description: Incredible wild camping spot. Spectacular views. Up a dirt road on the way to Qayut. Can get water at a couple of the little villages on the way up. Suitable for tent only

name: Sayq Plateau under Juniper tree
description: Alternative spot to the one further down the road: The way to the other spot was too steep for us so we stayed here. Completely quiet, no one but donkeys anywhere to see. Behind the tree is a nice spot to put up the tent. Cold at night but absolutely lovely.

name: Public toilet in visitor center
description: One of the nicest toilets I've used in Oman. Very clean, with TP in the stalls. Maybe you can even use their shower.

name: water Station
description: Here you get water from a tank with 2" pipe

name: Lulu hypermarket
description: Very big supermarket.Food department is open from 8am to 11.45pm

name: Hidden place on the cliff with stunning view!
description: Nice hidden place on the cliff easy to access from the road. 4G with ooredoo.

name: Lulu Hypermarket and restaurant
description: very cheap water, food, fruits, and sim card

name: Water tap near desalination station
description:
Water tap with good pressure meant to fill a water basin (probably for animals to drink). Just pass the water station leaving it on your left. You will see a water basin facing a small building which is a public shower.
Be careful! The area around can be muddy and the tap is sometimes not accessible with your vehicle. An alternative is to drive along the water plant and take water from the shower. If you have a 20m hose or more it is doable.
Last solution is to ask water at one of the water trucks that come from time to time to fill in.

name: water station
description: Here you get water from big hose. Not sure if potable

name: Jebel Samhan
description: Nice spot with plenty of space and stunning view over Mirbat!

name: Jabel Shams Wild Camp
description: Great flat area with gorgeous views. Easy for Rv and tents.

name: Visa Extension fast and easy
description: Here you get the visa extension fast and easy. Enter the right building there you'll be forwarded to the process.

name: Awqad Police Station
description: Here you can extend your visa. It's on the first floor. Have a copy of your passport and your visa at hand. You also need an request for extension. If you don't have you can get the letter and make a copy at any Sanad Service. Pay for the extension by credit card. Go in the morning. Closes around 12.30-1pm

name: GAS
description: This site refills gas, but delivery is on the next day !!

name: Tawi Atair
description: Place with a big water pipe where locals fill their tanks, probably for giving water to animals. I don't know if this water is meant to be "human-potable" because all the people here drink bottled water. Anyway, we took water there 2 times and used it for washing the dishes, cooking, cleaning fruits and vegetables, washing ourselves without any problem. We also used it for drinking after filtering. So for us, it is the same use as if we took from a mosque or at a water station. I would indeed qualify it as potable taking the usual precautions (filter). It is most probably the same quality as the water you would take from a tap or a water station in this country.

name: Ayn Razat
description: The toilets are near the parking. You can easily fill water in with a hose from the men's ablution. You can even overnight in the big parking, have a picnic under the trees and look at the beautiful water lilies  (in the morning)

name: yellow dunes
description: Camp anywhere in this area at the bottom of the yellow dunes. Some locals come here end of the week to climb the dunes with their car. Some litter left behind. A lot of bushes and gunpowder trees in this dunes, with life that goes with : gerbil, sand fish, lizard. This is the first stop but you can go further on the sandy track for other campsite.

name: Water tap near the desert camp
description: Big pipe in a kind of shower. Good pressure. Also good for shower and laundry. "Real" water filling station 100 m below.

name: Burkana oasis
description: Stop here to enjoy the shadow of the trees or have some wellness time. Hot sulfur water coming out of the ground through big pipes. You can arrange them to have a shower or you can dive into the basin. Locals come there. Unfortunately the place is not very clean.

name: Ramlat Jadilah - Highest dune of Oman
description:
Highest dune of Oman and supposedly from Middle East. Beautiful view from the top to all other dunes. From Mitan, good road for about 10 km, then gravel road for about 15-20 km, then sand track.
Local tourism highlight. The side facing the road is clean from car tracks, the other is full of it. The challenge for locals is to climb to the top by car!

name: Bur Al Hikman
description:
Beautiful white beach with a nice lagoon behind.. 
Not recommended to enter with one car unless you have a guide or a proper map due to its being a swamp area.

name: Al Suwaiq Port
description: You can sea ship your vehicle from here to Iran (specific ports). the vehicle  reaches Iran in one night using Ferries. this route is only from Oman to Iran not the other way around. Custom and Custom Clearance Offices are available on ground.

name: Oman bikers club
description: Motorcycle club house, the bikers meet at the place every Tuesday at 8 pm

name: Al Rawee Elextronics
description: Electronic shop that also sells solar panels, batteries, inverters, DEL lights.

name: Water filling with hose
description: Water tanker filling station with hose connection at the side. Easy. Next to the road, no fence.

name: Al Hoota Cave
description:
Although the cave is big and beatiful, I was not convinced by the guided tour, the fountain and the roaring of the lion.
But the little free geology museum is really worth taking the détour, with samples and explanations about all type of rocks you find in Oman.
Open 9am to 5pm every day.
Adult : 7 OMR
Children up to 12 : 3.5 OMR for the cave
Museum is free.

name: Kate Sweet
description: Very good French Pastry : croissant, mille feuille, cream puffs and other like in France. Come here and feel like home!

name: Al Mas Auto Spares
description: Well stocked, friendly staff. also recommend a nearby mechanic who specialises in brakes.

name: Summit Parking
description: A nice parking area on top of a small hill. Busy during the day and on weekends. A generator in the valley is a bit annoying, noisy. We slept well with ear plugs. Awesome view in the morning and no bugs.

name: Entrance to the Rock Gardens
description:
Entrance to the beautiful but fenced off Rock Gardens. Entrance was not sign-posted from main route and was hard to find.
Unfortunately, the Rock Gardens were closed when we passed. From afar, they looked like worth a visit, though.

name: Gravel Plain
description:
There’s not much here, but it’s conveniently close to the highway and with even more convenient sand mounds topped by dense shrubs for good wind protection. Firm ground, good for pitching a tent. 
There’s not really a road to here, just follow some tyre tracks off the highway. Road can be heard in the distance, but totally quiet at night. A visiting camel at night.

name: Pink Lagoons
description: You need to come here in season. Lagoons mostly dry in early November, no flamingos.

name: Lookout over Cliffs, camping possible
description:
Lookout balcony, views over cliffs and remote beaches, 500m a.s.l.
There is a gravel parking with guardrails at the far end. Camping is possible on the gravel area or behind the guard rails.
Some cars and cows at night, no problems at all. Great sunset. Cooler up here than on the beach.

name: Army Checkpoint
description: Armed checkpoint. Did not want to see any documents ineither direction

name: Steep 4x4 Track
description:
The Rakhyut end of this track between the highway and Rakhyut is really steep and narrow and has tight turns, small washouts and loose gravel. Crossing an oncoming car is a challenge at the very least. Use low gear reduction up or down. 
If you are a 4WD enthusiast, though, this is a great little adventure for you. If you are not: don’t start with this one.
Not suitable for big rigs.

name: Army Checkpoint
description: Road checkpoint, not asked to show any documents

name: bank saderat Iran for visa
description:
here pay 22 Oman rials for the visa to Iran.
better to do it before going to the embassy (if price hasn't changed) it saves you the taxi trip.

name: Sef motorcycle mechanic
description:
Sef is a quad mechanic, bush mechanic kind of shop. Sef is from India, little English spoken but cool.
he fixed some fan wiring issues, and I did my oil change.
btw the petrol station guy told me he has no licence for me to do oil change there, that's why I came here.

name: In the wadi
description:
Here you can rest and enjoy the nature. In the beautiful Wadi Bir. There are a lot of big stones, but round. So it is bumpy to get there, but doable. There are a lot of other nice spots in the wadi around here. We did the way up from Ismaiyyah (Route 30, Oman Offroad) with a 6x6 18 ton truck. Lets see how the way down is. The way in total is spectacular. We loved every stunning sight when you drive around another curve and see the new outlook.
Comment: We turned around a few km further because that curves were narrow and steep. But we drove the rest with the quad bike. And later it is an easy track. The last way down to the ocean is steep but doable.

name: By Water filling station
description: Very quiet with toads and local cats the only visitors. There is glare from town lights, but not too disturbing. If unable to reach the balcony over the Wadis this is a stop gap if you run out of daylight.

name: Mobilyo Quriyat
description: WiFi mobile shop with red bull sim cards

name: Al Ruwais
description:
A campsite with toilet. Beside beach, very quiet and very beautiful. Ocean views. No showers, mega mosquitoes ( but they only went for me). 

In town beside petrol garage excellent Restaurant newly acquired by a Turkish Gentleman.  Fabulous fish.

name: Sale of L.P.G. Gass
description: LPG gas sales. big sign on road in town next to street

name: Roadside
description: good Cold drinking water at the road.......

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Another checkpoint along the route to Yemen. They wanted to see the passport.

name: On the cliffs
description: Nice spot with a beautiful view over the ocean. There is a green field with wild grass. A few meters away is also a tree with a beautiful place, but we preferred to stay near the view.

name: Al Safa Lake
description: Trees with shade for camping near Al Safa Lake, about an hour drive on graded Road, crossing a wadi or two with rocks and sand, but easy drive in.

name: Half-way between Al Fath and Al Faj
description: Wild camp site close to wadi to explore, multiple rings of stacked stones (for sheep?), within sight of road but only accessible by 4x4.

name: Quarry partly hidden from road
description: Quarry with space for multiple vehicles and easy access from the road. Partly hidden from the road.

name: Top of Pass
description: Excellent views and camping possible thanks to excavations next to the road. No privacy, plenty of goats, but flat ground for vehicle camping.

name: Street
description:
There is a cooling machine for cold water at the road.
Just for drinking, not filling up the car. 20l should be fine.

name: Border Oman Saudi
description:
This is the new Border between Oman and Saudi.
Oman is easy, but the Saudi do not really understand eVisa.

**I NEVER CORRECT ANYONES NOTES. BUT HERE I MAKE AN EXCEPTION. THE SAUDIS AT THIS BORDER POINT ARE VERY FAMILIAR WITH eVISA.

Maybe some training will help ;-) If you can not print it, take screenshots  ;-)
There is gas station 6km on the Saudi Boarder.. diesel is 15 Cent December 2021 ;-)

name: White wash laundry
description:
Laundry. 
They charge 200 per piece. We negotiated to 3.5Rial for our whole laundry. Next day pick up.

name: Shell Station
description: They have a water tap with good pressure. Just ask. We filled up around 110l without problems.

name: Toyota Workshop
description:
Toyota Workshop. 
We just needed an oil change. They were very friendly and helpful.

name: Mall of Oman
description:
Really big Mall! 
EVERYTHING!
Including a cinema and „Snow Oman“ (at this moment under construction). A big Carefour and all kind of shops. 
It’s also big rig friendly (higher than 2,4m). Just follow the brown sights „Mall of Oman“ later there is a bus parking lane. We also parked there because of our hight.

name: Ibri Bawadi Mall
description: Mall with a LuLu Hypermarket and a Hotel.

name: Naeem Majan Polyclinic
description: Cheapest and fastest PCR Test in Town. 12 OMR. Take the Test at 5:30pm and get the result next morning 8am.

name: Camelrace Track
description:
Here you can see camel races or camel race Training.
Sadly we were one day too late. Yesterday was race day. It’s a little difficult to find out the race schedule. Normally it’s early in the morning around 7am.

name: Overlooking a Mini Canyon
description: Flat ledge covered in small shale overlooking a mini canyon with wonderful mountain views to the west, north, and east. A mosque and little-used dirt road is visible to the south. You can collect firewood around the area. 3G with Omantel.

name: Wadi Muaydin
description: Spacious and flat area set well back from road. Easily accessible for 4WD. Slightly above wadi bed but need to check weather. Very quiet, unlike sites already noted further up wadi near village.

name: Campsite 4
description: Difficult road to get there. A lot of shadow as you are between the mountains. Very quiet except for some goats. Almost no mobile connection. Gets cold once the sun sets.

name: NFC ferry
description: This is where you can buy ferry tickets from Khasab to Shinas.The alternative ferry route if you are like us and did not want to reenter UAE and exit back to Oman further down. We paied 110€ for two people and our Land Cruiser. This way you get to see the fiords of Musandam that are not accesible by road.

name: Al Hail Waves Hotel
description: A nice clean hotel with everything you need after long periods on the road. Run by a Thai company. The price per night was 14 Omani when we were here. Bonus the Thai restaurant of the hotel. A nice change after the middle eastern food.

name: Bamboo huts
description: Between the hi-way and the coast and of the main road there are 4 bamboo open air huts with bbq. No other facilities. A bit noice from the road but quite at night

name: City Center Mall
description: Big mall with a Carrefour, mobile shops and others. Good place to restock for the drive South

name: Top of Travertine Curtain, Wadi Darbat
description: Open flat area near the top of travertine curtain. Very little litter, but lots of camels and cattle. Great views down to the coast. Access from Wadi Dsrbat Road,  where it crosses the wadi and turns right, leave tarmac and turn left. Good 4G.

name: Wahiba sands dune camping
description: A bit further after the overpriced 1000 Nights Camp there is a set of trees around a desert well. Great shade and an ideal overnight camp under the stars. The road till here was ok. Nothing hard. Air down to 19psi and just cruise through the sand.

name: Water tap at Al Jawabi
description: Drinkwater tap at something which looks like a praying room. Not a place to fill a whole tank. We took 15 liters.

name: Golden Car Parts
description: Here you will find most of the truck parts you looking for. Ask for Mr. Arun.

name: Alternator repair - Al Awad
description: These guys are perfect in fixing alternators and starters.

name: Kiosk on the cliff
description: Another beautiful place to camp between the cliffs and the beach. It is mostly used by locals for picnics but we were on our own the entire time. Hidden away from the road. No facilities so come prepared. You can see dolphins in the morning.

name: Al Baleed World Heritage Site
description: This is the museum of Frankincense and the archeological site. Makes for a nice day out if you come picnic ready. Recommended

name: Picnic Huts on the beach
description: Usual set up for Omani coast. These huts offer a bit of shade during daytime heat. No facilities but oceanfront views.

name: Behind Old Tanuf
description: Behind the ruins of the village of old Tanuf and directly above the Wadi in a safe location from floods we found this spot. It looks like it was a designated  picnic area but it served to us as a great overnight spot.

name: Beside The Dunes
description:
Wonderful romantic place with a perfect sunset above the dunes.
The spot is easy accessible, but a 4x4 is a good option.
Here and there we found holes in the sand, which could might belong to snakes, as we saw lots of snake-trails.
Expect also scorpions, as well as dozens of smaller and bigger bugs.
No internet connection here.

name: Nice flat and huge parking lot with a playground
description:
Locals are friendly here and brought us some food and camel milk. There's a playground a few meters away, the area is tidy and very calm.
There's a water source very near, as well as a gas station.
Good place for a start into the Rub al-Chali.
Internet connection is very good here.

name: Parking Lot
description: Good for a night, flat tarmac, nice people and very calm here.

name: Hilltop with a View
description:
Grassy hilltop with 350 degrees view towards the lowlands, the coast, a canyon, a camel farm across the valley. This is a fantastic, if exposed spot in the Dhofar Highlands.
It's level, free, always breezy, but shade only at night. ;-) No amenities except for a fireplace.
Access from the paved Ittin Road is via a short dirt track for which you don't necessarily need 4wd but some ground clearance. 
Big rig friendly? Depends on your rig.
Note: I came here in March, and the area had almost zero visitors. It is supposed to be very crowded during Khareef season, so the situation might be different then.

name: Mibam Village
description:
Mibam is a beautifully located small mountain village at the end of a paved road. I was the only tourist at the time of my visit. Great valley oasis canyon vistas. Some trails, though none of them marked. Swimming spot below the village.

About the road: It is mostly one lane with view passing places, paved all the way but partly extremely steep. You do not necessarily need 4WD but I'm sure it helps with the steep grades. Ground clearance and some power do help.

name: Water tap of mosque in Al Hamra
description: Water tap with probably unfiltered drinking water on Women Prayer side. Here you can fill your tank, without feeling guilty. Local people drink this water.

name: shebeez restaurant
description: Very good seafood restaurant. Good parking for trucks

name: Best Tic Welder near Muscat!
description: Here you will find Ronni the best Welder for stainless and alloy! Right beside the bakery!

name: Nice beach, quite and clean
description: This beach is fat enough from the parking and therefore quite at night. You can still use the facilities from the picnic area.

name: In Front Of A Cave
description:
At the end of the road, it turns right to a graveled area, where the cave is. Easy to access, sometimes a few locals came along. 
Before entering this space, there's also a bigger parking lot, which is a bit more leveled and a good windbreaker.

name: Paradise
description:
White sand, great views, no trash and here and there some locals. The water is emerald green and warm.
The underground is very rocky, so it's just luck to get your tent pegs into it.
The place is easy to access, but a 4x34 is recommended.

name: No Dolphins, But Windy
description:
We expected dolphins here, but there weren't any. Easy to access, but a 4x4 is recommended as the sand can be tricky here and there.
Nevertheless very tidy, calm and huge. Perfect also for bigger rigs

name: Swim With The Dolphins
description:
We found this place by accident, when watching the coast for dolphins.
At this beautiful beach were a lot of them, maybe 25. Lots of action and entertainment, as they always jumped out of the water.
We took a swim and were able to get very close to them, nevertheless we kept a bit more distance as we didn't want to disturb them too much.
This area is huge and appropriate even for bigger rigs.
White soft sand and a nice beach, perfect for snorkeling as well.

name: Huge Beach
description: Hundreds of places along the coastline and a beautiful mountainous landscape on the back. Just a stunning place here

name: Green Oasis With Palms
description: Fantastic green oasis in the middle of the mountains. If you drive right there's the first one - easy to access, but in between the palms it's very narrow. If you drive the left graveled and bumpy road (4x4 recommended), you can get much closer to the hidden beach, nevertheless it's not accessible by car.

name: On Top Of The Mountains
description:
Huge area with hundreds of nice places to stay. Perfect view onto the surrounding mountains and the coastline.
Easy to access and no problem for bigger rigs

name: Seaside cafe
description:
Lovely place to refresh and relax.
Beautiful seaview with food

name: Masirah island probably the best campsite.
description:
Quiet, well protected from the wawes.
You can access by motorcycle but not all the way down.
Beautiful white/ pink sand.
Clean

name: Park Restaurant
description:
With the touch of Oman, Indian heart, European class.
A wide variety of excellent prepared and presented food, top management with top chef in the kitchen.
Immaculate clean.
Very correct and fair price , highly recommended!

name: Mirbat lulu exchange
description: You can use exchange services or money transfer here!

name: Cheezy Bites
description: Masirah Island. Excellent Italien inspired restaurant. Clean, reasonable price, excellent pasta ! Recommended!

name: Water and public toilets
description: Brand-new public toilets, very clean. On the side there are water hoses with very high pressure.

name: Quiet camp ground with Mountain View
description:
Only accessible via dirt road, overlooking the mountains. Several spots where other people have done camp fires, with lots of bushes around. Should be easy to find wood :)

You can walk a bit from the place to the front of the plateau and have amazing views. Also easy to start the w18b from here!

name: Mountains
description:
Easy accessible place with great views. You can come here, if the spot further east is too steep for you.
Cool at night, can be windy, quite.

name: Roadside
description: Cold drinking water tap next to the road.

name: Lagoon
description: 6KM away from the main road, you'll find this lovley spot here, directly at the lagoon.

name: Maldives Of Oman
description:
What a beautiful place, surrounded by emerald green lagoons, lots of white sand and the ocean. Access is easy, 4x4 is recommended, even appropriate for bigger rigs. There's also an established campground very close to this place, the owner is a friendly guy and here and there, locals come along at the weekends.
You can either swim or kayak in the lagoon easily, nevertheless water level is pretty low in April, as well as the water is very warm.

name: Dunes Of Wahiba Sands
description:
I would say, without a stronger 4x4, here should/could be the end of what is drivable with a weaker 4x4. Up to here, we did it with our Sprinter 4x4 without problems, but going further would have caused us to climb the dunes even higher as we already did.
The sand is very soft here. And here and there it's getting pretty steep. Without 4x4 this place isn't accessible.
Expect lots of sand storm.

name: Wadi Tiwi
description:
The way up here, is spectacular/epic, but here and there very steep... we estimate 25-32% grade and maybe even more. It's also very narrow sometimes, with quite a few needle curves.
You'll need to drive through some small villages until you reach the dead end, where probably 4-6 cars will fit.
No way for bigger rigs to go until here, even though a 4x4 isn't really needed.
We barely made it up here with our Sprinter 4x4 (1st.gear) and it took us approximately half an hour. If we had been forced to stop, we wouldn't have made it!
Locals are very friendly, staying for the night hasn't been a problem.
To get to the Wadi, there are 2 ways, one easy one, hundreds of stairs down (15-20 mins), the other way is through the jungle (30 mins), but here you'll need a guide, as you can get easily lost here.
The Wadi itself has been worth the journey. Two beautiful pools, surrounded by lots of rocks and a small waterfall. Swimming here is no problem.

name: Under A Tree
description: In Muscat there are less good places, especially with a bit of shade. Even this one here isn't the nicest, but there's a big tree, where our sprinter got at least some shade, because at this time, Muscat has been very hot (up to 40°C). The place has been very calm, nobody disturbed us, it is pretty much flat and sandy. Do not go here, when it rains, you might get stuck. You'll maybe get water at the near mosque. Omantel worked well.

name: AlSaigh Garden
description: Farm with swimming pool with all requirements as Toilets, Rooms & rest area.

name: AlAshkharah
description: Camping next to a clean public toilet runs by the ministry of tourism. FOC. The sea is just 50m away. The care taker of the toilet lives here. He's friendly but didnt speak english. His friends came at night and talking until fajr, but I guess this happens only in Ramadan. You can ask permission to charge your electrical devices at his room.

name: Close to Ruus
description: If the other places are too busy, this is a perfect, quiet spot for the night. Nice view.

name: Riverside
description: Nice place next to river, deep enough to swim

name: Grassy clearing in amongst volcanic rocks
description:
Lovely site at the base of the cliffs... hidden from onlookers.
Water available further down the track close to the beach.

name: Hill top vista.
description:
A nice place to camp. Close to a road... high enough to have nice cooling breeze.
Zero facilities... no mosquitoes!
4x4 required to access the top of the lose gravel track.

name: Dhalkut
description: At the very end of the village, at the end of the paved road. Just above small beaches. Very quiet. 4G coverage.

name: Awan Gas LLC
description: Filling station for propane gas bottles, it was no problem to fill our 11kg European bottle.

name: Hishan Palace
description: The most beautiful mosaics we have been seen so far in the near east. The Restauration just finished in 10/21. Absolutely worth!

name: Qatar
description: Nice camp, great wind and good for Northerly Wind

name: Hugs of canyon
description: View to ocean, nice protected by the cliff

name: White Dunes and ocean view
description: In the sand with great view to ocean. There will be occasionally cars coming down to the beach

name: Camp mangro trees
description: Leave the main road at the round about, find the entry gate throug the fence, drive few kilometer towards the ocean until you reach the mangrotrees and you can camp next to them on the sand.

name: Bush camp
description: Beautiful spot in the desert, but passing trucks with sand between 6:00 and 24:00.

name: Public parking
description: At beach near corniche. Beautiful view, but noise from picnicing people.

name: Public parking
description: In village between homes.

name: Public parking
description: Behind mosque between rubish.

name: Nationaal Museum
description: Garden of National Museum. Quiet, centrally located.

name: Public parking
description: Parking in residential section with shops.

name: Hotel 1991
description: Perfect hotel, 200 SD for room 2 person. Free WiFi. Parking on street but no worries, it is between S-klasses and Porsches. McDonalds, Pizza Hut and BurgerKing acros the street

name: Parking at Sasco Palm Station
description:
Huge area behind the rest stop. There are toilets, restaurant etc.
The highway is in hearing distance.

name: Parking at Sasco Palm Station
description: Huge parking area behind the rest stop (toilets, restaurant).

name: Parking at Sasco Palm Station
description: Huge area behind rest stop (toilet, restaurant).

name: Parking at Sasco Palm Station
description: Huge area behind the rest stop (toilet, restaurant).

name: Last Fuel Station
description: Probably the last possibility to get diesel.

name: Baaboud Shipping Office
description: Bureau of one of the shipping companies. On the first floor, open from 8.

name: Ferry to Sudan
description: Here you leave your car (they bring it on board) and wait for the passengers to go on board. Customs and Immigration.

name: Arkan Tyres center
description:
They suposed to stock BF Goodrich, but had none in stock. So best to phone a head if you need them.

Phone: 4633422 (local)

name: Durra border crossing Jordan/Saudi Arabia
description:
(Dutch citizens without a Carnet De Passage.)

Exiting Saudi Arabia:
Very friendly, fun staff and easy. 
You have to drive all the way to the end(alot of buildings left and right but just follow the road straight ahead).
No need to get out of the car, there are two different 'ticket windows' you have to drive by where they take your passports and check your car papers and you're ready to go.

Entering Jordan:
One of the more intense bordercrossings we had.
First of all they didn't seem to trust us being Dutch as we 'don't look Dutch' and kept our passport for more than 30 minutes while asking us all about our real nationality, our first nationality, our parents' nationality. It was ridiculous.

We ordered 'Jordan Passes' via internet, so we had to go to a separate window to get our passes checked and stamped in. Afterwards we had to head back to immigration where they asked if we could prove what we said our jobs were. After yet another 30 minutes of waiting they let us through.
Next up was customs: first a very very very thorough check of the car was done. After this we received a receipt with which we had to go get insurance(can be found in containers around the corner, as well as money exchangers): one month car insurance costed us JD.36,- 
With the insurance papers we headed back to customs to get our TIP for JD.20,-

After this we were finished.

name: Silver City 2
description: Surprisingly nice hotel! For 200 Riyal we got a small apartment. Clean, comfortable and nice staff. Parking on the street directly in front of 24hour reception. Walking distance to many restaurants (including a really good fresh Mexican option!).

name: Al-Hijr (Madain Saleh)
description:
This is an ancient pre-Islamic archeological site, similar to Petra in Jordan. It has been highly recommended from various people.
We drove on our 3 day transit visa from Jeddah up here in one day and the closer you get the more amazing the drive gets. The landscape is desert with rock mountains.
Unfortunately, the site is closed since 5 months and supposedly reopens in 2020. There was no way for us to get in! (No begging helped)
But it sure would have been worth it!

It seems there are plenty of possibilities to camp in the area, but we decided to continue towards Jordan.

name: Bush camp in the mountains
description: A secure, off the road spot for the night behind some hills. Not visible from the street, it’s beautiful and quiet.. We didn’t see anyone. Down a little used dirt track.

name: Al Mudawara Border
description:
Exiting Saudi: There are no signs in English, nevertheless pretty straight forward. Just follow the road, it’s like a “border drive in”. 
First window customs and car inspection, second window immigration.

Entering Jordan: Follow the signs! First immigration and after customs with a quick and superficial inspection.
After that you have to buy an insurance which they asked 100JD for 30 days (because we have a Hilux with a camper), but after a long back and forth he agreed to only charge us 36 JD as if it was a “normal” car.
Additionally, they asked for 20JD at customs and we had to remind them to stamp our Carnet.

The officers were super friendly and welcoming. We’ve been asked if we have the “Jordan Pass”. We didn’t, but the officer gave us internet access and we were able to book it online (jordanpass.jo).
It includes all important sights and the visa fees.

name: Saudi Jordan border
description:
Saudi side is easy, you get the TIP Paper. Jordan: 20JD for PCR Test 40JD for Visa, if you have Jordan Pass no need to pay 100JD for Car insurance 1 month 20JD for CdP register make sure you fill your car up in Saudi before you cross the border

Leaving Saudi, no need to leave car. Two drive in shelter for customs and immigration.
You’ll get a receipt which you need at Jordan side.

Entering Jordan, go to immigration. You can get visa here (40JD) and the stamp. Continue to customs, they will search your car. You’ll get a paper and continue to the insurance building (also money exchange inside). One month insurance is 36/100JD.
After that go to customs and pay them 20JD.

Note: they have stamped my carnet wrong while I was changing money. So better tell them how to do it!

name: Local restaurant
description: Friendly and good place to have a meal. just 500m of the main road.

name: Pakistan restaurant
description: Good restaurant! There is also a fuel station, a shop and even showers here!

name: Advsto - outdoor equipment
description: Excellent little shop for outdoor gear, including camping, mountaineering and some cycling accessories. They have brooks saddles.

name: Granite Rocks Wildcamp
description: You see these granite rocks behind a village. Nice and quiet place. Nobody disturbed us.

name: Beautiful view and quiet
description:
Beautiful view in Soda and charming views in all directions suitable for camping, hiking and climbing (the place is full of monkeys)

15.02.2020: Please check the coordinates: may be all is private?

name: "Mega Park"
description:
We call it "Mega Park". Incredible parking and picnic area.The place is brand new and is really huge. Perfect place after and before border crossing to UAE.
Very quiet place but hundreds of street lamps. At night totally empty, no people. We first wanted to camp wild right at the beach a few miles away and police/border control didn't allow that and brought us to this perfect place.
We tried 1 of the 3 toilet complexes, there water was available only in the women section.

name: Parking National Museum
description: Good place under trees.Close to National Museum

name: Parking @ Al Jad Garden
description: Al Jar Garden in Taif is open 24 hours and has a toilet. Outside of the park are many parking slots to park your car for free and sleep in it.

name: Parking space
description: An empty space. I parked here and slept in the car. There are no female toilet close by.

name: Border UAE to Saudi Arabia
description:
We exit UAE to Saoedie Arabia from this border. First get your exit stamp in the carnet... this is something they never seen so you need to explain. To get to customs drive towards the mosque in the right side and drive around it. At the end of the road go left into the gates which says only trucks. Go to the white building like on photo 1. There are many doors and waiting rooms. I can’t really explain which one so just go inside and ask for customs. Then go back and go in to the road for immigrations. Go to the building on photo 2 and pay your exit fee. We showed the one we payed already in Oman and that was oke! Then go with the stamp to the first locket. They check your stamp and let you go on. 


Saudi side 

We went to the locket gave our passport and visa. A guy walked with us to the places we needed to be and everything was just explained and straight forward. You give your finger prints and they take a photo. They are all happy to help and Interested in our travel story. 
Then we went to the next locket is customs. They did not check the car manually but with a scan. They never ask for the CTP. And they don’t know it. We didn’t get a stamp. 

And that was it. It took us 2 hours in total.

name: Camp/park at the red sea
description:
Unlimited space at the see. Beautiful sunset.
Make sure you tell the closest "coast guard“ office (you’ll find them on google maps) that you’d like to stay for the night. They check the coast side for safety and security and need to know who is there.

name: Honda Car & Motorcycle Service
description: Main Honda m/c dealer and workshop in Jeddah.

name: Saudi Border 1. Step Immigration
description:
You need Passport and Visa. They will take the finger prints of every finger and they will make a picture of you. Relatively fast because good organised.
The woman have a separate entrance but if nobody is there, they can use the counter for men also.

name: Saudi Border Step 2.
description: Customs, here your vehicle is entered into the computer system. For this you need the Carnet de Passage. Then your vehicle will be checked for the first time.

name: Saudi Border Step 3.
description: After the first customs check, you may drive your vehicle to the scanner, where the vehicle will be scanned. If so, another vehicle check may follow based on the scanner result.

name: Saudi Border Step 4. Carnet Stamp
description: The Saudis don't want to stamp your carnet. If you still want to have it stamped, go to this building and ask the manager. You have to tell them where and how to stamp the carnet. Then they will do it. (With us it was not stamped out when leaving Saudi Arabia at the Jeddah port)

name: Saudi Border Step 5. Insurance
description: You can buy vehicle insurance here on the right side and before the exit gate. Without insurance, they will send you back from the exit gate.

name: Money Change
description: Currency Exchange. Here you can also change your Dirham from 50 Dirham  notes into Saudi Rials.

name: Sasco Palm Gas Station
description: Sasco Palm gas station with some space to stay. Smaller vehicles can also stand in the hard sand next to the petrol station area.

name: Luxury Jadia Furnished Apartments
description:
MOD Note, original Name by user (in arabic): الجادية الفاخرة للشقق المفروشة / 

Clean - apart from the fridge where a previous occupant had left some chicken to go off - comfortable and cheap for the area. 

AC and heating - the latter necessary in Dec - hot water. If winter ask for another blanket!

You can get rooms only or a place with a kitchen

Cash only.

name: Big Supermarket in new Shopping Mall
description: Quality products in a new and big supermarket in a new shopping mall. But not cheap.

name: Sari Resort
description:
Find it on booking.com - price is same. You won’t see that pic from the road though. 

Excellent spot - new and spotless; pics on above site are accurate.  Pay by cash or card. 

Bed has duvet and en-suite has a bath! Also a washing machine

The one drawback is access; it can only be accessed coming from South. If you are driving South, you have to go 10km past, make a u-turn and come back. (Or if you’re on a M’bike you can do what I did, though this is not recommended, esp in thick fog). Would also be easy to miss coming from South I think so drive slowly when you get close

Didn’t have WiFi when I stayed; they said this was due to the weather (cold, wet, foggy and generally miserable)

name: Parking of Shopping Mall in Quweiiyah
description:
You have to ask the security of the mall if you can stay overnight. The mall is open up to midnight. We received the approval from the supervisor at 9 p.m. Mosque opposite. A little less traffic noise than at the urban park.
Water and Toilets at the near park.

name: Overnight Parking at the Park
description:
Small parking lot at the new, very clean park. Unfortunately along the higway to Mecca. Hence a lot of traffic noise.
The parking lot of the shopping mall is an alternative.

name: Sasco Palm Gas Station
description: Very clean gas station with space to stay the night.

name: Under a hut at the sea
description: Quiet spot in the desert. There are several huts to hide from the sun.

name: Entrance to the edge of the world. 4x4 only
description: At these coordinate you see a fence on the right side of the road, left side there is a big Dam. It is open between sunrise and sunset. It’s next to a police/ ranger spot. If the fence is closed they can let you in. When you enter the park just follow the white gravel road. Sometimes the roads split up but mostly they come back together. The locations of the cliff edge is also on google maps I would recommend to use this to have some understanding which direction you have to go. There is no connection at this Area so download the map before hand. It is allowed to camp and make fire but not allowed to cut wood.

name: Beach
description: Quiet spot with beautiful sunset and sunrise.

name: Bush camp
description: In saoedi you can camp anywhere without a problem. This spot is next to the highway from Riyad to Jeddah. It is quiet and had some shade. Really close to the highway.

name: Parking at the Alwahbah Krater
description: We stayed a night at the parking. We arrive when it was dark and the places has no light so we stayed on the parking. The next morning we saw that you also could park next to the crater. Nice and quiet and don’t forget to look up to see the incredible stars.

name: Namma shipping to Egypt and Sudan
description: here in Jeddah we arranged a boat from Duba ( Saoedi) to Safaga ( Egypt)  we paid 360 rial €95 per person and 860 rial €215 for the car (pick up with tent) we could choose speed boat or slow boat, we got the speed boat this will take 4 hours. Other boat takes 9 hours. Speed boot goes at Sunday and slow boat goes at Monday. We don’t know if they go at other days .

name: Wild camp desert
description: Place in the desert without disturbing fences, power lines, pipelines etc. You won't find nice dunes there but a quiet place to hide. The sand is quite compact so you can go even futher.

name: Wild camping
description: Used for picnic by some locals. Not the nicest place but the only chance to hide in this area. Looks like a dry wadi, some nomad tents, some camels, some waste (as usual). The road nearby is very low frequented.

name: Wild camp in the desert
description:
Quiet place in the desert near Shaqra. Some sand tracks are crossing the area and the ground is very compact so you can drive easily.
Don't miss to visit the old town of Shaqra!

name: Family Park, good for a night
description:
The best chance for a quiet night might be this family park. The road 400 is crossing the agricultural heart of Saudi Arabia. Due to that there are many fences at both sides of the road and no chance for a wild camp.
Toilets available. Fresh filtered drinking water on the eastern corner of the park.

name: Thuwal beach
description: Nice spot at Thuwal beach. Coordinates are a bit off but I could not  get them on the right place. There are many parking spots near the beach. You are allowed to swim as a man. I also swam but with all my clothing on. Nobody cared.

name: Old Town of Shaqra
description: The old town was completely made of clay and as we stopped by on 26_Dec-2019 the renovation was still ongoing. We were invited to come in. All doors are open and the people very friendly. In the center there is a maket place with some shops, coffee shop etc. which was planned to open at Dec, 27th.

name: Rock Arts of Jubbah
description:
Behind a fence you can see some inscriptions on the rocks. The rock engravings are dating from 4 different time periods, the oldest are 10.000 years old. The rock arts area is a few kilometers long- just follow the fence and look sharp.

On my mark you have also the chance for a very quiet wild camp closed to the rocks. By the way: On this place a local confirmed us that wild camping is legal in Saudi.

name: Wild camp
description: Beautiful wild camp- closed to the road 70 but quiet. There are nice rocks and little mountains to explore. My mark is just an example- there are many many places for a stay.

name: Picnic Area on the beach
description:
Picnic area directly on the beach. Nice pavillons and toilets available. 
Good for a night.

name: Kaluts of Saudi
description: 5 Stars wild camp within an amazing landscape. There are dozens of magnificent rocks similar to the kaluts in the Desert Lut in Iran. My mark is just an example- there are many many places for a beautiful stay. Enjoy it!

name: Beach near Al Wahj
description:
Great spot for camping. Some development under construction but not yet in use nor finished. The road is your typical Arabian Cornishe with trees and all tarmac. Several opportunities to drive onto the beach, also easy with 2wd since it’s hard sand. Swimming is difficult because of shallow water and rock&reef. Pretty quiet when we visited. Next (late) morning the police drove by and checked 1 passport.

lots of broken glass!!!

name: Al Nabarees Al Macy Hotel
description: A better name for this hotel would be Miss Haifa Hotel. She is the manager and true gem of this place. From the moment we parked the car in front of the hotel on arrival until the day we left we were treated like royalty. Highly recommended.

name: Al Ahlam Resort
description:
A resort with divided sections for single (men) and families, though recreational areas are common. 

Clean and comfortable. Air con and hot shower. Kitchen in “family” units is equipped ONLY with a kettle, absolutely nowt else. 

Swimming pool is great. 

On booking.com I booked a double room, but when I got there, single, they tried to put me in a single room - no kitchen - or charge more for double. A bit of wingeing/negotiating resolved the issue. 

Good value at SAR110

name: Canyon
description: nice quiet place for the night in wadi near hidden canyon.

name: red stand dunes
description:
nice red sand dunes in front of the mountains.
very crowded during weekends and unfortunately a lot of waste.

Place try to pick up after yourselves and others so we can continue have the ability to wild camp!

name: Al-Mazag
description: good simple and inexpensive arabic finger food, friendly stuff

name: truck repair
description:
Helpful people repaired a leaky fuel pump within a 1/2 hour.
In this area, you will find many car and truck repair places.

name: ROOTS coffeehouse
description: Trendy, cozy coffeehouse with all kind of coffee near LuLu hypermarket.

name: public toilet
description: public toilets for emptying the chemical toilet and drinking water with adequate pressure. Shadow parking.

name: Lavina Hotel (Hail)
description: Very good hotel for overlanding. Plenty of parking. Look for manager - Al Sayed. Very helpful. Good price too!

name: Parking with sitting area
description: Big parking close to a mosque with water and toilets. The mosque closed after the last prayer.

name: Al Andalus Mall street camping
description: This spot is behind the big mall on a separate road not directly connected to mall parking which is for cars only. 2 km of parking on both sides of the 6 lane road that isn't used much. park far from the 2 highways for quite. the mall can get noisy in the evening especially on Friday Saturday. Quite at night. toilets in mall. Amazing groceries at  hyper panda all Western food (global actually) except alcohol and pork. big food court and shopping. McDonald's, Burger king, Starbucks, other USA chains and local restaurants. free wifi in the mall. felt safe, no one bothered us.

name: deisel fuel station
description: Name is in Arabic.  This station is located by the airport and is the first     station we've found in Jedda that carries diesel. Most stations are petrol only. The price was great, though: 104 Riyal (28 USD) for 222 liters!

name: Red Sea Mall parking lot
description:
huge mall with WiFi and toilets inside. Western chains McDonald's, Starbucks, large food court and shopping including large grocery store Danube.

Found a spot where the tire bump stop was removed allowing a big rig to occupy 2 spaces. local delivery trucks also parked here. this was a noisy location all night long with cars and trucks using the nearby road.

No one bothered us.

name: free parking/camping near beach
description:
There are a couple places with free 24 hour parking on the beach side of corniche road with Palm trees and newly planted shrubs. The walking/bike trail goes by here, and just a few steps to the beach. McDonald's and Starbucks nearby.

Several cars spent the night.

A bit noisy in the evening (park closer to beach a little quieter).

No one bothered us.

A really nice local guy with decent English told is about all there great wild places to visit between here and Jordan.

name: Jeddah port customs
description:
We arrived at the ferry port about 2 pm from Sawakin, Sudan. It took 6 hours before we drove away.

The only cost was the online visa, and at customs they charged the equivalent of about 63 USD. There was much debate about whether I needed car insurance -almost let me go then said I needed car insurance. Started the process right there in customs, but I showed them my yellow card comesa insurance and they decided that was ok. Comesa doesn't cover Saudi (at least not what I bought in Zambia). I bought no car insurance.

I was able to keep my contents locked in my camper all the way from Sawakin till we were with our truck at customs in Jeddah. I had to give my truck key to Saudi customs to get off the ship, they had truck and key for 3 hours and drove it somewhere with a passenger. I had removed all the contents of truck cab at Sawakin and locked them in the camper. My truck was too big for their x-ray, so once we were reunited I unlocked stuff and they did a thorough dog sniff search. They wanted to do more searching but realized it would be a big job and they would find nothing - so they got the bosses boss permission to not do the search, this "do nothing" took 2 extra hours.

See my entry in Sawakin for ferry information and packing of truck.

GPS is not the exact location. But if you are going to Sudan this should get you to the port.

name: Micro beach camping
description:
Large leveled area where locals camp on the weekends. on weekday evenings a couple cars came for the sunset and 3 guys did some spear fishing.

Very quiet, with tiny sand beaches to access the water. larger sandy beaches are 1 km to the South.

The road is tar all the way. The local border patrol stopped by briefly. Nobody bothered us.

Good cellular data service.

no parking 100m from the sea

name: Moab camping in Saudi
description:
Great quite spot 20 meter perpendicular off the tar road Feels like we are in Moab Utah. Amazing sandstone walls, cliffs, outcroppings, and hoodoos all over this area. 

Does Saudi know what they have here?

no one bothered us. If you walk along the road locals will stop and greet you. Very friendly. 

this spot makes for a nice drive and close to Winter Park where you buy tickets for  Medain Selah.

No cell service.

You could squeeze multiple vehicles here or overland trailer.

name: Winter Park (Tickets to Medain Selah)
description:
This is called Winter Park. Parking is north of the road and park and ticket sales on the south. Tickets to Medain Selah and other attractions can be purchased here. see photo for other attractions. Medain Selah cost was 250 SAR pp. credit card accepted. you then take a bus from here to Medain Selah where you get on a different tour bus with tour guide. supposed to last 3 hours but took 5 hours. plenty of time to explore and take photos.

there is no point to driving to Medain Selah they won't let you in and they don't sell tickets there. Supposedly, this will close on March 7 and reopen in October, check their web site. tours are only Thursday-Saturday but the sales people said open Sunday too.

you can also buy package deals with private guided tours and hotel for up to 4000 SAR.

This region is strikingly beautiful and resembles Moab, Utah. They don't realize what they have here. you could easily spend a week or 2 exploring the area.

the Saudis have a lot to learn about tourism. but they do run a smooth ship - if you can figure it out.

Medain Selah was interesting but not as impressive as Petra, but still interesting. they are still working on opening up more areas to tourism.

name: Near Road
description:
Just off the road behind a hill, track access from West side of hill (and cell tower). quiet, though you can hear the traffic. The track is fine gravel, easy to get stuck in sand, big rig did ok. 

This road to the Red Sea is excellent tar. There are probably better places to camp near this road but we drove until almost dark, and didn't want to hunt in the dark.

camp is 1 km from a farm house further down the track and they drove by to their home a couple times in the early evening.

considering we were right next to a cell tower cell, service was average.

no one bothered us.

name: Toyota Service
description:
Friendly Toyota Service. The engineers speak good english. 
I just showed up, they took the car immediately in for oil and filter changes, while I could wait.
Only closed on Fridays (and at prayer times).
Car got inside cleaned and outside washed!

name: Oceanside Camping Spot
description: This is one of a number of camping spots along the ocean. Ask for permission to camp at the coastguard station before turning into the road. They told us we were supposed to get a permit in town, but waived it and asked us to camp within 2 km of the station.

name: OYO 355 Hotel
description: Nice Hotel in Jeddah with secure parking and Wifi. $20 for spacious room with double bed.

name: Desert Camp
description: Desert Camp just off the Road behind some bushes out of sight of traffic. Not too much road noise. I stayed here as it was difficult to find a hotel or hostel on my way to Al Ula.

name: Wadi Tayyib Al Ism
description: This is a stunning slot canyon for picnicking, hiking, and exploring. The tar road there is in excellent condition and it's a beautiful drive. There is room for big rigs to park at the entrance, but it is monitored by the military and overnight camping is not allowed. They said it is dangerous and so did the locals. The road north from the wadi is closed currently due to rock damage.

name: Camping Among Fabulous Rock Walls
description:
Turn off the highway here and follow the compacted gravel and dirt road around to the right. It goes 1.5 miles (2.5 km) into a valley of towering rock formations with multiple spots where you can pull off into before the road turns to sand. We saw a Bedouin camp nearby, but no one stopped by our camp, and it's obviously a place locals come to drive in the sand dunes. 


This is a place you could easily spend days exploring and photographing, and has room for multiples big rigs. We could even get so-so data on our phones.

name: STC SIM card shop
description: STC Shop (ground floor of big shopping mall) where you can buy a local SIM card.  We bought 8G for 110 SR

name: Wild camping area
description: A nice area between rocks/ ridges and with some dry river beds where you can drive in so you can hide from the road (and wind)

name: Wild camping near Edge of the World
description: Great area to camp near the edge of the world. At the edge of the world itself there is a nice hiking trail. Nobody was there when we camped/hiked (Wednesday).

name: Endless wild camp options
description:
This area has plenty of easily accessible wild camp options, with 2wd-friendly gravel road that takes you far enough from the main road. Some camels around. 

LTE good signal

name: Laundry service
description: Nice and good service. We payed 25 euro’s for two full bags of clothes + blankets.

name: SIM card
description: A SIM card may be purchased at this location.

name: behind hills
description: first/last stop after border crossing. Quiet spot behind hill hidden from view and road noise. Accessible by 2WD

name: Coastal road discontinued
description: We were planning to take the coastal road from Magna to Haql (asphalt, good condition) but both the board control guards and the locals told us that there is a checkpoint right after the wadi and for a 30 km stretch no private cars are allowed (apparently too many ended up in the sea). We found  the coast from Magna towards the wadi more beautiful than the one from Haql towards the shipwreck in the south.

name: Turn off here into desert
description: Turn of the highway here and travel along tracks to find plenty isolated camping spots as far or close to the highway as you wish. Firm ground no 4WD required

name: Hotel Nakmeel
description: Reasonably priced hotel (100 Rihal). Friendly staff, clean rooms and excellent WiFi. Bicycle friendly

name: Between the dunes
description: nice place between the dunes. If you are lucky a herd of camels is passing by. Not far from the main road. Could be a littlebit noisy at daytime, but not at night. Must be reachable by 2x4. internet by simcard

name: Al Ula for 2WD
description: We had a hard time finding a 2wd accessible spot, far enough from the big streets and close enough to the amazing rock formations of Al Ula. So we ended up here. There a few spots in the area, close to the dirt road but very few cars pass by. No one seemed to bother our presence. Earth was dry when we visited, be careful if this is not the case. No reception.

name: Dhee Ain Village (Marble Village)
description: 1200 year old village on a white marble stone hill.  You could camp on the parking lot under the palm trees.  Very nice reception here.  The road to this place is spectacular.  Worth the visit.

name: Well hidden in the hills
description:
Just Get off the road in this area and follow then as far away from the road as desired. There are many tracks leading into the hills.  Many spots and opportunities to camp. Firm ground wherever you go so easy for 2WD as well. Nice spot with dog, good
walking

name: The Watergateskandalen
description: Very nice campspot in the Valey. From here ( the too) get an amazing view first

name: Capital O
description: Nice hotel with swimming pool.  Big rooms. We paid 215 SAR breakfast included.

name: Green Valley and River
description:
The Valley offer many camp spots, during weekend more busy but plenty of space (all/most do not overnight) and a good chance to meet locals for a picknick that offer coffe or fruits....(we have our blond smaller kids with us 2 and 4 years - that might help to break the ice).
During night we heard some funny animale from the mountains (do not know the name), we also hear/see birds, butterfyes..
As it is a local place - expect that there are a lot of garbige...sadly:/(

name: The tree of flowers and birds
description: We parked under this tree - because it was beautiful and perfect for camp. Here is no river, so no locals go picknick here - so no garbage.....and that we liked a lot. From 16-ich you will have shade. There will pass trough few local sheperds in there 4wd - but not a lot...and the “road” is a bit away. The view is great and the tree very lovely...we saw also lizzards, and many yellowbirds and other lovely birds in the tree.

name: Elephant rock
description: Elephant looking rock and all sort of tourist crap being developed. Area surrounding is amazing. This place will surely change very quickly. At the moment you could easily wild camp close to the sight somewhere.

name: beautiful, peaceful
description: lovely spot of, I am sure, a lot in this area. Just drive ou'd the road and choose.  for 2WD also

name: good mechanic and electrics
description: fixed our electrical problem in no time. very good price.  does not speak English.

name: Crater Al Wanamaker
description: You can camp near the walls that are build around east and south of the crater.  It was a bit windy but nice place to set up your tent.  The guy at the visitor centre is very friendly like most people in Saudi.

name: Excellent café
description:
A place worth to visit even good food!
Railway museum is next

name: Wadi Disah
description: Nice arch, nothing spectacular. We camped just before the arch with our 2wd, just mind the soft spots. Quiet night, since you’re 600m away from the road. No need for 4x4 except if you want to drive up the dune.

name: The Oasis - Wadi Disah
description: Beautiful Oasis with palmtrees for free camping. Local people come to chill during the day but at night it's peaceful.

name: Gasoline fuel station
description: As it is almost impossible to find a nice spot along the road, this is a good place to spend the night. It is behind the fuel station. There is also a tire shop and an oil change garage. Also simple restaurants, supermarket and hotel. The parking place at the back was completely empty when I was there and very quiet at night

name: Tal El Sahel Hotel
description: Room with 3 beds was 155 riyals, for 24h stay. AC, private hot water bathroom, fridge, TV, WiFi. Only cash. Clean rooms and clean beds. The cheapest place we could find in town.

name: Fuel station
description: Here you can get Diesel, also a drive-thru ATM to get Rial.

name: Parking Lot
description: Next to Shubra Palace. Palace closed until sept 2020. Large parking lot/gravel space. At night quiet. Park your car in the middle section between the 2 white buildings because otherwise from 8:00 you will be blocked by parked cars,  especially important for big rigs. I came here on saturday at 17:00. It was completely empty at that time. 500 m. further there is a big shopping mall with restaurants, café's and a large supermarket with toilets and water

name: Parking at a big mosque
description: We just arrived from Jordan and slept two nights at the parking. All people were very friendly. Some traffic noise due too the streets around. At the mosque you can find some drinking water. Supermarkets, cheap eateries and laundries around the corner near the big hotel.

name: street full of laundries
description: You will find many laundries in the street. We paid 1 Rial / piece without ironing. 2 Rial / with ironing. Same day service is possible. We brought it around 11am and collected it around 9pm.

name: Try this open space
description: Open space between buildings and next to gastank supplier. 10 minutes walk from old town. Surprisingly quiet at night .Good for visiting old town and maybe stay one night.

name: STC Shop
description: here you can buy sim card, 10 GB, 50 GB, 100 GB. Bring your passport. They need the visa number.

name: Drinking water
description: here at the container you can take drinking water to fill your bottles. Not big amounts.

name: Shopping street
description:
this is the street where you have to go to fill up your stocks, while you stay on the wild camp nearby. 
here you will also find, supermarkets, bakery, tool shop, tailor, hair dresser, phone companies, vegetable shop. Also nice little restaurants with good arabic food. No need to drive here.

name: Pétroglyphes Bir Hima
description: Pétroglyphes: malheureusement, le site n'est pas ouvert, il est possible de les voir à travers le grillage. Bon spot pour bivouaquer. Un peu plus loin, il y a les puits archéologiques

name: propane refill
description: he did not have adapter for my australian bottle, but somehow made it work. was patiently trying and at the end succeeding.

name: Fort Masmak & Al Safa Square
description: here your in the center of Riad. Fort Masmak, a very interesting and beautiful renovated place about the countries history. It was free when we were there. The square is exactly the place where people are executed in front of the building of the religious police.

name: Aire de stationnement
description:
Parking area, with WC and tarmac carport
---
Aire de stationnement, avec WC et abri places goudronnées

name: Parking Palace Al Elmara
description:
Parking Palace Al Elmara, behind the Palace, good for camping. Free admission
---
Parking Palace Al Elmara, derrière le Palace bien pour bivouaquer. Entrée gratuite

name: Entrée site Ukhdood
description:
Entrance to the Ukhdood site, no real parking, interesting and free visit.
---
Entrée du site Ukhdood, pas vraiment de parking, visite intéressante et gratuite.

name: Wadi Hanifah near Riyad
description: Wadi Hanifah, at the river, a wonderfully quiet place, right on the canalized river bed.  Away from the noisy and dirty capital.  Many places and fire pits.  Quite a few wild dogs, but peaceful. Mobily 4G+.

name: rentacar theeb
description: theeb rent a car, know about the new tourist visa and rent you a car with 300 SAR deposit.

name: MAN Truck Service
description:
MAN Truck Service, very competent!  They organize you also a rentacar!  The main bearings on the intermediate frame have been replaced at MAN Riyadh. Long-serving experts from Arabia, Jordan, Turkey and India took part: highly motivated and very friendly people! We worked until 10 p.m. on both days so that we could get on quickly. Thanks to the whole team of workshop manager Ashraf! تم استبدال المحامل الرئيسية على الإطار المتوسط ​​في MAN Riyadh. شارك خبراء من المملكة العربية السعودية والأردن وتركيا والهند منذ أمد طويل: أشخاص يتمتعون بدوافع كبيرة وودود للغاية! عملنا حتى الساعة 10 مساءً في اليومين حتى نتمكن من المضي قدمًا بسرعة. شكراً لكل فريق أشرف مدير الورشة!
Hamid, the service manager, made it possible, that his crew started immediately after our arrive! And they didn't stop their excellent working until the the job where done!

name: Drinking Water Tanker
description: For 10 SAR you can get drinking water here. either filtratet or not.

name: desert camping
description: Nothing special, but a quiet place for one night. 2 km from the highway. Driving southward is after the bridge a open part in the fence. mobily H+.

name: Quiet place in the desert.
description: nothing special, just drive 2 km into the desert and you'll find a quiet place, as everywhere here! mobily H+.

name: Uruq Bani Ma'arid National Park. Southern end of the Rub Al Khali (empty quarter).
description:
Uruq Bani Ma'arid National Park. 
Known for a variety of rare animals. 
This park may not be entered without permission of the Ministry. 
But if you are too friendly to Hamad Hadi Alqhatani, the manager of the park and drink with him tea, he calls his boss, bring a special permit and drives you personally through the southern end of the Rub Al Khali (empty quarter). 
He is a master in dune-driving and know, where the animals are. 
At the end of the day, the rangers invited us for dinner in their "tent": tasty camel meat with rice.
No internet.

name: Hidden place in the Mountains.
description:
phantastic view, absolutely quiet at night, afternoon 4 pm 30° C, at night 7° C!
A farmer past by and invited us for dinner, in the morning 10 am a very friendly policeman wanted to know where we are coming from and going to. 4x4 not necessary. mobily H+ (sometimes).

name: Panorama Mountains Road
description: if the sight is clear, you can join here a phantastic panorama!

name: on Top of the hill, or inbetween the hills.
description:
on top you will find a phantastic view over the valley's and the mountains - and a lot of locals for picknick. 
inbetween is it quiet!
some friendly wild dogs and goats.
mobily 4G.

name: Drinking Water
description: Good quality, high pression, 10 SAR for 100 Liter.

name: sandy beach
description:
Kilometer of Black Sand Beach.
on Friday a little busy by friendly locals.
As a tourist you feel little exotic, everybody wants to talk with you, specially the Indians an Bangladeshi. 
Day and night beach controls by friendly police and security's, so no party at the beach.
Daily cleened, so very little trash!
Mobily 4G.

name: Quiet place over night
description: There are a lot of official beaches up and down this area, they are are really crowded. If you want to have a quiet night, stay here, but do not expect the place for swimming - and the ground is really dirty! mobily 4G.

name: Wild Camp at the mangroves
description: we just had a rest here, but it is also good for a overnight place!

name: Wild Camp at the beach
description: These areas are all artificially created, so the bank is made of boulders.  The water is so shallow that the flamingos walk around for 200 meters.  Unsuitable for bathing (dirty water).  Garbage collectors every day.  Quite a few curious who want to photograph the foreigners.  mobily 4G.

name: Gravel parking, quiet side street. H+
description: Gravel parking in a quiet side street. Almost level platform that was probably emerged by the road construction. Gorgeous view over the Asir Mountains. Two locals came, regardless of one another to invite us to the food, but we were just too tired. At night total calm. Mobil 4g.

name: Drinking water
description:
very friendly staff, water in good quality for free!
if you have not enough pressure, the staff starts the pump inside the door!

name: Road to Mekka not for big cars
description: the police don't let you pass with a bigger camper than a van!

name: River bed camp
description: Absolutely quiet at night, far enough from the highway! Some shepherds with their goats and shepherddogs in the near. enough wood for campfire. No cellphone coverage.

name: Huge sandy beach, well attended!
description:
police asked me to move
no sleeping over night

Huge sandy beach, well attended!  
Many visitors on Fridays.  
Quite noisy right on the beach, takeaways, drinks stands, quad rental.  500 m inland reasonably calm, nevertheless sea view. mobily 4G.

name: Hidden place between the hills
description:
If you want an absolutely quiet and hidden place, take this one, behind the hill! Follow the grit way after the hill.
No FM and now internet.

name: Entrance Rock Art Jubbah
description:
You have to registrate yourself with passport at the entrance office. 
No fee, open till 3 pm.

name: Camel Race Track
description: Camel raceways have the advantage that they are free of garbage, because the precious animals must not come into contact with it. Normally, both sides of the raceway runs an asphalt track (on which the carrier vehicles driving) and on the outside side is a 12 m wide sandbag on which one can stay without disturbing someone. It's wonderful quiet here! 4G.

name: public drinking water
description:
several taps, quality ok, it's free!
the biggest tap in the middle has the highest pressure.

name: High Plateau in the stone desert.
description:
High plateau in the stone desert.  
A wonderfully quiet place high above the valley with a magnificent sunset and sunrise.  
4x4 is not absolutely necessary, but good ground clearance.  
On road 418, eastwards, after the sandy desert, there is a white road on the right southwards.  High earth walls on both sides, drive in the first opening on the left (opposite the palm grove) and follow the tracks uphill.
mobily H+

name: Gravel places at the edge of the desert.
description:
Gravel yard on the edge of the desert. 
On a quiet side street.  
Nothing special, but totally quiet at night, unless the farm is running its groundwater pumps.  
mobily sometimes H +.

name: Craft Market & Toilet
description: nice litte craft market with cafe‘s, toilet and bazzar. Close to the site. Also here you can take water from the taps, only small amounts.

name: Family Park next to highway
description: here we made an emergency camp after a long day driving, nothing special, but seems safe and ok for a night.

name: Carrefour
description: You can stock up here perfectly. All kinds of products.

name: Wild camp on the way to Al Ula
description: On our way to Al Ula we stopped here after getting off the highway. Between rocks.

name: Tombes
description: The visitors centre should be open from 10am to 6 pm.  But at 1530 nobody was there.  The gate was open so we could walk to the site 200 m away.  A remarkable number of tombs some with decorations. Not comparable with Madain Saleh.  We had no documentation at the time of our visit.

name: Supermarket
description: here is a supermarket on the way to Al Ula. The gas station did not have diesel.

name: Sparhawk Arch
description: Nice arch, nothing spectacular. We camped just before the arch with our 2wd, just mind the soft spots. Quiet night, since you’re 600m away from the road. No need for 4x4 except if you want to drive up the dune.

name: Hyperpanda
description:
Large parkinglot at hypermarket
Lots of space.
Try also the adjacent Malek Fahad park. There are huge parking lots. but still under construction. first ask the gate keeper if you can camp there. I got an awesome place in the shade of trees

name: Old Al Ula
description:
Old Al Ula clay houses. Seems beautiful, but closed due to renovation. Controlled by police, bc. dangerous to walk thru the narrow lanes

you can go up the old fortress

name: Water at little mosque
description: here you can fill up water. Look out for the sign „bathroom“, on the left side.

name: Rainbow Arch
description: here you are at the famous rainbow arch. very beautiful spot.

name: Starting point Rainbow Rock
description:
24 April 2022: New road open. Doable with 2wd.

From here, you can see the track to the rock, very easy to drive, we had 4x4

name: Jibal Al Rukkab Canyon
description: This is the place. Absolutely jaw dropping place, they call it the dancers, so beautiful and absolutely fabulous, easy to find, but 4x4 necessary. Its not a long drive, but one of the best.

name: End of Canyon Trail
description: as you come to this point you have reached the village, you can also start from here, might be better than from the other side. We came from the other side.

name: Canyon Wild Camp
description: perfect place for wild camp, hiking and driving around, particularly sandy. 4x4 necessary. Track is also on maps.me Fun stuff for the off-road people. Its also possible to drive your own track. Make sure to have trackable gps to find the way out.

name: Madakhil Canyon
description: the best place to take a adventures walk. Its gets very narrow and you have to walk sideways. But lot of fun with stunning views. You have to come here when in the area. Its a sandy drive up to the entrance of the canyon. Leave the car at the camp, but you can also drive a bit further

name: Hotel in Tabuk
description: Actually a really price worthy budget Hotel with excellent staff. We paid 69 Sar..

name: Old Hijaz railway track
description: This is the old railway track, you can drive on it, it leads to one of these stations. They are fenced but still beautiful to see. Close to road.

name: Grand Canyon of Saudi
description: very beautiful area the Al Shaq Canyon. Perfect for rocky off-road driving, make sure to have high clearance. Also wild camps around. Some local families as well.

name: Mountain niche
description: Flat niche between two beautiful mountains behind dune. Partly sandy to get here. 4x4 required. Also locals know this place for picknick, but reasonable clean.

name: Water containers near Al Disah
description: drinking water from big containers. good to fill up your tanks

name: Catalina Wreck
description: Very cool spot of the Catalina wreck. Easy to get here. Border police will stop by to have a look at your ID.

name: Rock engravings
description: another ancient place with hundreds of engravings, very beautiful. We tried to ask locals, but they did not know as well.

name: water source
description: very good water source to fill up water. Big taps, even good for big rigs. Locals at gas station showed us this place.

name: Int. Tataload
description: Shipping agency to ship from Duba to Iskenserun.

name: Eastern viewing
description: High place from where you can see the beautiful city of Zulfi ,,, I advise you to watch the view at sunset

name: ALASFOOR BIKE SHOP- Spare Parts and Mechanic
description: If you have a problem in your bike its a good place to fix it.

name: Travel rest area
description: Rest area for travelers, good View to the city of Jubbah, quiet place and there is cold water

name: Zabal castle
description:
200 years old Castle .  Was built over an older one from the 1st century BC.
Please come before 18:00

name: In the mountains
description:
Secluded camping spots are hard to find in these mountains. This one is off the highway hidden by hills and rocks. At dusk some shooting near by, otherwise peaceful.
4X4 needed, very steep 75m gravel track to access area.

name: Shady place off the road
description: informal picnic place idyllic apart from rubbish. very quiet

name: Many protected spots in Park
description: A huge park on mountain top near al Baha. playgrounds, campinspot more ore less secluded accessibility depending on car. had some quiet nights here.

name: in Wadi, just off the road
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Flash floods can happen in this location. Please use caution.
very quiet place in wadi just beside hardly frequented road. Some shady trees. good for an overnight spot.

name: Big park at 2900m
description: There are lots of possible camp spots. Up the mountain beautiful views across mountains and valleys. Spent a quiet night in cool mountain air. There are public toilets, but they were locked. Due to off season?

name: Big wilderness park
description:
Lots of camp spots, close or further off the paths. very quiet apart from Friday's.
Quite clean, several playgrounds.
Lot of dogs, timid and harmless.

name: Wild area used as picnic spot by locals
description:
several secluded spots can be found here. Relatively clean. Bordering on military compound, however camping is allowed.
Can be busy on evenings or weekends, as all other parks in this area were closed for restructure at time of visit. 
Great views into valley when walking to the end along the fence.

name: undisturbed camp in Wadi
description: At this location drive off the highway anf follow this track appr. 200m to the wadi. if you want, take a nice walk to the end of the wadi ( see pics).

name: Historic town of Deora
description: old town, main buildings along main Street, such as mosque dating from 1500, renovated. you can walk through the old town and picture how it may have looked like 40 years ago  before the now abondoned houses fell into disrepair.

name: Jazan Faifa Mountain
description: Worth visiting ....we slept in our tent.

name: Desert Rose Hotel
description: Decent hotel with rooms around $50 a night. Safe parking out with clean rooms and a nice hot shower. I wasn't able to change the star rating but we would give it 3.5 stars.

name: Hills
description: anywhere in this area is easily accessible even without 4WD. Firm sand at least when moist as it was when i was here a short time after some rain. Lots of flat and even rock plates. Nobody came during my stay.

name: Derelict playground
description: if you lost track of time with the cave paintings or got stuck on the highway from Sakaka, because there are no petrol stations on the way, here you find a spot for the night. Not pretty, but quiet. You as well might hide behind one of those ghastly fake concrete timber- rock features (quite bright there at night). An added bonus for Aussies: I parked under a GUMTREE! No kookaburras though!

name: Veterinary clinic and pet supplies
description: Professional Veterinary clinic, beside Vet pharmacy and in a quarter for Vet supplies

name: car repair
description:
