Went there as my car was getting very sluggish and to check her over.
Don't know what they did but she is running much better. 
Paid SAR200 for those adjustments, some repairs on the front wheelbearings and the window lifter
You can contact Aylan on +966 59 427 8930

name: Close to nature reserve
description:
Quiet spot well away from the highway. 2WD accessible.
green shrubs and some trees.
Spent very quiet and undisturbed thursday  night, but Friday morning quite a few cars turned up. I assume this is a spot well frequentd by the locals on the weekend. But this is a huge area, so you are bound to find a peaceful spot.

name: Quiet city camp with view of Bahrain Bridge
description: Quiet and undisturbed spot on one of the semi-developed land strips built into the sea. frequented by locals and fishermen, but quiet (when I was there). Some rubbish here and there but cleaning crew arrived in the morning.

name: Lube Mastee
description: Oil change. Specialise in Oil Selection and additives,

name: Near lake
description: not too far off the main highway. Sandy ground but green shrubbery. 4WD required. very quiet and undisturbed.

name: Camping spot next to gas station
description: Behind the mosque you can pitch your tend, nobody told me anything. Lot on noise still 12, but it is ok. You have toilets and food all around

name: SIM card
description: Next the restaurant there is a phone shop where you can buy SIM card. 10giga for 160sar. Too much for my budget

name: Gas station
description: Last gas station before the border of Eau (200km)

name: SIM card
description: Here you can buy SIM card. 5gb for 135sar, or 10gb for 175sar

name: Change money
description: If you meet,at Enjaz bank you can change money or use western union

name: Tmaya coffee
description:
Nice western coffee with some
Cakes. Enjoy it

name: Harbour gate to Farasan island
description: Here the gate to take the ferry for Farasan Island

name: Ticket office
description:
Here you can book the ticket to come back to Jizan
5:30am - 7:30pm

name: Gas station
description: Here you can find one with restaurant .. better you fill up tank and stomach ;-)

name: Change money
description: In this supermarket you can change money Kuwait/Saudi for a good rate. In the bank it’s worst

name: Al said coffee
description: Very traditional place, coffee and restaurant, UNESCO site. You should come here and take a rest :-)

name: Gas station
description: Fill your tank because next 5gas stations direction Damman are closed ;-)

name: Salt Lake
description:
Salt Lake good place for a photo, 
before you go to Al-Waba Crater

name: KARTAM
description: This place is huge with a lot of rocks and trees. It´s open all the time and is the highest point in the area . There´s lot of WC made of rocks with hot water +electricity for charging devices .

name: Almana Hospital
description: Almana General Hospital In Khobar city. You can used for emergency

name: Suzuki dealer
description:
Suzuki Barayan
the Suzuki Dealer - sale and maintenance and parts

name: Mouwasat Hospital
description: A general hospital with all specialties and an emergency department

name: BMW Al Khobar
description: BMW Showroom and Maintenance and sell parts

name: Harley Davidson Dammam
description:
The Harley Davidson Dealer 
Selling a new bikes
Maintenance & parts
HOG

name: Alwaylee Apartment
description: Small apartments organised and fantastic for the desert campers.

name: File
description: Full service Gas station. Water room rental

name: Eye of the World Overlook
description:
From Al Ammariyah follow the unpaved road through the wadi to the escarpment. 4 wheel drive not necessary but would be preferable. 

There are a few shaded trees to stop for lunch in the wadi on the way to or from the overlook.

name: Abu Rakah Outskirts
description:
Sandy patch with some bushes and a tree up against a small pale sandstone cliff. 
Great sunset, great big rocks, a little light pollution from something nearby but the stars were still amazing! 
4x4 required unless you are super confident and avoid the deeper sand. 
No cell service at campsite but 1 bar of 4G Mobiliy walking on a hill nearby about 3-4 minutes. 
Very quite, just barely hear the road.

name: Siesta Hostel
description: A hostel for backpackers and people who are traveling on motorcycles

name: Shaf Bellsmar
description:
Off town wild camping
Shelter is avaliable

name: Motorcycle mechanics and parts
description:
On both sides of the roads, there are very small and unimpressive mechanics. There are bicycle mechanics and parts as well.
There's also a few shops who sell oil and tubes. If you get lucky you will find the right size. Prices are 2x 3x compared to Europe. if you plan to work on your bike in the area, Emirates would be a cheaper choice.
The availability of motorcycle parts is pretty unimpressive. There's no market for it here apparently.
I asked if they could bring a 21 inch tire from Riyadh, they said, it's unlikely they have it there either...
They had some good synthetic Motul oil 20W50 though

name: 4x4 High Wall Wadi
description:
Sandy spot in the wadi with high walls all around and some views to the sunset direction AND Sunrise direction. Amazing spot and so close to town. 4x4 is a must unless you have lots of confidence in your high clearance vehicle. 
Some wild dogs, tons of trash, but the further back you go the less trash there is. A bit windy. No cell service sometimes 3G (Mobily).

name: North AlUla wild camp near Camels
description: Lots of other around here maybe some for 2 wheels drive and this one’s for 4x4. Beautiful views and camels as you drive in. Great hiking near by!

name: Ghayal Palm Beach
description:
Beach tent site next to palm trees. Flatish area with nice sand and shallow swimming. Quite, there may be other tent or car campers near by. 2 wheel low clearance car accessible but be careful. 
Some cell service( Mobily )

name: PCR lab
description: lab for PCR 115. really fast and efficient. no need for booking

name: Viewpoint
description:
Nice view over the mountains.
Quiet during the week, some local people come here to picnic during the day.  Lots of monkeys, dogs and cats, but keep their distance. But always close your doors and never leave your stuff unattended.

name: Wadi camp
description: Quiet nice place with trees, not far from Highway

name: 4 Tap Drinking Water very cold
description:
next to a waterpump and to the Road
good to take some water Bottle with

name: Parking in Dunes
description: Park for cars and trucks in the middle of nice sand dunes

name: Al Rimaya - Camping & 4x4 gear
description:
Small shop of the Al Rimaya brach. You can find similar (sometimes bigger) stores throughout the country.

They have all sorts of camping and 4x4 gear: gas cartridges, compressors, 12v fridges, tents and much more.

name: Parking in the sand desert
description:
Official Parking
middle of sand dunes
very quit

name: Walls / Barriers
description:
This track is not "Northern". there's another track to the north where all locals go. it will take you all the way to the Edge. check on the map.

If you want to reach the Edge of the World by this track, you will find here the first double wall between two small canyons. There are three walls in total. So you are not able to pass. We drove with the quad bike. You can also walk (5 km). The track in total is quite bumpy. We took this track (northern) because we heard they blocked the official southern road. I think they did it because of accidents. We saw one car in the canyon.

name: big Water next to Road
description:
There are 2 large Water cooler.
Very good drinking water. Also you can use it to fill your Watertank.

name: Granite rocks
description: In this area you can find thousands of great places to stay wild. But we loved this place, because of these special rocks. Without sight of the street, totally quiet, with a stunning sunset. You can climb a bit. And you will get beautiful photo motives. 4G is available.

name: Slope of Al Sauda
description: Very nice street from the top into the valley and on the way to the Rijal Alma Historical Village. The street is doable for all cars, it is steep and has a lot of curves, BUT oficially it is forbidden for trucks. We did it and no-one cares the way down. The way up, there is a police station and they don't let us go the way back. But that was good, because the way back to the top via Muhayil is spectacular, too. Sometimes there are a lot of trucks, but the steepness and the beauty of the landscape is stunning.

name: Great street up to the mountains
description: Sometimes there are a lot of trucks, but the steepness of the mountains and the beauty of the landscape is stunning.

name: Rejal Almaa Heritage Village
description: Nice old village, not too small like others. Great to stroll around. With a small museum. And nice drive to come here. Entrance fee 20 pP.

name: Police Station / Check Point
description: Here the police check the cars/trucks for the way up. Trucks are not allowed.

name: Place in front of a white masonry
description: The place itself is not the nicest, but for a overnight stay perfect. Quiet, safe, with a great scenery around for a nice walk. The people are very friendly.

name: Street with beautiful views
description: Another great street into the valley or up.

name: View to Jabal Shada
description: This is such a beautiful spot. You can take the first one, when you leave the main street or different ones, but the whole area is so fantastic, with beautiful views, great rock formations and possibility to hike. Very quiet. Less people.

name: Water, Toilette
description: Good place to empty black water and refill drinking water, also 20l bottle fit

name: beach area
description:
there are road stops every couple of 100m
special zone (rich guy)
stay far away

name: Water at mosque
description:
3 Taps for water
one with Gewinde for filling up your tank
slow but water is okay

name: Dune-Amusement Park
description: some Dunes north of Riyadh, okay during the Week, very busy and loud on Weekends.

name: wadi between mountains
description: local site to camp quite during week okay on weekends.

name: Jabal Bayda (White Head)
description: Here is the beautiful white volcano as the sight itself. Enjoy it!

name: Beautiful area in the loneliness
description: Here you have a lot of space to camp. We loved this silent place just with some camels. The nature is beautiful with granite rocks and sand space in between.

name: Spectacular place with view
description: Fantastic place up the hills in the dunes with a great view into the plane. In front of a nice rock formation. It seems like a military area, because we passed some white cement columns, but we saw nobody. The sand is quite solid and it makes fun to drive here.

name: Beautiful Needle Rocks
description: Fantastic place between high rocks which looks like needles.

name: Quiet and beautiful space near the Arc
description: We we’re disappointed because of the long fence so we decided to stay here and we loved it. Very quiet, peaceful and nice.

name: Harrat View Point 1160m
description: Cool place with a fantastic view from the highest mountain (King Abdulaziz). With a modern restaurant and bar. Very stylish.

name: Asia Hotel
description:
One of the best Bangladesch Restaurant in Town or country. 
Meal with water, chia and 2 dessert for only 13 SAR.

honest people-highly recommend!

name: Cold water at Road with good Parking
description: Place with 2 Caps for Cold water zu refill zur bottles

name: Near the mushroom rock
description: Nice place with great photo motive. Quiet, easy driving along the tracks.

name: NEOM Barrier
description: Coming from south you will find here a military post. It is not allowed to go further because of the NEOM project and its development.

name: place at the top but away from Restaurant
description:
some how you are not allowed to take photos in the morning from restaurant view.

hier is a good place to park and rest
80m away from road sand with big gravel stones
easy access 2wd perfect

name: A'arif fort Park
description:
Park next to the A'arif fort

very quite road at the park of the A'arif fort.
there are shops, bank and Restaurants in walking distance.

name: Al'Isawiyah Sportplatz 2h Border Jordanien
description:
Quite Place behinde the sport center

This Place is 2h 133km from the Jordan border crossing away.

water, toilet and garbage bags

name: Uqair Beach - Caravanpark
description:
Nice place at the shore. Like a campground but no showers and toilets. 
First we parked at the beach but the military is controlling it and send us to this place. 
BBQ Station, water tap and bin at each site.

name: Al-Koote Heritage Hotel
description:
It’s a hotel. But they have a very nice restaurant. You sit in a really nice location. They serve Arabic food in all its faces. 
We loved it.

name: Yellow Lake
description:
In this area you find a lake with two dunes around. 
On weekends (Friday and Saturday) a lot of locals are at the big dune driving around with offroad cars and make picnic. All very friendly and interested. 
But the spot we marked was quiet. It’s a big area you will find a spot for sure.

name: Water Tanker filling Station
description:
Station where water tankers fill up water. 
They told us it’s no drinking water. But we filter it 3 times in the car so it was ok. We payed 10Rial. The didn’t care how much we filled up. 
Staff was not that friendly. Anyway we got water.

name: Diplomatic Quater
description:
In the Diplomatic Quater you will find nearly every embassy. 
Before you come google the one you need, because they all have different opening hours.

name: Mama Noura
description:
Great self service restaurant with Arabic food. 
Falafel, fresh juice…
We loved it! Local feeling included

name: Stone Mountain
description: In this area you can park everywhere. But this little mountain is interesting. The stones look so nice. And there are some flowers.

name: Empty Streets
description:
They set up a new district here but right now only the streets are finished. So we just parked at one. Some locals in the evening having picknick here. You hear the street but it’s not that bad. 
No one bothered us.

name: Between Volcanic Craters
description: Open place between Volcano Craters. Just walk over the edge and you have a look inside.

name: Wild dam
description: It’s wadi dam very quiet at night and surprisingly clean

name: Allith corniche
description: It’s long corniche in Allith very quiet and has service shelter to rest and public washroom.

name: Historic Yanbu Parking Lot
description:
Parking lot next to the entrance of historic Yanbu. 
We arrived at 4pm and it was empty. Around 6pm more and more cars came. So it was noisy until 2 in the night. But it’s a real good place. Toilets available and we tanked a little bit of water here.

name: Camel Race Track
description: Camel Race Track. We passed by and saw some camels running. So we stopped and took some nice pictures. We think they were training. It was around 5pm.

name: Al Khafji - Corniche parking
description: Large Parking area with children's playground and beach access. in the afternoon, locals are there for picnics. They leave after sunset. Quiet at night. 4G reception. Clean Toilets close by.

name: Dune camping
description: There are a lot of places off of the main road to camp. We camped here behind a small dune off  the main road as we were late entering Saudi Arabia. A beautiful quite first night in the dunes!!!

name: Mini Market
description: A part of the gas station this mini market has all you need.  No visa cards accepted here.

name: Waha Hotel (Behind gas station)
description: A new basic hotel with clean rooms and helpful owner. We got caught in a sand storm so sleeping in our Roof top tend was not an option. Double room we were able to barging it down to 150 SAR from 230. Wifi was not working because of the storm

name: Sand & Trees
description: Deflate and enjoy the African vibe of this spot with green trees planted in the sand :)

name: At the mosque
description: Mosque with water tap (for ablutions). Fast fill up.

name: Shade at abandoned petrol station
description: Abandoned hangar providing shade and wind protection. Good for cooking and a lunch break while heading to Najran.

name: Hour Laundry
description: They claim to be the only coin operated laundry in KSA. They are a bit tricky to find as they are located inside the building in the ground floor. Exactly behind Buzz JJ cafe. Wash and dry in full automatic machines with a cost of 10€. There was no washing powder option when we were here so bring your own.

name: Beach recreational park
description: This place is a bit out of the way but it is directly on the beach and it is popular with locals and fisherman. We parked and camped on the parking lot with our roof top tent. Police came by and told us that there is no problem spending the night here. Nobody here at night.

name: Jubail residential park
description: For a city that claims the title of the biggest industrial city in the world we did not expect to find a place like this. Located in the residential area of Jubail this long waterfront area has plenty of options to camp. We picked the specific one because comes with a nice shade from the trees, overlooks the water and has a bathroom across the road. We check with the police and you are allowed to camp here.

name: Majma'ah park
description: Found this park on our way south . We asked the locals and told us that we can camp here so we decided to stay. There are clean bathrooms with hot water but no showers. Plenty of shade. Locals come here for picnics on weekends.

name: Fuel station in Shabitah
description:
The only half way fuel station from between the Saudi & Omani border and Harad highway. Limited services as of today to only Gas and diseal. 
No supermarket yet.
Mosque with ablution facilities are available.. Safe trip to everyone..

name: Castle recreation park
description: At the end of the road and in front of the rock formation at the entrance of this walled recreation castle ,we slept with no problem. Security looking car came by but did not tell us anything. Away from the noise of the city and with very few locals around we spend a quite and a bit cold night in our rooftop tent. No facilities during the night.

name: Cliff top park camp
description: Another typical picnic park of Saudi Arabia that we pick to overnight. Friendly guard welcomed us and showed us where to park and sleep for the night. Tomorrow Ramadan is starting so we did a big cook up for the day ahead of us. Nice clean bathrooms and potable water.

name: National Museum
description: Explore centuries of Arabian history and culture at the Kingdom’s biggest and most entertaining museum. Housed within modernist architecture and flower gardens, the National Museum exhibits everything from Neolithic rock art, to replicas of the buildings of old Jeddah.Come on weekdays for a less crowded experience, and take your time exploring the museum’s eight halls.

name: Diriyah Gate
description: Closed in public at the moment but KSA is preparing something extraordinary here on the grounds of where the first Saudi state was and it was destroyed by the Ottomans. This is just a point of entry here

name: Lakes Park
description: Part of a new development. this place has picnic areas by the lakes and nice clean bathrooms. There is security driving around all the time. They were not very polite but when they finally understood that we were not setting up a ground tent camping, they were fine. For some unknown reason to us, we were not allowed to sit next to our car, only in it.

name: King Fahd Park
description: A beautiful park in the city of Najran. We spend the night here after asking permission for the head of the security. It is Ramadan time here but they gave us a warm welcome and directed us to this spot to camp. There are toilets open all night and lots of locals came to meet us and have a chat. Great place!!!

name: Quiet parking with shade
description: Quiet parking lot wit big trees to get shade in the morning. Stc 4G+. Photo taken at 11am still in the shade =)

name: Hypermarket
description: Big supermarket to stock up groceries. Veggies, bread, food and drinks.

name: Al Hesi Beach (Umluj)
description: A beautiful stretch of sand. This is the beach people refer to when they talk about Umluj. I made the mistake to go to Umluj only to find no sand beach. Good for snorkeling, about 50m away from shore it gets deeper. Enjoy!

name: Track leading to Needle Rocks.
description: This is where you can take the track to Needle Rocks. Not suitable for 2WD, due to sand pockets on 16 km corrugated stoney track. With 4 WD no problem. Very beautiful camping spot at the end!

name: Llwhdat Al Sakan Hotel
description: This is a medium range hotel. Clean and well maintained rooms. Safe shaded parking and all that at a good price at 32€. If you are stuck in Jazran and it is really hot waiting for the boat to Farashan island, then this might be your best option.

name: Al Rashid mall
description: The towns mall for supplies before or after the island

name: Beach camping
description: This is a beach area next to a park. You can drive any vehicle to this spot as the sand is hard as a rock. In the near by park there are bathrooms and water. Locals use it for picnics. We request permission from the police to camp here

name: Picnic Park
description: Picnic park on the beach where you can spend the night. Toilets are open 24hours. No other fasilities

name: New Ticket office
description: This is the new location for registration for the free ferry to Jazan.

name: Water filling station
description: Amazing place to fill your water tank, with drinking water provided by water company. Nozzle like fuel station, very high pressure.

name: Al-Qessar Heritage Village
description: Al-Qessar Village is the ruins of the oldest settlement in the island. It is partly restored and worth to have a look.

name: جولدن السودة (In Arabic) Golden Soudah
description: Newly refurnished hotel outside Abha. We were here during Ramadan and the camp spots mention here in Asir NP were closed. Very clean and quite place. You can park in the frond of the hotel.

name: Abha city dam
description: Found this place by accident. There are two permeant campers here so we thought that it will be fine. We also ask the police car that happen to pass by and he did not seem to care. It overlooks the dam but it is a bit of garbage around. We will say good for a night.

name: Dunes east of Buraidah
description: Nice place in the sand dunes, accessible by tarmac and firm track. We didn’t need to deflate our tires. Probably also 2WD accesible. We did suffer from strong sand-filled winds. Could be seasonal.

name: South side Ryadh
description: At Wadi Hanifa we were warned about ‘bad people’ coming at night, so we decided to search for another spot. Because of extensive fencing we ended up here. Not very charming, but convenient. Surrounded by petrochemic industry, bedouins and camel poo. But quiet night.

name: Abu Fadwa Garage
description:
What a great place!!!We had our diesel tank dropped and cleaned and they did not want any money!!!They said welcome to Saudi Arabia!!We were impressed!!Abu Fadwa was very helpful, super profesional and spot on. 
He speaks good english and is specialized in suspensions. His watchapp number is +966 56 710 5558

name: Thuwal waterfront
description: At the end of the road and right at the edge of the water this spot is used by locals for fishing. It does not have any facilities like the previous one mention here but it was lots more quieter.

name: 16 palm trees by the sea
description: I camped here for 2-3 nights. Police came at night to ask someone questions but no problem. Great camp spot with sunset view on the sea and peacefulness. Trash around as always..

name: Flamingo beach park
description: Another recreation park that locals come for picnic by the beach. In the area called Meditation section you can camp 5 steps from the waterline. Men are allowed to swim at the beach area next door. Police comes by regularly and says hello. No problem camping here after permission requested. There is cold showers and toilets provided.

name: Elephant Rock
description: Just across from the Elephant rock and below other rock formations. The security people at the Elephant Rock pointed us to this place to overnight. Nice and Quiet, rare as we are here during Ramadan.

name: 2wd entrance to Rainbow Arch
description: This is the entrance of the new 2wd road to Rainbow Arch. There are no signs so it can be tricky to find. Just keep on the left till you see it

name: Beach
description:
This is a very easy accessible, quiet and tidy beach with lots of space and a few pavillons along the coast.
The coast itself is guarded and a few hundred meters away, a police car is parking and observing the area the whole day.
We stood here for 3 days, nobody disturbed us, but here and there some locals came along for a small chat.
On the other side of the road, there's a toilet-building with running water.

name: Beach Camping
description: Moved out off Duba so we can be on our own.Ramadan time can be very noisy within city parks. Nice &  quiet night by the sea. Police came after 5 minutes as in all the places we camped in Saudi and we asked if that is ok to camp.They said it is fine as long as we do not set up a ground tent.Not sure why there is this difference .So no tent camping here.

name: Red Sea Camp
description: One of the many coves you can free camp along this coast. This one has also some palm trees that offer shade during the hot day. Just beautiful!! Border force comes by every hour or so but always friendly and with a smile. We did request permission to camp and we were told that "for sure" and with a smile!!

name: Close To The Park And The Olaya District
description:
Very safe, tidy and calm place for a night or so.
Not really calm in the sense of traffic, because there is, but people let you alone. The park itself isn't that nice, but there are hedges all around for spending some nice shadow.

name: At The Judah Thumb
description:
Such a great and remote place in the middle of the desert, directly at the Judah thumb. It's easy to access, you'll need just a bit more ground clearance, but normally no 4x4 (even though it helps of course, when you wanna drive around here).
The scenery is really stunning, some people came along and asked, if we're in need of help, but that was it.
We also had mobile connection here (STC)

name: Wadi Namar
description:
It's a well developed area, everything is paved and very tidy and offers lots of space.
Over the day everything is calm here... some visitors here and there, but in the evening, life begins. Dozens of visitors are coming and enjoying BBQ, Sunset or whatever.

name: Huge Place At Wadi Namar
description: Huge, flat and sandy area, with some palms here and there... not really tidy, lots of trash all around, but good for a night and for exploring the area (Wadi Namar) around.

name: Huge Camping Shop
description:
This shop offers lots of gadgets and equipment for camping as well as some offroad parts (kinetic ropes, compressors, ARB-cooling boxes, tents, sand boards and lots of other stuff).
Kinda "paradise" if you're in need of missing equipment

name: Fuel station + groceries + cafeteria + coffee shop
description: A gas station. With a grocery store and a nice coffee shop that is open 24 hours

name: Edge Of The World
description:
This place is the official dead end of the "Edge Of The World" trail, but the place is nice .
If you nevertheless wanna get to the Edge, drive the pathway, which is on the right side of this place. It's very steep and rugged, so a 4x4 with low gear and a good ground clearance might be necessary.
As other overlanders are coming this way, it also is a good idea to ask them to pick you guys up for the rest of the trail, if you don't dare to drive it by yourself

name: Top Of The Camel Trail
description:
Easy to access and spectacular view from the top of the Camel Trail.
Flat area, but might get very windy, aka stormy and therefore dusty.

name: Desert Camp
description:
It's hard to find places, where you're completely alone in Saudi Arabia.
This one is one of them. Unfortunately all roads and tracks to the nearby mountains are closed. Nevertheless dozens of possibilities for some offroad fun here.

name: Hidden Valley
description: Dozens of possibilities for wild camping, but this one is with a shade giving tree, close to some dunes. Expect lots of sand-storms here in summer.

name: On The Way To Narjan
description:
Nice and calm, with dozens of possibilities to wild camp, when you're heading to the west of the KSA (Narjan).
Here and there some locals came along, asking if we're in need of someting.
The area is just a bit off the main road, but it's easy to access

name: 4x4 Track To The Rock Formation
description:
Such a nice place with a view, in front of some massive rock formations.
Easy to access, but  a 4x4 and a good ground clearance could be usefull.
Quite place, nobody came along.

name: Crystal Clear Drinking Water
description: A good source for fresh and cold drinking water here.

name: Nice Drive Through The Wadi Lajab
description:
The drive is easy, no 4x4 needed and at the end, there are some smaller water pools and space for r.a. 20 cars.
Downside was, that in the evening dozens (!) of trucks came here to fill up hundreds of thousands of liters water. 
So expect lots of noise and Diesel pollution.

name: Wild Camp Close To The Salman Park.
description:
The Salman Park is on the other side of the main road. This place here is super nice with an epic view onto the surrounding mountain ranges and lots of possibilities for some hikes.
There are a lot of baboons, as well as beautiful blue shining lizzards.

name: On Top Of A Small Hill
description:
Along the main road, you'll find this small place (good for 2 or 3 smaller cars). It's a bit steep and probably not doable without a 4x4, but on the top it's flat and offers a very nice view into the valley.
Police came along twice, but just wanted to know, if we've had problems.
They said: no problem here, enjoy.
Mobile connection worked well here.

name: Ferry Jeddah (KSA) to Suakin (Sudan)
description:
Company: Namma International Marine Services Co.
Location: 21.468924, 39.184857 (NOT the current Google Location)
Small office, people barely speak english.
We asked for information for:
2 Passengers, 1 Car (Mercedes Sprinter 4x4)
They asked for Tiptrik (no CDP), but we haven't both.

:: Prices ::
CAR: 1200 SAR = 300,44€ = $319,88
Tiptrik: 1050 SAR = 262,89€ = $279,90
2 Passengers: 900 SAR = 225,33€ = $239,91

Overall Price: 3150 SAR = 788,66€ = $839,69

Ferry takes 12-14 hours, departs every 2 days.
Car has to be there for check-in: 10AM
Passengers have to check-in: 4PM

The car will be driven by one of their workers!
The car key needs to be handed out and will remain in the car!

We did forget to ask t which time the ferry departs.

name: Old Corniche
description:
This is a great place for watching the worlds highest fountain, as well as experiencing a lot (!) of Arabian life. The place is directly at the border guards area and therefore very safe (it would have been safe anyway).
We stayed here for 5 days, due to car problems and the people here have been absolutely incredible, interested, helpful and welcoming. 
They brought us lots of food, drinks, cigarettes etc, every single day. We were really exposed (2 chairs, awning, stoves outside, etc) and people came every few minutes to ask us what we're doing here and found it very interesting. While in the daytime it has been very calm, life begins once the fountain starts (with sunset). People coming here for picnics and enjoying the sunset and fountain.
The place has been very tidy (trashcans all around and people, who are cleaning all the day) and "old" shouldn't keep you away from this site. The view onto the  King Fahd's Fountain is really nice.
If you wanna be alone, this place is definitely not for you. And for all others: you'll enjoy dozens of cultures, as well as some of the most friendliest people in the world!
Toilets: not directly at this place, but a few hundred meters along the street.

name: Jeddah Corniche
description: It's a nice and very tidy place at the Corniche in Jeddah, but expect lots of people coming here to enjoy the evenings.

name: Along The Waterfront
description: We stayed here for a couple of days in the hope, that it's a bit more calm. The place isn't the most tidy and while the day, nobody was here. In the evening though, the place filled up very fast and was completely filled with cars.  Nobody really noticed us and even police passed a few times without saying anything.

name: Hidden Place, Surrounded By Bolders
description:
Very nice and calm place, hidden by the main road. We've been standing a bit more close to the road before and immediately  a car from the "ministry of environment" sent us way, because it's a "country controlled" area.

At this place here, we were invisible and stood there for 2 days.
Unfortunately there's lots of trash in the KSA, here the same.

To get here, you'll need to cross a riverbed, which was dry, when we came. No 4x4 necessary, but definitely a good ground clearance.

name: Lots Of Trees And Trash
description:
It's not that easy to find a wild camping spot close to Jeddah, especially not, when you're searching for some shade and the possibility to take an outside shower.
This one here was good so far, even if it was full of trash all around. This spot in  this huge area, was the most tidy, but just for a few qm's ;)
Do not expect fancy atmo here and don't take our image too seriously, in real it looks way worse than on the fotograph ;)

Nevertheless people are coming here for playing soccer and doing picknick etc, but in the evening it has been calm so far.
We stood here for 2 days

name: Half Moon Beach
description: Nice beach on one side and other side is nice sand dunes. The place is good for swimming and relaxing. Has a lot of amenities such as bathrooms, gas station with supermarket, hotels and resorts . You can camp or check in resort.

name: Offroad Customs
description:
We've been here with our Mercedes Sprinter 4x4, as we had problems with our brake-system, which needed to be changed.
Tarek and his team took al lot of care about our car and they changed the brake-discs, calipers and pads in no time and that very professional for a very fair price. Also ask for Mark, he is the chief-mechanic and a friendly, helpfull guy.
All the guys are speaking english very well, which was a big help.
They're located 60 KM north-east of Jeddah, in a new industrial area, where you basically should find everthing you'll need.

Here are the WhatsApps:
Tarek: +966 56 622 8824
Mark: +966 53 166 1642
Just give them a call and they'll be with you in no time!

We can highly recommend this company.

name: Picnic area in the mountains
description: Quiet area up in mountains with a nice view. There are few parkings on a way up, there are playgrounds for kids. Relatively cool temperatures, a bit windy. Some families come in evenings, but at night it was empty. Beware of monkeys!

name: Water Tank
description: Fresh and cold water source at the side of the road. Those tanks are widely spread in the KSA, but here in the Al Ula/Tabuk region they're rare.

name: Inside Wadi Disah
description:
The Wadi Disah is absolutely beautiful, even in June. The 27 KM drive is fairly easy, but not recommended without 4x4. There are 6-7 bigger waterholes, which need to be passed, water was 30-45cm deep. The track is mostly sandy, sometimes a bit deeper, but not that big a problem.
Along the Wadi you will find dozens of places for wild camping. Police came along frequently, waved their hands and just passed by.

At some points, the Wadi gets fairly narrow, so I doubt that bigger rigs could manage. Just ask the locals, as fauna changes all the time.

name: Small green parking lot
description: Finding shadowed places inside the KSA is quite challenging sometimes, depending on time of year. This one is along the main road, tidy, halfway calm but with lots of bigger trees. Police just passed by several times, no complaints (as usual in the KSA)

name: Workshop and welding service
description:
This is a basic workshop for simpler projects. People are very friendly, but not speaking any English, except one Indian guy. We let them weld the spare wheel carrier, the back door of our Sprinter and some other parts for a very fair amount (pretty cheap).
Ask for Abdullah Majeed or Ibrahim.

name: Green Parking Lot
description: Calm and tidy parking lot in Tabuk. Some people came here at night for picknick, but we haven't been disturbed. Lots of possibilites to flee from the sun, as there are bigger trees all around.

name: Green Parking Lot
description:
Calm and tidy parking lot in Tabuk. Some people came here at night for picknick, but we haven't been disturbed. Lots of possibilites to flee from the sun, as there are bigger trees all around.
We took a place, aside from the lot, as there were the biggest tree.

name: Watertank
description: Big water tank along the road. These water tanks can be found all over the KSA, lots of times even filtered. The water is fresh and mostly cold (thanks to those special tanks) and can be drunk. Here in the Tabuk region they're very rare though.

name: Shaden Resort
description:
It's not just a hotel or restaurant, it's also a super beautiful tourist attraction. Surrounded by the Canyons and Mountains of Al Ula, it offers spectacular views, lots of possibilities for hiking, bird watching and many other things.
The manager and the staff are very friendly, English-speaking and warm- hearted and hospitable. The apartments (tents, houses) etc. are well equipped and tidy. At night, the Shaden offers a very special view, as the whole area is lit by thousands of spotlights, which makes the stay an unforgettable adventure.

name: Watertank with fresh water
description: Inside the park, there's this fresh-water tank, which you can find all over in Saudi Arabia.

name: Hisma Desert
description: Easy to access as there are leading several ways into this part of the desert. Phantastic sourroundings and absolutely light unpoluted, which grants perfect night sky photography. From here it's just a few hundred meters away to a pharaos tomb, as well as to one stone arch. We couldn't make it up there, as we were to heavy with our Sprinter. Sandy roads leading uphill.

name: Beach At Neom
description:
Beautiful spot at the beach, where swimming seems not to be allowed, as police came by and told some people, they shall leave the water. 
Police didn't say anything to us, just greeted.
Nevertheless more or less tidy and calm, just some people came here for the sunset. This area has smaller and bigger palms all around, for getting some nice shadows.

name: Nice Spot At The Beach
description:
Good for a night, before crossing the border to Jordan.
In the evening lots of people (and trash) here, but while the days, relatively calm.

name: Parking Area
description: Big parking area. we slept overnight and it was really quiet. good for big campervans.

name: Parking Area
description: A parking place near the old town. We stopped here for visiting the old town the next day. There was a man checking if people paid the parking ticket but when he saw that we had foreign plates he said that we don't need to pay. we stayed through the night and it was really quiet. It's better if you park near the last spots of the parking lot . It's fine for big vans too.

name: Roadside
description: Drinkable water  next to a closed Petrol station. we saw a local person filling with water. We asked him and he said it is drinkable.

name: Parking Area
description: An open free parking space. nothing great but very quiet during day and night. nobody bother us. we stayed overnight.

name: Damascus gate
description: Best meal we had in all Saudi. The food is Syrian and they had the best  meat and hummus. the prices were the best ! totally recommend it

name: Dune adventure sport
description:
This area is characterized by its proximity to the highway, and there are sandy lanes suitable for Adv. motorcycles and  4x4 vehicles. There are sand dunes of medium height and crowds are frequent on weekends, especially in winter,  suitable as a camping place.
Its official entrance (Google Maps)
26.6080308 - 49.8257305

name: Drinking Water
description:
If you can’t find water and need to fill up your water tank, here you right. treated drinking water
100l. 20 sar but there wasn’t a water meter

name: Flat gravel spot
description: Nice view over the mountains, Drive a short gravel road up. cellphone antenna service road. (4G Zain) Manny places to park, some fire pits. Lokals also come here for the view’s. Quite and cool night in saudi august!

name: Next to a Park
description: Good place to spend a night. It is in a small village next to a park. Street is close but not too noisy. Nobody blathered me. I had a good night.

name: Parking Hijaz
description: central , but expensive (don’t recall price): large parking lot east of the Hijaz train station (west of the medina, next to Syrian Telecom).

name: Selge
description: In the mountains with nice view, in the village Selge are ruins to visit

name: Nemrut Dagi (Volcano)
description: in a volcanic cone on a lake, quiet and beautiful

name: Troia Pension and Camping
description:
Campground for up to 8 rigs with usual facilities. Restaurant on site.
About 700 metres before Troia Archaeological Site (Ancient City of Troy)

Open all year.

Spotless bathrooms, hot shower. 
Washing machine available.
Grassy gravel sites.  Basic dump point, power and water.
Internet is fast and included.

Some shade.
Cost per night (March 2015) 45TL, washing machine extra.
Owner Uran Savas is a professional tour guide if required.

name: Goreme Balloon Launch site
description:
Full-action overnight spot, and very hectic in the morning if they launch the balloons from this spot. 

Don’t stay here or anywhere near here unless you want to be part of the «Balloon Launching Circus» from as early as 4:30 a.m. 
50 Balloons going up on this side of Göreme require a lot of space and you may find yourself hemmed in between launch sites. Then there are all the photo shooting teams for wedding and posing pictures, vintage cars, etc. 

To actually see the Balloons in the air, camp at an elevated spot or ridge with the sun in your back or left or right of you.

All facilities available in town about 1km away.

name: Nirvana Cave Hotel, Goreme
description:
I came here based on the information from ioverlander (see below). They do not support camping anymore nevertheless they offered dorm bed for 30tl with pretty decent breakfast. The houses are sighed in a rock, they look pretty cool. I stayed 2 nights and had the whole place for myself. 


Small area in carpark right next to formations. . 
Right in the middle of town so good for exploring the town, but with attendant problems of dogs barking at random times during the night plus guaranteed wake-up at dawn.
Hotel can arrange for laundry to get done. Hundreds of restaurants nearby.

Pool in the summer season.

Access possible for largish rigs (unimog and similar expedition trucks) but should walk in first to make sure there is room. Room for one or two bigrigs and a couple of smaller units

name: Ahlat, Van Golu (Lake)
description:
Small promontory into the lake. Can get far enough off the road that the traffic is barely audible. No facilities
Shade closer to the road if required. Mountain views south along the lake.
No dogs barking.

name: Ziyaret - 3km east on E99
description:
Nice spot at the junction of two rivers. Well off the road and river sounds mask traffic on the road above.

Were five dogs turned up but a few well placed rocks and a bit of chasing soon had them running up the valley never to be seen or heard again.

Few friendly locals were picnicking nearby when we arrived.

Quiet all night.

name: Dogubayazit - Murat Camping
description:
Restaurant, picnic and camping ground located just below the Ishak Pasa palace. Cost is 15TL/25TL per night including electricity.
Restaurant on site.  Parking on paved carpark.
Quiet at night

name: Burhaniye off D550
description: Beachside parking that will be busy in peak season. Carpark right next to the sand will be busy with locals drinking and necking and playing loud music so would be better driving on to the large grassed sandy area adjacent. Quiet in off-season, but no guarantees in peak summer..

name: Permagon Akropolis
description: Nothing fancy, just a very large parking area at the bottom of the road up to the ruins. Shade if wanted and can get well away from the road. Downside is dogs, but they are not too bad. Polyphonic calls to prayer as you would expect so will get an early start to your day..

name: Paradise Beach
description: Beach Camping about 3km west of the Ephesos Ruins. Long beach with hard sand. Quiet when we were there but would be packed during high season. Beach is several km long so could escape the crowds who are all in 2WD cars. Pretty quiet at night. Couple of dogs and fishemen visiting but OK

name: Marmarvis Overlook
description: Large roadside pulloff with great views over Marmaris and the bay. Plenty of spots that are level enough, but might be busy with locals drinking and playing music until late evening and then it is quiet with little traffic.

name: Smuggler's Cove
description: Little sheltered cove with pebbly beach and level parking. Perfect spot for a day or two on the way to Knidos Ruins at the end of the peninsular. Try your luck at fishing off the beach.

name: YakaPark Restaurant
description: Mountainside restaurant on the tourist circuit featuring comprehensive water features. Overnighting in the carpark is permitted with permission

name: Dragon Restaurant & Motocamp
description: Family-run restaurant and camping ground off Hwy 400 adjacent to Anamur Kalesi. Basic facilities and can park right on the beach. Plenty of shade, solar showers, Toilets. Basic facilities. No road noise down on the beach. 15TL for 2 people in motorhome. 25TL includes electricity. Laundry service available.

name: Aspendos Ruins
description: Carpark of Aspendos Ruins. Permission to overnight given freely. Small charge to use carpark

name: paranoma  hotel
description: safe parking and clean room cheap rate 120lira. AC and Wi-Fi Average. attraction is 14 km away

name: Camping Damlacik
description: Small campground with swimming pool and bar. The bathrooms are not the best but view is nice.

name: Star Restaurant & Pansion Camping
description: Messy terrain next to restaurant. Shower and toilet locked at nights.

name: Camping
description: Open terrain at Lake Van. it is a camping site. nice location. run down but the area is clean. 50 lira for tent for 2

name: Dilek Camping
description: Next to rock structures. You can see the sign camping near the rocks

name: Istanbul Mocamp
description: After a long day starting with lots of rain and the traffic jams in Istanbul this place feels like an oasis. Among fields, surrounded by a green hedge, close to the highway (but not hearing it), big terrain with mowed green grass and trees. Hot showers (4) and clean toilets. No wifi. We paid 4 Euro pp + 5 Euro for our car, say 45-50 Tl. OK its on the high side, but what choice do we have around Istanbul! Nice welcoming owner.

name: Otopark Kadioglu Otel
description:
Terrain across hotel.
ask hotel owner. 
tent 30tl for the night

name: Public parking
description: Parking next to restaurant opposite beach.

name: Artvin SE on D010
description:
Yes, just another roadside pulloff, but with water and mountain views and far enough off the road to be quiet at night, it is worth adding. Can even park on a big level concrete slab if you prefer.

Phone service and wireless internet available

Do not park or camp close to the edge as the winds are strong along the edge

name: Lake Tortum off D950
description:
Typical water/picnic/"camping" ground. Restaurant on site in season (opens May), basic facilities, couple of picnic shelters on the end of the peninsular and room for a couple of vehicles.
Probably get power if you stay in the parking lot, but nothing at the end of the peninsular.

Very quiet at night and way off the highway, but this is off-season so things will be very different in high season.

10TL a night, but may be more in high season

name: Samsun Karavan Kamping
description:
Space for 15 medium RVs  within a huge water complex - pools, wakeboarding  course, restaurant etc.

Internet available free plus water, electricity and really nice amenities block.

Very noisy from traffic noise on the overhead roadway, but not too bad at night. Horrendous racket from powerful speakers hidden in the apartment blocks will have you springing out of bed at the usual ungodly hour in the middle of the night.

500 m walk and then a short bus ride gets you to Piazza, a swish shopping centre with lots of speciality shops plus a Migros. supermarket and huge food hall. 20TL for a taxi back to your door.
Soon be a busway running past the door. Huge green park adjacent.

Cost is a HUGE 15TL a night. Staff speak English

name: Verizana Camping Restaurant
description:
Camping in the grounds of a restaurant. Nice enough location with mountain views.
Quiet at night. Electricity from inside restaurant. Water available. Hot shower and toilet adjacent
Nice brothers are the hosts. Little bit of English spoken.
Lawn for tents. Bigrigs would have to use the carpark

Cost 40TL a night which is certainly a bit rich but a good enough spot for visiting the monastery (which incidentally is at 40.69863, 39.65406  and not where shown on some maps of POI lists.

We did ask at the monastery lower carpark and it was OK to spend the night there. Suggest taking the shuttle bus up to the top. 5TL return and worth it to save the angst of trying to turn around in the chaos up top.

Sumela Campground is a bit further up the road on the right but make sure you get costs in writing as 4 out of 4 reviews stated they will rip you off otherwise.

name: Lake Iznik (Iznik Golu) near Nicaea
description:
Lakeside wild-camping. Along this section of the lake there are many places suitable for overnighting. 1km back east towards the town there are several sites with good shade as well)

Quiet at night as traffic is minimal.

name: Layby off D260 7km east of Polatli
description:
Section of old highway loop that also goes into a rock quarry.

One section is level enough and has nice views to the south. No highway noise and not visible from any part of the highway.

Don't block the entire road as the quarry is still in use and trucks might use the road to access the quarry.

Absolutely quiet at night.

name: Gallipoli Peninsula
description: Nice spot overlooking the Aegean Sea. Down a short dirt track off the road with some trees for privacy. Quiet and nobody around.

name: Ada Mocamp Kamping
description: A bit pricey for Turkey but you pay for the view. Nice flat grassed area for camping right in front of the beach. You might have to stretch your line pretty far for electricity depending on how full it is but there are outlets. There is also a restaurant onsite.

name: Kosovo Plaji
description: Large flat grassed area on a small bay just off the road into Foça. There are some trees if you are looking for shade. It is a paid day use beach but the owners had no problem with us staying the night. I saw a small building with WC on it but didn't check to see the condition. There is also a small cafe at one end of the beach. The beach was pretty full on a Sunday in early June but cleared out by 8:00 and we spent a quit night. Beautiful place to watch the sunset. Cost 10 lira

name: Yat Camping
description: There are 2 campgrounds right next to each other. Located across from the marina they are well situated. They both have swimming pools and wifi. Yat Camping seems to have nicer bathroom and shower facilities but there are a lot of semi permanent trailers here leaving less room for parking. Bigger rigs might have difficulty getting a space depending on how full it is. 85 lira for a caravan and 2 people. Electricity is extra and metered.

name: Onder Camping
description: There are 2 campgrounds located right next to each other. Located across the street from the marina and water they are well located. Both have bathroom/shower facilities, a swimming pool and wifi. The bathrooms at Onder have seen better days but they are kept clean. The camping here is a bit better than next door with nice flat grassed terraces going up the property with a mixture of sun and shade. 30 lira for a caravan and 2 people. Electricity is an extra 8 lira and a load of laundry also 8 lira extra.

name: Dereli Camping
description: Nice campground right on the beach. Kind of a free for all as far as camping pitches. Might have to run a chord pretty far for electricity. Bathrooms and showers have seen better days but are clean enough. There are also rooms for rent here. Camp closer to the beach to avoid the worst of the mosquitos. 50 lira for caravan and couple electricity included

name: Herakleia Restaurant And Camping
description: More of a restaurant that happens to have bathrooms and a shower but will let you camp as well. Nice beach location right on Lake Bafa and literally right in front of a small island with ruins. You can run a line to the restaurant for electricity for an extra 5 lira. There are roosters and dogs that make some noise at night. Cost =30 lira for camping

name: Montenegro Motel
description: This beautiful motel allows camping in their parking lot as long as there is space. It is a fairly small parking so big rigs won't fit. You can run a chord for electricity. Use of clean bathrooms and showers and pool. Good wifi. It is located near the trailhead to Butterfly Valley and has amazing views from the restaurant. The owner is super friendly and can give information on hiking.

name: Garden Pansiyon
description: Small restaurant and hotel that allows caravan parking in the rear of the yard. Flat gravel area with some trees for shade. You'll be sharing your space with a flock of chickens and some peacocks so be prepared for a wake up call. Clean bathrooms and showers and you can run a line for electricity. Only a few minutes walk from the beach and Olympos ruins. 35 lira a night including electricity.

name: Karatay Belediyesi Caravan Park
description: Free municipal campground on the outskirts of Konya. It even has electrical hookups and water at each parking spot. Bathrooms and shower were surprisingly clean for a free campground. It is near a mean highway so there is some traffic noise at night but not bad.

name: Kaya Camping
description: One of the nicest campgrounds we've seen in Turkey but also one of the most expensive. Swimming pool, clean and very nice bathrooms and showers, kitchen and washing area and a washing machine for 15 lira per load. Beautiful views of the valley below and great views to watch the balloons in the morning. They come right over the camp. Highly recommended for a night to recharge. 60 lira per vehicle with 2 people. Tents cost the same.

name: Sumela Monastery
description: You can camp in the lower parking lot at the monastery. There is a (15 lira) parking fee for vans (but you are charged 100l per person to enter the national park before you reach the parking).  we arrived in the evening and there was nobody charging. There are dirty (clean and new but not free) but working bathrooms. The parking lot is sloped but with a few leveling blocks we managed to get pretty flat. Quiet with nobody around after 9:00 or so. Go up to the monastery early to avoid the bus loads of tourists.  (You can no longer drive beyond this car park).  The only vehicles permitted are little buses ferrying tourists up to the monastery.  (30l per person round trip) It is a long steep walk from the car park and not very pleasant.  The scenery and monastery itself are breathtaking. There is a snack bar.

name: Ant Camping
description: Very nice little camping at the seaside. Bikers welcome!

name: Snake Valley Starcamp / yılan vadisi yıldız campı
description: Located in a field near to the highway but still far enough not to get disturbed by the noise. Located on the top of a hill, this place offers an amazing view of the surrounding and there is no house in viewing distance. A overlanders dream! Be careful of snakes, according to some locals they are plentyful in this area.

name: Marti Camping
description:
Nice flat grassed camping pitches. Some shade available. Good clean bathrooms and showers. Nice beach area as well. 
Opens 1st April until 1st October

name: Hamburg Camping
description: Nice flat grassed campground. Decent bathrooms and shower with solar hot water. Very friendly owner speaks good German. They tried to charge 50 lira for the night which is too much for this place we talked him down to 40.

name: Parking In Istanbul
description: Secure public parking on the water in the historical center. Can be quite loud at night but it's a great location with flat parking. There was a very disgusting porta potty for emergencies. 30 lira per night

name: Sundance Camping
description: A paradise lost... in between tourist dineylands this cozy litte camping is situated in a quiet bay. Ecofriendly with lots of animals roaming around and a very friendly staff this place is a true paradise!

name: Altin Camp
description: Very nice place along the Aegean Sea. Beach-front campsites and Garden campsites are available. Beach-front are more expensive. Bathrooms are clean.

name: Hotel Sultan Ahmet
description: Expensive car park of Hotel Sultan Ahmet, next to the Blue Mosque, central, quiet at night, 15€

name: Waterfront
description: At the end of access road to the waterfront, between two big hotels, only about 10m wide but right by the sea

name: Kizilot Beach
description:
Sandy area right at the beach near Kizilot. About 200m east there’s a real campground, too (there: EUR 10/night, wifi, electrcity, good restaurant, right behind the beach).
Between a hotel and a beach club. Peaceful and really good place for one night especially if you arrive late and want a good morning swim.

name: Between restaurants
description: Open space right by the sea, between two nice restaurants, WC in little park next door. Surrounded by holiday homes.

name: Olympos Mocamp
description: Good campsite with its own beach and clean facilities but well worth the price.

name: Osay Caravan And Camping
description: 50TL for 2 people, 40TL for one person per night. Beachfront location. Ok facilities.

name: Sumer Restaurant Camp
description: As the name implies this is literally a ground next to the restaurant. If you don't mind being a bit of a spectacle on the odd occasion when it gets busy, then this is fine for you. Has all the basic facilities but toilets are very primitive, all low and permanently smell like sewage due to no flushing system.

name: Uluburun Campsite And Restaurant
description:
This was a pleasant surprise in an area where there are no campsites for a while in both directions. It is located on the edge of a hill overlooking the Black Sea or Karadeniz, providing spectacular views. It rained and thundered while we camped here, but I am certain that on days with better weather swimming will be a treat on this secluded beach. The campsite and restaurant share toilets which are clean and there is a basic shower available. Electricity is provided via one of the Restaurant cubicles. This seems like a fairly new establishment with great potential and for 30 TL a night, it was quite worth the picturesque location over the vast ocean.
Continuing to function as a picnic area, but the public toilets/showers are being renovated and unusable. However we were allowed the use of a private (clean) toilet/sink. Besides this toilet, I’m not sure what other facilities are available. We weren’t charged for camping in their parking lot. Very nice staff.

name: Boomerang Bar
description: Boomerang bar in Enceabat. Basis but convenient overland spot. Friendly owner and you might meet other travellers. Price for camping 25 YTL per night for shower and toilet and wifi

name: Bushcamp Mountain Road
description: Bushcamp on small mountain road of the highway between Dursunbey and Tavsanli

name: Bushcamp Parking
description: parking atCatalhoyuk, gravel even surface, easy access, clean and quiet.

name: Bushcamp Parking
description: Bushcamp on parking of public park in Kahramanmaras, toilets available

name: otel Karadut pansiyon (camping & restaurant)
description: Camping at restaurant in Karadut, on the way to Nemrut Dagi. Try the menemen in the restaurant, great. Free wi-fi. Camping 10 YTL per person, incl toilet and shower

name: Bushcamp Conference Center
description: Bushcamp at a conferention centre in the middle of the town. Just ask they might say yes. There was a wedding when we were there. Only toilet.

name: Evi House
description: Bushcamp at parking near Evi House in Harran. Toilets left open for us.At night they also left the beeheeve houses open for us. Great views.

name: Gazi Konagi Hotel
description: Camped on the parking of Konagi Hotel in Mardin, very convenient in the centre of town. Paid 50 YTL per night for camping and shower. Free wi-fi

name: Bushcamp Parking
description: Bushcamped on parking in Diyarbakir, not a great spot but convenient and toilets available

name: Bushcamp Gas Station
description: Bushcamped at Apet Gas station near Lake Van

name: Camping Lalezar Dogubayazit
description: Basic, hot showers, not a very clean campsite. Price 100TL per person per night.

name: Sultanahani - Caravanserai
description: Sultanahani, beautiful caravanserai which is ready restored now.

name: Supermarket
description: Carrefour big supermarket near Diyarbakır

name: Harsena Castle woods
description: Wild camp in the woods overlooking Amasya. After you pass the restuarant on the way up to the castle. There is a dirt/grave road turning into the woods on your right. Before the final few corners to the castle. There are a couple of easy spots in sight of the road. But if you want to be out of sight, follow the gravel road/track down hill and round the corner. There are 3 spots with fire places already set. Good 4g Turkcell coverage.

name: Acisu River Camp
description: Many spots to camp in an area just off the road by the river. Easy access for 2wd vehicles. Grass to pitch tents. Many fire pits already used. 2 bars 4G coverage from Turkcell.

name: AK Bank
description: Takes forgein cards and give USD or Turish Lira.

name: Atmosfer Balloons
description: Head office of balloon company. You can book direct with them from here. 1 person 125 euro or 400TL dawn flight. They pick you up with minibus from camping or hotel.

name: Tasucu Old Coast Road
description: Great picnic/lunch stop. Or could be a handy overnight stop. Access from east bound side of highway at end of barriers. The old road is tarmac but I did see dirt/grass areas where you might pitch a tent. Good Turkcell 4g coverage.

name: Deserted Beach Wild Camp
description:
Its a bit of a long trail off the road but you are rewarded with a deserted beach all to yourself for the night.
The trails do not show up on Google maps. You have to look at the Satilite images to see them. The way point for the turn off from the road is N36 03' 35.5" E032 39' 12.7" and the way point for the switch back corner left you need to take is N36 04' 04.5" E032 38' 31.4" you can find it in maps me.
This place is also used by other people from the fires and rubbish. The track is graded dirt most the way and ok for 2wd. But the sand on the beach is soft and 4wd is essential. Good 4g Turkcell mobile coverage.

Nowadays the road is perfectly indicated on maps.me, so no trouble at all to get here.

name: Andriake Camping
description: Nice little rustic camp ground by the harbour/beach. You can catch boats for tours to Kokova island (sunken city) Good mobile 4g mobile signal from Turkcell. Good wifi (video skyped home)

name: Military Base - no through road
description: There is a military base in the bay and they are not keen to let traffic through to Marmaris.

name: No through road to Marmaris
description: You can't use this road to drive through to Marmaris. As there is a military base in Yavas bay and they won't let you pass.

name: Zetas Camping
description: If you want to stay in Bodrum to go out and enjoy the night life, then this is a handy place. But don't expect to get much sleep. As noisy night clubs pump music until very early morning. Showers and toilets are functional but not nice. Wifi in the restaurant only. 15TL pp pn off season.

name: Alexander Trosa Wild Camp
description: Wild Camp spot next to beach and river. There are a few spots in the immediate area but this is the flatest and on firm ground. Good 4g Turkcell coverage. Look on google sat images to see tracks from corner of road.

name: Unye
description: city parking at sea side next to park with free and clean toilets

name: Kayalar Oto - Land Rover Parts
description:
Land Rover parts supplier, including Defender. www.kayalaroto.com.tr
Contact Niyazi Sipahi
niyazisipahi@kayalaroto.com.tr

name: Bodrum
description: It' s an Otopark very close to downtown. But quiet. Price per day is 30 TL.

name: Next To Marmaris Yacht Marina
description: Wild camping. Quiet. A lot of trash. The supermarket at the marina is very good equipped. Also with camping equipment.

name: Ekincik
description: Beautiful little bay. Quiet, no trash, friendly people, a marina with toilettes, little market, it's just perfect!!

name: Omerli Baraji Dam
description: Grass and forest area along side of dam. Most tracks in the area are ok for 2wd if your careful. The frogs can get a bit noisy at night ;-) Ok 4g Turkcell coverage.

name: Kum Camping
description:
This is a good place for an admin day.It has good wifi, electricity, washing machines, hot showers,vehicle wash area and shady grass campsites. Access to beach also. Everything is included in the price 80TL pn. NO TENTS

Washing machines don‘t work and are very very dirty. 
Pets are allowed but only on lane, even though there are lots of wild dogs and cats running around.

name: Disused Artillery Emplacement
description: Wide open flat are on cliff top overlooking the entrance to the Dardanels. There are old emplacements for artillery along the cliff edge. Access is via easy gravel track. This place would be good for an overlander meetup. Good 4g Turkcell coverage.

name: Yusufeli Greenpiece Camping
description: Small campsite behind Pansyon Greenpiece. http://www.birolrafting.com. 20 Tl per person. Quiet at night. Walking distance to village centre with various supermarkets. Owner is very friendly and speaks English well.

name: Semizkum Mocamp
description: Established site on beach. Campers, caravans and tents. Cafe. Clean facilities. 50TL for a tent.

name: Agara Hotel, Restaurant, Camping
description: Camping behind hotel/restaurant. Grass. Some big trees give shadow in the afternoon. No showers. Clean toilets. 20 TL per night.  Next to river on the road from Ysusfeli to Bahal/Altiparmak. Beautiful gorge. Quiet place. Great to relax a bit. Next to campsit you can dip your toes in the river. Campfire OK.

name: Taka Rafting Camping
description: We stayed for free but had diner at the nice restaurant. Really friendly people.

name: Bc Taskopru
description: Ok place on the road to Taskopru. Nothing special, but fine to spend the night

name: Turkey border
description:
arriving on usa registered moto. 

first buy visa in separate bld. 30usd

then stamp passport

then buy insurance 40 euro

then document control

then baggage check unpack bags

then xray the bike

then final document check

total time 1.5 hrs

name: Goekceada Eshelek Kitebeach
description: Camping all along beach. You can use showers and facilities at kiteshop. Nice kitesurf spot with steady onshore wind and nice swell. Windy so if in tent there are a couple of structures to shelter behind or inexpensive pensions in town 1km away

name: Yaramida
description: Restaurant with small camping area. 20 TL per person per night. Bathrooms are a bit dirty; weren't cleaned while we were here. Sinks in bathroom used for doing dishes. Right on the water so good view. Secure as we left tents up and one motorcycle while we toured Gallipoli. Restaurant had very good BBQ. Showers but not sure if hot water. Good wifi.

name: Caravan Camping
description: small place with pool and resto. TL 200 for caravan/camping car, TL 20 for washing machine per load. Hot shower. Clean ablutions. Grass camping, some shade trees. Fronted by highway but camping is behind resto so only background noise. Good stopover.

name: ADA Camping
description: Very nice and cheap place. I'm not sure whether they charge 10TL for a person in the high season but at the end of September I paid this money to stay here. They also offer breakfast for 10TL and dinner for 10TL.

name: Garden camping
description: 30 TL for two people, two motorcycles and a tent. The place is run down so the pool has no water, no restaurant, etc. but the bathrooms were fairly clean, drinking water available. There is wifi but we didn't use it. We charged things via a outlet in the bathroom with an extension cord. There is a washing machine and a kitchen area with washing up sinks. Easy walk to town and 3k to Efes. The caretaker is very friendly. It is a grass area with lots of shade trees

name: Akyaka camping
description: Massive place on the edge of town set in tall pines. Basic facilities. Very busy in high season. Short walk to beach / town. Kite spot on other side of bay. Long walk along beach or 10min drive around

name: Aksazlar Camping
description: Dirt & rocky site on the beach. Didn't stay. Empty maybe end of season. Accommodation in town super cheap so opted for a roof

name: Doga camp
description: Up narrow dirt road small quiet campground. 12l pp. single lane track so you should call number before climbing if not on moto

name: Pearle camping
description: Didn't stay but looks like tiny car park on the beach. Some shade but grassy area was closed so nowhere to put a tent at the moment

name: Camping paradise
description:
Next door to dragon. More grassy and directly adjacent to castle, which is worth a visit!
This place is fantastic by its * personal* aspect, next to a castle it offers the beach, date palms shadow, hot showers in good condition and prime verified water by its owner, alevit and architect, price very reasonable.

name: Cyprus Car Ferry
description: Ticket office is in town 2km away (on waterfront road in marina)

name: Akarsu Camping & Bungalows
description: 30TL for two people in a tent plus park for two motorcycles. The tent area is nice with great views of the Black Sea. If in a van or camper car then you park by the small one room bungalows. Nice area with tables and chairs and great view. Kitchen area for cooking with lots of pots, pans and things. Pathway to beach. Some electrical outlets for charging things. Wifi available but we didn't try it. Solar hot water.

name: Zargana Camping
description: Looks like small dirt lot on the beach very close to castle and old military bunker museum. 1min to ferry. Didn't stay

name: Goker
description: 30TL for two people, two motorcycles and a tent. It is a restaurant, hotel and camping. Big rigs go across the street whereas we, with tent, were near the restaurant. There was lots of grass. Next to lake. Actual hot water in shower. We don't know what the facilities are like across the street and if the place was busy tents may not be near restaurant/hotel. Right now there was no one else here. Don't know about wifi. Some electrical outlets. No laundry or dishes area on our side.

name: Pamukkale Hotel, Pension & Camping
description: 40 TL for camping for two people, two motorcycles and one tent. Nice grassy area with some shade. Swimming pool. Owners speak English. Very clean bathrooms with plenty of hot water, really hot. Area for doing dishes. Initial price quoted was 50 but we negotiated for 40 as it is low season. Easy walk to travertine pools and ruins. Very secure.

name: Anatolia Restaurant, Hotel, Bungalows, Camping
description: 20 TL per person for camping. Large grass field with lots of olive trees for shade. Gorgeous bathrooms with courtyard, lots of stalls, plenty of toilet paper and hot water. Very clean. Electricity available. Wifi average to slow. Owner speaks English. No dish washing up area.

name: Kas Camping
description: Great campsite, good facilities, on walking distance from Kas and nice snorkeling. Go for site number 1. Yes it is the most far away from the abolition block but its quiet and it has the best view over Kas and over the ocean. Price was non negotiable, 55 lt a night (washing machine including).

name: Doga Camp Fethiye
description: Nice site for a night, right at the beach. We negotiated the price down from 40 to 30tl (off season). Wifi from neighboring places. We found it hard to find campsites at Fethiye and Oludeniz.

name: Ekin Camp
description: Beside all the wasps, the place looked very nice during the day. But as we were the only guests, the place was deserted and dark at night. With the staff being unfriendly and lots of locals drinking at a nearby picknick spot, this was a noisy and uncomfortable night. Perhaps in season this is a good option but in this time of the year we can not recommend this place.

name: Dalyan Camping
description: Good view over river and close to village center. Apartments with only few camping spots. Nice setup!

name: Athena Pension and Camping
description: 20 TL per person per night for tent camping. Tent camping only. Camping is in a garden and motorcycles can be right with you. There is secure parking for cars and vans too. Great inside common area with lots of light and both heating and air conditioning. Kitchen to use that is fully stocked with every kitchen item needed. Laundry for 10tl per load. Hot water and excellent wifi.

name: Ynlu Bufe
description: 30TL for two people, two motorcycles and a tent. Little overpriced. This is a restaurant/bar that offers camping. It is run down. Toilets are ok. Didn't see a shower but we didn't look. There is an area to do dishes. Right on the beach. We put our tent up in the front area away from the chickens and ducks. The nearby Ant Campground closes on 15 Sept.

name: Goktur Hotel and Camping
description: 35 TL for camping: two people and a tent. Though because he is technically closed right now we were given a cabin. No hot water but nice. In the beach. In season there is a restaurant and wifi, etc. lots of animals to play with.

name: Melia Suites and parking
description: We stayed here two times both in s two bedroom apartment and a single room. Best part is the secure parking for 10 TLper day for a motorcycle. See photos, might be tight for a ban but Mike pictured in garage opening is just over two meters. The two bedroom basement apartment had small kitchen and table chairs plus a storage closet for 30 Euros per night. We paid 20 Euro per night for the double room. The double room is I a different building about two blocks away. The basement apartment is at this GPS and looks into the parking area. There are more apartments at higher cost on the other floors. We booked through booking.com. Both places were very clean and well kept. The management is very friendly and helpful.

name: touratech turkiye
description: BMW service point, touratech accessories , outfit

name: Beach Ünye Airport
description: This place is a campsite. We payed 40 tl for one night. Good place with shower and toilets. It is possible to swim, not far from the town. There is no wifi, small kitchen for a sandwich. also good place for a tent. A lot of picknick tables.

name: Turkey/Bulgaria Border
description:
Big border with drive through immigration (given you got the E-visa online prior to arrival to Turkey). They check the vehicle papers and insurance a few meters ahead, and may or not request a customs vehicle check or even x-ray.  They told us to drive into the customs hangar for a check but they didn't really look at the camper and we were free to go within a few minutes. Didn't receive any vehicle papers. They also didn't care about the dog. The border crossing was quick and painless.
Can buy Europe Green Card insurance from kiosk just next to final exit gate into Bulgaria: 1 month, €54 for LC Troopy January ‘20.

name: Hotel Bayburt Konaklama
description: Lovely new hotel - great option if freezing conditions.  Rooms are 180tl but we negotiated 150tl.  Breakfast included which is fantastic.  Wifi a little slow.

name: Central Stone House, Goreme
description: Simple and basic but clean with good breakfast.  We paid 60tl per night for a double on booking.com

name: Cliff Camping
description: Nice and quiet spot at the Sea. Up on a cliff. Fire places, water fountain.

name: king Beach club
description: This camping / party place is available in all seasons. The owner is a bit crazy and loves money. Only put up your tent here and don't let them lure you into eating/drinking with them.

name: Melikler NP
description: Very nice place. Big grassy hill with plenty of flat spots.

name: Suloglu Lake
description: good for one night.

name: Tercan Lake
description: Difficult to get access to the lake, good for one night.

name: Mavi Cennet
description:
Cozy campspot for a night or two. Beach front, super friendly owner, nice setting.
30TL For two persons with car (low season)

name: IbrahimPasha Rock Camp
description: End of a dirt road leveled patch overlooking some small caves and pretty rock formations. There seem to be several possible boon-docking sites in this area. We only stayed for daytime Picknick since the nights were still cold too cold for us, but it was a completely peaceful and desolate spot.

name: Rock Plateau Balloon Launch
description: Beautiful grassy plateau overlooking rock formations. At the end of a dirt road. Found a Swiss rig camped here. Very near a balloon launching site (5-8am we heard).

name: Ferry to/from Gallipoli
description: Ferry terminal. Paid 35TL when boarding. Seems to be a frequent, short ferry ride.

name: Meadow between olive trees
description:
Very nice flat spot between olive trees, with ocean view. Met a nice farmer who had his donkeys and sheep here. We asked him if we could stay and he agreed. 
Very narrow gravel track leads to this spot. It is a little bit off down to the coastline from the main track. With 4x4 no problem. Becomes probably muddy in wintertime.

name: Side Ruins Beach
description: Nice place for wild camping close to the beach and the ruins of side.

name: 4x4 garaj alanya
description:
Tel: +90 5322702272

usta yüksel made a full reset of our motor because we had problems with the cylinders of our mercedes 410D. he did excellent work for a very reasonable price. the garage is specialised in 4x4 vehicles (defender, jeep etc.). even rare parts come quickly due to good contacts of the mechanic. anytime again and fully recommended by schnegg-und-weg.com

name: Emli Vadisi Campsite
description:
