National Park campsite with basic facilities (which were not open in winter when we were there). 
It's a beautiful spot in the valley with mountain goats and a view of the snowy hills. We paid 24 lira for 2 nights, 2 people and a car. They don't stop by every day though. 

Best way to get her is by using Maps.me. The tracks leading to the campsite are in there. 

Water on site is potable. Limited Turkcell coverage.

name: Wild Camp
description:
Up the hill and slightly off the road on a mud track.
We were visited by goat herders who although we could not speak each other's language we gave them coffee and they gave us a dozen fresh eggs.
Nice spot for a night and far enough away from the lake to get shelter from the wind

name: Parking Athletic Ground
description:
Parking lot near the ferry harbor and subway station, new sanitary facilities.
100 TL per night. Electricity and washing machine. 
The parking place further east is nicer.

name: Yazili Canyon
description:
Very nice under trees at a stream, sanitary facilities only rudimentary.
Good and inexpensive restaurants for trouts.
Entrance fee (about 5$) for the canyon is extra (hiking recommended).
6$ for 2 person a night.

name: Adada Ruins
description:
Between the temple of Zeus and the amphitheater on a lawn with bushes in a nice valley. The road is quite near, but almost no traffic.
poor 2G with Türk-Telecom

name: Parking View point Meke Gölu
description:
ADMIN NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals. The crater is surrounded with a fence. 

Directly at the rim of the crater with views in the crater and around, windy
3G with Türk-Telecom SIM

name: Parking View Point Hasan Dagi
description:
Flat parking place and meadow with a terrific view at a closed hotel.
Starting point for a hiking tour on Hasan Dagi.
Poor 2G with Türk-Telecom

name: Parking at entrance of Ilhara Gorge
description:
Huge, flat parking place at the entrance of the gorge. At the edges good for picnic. Nice view. Price negatiable.  
5$ for two persons.
3G with Türk-Telecom SIM

name: Parking at the Church
description: Flat parking lot at the church with nice view over the lake  of Güzelyurt, Ilhara and the mountain of Hasan Dagi, remote area.

name: Caravansary Sultan Hani
description:
Directly at the road, well reconstructed, reasonable entrance fee of 1€ p.p.
Better than Karatay Hani.

name: Lakeside
description:
On a hill by the lake in an area like a park, nice view.
More possibilities further down.
3G with Türk-Telecom SIM

name: Nemrut Dagi Crater
description:
Slightly uneven spaces at a small mountain lake. A lot of  garbage.
Looks a bit like Germany.
Friends have met bears here at night.
6 $ after negotiations.
No coverage with Türk-Telecom.
There are more places where you can stay for free in the crater.

name: Camping Grand Deniz
description:
Parking on the gravel beach, directly at the lake, unfortunately  near the waste containers.
Sanitary facilities ok, washing machine and electricity included.
18$ for 2 persons.
Boat trips to the Akdamer Island for 10TL p.p.  
2G with Türk-Telecom SIM, LTE with turkcell.
Good Restaurant.

name: Parking Airport
description:
Huge parking lot directly in front of the terminal, a little bit noisy during the day, quiet at night, safe.
6$ for parking per night.
3G with Türk-Telecom SIM

name: Tepe Camping
description:
Set high above Pamukkale.
Was a bit of a building site when we visited as preparing for the start of the season. 
There us a swimming pool but was drained when we were there.
Whole place as usual needs tlc and some deep cleaning but wonderful grassy terrace to camp on if with trailer or bigger truck. If just a tent a lower grassy area is available. 
Nice for a couple days if sunny and can watch the paragliders take off from just adjacent.

name: Analipsis church parking
description: parking close of the Analipsis church. Flat place, little windy, with great views.

name: Uzbekistan embassy
description: We applied for our tourist visa in Istanbul and picked it up in Ankara 10 days later. See Uzbekistan embassy in Istanbul for the procedure.

name: Turkmenistan embassy
description: We applied for our transit visa here the same day we received our Uzbekistan visa.

name: Uzbekistan embassy
description:
We applied for our tourist visa in Istanbul and picked it up 10 days later in Ankara. You keep our passport during that period so you can easily apply in one country and pick the visa in another. 

The application form has to be filled up online in advance. You will need a passport copy and a picture. Payment is done when collecting your visa. We paid 80 EUR per person for both Swiss and German nationalities, 30 days, single entry. Be careful, the visa is date specific so you have to enter and exit the country within the 30 days period you requested. When picking up the visa, make sure you bring a copy of the form you already gave them when applying along with another picture and passport copy.

name: Bazargan border
description:
Start by going to the immigration Hall. On the left side there is a kind of tourism buro where the lady speaks perfect English. She will explain you the procedure and give usefull information: 

1. Go through immigration to get your passport stamped.

2. Customs : there are some guys insisting to help you through the process. But as the tourist lady explained, the border services are totally free so you dont need the help of those guys. If you let them, they will charge you 5-10 EUR or take a heafty commission on money change or car insurance.

Insist on doing it yourself. You need your carnet de passage, a copy of your passport and copy of Iran visa. When entering the customs hall, you need to go to a small desk to collect some signatures on the back page of the carnet. Then proceed to the customs counter (right). After a few stamps, signatures and the car inspection you can drive down (about 1km) towards the final gate.

3. Insurance: If you are not covered by your green card, you will have to get an insurance coverage here. The office is just before the exit gate on the left side, called 'Iran Insurance'. Again you dont need anyone help for that, but after they started registering us in their system, someone decided to 'translate' for us and at the end we found out he was a stout 'working' with the insurance guy to get a lot of money from us. They asked 110 EUR for a months but after refusing to pay and insisting on seeing a price list, we paid 30 USD (payable in USD or EUR but they won't have change or in Riel).

4. Money change : The tourist bureau lady also gave us the official bank day rate to avoid confusion. The exchange rate in the official exchange shop just outside when exiting the border is actually better than the bank rate she gave us. Unless I can't do differently, I usualy avoid changing money with the guys running after you at the border.

name: benzine station, Turkuaz-Erollar Petrol
description: very friendly, offers tee, free wifi, great parkplace behind station, toilet, fresh bread, restaurant

name: Cemlik Camping
description:
Latest update2022: This place has been updated and is acceptable hygienic wise. New hosts are really friendly and helpful. 

Great location which is about the only thing going for it.
Dirty and unmaintained. Wifi is ok but would not even consider using the restaurant. Pack of dogs live adjacent barking all night.

name: Dolmus Kamping
description:
Small site near the water, laid back place with time to chill and relax.
Limited toilets and showers but all nice and clean.
Small bar and restaurant with cold beer and simple food.
Hot showers and good wifi.
Nice spot to relax for a couple of days

name: Kapidag Camping
description:
Right next door to Ant Camping.
Plenty room for big rigs, some caravans look like they are here year round. 
direkt Beach Access 
Plenty shade under the trees, difficult to find a grassy space.
50TL for Moto, bike and Tent per person.
Electric hook is available and extra but no idea how much extra as we did not need it for 1 night only.

name: Lakeside camp north of Istanbul
description: We found this place in the dark, so didn't realise what a nice spot it is until the morning. In daylight you can probably find a place between the trees or further from the road. The only other people we encountered were a fisherman and a sheep herd. Very quiet, except for the frogs at night.

name: Pebble beach just off the coastal road
description: Small place where others before us have built campfires. Just off the road, but sheltered enough to not attract attention from passers-by.

name: Pond Side Wild Camp
description:
Was getting late and we found this place just as it was getting dark.
It's access to the beach and where we camped has a hard standing.
Frogs etc a little noisy at night.
Lots of fallen wood for a fire if needed.

name: Saros Camping and Beach Resort
description:
Off season price of 30TL.
I was told they had hot water but no wifi.
When we got there we found no hot water only one staff who spoke no English and kept turning the water off completely.
We did however have wifi.
At no point was any cleaning carried out there the 3 days / nights we stayed to explore Gallipoli.
Could be a really nice place but sadly let down by poor maintenance and cleaning.
There is a washing machine.
The restaurant, bar and shop were closed as off season.

name: camping in Aliaga
description: parking space close to the beach. lots of dogs and cats. locals grill. toilets close by.

name: Near the "Hospital Monastery" caves
description: A very serene spot with the typical Cappadocian nature around you. Trails run in all directions, but no one uses these during the night. We only saw and heard the hot air balloons off in the distance, so stay here if you want to sleep in.

name: Demir Karavan
description: They build custom camper vans, but helped us getting a new solar panel set up on our Land Cruiser. Great service, very friendly and incredibly helpful. Google Translate helped solve the language barrier. I can imagine they can help you with any plumbing, electrical or other camper-related problems. Say hi to Ercan from Harm and Loes

name: Next to the Black Sea in Çavuşlu
description: Not the most perfect wild camping site, but it'll do. There's a trail between the football field and the trees leading to the water. The only company we had were a couple of boys heading home after football training. The local mosque is pretty loud, don't say we didn't warn you.

name: Wild camp near monastery, without the steep dirt ramp
description: We couldn't go up the ramp of the other wild camp near the monastery, so looked a bit further up this side road. The view is amazing and the only things you'll hear are rushing mountain streams and chirping birds. And a mosque off in the distance, if you listen closely. We've been standing here since lunch and nobody came by until 8.30 the next day.

name: Sandy beach just off the road near Sürmene
description:
One of the few sandy beaches in this part of Turkey and this one you can actually reach with your car. There were a couple of locals barbecuing on the beach who shared their sausages and bread with us. The rest of the night, we had the beach to ourselves. It would be a perfect spot if it weren't for the nearby mosque interrupting our sleep...

PS I've set the location to the coordinates of the ramp you use to enter the beach.

name: Just outside the village on the Hidirnebi Plateau
description: This grassy patch has everything: cover from the wind, a beautiful sunset over the mountains and total quiet except for chirping birds and rustling trees. We did come past a bit of construction work which looks like it's going to be water taps (like the ones you see all over Turkey). If it is, you'll even have running water.

name: Wild camp next to stream
description: Down a small dirt track off the main road. Well away from the road, and hidden behind bushes, right on the banks of a large, clear stream. Good Turkcell coverage.

name: Land Rover Oto Mechanik
description:
Very reliable, professional and skilled Land Rover workshop in Istanbul. 
They took care of my 80'000 km maintenance and several other issues.
Phone 0212 2852994

name: Quiet wild camping spot on the mountain
description: For this spot a 4x4 car is preferred (though not necessary). It's on a mountain where you are totally on your own. You have a nice view over the mountains. It's a little difficult to find a flat terrain, but camper raisers will help. There are a lot of trees so you'll find plenty of shade.

name: Sardala koyu
description:
Small inaccessible road for normal cars to a nice camping spot with access to to sea
Very nice place. However, it can only be reached by off-road motorbike or 4x4.

name: Cilder lake
description: Possible for cars and motorcycles to park and camp next to the lake. Place is close to Georgian border. You can swim in the lake. Nice levelled ground for tents

name: Cildir Golu
description:
Nice place for picnic and overnight stay between Kars and the Georgian border. Well maintained picnick site and they allowed us to camp.
One of the very few wind sheltered places around. Ok facilities (water, wc, garbage cans, pergolas). 
10 TL in 2021 (total).

name: Picnic Spot
description: Take a small road off the highway and then a short track down to this used picnic spot by a little stream.  Some rubbish around but ok for an overnight stop.  Visible from the small road but very quiet.  No facilities.  Free.

name: kirikkale
description: drinkable water source

name: Sagalassos Hillside
description: We had hoped to camp in the sites car park but were told it was not possible. They said we could camp back down the road.  This spot was flatfish but right next to the road. Smaller vehicles may be able to get further off the road nearby.  After the site closed at 7 the road was completely quiet so it was an ok spot for visiting the site the next morning.  No facilities.  Free.

name: Hayalet Camping
description:
Very nice campsite
Friendly family
Clean showers and facilities
Great breakfast and evening meal
Only 25 tl per person for a van 
35 tl for tent including breakfast p/p
45 tl evening meal and breakfast p/p
Close to beach and ruins

name: Seaview
description: Camping at the end of a track with views over the sea.  A short path takes you down to a sandy beach.  A few locals around using the beach but otherwise quiet.  No facilities. Free.

name: Tuz Gölü - lake view
description:
If you pass the village of Hamzali follow the dirt road/salt road up the hill. if you're almost on top turn right on a dirt road. follow the road to get as close as possible to these coordinates. if you can't get closer on the road turn left, this part is off road. just look for a way to get down to the coordinates, it's a bit searching but definitely possible. if you've find it, there is a straight spot where you can stay in total tranquility. From there you just walk up to the hill next to your spot and you will find a beautiful sunset on the salt lake. 
It might be a bit windy when you arrive but when we stayed the wind layed down later in the evening. Only accessible wit 4WD.

name: Lake Side
description: Camped by a lake near some wheat fields.  Followed the track down from the road to a quiet spot by the lake.  Handy for the Greek border.  Quiet.  Mosquitos at night.  No facilities.  Free.

name: Wild Spot
description: Just at the end of tarmac there is a pull off on the side or another Option over the nearby Bridge for an overnight stay. Really nice setting along the Little Stream coming down from the surounding hills. Food options about 2-3 km down the Road in the nearby Village which has a little campground for pitching your tent (7.50)

name: Wild Spot
description: A quiter overnight Option Further Up the picturesque Valley which is otherwise very busy with Rafting and hiking people from Turkey and the Arab world. Stone Bridge and water fountain nearby.

name: Seven Lakes - National Park
description: The main parking lot of the national park is also used as a campsite by many turkish people. It is not super cozy, but has everything one needs: benches, toilets, fireplaces... Close to two small lakes. There are some hikes in the park, but not very nice paths in our opinion, since you can do them with a quad, too. It takes a bit to get here (1h+ from Bolu).

name: hotel campsite near Hattusha
description: Hotel close to Hattusha. They offer camp spots for 20 TL. Shower and toilet facilities are perfect and staff is super friendly. We had no electricity, but maybe if you ask them they can arrange something. On top of all there is a nice swimming pool which you can use.

name: Close to the border
description: Convenient spot about 60km from the border. Quite high, so might be too cold in wintertime. The gps point is marked at the turnoff from the main road, follow the tracks (take left at junctions) until they end into a field. Where the forest meets the field are nice spots out of sight of the road.

name: Georgia/Turkey border at Turkgozu
description: Smaller border post (24/7) with little traffic - very fast. Georgian side super smooth. Turkish side slightly more chaotic as both leaving and entering people use the same queues. Turkish visa can be bought on the spot, payment in Lira or USD. Euro accepted but at bad rates. No other costs. Green card insurance is required for them to check the vehicle in the country

name: Memoriam mountain
description:
Google maps says this is Haselsa Hatira Ormani memorial park. Not sure what that means but this hill is quite nice for bushcamping. Close to the highway, but out of sight and no noise. Great sunsets over the nearby lake and the Ankarra skyline in  the distance. The hill is dotted with newly bulldozed tracks. Not sure what they are for, but nobody uses them. You can park next to one of these tracks (4wd req'd). From the higway, take the exit and follow the road trough a stone factory, keep taking left on the dirt roads the make a right towards the power lines,
On  behind it.

name: Vefa Otopark
description:
Located at the right of Istanbul historic site, is a great spot to explore the city. Beautiful setting equipped with 135 spots for motor homes, laundry, bakery,vending machines, wi-fi and electricity plugs for European. 
Area offers all services for summer and winter with both open and closed parking area including washing services for cars and motor homes. Location provides safe accommodation with security 24/7. Historic attractions of Istanbul are only walking distance away from this parking area.

name: Levent Vadisi Viewpoint
description: Parking on the parking site of the restaurant. Personell was welcoming, made it become possible because wild camping in this area is not recommended. They informed the village security about us. Even toilet and shower here!

name: Nemrut Krater
description: Wild camping at the small lake inside of the nemrut krater. Beautiful and quiet place, almost no people crossing during the day. A lot of turtles at the lake. But a lot of wind and sand.

name: Akcakil
description: nice camping .Close to the Sea. Good Restaurant.

name: Parking area "Park25"
description: Just a parking area. We entered because we didn't found alternative parking. It's near the city and near the iranian consulate. Secured with cameras. Directly nereby a municipal office so save and only used by cars during the day. We felt secure. Only problem was to come out again - there was just open the second exit which we can't use because of the high of our car. So we left the parking using the entrance lane and didn't paid anything (normally 10lira/night). But we had the OK from the parking manager.

name: Consulate Iran
description:
Iranian consulate in Erzurum.
Fast and polite service.

name: Cliffs at Kerpe
description: Flat area on top of cliffs in the town of Kerpe. Locals say you can camp wherever and we thought this was the best spot in town. Unfortunately some trash around, but great sunset view over the Black Sea and spotted some dolphins. Friendly dogs all over. Several fish restaurants next door. Outdoor showers on the beach 2 minutes walk away. Toilets only open in summer. Supermarket and bakery 5 minutes walk.

name: Rock quarry
description:
Flat area in small abandoned quarry in the woods. Not beautiful, but remote and quiet for a night. Maps.me shows the track here. It's offroad, but did it without 4x4. Rain overnight made it muddy though and we needed 4x4 to get back to the tarmac. 
We did see bear paw prints around.

name: Gaferli Stone House
description: Small Family run Hotel. Walking distance to town centre. The owner went out of his way to help secure balloon flights for us. All were cancelled past. 3 days due to weather. He even cooked us lunch one day.

name: view on love valley
description: From here you have a view on love valley

name: Takoser
description: Ask on the road to kamyon garaji (Turkish for truck garage) and there ask for Takoser and his name is Hakan. He is very handy, he makes his own landrover from old landroverparts. He helped us with our landcruiser. It is not an official garage, but a mechanic.

name: Hidden apple garden restaurant
description: You can park a camper on the parking lot and a tent you can pitch in the apple garden. Camping is for free. We took a dinner for 25l pp. There are toilets and a shower (cold because of broken solar). Yilmaz is very nice.

name: between Kocaeli y Sakarya
description: just a point between this two cities. quiet street near the lake. good for a night. we made a fire near the lake, there is wood.

name: Yenicaga lake
description: big relaxation area with many BBC and children's games. quiet at night

name: Kurucasile port
description: big parking of the little port. quiet and nice people. beach

name: Amasya
description: free big parking 10 min to the old town wich is beautiful by night! parking quiet at night but near a mosque...

name: Bolaman
description: little port of the village. very quiet. just the mosque...

name: Uzman otomotiv
description: Small workplace with a really friendly owner. specialized mainly in Mitsubishi but was car in general are all in good hands here.

name: Hill pasture view
description: take a little farmers' dirt road on the west side of the Yenikoy-Sogrut road and park on top of the hill near the electrical pole. Very accessible from highway (100m) even with 2wd, beautiful views, a little bit of sound from the road, farmers came by in the morning to say hello.

name: Uzengi Valley view
description:
Camp on a dirt track off Uzengi Valley 15 minutes from Ortahisar. Great views and very quiet. We stayed three nights and just saw the horses from the nearby ranch strolling past daily  Really enjoyed this spot. It's an unpaved road, but 4x4 not necessary. 
It's also a very nice drive if you continue east. High clearance is helpful, but big rigs might struggle.

name: Golgoli Caves
description:
Nice quiet camping spot at the end of the track to the little-visited remains of the rock-cut houses of Golgoli. It's a bit of an off road drive to get here. Supposedly Jeep Safaris from Göreme come by here too. 
The nearby lake (which we passed the next day) seems to have good spots too. Road and turns might be too narrow for big rigs.

name: Parking at restaurants
description:
A string of restaurants, some with wifi and shower, offer parking/camping. Ask if they charge for it if you eat there. Or park at the Belisirma ticket office down the road. 
Secret entry to / exit from the valley at 38.266865, 34.29047, so you can hike down one side of the river and come back the other side which is nice.

name: kervansaray camping-pansion
description:
we didnt stay here as we were en route to capadocia, but the owner Tahir was super nice and offered us a great price for our truck (20TY plus electric). we will stay here next time for sure!
High season, 80Tl/night for 2 adults, car, electricity. Dinner also available—tasty. 

i believe they also have rooms available but am not sure.

name: magical ridge over red valley
description:
fairy chimneys heaven, great for sunset and sunrise. we camped here late october so there were no balloons in the morning BUT they launched at midnight and we could see their fires bobbing over sword valley so we think you should have a good view in summer season.

but in any case view of red valley is magnificent. there is a very large flat area suitable for large rigs - if you have a small rig like ours you can continue onto a more narrow ridge with drops down into valleys on both sides. 

easy access from asphalt road (2wd ok), take a left after the cafe just before the entrance to red valley toll gate.

name: Nice bush camp
description:
Nice place to stay overnight, away from everything. It is surrounded by some bush, trees and nice rock formations.

Access : 
If driving east, take the small dirt track at coordinates 40.984535,34.666733, it really follows the highway for 50 meters then makes a right curve.
If driving west, take the small road left at coordinates 40.983208,34.671303
Then about 200 meters later take the dirt track on the right.
Pass the few 'houses' turn left at the water reservoir and follow the track.

name: Trabzon Iran consulate
description: parking in the center of Trabzon, just 50m to the Iran' consulate. 25LT / 24h

name: Bayburt
description: in a big park with bbc  and picnic table. lot of kid'games. Nice people. quiet at night

name: old roman Bridge
description: We haven't camped here. But the restaurant owner told us, there were many campers before. They speak good German.

name: Hot Spring
description: Cabins and picknick area for turkish tourists on a hot spring plus tea room and hamam (= very very basic). We asked for allowance to stay overnight and were welcomed. Got the offer to use one of the hot basins privately for 30 TL p.h. (quite hot but enjoyable). Guarded and absolutely quiet at night.

name: Crater Lake
description: Quite a few kilometers earth road, here and there challenging (steep, narrow, 4x4 in action). Remote from everything (alt. 2.344m). Fresh air, just some shepherds around, more stars in the sky than somewhere else...

name: karagöl lake
description: It is a piknik alani at the Karagöl lake. At the restaurants we saw a toilet outside. It is quiet now, but in summer maybe busy.

name: The local's fishing lake
description:
We drove to the nearby "snake valley starcamp" but were not too fond about it. We decided to go to the lake on the other side of the road. The lake is beautiful with an active animal life. There were some local men fishing when we arrived, but they left when it got dark. Some others arrived in the morning - it is a well used fishing and camping spot for locals. They are fishing carps and other fish. 
The road here is gravel road but the locals manage to get here in their old cars. There is some trash and some earlier used fire pits but a long way to find firewood. 
We could hear the mosque and the road in the evening but not loud. 
On maps.me it looks like this spot is out in the lake but in reality it is on a small peninsula.

name: UNESCO art "a Day on Earth"
description:
We drove up to these big rock art-things and found it was a nice area for a one night camping. The road placed furthest to the west and going all the way around is the best. The other more direct route is in very bad condition. 
A good rough car is recommended.

name: Spring camp on small road
description: This place has a spring and a home build table. It is just a small gravel road of the main road and you have to pass a stream in the car (it was no higher than the inner side of the tyres). Close to the road but quiet at night.

name: Track above Isak Pasha palace
description: We took the small track from the picnic area above the palace. The spot we found had great views. There is a herders hut close to and the dogs came a few times barking. Requires 4wd.

name: Diyadin hot springs and campsite
description: There is a nice hot spring-place here where you can get private rooms for bathing. The water was extremely hot though. There is also a campground. The guys there allowed us to camp in the parking area after we had a bath there. There are other hot springs in the area at different prices.

name: Drycleaner/Laundry
description:
Dryman
It is a drycleaner but they accepted to do just the washing. Next day pick up and discount price.

name: M1 shopping center
description:
Huge shopping center, including a DIY shop. 
Stayed for the night on the parking. No problems.

name: Parking next to promenade
description: Free parking area next to promenade, beach and castle. Very quiet at night.

name: At lakeshore
description:
Great spot at the lake with nice vistas of the mountains. There's a little "beach" as well when water is low (like now in the winter). 
3G vodafone coverage.

name: Beachcamp
description: You can go on a tarmac road all the way to the beach. We stayed 2 nights, no problems. Use of beach showers of the hotel/resorts. They are all closed. Some fishermen come and go, we liked the spot.

name: Caravan Parking
description:
Excellent place to stay! This is a known spot for campers and caravans by Turkish tourists. There's a toilet (1,5TL), shower (3TL) and filled up the water tank for 5TL. Stayed 3 nights. Some stay for 3 months. Jandarma (police) is opposite so super safe. All around 4 and 5* hotels and resorts. 
One of the best places close to everything we stayed in Turkey.

name: Close to airport
description: If for whatever reason you need to be at the airport, you can park/sleep here. Not ideal as planes fly over, but free and within walking distance to the airport.

name: Next to the beach
description:
If you don't mind camping next to the road, this is a good spot. 
Beach Shower and toilets available. Lots of Turkish campervans come here as well.

name: Canping
description:
Very nice place in the woods. 
Basic facilities. Good for hikes. No cellreception.

name: Picnic Area Camping
description:
To get to this place you have to turn left of the main road at the first traffic light (coming from the east) There is a small sign pointing right along the road that parallels the main road for ~100m before turning left.
There are two places, the first one is fenced in and has toilets, but might be closed at night. The second one where I stayed is open all night. 
Vodafone TR 2G

name: Hidden valley near the lake
description: Hidden valley surrounded by steap mountains near the lake, really beautiful! We felt save and no one came by. We tagged the exit of the paved road, follow the dirt road up in the hills for ~300m for a spaceous and leveled camp spot. No 4x4 needed.

name: Lake Camping
description:
Nice little place away from the main road (still audible across the lake though). There are two more spots a little further down the road. This one had the most sunshine when I was here. Trash level is bearable, some locals around in the evening, but quiet at night. 
Vodafone LTE Speed available.

name: Tepeköy
description: We parked all day and night. Square kids, opposite the sea, beach 50 meters with shower and hammock. Mini market and restaurant opposite .mesas and picnic benches. At the bar "coffee can" received us owner "Murat" allowed us to use the baths and Park us without problem.

name: Dolphin Caravan
description:
RV / Caravan manufacturer. Not a mechanic, but a very friendly workshop which builds RV/ campervan. 
They can support you for any issue with your cellule, fridge, heater, gaz, water, furniture. 
No-one here speaks English anymore. They were happy to help the best they could.

name: Flat grass near stream
description: Flat area in a bend of a small stream, reached after 300m on an easy track

name: Panorama Camping
description:
Campground, the owner Ahmet is very friendly and nice, nice view over Göreme, a little bit noisy because directly on the mainstreet but ok at night, 
hot shower (new built), kitchen, small bar/café, free Wi-Fi but not really strong, 100 TL for two Persons + Caravan

name: Parking lot Open Air Museum
description:
Big and flat parking lot. We paid the regular parking fee for Caravans and were allowed to stay for the night : 20 TL.
Very quite from 18.00 when the tourist busses are gone.
We received the WiFi key from a restaurant just above. 
Toilets on the parking.

name: Car Repair Compound
description: If you ever encounter technical problems with your car in the Istanbul area, this is the place to see. Literally dozens of repair shops covering each and every aspect. Was having clutch problems that have been resolved here. Also , Metro is nearby (Atatürk Oto Sayani).

name: Alexandreia Troas Ruins
description: This is the remains of the ancient city of Alexandreia Troas. Entrance is free. There are some interpretative signs and in some parts you can roam freely through the ruins. GPS points towards the forum - also interesting is the thermae about 500m further uphill which features several large arches.

name: Viewpoint Dardanelles (+ Wildcamp)
description: Large unpaved viewpoint with good view over the Dardanelles entrance and strait. Only accessible when you come from Canakkale, due to divided highway. I suppose you can overnight there too, but it's close to the highway and you are visible.

name: Kocadere Göleti
description: Nice spot on a dam overlooking the lake. The track on the dam is very wide, so you can park your vehicle on the side. Locals do the same for fishing or having a bbq there. There is a larger spot at the end and some more on the bottom of the dam. The one at the end had some glass on the ground though, so we chose to stay right on the dam. Restrooms are available at the Kipa Supermarket by the road.

name: Copy Shop close to Uzbek embassy
description: In case you need copies of your passport or your online application form printed out, there is a copyshop in this building close by the embassy. Enter the building, take the stair-case on the left down to the basement/cellar and then at the very end of the corridor you'll find a fully equipped copyshop. It's cheap too - I think I had about 30 pages printed/copied there and paid 3.5 TL - and it was very fast as well.

name: Haci Salih Bayiri Park
description:
Park on a steep hill outside the city overlooking the valley, used by locals for picknick. GPS is at a flatspot close to the top, features benches/tables, a basic restroom and several water taps. Park workers stayed until dark and came back in the morning, but didn't seem to mind us staying overnight.
There is a larger parking area on top, but it has a gate. The gate was open all night, but I'm not sure if that's always  the case.

name: In the woods
description:
Nice place in the light woods close to the Greece border.
Good spot to stay for a night before or after crossing the border.

name: Ayazini cave Church, -graves and housing
description: Parking on flat grass spot infront of the biggest housing cave (several caves ajoint).  Along the road you'll find an old cave church, several housing caves and behind the village cemetery old christian tombs with decoration carved out of the stone.

name: Wild camping at the sea
description:
Great spot for wildcamping at the sea. Including beach and plateau 
Road to this place can be a challenge but should be doable in all 4x4’s. Very enjoyable road
Took the northern entrance (40.1270897,26.2309554), got a bit stuck going past this beach

name: Livera Kamping
description:
A fantastic place up on the mountains, relaxed and with little to no noise other than nature. The bathrooms are cleaned multiple times a day, and the shower water is warm - takes one hour to warm up, ask first.

You have little huts available or a place for your tent. We payed 50tl for 2 people on our own tent. Small parking space, perfect for our motorcycles, maybe not perfect for campers.

The owners don't speak English, but they are beyond friendly and made our 4 night stay here fantastic and welcoming.

They also serve food, although you can pitch a fire and cook yourself. The nearest city with markets is Macka, 9kms away.

Highly recommended!

name: GurmeRestaurant
description: Nice family owned restaurant where you can officially stay. 50TL per night, toilets quite good, shower available (everything in the main building) and incredibly good WiFi even though we stayed in our van around 50m away from the restaurant. Owner (Sabri) is super nice and speaks english. Everybody there was really friendly and they brought us tea several times a day. Stayed two nights there as we liked it a lot. At the weekend it might be a bit noisy as there are some beach bars close by.

name: lake bafa Kisla
description:
On the side of the road 200m before Kisla. The village seems abandoned. There is no water in the village. Nice spot just above the lake. Only 6 cows and a man on a scooter passed. A lot of birds.
There are more spots on the side of the road on the way here. Its a good asphalt road all the way.

name: Grassfield along small River
description: Quiet nice grassy field close to a small River. Lots of spots. Also along the river. 2 houses on the Hill (250m away) but nobody bothered us. Locals seem to use the place as well since there are Some fireplaces. No cell phone coverage. Site can be accesed just before/after the brigde.

name: Güre
description: parking place just in front of the boardwalk and the beach. Lots of People are on the boardwalk bit noone deels to mind.  Turkish People picknicking and BBQ on the beach

name: Spil Dag Milli Parki
description: streep climb up and just afterparty the bar/restaurant streep and very bad dier Road leads to an informal picknick place. Impossible in bad weather and some ground clearance is a surplus. Beautifull view over the valley.

name: Ceylan Pinary
description:
camping place die Turkish families. Very nice swimming pools. Lots of picknick tables and pergolas with carpets and sofa's. Some indoor mini pools. Clean toilets (both european and turkish style) and showers. Die i already mention thé swimming pools? Very near Heriapolis, but very streep road ( +10%). 20ytl per person, Unimog included.
tv

name: Yavuzlar picnic area
description:
Very nice grassy and flat area near a river. Close to the road but little or no traffic at night. Many locals during the weekend and holidays. 
Close to the beautiful Capaddocia-like village of Yavuzlar.

name: Muhammedusta
description:
Brilliant mechanic for motorcycles. 
Thorough and professional. 
Friendly mechanic Muhammed and Turkish motorcycle policeman Emre also got tea and kebabs for me while I was there. 

Phone:
05345666136

name: Commagene Hotel
description: also known as Commagene Wooden Hotel or Commagene Nemrud Hotel. There are 5 places in the garden where you can put a tent or camper. We had to stay in the parking with the Unimog. Staff does not speak English but they will call the manager who does. Noisy place on busy crossroad. Toilets not very clean. We got the keys of a room for a warm shower (and clean toilet). 50ytl for two persons and camper.

name: Dyarbakir University
description: new buildings and extension of the university. Camped beide the empty buildings with permission of the Kurdish guards who invited us for thé. Quiet place with view on the city. Much better Alternative to the parking lots mentioned for Dyarbakir.

name: Picnic place near Halfeti
description:
More or less flat area right next to the lake, accessed via an easy gravel road from Halfeti. Little trafic on the road during the day, none at night. Easy access to the lake for swimming. You hear some music from the tourist boats and restaurants during the day and evening, but totally quiet at night. 
Given the quantity of rubbish lying around, it must be busy during the weekends, but we were alone. 
Not on the path of boats going to Rumkale and Savasan. 
Turkcell 4g.

name: Kodal Oto Klima
description: Authorized Webasto and Eberspacher  Dealer and Service. Can install and repair heaters and air conditioning units as well.

name: Sonmez elektrik
description: Excellent auto electrician. Special expertise on 4x4 vehicles, especially Defenders

name: of the old road
description: Take the old road to Beysehir, follow the signs to the national park. Take the dirt road next to a water tap for a few km. You end up just next to the lake. No swimming all marsh. But beautiful gras with some small trees for shade and fire wood. Beautiful spot in the middle of nowhere.

name: top of the hill
description: Overlooking all the villages in the area. Drive up from the road to Kavak. 2km offroad but great views, specially at night with all the light off the villages. Not the best track but i was ok with 2wd.

name: Lake Burdur
description: Great quiet wild camping spot next to Lake Burdur. There are amenities in the nearby town.

name: Rumkale
description: Amazing place with stuning view on the Euphrat river

name: Ishak Pasha parking
description: Stayed on the grass field just above the Isak Pasha palace. Great view of the palace but not of mount ararat. A lot of families  who picnic during the day but  quiet at night.

name: between bunker and castle
description: Just next to the castle overlooking the city. Small parking between the castle and a bunker. Steep uphill to get here. Not much noise except from the mosque.

name: Very good Volkswagen etc. Mechanic
description:
Emir is a very good Volkswagen Mechanic and also other Brands. Could organize spare parts very quick. Also cheap... 

There are many other Car/Tuck Shops and Mechanics around so you shoud get allmost any problem fixed

We where very happy as we could not find parts in Iran an Pakistan. Great Job

name: Flat gras area well hidden
description: Nice flat area in between trees not far from the road, well hidden but little loud because of the highway. Good for one night

name: Karabayat
description: Good place for tents on the road between Beysehir and Konya. The site is about 400m above the road on the edge of a small wood. Nice views over the hills.

name: Near lake at end of Monastery Valley
description: Great spot with view to Mount Hasan and Yuksek Church. Very peaceful. Great for tents only.

name: Beach
description:
Beach at a small bay. There was nobody except some fishermen who said it is ok to stay overnight. We helped with their boat and got fresh fish in exchange. Small fresh water pond- great for bathing. 
We saw a big group of dolphins in the morning. Awesome, absolutely remote place (you just hear waves, birds and frogs) that reminded us of the tropics. Would be more fantastic without all the trash.

name: hidden spot overlooking the ocean
description:
Use the very small road (not on google maps) on the left side of the road before the hairpin bend. (If you are reaching the water tab on the left you are already too far). The dirt road leads you approx. 500m down to a patch of grass. The road is narrow and steep, 4x4 recommended. 
There are several levels where you can stay. Beautiful ocean view (incl dolphins) very remote, no trash.

name: Wild camping 20km from Kayseri.
description:
Wild camping spot suitable for cyclists, motorcycles and 4x4.
Quiet spot a few hundred meters from the main road. Good views to Mount Erciyes and Kayseri.

name: Remote spot in a stone quary
description:
Good spot when you are on road D851 and looking for a close place to stay for the night..
Hidden spot, overlooking the surroundings.

name: Andalouse Suite Hotel
description:
This is a great cheap place to stop off and recharge on route east or in our case to fly home for a wedding.
We paid 407TL £66) for 3 nights in a bright spacious room with balcony.cheaper than some camp sites.
Good WiFi
Secure parking for our Land Rover

name: Wild camping on the shores of Tuzla Salt Lake
description: Very quiet and peaceful wild camping spot on the shores of Tuzla Salt Lake. Beautiful surroundings. Area with nice grass and perfect for camping. There is also space for small campers. There is a water tap but this was not running when we were here.

name: Remote Camping at the beach
description: Endless space at the beach, that we had just for us. Very fine sand (party black) with lots of clams. Unfortunately including plastic waste and mosquitos.

name: Collection Turkish Airlines cargo
description: We picked up our motorcycles here after they got airfreight from Sudan. This is the office to go with your invoice.

name: Wildcamping in the pontian mountains
description: Wildcamping in the fields tucked away behind some trees. Natural water source nearby.

name: Natural water source
description: Drinkable water source. Used it for cooking.

name: Vostechnic Garage
description:
Mechanic for all old VW vans and cars such as T3, LT, Type 2 etc. 

Nice guys knowing all the people for parts they dont speak english but there is always seem to be someone there who can translate. I found them a bit pricey for parts but apparently it was all imported and the lira is inflating very fast - so couldn't negotiate

We ended up taking the part out and going there with the metro as the street is very steep if you end up camping in your car.

Note there is no sign over the door or anything just need to walk through the black doors where a lot of beetles parking outside.

name: Amasra Bus Station Car park
description: Nice spot with lovely views over the town, very friendly people. Not clear if you need to pay or not but we gave 10TL to a man who was a guard or similar - probably get away without this but we looked for someone who could confirm if its ok to sleep here. Only downside that the the local landfill is a few 100m away behind the cliff and probably in SW winds you might be able to smell it (couldn't when we were here). Lots better still then the other parking in the port.

name: Tatvan to Van
description: entrance for vehicle shipping from Tatvan to Van. Normal shipping is at 8:00, price 50 ytl for truck, 15 ytl per person. Pay on the ferry. Check for departure hours with guards.

name: Ferry from Tatvan to Van
description: we were allowed go stay at the entrance for the night by the guards. A little noisy in the evening, quiet at night.

name: Picknick spot next to a dam
description:
Nice camping spot behind a dam next to a lake. There are plenty of tables and fireplaces and shade. Also working bathrooms and electricity and potable water.
Seem very unused we were alone here. Next town sivas is 50km away

name: Goreme campground
description: 125 per person in a tent. includes electricity, kitchen, wc and swimming pool. nice campground,  10 mins walk from town.

name: Panda Hostel
description:
Dorm beds, €5 per person incl. breakfast. Hostel offers very clean beds and rooms. it is a new place so there is some things not finished. but if you are looking for a quiet place to recharge this a nice place and it is not damp like some of cave rooms. there is a common room available too. we used it for cooking dinners.
it is off the main road and we safely parked our motorcycle outside.

name: Hakan otel
description:
There isnt much choice around. Hotel is clean and tidy, a bit on the expensive side. around 130-150 lira per room for 2 people.
for campers ypu might be able to park outside behind the hotel.
there is a big parking behind the hotel and toilets

name: Nice big field with sandy beach
description: Very nice long beach on the side of a field. Road  cc 8km of forest road 4x4 or high ground clearance recommended, may get slippery in wet weather. Nice beach breaks for surfing. Good 4g Turkcell signal. We haven't seen anyone for a day here only cows on the beach. Nice stop before Sinop

name: Lider Motorsiklet
description:
Super workshop for motorcycle repair or maintenance. Mechanic (Isa Usta) doesn't speak much English, but does an awesome job on your bike. He works secure, precise, clean and charges a very fair price. If you contact him in advance (+90 543 675 09 26), he will make sure to have all the parts you need. My sprocket was wrongly delivered so he jumped on his scooter to cross the city and find the right one for me straight away. 

No extra charges, but a lot of extra service. 

Highly recommended!
https://foursquare.com/v/isa-usta/542e58ca498e0f620695b6ab

name: For (motor)bikers only
description: Patch of grass along the river with some trees providing coverage from being seen. It's close to the main road, but quiet at night. Looking out over a river and hill where you'll see some foxes at night. It's at the end of a paved path, but only motorbikes and bicycles will be able to get in between the trees. Vans can drive down there, but will surely be seen from the road.

name: Great view
description:
Good place for motorbikes and bicycles, but inaccessible for cars or vans. Along a dirt track (with a lot of dirt around indeed - be careful, lots of glass) - quiet at night. We asked around in the nearby village and a few boys showed us this place. A little later they came by with local delicacies :)
Great view over the lake and magnificent mountains. Sky full of stars at night!

name: Cliffsite
description:
This place is Not accessible for bigger Campers! 
Beautiful place surrounded by cliffs with lots of opportunities to park the camper. Off road path with one steep part to go to the nicer places. 4x4 recommended

name: hotel atak
description:
small budget hostel..the family that runs it is very friendly and also manages the tours.
8 € per 1 person, including spectacular breakfast on your terrace with spectacular views
---
pequeño hostel economico..limpio la familia que lo regenta muy amables gestionan tambien los tours.
8€ 1 persona desayuno incluido espectacular en su terraza con vistas expectaculares

name: Small camp option
description: Close to the road, 20m down on a gravel path. Almost out of site for by-passers. We used it to take a break and have dinner did not stay overnight. Spot itself is not very interesting, some trash laying around like in most spots. The view on the seaside however is very pretty.

name: Beach near Ordu
description: Small beach near city Ordu. Its accesable by cars and vans.

name: Yesilirmak Merit Hotel
description: Clean and comfy hotel. Next to Maxoil petrol station. The receptionist was so nice and told to to bring the bike inside the hotel corridor right next to the hotel’s lobby.

name: grassland near the lake
description: There are several small roads from the main road towards the lake where you can park or camp. Very quiet and in turkey therms relatively clean. no facilities. Road is easily accessible, can be a bit muddy.

name: Lake side park
description:
Ask the nearby restaurant and security guard nearby and they suggest you to camp around here. Toilets are available, but no shower. 
It's a terrible camping location however... There is constant noise from the highway, trains passing, people hanging around the place or fishing at night, etc. We could also hear gunshots around the lake (probably hunters).

name: private tea spot for camping
description: Spot with trees and decent terrain for camping. A tea spot place owns It and they let camping here. Nice views over the river, and the ancient bridge.

name: In the macchia
description:
A flat ground hidden from the side street, within trees. Sun almost until sunset. To get there, follow the main road, and keep your eyes out for a small traktor path going a bit downhill. The place is then on the right side. A small fireplace was there too. 

No water, ground is not suitable for tents. Takes 15 min driving from the D100

name: Parking with great view
description: parking with a great view. a bit windy but quite nice in summer. busy during day time with local tourist.

name: Wild camping next to mount Nemrut
description: Beautiful 360 view, you can also see mount Nemrut from here. No trash, no dogs and no people. Driven path from main road. You need a 4x4. Very windy, make sure to check weather forecast. We had to sleep in the car. Other than that, perfect for wildcamping.

name: Aktas Road restaurant and services
description: The owner saw that we were looking for a place to stay for the night and showed us a small parking lot right next to his restaurant to park and sleep. He ever offered us tea. Best to ask before park here. WC in the service area for 1TL.

name: Van-lake peninsula to Achlamar-island
description: 500m to the north from D300 you'll find the lane and then a dream. Calm, sundown left, sunrise right. Rubbish, but after 10min it was clean round about.

name: Acigöl Kratersee
description: 8.5km after Karapinar direction Eregli on the left site, Shell-station, is a wonderfull Kraterlake:Acigöl. Many places around the lake. good road down.

name: Altinkum Campground
description: A simple turkish campground with simple warm showers and toilettes but clean. Sand beach, in highseason very busy.

name: Ömur Camping Edirne
description: It probably used to be a good camping spot but now it’s a bit in decline. The swimming pool is empty, sanitary is the old sanitary of the swimming pool, the bar and restaurant are closed and empty. There is  a.lot of noice at night from a nearby disco, grass that needs to be cut. The whole of it leaves a bit of a sad impression. The owner is friendly and speaks German.

name: Tarcan lake
description: Nice wilcamp on the lake. There is a path that is easy to drive.

name: Asikoglu Tourist Camp
description:
Enclosed ground behind hotel.
Lots of tree’s for shade. Its in town so you wil here trafic.

name: Ulasan Hotel
description: Camperplaces just behind the hotel. It looks new but is not maintained. Its more to stay for the night and thats it. Motorway makes noise but on campsite not so much.

name: Doga Muhit Camping
description: A nice small place on the lake. Very friendly owner “Muhittin”. Charges 50lr. We are staying at the lake. The road is nearby. But at night no traffic. He has a restaurant were he is serving fish from the lake.

name: Zirve Oto
description:
Mechanic in Samsun that can handle old cars. They are currently fixing the burnt? clutch of our Skoda 120LS. They quoted 100EUR, labor and parts included which is resonable. Will post an update once we are done.

They don't speak English, but Google Translate did the trick.

Phone numbers:
05449719916
05423901423

name: Albatros Restaurant
description: A parking place behind restaurant. No more, no less

name: Below Dam
description:
Mostly hidden from the road behind bushes. Abandoned house nearby. Very quiet. Not completely dark in the night because of lights on the dam.  There are now “street” lights along dirt track, but not very bright.
Lakes and roads in this valley not up to date yet for GPS —still true for some sections of the main road even in August 2022.

name: behind hill
description: A path leads away from the main road. Follow it until it ends. There is a meadow with nice view, mostly hidden from the road. Some rubbish around...

name: Quiet camp by beautiful clear lake
description: Just off the main road you will find this very pretty lake with multiple places to park up for the night (or a few). We have put the GPS point at the camp we chose, which was very quiet and clean! The dirt road goes all around the lake so you can choose any spot. There are also 2 restaurants, which we haven't tried. Enjoy!

name: wild camp near Eskimese
description: Off the main road leads a road to the village Eskimese. After about 200 m a path goes downhill. There are some spots for camping. Nice view to red mountains. Not visible from main road and Eskimese road.

name: Water reserve
description:
Water reserve 5 km After Siran.
Great place to stay overnight.
Not seen from the road.

name: Trabzon-Akcaabat
description: Near a football playground. Close to the sea with view.

name: Picknick area?
description: There is an entrance gate to what possibly once was a picknick area, but nobody there. there are some quiet spots at the western end, also plenty of shade ... regrettably also lots of rubbish

name: Gelibolu sea front
description:
take to entrance to the Hotel Milestone for this huge parking like area. easy waling distance into town, nice view out to the Dardanelles … but also trash
reasonably quiet at night

name: Dalyan fishing harbour
description:
fairly spacious but not overly flat parking right at the harbour of this small and quite nice village; nice beach just to the SW of the parking and some nice restaurants around, pleasant atmosphere; of course one is somewhat exposed, but nobody cared
water available from taps, shower at the beach

name: delikli koy
description: Perfect spot to relax, everybody is camping. Nice beach to pitch a tent

name: Parking next to football playground
description:
At the end of Yusufeli.
Close to the kayak place.
You just hear the water, no cars around.

name: Nemrut Krateri
description:
Wonderful view.
difficult road
UP to the Krateri.

name: Ayvalik
description: South of the busy town a large open flat area, not overly romantic but still next to the see; quite exposed, locals coming and going, but reasonably quiet at night

name: Beach south of Bodrum
description: Quite good beach, easy accessible, huge area, also with some trees … but well frequented by the locals and hence noisy at times

name: Hurma Bay/Masaköy
description:
It is a bit difficult and narrow to get down to these bays and usually there are holiday homes, restaurants etc. ... but on a low profile. But it is definitely worth the while to drive along the road towards Akyaka, very scenic and in good condition … and you may find one or the other spot, e.g. before you get to Ören or in Akbük
This one is in a cul-de-sac, between two small, friendly restaurants, just a few meters from the beach, very quiet

name: Meadow near Xanthos with plenty of shade
description: Large area with big trees, hardly any noise from the road at night; beer bottles and other rubbish indicate the place might be frequented at times…

name: near Patara beach
description: The car park at Patara beach doesnt allow overnight stay ... this place is just outside, not terribly romantic but its quiet at night and bypassers don’t care

name: North of Antalya, in the woods
description: A bit further up the road from Kursunlu Waterfall, small side road into the woods, quiet

name: Station building Isparta
description: We found Isparta a very pleasant, clean and quiet town … in fact one of the best towns in Turkey! We parked a big rig right in front of the station building … nobody cared … easy walking distance into town … of course some road traffic also during the night, but bearable

name: Egirdir Lake
description: Beautiful lake and you may find some spots to park and camp … but don’t expect to be on your own, the locals know these places too, so expect some litter, but at night you are likely to be alone and left in peace

name: Karaburun Beach at Beysehir Lake
description: Managed picknick/beach area with entrance fee charged (TL21); still, there should be plenty of space, but could be very busy at weekends; good for a refreshing swim and quiet at night

name: Narli Göl
description: Very nice crater lake, should even be ok to swim … but the locals know that too (litter) … but except the odd late stayers it should be quiet at night

name: quarry off the D300
description: We picked this from another traveller … and agree: difficult to find a quiet spot in this area, but this is fine: the quarry provides for shelter of the noise from the road

name: Nemrut Mt. NP Visitor Centre
description:
The last few hundred meters to the former end of the road are closed and only used by shuttle busses. If you are lucky, they will let you pass also. Big parking lot in front of the new visitor centre is as steep as the hills around it – ask the centre manger if you can park on the flat pitch just past the gate (where they park the shuttle buses). Wonderful view from there … but the noisy shuttle buses start at 4pm … but you anyway may want to go up for the sunrise. 
Good toilets in the visitor centre

name: along a stream north of Divrigi
description:
Unfortunately, at the time of your visit the Great Mosque in Divrigi was in renovation and couldn’t be visited. The camp spot is ca. 10 km to the north along the 58-27, a short but easy dirt track down to the stream; locals may visit the place too, but it is quiet at night, also hardly any traffic on the road.
The stream is even good for a brief and refreshing swim

name: along D855 near Gürgentepe
description: It is almost impossible to find an overnight spot if you cross on the D855. This is a quite large and flat area with great views. The locals may watch but they don’t bother and the nearby road is fairly quiet at night

name: Bolaman
description: Diffidult area: Small vans may find some spots, but the whole coast is quite densely populated. This is a flat area next to the sea (but forget about swimming), the road is quiet at night … and the Jandarma on the other side didn’t care.

name: Zigana old mountain crossing
description: Nice views and possibilities for some walks, some by-passers, picknickers and cows, but they don’t care, quiet at night

name: East of Gümüshane, up a side road
description: Take the road at N40.41262 E29.602266 quite steep up (it is mainly used by trucks), pass a gate (the warden let us thru), then turn left and you find a big flat area with a great view. The kind people from the nearby sweets factory may come by (even offered some of their products); water is available from the garden tap. Very quiet at night

name: along D955
description: Very scenic drive on the D955 coming from the D957 driving north via Oltu and Göle. We stayed on a meadow a bit off the road (but only as it was freshly cut and we asked the farmers), near a pond/swamp, very scenic and the road is dead quiet at night.

name: Narman Fairy Chimney
description: The coordinates are the turn off “Peri Bacalri”; we didn’t stay here but a couple of hundred meters up the reasonable dirt track you find good and very scenic spots to stay among the ‘Narman Fairy Chimneys’

name: Odyssey Guesthouse
description: Nice placer. Hot shower, fast internet, clean rooms and toilet. Access to kitchen, drinking water. Security place for bicycles. We pay 60 trl for 2 persons, without AC and without breakfast. Very beautiful view to the city.

name: Hotel Su Vadi
description: we stayed 1 night in double for 100 liras. Hot water, normal wifi, very good breakfast and amazing view from our room on 8 floor.

name: Hikmet Shef
description: Very good restaurant, not expensive (usual price 25 tl for köfte plate), very nice, helpful and friendly crew, good Wi-Fi connection, really good service. Much better and much cozy place than big restaurants for the buses. Super tasty sweets for tea - a compliment (free). We absolutely like it, so recommend it. It was difficult to make choice, because here is a lot restaurants on the road side, so we took the right one:)

name: Terra Vista Hostel
description: Great hostel. Dorm is 35tl, private twin with en suite is 100tl. Comfortable beds. Can park bikes out the front. Very knowledgeable and friendly staff!

name: Parking on peninsula
description: Parking on peninsula. Also some turkish caravans were there. Quiet place. Strong winds during the two days we were there. Parking fee 5 TL, but probably only on Thursday when the big market is in town.  Shops and restaurants in walking distance.

name: Mall at roundabout
description: Big shopping mall situated conveniently at main road. They sell also beer and wine. Several restaurants in mall.

name: Mercedes-Benz Truck and Van service
description: We had a problem with our Mercedes truck, a bolt had smashed a hole in the pto part of the gearbox. We limped it here, and they made time immediately to fix it. Communication was with Google translate, but the mechanics were good, dealt with the problem well. Don't expect European ways of working, no ordering parts from MB, but running in to town to find parts or get stuff welded. We could join for lunch, they let us stay overnight, and labor and oil is cheap. Great service, and tea.

name: On the shore of Lake Keban
description: A leveled gravelish space big enough for many tents and some cars close to Pertek. From the ferry follow the small paved road East along the lake for about one kilometre. You will pass the spot which will be a bit lower than the road. Continue a bit further and take the little dirt road on your right to get back to the spot. Some small trees provide a bit of shadow and tent pitching works with the help of some rocks lying around, but it's not ideal. What is ideal though is the gorgeous view and the opportunity to swim in the clear lake. Fishing should be possible as well.

name: Noah’s Campsite
description: A nice established campsite just below the old Ottoman palace. You will notice it by all of the old carnival rides among the trees. Very friendly and helpful staff. 20TL per person for the night, The next morning they charged us 30 TL They also have rooms of you would prefer a cabin for the night. Restaurant with delicious food and a great view over Dogubeyazit on site.

name: Cildir Lake
description: approaching from the south, this spot is before the little forest, which is used as picknick ground. Flat area, very nice view on the lake, very quiet at night. Swimming possibly not advisable

name: derebelek restaurant
description:
they have a drinking water tap with a pipe to fill in the car. 
nice and friendly people. 
behind the hous you can drive down and camp at the lake with shade from trees

name: military checkpoint
description: checkpoint on the road. they check passport and car. they checkt the inside from the door (opend the cover and closed it aswell). fast and efficient. no problems

name: military checkpoint
description: you have to drive throu. they didnt want to see something from us.

name: Silent Place near river
description: Little open space near the big road. You will drive offroad Parallell to the bigroad on some moment you will find a openspace near some big rocks. Watch out wild pigs in the area.

name: Ackaova Water fountain
description: A water fountain which has cool and fresh spring water right on the main road.

name: Small river camp near Delice
description: A small river runs next to the town, some farmers around working but no one bothers. A good place to sleep when driving through this region. Also interesting red mountains nearby.

name: By Gölova Lake
description: A road goes around the whole lake. There is access now and pull-out‘s to park or camp. Very few ppl come/drive by. We stayed here for three nights, super quiet at night and nice starry skies.

name: Girlevik Falls
description: It‘s like an oasis in between the dry mountains. There‘s a big parking lot, we payed 1Tl/hour, also spent the night here, it‘s very quiet and safe. The owner of the restaurant is a really interesting and nice guy who also speaks perfect english.

name: Lake Timar
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Locals warn not to stay overnight due to the wild animals that can be dangerous when they enter. Exercise caution if you must camp here. 

Ver quiet spot. From the dam you can turn left or right. We went right because there were more possibilities to camp. Many fish in the lake, you can probably go for a swim too...

name: kaymakli underground city
description:
a very nice undergroundcitty in good conditions. its beautyfull and cool. 
25lira pp. parkimg 5lira.
you can also buy a musee-pass (but we dont know which one are all included)

name: Belvedere Of Bala
description:
Great belvedere over Bala and all over the region. Big and flat area such a parking. Nobody was there and there is not too Michel trash. Quiet at night.
3G available

name: Aciksaray
description: On the little parking of the site, the guardian left toilet open for us.

name: michelin tires
description:
they have all michelin tires.
but in turky are only winter or somer avaiable (all season in one)
good job, fair price

name: aygaz
description:
A propan and lpg "office" they can fill bottles, sell bottles and all the stuff.
our regulator was broken because bad gas in Iran. so they changed it and everything is working. Fast and nice service for a very fair price

name: picknick areas
description:
On this road are some spots to camp at the sea. close to the road but its very quiet at night.
We stayed 500m before this checkin..  (forgot to login the gps datas) down there is a fishermen harbour. on the right side a small gravel road. flat spot, very quiet and its clean here! there is also a potable water station for free.

name: beach
description:
Big sandy beach area. 
Amazing spot. (close to the road)
Water station with potable water

name: Derebeyi Rafting Parking
description: Rafting, zipline, tent camping, bungolow and restaurant with a very decent and natural place next to the storm river facility flow and sound to the people who want to fill the peace we came and we left happy.

name: Express laundry
description: Good Service. Charges per Kilo. Same day.

name: Sea side spot
description:
A picknick spot in the forest at the sea. Lot of shady spots, but not many flat ones.
Very nice and quiet.
Potable water at the entrance road.

name: Border Turkey - Greece & HGS motorway toll pass
description:
going out of turkey:
drive in boarder ;)
you can sit in your car and pass the passport and car control. easy and fast. 10minutes 
drive over a bridge throu some military points 

entering greece:
car desinfection
same like before. passport control in the car and car check.
very fast. 3min or less

name: kardiye beach park
description: to be clear; its a park with beach access. the guard let us sleep there. entrance fee 3TL.there are several parkingareas, some with shade. public toilets and shower for free. different restaurants, chair rental and and and. this was one of the cleanest publicbeaches in the area and not so overcrowded than all the others. its a good place for a night if you like to stay at the beach, have a swim and need a shower:)

name: Inliche public beach
description: It's a parking place close to the beach. We didn't pay entrance because we arrived in the darkness. It is written, that camping isn't allowed, but a lot of locals slept on the beach in their tents. In the evening as we arrived it wasn't overcrowded. In the morning a lot of people came. there is a small restaurant behind the car park.

name: Beach camping
description:
Great beach camping. Also an absolutely amazing road... stunning views. 

Worth to drive this road even if not camping.

name: beach
description:
Grassy flat spot at the beach. We stayed here because the other place was not possible to go with our car.
Cose to a hotel.

name: Otokar Urartu Motorlu Araclar
description:
I can highly recommend this place for Land Rover and Toyota Land Cruiser mechanic stuff or all other 4 wheels cars. 
Kenan the Chief Mechanic knows a bit of English and can organize every part you need for Land Rover etc immediately ! 
They have good prices!

Very friendly people!!

name: beach bar parking
description:
we camped on the grassy spot next to the bar. direkt at the sandy beach.
we ask, and its allowed to stay and camp here. (free)
(we dont understand why people are going to the owercrowded and expensive campsite close to here... there are so many spots direkt at the beach.)

at the bar you can have chairs, small snacks, beer and all you need. (chairs and umbrellas are for free if you order something)
very nice and friendly people

name: Dangerous road when wet - D-010 Between Sinop and Bartin
description: The Coastal road is absolutely beautiful there are amazing landscapes and nice villages, also some spots for take a swim or camp. But be absolutely careful when it's rainy. The road, often only 3-4 meter wide, becomes a slippery and dangerous surface... Mostly there isn't a rail along the road and it goes are steep up and down hill.

name: a road with almost all type of car garages
description:
fiat garage.
you can find almost every car garage at this road. service and everything you need

name: Environs d’Iznik
description:
Large flat surface between road and lake
Possibility to swim
Fairly quiet

Grande surface plane entre la route et le lac
Possibilité de nager
Assez calme

name: Lost Building, good shelter
description:
We search for a place to stay overnight and find this lost building.
Perfect shelter from the wind and next to the street.
It is „open air“ because the building is not completed. Trucks can drive in too.
It is difficult to find a place in this area. 
We liked the atmosphere here.

name: Deep in the forest, edge of Igneada NP
description: Small meadow near track. We came here via long gravel road from sivriler, track continues N to Igneada, unknown quality, bridge was washed away in 2014, we had to turn around.  If you are into birding, you will find almost all woodpecker species around here, incl. White-backed.

name: Kastro Camliköy Beach / Plaj
description:
Northern end of the long & beautiful beach has a managed campground with facilities, restaurant (?) and a small shop. To get there, follow tarmac road turnoff from main road saray-kiyiköy. 

If you turn south before you reach the beach, you can also access  the beach for wild camping. Just follow the tracks on either side of the dam downstream. High ground clearance or 4wd helps.

name: On top of Aydos Dagi
description: Highest mountain of Istanbul. You can drive all the way up, the turnoff is on Orman Cd. at a bus stop on the southern flank of the mountain. Narrow bumpy gravel track, but a normal car is ok if average ground clearance and driving skill. Once on top ridge, you can drive south (to the summit) or north for a few 100m to pick your spot. No campfire!! Fire lookout personal lives on the mountain and they would certainly get very angry at you. Best to pick a spot where they dont see you or just say hi to them beforehand if you can. Only little flat ground for tents, lots of rocks & stones, some areas with glass shards but otherwise not that much trash up here.  Great looks. The sheer size of the city just on the asian side is scary. For the birders: this is a fantastic bird migration lookout in fall.

name: Between Bandirma and Canakkale
description:
The Coordinates shows the entry to this big green area.
Everybody will find a place for his tent or his vehicle with shelter from wind.
A lot of Natural Water sources are located in this area.

It is a agriculture and reforestation but widely branched network of paths.
Drive in and find out.

name: Baris Camping
description: swimming and picnic area more than a camping. 40 TL for two people with tent. 3 TL for shower and 1 TL for bathroom. at a side of the road so quiet noisy. no shade. but useful for bike travelling.

name: kusçu picnic area
description: roof and table above the road. quiet. dirty toilets 30m away. supposed water but dry at this time of the year.

name: vodafone
description:
69 lira for 6 GB. also ATM, exchange shops, and doner in the same square

You better go for Turkcell, much better coverage

name: Environs de Dikili
description:
Beach-side
Several places catering
Quite quiet except WE
---
Bord de plage
Plusieurs endroits petite restauration 
Assez calme hors WE

name: 15-55 Golhisar-Karaculha
description:
First path on the right after the pass, Several possible places
GREAT CALM, No dogs nor Mosqitos

Premier chemin à droite après le col
Plusieurs endroits possibles
GRAND CALME Pas de chiens ni de Mosquée

name: Chimère
description:
Before parking the site (parking prohibited at night) on the side of the paved road
Very calm
Good to visit the site in the evening
--
Avant le parking du site(parking interdit la nuit) sur le côté de la route pavée 
TRÈS calme
Bien pour visiter le site en soirée

name: Beach camp
description: Empty, clean beach (little stones). There are fisherman huts and boats and the guys come in the morning and leave afternoon. There is running water and firewood available. There is Vodafone 3G

name: babadag
description: After going to the top of Babadag and watching the parasailers take off into the sunset come partially down the mountain. A short rough track leads to a small clearing with an abandoned cistern and where a shallow well has been dug out of the mountain. Some road traffic noise in the daylight hours but quiet at night. At 1200m altitude a bit cooler than the coast which is welcome in the summer. No campfires allowed due to forest fire risk.

name: Bay camping with cows
description:
Big flat grassy area (with bushes and trees) between the mountains and at the beach. The road is quite bad at certain places. Regular cars , 4x4 and motorcycles should not have a problem. Big rigs I would not advice.

Cows are using the are to graze. There is also a small fisherman living on the beach who is super friendly and can cook fresh fish if so desired.

The area is used by Turkish people for chilling and some camping but at the end of September there was nobody.

Not to much trash lying around and beach is reasonably clean. When swimming, watch out for the black needle sea creatures. Best to swim with shoes.

name: Vallée de Devrent
description:
Roadside path below the point of view
Quiet to spend the night
-
Rough entrance. Not suitable or risky for Auto caravan . Large park slot just in front
-
Chemin en bordure de route en dessous du point de vue
Calme pour passer la nuit

name: Kazancik
description:
Away from the road to Sivas coming from Cappadocia
Path in the fields absolutely calm (no vehicle, no dog, no mosque)
Panoramic view

A l’écart de la route vers Sivas venant de Cappadoce 
Chemin dans les champs absolument calme(pas un véhicule,ni chien,ni mosquée)
Vue panoramique

name: Picnic area
description:
Picnic area with restaurant and toilets
30 lira p/Night

name: Hidden place in small valley
description: If you are looking for a hidden place in this area to avoid trouble with police... This is a good place to stop on your way. Not visible from the road. Way to the place a little rough but OK without 4x4. The ground is not totally flat but it is OK. Small Trucks could fit but with big trucks it could be difficult.

name: Pine Trees Canyon Park
description: Many tracks suitable for 2wd run along the canyon. Lots of flat areas under the pine trees to park / pitch tents. Totally quiet at night. Close to Termessos.

name: Flat area on a ridge and ce Olympos
description:
Very nice place with great views over the valley (but not the sea). Difficult double-track to reach, high-clearance vehicles only. Secluded and quiet, unlike the sea coast. 
Café nearby open during high season. 
Spring water maybe available.

name: Sirin Otel
description:
Nice and clean hotel just in center of Elazig.
Good Wi-Fi, big room, breakfast, garage under hotel
130TL for two

name: Hilltop camp
description:
Hilltop camp with great views. Access is to the right of the two stone blocks at the coordinates. 4x4 or high ground clearance is only needed to pass these blocks due to track being uneven/rocky. 
No facilities, few trees give shade. Much space for tents too. Turkcell 4G

name: Toyota Tem Özel Servis
description: If you are looking for a Toyota 4WD specialist this is the place to go. Probably the best place in Turkey! Very nice staff, good mechanics and correct prices.

name: Camping at the beach
