description: At this place you can drive down to the beach if you have 4x4. The way is norrow but with our 4t van it was possible. It is a quite place but still some rubbish around.

name: beach parking ciralis
description: Flat gravel parking next to the beach. Full of Turkish locals in their campers

name: Next to Harbor
description: Disused part of Harbor overlooking Marmaris.Steep but easy access for all vehicles. Few long term campers here. Small beach. No facilities. Locals around till late but everyone friendly. Shade in the mornings. Turkcell 4G.

name: Bateman Baraji lake
description: A little further towards the lake, rough track OK for Land Rover, nice flat spot overlooking the lake.

name: Duvan Prestige
description: for about 33$ you get a nice double, amazing breakfast buffet and a rooftop bar/restaurant. paking space next to the hotel. good value.

name: Bodrum ferryboat
description:
Office of Bodrum Ferryboat. Their ferry to Kas can only take foot passengers and 4 normal height cars 2.05m.
 Very helpful staff speaking good english.

name: Turkish sea lines office and port.
description: Ferry for vehicles over 2.05m to Kos. As with Ferryboat their Web booking didn’t work so call onto the office to book. €92 for car and driver. The boat I was on only took one high vehicle at rear of ferry. Passport control and Customs very quick. The missing link to get to Greece :-)

name: Nemrut Crater Lake
description: Beautiful flat spot overlooking the lake and on the opposite side of the tea house. There is a track going left from the “mainroad” to the campspot.

name: Marmaris Ferry office and port
description: Ferry to Rhodes. Not a regular service for vehicles so you have to call and say you are interested then they schedule a date. Car and driver was €145.  I didn't take it in the end as it was delayed and I didn't want to wait. English speaking staff. Suggest calling ahead.

name: 4*4 Atolye
description: This is a really good Landrover garage run by real enthusiasts 05352276079

name: Big sand nose
description: At this big sand nose you can find several spots for camping. Even on the weekend there were almost no people here. If you have 4x4 you can drive up or down the beach to find the perfect spot for you.

name: Quiet clearing in the Forrest
description: Nice quiet hidden place 5 minutes away from highway. In 3 days no one came by. but it is a little tricky to find a plane spot. maybe for big Rigs it could be more difficult but 50 m closer to the street also big rigs will find a spot. 4g Turkcell average. no 4wd is necessary.

name: Dream Defender
description:
We support all overlanders but especially who has Defender s.

Dream Defender is a brand of Overland ANATOLIA.

name: Parking area off main road
description: Ok, this place isn't perfect but it's flat and off the road. We were desperate for somewhere and we found this place. There is water just opposite at a roadside mosque.

name: Picnic area
description:
Beautiful spot for a night or two. Very high up at 1900m so cold at night especially in late October. There are many water sources around and two toilets (1 is a pit toilet) There are also rubbish bins all over do it's quite tidy. We met some very friendly locals. 

Good 3G signal on Turkcell.

name: Spot next to lake
description: Wild spot next to a lake. Not many people except for some fisherman. You can hear the road but it is not to loud. Follow the road to the lake and you will find a nice flat space on your right side.

name: Camping next to Tuz Gölü
description: Great spot in the middle of nowhere next to the Lake Tuz Gölü. Also a fun right to get there (4x4 is required). Easiest is to go to the village Eskil. Pass through the village and you will find a road sign with Tuz Gölü on it. Follow that road all the way till you are at the lake. Please don’t try to get on the lake with your car, we did but got stuck :-). You can make a long  beautiful walk over de salt lake here. Bit windy but ok.

name: TJs Tours & Hotel
description:
New, clean, modern hotel. The owner TJ and his staff speaks perfect english. They are Gallipoli Specialists conducting, ANZAC tours, snorkelling, scuba diving, yacht cruise to ANZAC Cove plus many more trips.
Contact them via www.anzacgallipolitours.com

name: Upper area from Ishak Pasha
description:
Since the great spot overlooking Ishak Pasha is under renovation (or destruction!), we camped here and it turned out to be a nice bivouac.
No muezzin at night. We did see 2 cute foxes.
There are toilets at the mosque and a restaurant.

name: Parking area on quiet road next to water spring
description: We stopped here for a night in our campervan. It's very very quiet, hardly any traffic and there is a nice water spring to fill up containers. It is very high up so cold at night and unfortunately there is no signal on turkcell.

name: Beach area with some trees
description: Nice place with trees and a nice beach. Several fire places from locals nobody around at this time of the year but in summer maybe some locals camping here too. Visable from small road above. Access road step and rocky, check before driving down if you have no 4x4.

name: Gravelled area off the road
description: We stopped here driving north towards Oltu. The road is beautiful with stunning scenery. There are many places so along that make nice wildcamping spots. This one is about 30m off the road so quite quiet.

name: Anatolia Overland
description:
New premises for Anatolia Overland.
Use of garage, 5 ton hoist and assist with all things Overland whilst you are in Turkey.

Good place to get last minute repairs and maintenance completed before heading to Asia.

Emre can arrange spare parts particularly for Land Rovers and servicing. He has contacts throughout Turkey if you need assistance.

He is also a really nice guy. 

You can find contact details on fb

name: Opet Petrol Station
description:
We were stuck for somewhere to stay and we drive past here. There is a massive car park and it is 24hour. We asked inside and they said it was totally fine to stay. There are very clean toilets inside and WiFi 

It is a bit noisy but great for a night.

name: HavaSuPark Bungalows
description:
One of the best campgrounds have ever seen in Turkey. However its not just  campsite, it's a beautiful eco-tourist hotel which has place for campers and tents.
You can use free wi-fi, swimming pool, outdoor kitchen, very nice and clean hot shower, toilet and laundry only for:

* 55 tl for two persons and a camper
* 45 tl for two persons and a tent
* 15 tl for each additional person
* 10 tl for laundry 

The owners of the hotel are a nice couple who run the hotel and the restaurant themselves. They cook organic and delicious dishes.

name: Area next to lake with spring
description: A nice quiet place for a night next to quiet road overlooking the lake/reservoir. There is also a strong water spring here which we used to fill our tanks and give our van a bit of a clean. There is a medium strength 3g network on Turkcell.

name: Parking area next to old church.
description: Beautiful spot next to newly renovated church. The drive up is quite steep but ok for most vehicles.

name: Beautiful Spot at 2400m Pass
description:
Absolutely beautiful spot at the top of Golyurt Gecidi pass at 2400m. The scenery is simply stunning and we witnessed the most amazing sunset ever. There are no services but there is a water spring about 1km south with fresh water. 

Full 4G network on Turkcell.

name: Dermirgoze
description:
This spot is amazing. Very far from the main road along a dirt track (couple hundred meters—dead end at camp spot) that is very good and is easily accessible from a paved secondary road with a 2wd ((we did it in our Fiat Ducato). There is zero noise. 
Little to no traffic on secondary road below spot. The 2400m altitude means much cooler temperatures :)
Full 3G network on Turkcell—reasonable 4G on Vodafone

name: Very fast flowing road side spring
description: This is a very fast flowing road side spring. The water is lovely and cold and fresh. We filled up all our tanks here.

name: Beach camping
description: Also at this side of the beach camping is possible. Locals come here for fishing. In the evening the border patrol visited me, but said everything is safe. Stayed here 3 days without problem. Locals drive in the beach with 2wd but be very careful if you want to do this.

name: Old quarry on very quiet road
description:
We pulled into this road to find somewhere to sleep away from the motorway and there are many many places to sleep but this we found to be the largest and most flat space. The road is very very quiet, maybe only 2 cars an hour passed us. There aren't any services. 

Low network strength on Turkcell. Stronger outside the van. You can get medium 3G outside. Inside our van the signal was zero.

name: Nice track away from road
description:
This is a small dirt track just if the main road. There are a few places that are nice to camp for the night. Very quiet. No services. 
Good signal on Turkcell (3G)

name: Onem Pansyion
description: Very cheap hotel in the center of Sivas. Not sure, if the city is interesting but the location is exactly halfway of many hotspots in Turkey, meaning here’s good to spend a night and recharge. Rooms are comfortable, the guys doing the night shift super friendly, and they organized a parking place opposite the hotel, on s residential parking space. You can’t ask for more for 80 Lira/Night incl. breakfast.

name: Small parking off main road
description:
We stayed here for a night on the gravel parking area just off the main road. Some of the locals came and said hello and were very friendly. They said that the village was nicer but we staye here in the end. The road is very quiet. 
Full bars of 4G on Turkcell.

name: Petrol station on motorway
description: We stopped and asked if we could sleep on the parking area for one night. The staff were lovely and said yes. They even offered us tea inside the shop. Inside there are clean toilets and sinks. The parking area is huge with plenty of room for big vehicles.

name: Unused ground
description: We found this spot after having checked out the other iOverlander places and not being impressed by those. This one is truly quiet, not a car, tractor or person the entire night. No facilities at all, but also no trash, which is quite remarkable.

name: Parking at Gilindire Caves
description: We arrived late and decided to camp here and visit the caves next morning. We asked the personnel if we could camp at the parking area and they were happy for us to stay - for free. Ideal for overnight stay, has basic facilities and has fantastic view over the cliffs and is quiet at night.

name: Small area on side of road
description:
It is possible to park at the cave car park where there are toilets and water but the parking area is not flat and can be quite busy. So we drove a little distance back to this space where the view is stunning. It's on the side of a very quiet road and it is flat. 
4G on Turkcell available.

name: izmir sandvic fastfood
description: cheap and freandly owner we ate 2 burgur and 2drink for 24try but Some neighbors who met during the meal paid for the food it was amazing experience..

name: Beach near Didim
description: Nice beach almost no people here. At this time only a few fisherman come here. Not much shade only some little trees. You should be able to get here without 4x4. Road is rocky but a overland vehicle should make this.

name: Gold Hotel
description: Very central 3-Star hotel, that feels more like 4-Stars. I paid for a single room including amazing breakfast 110 Lira. Dedicated and parking spots in front of the hotel - and two kinda carports on either side of the hotel.

name: Parking area on quiet road with spring
description:
Found this place whilst driving towards Hittites. It is just 2km from the ancient site of Alacahöyük. There are BBQ places and water from a spring. It's very quiet.
Full 4G on Turkcell.

name: Car park for ruins
description: The car park is big enough for campers and large rigs. There are toilets inside the complex. There is water just outside. The ruins are well worth a visit and the museum is very interesting.

name: Beach camp
description: Nice place at remote beach. Only some fisherman or shepherds coming past. Also at the beach before (when coming from main street) are places to stay. The next beach across the hill is possible too but only with 4x4. Even during Turkish holidays you should be able to find a place somewhere here.

name: Quiet little parking
description:
Quiet little parking for a night near a quiet road. 
Perfect if you want to stay the night before visiting Aphrodisias
4G cell phone reception

name: Nice Picnic Area
description:
Nice area direct on the lake mainly used by locals. Tables and toilets available.
Paid entry, 21 TRY (official rate for "minibus" 60+, but can be bargained to regular car rate)
We stayed overnight, no problem. Can be reached with 2WD vehicles.
We were here with a big rig, no problem at all. Very quiet.
Cell phone reception is quite bad.

name: Otel Karahan
description: Probably the cheapest hotel in the city center. Great location. Comfy room and friendly staff. Can’t speak English but will help you with anything you need

name: Small parking area of quiet road
description:
Small parking area just off road to Gokyurt. It's ok for a night, very quiet. There are many water sources asking the road. 
Good 3g signal on Turkcell.

name: Hotel Ozyurt
description: Affordable hotel in the center of the city. I paid $13 for a night. Staff is friendly and room is comfortable. Price includes a small breakfast

name: Beach camp
description: Very nice remote bay. Several spots to stay here. Old farm house ruins near by. Nobody around expect of some fisherman, but I could imagine that during Turkish summer holidays some locals come here for camping. 100-200m west from the marked position the beach access is better. Gravel road to get here is in a very good condition except of a few meters before you reach the beach. Locals drive this with their 2wd cars and vans.

name: Park camping with playground
description:
Close to highway. Follow this given coordinates 300 meters to north. Stay a night in a park. Grassy and gravel area. Left and right from street. 
No facilities in off-season (November)
LTE coverage with turkcell

name: Gun Hotel
description: If you are looking for a cheap overnight on your way to Istanbul like me. This is the place for you. Breakfast included for a single room was $12. It’s a little far from the highway but the owner is super nice and speaks good English. Also there is only WiFi available in the lobby

name: Sahil Camping
description:
Campsite directly at the coast. Parked my van on a cliff above the sea, so you have perfect view in the morning. The site has also direct access to the beach. 
There’s a restaurant and all the facilities but as it is off season and heavy rain I’m the only customer and everything seems closed.

name: Dilkaya
description:
Little spot on the cliff.
A small parking area under the spot.
In a nice and quiet village, people are really nice here.
There is a beach 5mn by walk.

name: Water between GoIpragaz station and Erpen shop
description: Along the main road, there is a tap with water, easy to access.

name: Shell Station end of motorway
description:
We were driving to Cesme late in the evening and we stopped here and asked if we could stay the night. They were very nice and helpful and said yes. They even told us where to park so we would be covered by the CCTV. Toilets and water available. 
Full 4g on Turkcell.

name: ACR Motorcycles - Heidenau Tyres
description:
Official importer of Heidenau tyres (only one in Turkey). 
Very friendly and professional! 

They do also other works on your bike...

name: Quiet site near Bahçelik dam
description:
Nice spot directly on the lake,easy access via paved road near the highway. Camped here for one night with a big rig in November. 
Nobody here, that could be different in warmer times, we recognized some firepits.

name: Maltepe Karavan Parkı
description: Seaside public car parking with security. Suitable for caravan parking.

name: kas
description: Off season, park in the middle of pretty village, on harbour wall, by boats, café's, shops. Electricity hook up, water, clean public toilet 200 metres. Talk to friendly harbour master, pay him for electric, approx 10tl per day.Fuel station at the top of the village.

name: Myra théâtre  parking
description: Free parking in front of the site.Calm and secure

name: On the way from border
description: Unmarked gravel/limestone road up and up to where there is a bend, a stream and a flattish spot to park a big rig. Quiet and scenic, there was no one around. After a delayed border crossing after dark we were lucky to find this road.

name: Big car park near the water
description:
Free parking and camping in a big car park.
Lots of local caravans.
Lots of streetdogs (no problem).

Big Park for walking. The bay is a 5min walk away with nice view of the city and the skyline across.

checked in end of December. Might be closed in summertime!!!!

name: Oto Randıman
description: Ford doctor! Specialized in Ford Transit with years of experience and excellent service for a good price. I had my engine replaced in one day.

name: Overlooking the bay
description: Parking past the harbour and near the main promenade. Nice outlook and a short walk to the shops and restaurants. Not sure what it’s for but it was quiet out of season.

name: Ferry office for tickets to Cyprus.
description: Two companies which do the car ferries have their offices in this street opposite the small harbour. We paid 655tl for driver & 1pax and our 6mtr womo to go to Girne on the overnight ferry. Parked and slept here while waiting for 10pm next evening to go thru customs and immigration hoping for no delays or cancellation.

name: Karakaya
description: Beautifull and quiet Place between rocks and fields. In proximity of the little village. You only hear the Bells of the sheep, singing of the Mosque and a soft buzz in the background by the Mine.

name: Tocusu Filo Shipping ferry to Cyprus
description: ticket office is opposite the ferry. it's a small car ferry, all the locals use it. the ferry facilities are very basic. by your provisions at the supermarket just up the street. have a kebab before the voyage!

name: Exchange office
description:
Here in Tutku Doviz, you can exhange monney.

We had for 1$, 5.25TL.

name: Turkcell sim card
description:
We bought a sim card here for 150TL. One guy was speaking english.
4Gb internet and 3Gb for Facebook
500 minutes
1000 SMS

name: Free water
description: Running water from tap, directly on the castle's parking. We don't know for sure if it's drinkable water but we have seen local people filling their water tank here.

name: Akçabük Camping
description: İts a nice camping by the beach, lot of shade, great owner. They will renovate camping for 2019. Small cafe in the camping. Paid 40 TL in October -18 for a tent (2 pp) About 1 km from town center.

name: Free water
description: Near from the main road, there is this water running through the mountain. A small dam has been build and you can fill bottles directly from the tube. Very good flow even in january !

name: Ziyade...amazing !
description:
If you are going to visit Hasankeyf, you truly should stop to this incredible restaurant. The food is absolutely fantastic 😍 We have never seen a buffet like this... everything looks delicious. The atmosphere is very relaxing and seats very confortable. Moreover people are taking very good care of you.
Highly recommended !!!

name: Troglodyte houses of Hasankeyf
description:
Free parking where you can park to visit troglodyte houses with the very nice local guide Mazlum.

Feel free to contact him on his WhatsApp number : +90 543 238 81 92
He will bring you to places you wouldn't do by yourself.
We spent more than one hour, have visited one troglodyte house (1TL per person) and had a very good walk threw caves and canyon with at the end a fantastic view on a very old village.
You will love it !!!
At the end, he didn't ask for any specific price, we just gave him what we wanted 😉

To spend more time with him, he brung us to Ziyade restaurant in Batman city...such a good choice !

name: Quiet spot
description: It's not heaven, but at least it was very quiet during the night and very easy to go when it's rainy. OsmAnd was showing a green area...but it's not.

name: Elis Turkish Bath
description:
If you need to relax, this is the place to be. In the classic package you have :
- face mask
- 15' sauna
- typical massage from Turkey front and back (with foam) which was very interesting.
- illimited time in jaccuzi
We took an extra classic massage (30 minutes full body) highly recommended !!!
At the end we were so relaxed.
Men and women are separated.

name: Restaurant in a cave
description: Very good traditional food in very nice cave atmosphere. All is in Turkish way, naked foot and tables on the floor. Good choice of wine, and they even have their own one.

name: Switchback Camp
description: Flat area off the main highway. Take small unmarked gravel road opposite the large pull out, not the marked forest road. Turn right about 50 metres up. Quiet, no one can see you. A bit steep and a tight turn. We did it in our 2WD VW. I would walk it first as rain can affect the road conditions. Bit of garbage around but not bad.  Super quiet night. Access road is in photo. Room for a few vehicles.

name: Short cross
description:
For 15TL you can cross the river here until 7.00pm (Winter time)
We are 3.5T, less than 6m length and 3.1m height so that was a little adventure to take this tiny little ferry but apparently they can carry much more...perfect to avoid the detour to go to Sultaniye.

name: Ferry
description: It's 65TL with a camper-van to cross from here to Kilitbahir.

name: Without traffic road
description: After the ferry from Canakkale, we found this road without traffic just before the darkness. We spent a very quiet night just at the edge of the forest. Not perfection, but good enough for one night if it's getting too late.

name: Iran Consulate Trabzon
description: Extremly friendly consul! We phoned beforehand to check if RN was there; didnt need to bring anything else but passport und cash (we could pay on the spot, didnt have to go to the bank); we paid the 'express' fee and were all done in 45mins

name: Tasucu
description: Car park by harbour promenade. Clean toilet, electric hook up if you ask the attendant, hose pipe to fill water tank. Shops and supermarket 50 metres. Quiet and safe. Filo ferry office and Cyprus ferry within 80 metres.

name: Behind Ölüdeniz off-season place
description: We came in off-season (February) and checked out the Ölüdeniz parking. Staying there for night is not allowed and also during day it’s expensive. We looked for another place and a security guy recommended us to stay here. It’s a parking at the end of the street for boatsmen and the entrance to the last hotel. Quiet at night and beginning of hiking trails. The bay is beautiful. I guess when the hotel opens you can’t stay here any more.

name: Izmir truck park.
description: Truck park. Flat ground, opposite container shipping terminal. 25TL per night. Gate is supervised. Truck movements day & night. Quiet at night, easy wall to down town shops and city life.

name: Ruins of Antiochia ad Cragum
description: There is a crappy road from about 5km going to that ruins (2wd no problem). Its a beautiful view around, and a flat parking space, where i stayed over night. but no facilities and no phone signal (except on top of the castle)

name: Ephesus Historic site car park
description:
Entry payment of 25tl for motor home and the official car park attendant said we can stay overnight (2019). In 2022 overnight is no possible as stated by park attendant.

 They also give you a spiel about a lift to the top entrance for free if you agree to be shown a very large carpet showroom! An excellent little half hour side tour but feeling of obligation to buy? Otherwise walk up the slope thru the ruins after paying 60tl pp. Immense and impressive ruins not only for history buffs.

name: Small beach near D010
description: Small beach at the end of a side road from Karaman village, in a sheltered bay. A river flows into the sea at the beach, but there is a major construction site just inland so we used our own drinking water. There are a couple of houses on the beach but not all were occupied when we were there. Some toilet facilities were seen but they were not maintained, possibly because it is winter. We heard a tractor driving around on the beach in the evening, but were otherwise undisturbed.

name: Small beach near D010
description: Small beach at the end of a side road from the D010 near Cayyaka village. There was construction going on on the side road, but the beach itself was undisturbed. Scenic location with rock outcrops on both sides of the beach. We met a handful of local tourists when we arrived, but they drove off soon after and the beach was quiet for the rest of the night. There is a restaurant building on the beach but it was closed - we guess it will be open in summer.

name: Beach near D010
description: Beach just off the D010 after Bahceli village. The beach was secluded when we were there, but the streetlights were on. There were small shop/restaurant houses and toilet facilities seen but everything was closed for the winter. We guess they will be open in summer and the beach might be busier.

name: forested beach
description: This area has many camping spots. It was wet when I was there with big puddles, 4x4 recommended although I saw normal cars driving over the beach. NB: in September the place had the smell of rotted stuff, very annoying and felt more at night when the wind calms. Better look for a place further west.

name: mobile Sim
description:
turkcell and vodafone shops for turkish mobile sim 
turkcell around 120 TL incl 3GB
Vodafone 95 TL incl 6 GB

name: Cilingoz
description: Right next to a small lake. You can also fish.

name: Beach picnic area
description:
Picnic area right at the beach. 30tl for camping in car. Multiple car bays. Trees probably a bit low for high vehicles—maybe ok for sprinter.
There is rubbish as usual and the beach is sand with stones but nice for a day. 
Get drinking water 300m away on road to Istanbul. Hand pump on site. Friendly guy. The entryway (no sign on road)is before it goes uphill. If your conning from the top you will see the spot already. 
Turkcell LTE, vodafone 4G

name: Iraq / Turkey Border
description:
Went from Iraq to Turkey with a car. 
As the Iraq entry border didn’t give us the right paperwork for entering it took a bit of running around to get the approval to leave. We asked someone for help and he helped us all the way. Everybody was friendly and they just needed to get the formalities right. 
Also Iraq wanted 10USD for leaving. Maybe because we didn’t have the right papers? 

Turkey was also long as they check paperwork on multiple station again and again. They also check the car more than once. We also got selected to get the car x-rayed which included a 1 hour wait to get a turn. Then they will ask you for your green card insurance on a few stations. 
After all they didn’t really question too much why we went through north Iraq (never ever call it Kurdistan on the Turkish side). We just said it’s not as cold as the mountain area at  the Iran/Turkey border and that wes good enough. 
Jerrycans are not allowed but our 20L was half full and the guy said it’s ok. But be carful   We also had some extra jerrycans in the car but they didn’t find them even with X-ray. I guess they are looking for cigarettes, drugs and humans. 
Overall about 4.5 h to cross this border.

name: KAYA Camping
description: It’s possible to give the empty bottle to the reception and get it back filled next morning. We got this service on 24.03.2019

name: Saucisse river spot
description: Spot between river and dirt road. Very quiet in March. Not a single car passed there. Maybe a little bit more busy during harvesting.

name: Restaurant with big parking
description:
Restaurant with very friendly owner. Very clean. Delicious food. 
Big parking place for stay over night . Fuel station also behind .

name: Mountain camp
description: Nice little spot in the mountains with view over Izmir. Big enough for 2 Tents or one Car. 2wd should be fine. Hidden from the street, very little traffic at night. Quite clean, but seems like locals sometimes come here to make a campfire.

name: Parking area
description:
Sport complex parking area , with city lights.
Comfortable for night stay in rv.

name: Eden
description:
When I think overlanding, I think of places like this. Beautiful nature in the mountains, with a small fresh water stream. (I used a sawyer filter just to be sure for drinking.)

The way leads through a small village with some narrow streets, can be tricky with big rigs but doable. 

There are many places to camp with or without 4x4. Open places and many places under big olive trees with shade. Down by the stream even more beautiful but only with a tent accessible.

It is also a good place to start your hike into the mountains. 

Only downside is that you won’t have the place for yourself as locals camp here too and have family picnics in the weekends. However there is enough space for many people.

name: fairy meadow
description: nice grassy place between small trees, hidden from the street. you can hear the traffic quite good.

name: Güleryüz Hotel
description:
near to old town and with private and secure parking in garage
double room for 145 TL

name: River spot
description: Quiet spot next to the river. Very few cars on the road. Some fireplaces around already.

name: Parking lot for big rigs
description: Free open parking lot near shopping , restaurant and zeraat bank .

name: old quarry
description: Something different from all the good beachside wildcamps along the coast. Deep quarry and cave in which you can walk.. Good walks uphill too. Flat stone camping ground, just a short uphill drive, should be OK with any vehicle. No shade. You may smell the burning of garbage from a km uphill if the wind is wrong. Falcon nesting in the cliff wall. I absolutely loved the place.

name: D775 Between Cebeci and Akkaya
description: Magnificent camp, panoramic view, quiet, 3G

name: Wild Camp outside Manavgat
description: We are cycle tourers. There is a pull off to a large meadow here where there are many old fire rings and I imagine it would be a good place to camp in your vehicle. We continued on the dirt road to the back where you cross a dry riverbed. After crossing take the left and we pitched our tent in a very nice little meadow there on a creek. We even stayed here two nights to wait out rain and never saw anybody.

name: remote rocky beach
description:
lovely access to the sea (rocky). toilet (dirty but here) and water tape. pit fire. some olivier for shadow in summer.
used by camper as campsite in the middle of the foot treck. So, unless the be here in the middle of winter, don't expect to be alone. But the place is pretty nice and the view is good.
The road from Kas is also very nice (nice viewpoints).

To be confirmed but probably much more crowded in the touristic season (you should arrive before 5pm if you want a flat place under the tree).

low LTE signal for phone.

name: cafe pi handmade
description:
a very nice place handmade shop on the ground and café on the roof top.
Resat, the owner is very nice and you will enjoy the place and coffee

name: turtle beach
description:
quiet place away from touristic places and resorts. big grassy/sandy area very close to the beach. simple toilet and some places for picnic (probably families comes here during weekends and holidays, but it's quite clean). Almost nobody in week days at this moment.
Be careful to avoid camping on the beach because it's protected area for turtle breeding (beach forbidden the night from 8pm to 8am).  
 Local name for the beach is Karaot. There is a wild life reserve around the lake at the far end of the beach. I saw no signs warning about turtles, and since it’s a stone beach I’m not sure they’d like it. Perhaps the next reviewer on here can double check. It’s a beautiful location with shaded trees back from the beach providing good spots for tents and vans. Water is available via a well with a manual pump. About 10 other campers were here, and a friend stayed here for a couple of months. Well recommended. The police patrol occasionally but do not move anyone on.

name: Camping spot on dead end rural road
description:
Several possibilities to stay for a night on the sides of a dead end rural road. At the end of the road there is a gate to something like a stone pit.
No 4x4 needed, but the road is quite bumpy. We stayed for one night, in the evening a friendly worker passed by car. You can slightly hear the road, but at night the is no traffic. Little bit of sea view.

name: Kille Bay
description: A paradise valley and a pebble beach. Plenty of flat spots, some fig and olive trees providing shadow. The usual fireplaces and rubbish here and there, but there is a container, so it's not to bad. Probably busy in season

name: Optima outlets
description: We pulled in for a rest before heading into the city and just ended up staying the night in the gravel bit of their parking lot, no one seemed to mind. Fairly quiet on a Friday night. Starbucks, 3 playgrounds, a bowling alley and a massive soft play in the outlets. Additionally there’s a supermarket across the street.

name: Wild camp with view
description: Up in the hills, nice view, some traffic, but otherwise calm, controlled by policeman all in order

name: Royal residence hotel
description: We decided to give ourselves a weekend to do laundry and relax in Ankara and stayed here. We booked via Airbnb at 40 euros a night, they’re lovely apartments with kitchens and Separate bedrooms, ample parking in the front for vans and we parked our mini bus on the road directly in front of the 24 hour concierge. It’s a nice part of town with a great pan Asian place on the corner and a killer kebab place (with coals not lights) across from that. Although if you’re a light sleeper the call to prayer is very close but what overlander is a light sleeper?! The manager of the hotel bent over backwards to accommodate us and our son and dog! Less than 15 minutes on the bus to the center

name: Mountain alp near Kabak
description: Plenty of flat space for your car of tent. It's along the Lycian Way hiking trail, so you'll see hikers passing by during the day, further very pristine. No rubbish

name: Road leading to Grand Altunas Hotel
description: It was stormy and we needed somewhere to stop for the night but didn’t want to drive into the town, this was the perfect solution. There’s a big hotel on a hill just outside the town with a wide road leading to it. We parked along it and passed a quiet night.

name: yildirim otel
description: Hotel just next to a big car park. The cousin Zeki of the owner Nimet helped me out in a restaurant. They are very friendly, big family. Like to have international  guests. You can contact Zeki, he speaks english very well, Instagram zekiaslanx

name: a quiet place to sleep in the car by the river
description: When you take the side road to a village from the main road and take the path to the river side, it's pretty nice to sleep in the area. it's quiet,  but muddy in the rain season. A humble advice is to avoid potential rocks that may fall on you.

name: Camp in the pine wood
description:
A nice spot in the pine woods 
Great view over the Valley. It’s a very clean place. Nice place to pitch a tent. There is much flat ground 
No traffic at night, only some friendly farmers at daylight. 
Dirt track from the main road is no problem for motorbikes and lightweight cars. Not sure about big rig.

name: Pamukkale wild Camping
description:
right next to pamukkale!
The way up from the parking lot (at the ATM).  There is plenty of room to pitch your tent here, but the ground is rocky.  a gravel road leads up the hill (not overlooked).  In the rain, this could be difficult to drive, otherwise no problem.  Surprisingly very little garbage.  No traffic day and night. Very nice view of the valley, and view of pamukkale.

name: Panorama view near Söcün
description: Almost flat gravel parking. Mostly invisible from the Street. Nice view over river and Mountains.

name: Money exchange - Yuksel jewelry
description: You can exchange money at the Yuksel jewelry with a good rate. Euro or Dollars to Lira.

name: Ancient city of Kyaneai
description: In the middle of the remains of an ancient Lycian town in the mountains. View on the Greek style open air theatre. Lots of interesting things to discover like dwellings carved out in the rocks, thomsb and old city walls.

name: Picnic area
description:
Good to stop 1night. Flat parking with trees above the graveyard...but a little bit noisy because along the road. Very beautiful view!
4,5G ok.

name: Panoramic spot on the flank
description: You will need to drive steeply from the bigger dirt road. After 50 meters the steep road ends in a flat grassy terrain. Nice spot and wonderful view.

name: Hopa Belediyesi Plaji
description: Accommodation next to a beach. Camping and restaurant. Basic facilities. Nice owner. We were here in April and were the only customers. Might be more busy in hot summers :)

name: Currency exchange
description: good place for change money, friendly, you Can drink a thé !

name: camping by the river
description:
Beautiful little campspot right next to the river with a waterpoint. Bit of shade, good cell reception. Only downside is that it's close to the road, so some road noise, but you're not visible. Low altitude, so warmer that high in the mountains. 

this place van be visited by Land Rover, VW-Bus, not much bigger!

name: günpinar waterfall
description: Günpinar waterfall, good spot, picnic area, not easy for Park, stop in the village for Big rigs in farmer-camp walk 1,5km for waterfall

name: Roadside Kas
description: We parked along the road leading to the campsite directly across from the amphitheater ruins. There’s a flat plateau where the road widens a bit. There were a few campers parked right at the entrance to the campsite as well.  The road is fairly quiet. There are a few stone beaches further along the road and it’s just a few minutes walk into the very cute town of Kas. I don’t suggest the ferry to Meis unless you’re doing a visa run.

name: parking and water
description: large parking area. noisy as near road. has an area full of taps?? nice promenade and nice looking restaurant

name: Camp near green canyon
description: Nice advertisement in the salvage, near manavga and green canyon. large meadow without stones. much place and no garbage. about gravel street to reach. all vehicles are possible. In the  evening some traffic, at night nobody. no good internet connection

name: Josito campsite
description: A wonderful place to stay in a tent bungalow or van. Surrounded by impressive limestone mountains. free entry into the site so it's also possible to camp for free outside and still use the facilities.

name: Kromna cafe restaurant hotel
description: A very nice place, we ate a lovely meal of kofte and istavrit (a local fish). The beach is beautiful, surrounded by mountains, and the place very tranquil. The owner of this place is lovely and very friendly. Speaks English and Dutch too. Wifi too. There is plenty of space to park in front of the beach.

name: Lonely place next to the lake
description: From Antalya-Isparta-Yolu (coming from Antalya direction), before you reach Elsazi, take the mud road to the right, it will lead you to a beautiful, totally lonely place next to the lake with a view on the mountains. Take care if it starts to rain, because the mud road is sometimes not very wide and goes up and down all the time. The night we spent there it was raining lightly and we needed some prayers to get back to the main road. Might be no problem with 4x4, we have rear drive 😁)

name: Parc near city
description:
Parc on a hill near Antalya with view on the city.
Not the best spot : really dirty and noisy at night (near the road). But ok to stay on night especially if you have to go in the mechanics district of Antalya (at 7km).

name: Camp between hills
description:
Place between two hills with view on valley. Small dirt road leads there. Place seems the locals known to be, there is some garbage. very much bad internet connection with türk telekom. Camp possible, but slightly stony.  absolute quiet! No traffic, because of no street :)
There is only one dirt road to the camp. Please have a look in google maps

name: Beach & bird sanctuary
description: Many wildcamping opportunities here. Take the road from Yorukler and then take a right close to this point. Accessible with 2wd but to continue along the beach road probably 4x4 recommended. Bird sanctuary is inaccessible to camp.

name: Parking in Patara town
description: There is no way to park in the beach parking or ruins parking anymore there is a gate you must go through to get into the national park and the hours are 8am to 7pm everyone is made to leave outside those hours. There is a free parking lot in the little town next to a playground. We parked here each night and drove in each morning to the beach. The Turks aren’t early risers it would seem and no one was ever at the beach before 10 am.  Patara is one of the only sand beaches in Turkey so if you hate pebble beaches (I do!) it’s worth the stop. 30 liras for 5days of entry to the park.

name: Mountain Paradise
description: Absolutely gorgeous spot on the ridge of a hill looking out over water and surrounding mountains, just off the main road. There are plenty of spots to pitch a tent or park a campervan. If you follow the main road further it leads you to a beautiful lake with many potential spots to stop for the night. There are a few houses on the road but plenty of space available where you won't bother anyone. This is the best spot we found in Turkey so far, highly recommend!

name: lake, Frogs and fishermen
description: big lake with tons of parking around it. two access tracks from the main highway. some ways to the water better for big rigs than others but we made it here in 10t truck no problem. loads and loads of fishermen but they were more interested in fishing than us. Also has the noisiest frog population you may ever hear!

name: Cerkes stade
description:
next to the stadium a near unoccupied small town with many shops home nice
---
a côté du stade un près inoccupé petit bourg avec de nombreux commerces accueil sympa

name: entre route et mer
description:
nothing else found between the coastal road is the sea Rakani restaurant opposite and small fishing port
--
rien trouvé d'autres entre la route côtière est la mer Rakani restaurant en face et petit port de pêche

name: Military border CLOSED
description:
When going from Erzurum to Batumi, google maps can lead you through this place. However this border is a military base and CAN NOT BE CROSSED BY CIVILIANS. 

You have to go to the Scarpi border at the black sea.

name: Novada outlets
description: Navoda outlets, right on the motorway, large parking lot. Migros 5m, which is the biggest supermarket we’ve seen in Turkey. Soft play area and Starbucks. We parked on the side of it rather than in the parking lot as there was more space but we noticed pictures of caravan painted on the back of the parking lot so perhaps there’s electric?

name: Beach parking
description: Parking about 200 meters from the beach. GORGEOUS beach. White sand clear waters. Shallow though so it’s a windsurfing place.  Near Alaçatı, there are loads of mini buses. It’s a big dirt lot with shade but you’d have to be small to get under the shade.  Some trees as well. We paid 20 lira for the night, could be negotiable. Toilets and showers available. I imagine it’s rammed in the summer on weekends with people from Izmir. It’s not the nicest places but the location is fab.

name: View Point Camping
description: Plateau with a wide view over the landscape to the snow covered mountains and face to face with the white limestone formations of Hierapolis. Maybe somewhat noisy because adjacent to the street and the "touristic hot spot" Pamukkale.

name: Truck Garage
description: Truck garage specialized to MAN. High-level service. They completed our to-do list immediately on "drive-in basis".

name: Park at Lake
description:
Big area at a lake for Picknick. Water, tables available. 
For entry is a fee for the car or truck. We paid 54 lira. This is a DAY USE spot ONLY

name: ShantiHome
description:
Super nice and cheap hostel with amazing free breakfast: 50 Turkish Lira.

There is a carpark round the corner. I pay 30TL to store my motorbike overnight. Not sure it was actually locked up at night. I didn't see any gates that could close.

name: Ergani Virgin Mary ruins - parking with beautiful views
description:
Brand new parking and amenities (toilets, picnic tables, prayer room(!)) at the top of Mount Zulkuf accessible with very good new cobblestone road. Follow google and not maps.me.

The views are amazing and is is very quiet at night. Locals come to see the view during the day.

name: Wild camping with lake view
description: At the roadside (nearly no traffic) slightly above the lake, wide view. There might be some places on the lakefront (we saw a few tracks) but be aware of the "soft soil" and mud.

name: Good fish restaurant in lovely area
description:
Restaurant and hotel situated on a powerful small river in a very nice valley. 

Food (fish!) was good :)

name: peaceful valley
description: A quiet valley away from the noise of the road, the sound of running water and birds. we used the junction to park the truck and camped on the flatish grass near by. The track actually goes down to a nice field so possible to camp there too.

name: Quiet place by the sea (4x4 only)
description: Nice quiet place by the sea. Go to the edge of the beach, then cross the last part of it (fine sand) an on the right side you’ll see a track uphill. Follow the path for about 100m, it changes to pebbles and then dirt. At the end there’s a place approx 20x8m. Swimming is possible on the beach you crossed.

name: Divrigi
description: Flat car park above village and under the mosque/hospital next ton a tomb. Market on wednesday. Hamam 17th.

name: car park next to public leisure/piknik park
description: Flat car park. Café on the Park. Along road and Van lake North coast. Quiet road not too close.

name: Forest and sea bushcamp
description:
Quiet and nice wild camp with shadow and beautiful view on the sea.

Access to the sea.

Other flat spots around to pitch tents.

Water tap on the road 500m before the camp. Little market and outside beach showers in Karaoz.

Ok for 2wd car but can be difficult with big rigs because of the trees!

Turkcell 4.5G ok.

name: Van kalesi
description: car park of the Van Kalesi entrance. water available.

name: Parking lot next to the graveyard
description:
Official parking lot next to the graveyard. You can stop with your car. No parking fees.
Very close is running Water available. There are also public toilets at the parking lot (which where closed during our stay).
The ottoman quarter (Oldunpari) with Lots of restaurants, cafes and shops is in walking distance.

name: Middle of Nowhere
description: lovely grassy flat terraces. Tents or 4x4 only.

name: Picnic-area next to a lake
description:
It looks like a defunct picnic area with all sorts of facilities, but closed (maybe just for the season).
There is security and they did not mind us camping on the parking-lot.
Nice and quiet.
No facilities (that work) but turkcell has good coverage.

name: Acceptable spot next to the road
description: Since this area is full with farm land and very flat and windy, it is difficult to find a camping spot. This one works out if it becomes late, it’s between two turn with some flat grass areas for tents. Also it’s a rare place that’s surrounded by hills, which keeps most of the wind away.

name: Atilla’s getaway
description:
Small hotel with lovely remodeled rooms @ 15€ pp/pn incl. Breakfast.
Tents allowed @ 8€ pp/pn incl. Breakfast.
Space for a few overland vehicles @ 25tl pp/pn.
Beautiful swimming pool and seating area. A small Oasis ! Relaxed atmosphere.
Toilets and hot showers (run the tap for a few minutes - solar energy)
Laundry service @ 20tl per bag which is provided by the hotel.
It is run by 2 Turkish brothers which speak English & Turkish fluently!
Well worth trying !!! 
Just a few kilometers from Selcuk city center.

name: Gölge Camp
description:
Very nice campsite for tents and vans. Quite flat if you pitch the tent on grassy-sandy ground about 5 meters away from the beach (clean, sand).
The owner is super friendly, brought us çay in the mornings.
There's a restaurant and you can buy some drinks.
Basic Asian toilets get cleaned several times a day, sink to wash dishes, fridge, wifi, electricity, shower (solar, so depends on sun for warm/hot).

Just next to the "wildcamping" spot in iOverlander there are 3 campsites along the beach, I think it is good to support the local community so I chose this camp site.

name: Camp next to the water
description: This may have been a campsite at some point. The owner let us stay here under the trees next to the water. Great setting and very nice owner. Come prepared and self sufficient and it will be a good spot.

name: Etur hotel
description:
Good service and good practice 
Very recommend

name: Quiet Bush Camp not far from the road
description:
En route to the other iOverlander point, we decided to turn right from the road onto a small dirt road. 100m after we found a flat space and obviously people come here to camp as you can see remaining fire rings.

We camped there, did a fire and had a very quiet night surrounded by small trees.

name: Nice green wildcamping spot
description: On the way to do the famous D915 I used this place as a camp to get on the road in the morning. It’s a nice view, almost no traffic, just a local farmer and a small river along.

name: Moto Garaj iLHAN ÖKSÜZ
description: He repairs big and small motorbikes. Already had a lot of adventure bikes from all around the World in his Garage. For me He welded my bike.

name: Köprülü Kanyon
description:
Amazing camping spot at Köprülü river. We camped at the river. Very clean water, possible to swim. No garbage around around. Dirtroad goes steep downhill to reach the valley. 
Spectaculair views
campspot is at the road but nobody around. We didn't see anyone during the whole time we camped here.

name: kommagene hotel /camping /tour guide
description:
Basic hotel with a garden /parking lot.
Showers and toilet available.
Everything is negotiable, we had a room for 2 adults and 2 small kids including breakfast for 80 lira.
Best price for a room is by airbnb

The garden is next to pretty big road, some road noise of you sleep in a tent.

Contact : 0416 725 97 26

name: laundry Kas
description: 30lira around 9kg. Washed, dried and folded!! Very good job!!!!!

name: Kumbaz pension
description:
Nice, small family run clean pension. 
Very big rooms including private bathroom which is a little small. Big double bed, room has a balcony as well. We came here out of the season price 100tl (currently approx 15 euro). It's very close to the lake where you can find a lot of restaurants.

name: Turkcell
description:
SIM card 9 GB + SMS + call : 96 lira 
friendly staff, very helpful, English is « okish ».
You find all the mobile operator in the surrounding if you walk a bit.

name: Entrance to the Kashkar National Park
description: Entrance fee to the national park. Paid 11 lira for a campervan.

name: Water tap
description: Next to the road. Very fast water filling. Locals fill also their bottles here

name: Fiat Garage
description:
You can get your car, camper or truck serviced here. 
The owner of the garage Mr. Akmehmet speaks very good English. He is very friendly and even took us in a good place for lunch. 
We got our campervan serviced (oil, filter, general check) for 1331 lira.

name: Wild camping next to a reservoir
description:
One of the quietest night since in Turkey. No dogs, mosque barely heard and no people coming late in the evening or at night. We were the only one. 
There is a restaurant right next to the road with a playground and parking. Did not go there. Follow the dirt roads that lead to the reservoir. Lots of place available.

No need for 4x4. No problem for low clearance campervans but don’t know how it is when it gets wet.

May be busy in summer and on week-end

Only negative point : rubbish layed on the floor.

name: Flat ground close to Zelve open air museum
description:
A quiet night just next to the asphalted parking lot of the Zelve open air museum. 
We asked the staff at the ticket office if we would stay overnight. Was not a problem.
Around 9:30 pm, police (jendarma) came and asked if we were tourist. Everything was fine and we had a very quiet night in this wonderful landscape. There is a water tap opposite to the small shops. According to locals, it is no potable water.

A perfect place if you want to get early and late to the museum

name: Parking next to restaurant and playground
description:
Quiet night at this parking lot next to a restaurant and a playground. Beach is also nearby.
The restaurant was closed on week day. 
May be crowded during the weekend. 

We filled the water tank with a pipe laid on the grass.

name: Flat gravel ground with playground
description:
Huge flat gravel ground with view on the bay. There is a playground for kids. Small shops and cafes are nearby. The marina is not far as well.

Very quiet place, no one came late in the night. 
Good location.

name: Flat ground next to the sea
description:
Quiet place next to the sea. Not far from the Cesme harbor. Big flat ground.

Convenient if you look for a nice and quiet place before taking or after having taken the ferry to Chios Island. 
No dogs barking, no loud music and no loud muezzin.

NB: we stayed one night on the parking next to the ferry departure. Loud music from the harbor and trucks operating the whole night for the cargo ships.

name: On the alp
description: Beautiful setting in absulutly quiet area . About 4km from the main road. Some farmhouses in the area. Good for a overnight stay. The view to all the mountainhills around is fantastic.

name: Yumurtalık Beach
description: Right at the Beach of this little city. Shadow from the trees and for 1 TL you can use the toilet (free at night). Locals told us it is fine to camp here for one or two days but ask the people from the beach restaurant anyway just to be sure ;-) We were here in off-season so maybe it is different in high season/summertime. Busy around sunset with pedestrians and quiet by night. All in all a good safe place.

name: Van Lake at the coast
description: Nice Place with a wooden Boardwalk and ladders directly to the lakewater. Good for swimming. Sadly a lot of trash on the floor. Aside from the trash its nice and quiet. No one else was there. Little shadow from the trees.

name: In the middle of nowhere with mountain view
description: This place has a stunning panoramic view. Close to Armenian border. Farmers said its ok to camp here. Silent and alone. Close to a river(5 min walking). Gravel Road is ok.

name: Türkday Oto
description: Friendly mechanic and a 'Toyota maestro' (a quote from his neighbor) who cleaned my air filter, changed my oil, oil and fuel filter for 360TL. He even invited me to dinner with him that evening, overall a great experience. No English spoken but one of the guys there spoke a little German which did the trick.

name: Meadow near Kemaliye, dark canyon
description: After the dark canyon (from Kemaliye) follow the road about 2 kilometer, then turn right into a small gravel path for another kilometer until you see the river Euphrat again. 4x4 necessary, motorcycle good, but difficult for beginners.

name: the mud place
description: swimming pool with sulphurous clay and camping. 40lira/van night/2pers/thermal baths. outside and cold showers. Great place.

name: Green area beside river
description: Small green area near river, quiet and nice. Good for one night camping.

name: gunesler mercedes
description: We came here to fix some small issues before heading back in to Europa. Window whipers, broken mirror.. Got a great service here but there are also a lot of different mechanical shops in the area. For some bigger welding stuff they said it was cheaper in Ankara.

name: open during Ramadan
description: The restaurant is open for lunch during Ramadan that is amazing. Good view over the lake. Can pay by credit card.

name: Ephesus back-entrance parking
description:
At the (much smaller and quieter) back-entrance of Ephesus. At the edge of the parking (on the right when you enter).
25 or 30 TRY for camper.
Toilets for 3 TRY

Gates open at 08:00, to beat the crowds.
There are toilets and Turkcell has 4G.
There are also dozens of stalls on the road that sell stuff, including drinks and snacks.

name: Camping / pension Istanbul
description:
Official camping in the old center! 
We camped with our car and rooftop tent, but not many places , problem for big rigs. Friendly owner , hot shower , toilet.
We payed 60 Lira for Night

name: Tüz golü, Salt lake.
description: We came here begin of June, on this side of the lake you can ride on the salt this time of the year. Very easy access for cars and motorcycles, we are on a motorcycle and had a lot of photo/video fun on the lake. There is also a all year round road what you can take to cross the lake. Plenty of wildcamp spots around but can be windy, on the Eastern side of the lake the is water and in the morning it's completely pink, very beautiful to see.

name: Agora hostel
description: Hostel with dorm and private rooms. A roof top terrace to chill where also the breakfast buffet (included) is served. Really friendly and helpfull owners. Closed to Saint Sophia walking but in a calm street. Dorm with huge and strong lockers. 15€/p/n. Bed is done every day. A small corridor can be used as parking for 2 or 3 motorcycles with gate closed. Reception 24/24! Credit card accepted. It’s clean, and well located

name: Karaburun Lighthouse
description: When you enter the campsite from the dead-end street, Şansal Street, it stays below the ramp. There is a lighthouse on the right and under it, there are also spots where you can camp in several places. It is a peaceful camping area under the light of a lighthouse where nobody will disturb you at night. It is unofficial, the camp was laid on the advice of local people during the bike tour.

name: Lovers Hill / Aşıklar Tepesi
description: Discovered on the advice of local people. There are 1-2 camping areas. Usually a sloping region. The cliff down the campsite. On your left is the municipal beach. Be sure to wear your tent stakes!

name: Ulasan hotel
description: Hotel on the road to Goreme. 20€. As a big hotel for the price of small.

name: wild camping behind a hill
description:
wild camping behind a hill. leave the road and follow the dirt road nearby. nice view over the hills. 4x4 recommended, way up is a washed out dirtroad with some
 bigger stones. tuekcell 3G

name: Unal camp
description: On the way to Istanbul perfect stopover. Very friendly crew. It is more small holiday cabins place than camping. But we could stay on the parking. Lot of trees/ shade options. Entrance to the beach. Directly next to the high way. Toilets and shower basic. During the weekend we stayed lot of families. They shared nice food and good vibes with us. The price was 60 TL

name: Neverland camping
description:
Nice, family run, campsite. long sandy road down to get there, so no big rigs. 

We stayed one night. 55 TL per person including breakfast and power. Defender 110 with rooftop-tent.

Amenities are clean, private sand beach which is also clean. For people with tents, there are refrigerators and there is a cooking and barbecue area. Also a small bar with simple food and cold drinks.
.
Possibility to rent a tent at the camping.

name: Between the trees
description: Nice grassy fields between trees. Lots of shade and space to park. Just of the gravel road. Next to the road is a big grassy field if you have a bigger rig. Locals also camp here. Nice mountain views and waking up to the sound of birds.

name: Camping near river
description: Quiet downhill camping area near the river. Far away from the mainroad (D010) and out of sight from the small sideroad. Just a few cars crossed the side road.

name: Turkey/Bulgaria Border
description:
We crossed from Turkey to Bulgaria.
Quick and easy border.
On the Bulgarian side, you must pay 3€/6BGN, only in cash (no CB) for the "disinfection" of the vehicle to enter in Europa.
Just after the border, there are offices to change money and buy the "car vignette" to use Bulgarian roads.

name: Doğaperest Kafe Restorant ve Kamp alanı
description: Very nice place to stay for a night. Amazing spot in terms of nature (small river). A lot of space to set a tent (quite pebbly, but we managed to do it hassle-free), hot shower, wifi in restaurant, wooden chill spaces. We paid 40 TL for 2 people, 2 motorbikes and a tent in May 2019 (off-peak season). You could recharge here, but not everywhere, so it's rather not for RVs. Owners - funny guys who speak little English (what is a huge advantage in Turkey!) offered us a cay and some turkish sweets.

name: Misi karavan kamping
description: Very clean, comfortable camping with free washing machine, fridge, kitchen (1 hotplate, nothing else) and hot showers. In the grassy part where we set our tent there was no wi-fi—No WiFi in campsite. We paid 40TL for 2 persons, 2 motorbikes and 1 tent in May 2019. In July, 70Tl for pop top , 2 adults. It is situated near main road but at night the traffic wasn't so heavy and we could sleep without problems. At first GPS took us to the restaurant but finally we managed to find the right place (metal, automatic gate). Phone or shout to get let in—go to restaurant if no one around.

name: Near Roman Aqueduct
description: Camping right  in front of the Aqueduct. There is a flat surface. The locals said ok and the night and morning were very quiet.

name: Camping at the Beach
description: This very nice campsite is situated next to the beach under trees. We came here on bicylces and found the perfect spot for us: showers (suprisingly with hot water), toilets (which are in walking distance), sunbeds and umbrellas at the beach. At night the Jandarma came around and checked our passports. No problem at all! Great spot to spend more than one day. When we came here, there were only two other turkish campers. Might be more crowded on holidays.

name: Wintage car repair shop. Land Rover
description: Good place to get some work done on your Land Rover

name: Marina Laundry
description:
In the Marina, there is a laundry place where you can leave your loads to be washed (20Tl ) or washed,dried and ironed (40TL). So happy :)

If you park in the Migros, the first hour is free.

name: Kapuzbasi Waterfalls
description: Very nice waterfalls, 3 of them in a row coming out of the mountain through a cave, there are some viewpoints on the road and you can walk down. We camped in our tent at one of the picknick spots down near the river. Amazing spot, I will add a photo. For overlanding vehicles there is a small parking lot where you can stay. For us a 5 star campsite, only very noisy from the water :) if you don't camp this is still a beautiful spot to visit, all the way is tarmac and a great road to ride especially on motorcycles.

name: near assos
description: good place front the Rocky beach, one Big tree for shadow on afternoon and natural water Spring, quite and clean, not busy people, 4g turkcell

name: didim cric
description:
i think it's better place around diddim for wildcamp, so clean and less of people than other beach, because the accès it's by a private square, but you Can get around with a little rocky way (satellite maps), just some family Come afternoon, at morning and night we was alone. 
Paradis sand beach, azur hot water

name: Derebag waterfalls
description: Nice waterfall, free to visit worth a little detour if you are passing from Yahyali. Has a restaurant next to it as well what serves pretty good food for reasonable prices. Locals will have a bbq all over the place especially in the weekend.

name: "Campground" next to Midas's Throne
description: I found this place from the top. Highly recommended walking around there. It's incredible. Anyway...looks like an abandoned campground. Others had been there recently (fire pits). There are toilets. DON'T USE THEM! And a tap that doesn't work. The police came at 1am but we're very friendly and happy for me to stay. Medium trash level.

name: rooftop Villa. kinda
description: open area for 3 or 4 tents.  balloons in morning and coyotes at night.  beautiful view.

name: Lake side beach
description:
Tranquil beach next to the lake. Big flat area right next to the pebble beach. The path going in is a bit overgrown. Keep right after going in through a green gate (only the gate posts are still there, next to an abondend house). About 200 metres down, you will find the beach.
.
Higher up is a big flat grassy area, you might fit bigger rigs in there. (check photo).
.
Might be busy in the weekends, considering the trash that is left behind. (it is still clean enough luckily).
.
You can swim in the lake, nice to wake up in the morning.
.

name: Doga Bungalov
description: Great place on the shore of the lake with very nice owner (Mustafa). Very quiet. Space to camp and also bungalows and restaurant. Good salmon grown in the lake.

name: Archaeological site Adada
description:
Archaeological site Adada. Some well preserved temples and an amphitheatre. These ancient buildings are in really good shape and give you a good impression of how this place must have been in ancient times. 
.
Clear signs on site explaining the buildings. Pretty big site, no entry fee. When we visited there was nobody around.

name: Along the road
description:
Big flat grassy area, just along the road. The road is very quiet. There is a well on the field, not sure if you can drink it. We used a waterfilter.

Good place to stay for the night. Dry riverbed alongside the field.

name: Wild Camping Riverside
description: A very nice spot for camping under pine trees just beside a small river—was dry in August ‘22. Use the track leading away from the main road. After crossing the river take the left turn where you will find several spots which are also used by locals due to the waste lying arround. Continue the track by crossing the river again to its end. You will find a nice space there with hardly any trash. We spent two nights there friday to sunday and did not see any other people.

name: Nemrut Nat. Park
description: Nice place to camp in the Nemrud Nat. Park. The place is behind a small hill in a depression. Therefore the wind is not too bad. The place is out of sight from the road. Use an old track on the right side in a sharp left bend leading steep uphill. 4x4 and high clearance is necessary.

name: Çatalhöyük Neolithic Settlement
description: One of the largest (discovered) neolithic settlement on earth. About 9500 years ago, up to 8000 people lived at this archaeological site. Excavation areas, museum and experimental house. Free to enter.

name: Toz Gölü
description: Camp right at the lake. When you pass through the town of Eskil, follow the signs to Toz Gölü. Take the dirt track. After a while you will pass a couple of trees (only ones around), there is a 100 year fresh water source (shown to us by locals). Take a right and head out to the lake. Be careful driving on the lake so you won't get stuck. We parked at the edge of the lake. There were some old fire places.

name: Mountain Plateau. Stunning!
description: One of the best wild camping spots I've ever found. Absolutely beautiful. And very quiet. Only really acecable in summer months. 2WD easy. Go up over the hill till you get to the lake. Go left around the lake (lake on your right). Take the "road" to your left up the hill. Flat spots for big rigs, but go to the top for the plateau. There are shops on the main rd and in the middle of the shops is a spot where all the locals get water. Heaps... of water.

name: Picknick area next to restaurant
description:
A picknick area, belonging to the restaurant. The restaurant is al the way on the end of the road. The picknick area is on a small peninsula in the lake. 
.
We've asked the owner of we could stay for the night. (It was very windy, and this was the only place with trees to shelter behind with our rooftoptent). After a bit of translation with Google translate we where welcome to stay for the night.

The gate closes at 21:00 and opens at 09:00. There are some guard dogs, but they won't come near.

There is a place to swim, picknick tables and lots of shade.

We paid 70 to for 2 people, car and rooftoptent and loads of thea.

Local people use this spot to picknick (also paying entrance fee). Everybody was very welcoming and kind (like everywhere in Turkey).

4G signal was ok.

name: Hatipler Beach
description: long sandbeach, clean water, less trash, less people, no wild dogs!

name: View 270° over the mountains
description:
Wild Camping on a flat area with shadow under the pines. Amazing view over the mountain at the sunset and the sunshine.
Take a path 10m before the top hill,  around 1 kilometer from the main road, better with 4x4 but accessible without.

name: Türkeli municipality beach and parking
description:
Next to the small harbor of Türkeli you will find a large parking, road goes little bit down, below road level. No concrete but gravel. Parking is next to excellent restaurant Rihtim which also offers small bungalows with view on the Black Sea. Each bungalow has own terrace. Fast WiFii at the restaurant. Open year round. WiFi only in restaurant or on parking next to restaurant (weak).

We arrived late at night. In the morning we saw a ticket stand appearing on the road. We haven’t paid yet so don’t know the price. 

Clean public toilets, footsteps, with washbasin and soap. On the beach there is a small restaurant with terrace and shade. You can rent sun loungers. Clean cold showers rooms at the beach. Safe and quiet place. Some friendly stray dogs at the beach. 

Since it is a public parking there a cars from local tourists being parked during the day. At night 10 big camping cars can be parked at the most.

name: Yesilyayla Spring Water
description:
Free water, low pression, 1/2 ".
Direct from the Mountain Source!

name: Çakraz Parking on Grass
description: Parking on grass, right next to the Mosque. In the back area also very quiet at night. No trash. Sandy beach 150 m. Many small shops and restaurants in the village. 10 TL / 24 h.

name: Ardahan Ipekyolu Hotel
description: Simple, clean and not too expensive hotel with breakfast for 140lira per night. Good wifi and service.

name: Camping spot at a small river
description: Yeşilgöz (green eye), beautiful small lake with a little river where you can camp. We came with our motorcycles and crossed a little bridge and camped next to the water. There is a little shop as well that sells all sorts of drinks (non-alcoholic), ice-creams and snacks. Free to stay, some locals told us they only charge if you use the wooden plates they made. Can be crowded in the weekends. Also possible to stay in 4x4 or unimog, just you cannot pass the little bridge. Very friendly people around. Also nice to just visit and take a look..

name: Woodland Clearing
description: Large clear flat area surrounded by trees off a track. The ground does have fern cover. The track didn't require 4x4 but care is needed. There is only woodland chatter. No rubbish and no barking dogs!!

name: Abdipaşa wild camp along the river
description: A wonderfully quiet place on the river.  Still no waste.  Please keep this place so clean!  No wild dogs.  Solid steppe soil, mostly flat.

name: refill bootle
description: you can refill your propane french bootle, Ask Dimitry Manos, his shop it's near the el mondo bar, i wait 2h for translation and pay 20e for 10kg gaz

name: Park Hotel
description: The owner graciously reduce the rate from 150lira to 140 when we paid. parking in front if hotel - safe Cox we left our tent and raincoat tied up to the bike. Breakfast is sumptuous. owner speak little English but there are fruits for breakfast which is a plus plus to us.

name: Hera Beach Camping
description: very nice campsite, clean, 40tl per tent. Direct in the beach. No Wifi.

name: Frig/ Phryggea limestone hill top
description: Beautiful area with stunning views of surrounding hills. Many open spaces to stop overnight.

name: Evren Konukevi Pansiyon
description: Great little guesthouse/hotel very close to the centre (about a 3 minute walk to the pedestrian promenade). For 1 person, 70 lira for a spacious double room. Rooms are very clean, modern, and well equipped. A gated (locked?) gravel lot for guest parking. Breakfast included.

name: Parking in the fishing port of Cide!
description: Parking in the fishing port of Cide!  This city is widely known for its 11 km long beach and the corresponding tourists.  Away from this hustle and bustle, there are fine parking spaces, even for very large campers!  The locals are very friendly to tourists!

name: Water Source
description:
Free water, 1/2 " hose, low pressure!
The locals fill here your trinet water bottles!

name: Erciyes hotel
description: Basic hotel near the city centre of Gaziantep with private/secure parking behind a gate. We paid 80 tl (cash only) for a 2 person room. Wi-Fi available, hot shower, normal toilets, beds are not great but ok. Friendly staff, all you need for shopping around available. Make sure your room is not on the street side, can be noisy..

name: Mount Nemrut
description: Here is the gate to Mount Nemrut, the road is in very good condition to get here. All cars, motorcycles or rigs can come here. Entry price 25 tl per person, from here you get on a small bus what will take you up and down for 2 km. You have a pretty easy walk up from there what takes about 30 minutes. We went in July and see a beautiful sunrise, up it was windy but not so cold as the people say. You can rent a blanket for 10tl. but a sweater will be fine..

name: Keçi Camping
description: 90 liras for camping per person, 140 liras for bungalows, including a breakfast and dinner daily. Not suitable for caravans. There's no electricity and water at the campsite. There's a dining area that you can use electricity. Quiet, family-ran place.

name: Ayhan Apart Pension
description:
Convenient location by the road. Great swimming pool and cheap rate for room with/ without kitchen. We exchange the view to the pool and got one with kitchen at same price 100 lira! 
Unfortunately the fridge isn't working and some parts are not well repaired and maintained. Owner speaks some English but very friendly. We stayed 2 nights because we love the pool and cheap price again there is only 1 power point and the water in the sink flows very slowly.

name: Mountain meadow
description: Track off mountain road is a little steep at the start but 4x4 isn't needed as long as you have good ground clearance. There are a number of places to camp, it's reasonably flat. After the heat of the lowlands the cool temperature in the meadow is wonderful!

name: A wonderful place on the cliff! Grass.
description: A wonderful place on the cliff! Grass. At night Total calm. No garbage. Please let it be left. The bay including it is a garbage! Hincher's supply only with 4 × 4 if it is dry. Better is the access to the east!

name: Lakeside Camping
description: Roomy and clean picnic area under trees and alongside the lake. As long as we stayed there we were alone, the complete site seemed to be still in winter sleep and unused. Quiet, only some shepherds and hunters in the surroundings. One can hear the road nearby but it is not disturbing.

name: Lakeside camping
description: We followed the small unpaved road down, turned left at the fork, found a suitablel lay-by. Some angler and families there when we arrived, but nobody around at night (just frogs). Very quiet, relatively clean.

name: Restaurant and good campside
description:
Very nice place, lot of trees and shadow. I paid 50TL for a good salad , but I slept here for free. 
If you like fresh fish, it's the right place

Vespanda Ilario Lavarra

name: Sümelas Camping
description:
Small lawn campsite next to a small stream in an otherwise absolutely quiet and green location. Two little huts and one shower/toilet. For the last 600m, the road is a bit bumpy, but nothing problematic. Probably not too good for very big RVs, but very nice for small busses (eg VW T4) or a tent.
The owners are very friendly and speak english good enough. 1 night with a van and for two people cost us 40TL (others in the area want up to 110!).
We are nor sure if they sometimes cook, but there seems to be some menu. They offer beverages and i think, they can lay an electric cable to the sites.
Simple, but very recommendable!

name: Great view over Göreme
description: Perfect view over kapadokia and overnight stay. In the morning great view to the rising of the hot balloons.

name: drinking water on the  E95
description: low pressure, 3 taps, 1/2", with a little picnic place.

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source. 2 taps, parking for larger vehicles. It's a fountain from which the locals filled their bottles and they also told us it was drinking water.

name: Samsun at the beach
description: Staying at the beach. If you want to avoid the noise of the city of Samsun, drive a few kilometers to the east! Quiet place on the east side of the river mouth. OSM inaccurate, use coordinates. Beach full of garbage, wild dogs.  Swimming not recommended. Only suitable for overnight stay!

name: Emek pension / restaurant
description:
This is a magic place, incredible in the night. Nobody around. The owner, Miss Mesudè, is an excellent person. She cooks very good food too. You should try to spend one night here, to enjoy the real rural Cappadocia :-)

Her number: +90 (352) 653 10 29 or 
+90 (532) 375 65 38

Ps she speaks French and English.

name: Free spot on the seaside
description: Free Spot on the seaside. There were a few locals at the evening to grill. They were all really friendly and one of the families gave us some of their food to try. Unfortunately there is a lot of trash. But other than that, it’s a nice spot. Road to the sea is a little bumpy but not to bad.

name: Drinkingwater at the E70!
description: Drinkingwater in real good quality, direct at the E70!

name: Of tea plantation
description:
sur une aire de chargement bétonnée avec un auvent bien pour une nuit route peu trafic nuit
