a concrete area on middle of tea plantation with little shelter few trafic on road nignt

name: E97
description:
dans une friche industrielle au bord de la route, en dépannage trouvée a la tombée de la nuit

flat area found en route. good if night is approaching

name: Lake Van beach
description: Stony beach with almost no rubbish. Just a lot of sheep fur and poo when we where here. Small gravel road ok for all cars. We spent one sunny  Sunday afternoon here. Just one other car with locals. Main Road close - visible / hearable

name: in the middle of nowhere, next to a lake
description: Remote and very quiet place in the hills. No people, no cows, no rubbish. Muezzin in the distance in the evening, two cars passing in the morning. Big flat area with an old olive tree for some shade. Gravel road good for all kinds of cars. Lake is 5min to walk and nice for a swim. Villages visible in the distance. No mobile networks available!

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source.

name: Next to the lake
description: We searched for another place like the “main beach“ because it was totally crowded on a friday afternoon. Most of the dirt tracks around the lake leading to the lake are forbidden for vehicles (only written in Turkish). After we drove almost half around the lake we found this spot next to the lake. There are several dirt tracks leading to this spot. It is completely quiet, nobody around (in peak season on a weekend!!!). You only can hear a bit of the road but there is not a lot of traffic. Take care if you want to drive directly on the beach, it is really bad ground (sand and loam). We got stuck and had to dig for at least 4 hours. No shade and 4x4 recommended! 3G to 4G signal with turkcell.

name: Adana Hostel
description:
nice hostel in the city 
- 10€ shared room 
- "safe parking " for one motorbike maybe 2 .
fast WiFi 
kitchen 
hot shower

name: On the road
description:
A tape of drinking water.

Un robinet d'eau potable de source.

name: Beach & bird's sanctuary 2
description:
Huge sandy beach, flat, you can go far in the water before losing quiet foot disturbed by a stork, curious, which landed 20 m from us.
Access on road N 41.57933 E 036.1104.

immense plage de sable, plate, on peut aller loin dans l'eau avant de perdre pied tranquille dérangé par une cigogne, curieuse, qui s'est posée a 20 m de nous.

name: Evim Hostel Kadiköy
description:
At Asian side of Turkey location near highway, rather noisy but short distance to metro bus. Mainly for uni students.
Private room @120 lrt, breakfast @3 Euro.
Room is clean with shared toilet and shower.
Wi-Fi only at canteen and office area.

name: Free drinkingwater at the E97!
description: Free drinkingwater in excellent quality, direct at the E97!

name: Parking at the monastery ruins of Imea.
description:
Parking at the monastery ruins of Imea. Not horizontal. Straße continues to get to the mountains, 1 car in 12 hours. Small picnic area on the monastery terrain. Strong water sources. 
About 500 m east of there is another ruin terrain with flat meadow, but it seems to be private? 40.53522 39.59302. 
We spent here the quietest night! 
EDGE = no internet!

name: Nur motor
description:
Motorcycle shop. Very helpful owner and mechanics. They speak a little english, but most of the time google translate is used. Free tea when you are waiting. 
Visa creditcard is accepted.

name: Rest Area Highway
description:
In the rest area category, this one is a good place to stay one night and take the road again early.
Choose one of the first parking lot in the entrance. Bigger and quiet (except traffic road). Toilets 24/24 and free wifi on Starbuck. No shower, no possibility to refill water tank.

name: Quite place with a view
description:
Nice quiet spot on the Sufi trail. 
A dog come by barking in the night which brought the attention of a shepherd. When he saw the bike and tent he come and after a few words gone.

name: au bord de la mer
description:
arrived late. camping expensive 100 tl at the edge of the road without traffic from 9 pm to 9 am clean. no flies.

arrivé tard le camping cher 100tl au bord de la route sans trafic de 21 h à 9 h propre pas de mouche

name: Doganyurt harbour
description:
drinking water village people come to fill their cans.
----
eau potable les gens du village y viennent remplir leurs bidons

name: Doganyurt
description:
near rangers house along Sean water about 20m away, public toilets 300m not free. no traffic quiet in village shops and restaurants
----
a côté des gardes du parc le long de la mer point d'eau a 20 m tranquille pas de circulation village a 50 m commerces restaurants

name: On the rocks
description:
Not the easiest area to find good spots in the area so this is as good as it gets. It’s quiet and only very few locals come by. Stayed there on a weekday. I assume it gets busier during weekend and/or holidays due to the many fireplaces and trash. 
Good for all rigs, no 4WD needed.
It’s possible to climb down to go swimming and the view is great. The wind makes it bearable on hot days, because the place is exposed to onshore winds. Keep that in mind on windy days.
Close to the new Motorway O-6 and therefore the new Istanbul Airport. 
 When on the O-6, leave at the Exit Kilyos, drive through Demirci, taking a left in Demirci heading east then northeast. Follow the road until just before the sea you will see a dirt track on the right. Go up, first left and you’re there.

name: Adagol free camping
description: We didn't stay overnight, but some others did. Lot of free parking lots, few of these on shadow. Free barbecue, picnic area, playground... Toilets available during the day for 1,5tl

name: Next to river
description:
Nice place next to a river. Even on a weekend in peak season we were completely alone (except of a shepherd). When you drive from Begendik to Kasaba leave the road to the right in a sharp leftcurve. Follow this track for about 3 km (always stay on the main track there several smaller tracks leaving the main track) and you will reach this place (watch google satellite). A lot of flat space for several vehicles. 2wd possible but 4x4 better. No shade. 3G signal with turkcell.
Edit: Next noon came one friendly family from the village to make a picnic. But they left in the evening.

name: Parish hall of Bölümlü!
description: Parking at the parish hall of Bölümlü!  If you ask the boss here in Turkish, then you may - depending on sympathy - park in front of the house, or even better parked behind the house and stay overnight.  There are  sanitary installations, but we did not need them.  The people are extremely friendly to strangers and offer everything that their house has.  Behind the house it is very quiet and there are different covered seating areas which are dry even in the rain.

name: Sile
description: Entrance at Sile picnic area for local people. Also industrial Zone nearby.

name: Havuz Camping
description: The camping doesn't exist anymore as a camping, the ground has been cut off ,only the restaurant subsists, Wc and showers still very basic if functionable. We stood 2 campers cramped , being waved in, advantage: being alone and quiet. No camping activities seem possible.

name: 300 m main road Sile Istambul
description:
taps drinking water possible connect hose drinking water 300 m main road




robinets eau potable possible brancher tuyau
water potable 300 m main road

name: cide belediyesi
description: great spot for picknick swim and you can Stay here for the night.

name: Ziyaret
description:
Great plave. Two options tot stay.
Free place at the end of the dam. 
Parking place by the restaurant. 10tl for 1day.
Here you vind playground for children and you 
can rent small boats and bikes.
Amasya 3 km. wifi 4g with your own simcard.

name: Kahve Deryasi
description:
You were not in Van if you did not have Breakfast there ! Türkisch old saw ;)
and they are right - perfect traditionell Breakfast!!
Parking place direkt on side .
very very nice friendly  People

name: Place at a river (4x4 preferred)
description:
Here is the point where you leave the road to this beautiful spot at a river. When you come down and turn right you can drive till the end. Even at a weekend in peak season there were only a few friendly local families who made their picnic on the other side of the river. In the evening they were all gone. Completely quite at night. No trash around. You can swim in the clear water of the river. It is really refreshing. One of the most beautiful and cleanest spots we had so far in Turkey! 3G to 4G signal with turkcell. Only 4x4
Edit: The mornings we left a local told us that they sometimes open the floodgates from the upper reservoir. So the problem could be that the way back is cut off because of water. Better ask somebody who is around or don't drive too far that you can return before the water gets to high.

name: Pasinler
description:
Picknick place. Can be Bush in daytime but
quiet in the evening.

name: Woodland clearing
description: Large woodland clearing with flat areas. Plenty of shade and hidden from the road. Access is along an overgrown but easy track. You can hear the main road but it remains far enough away to be background noise.

name: Port Riva
description:
In the Riva harbour behind stadium. Water and power if you ask the fishermen. No traffic on main road and bridge at night
-
sur le port de Riva derrière le stade accueil sympa des pêcheurs eau possibilité d'avoir du courant en demandant pas de trafic la nuit sur le pont

name: Akcaabat Gasbottle filling
description: Gasbottle filling 12 Kg within 5 minutes, 110 TL.

name: Aile Beach
description: Aile Beach, a large parking lot right on the beach. The cleanest beach so far in the Trabzon area. Flooded at the weekend by the locals. Drinking water, sanitary facilities, simple restaurant with self-service. 20 m below the highway. Loud during the day, relatively quiet at night. 10 TL per vehicle per day, regardless of the number of people (we saw 9 people disembark from a Clio). Every day the farmers sell fresh vegetables and first-class chicken eggs here. Gas filling station (also for German gas bottles) a few km in the direction of Trabzon.

name: Akasya
description:
Nice place to stop for 
 bordercrossing to Georgia. IT is possible to swim and there are cold showers on the beach.
There are many spaces, one on free place on a gravel field the other  by the restaurant.

Nice owner, we didn't have to pay if we should take a drink or diner.
We had a perfect diner for 75 tl

name: Bahcekapi
description: There is a restaurant right next to the gas station. Very very good food and service. Ok prices.

name: Close to the road
description:
Really very quiet, absolutely no traffic between 8 pm to 8 am (because all people have to left Uztuzu beach).
Big flat gravel spot, with shadows in the morning. Pine forest is available for little walk.
Nothing else.

name: Roadside parking at a military checkpoint
description: We stopped at a military checkpoint to ask where it would be safe to spend the night in our van. All the guys were helpful and polite, although keeping hands on their guns. They pointed out the parking space right across the street and told us they would keep an eye on us so we shouldn't worry. The two-lane road gets somewhat quiet at night. Good place to spend the night and move on. Especially if you are a bit nervous about camping 20 km from the Syrian border.

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source.

name: Wild camp next to waterfall
description: Very nice spot next to a waterfall, there are 2 of them around here next to each other. Not far from the main road but no one can see you from there. Just turn before or after the tunnel to the small road that follows the river and you see the spot yourself. No one was around when we where here.

name: In the hills at the end of a dirt road
description: Nice spot for 1 night if you go to / come from Erzurum. No passage, very quiet, nice view on the hills. Not far from the main road but it wasnt disturbing. At the end of a dirt road. 4g ok.

name: Wildcamp next to the river
description: Nice spot just next to the river. Only accessible by motorcycle or 4x4 with good clearance. We where the only one here and the only noise you hear is from the river. In our opinion the best spot around here away from all tourists.

name: Isparta
description:
Big and very clean campground.
Very quiet & beautiful mountain view. Wood is surrounding the area. Follow the sign from the water and picnic area on a dirt road. 4x4 not necessary.

name: Around the football field
description:
200m from the beach. A lot of t local people overnight on there cars around the field.
There are some beach's toilets not so far... But not recommended.
Quiet.

name: Big wasteland at Selime
description:
Nothing except big flat field, a small river (so, with mosquitoes) and some trash.
But quiet and close to the start of Selime / Ihlara trail.

name: Dogal Yasam Parki
description: Park with pond, stream, picnic area, reasonably priced restaurant, toilets, paved parking area—well maintained and clean. There may be entrance fee but no one was around to collect. We asked at the restaurant about camping and the manager showed us where to park. Very nice people here. Very quiet at night, only sound of stream. No one here at night—was mid week. Also recommend restaurant—tasty food, nice modern environment—eat inside or on terrace overlooking pond. Picnic sites are nice and grassy.

name: wild spot at lake
description:
Perfectly paved roads in this area.
One leads to this spot.
We didn't swim because of a lot of plants and strong stream. Some plastic around.

Very beautifull and silent spot, exactly what you want when camping in wild.

Some, very poor turkcull 3g coverage

Every vehicle can get here! We added the easiest road to the pictures (drive up from the east bay) 
For a tent you have to pick a spot with no rocks

name: Kaya Green Park
description: far from the highway .more quiet than the other petrol stations.big parking infront of the park,near the restaurant

name: erzincan gas station
description: big parking near the restaurant in a gas station .there is a hotel behind but it was closed .clean rest room.

name: Nemrut Dagi Reception Center —northeast side
description: Modern Reception Center—inside toilets nice but not available after Center closes at night (9pm?), outside toilets a bit grim but useable.. Possible to park overnight in small parking area as “guests” of onsite restaurant—110Tl for 2, soup, salad, meat dish, bread, drink. 20Tlpp entrance fee, 5Tlpp for shuttle bus to site, but since the bus didn’t want to wait for us, we were allowed to drive to top :-). Saw other private cars in small parking at top—driving to the top on south entrance not possible. Overnight parking is exposed, so we parked next to (closed? Sunset Hotel) for wind protection—kinda noisy in v early morning with a few cars arriving and leaving. Paved road to Reception Center, stunning views but steep, mostly 1st/2nd gear for Troopy. Well worth the time and effort!

name: Turn on below the main road
description: There is a turn off that lead to a dirt road just below the main road. You can camp here. A little bridge leads to a walnut orchard but there it seems like the night would have get more damp than I like.

name: Natural spring.
description:
Close to the road there is a turn off to the natural spring. It’s a the back of a little shack that looks like a temporary restaurant but it’s high summer season and it’s closed. 
Plenty of space to camp around. 
Just above there is a little mosque I camped there because of the concrete basement and shelter from the wind. Quiet, at 2300 a local come to fill up his water tanks and left.

name: Big parking lot before bridge to old town
description:
We stay here during afternoon without having to pay anything.
We came back at night and slept until 9 am. When I leave my motor home, an guardian say me it's 5 tl for night. 10 tl for 24h. He gave me receipt.
So, not free, but good place to overnight.

name: ADRIA campsite
description:
ADRIA manufacturers with a campground next to it.
Prices unknown.
Hot shower, looks clean.
Very European campsite. Maximum height 3 meters.

name: Mustafa’s Market
description:
There is a great market off the road. Lots of food supply, mosque and toilets. The owner will let you camp freely there is lots of space. They are developing a new restaurant/cafeteria. 
Big rigs no problem.

name: Akbük
description: Situated directly at the beachfront with own beach.   Very nice view, quiet area and friendly people. Restaurant and little shop. Not many people.  70 TL per tent and night.

name: Camper Village Ivagon
description: Nice camping on a grass, big but has not shadow. There are only two wc and One shower enough dirty also the Sink for washing the plates is in bad conditions. the owner is nice and give informations how you can move in Istanbul. the gate is closed and you have to ring  the bell and wait for few minutes. Allowed camper and  motor caravan

name: Bush camp.
description: Nice and quiet bushcamp off the main road. There is a dirt double track turn off to follow. Here is quiet and no noise from the road.

name: Gölova Lake
description: Next to water but a bit hidden for the wind, it was very windy when we arrived till around midnight. Be careful when you go into the water, I just wanted to wash my hands but lost my flip-flops as I went down in the mud till my knees.

name: Ushguli Camping
description: Ushguli parking lot without usable installations, for 1 big rig.  Absolutely flat next to the house.  10 GEL.

name: Lentechi Mineral Water River Camp.
description:
A huge flood plain with its own mineral spring (fairly sulfurous).
During the day the locals come to fill their containers with this water, at night totally quiet. If one chooses the lowest corner downstream, one has its peace, except for the cows and donkeys, since from time to time curious to stop by and nibble everything around.
Otherwise, continue upstream until you are out of sight of the source. From the road you are not seen through the trees. Directly at the source there is a covered seating area. The steep descent to the terrain takes place at the blue board "Mineral Water"
There is plenty of firewood. The place is relatively clean; please leave it that way!

name: Yagcilar beach
description: 4wd drive only, 8km track to get to very nice beach known by the locals, quiet at night and clean.

name: akveren
description: Good local Kebap. No tourist trap. Normal local kitchen all around this place.

name: Baja's wine
description:
small family winery with excellent wines!
For example "tsolikouri" 7dl 30 GEL.
only 3 ha ground!

name: Bush camp
description: Follow the turn off from the main road coming uphill. Find your spot, that’s all. You can hide in the bushes as well as limited view on the lake. Ground seems rocky but it’s actually soft, rocks sink into it.

name: mototalya
description: Motorcycle shop owned by incredibly friendly motorcyclist couple. I had broken spokes and they got me sorted. They also got me a place to spend the night. Whatever your need is I'm sure they help you out oneway or another.

name: next to the lake
description: 30km south of Erzurum a very quiet place on the side of the lake. very quiet only cows in the morning but some garbages we have to remove to make the place really nice. possibility to fish but not to swim. no Shade ans no services.

name: Beach camp in dunes
description: We found this place close to a small town. Beautiful sunset. The usual trash. Life guard of beach said its okay to camp here. In summer some noise until 11pm from fare in town but after that and suring daytime very calm. Your private beach :)

name: Hill view
description: Follow the double track facing the restaurant on the motorway (next to the paved road)uphill bring you towards the cellular antenna. Plenty of spots around.

name: Wildcamp spot
description: Nice spot next to a tree just off the double tracks.

name: restaurant/piknik area pkg
description: very nice owners...bring your meat and rent a bbq and a nice table for 10l.

name: Yason Church - small cape next to lighthouse
description: Good place for rainy nights as you are standing on concrete. Nice views to mountains and sea. Some fishermen pass by. A little restaurant sells food.

name: A night at the theater Pinara site
description: Just next to Pinara's Ancient Theater, very quiet and uncommon neighborhood, try to find the truck on the image ;-)

name: By the lake
description:
Beautiful and very quiet place with a view over the lake.
 Not possible to swim, because you can not get to the lake. Lots of spots but may be it's easier after the
 harvest as many fields are cultivated.

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source.

name: private parking
description:
you can park any vehicles in this place. the owner ask us 10 lira for the night wich is ok as you can walk to the old city easily. 10mns only. it's not very quiet at night! but it's safe. 
you can even open your roof tent here...

name: abandoned house on hill
description: flat area at end of dirt road.  no big rigs.  abandoned house driveway.  really good view.

name: Toyocar garage
description: Perfect garage for Toyotas. The boss Yücel Toptas used to work for Toyota and now he has his own business. Can arrange original spare parts and you can normaly get a short term appointment within one or two days. Very friendly people and good work for a fair price. Highly recommended!

name: Mechanic and Welding
description: Motorbike repairing and welding. 2 shops. near the bakery

name: Drinking water
description: Drinking water by side of road. Some marquees nearby for chai and a sign to a small mosque somewhere too.

name: Samli Bicycle shop & repair
description:
If you’re like me and stuck halfway between Samsun and Istanbul with no spare tubes left, this is a great bike shop. (NB: you will need to descend the ramp from street level - they are in the basement of an apartment building).

Mustafa and his wife seem capable of most repairs and, most importantly, they stock some 28” Presta tubes!! If you stay a while, they might even order a chai from the club across the lane...

name: Erciyes Oto Cam
description: Good place for replace windshield. Lots of stock and the guys are super helpful and accommodating. On the area has loads of other mechanics.

name: Under the tree
description: Close to the road but people won’t see you. The site is VERY windy. Nice sunset and sunrise.

name: Trail camp
description: Camp right on the trail. There a flat spot. Great view on the bay.

name: Hos Geldiniz
description:
Mechanic place for automobiles Citroën. Cheep, gently and efficient !
Tea for waiting

name: next to the lake beach
description: beautiful place on the lake where you Can swim and even if it's close to the road it's very quiet un the evening and at night. very good for an overnight.

name: Monastery Cave Hotel
description:
Erjan will welcome you and answer to any request you might have. He does speak many langage, fluent french, spanish, italian, macedonian, english and a little bit of turkish😉...He does know very well the region and can help you to organize walking day in area. 
this place is one of the oldest turistic place in Cappadocia, third generation.
The place is really Nice and the atmosphere is perfect for a break far from the crowd. We did park just in front and we got a room for 200 lira per night 2 people. shower is the best one ever! Food is great. Wifi ok and if you need you can even ask for a laundry! 
and if you have a bike, you can also park easily.
a perfect place to relax and get some information of the turkish culture.

name: OtoCanCan
description: If you need a good place to change the bled schock absorber for truck and car. They change our in one hour. Very well organized and equipped. They have the shop just with the mechanic place. We pay 300 TL.

name: Vasili Piknik and Camping
description: They say on Google, it's a usual campsite, but it only has pace for tents. also there are sanitary units, but no showers. no internet. Yet they have a fence that protects you from wild dogs and Kojotes. Campsite is clean and looks quite ok. the night costs 20 Lira, but you can talk to Vasili then you will probably get the night for 10.

name: Parking Lot Behind a Mosque
description: Quiet place to spend a night, gravel parking lot behind a playground and a mosque, only the muezzin is a bit loud, ok for one night, we went here because the road to the place "on the rocks" is closed with a gate, the nearby restaurant did not allow us to stay on the almost empty huge parking lot, even if we had dinner there. They wanted us to stay at the campsite next to the restaurant for 300 TL, so we moved here, police passed but they did not bother us

name: Dirt road into the wood
description: Follow the double track off the main road. The dirt road will lead you to the wood but probably here is better spot to camp. Exposed to the morning sun and breeze during the night.

name: Hill view
description: There is a double track that leads up the hill. Half way up there is a turn off that leads to this place. Nice and quiet.

name: Could be hidden after water crossing.
description: Camped here for tthe night. It’s just next to the road. Although the road is very quiet at night. If you cross the stream I am fairly sure you will find an hidden spot. Night was quite, and have an very slow turkcell reception here.

name: Mount Ararat
description: Not the best, but good view. Couple km off highway on a tarmac road. But it’s quiet at night.

name: Parking Area
description:
it's a parking area. no asphalte. not charming at all but when night coming and you do not want to pay a parking...it's a good alternative. you can even go walking, go for a swim but rock beach so take your water..shoes!
otherwise it has been very quiet. good sleep.

name: Kaleköy
description: a wonderful spot. quiet. we did park close to the sea, just on your right side when you arrive. it is a really small port but you can swim if you do have water shoes. there is toilet and shower in the little white house...Network 4G ok. and you can walk to visit the castle (14 lira pp) and the lycienne tomb! only 20mns to go to the village down the castle. many bars restaurants....

name: Quite fields close to the road
description:
Its grassy area.
Not far from the main road but very quite.
The gravel track how leads to this place is drivable for all kinds of vehicles.

name: Harput castel
description: Castle is almost not there anymore. But some great views.

name: Big parking
description: Big parking in front of the sea. Very quite.

name: parking north entrance
description: if you do not want to pay 30TL, it's a good place. any vehicule can park here. we haven't been disturb. after visiting we decided to camp here ; it's not the best spot of the world but for one night it's ok! for the site, do not miss the vasq by the north side specifically by sunset time! theater and colonnade alley must be seen ! good visit (60 pp and 72pp with museum)

name: Wild camping at the beach
description: Wild camp spot at the beach, good place to open the tent on the island. If you camp at the crowded beaches there is a big chance the police comes and sends you away. Here nobody came, we had a quiet night. Also possible to find a spot less windy.

name: Ferryboat to Bozcaada island
description: Goes in the summertime every hour, the boat takes about 40 minutes. The ticket is valid for both ways, price for motorcycles is 22tl.

name: Wild camp at the beach
description: Wild camp spot with not so much wind. You pass a summer house village after that you come to the beach, on the right there is a nice spot out of the wind but next to the beach. On the beach itself there are a lot of beach chairs from the summerhouses, the place is clean.

name: Free Parking for Afrodisias
description: if you do not want to pay for the parking, you can stop here! 200m to walk to the site (24pp)

name: Wild camping spot
description: Nice quiet grassland spot for camping. Signs of old camp fires here, so I’m not the first.

name: Kaklik cave
description: A cave with small features like pumukkale inside. (I have not been to the real thing yet) but nice. Free entrance and parking. Also a natural swimming pool. Showers and toilets. (clearer than most I have seen so far)

name: Parking of Kaklik cave
description: Was thinking of looking for a camp site after the cave in the vicinity. But ended up staying on the parking lot. Free pool with natural water. And turkcell reception. Downside; there is a light sulfur smell somethings. And Some light noise.

name: old road
description:
grassy place right next to the old street and close to the river. Its not really flat but we managed with wedges. Follow the "bad" road with a sign for a restaurant along the river (not on the map). Very quiet, only 2 cars passed in the evening.
3G on Turkcell.

name: Mega Beach road
description:
quiet at night. many places free around. we did arrive at 7pm. the beach is not free but nice enough if you feel for a swim. all facilites,  toilets shower...restaurant.
less than 2km from the Trojan horse, Nice walking to the port.

name: Kuşcenneti National Park
description:
Currently under renovation and not accessible
.you can stay overnight on the parking area in front of the entrance to the park. very quiet at night! we were alone from 7pm to 8am.
entrance fee : 7pp. you will observe the migrations birds in season (june july sept oct) and the small museum. facilities in the park. not open at night.

name: No Name
description:
Moderator Note: Please check to confirm that it is acceptable to camp here.

A lost place. Looks like a former factory. situated right at the beach.

name: Kulturi Park
description:
7 lira for a private car. No time limit, that means you can stay forever! Many flat places and really clean. Close to the old city, but you can easily visit all the interesting places from here by walking. 
Quiet at night even if local people are coming late. Water, toilets 1,5 lira (closed at night), playground, restaurant, groceries alcohol shops around.
Really nice park to relax. Better if you do arrive before 7pm.

name: Car service, mechanics, parts
description:
This is the entrance to the car service zone in this city.
You will find loads of different repair shops specialising in different cars and parts.

name: Tunnel side sea front
description: Right from the tunnel there is a long side road with one small cafe and large area for parking. No sound of cars at all - they pass in tunel. Quiet.

name: Bulvar Pastanesi
description:
They offer a great and tasty selection of Baklava and you should definitely try the cookies (better than baklava). I think they also have some cake and you can eat there as well. Friendly guys.
We just got some sweet snacks to take away and were very happy with our choice.

name: Truck Repair
description: Truck mechanic repair and body repair. We had a leakage to the aux diesel tank and need to find exactly where and weld it. They were very helpful and did the job in the afternoon.

name: Restaurant off Highway
description: Just off the highway so convenient if you're on the go. Really nice food and enough to choose from. Just go inside and have a look at the "buffet". Busy with locals at lunchtime. Nice to get away from the highway fast food places. Shops also.

name: Cesme to Chios
description: Here you can get a ferry to Chios, Greece. Sunrise lines is the company. I was told there are 2 boats a day in July and august, one in the morning, one in the evening. The other months it's only one at around about 6 pm. Tickets can be bought at a small office along the street but getting a ticket in advance might be useful when traveling by car or motorcycle since it's a very small boat with limited space. Customs was very easy and quick. Price €52,- and the crossing takes about 45 minutes. From Chios you can get an overnight ferry to Piraeus (Athens).

name: crater edge
description:
big flat parking space next to the road on top of the vulcano crater. Amazing view over Tatvan and lake Van. Quiet, some tourists stop for pictures. It can get very windy up here.

The street is asphalted half way up until the cableway station. After that, ok coblestone street up to the edge and into the crater until the lake.

4G on Turkcell.

name: Akdeniz Camp
description: Small lovely camp site at the lake. Very quiet. Toilet and showers very clean

name: Helpful  Mechanic in Mus
description: We came with a cooling problem and even though not specialized on landrover Eyyup and his very friendly team went on immediately to fix the problem in a very  professional  way.They served us lunch and offered free wifi. He does not speak english but works well with google translator and helping hands around. Very good price for all the work he did.

name: Mountain Pasture
description:
This is a lovely place in the mountains close to the hazelnut growing region.
You will probably need 4x4 to get here and definitely some ground clearance.
We only saw a man with his cows and asked him if it is okay if we stay here and he told us that it's not a problem. If you see him please ask him just to be friendly.
You have a beautiful view to the mountains around you and you're able to watch some birds. The place is extremely quiet.
You will be able to find a levelled spot.
If you need shade you can probably drive further uphill towards some trees.
It's the first spot we found in Turkey where we didn't see one piece of garbage, please leave it that way. And just don't go here if you don't even burrow your toilet paper.
There is also water source a bit further uphill and along the road between the main road and the dirt track. You have 4G+ cell connection with Vodafone.
You leave the main road here: 40.6994243, 36.9927964 and turn into the dirt road here: 40.6999703, 37.0043923

name: Camp in the Field
description: We just drove off D260 direction Savcun and found flat spot on a hill with wonderful view on the road, sunset and the hills around. No wind, sounds of birds, road barely heard. No soul around. Road uphill somewhere inclined but no 4x4 needed.

name: Midyat parking
description:
Big parking area and bus terminal of Midyat city. There is a park next to the parking with a tea house and toilet. Toilets for 1 Lira as long the teahouse is open (probably until midnight and morning starting at 8). There is water available too, we could use the hose from guys cleaning a minibus.

There is some traffic at the park lot, buses and trucks,during the evening, but it was quiet at night. We felt safe, some people around but nobody bothered us. There is a guard at the house at the entrance, we asked him for stay overnight, no problem, for free. 

The old town of Midyat is beautiful, climb the tower of the mueseum for sunset. The city is quite touristic and the old town is renovated. 
4G on Turkcell.

name: Sanliurfa
description: Parking next the the Archeology Museum in the city center. It is guarded (at least from 8:00 to 23:00) and cost 10 Lira / day. We asked the guard if we can sleep here, no problem. We did not ask for toilets (there has to be somewhere for the guards) but there is a Restaurant/Cafe in the museum, and the museum itself has toilets too available during opening times. On the other side there is a huge mall with ATMs, Migros and everything else you might need. 10 minutes walk to the holy places and the castle. It was quiet in the night, some people walk by next to the museum. 4G on Turkcell.

name: Water tap
description: Strong water source from tap right next to the road.

name: Near Diarbakyr
description:
Small gravel road leading to the hills. There is a place next to a small river. In general very quiet. A car stopped in the night and some locals came to ask what we are doing here (not in the friendliest way) but did not speak English and went away. At the end of the gravelroad is probably a village. 
Poor signal on Turkcell.

name: Hush Hostel for Cyclists
description:
Nice hostel with garden and space for bicycles and some tools to repair.
Quite a lot cyclists stay there.
Prices are moderat, not really cheap.

name: Ormanya Camp Park
description: Free camping with water and electricity for free. Near to a free zoo park. You just need to sign a document with your passport number at the entrance—take passports to the guard office at the zoo entrance. Prior to checking in, 5 m long vehicles can easily park outside the locked entrance gate to the campsite. At the moment, at busy times, this area can be quite congested.

name: Mercedes mechanic - Asmer Otomotiv
description:
Best mechanic in town. Cheaper than dealer service center. They’ve got all the parts needed or can order in 2 days max. We replaced turbine, fixed alternator, changed oil and filters. Original Mercedes oil! Really solid guys. 
Lots of Sprinters came during the day. This is the place. From the border of Iran this is the first place where you can fix your car. 
Free lunch and chai included :)

name: good fish and köfte
description: Nice restaurant with cute little huts in backyard for too hot/cold/windy days. Owner speaks very little english but is very nice and tries to communicate. ask for fish and he will show you which fresh fish he has in his fridge. we payed 35lira for a plate of excellent fish, a very good fresh salad, bread, water and tea. köfte is also very good, 25 lira also with all the same sides. Right by the street but didn't bother us to much, if it does you can eat in the little huts ;)

name: in the hills
description: quiet hidden plattform in the woods near the reservoir. shadow from trees, almost no traffic. 4G signal on Turkcell.

name: Riverside
description:
Small, flat grassy path next to the river. There is small dirt track next to the main road that gives access to this place. You are behind some trees so pretty private. Good for a night.

Hardly any cellphone reception.

name: Citycamping beside a quiet Park
description:
l camped there 3 Weeks ( because i had to organize  my carnet the passages)  in may and also 3 days in the end of september, without any  problems. The Park is large and nice for parking and playing with my dog. You can ask at the Parktaxi Station at the beginning of this street for fresh drinking water and probably they offer you Tea. the place is nearby the University area and old City. all kind, of shops, restaurants one need are also very near. there are very nice and cheep, old Hamam in the oldcity. i gues they are bulding a new toilett house at this Time.
i enjoyed this secure place very much and found also good friends wich helped me in every way at this place.

name: Dogal Service station and restaurant. E80
description: Absolutely fabulous restaurant and wonderful service from staff. Some staff spoke good English and all were incredibly friendly and helpful. Reasonably priced (vegetarian & meat) food selection and the quality was superb. Great shop with local produce etc. Loos were clean, had paper, soap, western style loos and everything worked. 10 km N W of Ozman Gazing Bridge near Istanbul.  Highly recommended.

name: Lagoon
description: Very quiet place, remote from road, very clean beach located between hills, place popular with local people, you may want to spend few days here.

name: Şendinç Otomotiv
description: One of the most experienced and competent VW Transporter, T1, T2, T3, T4... mechanics I met in Europe. The prices are very fair, and the work excellent. I am repairing my VW T3 Syncro Turbodiesel here.

name: Clearing in the woods
description: The other Ioverland places nearby are closed, trashed or kind of over grown. But no worries, there are enough places to camp in the area! This place is a open and flat clearing. Nothing special, but quiet, green and good for a night. Turkcell 3G moderate strength.

name: Tazi canyon
description: A must-see place. Great view on the Tazi canyon.

name: Papaz plaji Jenikoy
description:
Standing in dunes, in the tourist season you pay a one-entry fee, campervan 40TL touringcar 75TL so trucks probably in between. Also a picknick place, in the weekend really crowded and Nice atmosphere, outside the season quite peacefull and Nice and No entry... 

The village of yenikoy. Very small, @1 km small shop, breakfast, lunch and diner restaurant....

name: Gorge Club Camping, Restaurant, Bungalows and Caravan
description:
Campground with tree houses, caravan places a resaurant and bungalows. Very close to the entrance of the canyon which is a famous touristic attraction.
Very commercial place. In october one tent (doesnt matter how many people sleep inside) was 80 Lira. Nice seating area with some places in the river.
Nearby is another campground which I didnt check out. They speak english. Lots of outdoor activitys are available.

name: Botanical garden
description: At the zoo and the botanic garden is a lot of parking place, But this one lays behind the park and is relaxed and quiet... with the bikes you can do cekirge in 10 minutes... security came by and Said it was totally ok...

name: Patara beach
description: Huge flat campground  under eucalyptus trees. Big rig friendly.  Due to breeding zones for the endangered sea turtle limited access to the totally wild natural beach over kilometers in july and august.The english speaking, very friendly owner of the restaurant let us use his wifi, toilets and shower and is an excellent cook!! (Tent camping  possible in the nice garden area of his place).

name: Turkey
description: Bolu Hotel. Cheap basic overnight accommodation. Good breakfast. On site parking.

name: Road side water
description: Road side drinking water source. Good pressure! Locals coming to drink from here.

name: Kasta Cadie Zamani Camping
description:
Campground on the other side of the beach with laundry machine for 10 Liea, 2 persons with a tent 60 Lira in october. Nice owner who didn't speak english.
Around the street there are plenty of campgrounds, some have bungalows.

name: Trabzon
description: This is a large well used car park on the sea front. Good for an overnight stop. Not bothered by anyone, a bit of noise from local lads later in the evening but it was the weekend.

name: Toyota Trabzon
description: Great service! Our car was fixed the same day, we could just wait in the lobby with endless cups of Turkish tea ;)

name: Hayal restaurant
description: We had Köfte (patates + içecek) for lunch.It was great. You can find a children play grand in the restaurant. people are so nice.

name: Lakeside
description:
nice place next to the small road and above the lake. several spots possible, maybe little hard to find a flat place. access to the lake. some locals may come by for fishing or barbecue, no one bothered us. 
4G on Turkcell

name: D865
description:
A stopover on the D865. Very quiet overnight stop in a flat area just off the road.  The WiFi is only if you have your own data, but Vodafone 4g worked very well.
There is a possibility for tents but a bit of a scramble up the bank to the right of the quarry,it is flat grass and completely hidden from the road.

name: Official campsite
description: Very basic huge campsite under trees. Gouvernement run. A few Meters to beautiful clean lake. 10 TL entry fee. Many friendly wild dogs around. Looks like very busy in high season. In low season calm and nice.

name: Engin pension and camping
description: Campsite under big trees. Police don't allow camping wild and we checked in here. 80 TL end of September.

name: Gerga
description:
prehistoric site ...maybe prehistoric cult place. Very beautiful, no tourists. 
Camp on parking space at roadside of gravel road.

name: Cildir Peninsula
description: Beautiful and very quiet place on the little Peninsula. There are many places where you could stay. We chose this spot because of the nice view and the flat area. There are trees for shade and you could swim in the lake. At night it's very quiet, no road noise or people around. We could see some fire pits, but there's no fire wood around. Enjoy this place!

name: Yamacdere Cafe, Rafting, Konaklama
description:
Very welcoming place with restaurant. Good spot to park the camper. Food is good, payed 40TRY for meat and salad.
Camping is 50TRY.

name: Turkcell sim
description:
You can by a sim card here. Turkcell and Vodafone shops are next to each other.

Turkcell was 99 lira for 6 gb + 1000 min.

name: Teheran Boutique Hotel
description: Great small hotel. Good and very clean rooms. Parking safe on the other side of the hotel. Great breakfast. English speaking.

name: Before canyon
description: Just off the road to Sallikent canyon, little uphill on unpaved road, 4x4 not required. Absolutely nobody around. Good to visit the canyon in the morning- we read that you can’t stay overnight on canyon parking, so we found this one.

name: All type of shops
description:
Big mall complex with all major shops: 
Clothes + food
Bauhaus
Decatlon

name: D260 Bestepe
description: This is a good spot for overnight stopover. It is off the main highway D260, on the old road which was only used twice by locals. It is sheltered very well from the main road noise. Very large level area. Great outlook.

name: Kizilkaya
description: A very quiet place by the river. A large open space with tree cover by the river. We only had one night here but no reason you couldn’t spend many days and nights with a large group or by yourselves as the area is the other side of the river from the village.

name: Water near Beldibi
description: Fresh and good water from the mountains. Many locals fill their five and ten litre canisters here.

name: Büyük beach
description: Nice clean beach with view on the city, people come during day but leave you completely alone at night. Good swim, but no showers or toilet. Cafe seems abandoned, but trash cans are serviced. Good place for a night in Fethiye.

name: Kevin Volkwagen Özel Servis
description: great place if you have problems with your VW transporter, even if you do not speak Turkish. very honest and professional team!! I came  with my VW T3 Turbodiesel here, and they are giving a great service.

name: Berdan Reservoir
description: Big lake accessible by car with many camp spots. A very nice place so close from Mersin, that was a good surprise !

name: Gölevi Müzikhol
description:
There is a Camping Site, which is on no map.
The Gülem Pley ground was closed. But one of the staff gave me this address. Just 4km same road.
it is 20m from the sea. Restaurant good and cheap, water, power, toilet and shower(not that clean).

name: Alican Sakli Bahce
description: Really nice and idyllic camp spot in a beautiful garden. Price in October 60 TL for 2 persons with camper. Friendly hosts. Basic bathrooms, but hot shower.

name: Sakarya Bicycle House
description:
Sakarya Bisiklet Sevenler Grubu.
It is a kind of bicycle association in Sakarta, Turkey. It is a room that is given to cyclists for free. WC and shower is not bad. very nice people.

name: Decathlon
description: Sports equipment and mountaineering equipment.

name: Beachside
description:
Between the trees at the beach. Many places to park at this beautiful picknick area! We drove a bit further from the entrance. (Track is next to an official fenced picknick area with a restaurant). Some family’s picknick there, but the place was all for us at night. Very quiet off season. Beautiful sunset and full moon. We had a good quiet night. Lot of trees, so be careful with your big rig.
Swimming in the lake is very nice and refreshing! But watch out: the beach is soft, tricky and kind of muddy-ish, don’t get stuck with your car or yourself! That’s why we walked to the very nice and clean official beach close by.

name: Rocky field
description: In a field full of rocks, you will find many possibilities to camp. It is quiet, with some views of the nearby cities and villages. No shade nearby. A little bit bumpy road off the main road leads to this place.

name: Parking Harbor Sinop
description: There is a really big car park next to the harbor. No facilities, but very close to the town. Parking is free.

name: Iran cell simkaart
description: Here you can buy Irancell, guys are super friendly

name: Source near horse range
description: Good running drinking water next to the road in front of a horse -range.

name: Meydan Av
description:
mountaineering, scuba diving ...
great and cheap

name: sleeping near a ford crossing the river
description: There is a ford Crossing the river. We parked before the ford. place is near the street but it was quiet at night. Internet with turk-telekom is 24 mbps.

name: Eksisu Parki
description: Park near Erzincan. People are here for picnic. There is a door at the entrance. Toilets are only open during daylight.

name: drinking water
description: A place where a lot of locals get drinking water

name: Bag camping
description:
Very nice camping with amazing view. The camping itself is run by a very nice family. Places to park a campervan or 4x4. Possibility to rent a tent. Loads of places to pitch a tent in the olive orchard.

There is a bar for drinks. Possibility to have breakfast or dinner. Great Turkish food.

Hot shower available, bathrooms are clean.

Sprinter size Campervan’s will get in here, as will cars with caravans, though I would be cautious about anything bigger

name: mutlular balik evi ve
description:
Private restaurant  place  near the lake the ,only good fish.
Very friendly.
beautiful view.

name: Indiana valley
description: A lovely spot directly by a lake. Lake is very clean. It's quiet at night.

name: Mercedes Mechanic - Yildirim Usta
description:
We had a major engine breakdown nearby Mersin, and had to bring the car here. Many people we asked pointed us to this specialist - Mercedes and engines. 

Within a week he managed to take out the engine, diagnose, get all the parts and put it back together. 

Crankshaft was completely broken, couldn’t be worse than that. The cost of course was expensive but at least all the parts were available. Had it happen earlier in Iran - we would’ve been done...

Anything related to Sprinter - this guy can do.

name: Hillside
description: We found this place while taking an alternative road to Cappadocia from Adana. It's in the hills, close to a road that is almost unused. Friendly shepherd came by a few times. He didn't mind us staying there. If you have a tent, you can find shade underneath the big trees. When in a vehicle, you won't have shade. A bit cell phone reception.

name: Field
description: Nice and beautiful quiet field next to small river, there are some low branches of trees, But we did it with 8 mtr rig and 4 meters high...

name: Kosem restaurant
description: Cheap and delicious local food, prepared by nice ladies. They cook fresh in the morning.

name: Demircili Plaj
description: A stone spit leads out to a small island with a rough track going around it the island.  It is possible to camp with all but big rigs on the spit, and lighter vehicles on the island. In the summer it can get busy. The spit has water on both sides and a very modest marina.  There’s a small commercial campground 100 meters away. Otherwise is quiet. A couple of dogs came and had a bark, then disappeared.  The water is nice, but you’ll want stiff water shoes to plod around and get in the water.

name: Nightspot at lake
description: This spot is OK for a night if you travel with your Campervan. Looks like a former pit stop. The spot is not visible from the small road but from the the highway, not when it's dark anymore though. We had a very quiet night. We saw no one in the evening and no one in the morning. Two staircases lead down to the lake. Water is very clean

name: Best place to see balloons
description: This place is perfect to stay overnight and see the balloons in the morning. There are a few trees that offer some privacy from the road.

name: Shepherds camp
description: Beautiful and very quite spot for the night. It's just a bit of the Highway and from another tarmac road leading to this place. There was goat shepherds sawing us going here but they didn't care. Easy accessible for all kind of vehicles. Very good Vodafone reception.

name: Roadside restaurant
description: Simple roadside restaurant near gas station but all the trucker drivers stop here and indeed the local food is really good for a decent price. Owner is super friendly.

name: Rosarian Hotel Sulan Saray
description: Nice small hotel with nice owner who speaks english well. Nice room for two persons was 100 Lira a night. Opposite of the Karavanserai. Entrance is through a rose products shop.

name: Public street parking
description: Tiny street up the hill, we parked here for a few days in this local neighbourhood. super central location. Ate at this Cafe Bar restaurant, did some online work, strong WiFi, toilet, good coffee, and tattoo bar. Friendly guys. We paid 20 TL per day.

name: Hacilli Kamp
description: River bank near a waterfall. Popular place in Summer/weekends with the locals (no foreigners here). Campfires everywhere and a nice buzz. I guess really quiet during the week / off season. Uneven road to descend to the river bank but normal cars seem to manage it (we had a 4x4).

name: Land Rover mechanic and parts
description: We were recommended this place by locals using Defenders for tours. Baris is a very skilled mechanic with a lot of knowledge. He doesn't speak English, but there are many guys around who can translate. It's located at the back of Cappadox tour. Ask for him and you will be send down and offered a cup of tea. They asked reasonable prices and had parts in stock.

name: Out in the fields
description:
Very nice place. Leave the main road at Beğendik and follow the paved road for
 a few hundred meters then turn right into the unpaved road and then again right. There are several possibilities along this road. Just find the one you like. You can hear the street a bit but you are totally invisible.

name: Abandoned Camp site
description: Former campside? Or closed for winter? Fishermen park up here and so did we. Access to a beach, nothing pretty but perfect for a quiet night with a fire.

name: Little spot next to a stream
description: Just off the road to The seven lakes, crossing an undeep stream, setting up camp between the trees.

name: Torba North
description:
Dirt track North out of Torba tales you along the coast. The track stops at this point, and there’s room for small rig camping, and a couple of spots for a tent.  There were a couple of locals fishing off the beach, otherwise very quiet.  Storey beach, good swimming (and fishing)
Do not approach on the track heading from the other direction; it takes you through a private community beyond which the track is impassable.

name: Water from tab
description: Water coming from a tab. Easy accessible.

name: Sakli koy camping
description:
It's a nice camping place right in front of the Marmara Sea. The owner, Apo, is very friendly and helpful. It is possible to park the motorcycle in front of the tent. You can also buy something to drink like Coca Cola, Fanta, beer, water... There is a kitchen that you can use and toilet for man and woman, also shower and electricity available.
Nice dpot best to chose in this region!

name: Phaselis old Greek ruins
description: Very beautiful and preserved ruins of the antique Greek town of Phaselis. Dotted among the pine trees and beaches, It's a very beautiful visit.

name: Water treatment oludeniz
description:
There are not many to park for free in the low part of oludeniz. Up the road to babadag you might find Some. But than you are far away from beaches and shops. We found this place and asked the employee of the water treatment If we could camp and it was No problem.

We stayed for 6 nights. We even emptied our black water directly in the bassin. And got water. With help from employees.

I always recommend to ask before camping. Very friendly people. 24hrs around... don’t know what happends If regular campers or trucks arrive in future due to this post. So keep updating!

name: Among Trees
description: It's a nice place to stay overnight if you're on your way to something else. Not very special, but clean and there's shade from the trees. No noise from the road and no one came by. At the beginning of the gravel road there's a water well.

name: Iliç
description: Official park by a mosque with beautiful view. Might be busy during the day: people bbq-ing etc.. But very quiet during night. Police came to check but no problem camping here.

name: Isolated Camping
description: Perfect spot to see the balloons. Perfect sunset and sunrise. There is place to make a campfire. Acces is a bit difficult with loaded bicycle but it is possible. Go to the end of the parking lot with cafés. Follow the trail starting by the toilets. There are a few stairs on the trail but I could walk my bike next to it. Follow the single-track and you come on the plateau. You can camp anywhere. There is a fountain next to the last cafe to take water.

name: Madeni Yag Servisi
description: If you need service be done I can recommend this garage. Did an oil and filter change, grease and a look over. Landcruiser needs 11 l oil. Paid 450 tl

name: BEER, near Amsterdam Bar
description:
After a month in iran, me, as a german (who starts to get ill after one month without beer), searched for some cans of beer in Erzurum. Wasn't so easy.
But here it is: ice cold and fresh, Efes, Tuborg, etc. Well, no german stuff, but that's o.k. in that case

name: Water tap
description: Tap where the locals fill up their bottles.

name: Monastery Viewpoint
description: The Monastery is under renovation, no real point going in (you can, pay 10TL but you see nothing). Still it is a great area to visit. Head for this spot and camp at night to see the morning sun shining on the Monastery. In November: nobody here.

name: Picnic Area with drinking water
description:
Picnic area next to the road with (drinking) water, tables and wc.

Nice view of the sea but a bit noisy due to the proximity to the road.  
Accessible to any type of vehicle (larger trucks must leave by the entrance road).

Probably there will be some locals grilling with the comunal barbecues.

Ok for one night or just to fill the water tanks.

name: Restaurant
description:
Good restaurant with turkey doner or pide or chicken.
Very tasty and low prices.

name: Picnic Area
description: One of the better public places along the coast. The road going down to a plateau is steep but good. On the plateau you have some picnic facilities like trash bins and tables. It is well covered with trees and has a little path going down to a private beach. On the beach there is a natural, freshwater source. Only few trash, might be more crowded in the summer. In November we were basically alone. Strong 4G turkcell connection. Big rigs will have trouble doing the sharp turnes!

name: Kahvehan Cafe
description: Very good small family cafe, owner speaks English and was extremely helpful, Turkish coffee was excellent as was the food, if you need food and coffee with friendly help this is your place

name: Kayseri park
description: 2 parkings places with a lot of space.  Ok for big rigs. There is a park for walking and some shops around this place. Quiet at night

name: Özel Tatvan Private Hospital
description: Clean, small private hospital with good services. Only the management and the doctors speak English.

name: Overnight stay between rundown hotel and small Mosque
description: We asked at the hotel reception, if we are allowed to stay over night on the parking lot. We were told this relatively quiet place.

name: Camping Spot at the Kervanserei Lodge
description: Place next to the guesthouse with a beautiful view of the countryside. It also organizes trips to the Nemrut Dagi. The sanitary facilities we did not check, as not used. Very quiet dring night. The road to the guesthouse and further on to the nemrut Dagi is narrow and very steep but througly with solid road surface. At the Nemrut Dagi it is possible also for Big Rig's to stay over night on the flat, where the Shuttle busses stay.

name: Gürün: Safe place to stay next to rest stop.
description: We were allowed to stand for free next to the rest area with restaurant, supermarket and Shell gas station. The night was relatively quiet.

name: MAN Service Yasar Kardesler
description: MAN does not speak English here. Still good service! A mixture of good quality work and you still have to keep an eye on the work and control it. We were very satisfied. Next door are small shops where you can buy the well-known dried meat products from Kayseri.

name: Place at Sunset Point next to the road
description: This place is suitable for bad weather (rain), because not far from the road. Nice View. Quiet at night. No nightly harassment here.

name: Han Airport Hostel - hotel
description:
Nice hotel for one night .. I arrived too late and I found it! 
They have parking in the yards but not gated, but safe
22€ private room with breakfast.

name: Place under the Terraces
description: We stayed here for two nights, but only when it was already dark. We were sent out of the North parking lot at night. A quiet and from the street little visible place. If you drive further into the fields, it will even be better. You should not pitch a tent here. Only for self-sufficient vehicles with own toilett.

name: Big Rig Parking to 5M Migros Supermarket
description: Here you can easily reach the Migros Supermarket and park also with aBig Rig.

name: Dharma Beach, near by
description: Access point to beach camping near Dharma Beach

name: Onen Koyu
description:
Small cove accessible by a long dirt track. 2WD small rig access. Beautiful cove, clear seawater. Beach itself not too clean. Good level camping spots.

Access is via the wind farm access track, which itself can be accessed at:

 	Latitude:	38º 14' 23" N
 	Longitude:	26º 44' 17" E

name: PERGAMON PENSION
description:
nice pension "hotel " 
private room 60 lira 
super delicious breakfast 20 lira, and I parked the bike in the house of the owner just in the front . super safe 
good WiFi 
it's possible to put tent for 20 lira . only 2 tent I think . small garden .

name: Mavi kose
description:
Amazing sandwich and Kola for 20 lira
nice owner

name: Bei der Kanone
description:
Nice place right next to the big cannon. Space for several vehicles directly on the water. Maybe also above the cannon?

Netter Platz direkt bei der grossen Kanone. Platz für mehrere Fahrzeuge direkt am Wasser. Eventuell auch oberhalb der Kanone?

name: Between the road and rail line
description:
It's a place between the main road and the rail line, there's something like a field with some threes and lot of space for camping or parking. It's near the lake.
At night came a man that lives here and said that there was no problem to camp and that it's a safe place, even invited us to go to his house if we were in need.

name: Very near Karacus Tümülüsu
description:
It's a souvenir/coffee shop and we asked for the SR. that lives here if we can stay and he offered us a room with lot of space for putting our camping stuff inside his shop/house and also using his simple but very useful bathroom.
We paid him 30lira for the night inside (a couple) and parking a car with our friend and his dog.
The owner is an old man very kind!
The place is just beside Karakus Tümülüsü and you can also camp here, if the weather is good, because there is lots of space.

name: Next to Cleopatra Beach
description:
Nice camp spot next to the cleopatra beach. A few locals come here to go fishing. 
A supermarket is 5 min walk away (cold beer!) 
Internet connection over Turkcell is perfect (LTE at full speed)

name: Water tap
description:
Clear and cool water right next to street. Good flow.
Locals fill up their bottles here.
Easy Parking!

name: Devin Hotel
description:
Nice amazing hotel 
100 Lira private room with amazing breakfast 
Parking in the backyards

name: Look out tower
description: Very nice new wooden look out tower. Beautiful views, very quiet. Right next to road.

name: Wild camp in the forrest
description:
A beautiful grassy field nestled in the heart of the forest.

A small dirt road runs next to the area with little or no traffic.  Locals slow down to take a look but no curious inquiries. 

Suitable for most however the entrance area may be too steep for some larger motor homes. This area is large enough to accommodate several vehicles. 

Trash however was a problem when we arrived.  Cleaned and packed out most of the material.

Ownership of the area is unknown.

name: Room room motel
description:
nice new hotel , safe parking . good internet 
112 lira with out breakfast 
160 with breakfast 
good for stay overnight 
a lot of place for eat around here

name: Velo Maris bike shop
description:
Nice bike shop on marmaris.
The owner is really cool he helped us a lot!

name: Spring water
description: Water from a spring by the road, super cold, but tasty.

name: Next to the Muradiye waterfalls
description: Gravel parking lot next to the Muradiye waterfalls. It was super quiet during the night, but this was off-season, it will be busier in summer.

name: Next to river/dam
description: Great view of wide river (near dam). Easy access. Off secondary road, so not much traffic (none at night)—quiet. Only local fishermen, friendly. Trees are short, so no shade. Not trashy. Turkcell LTE, moderate strength. Probably lots of other places off of the road—didn’t check.

name: Muradiye waterfalls
description: Beautiful waterfalls, possibly quite touristic in high season, but empty in December.

name: Atayurt campsite
description: Amazing campsite just beside the lake. In the door its written 2lira but they charge me nothing because I said I just want to stop for lunch and rest but I guess its no problem to stay overnight. It's a campsite but you can park little bit further under the trees. Toilet available. Nice place, one of the best sunsets I've seen!

name: Limón Hostel
description:
nice hostel 
have kitchen.
nice owner and free tea
9€ 4 bed room 
parking inside only 1-2 motorbikes max.
and car for outside

name: unisite hotel
description:
very nice hotel apart ( small kitchen ) 
parking outside but safe place 
amazing breakfast and room 
100 tl include breakfast

name: Water fountain
description: Fountain with water, probably from the mountains. Not sure if it's potable, but there is an official water sign next to the road to point at the place. There was also a drinking cup hanging there.

name: Canyon Kazankaya
description: Très calme, aller au bout de la route il y a des toilettes et des jeux pour enfants

name: Gul restaurant
description:
Very friendly stuff and good food. They let me sleep in the parking lot. been invite to lots of chay and beer. Toilet also available. Very helpful owner 
and happy to see tourist. wifi very fast

name: Free Parking Center
description: Free parking in the old city center. no facilities but good spot for the night, good views from the city.  Market and coffee shop around, you can walk everywhere from here. Quiet at night but busy at morning. the other private parking it shows in the map it was close, this one its much better option, closest to center and free! :)

name: Grand Aga Hotel
description:
Nice Hotel with Sauna, Hammam and Steam Bath. You can order a massage.
Moreover you have a great view on the Ararat mountain!
We paid 225 Lira for one night.

name: Vehicle Number Plates
description: Small shop where they make custom number plates. Our plate got stolen in Iran so we needed a new one. 100Tl per piece, pressed in metal - looks like an original.

name: Marmaris Marina Carpark
description: Very close to the center of Marmaris, the marina carpark makes a useful overnight stop.  24 hour parking costs 30TL and the parking attendant was aware of our intention to camp, and offered advice as to where to find toilets and showers. The gravel carpark is of a good size, though can get full later in the day. We camped in December, but reports from others suggest in the summer it can get noisy from nearby discos. Security was good and the marina offered shops, restaurants etc.

name: Yaziköy Plaj
description:
Beach camping about 15 minutes before you reach Knidos on the Datça Peninsula. Google maps suggests that there is an established campground here, but nothing could be seen of this. There is a restaurant of sorts, but it is closed for the season (visited in December). There is a steepish track down the the beach, but 2WD capable, and space to turn at the bottom. 
Beach is pleasant, but stoney. Good location to stop on visiting the Knidos ruins. 3G reception on VODAFONE.

name: Emiroglu Konak
description:
Very clean, modern guesthouse set back from the main road, in a traditional house with modern interior. 90TL for 1p in double room; 135TL for 2 in double (low season). Excellent bathrooms--no 'cupboard bathrooms' here. 

Gated, covered parking for 4 motorcycles and more uncovered spots too . Reasonably safe street parking for cars, but old streets are very narrow for larger vehicles. Secure pay parking lot along main road. 

Check hotels.com for rates.

name: Public beach
description: This site of the river is very quiet. Only some fishermen came by. We just parked next to the old wooden buildings. Probably more busy in summer. Had two quiet nights here. Can be a bit windy. A lot of garbage on the beach because of an earlier storm. But great place for sunsets.

name: on the beach
description: Nice and quiet place in January. the end of the beach street. beautiful view. The police came at night but didn't knock on the door. in the morning they pass again and talk gently. some friendly dogs. showers are walking to the north. 4 places. cold water. this is a Muslim country so use a swimming suit.

name: Airplane Restaurant
description: Here is a restaurant inside an old airplane. Playground for kids, lots of fun. Prices are cheaper than most restaurants along toll road.

name: Urla Off Road Garage
description:
Very Friendly Garage with experience with Jeep, Land Rover, Land Cruiser and all American Cars.  All Asian 4x4 cars.
Tuning, Electric and Camping Works. very cheap and fair price...
Yasar contact 05556979514

name: OTO Cem Auto Servis
description: Nice guys, they changed my fuel filter very fast. The speak no English but with google translate all was fine.

name: Forest near beach
description: A small forest near the beach. On weekends (and probably also in summer) it can be busy at the beach and around the edges of the forest. We parked at the end of the forest where it was more quiet. A lot of tracks go into the forest. Enough place for everyone. Quiet night. Easy to reach from D400.

name: Land Rover Mechanic Ezmir
description:
Land Rover mechanic in Ezmir that can probably work on other cars as well. We had some work done on our Defender here. 

There’s also a parts shop very close where you can get all sorts of stuff for any Land Rover. The place is located in the industrial area so you can find a lot of parts and hardware here.

The mechanics doesn’t speak English but there’s a lady working in a shop close to the workshop that works as their translator.

name: Stopover in the bush
description:
We camped here one night because we arrived late and wanted to take the ferry in the morning. There’s a lot of small hidden spots here around of what looks like a parking. Some of the spots are inaccessible with a big rig but you can defiantly find a spot here with a truck as well :)

We were not able to camp by the canon mentioned at the other wildcamp due to wind. This place however works just fine if you stay in a roof top tent. 

We had police come when we were setting up camp, they said that they just passed by and we’re wondering what we were doing. Super nice and after we explained that we just stayed for sleeping they left us with good nights wishes.

name: Picknick Area
description: Just a place to stay. No facilities. I was here in the winter. much snow and in the daytime many families for picnics. Many houses but nobody lives here, maybe in the summertime.

name: Aygaz fuel station
description:
This is a fuel station. But, if you find the right person to talk to, you can get gas bottles filled... We have 5kg German bottles. There is an Aygaz filling plant about 200m away. They refused us and sent us here.
One of the attendants has a 'home-made' adaptor device.
Use this place at your own risk - we were getting desperate...

name: Ingiliz Burnham (English Nose) Peninsula
description:
Around the bay from Foca, this beautiful campsite sits on a small peninsular and offers beach or headland sites to park up. I don’t think it’s a formal paid campground, in the winter at least, but camping is allowed and in the summer apparently there’s toilets. 
Foca is one of the most beautiful villages on the Aegean coast, and this campsite does it justice. It has views overlooking Foca which is about a mile away.

name: Volkswagen Garage
description: It is a quite new garage with very helpful stuff. They don’t speak English but with google translation it’s will be fine. They changed my oil and the Filter. They use Castrol oil.

name: Next to the lake
description: Close to the city of Tekirdağ. You are staying next to the lake in a quiet and nice place. The campground is not that straight but it's acceptable.

name: Camp side next to the lake
description: Nice view to the lake, many trees, nobody disturbs you.

name: Abandoned farm
description: An open place on the hill. Probably an abandoned sheep shelter. Could still be private land, but we didn't see anyone. Not a lot of flat space, but good enough for one night. (The other place nearby was visible from the road, so we went here.)

name: beach camp
description:
You can drive off the road and on a pebble beach outside a little harbour.
Some trash but very quit and 20m away from the water.
Inside the little harbour there is a more clean sand beach. But then you are in between some boat houses.

name: At Public Beach
description: Just for the night. It’s near the public beach in a small street. Maybe in the summer it’s difficult to stay here but you can try it. Along the street many places. But it’s in the city.

name: Next to the Sea
description: A long this street you will find any places where you can stay over night or maybe more. But check here also houses. I’m here in the off-season.

name: Ballon Viewpoint
description: Those who come to Cappadocia or Göreme of course want to see the hot air balloons take off early in the morning. The place is flat and very quiet at night, during the day a tour group with quads passes here and there. This was a great place to see the balloons. In the valley to the left, many balloons are launching, directly in sight. In the valley on the right, more balloons are passing this place, which are still launching somewhere. You stand in the middle of the valley and can watch the balloons from here. Additionally, there are some footpaths, so that one can also walk to other view points in the surroundings.

name: Sultansuyu lake
description:
Moderator Note: Some neighbours reported that site might be dangerous.

A dam and lake near the D300. We just parked next to a dirt road.
In the evening two cars came by. First said it was no problem to stay there. Second said it was dangerous, because of hunters and wild boars.
The night was very quiet. In the morning Jandarma came by, no problems. Fine for one night, because of lack of spots in this area.

name: Oktay Engine Service
description: The best motorcycle repair shop in Istanbul

name: Shell station for motorway sticker
description: Here you can purchase the motorway sticker. It's needed for certain motorways especially the ones around Istanbul.

name: Camping at the beach
description: Camping for one night is ok but there is nothing to get food ore water. Maybe you have got luck and helpful persons offer you these things. It is also not a quiet place.

name: Nemrut Dagi
description:
Nemrut Dağı (Kurdish: Çiyayê Nemrûd, Armenian: Նեմրութ) is a World Heritage Site in Eastern Anatolia, in the Turkish province of Adıyaman. At 2150 meters, it is the highest mountain in the northern two-stream country (Mesopotamia). At the top of the mountain, in a 50-meter-high pyramid-shaped burial mound, King Antiochus Theos (69 - 40 BC) is probably buried at Kommagene. In front of the burial mound is a complex of colossal stone sculptures by King Antiochus himself, flanked by two lions, two eagles and several Greek, Armenian and Persian gods, such as Zeus, Tyche and Mithras. The stone heads of the statues surround the burial mound.
---
Nemrut Dağı (Koerdisch: Çiyayê Nemrûd, Armeens: Նեմրութ) is een werelderfgoed in Oost-Anatolië, in de Turkse provincie Adıyaman. Met 2150 meter is het de hoogste berg van het noordelijke Tweestromenland (Mesopotamië). Op de top van de berg, in een 50 meter hoge grafheuvel in de vorm van een piramide, is waarschijnlijk koning Antiochus Theos (69 - 40 v.Chr.) van Kommagene begraven. Voor de grafheuvel staat een complex met kolossale stenen sculpturen van koning Antiochus zelf, geflankeerd door twee leeuwen, twee adelaars en verscheidene Griekse, Armeense en Perzische goden, zoals Zeus, Tyche en Mithras. Rondom de grafheuvel liggen de stenen hoofden van de beelden.

name: Pacific Gas Station
description: Here it is possible to get your truck tire repaired and also get a wash for the truck. Breakfast and food is also available. Very friendly.

name: Beach Parking
description: Huge beach parking with sandy beach as well as parking on a paved flat parking. Very quiet, could be more traffic on weekend. 10 min footwalk to the nice little town of Yumurtalik. Very delicious food on the harbour restaurants. We spend 2 days here in February.

name: Good ground near the road
description: Good spot where you can camp easily, just is a little close to main road.

name: 24h Parking Istanbul
description:
A good place to park your car over a few days while visiting Istanbul. We have been there for 3 days and slept in our car. No problem. One day costs 30TL which is quite cheap.
Bus station directly in front of the parking lot. It is secured by fences and by one person 24h. 
It is quiet for the location directly in the city. One night people came and listened loud music, but they stayed only 1hour and at 22o'clock it was quiet again.

name: Park slot between Ürgip and Avantis
description: Carpark with views. Earthy and flat.  Next to the road but quiete at night

name: Kayali
description: PickNick area 2018 next to the new bridge

name: PickNick areas along the river
description: Between the car bridge and peatonal bridge there are several PickNick areas with restaurant and services

name: Diyarbakir - wall entrance from south
description: Parking along the street arriving to the Wsll from the south. Between a line of tee shops and the promenade and terrace with views out the Tigris. Totally quiete at night  dispite of be in the street

name: Dara - Querry
description: Roman quarry arriving Dana. In the middle of the fields. Views. Quiete day and night

name: Dara Antik Kenti
