description: Dara garden of the tee shop face to the main gate of the Entrance to the ruines

name: Beach East of Side
description: Open land parking behind the beach clubs.  There is a bit of shade.  We arrived on a Sunday in early March and there were a few people around.  Night was very quiet.  Easy access from the main road although the last part is on potholed dirt track,  but driveable. Police drove past once but never approached us.  This is a big area so finding a spot shouldn't be a problem.

name: Escape spot for windy nights
description:
We came here because it was a windy day and we searched a place where we can stay a little covered. It is surrounded by rocks and is nearby the cave-church.
It's even, but has only place for maximum 3 cars on the little Hill. Over the day there will be tourists coming, but to escape from the wind it was a perfect spot for one night and very quite. We have been here off season. Only negative point: there is some dirt in the back area.

name: Vali Pension
description: Great guest house, incredible views from upper balcony, very clean, kitchen, hot water. Get room 1 or 5 if you can. Off season rate 100 TLL.

name: Landoff, Defender Workshop
description: We searched for a workshop to fix a problem with our Defender 110. Most Land Rover workshops in Ankara can't fix Defenders, so after 3 different stops we have been sent here. Many Defenders already stood here. As we had a little problem with the brakes, they fixed it very fast. They had been very friendly and did a great job. I can't say something about the prices because they didn't charge us for that small repairing. Amazing! So if you have a problem with your Defender you should take a try here.

name: Parking Ankara
description: If you want to visit Ankara, this is a good spot to sleep quite for beeing directly in the city. We paid a price of 10 TL for one night here, which is very cheap. Also, there are Toilets 100m besides a few restaurants.

name: Big parking by the sea
description: Big parking by the sea. Quite a few locals at night, quieter later on. Police came to check, all good. Convenient for an overnight stay.

name: Adilcevaz -quay
description: pier of a marina before entering the city.  level and wide.  very calm

name: 7 kita gas station with park
description: A very nice gas station to spend a night. Bathrooms, makeshift shower (just a hose from the wall, but worked perfectly for us). A very green little park with children’s playground on the facilities. Very friendly staff!

name: Parking at Beykoz Koruzu Park
description:
We found a nice flat parking at Dilruba Restaurant inside Beykoz Park.
We stayed here one night for free. After midnight they close gate until early in the morning. 
Water in the park, and toilette at restaurant.

name: Abit Adana Cycling Community Sports Club
description:
Bicycle travelers are accepted to camp. There is WC Water, electricity.

Kamp kurmaya bisikletli gezginlr kabul edilir. Wc var Su, elektirik var.

name: Water Tap
description: Water Tap next to a mosque. Good pressure to fill up water tank.

name: Cavustepe - Hayjaber Kalesi
description: On the top of the hill Great views flat parking place Windy probably

name: Park place in the promenade
description:
Park in the street along the beach. Next to a restaurant/ market “Rose” 
Tomato & paprika greenhouses
Quiete at night. Friendly neighbors at Rose

name: Quiet spot on the lake shore
description: It was getting dark and I needed a place where to park, this is very nice and quiet. No frills but convenient for an overnight stay.

name: Wild Camping near Ereğli
description: A little field just off the D010 coastal road great for wild camping, space for tents.

name: Picknick area in Büyükdere on the way to Arsuz
description: PickNick area by the see. Grassy and flat. Easy access . Perfect for a bath in the sea. During the summer season probably will be crowded during the day due to easy access and the quality of the place

name: Uzuncaburc wood area
description: 4 km from town, approx, take a unpaved track on the right.

name: Kizkalesi beach
description: Paved area just at the entrance of the beach. Next to a kiosk, so probably only good out of season

name: Zeyve Pazari Otopark
description: Oy park in construction clean  and quiete

name: Tap water by the road
description: Tap water. Natural water from well. Signal of tap water so we have assumed is potable. It is in fact very tasty

name: Eskibag - flat area next to the wired road
description: Flat spot in a wired mountain road . Before and after sources of water at a few hundred of meters. Good views. Quiete

name: Park on abandoned road
description: Flat area next to main road with shadow and quiete at night

name: Roman  Bridge next to the river
description: Several  camp spots next to the river at both sides of the bridge. Some of them tent friendly

name: 4x4 Garaj
description:
4x4 Garaj Club—Servet, former off-road racer, is a great guy and mechanic!! Recommended by a local off-roader, Servet welded my cracked LC 78 front axel housing that the Toyota dealer In Tbilisi didn’t want to attempt. Very thorough mechanic—he also checked bearings, brakes and replaced hub seals. Since he builds off road trucks and  also makes custom after market accessories like bullbars (saw him bending 3 1/2 mm thick tubing!), we had him install custom fender flares/mudflap extenders and also weld up a battery box for the in-cabin Li battery. Also saw him clean the considerable crap out of the diesel tank of an overlander  LC78. Our Istanbul contact showed us the nice custom drawer system Servet installed in their new Jeep. Like other mechanic work I’ve had done in Turkey, Servet’s prices are very reasonable. Highly recommended.

(Due to coronavirus lockdown, we worked with Servet from December to June!!)

name: Park between houses and beach.
description: Park between city and beach. Many trees and good shadows. WC module 1,5 TlL, Showers on the beach. Bar

name: Hotel Grand Silopi
description:
Decent hotel in Silopi. Ideal if you want to cross the border or just crossed it. Things can be a little dated, but it's all doable. Prices around 20/30 euro a night for a double room, depending on time of year and your own negotiation skills. You can pay in Lira, but probably also Dollars. You can pay by card as well. If you leave the hotel and walk 50meters to the left, you will find the BIM supermarket.
Car parking isn't secured (only camera's). But it felt safe enough. We stayed here 2 nights in February and 2 nights in June.
Staff doesn't speak a lot of English, but will use Google Translate if needed and are really friendly.

name: Derek Nature Park
description:
20 mins off the main road just outside the town of Derek. A good stop if heading East to Mardin. 
The location has springs, swimming cave and waterfalls. There is some road and facility building as the town develops this into a picnic park. 
From the park location, drive up onto the plateau where there is lots of flat ground and camping choices.

name: Next to small river
description:
We parked the car at the end of the dead-end road that is visible on the map. Stayed here for 4 nights without problems. There is less wind here than in other places, but no shadow. The larger river is on the other side of the road. Not a lot of traffic comes by. Only some friendly waiving locals. Saw wild boars. Two street dogs, but didn't even bark and stayed at a distance.

No cell reception at camping spot. Only if you walk down to the big river or up the hill.

name: Water source
description: A lot of locals stop here to fill bottles. Use a bottle or Jerrycan to fill up your tank. There is enough space to park the car.

name: The peacock place
description: If you don't want to camp at the nearby (windy) peninsula you can go here. It's a small but very clean picknick place run by a kind family (they don't speak English). We spend 2 quite nights here and paid 80 lira. The D300 is close by, but it's not annoying. There are a lot of farm animals including a peacock. We could use their washing machine for free. Shower is cold! Toilet is not the best. You can park next to Van Lake.

name: fresh water next to chai house
description: here you get fresh drinking water next to a chai stall. nice atmosphere.

name: Emrullah Usta Grill Restaurant
description:
This place is awesome, best food I had so far in 1 month traveling 10 countries!
super warm and friendly staff.
Try the mixed grill platter it's not low budget but at 60TL you get something else there, 5 star!
It's just 300m walking from the camping kapidag

name: Wild camp in the woods close to main road
description: Big flat spot in the woods close to the main road but very well hidden. Some locals came here to picknick. The road is quit at night and no one can see you because of the hills. Take the old way up and drive to the flat spot.

name: Köprülü rafting camping
description: Nice camping, friendly owner, hot shower, restaurant and open all year. There are also camp places in front of the river, grassy area. Price was in low season 50TL for 2 person and car. Nice and clean facilities, camping is almost new.

name: Riverside close to Aspendos
description:
Nice big flat area next to the river. Some locals came for fishing and bbq but very quit at night. Drive a bit more to the right direction for more privacy. 

Be careful when there is heavy rain our wind, the water level can rise very quick and high.

The place is very central, Aspendos is close and the Olive cave is an well worth visit. Is also on the way, or back from the Tazi Canyon (highly recommended).

name: Don’t miss this place, best breakfast ever
description: Your trip to Turkey isn’t complete is you haven’t visit this place. It’s an breakfast restaurant with an amazing breakfast. You can eat here the hole day a breakfast. After the breakfast you  don’t need any food the hole day. Highly recommended!!  Price for a breakfast is 70TL for 2 persons

name: Hill top wild camp
description: Nice place on the top of the hill. It’s next to some ancient buildings. There are some houses nearby but you can park your car hidden behind some trees. Good views. The road to the hill is steep so make sure that you’re vehicle is not to long and to heavy (4x4 recommended).

name: In Between two Hills
description: Good cover for wind, shade from the side of the forest, quite, no people, you can also camp further up hill and get view. We just had too much wind, and prefere to sleep quitely in our rooftop tent. The Wild Wils Family

name: Grassy field near abandoned castle town
description: Nice place close to the abandoned castle town Burj al babas. It’s hard to find a flat spot but possible. We followed the dirt track from the main road and than drive uphill. Completely quiet at night.

name: Ada Camping
description: Old time and popular campsite. Walking distance to nice beach.

name: On the Storkfield before the Ararate.
description:
On the Storkfield before the Ararate. 
Very quiet, sometimes friendly Kurdish shepherds come past the herds. 
Do not continue to go to the swamp. Hundreds of birds, mainly Storks.
4G.

name: military Zone, don't try to find the ark this direction!
description: military Zone, don't try to find the ark this direction

name: Noah Arch shall landed here!
description:
Beautiful view over the valley and to the Ararats. 
But the exibition house is closed and all is full of garbidge here.
If you like to have a nice view from a quiet place, it's ok, but for more it's not worth to come here!
4G.

name: An absolutely peaceful place over the flood plain.
description:
An absolutely peaceful place over the flood plain.  
Fantastic view, sometimes the shepherds come by with their herds.  
There is only this one surface in the fork in the road.
sometimes 4G.

name: Bağtur Aile camping
description:
Very nice campsite with lots of shady spots and big trees. They have a nice private beach and a cafe/ bar. Facilities are coming from Europe simple, coming from easy great. They have a normal toilet and a hot shower. Definitely the best choice in this area. Make sure that you choose the right camping, there are two others in the same street but they don’t have any shade. 

Not the cheapest camping in Turkey, we paid 50 TL pp.

name: Tekel beer and spirits shop
description:
Tekel beer and spirits shop,
Carlsberhg 130 TL, Tuborg 160 TL.

name: MAN Truck & Bus Service
description:
MAN Truck & Bus Service,
they have the Main parts (like filters) on stock.

name: High plateau on the old silk road. hidden place.
description:
High plateau on the old silk road.  A hidden place with a huge view over 180 °.  The old road is no longer used, but you can hear the new one.  
The plateau is heaped up rock from the construction of the new road.  
If you don't stand on the edge, you will not be seen from anywhere.  4G.

name: Dry riverbed.
description:
quiet place in the old, dry riverbed.
Hugh variety of waterbirds, frogs.
Only one shepherd with his goats came by, sometimes H+.

name: Uzuncaburc drinking water 2 taps, no thread.
description:
Uzuncaburc drinking water 2 taps, no thread.
Medium pressure.

name: Drinking water at Petrol Ofisi
description:
Very good pressure!
On the right side of the petrol station is a red-black hose in the grass.
No threads. The guard wanted 10 TL for 200 L, I give him 20.

name: Travertine near Dereiçi
description:
Beautiful mountains with travertines (like Pamukkale), small, but very nice surroundings. 
The road to this place is very scenic.

name: Lakeside
description: A long peninsula with several campspots, beautiful sunsets on one site, nice moon view and view on Van on the other site. In the morning cows pass by.

name: Campspots next to river,near Bahçesaray
description: Nice spot next to river. (Cold!) bahçesaray only in summer reachable because of heavy snow. Very scenic road

name: Moto Adv Garage
description: Motorcycle Mechanical service. Mechanical Service and Sapare Part.

name: Lakeside
description:
Very nice spot with view on the lake, Tat-van and Nemruth.

It’s a flat gravel parking, we spend two nights.
There’s a dirt-track down to the beach. Steep, and bumpy but doable with 4x4. Also trucks possible... but we thought the place upstairs was much better. There are many places at beach possible around the lake.
Ofcourse we cleaned lots of plastics and toilet papers... will probably be the same when you arrive..

name: Street Parking
description:
Street Parking close to the castel. Small side Street with square and long parking space. Close to the castel very central. We could get there with our 10t Camper.
Just one small shady place.
Police visited to check our passport but said there was no problem visiting overnight.

name: Potable Water free in front of Bogaz Keyfi Cafe
description: Drinking Water for free. In front of die Cafe Bogaz Keyfi

name: Picnic area. Place to fill up with water
description: Various places for a barbeque along the seafront with taps for drinking water

name: By the lake
description: Nice place where the locals go fishing. Nice and quiet at night

name: Sultandağlı
description: Very professionel and experienced Mercedes truck service. We stopped here with problems on our front axle of an 4x4 Vario. Everything was fast and thoroughly fixed. They don't speak English, but with Google translate it works fine.

name: Beach Parking
description: Nice Spot right at the beach. Some lokal campers are there as well. Close to the Airport.

name: rocky cove
description: small sheltered cove between two stone cliffs. small creek and a potable water source. nice rocky beach. lots of kind people on summer weekends. shadowy spots can be found. to get here: turn right before you cross the creek (its not very well visible at the gravel road, but if u are unsure, Google should get you to the spot anyways)

name: Up on the hills
description: This is a beautiful spot in the wild. You need a 4x4 (all sizes) to get here. Besides some cows you will not meet anyone up here. Beautiful view and almost stable 4G.

name: Riverside
description: Long river, lots of places, some pretty some not so pretty. Good for a night but be careful of water levels as it’s controlled by the reservoir and can ride at any time. Lucky for us it went down a metre and not up a metre!

name: Oto Murat Tamir Bakim Onarim
description:
Got our wheels aligned here on the machine, very quick, helpful, 70 lira. 

This area has lots of mechanics shops.

name: Perre Antik Kent
description: 10 lira entrance, 2000 year old stone city. Recently partly excavated. 2000-2009... very nice, lot of caves and very big

name: Quit beach camping / piknick
description: Nice camp spot. Up to beach with lot’s of shade... water showers and toilet available. 50tl a night in high season. Probably closed off-season. Ofcourse there is rubbish of Turkish locals. But it looked less than on other places.. 😃... still not getting used to this

name: Picknick area..
description: In summertime there are waterplant on the picknick area. With a hose 20 meter you can reach first one from carpark

name: Yeniguven Motosiklet electric
description: Very smart motorcycle electrician. Had a vast knowledge of all motorcycles and their electronics

name: Inceler motor
description: lots of parts and very knowledgeable mechanics.

name: Gökçesu Restoran and Camping
description:
Checked in here because neighboring Köprülü Camping was unattended.
Nice campground and restaurant with fresh own fish. Big rigs possible. Run by a very friendly family. We payed 80 Lira for caravan 2 adults + 2 kids. Parking directly on the river, lots of shade.

name: Balikligol
description: Beautiful park with fish pond, where the prophet Abraham was said to be thrown to the fire from the mountain. Free entry.

name: Talat Göktepe Pine Grove Campground
description:
Campground and picnic area, 40 TRY for one night, includes showers and toilets (didn’t try showers, toilets were clean enough. 
Access to electricity included, lots of space to camp amongst the pines. Lots of rubbish bins, not much litter around. Very pleasant for a few days stay, we only stayed one night. Right next to main road so sound of cars all the time.

name: Çamlik Restaurant
description: Perfect roadside stop, meat cooked above wood, comes with large side salads bread and water, we had 3 lamb kebabs and 2 chicken wing kebabs and it was more than we should have ordered. He stopped us ordering more 80 TRY for the lot, very good value.  Clean toilets at back.

name: Göynük Beach
description:
Beachside camping spot, popular with locals, lots of buses stop here to rest during the day.
Stayed in October 2019 for one night, was busy but no problems, we parked under the trees, a few cars driving past during the night but fairly peaceful. 
Stayed in Sep 2020, lots of loud music from local bars well into the night.

name: Out in the hills with an amazing view
description: It's a very nice and quite place. No people, almost no flies but a lot of turtles. After dark you have a beautiful view on the nearby city. Full 4.5G.

name: Shady Spot under Pinetrees
description: Nice shady and quite place under pinetrees. A bit windy, which is nice as it cools down. A very nice view over the town and surrounding mountains. Watch the cliff!!! Not even, but there are enough rocks around to level your vehicle. Full 4.5G (Turk Cell and Vodafone).

name: Kara Dag
description: Great flat place on the edge of the volcano crater. Magnificent view on the valley deep below. Close to the ancient churches of Binbirkilise. No 4x4 needed.

name: Picnic area with nice view and quite
description: Just north of the main road. Nice view into the valleys. Quite at night, during the day sometimes sheppards passing. Remainings of an ancient village on the eastern hill. Water and toilets!

name: Panoramic view from hill over Konya
description: Use Google earth or OSM to follow tracks from the north leading to the place. Great view from a hill  over Konya, especially at night. Try to park at a lower terrace, because the upper ones are highly frequented by locals.

name: Konya Science Center
description: Great place to spend a day (especially with kids). All about science, experiments, nature, history, astronomy, space... Many different exhibitions. All as well in English! Fantastic didactical place. Entrance adults 5TL, kids 2 TL.

name: Sahin MAN MERCEDES truck garage
description: Competent place for truck repair - old and younger once. Very experienced - especially for engines.

name: Uzel otomotiv
description: Huge store for truck spare parts. We have an old Mercedes truck and got everything we needed. If you need German language, ask for Osman - he speaks fluently.

name: Hillside
description: This is a nice place to stop for a night. Nice view of surrounding mountains and the city. Quiet. Full 4G with Turk Cell and Vodafone.

name: Beautiful cove, 4x4 track down
description:
Beautiful cove, good for swimming, small flat space above beach to camp, two or three spots available depending on size. 4x4 track down, adventurous big rigs might be possible. 

Cameras in area to ensure archeological artefacts aren’t disturbed so no digging (or soldiers may turn up and fine you, we were told by a local). 
Very quiet, a few boats during the day and a few other people enjoying the peace. Not much rubbish either, very clean for Turkey. Intermittent Turk telecom 2-3G.

name: Gomeda Harabeleri
description: A stunning place to visit the underground city of Gormeda Harabeleri. Fantastic view, quite and just a minute away from the underground city. Full 4G with all providers.

name: Wild camping by the trail in the pine woods
description: If you’re on the Anamur <-> Ermenek road, you should leave it around (36.2056655, 32.9010135), and then go up a hill, there’s a trail which you can follow and find a nice place to camp.

name: Gizli Vadi Camping
description:
Nice place with very friendly staff. Lot's of place for big rigs, next to the beach and good starting point for a hike on the Lycian trail.
We paid 100 TL incl. water and electricity.

name: On the cliff side
description:
Nice little place in the mountains.
Fire pit, even though there is “no fire signs” everywhere.
Not flat but a lot of stones to level your vehicle.
Logging activity around. Otherwise calm. And shade.

name: In the middle of nowhere
description: Nice spot in the middle of nowhere, this place is a bit windy, probably all the time. But I bet you can find shelter somewhere.

name: Abandoned mine site
description:
I’m pretty sure it’s abandoned. You’ll have a fantastic view over the landscape.
Pretty cold as well.

name: On the love valley
description: Fantastic place to stay over night and watch the balloons in the morning. Nice view into the valley. Not easy to enter the love valley from here. 4G Vodafon.

name: Etiler Kuru Temizleme
description: Nice couple running dry cleaning shop. They did a big load of laundry for us - we collected the next day for 50 TL. They don't speak any English but are friendly and able to use Google translate so no problem. Street is busy but easy to park so simple to drop off and pick up clothes while camping at nearby beach.

name: Lakeside camping
description: A few places around this pretty lake, popular with fisherman and locals coming to enjoy picnics and late night driving. We found a spot at the base of a hill that was protected form the wind but there seem to be a few places dotted around the lake.

name: Forest
description:
Lovely spot near the canyon, tucked away from where the main crowds of picnickers go so you aren't disturbed. Beautiful view over to Antalya and the sea and peace an quiet all around. 

We arrived on a Sunday afternoon when the park was very busy with big family groups and struggled to find anywhere along the canyon ridge but this place was a total win for privacy and space. We stayed for two nights and only saw a few friendly dogs. The track down is a little rough so maybe hard for big rigs, we have a 4x4 but you don't need one to get here

There is some garbage around like everywhere in Turkey but it's really not bad at all because I don't think lots of people come here.

name: Fariske - Göktepe
description: Picnic area with water and tables. it's also toilet but abandoned and in horrible condition. It's full of caves and old ruin around, so very nice for exploring. Also a lot of hiking possibilities. It's not flat, just one little spot, but with some rocks you can manage it.

name: Alahan Monastery
description: Very nice place to spend the night. Amazing views and the ruins of an old monastery to visit. when I was there it was winter and corona so no one there, but I seen a closed ticket office so maybe in another circumstances you should pay. No facilities

name: Eregli
description: Free parking in the city center. Good enough for one night, police came to check and said it was no problem to sleep there. Beside a mosque, so you can use the toilets

name: Karagöl Yolu
description: Little spot beside the road (is offroad so I haven't seen many cars) with amazing views. Probably in summer you can drive all the way to Yayla pikinik site and camp there. Very beautiful views and nice hikes around. You can go to Karagol lake and Medetsiz peak. It can be very very windy!

name: Arsus
description: Just south of Arsus on the high mountain pass route by the road. Great wild camping overlooking the ocean

name: Kilic motel
description:
Great hotel to stay. A small village of Karaburun located by the Black Sea. Just 10 min to Istanbul international airport and 2.5 hours from the Greek border. You can hear the sound of the waves rushing to the white sand shore. There’s a restaurant on the ground floor and delicious Breakfast is included the way you wanted it.
Also Ali is a great cook and very hospitable person. He always made sure that you are doing good and help you out of whatever you need. Also the owner is very nice. Even lend me his car to transport my motorcycle to the airport. It’s a good place to get a few days of rest and walk along the beach before to to the next adventure.
There’s a secured parking area for big rigs and for motorcycles. Security camera is available along the premises.

name: Flamingo Camping 2
description: There are two Flamingo Camping sites the first one is 0.3 miles closer to Fethiye, Flamingo Camping 2 is the one we chanced upon in early December.  quite adequate with showers, toilets and electrics. A warm welcome with all in price of 100tl. not cheap but right on quiet part of beach. Buses passing every day so easy to get into Fethiye and with a beach club restaurant over the road where they serve good selection of food every day including fish/meat, a high standard and welcoming. No Wi-fi but wifi is available at restaurant.

name: Natural camping
description: Natural camping on the parking side.  Closed parking, but has entrance for motorbike and bicycle.  In a place, there are no people and the night is quiet except for a few dogs barking.  Ideal for bicycle travelers.

name: Homestay with Rockandrollcaravann
description:
Hello, we are a traveller couple from Turkey and Germany.  During the covid times, we rent an apartment in Adana and it is too big for us. That's why we want to rent our rooms. Duygu is local from Adana. We can also help you about anything. 
Please don't hesitate to contact with us. 

Timmy :+4915777315249
Duygu :+905413276504 
Instagram : rockandrollcaravann

name: Lakeside pine and dine
description: Quite nice spot near the lakeside. Was able to tuck the car into the trees for a bit of privacy. Nice soft ground from pine needles falling perfect for tents. Could accommodate larger big rigs just not under trees. Lots of space to let the dog out for a run.

name: Yakacik Beach
description: Nice wild beach camping. A bit further of the GPS koordination are more quiter. Some locals around but at night it is calm. Windy during afternoon but it stops in the evening. G4 are available. No wild dogs around.

name: İncekum Nature Park
description: Amazing Camping site inside İncekum Nature forest, very friendly people, you can rent a tent or use yours, I used mine and cost me only 17 TL per night per person

name: Oto Park & Yakima
description: day or night parking upto 7m long, no height restriction.  15TL per day. gets busy during the day. Narrow access.

name: essen oto
description:
Garage specializing in Ford but also other brands. Very good service. Possible to overnight here.
.....
garage spécialisé Ford mais également autre marque.
très bon contact 
possibilité de dormir sur place

name: 4x4 Workshop - Toyota and Land Rover
description:
Quality workshop on the southside of Izmir. Ismail is the owner - he speaks a little English, but his knowledge and Google translate work.  Cell/WhatsApp +90 554 245 20 95
İsmail Üstün İş

name: Belemedik
description:
Good place to start hiking and exploring the Belemedik valley and the rails of the Bagdad train. 
It's a big picnic place with toilets and water.

name: place near Ihlara river
description: near Belisirma on the east side of the river. marked on OSM as a campsite. no services but place is world class. big rigs posible but depends on driving skills.

name: Setur Kusadasi Marina
description: Large secure level marina car park. 25TL for 24 hours water tap, WiFi, and trash available. Next door to the supermarket. No height or weight restrictions. Quiet and close to town centre. On approach along the seafront road ensure you are in the right hand lane.

name: Karaman center
description: Big official parking right in the center of Karaman directly behind the museum. Free of charge. Little busy during the day, but empties late afternoon. At night not much noise. Museum, bakery, shops etc. in walking distance.

name: Akbük
description: Great place to spend a few nights, popular with locals for having bbqs. Walking distance to Albük town, and nice beaches nearby along coast. Jandarma wander by but just waved. Rubbish levels not too bad, lots of bins. Street dogs around but all pretty friendly, bit noisy on some nights but not all.  Apparently extremely busy in summer.

name: Sheltered clearing
description: Medium sized sheltered clearing . We found this late in the day after we had been moved on by the Jandarma from the national park. Clearing surrounded by pine trees, ok for big rigs. We stayed one quiet night and weren’t disturbed. Sheltered from winds, could be soft and slippery when wet. Entrance just to the side of the little bridge.

name: Cleopatra island
description: Big parking next to small marina where you can get boats to Cleopatra Island. We were going to camp in the little small clearing to the side but were moved on by Jandarma saying that it’s a national park and no camping. Hard to find a camp around this area at this time of year (March), access to most beaches closed or not accessible for big rigs.

name: Pine view
description: Beautiful quiet spot up in the pine forests. Just off the small road but very peaceful. Level and sun or shade. Lots of birdsong. Water spring and campfire area. Good 4g reception (Turk telecom)

name: Şuğul Kanyonu
description:
Big parking at the canyon entrance, close to a picnic place. Toilets and fresh water available.
Good place to start a hike into the beautiful canyon.

name: Real truck drivers restaurant
description: And where the truck drivers stop, for sure you can eat well! If you need a place to eat, this is the good one! (Even because around just fields and nothing else)

name: Modern gas station
description:
Where you can find good coffe or restaurant.
It’s a buffet and coffee place. Clean and modern

name: Wonderful campsite
description: With a gorgeous view, the road is 500m far, so Not many noises. Sometimes the road to reach the place is full of wood, so not always easy for a Van. But perfect for biciles and motorcycles

name: 1 year resident permit
description:
At the first floor of this building you can find the agency of Gurkan. 
Gurkan is a very professional and organised man, who can help to get your resident permit in about 6 weeks. 
His commission is 300lira. The rest is for taxes (about 1700lira). 
In the pic his contacts ( +90 536 296 70 08).
Many British and Russian people living in Fethiye know him.

name: Custom office
description:
Here you can extend your permit for your vehicle. Just bring your docs and the resident permit (no problem if it’s still under process). Very easy going and people super helpful (not very busy).
In 20min you get it!
(I got 1 year extension for my Vespa).

Ps DON’t go out abroad  without your vehicle within passing from here first!!! (If you go abroad with your vehicle there are no problems)

name: Water
description: water tap available.  requires a key to open the tap.

name: Kairos pension
description:
This is a great place full of trees. The two owners(two siblings half Turkish and half German) are wonderful person, old hippy. 
The bungalow are super nice. On the winter time we had very good price 
I recommend it, good vibe 

Look: 
Kayroslimpos.com

name: Dentist
description:
good dentist, I cleaned my teeth for 200lira.
I suggest it.

02526166561
05523320718
Dilara Kilinç

name: Friday local market
description:
Best place where you can buy fruit, vegetables, etc... very cheap and quite big

Just Friday

name: Natural fountain
description:
Good natural water always accessible 
Enjoy the view

name: Lakeside Parking
description: Likeside parking. Almost flat. White Beach and crystal clear water.

name: Potable water
description: Faucet with 3/4" thread connection next to the street

name: Karatas Beach
description: Small sandy beach with a few trees, donate shadows. The place is nothing special, but in order for a night. Unfortunately, there is garbage around everywhere.

name: YILDIZ OTO Land Rover
description: Workshop for Land Rover Series and Defender.  Very friendly owner, only speaks Turkish. Good car mechanic.

name: Beach view from Mountain
description: Very nice quiet place to spend a few days here. Sometimes flocks of sheep come by and also locals who are very friendly. Good 4G Signal. Trucks should be able to breach this place.

name: Quiet with a great view
description: Clean and quiet place at the end of the street with a nice view over the lake.  There is very good 4G signal here.

name: Beyrebucak
description: it's beside a cemetery. have cover place and only water. no toilet or shower.

name: münür nalbant hayrati
description: Picknick table & drink water.  between Highway and countryside road.

name: pétrole ofis-yiltaş
description: Fuel station with small area lawn & pick-nick table. a bit noisy because of highway beside.

name: Demre parking
description: Open parking near soccer ground, gravel/sandy ground, even with some trees for shade. 1. row to beach, alongside the main road. Beach restaurants close by, town center  approx 3km.

name: river side camp
description: river side camp site, solid gravel parking close to river with swimming hole.

name: Doganbaba Salda Lake Side Parking
description: lake side parking, shade available and spacious parking

name: road side harbor parking
description: small quiet harbor next to main road, good access and wide even parking on pavement and gravel.

name: cave parking
description: spaces even gravel parking below cave. access by asphalt road, narrow but suitable for large rigs.

name: lake side camping
description: spaces even gravel parking next to lake. easy access from main road, approx 500 m. good spot to explore the lake which has rich bird wildlife.

name: old stone quarry
description: old stone quarry with deep water hole. gravel road excess also suitable for heavy vehicles.  parking spots left and right alongside the track. very quiet,  no traffic and no garbage.

name: 360 panorama view
description: very nice and quiet location with terrific panorama view and within swimming distance from carpanak adasi. gravel pitch suitable for 2wd and big rigs when dry.

name: Water Tap
description: Potable water out of a mountain spring. Possibility to connect water hose.

name: ancient ruins
description: old ruins can be found on Google map but it is easy to get turned around going through the neighborhoods. would be hard to get a rig here, but it was fine for our bikes. there are brokers bottles so there may be people here regularly to enjoy sundowners.

name: Ottokar Land Rover
description: Workshop for Land Rover Serie and Defender

name: Love valley
description: It's a nice place in the Love valley. during the day there are some Tourist but in the night It's quiet. please ask in the Keles Cafe for staying there Yilmaz is the einer and will allow you to stay.

name: Watertaps
description: Three watertaps with potable water next to a police station. No threaded connection.

name: very nice place next to river
description: Nice camp next to a river. 4x4 required to drive the steep path to the river. Water is very clean and can also be used for a shower.

name: Rivercamping Özmenler
description: Great place to cool down in the summer. Actually a restaurant and cafe directly on the river. But the very friendly owner allows overnight camping. Lots of space, toilets, river swimming and pool, restaurant... He asked us to pay what we think, so we gave 50L for a big rig.

name: Gol restaurant
description: We pulled up on our bikes and the guy let us camp straight away for free on the pebbly beach. not a lot of flat ground but worth it for the view and the restaurant next door.

name: Saint Pierre Church
description:
Almost flat area. We spent one night. Some locals (maybe it's more crowded because the pandemic is over) spent time here but weren't that loud. Also. jandarma passed by, but they only asked if everything is fine and left again.
Update august 2022: Not suitable for big rigs but there is a large flat car park a few hundred meters ahead (36.20993N; 3617715E).

name: invisible area
description: There is a path leading down to the sea from the asphalt road. You can go with bike or motorcycle. phone signal is weak. Not visible from the asphalt road. You can stay with a tent, but when I was staying there was a lot of wind.

name: Gaziantep Free Camping
description:
Official campsite provided by the city of Gaziantep. Every pitch has his own watertap, power point and sewer connection.
There are also showers (hot) and toilets available. 
Everything is not very clean but usable.

name: Short before Ulupinar.
description: Nice quiet place next to a mountain path, can be reached by car.  4x4 necessary.  Quiet and not very busy and extremely clean.

name: at the euphrates
description: Very nice place on a hill. Directly on the Euphrates. Very quiet and you can swim in the river.

name: Camping next to monastery
description:
Parking next to monastery. Quiet and clean.
We stayed here for one night. The security said it was ok and was very friendly.

name: pine tree area
description:
big area for picnic and bbq, this time almost nobodies, planty of place, not many flat spot but possible to find one specially with little van/car.
easy for big rig.
directly on top of the sea.windy as usual in this area

name: Near beach
description: this is a free camping area. you can set up a tent. There are places where you can meet your basic needs.

name: Near Beach
description: There are no places where you can get facilities. many people set up camping tents or cars.

name: Manazan caves
description: Place to easily fill up water and amazing caves to explore.

name: Quiet pine grove with campfire sites.
description: Not far from Göblekiteke is this pine grove with some trees that also provide shade.  Locals should also come by here from time to time, which you can see from the campfire sites.

name: Özmen picnic area
description: Very nice place on the river. The Özmen family is very friendly. The ideal place to take a break here on a hot day. There is enough room for larger cars. I enjoyed the time here very much.

name: Kaçkar campground
description:
Really nice place to stay, right next to the beach. Toilets and (cold) shower available. entrance is next to the bigger (and way more inexpensive) Sahil camp. There is a small shop to buy drinks and snacks. A bit messy and run down, but a wonderful relaxed place to stay and enjoy the beach
We paid 100 TL (10 euro) per night for our family of 4 and 2 dogs. Including electricity.

name: Bungalows in Gürlek
description: Wonderful place to stay on the way from the Mediterranean Sea to Pamukkale. Nice bungalows with toilet and hot water. Restaurant. (bungalows are new/2021)

name: Waterfall near Hakkari
description: Beautiful waterfall. About 45 min from the road. Walk up the river on the right side.

name: Sokullupinar Kamp Alani
description:
National Park campground at the base of the Aldalgar mountain range with a brilliant view. Great startpoint for hikes.

Park ranger came by for a chat. Daily fee is 8 TL per person and 35 TL for the car.
The gravel road to the site starts in Demirkazik and is of good quality (doable for 2wd).
Toilets and (cold) shower are clean. The water from the tap is drinkable according to the ranger.

name: Kampüs Pension
description:
Cheap, clean, friendly, parking and breakfast included! Washing machine available, WiFi, workdesk, private bathroom. :-)
We payed 110TL per night, breakfast included. Parking is in front of the hotel (free of charge). Laundry service is 10TL per load washing and drying. The lady that runs the place is heartwarming, always smiling and super helpful, but doesn’t speak any foreign languages. (Do you?) :-)
From the Hotel you can easily walk to all sights, the promenade with restaurants and cafes is 150m away, a supermarket 100m.
There is a microwave and kettle in the hallway. Heating and a/c in the rooms. Very comfortable beds, elevator, filling breakfast. More than you need! :-)

name: Yeşil Vadi
description:
It’s in the middle of nature, very fresh and shaded, close by a small river... perfect spot to relax and do some excursions, swimming or different activities. (Nice swings!!)
There is even a little simple restaurant. (Bad phone connection)
Price for tent 50 LT per person
Price for bungalow 300LT (for two person)
Phone +905357859482 (mustafa)

name: Müftüoglu
description: Wet cleaning and drying full service for a good price. The old owner speaks some English and has climbed the Ararat 8 times!

name: Güner Otel
description:
Cheap and friendly place! Car park directly in front of the door. They have a camera surveillance. Bicycles can park in the yard. Tell them in advance you need parking and they will reserve a space for you!
Rooms are small, but with private bathroom and directly in the city center.
We payed 100TL for a double. Mattress is soft, everything super clean, there is WiFi and a washing machine (didn’t use it). 
Staff is super helpful and knows some English.

name: Beach
description: Nice spot with plenty of space near a village. windy during the day. calm at night. no shade. quiet. some people go fishing or for a walk at the beach.

name: Between Kiyikoy and Saray
description:
On the left side of the highway, 5 km after leaving the Kiyikoy City, just when you start uphill. A dirt road with stones and dust.
Grassy place for small cars. Don't need 4x4 but a high-clearance car is recommended. Nearby is a house that burned down several years ago. 
Quiet and good for a night.

name: Between Sultanköy and Tekirdag
description:
Several places just near the beach. A small cliff to reach the water.
You stay at the limit of the plantation.
Quiet and some fisherman only appeared at the end of the day.

name: Field by stream
description: nice little field with water stream. street close but few people drive by, we stayed 2 days. fine place

name: Oludeniz
description:
Oludeniz hilltop park. Perfect place for stay, nice view of the bay, not easy to find other place here. We stayed 2 days with our 15t/10m truck and no problem. In the evening, one car came by with a local drinking a beer watching the sunset, otherwise no one showed up. Street is close by but not too loud.
Further down the street, there is also a big parking area by the mosque. It seems also to be free at this time to park.

name: Good spot for one night
description:
It’s about 200m far from the main road, there are some tables and several spots for tents. Bit dirty but there is a fountain (used mainly by sheep). Here locals come for barbecue and for drink beers with friends.
Good for one night

name: Water, sight and overnight spot in one :-)
description:
This fountain has a lot of water! You will fill your tanks up very quickly!
While filling up the water, you have a view on the Burj Baba „village“.
If you drive the path upwards to its end, you find a flat place to overnight. We spent the night there. Not completely invisible, but quiet and with a view.

name: Golcuk Nature Park.
description:
Nature park with a beautiful lake. Open all year round. Entrance fee 10Usd includes camping. No showers. Clean wc, picnic tables, drinkable water. It may be crowded on weekends and high season (01 June-31 August). Many spots for campers and caravans.
Good for tents and bikers too. Many flat spots under the trees.

name: Carpark
description: Huge free carpark just near the beach with showers, cabins, wc and sinks. Very quiet at night. Caravans and campers park freely.

name: Art Suit Apartments
description:
We payed 140TL for a nice apartment with kitchenette, living room, bedroom and bathroom.
Washing machine available, fast WiFi. The owner speaks English and is happy to help with everything.
There is parking in front of the house and if you want a guarded car park, there is one around the corner (70m). 
We stayed 2 nights and enjoyed it very much.

name: Bozyazi Malecon
description: Malecon and public beach with toilets and beach showers. Quiet at night. Safe neighborhood. Overnight parking is free on the streets and riverside. It is little crowded at daytime in July and August. Markets and shops around.

name: Salt mine and cave
description:
Beautiful salt cave. Parts are still active, other parts just recently open to public. Entrance 10 Lira. 
Parking maybe also suitable as overnight spot.

name: Next to lake
description: This place is a gravel road leading to a lake. At the end of the road you can park your car on a relatively flat area. It is not the best wildcamping spot we have ever stayed at, but it was quiet during the night, not windy and a bit cooler than elsewhere! OK for a night.

name: Scammer!
description:
There is a guy operating in the area around Izmir pulling travellers over on the basis of a wobbling wheel and failed wheel bearing. 

At some point before he stops you he has squirted grease around your axle and or bearing and even potentially loosened the bearing.

For us he had also somehow managed to fake the bearing rumbling noise.

We now know of two other travellers who he has stopped.

He will demand an amount of 10 times the actual cost (if the repair was real) and becomes aggressive when he doesn’t get it.

He is tall well dressed and has a glass eye.

He has been doing this scam for at least 4 years

name: Cennet vadisi
description: Near bilicec. Restaurant with a terrific host. With a pagoda-like entree 4,50 high. Mr Cihan will and can let you stay if you dine there. There is place for a few cars or one big rig. No electrics or water or drain for effluents. (Yet) Its a 75 meters away from the road. Dogs can come but on the leash. Food is more then awesome.

name: Ararat view
description: quiet and clean area with a lot of space.

name: Vetanimal
description:
We can highly recommend this veterinary practice. Engin and his team are very friendly and competent, with fair prices. They take their time to take good care for your animal. Animal welfare in the first place.

We found a stray kitten and as we were not really satisfied with the first vet we went, we found this veterinary practice via Google and his good review.

Place is next to a pharmacy (left side), on a main one way road.

name: Pamukkale (Opposite side)
description:
On a hill opposite side of the Pamukkale Terrasses. This are roughly our coordinates. There are several dirt roads, we found only two flat spots, where the road was wide enough so another car can pass. If you come from the south gate of Pamukkale, use the second dirt road on the left side (the first one is very steep, 4x4 needed). Dirt roads are good, when there was no rain. 

The view is very nice to the Pamukkale Terrasses. We had a quiet night there. Waking up early in the morning from the noise of hotairballons. Two were landing on a field not far away from our spot.

name: TEZ oto Servisi
description: Suzuki Offroad expert. Also part of the Antalay Offroad "antoff" team. Ali and his family are awesome and very competent with over 30 years of Suzuki experience. The completly checked and repaired our Suzuki Grand Vitara. It took two days. They take their time and watch every detail. They also have a big offroad connection to other car models, like Landrover. www.suzukitezoto.com Ali speaks english and supports the communication with google translate.

name: Near Manavgat River
description: Very beautiful view on the Hill near Manavgat River.

name: White Bodrum laundry
description: Laundry and dry cleaning in the center of Bodrum. If you are lucky, there is parking right in front!

name: Umutku Laundry
description:
Laundromat, simple, but effective and inexpensive.
Parking at a „Otopark“ on your left when driving downhill and the laundry is on your right.
There is another laundry (more dry cleaning) on your left when driving further down. It’s also marked here.

name: Tundra
description: nothing special, nothing fancy, not far from the road but quiet. we stayed here because we had to sleep somewhere on our way to the east. we did not want to have people and dogs around us, therefore this was perfect. a lot of space,  some small abandoned houses.

name: hot tub
description: nice place next to a realy nice clean natural hot tub. around 40 degree. does not stink. reallly nice. some locals pass from time to time. quite, not to dirty.

name: Galata West Hostel
description:
It's a nice small hostel, very cheap (5€/night), clean and comfortable. The staff is welcoming and helpful and the location is perfect for looking around all the tourist attractions at the city centre.

It might not be suitable for someone with a car though, as the streets are very narrow and unbelievably busy with people and traffic.

name: Tarsus Dam Picnic Area
description: Huge free picnic area with tables, toilets, drinkable water and trees near the dam. We stayed one night at the carpark in front of the small mosque (near the entrance). Carpark was quiet but picnic area is noisy in the afternoons. There is a riot police spot in the park so it is pretty safe. Another park with a zoo in just 2 minutes ride. Another tip: There is a parking lot and car wash at the back street of Ulucami in the center of Tarsus. Even big rigs can fit. Good option to enjoy the old Town.

name: Obruk Han - Caravanserai
description: Hani in restoration phase. Good place and plenty parking around it.

name: Road triangle
description: small "island" in a dirtroad triangle. its next to a damm. quite. lake nearby. wind protected.

name: Dereci Oto - Land Rover
description: Land Rover workshop. Very helpful. Didn't speak English but it worked anyway.

name: Esenbahçe Camping Picnic Area
description:
Open all year round.  Nice campground for overlanders, bikers and backpackers. Eight minutes ride to center. Tables and sofas at riverside. Flat area for tents under orange trees. Flat area for campers. Big rigs can fit. Family makes local bread and can order kebab for delivery. 
Very friendly family. Young owner Cemal speaks little English. Picnic tables, sinks, hot shower. Very good option to visit  Antakya. Wifi will be available soon.

name: Oto Pratik
description:
Car service with 100% genuine brands such as Varta Batteries, Male filters etc.
Good for oilchange and all other services.
We got a new battery fitter here.
Not cheap but high quality brands for long lasting.
English spoken. Free coffee/tea/water in climatized waiting room with window to watch your car :-)

name: Günay in Yeri
description: they have restaurant and toilets also equipped with hot water shower. There are some trees and under them you can camp. price is 50 TL for one car.

name: Lovely campsite at the lake
description:
Very nice campsite/picnicarea right at the Vanlake. An extremely nice and helpful family runs the place. In daytime, there are lots of locals who picnic here, which is quite fun.
There are toilets and a hot shower and for 20 TL you can use the washing machine. There is a lot of shade to pitch your tent or park your camper. We paid 50 TL per night.

name: Hangar camp
description: Very nice campground with lovely details. Located near Kas in a small village. Owner is very friendly and speaks good English! We payed 75 lira p.p. with our own tent, including breakfast, Wifi, free water, coffee and tea! The place offers a lot, you can stay with your own tent or rent a tent, room or bungalow. You can use the washing machine, jump into the pool or do some yoga in the yoga area.

name: Up in the mountains
description: Big flat area between two hills, a few kilometers away from a small village. Stunning view! The road to get there is a good gravel road. When we arrived, there were shepherds with their goats and sheep, like a small shepherds village! We asked them, if it’s ok if we stay. They were very friendly and said it’s ok, so we put up our tent. A little bit cold at night because of the height and noisy because of the barking dogs. Place would be also good for camping vans. 4x4 or motorbikes can also drive the road further, maybe there are also good places

name: Yakamoz camping
description: Nice little campground, very friendly. Tent for hire also. Electricity available. 100tl for 2 people and a vehicle. Good 4g, showers and toilets clean. Restaurant available (not tried). Lots of bbq available to use. 150m from the beach. Can be busy at the weekend with locals

name: Baskonus camping
description: Huge camping area in the mountains (1200 altitude). In summer it's nice and fresh here in the night. tables available, western and eastern toilets. cold and hot(solar powered) showers, small/tiny supermarket. 50 TL for two persons with jeep and rooftop tent without electricity. friendly staff, we got tea as a welcome.

name: cozy place with a stunning view
description: cozy hidden place with a beautiful view over the black sea. just 20 minutes from the Georgian border. space for maximum 2 small campers.

name: Near a stream
description: Really quiet place next to a stream. Right of the road, but no noise whatsoever. Nice views, no trash, no dogs, not even a single person

name: Abandoned quarry
description: Close to the beach. Pretty clean and quiet. Just a 20 meter short track to go up there

name: PCR-test Covid 19
description: At the Recep Tayyip Erdoğan Training and Research Hospital, you can take a PCR-test (for travelling into Georgia). You have to go to the Health Tourism Department in the hospital. The test costs 170 TL. You have to wait a couple of hours for the result.

name: Camping next to an old unused road
description: Nice place between the old, unused road (dead end) and the new road. The new road is highly above this place so you cannot be seen from the road! You have to come from south. Next to the old small road is a really small river, but with nearly no water. Nobody except a shepherd with his goats came around at the evening. The place is next to the old street, a little bit below. We drove there with our motorbikes. Not good for big rigs, but maybe you can find a better place to stay earlier next to the road.

name: Küsleme Kebab Han
description:
Gaziantep is recognized by UNESCO for it’s food. This is the place to taste it!
Best Bakhlava for dessert we ever had: buttery and no syrup! 
Bit expensive but much more worth the money!
This is a food experience in foodlover‘s heaven!

name: Camperist Camping
description:
Nice and tidy established campsite. Opened recently. We arrived without booking, but we were given a nice spot between the locals in their caravans.
Close to a road but not visible, not much traffic.
All amenities you can expect from a decent camping and as a bonus they have a swimming pool!
Starting price 200TL, but we got to an acceptable price after a nice conversation.

name: Beehive house & Cafe
description: Here you can visit a traditional beehive house. No entry fee, but please have a drink at their cafe.

name: lake side
description: good place for putting tent near lake, there is soft sand at this point, but gravel road is 20 meters near here

name: Mountrain Outdoor Club
description: After a strenuous trip on the highway we arrived here in this peaceful camp. The air at this altitude (above 1400m) and the wonderful pine forest invites you to spend a couple of relaxing days (and nights) here. The manager Ali speaks English, he and his staff are very helpful. The facilities are well maintained, clean and well operating. The sites are equipped with fresh water and electricity. The restaurant offer a nice buffet. There is free Wifi close to the restaurant. The detour from Bolu is worth every kilometer.

name: PCR-Test Covid 19  at Özel 7M Hastanesi (Hospit
description:
PCR Test to cross the border into Georgia directly at D-010 at private hospital. Parking available.
All very efficient. 
Took 20 min to get the test done, the result came 4 hours later via email. 
Go to the emergency entrance  (Acil servis).
Make sure to be there before 5pm.
170 tL/pp. Credit card accepted.

https://maps.app.goo.gl/g1abLLBZwsYoxu1x9

name: nice spot near Goreme
description: One of the spots overlooking Goreme. There are two nice platous, one has barbecue set up. Easy access, solid dirt road. Balloons are passing by closely, some over our heads.

name: Hayrat
description: water fountain near road, some trees with nice shade around also.

name: Seabuckthorn Paradise
description:
If you love seabuckthorn, that’s your paradise! :-)
Hidden in shady trees on a green, flat meadow next to the river.
The entry to the place is through seabuckthorn bushes, so if your vehicle is too big, it‘ll get scratches. If you love seabuckthorn, you don’t mind
Perfect for tents, motorbikes, bicycles and small vehicles. Big rigs would destroy nature and can’t go.
Please note that your government would advise you not to camp here. Drones are flying in the darkness for control…
We didn’t bother, stayed and enjoyed seabuckthorn and a cool night at 2000m asl :-)

name: Cetin Volkswagen
description: Car mechanic small shop for Volkswagen, Skoda, Audi. He doesn't speak English but it's no problem. Good price. We did our service here twice. He was recommended to us by some locals.

name: Abandoned artillery 1st world war
description: Quiet and pleasant place in a battery of abandoned guns from the First World War.  Beautiful views at sunset.

name: Toprak Hotel
description:
Very central location. Parking for bikes (with or without engine) in the lobby or in front of the hotel with cctv surveillance. 
All vehicles that fit into underground parkings may use that parking for free. Others park in front of the cameras in front of the hotel.
We stayed 2 nights and left the car in front of the hotel. The owner is more than helpful and will arrange everything you need in perfect English.
We payed 15€ for a double room with private bathroom, good WiFi and breakfast included.

name: COVID PCR test location
description: Place to get PCR test done for 170tl. Upon entering the COVID-19 Poli (side entrance) go to the first floor to do the payment and registration. Then head down to the ground floor (at the front of the building) to do test or get results. Come early to be able to get your test results by the late afternoon.

name: PCR Test
description:
1. Go to Emergency (Ayaktan Hasta Girisi). That’s the left entrance when coming from the seaside entry. Get a patient sheet at the booth there.
2. go to 1.st floor to a room called VEZNE, get your patient data and passport details registered and pay 170TL/test. Stick the label they give you on the patient sheet.
3. Go back to -3 and then take the right entrance, opposite to ER entrance. You will probably see people queuing there. In there your data is collected again and the patient sheet exchanged for an other sticker and paper.
4. with that sticker and paper, go out to the tent where they will do the PCR test.
5. come back to the right entrance 8 hours later to collect the result.

name: Erdem Pansiyon & Hotel
description:
Clean Hotel with washing machines and huge parking possibilities!
We payed 200TL for a 3-bed room with private bathroom, centrally located.
They have washing machines and dryers, each load is 20TL and you may operate the machines yourself and choose the program :-)
Parking is on the street for free or 50m further down on a huge payed parking. 
You can get your PCR test opposite of the hotel.
WiFi is typically „turkish“ (sometimes strong, sometimes weak), there is an elevator and a nice breakfast place very nearby.

name: Garage Otomotiv Aydin
description: Workshop for several cars, like Mercedes, Volkswagen, BMW and others

name: Toyota Service
description: Toyota Service. Very helpful, quick solution of our problem concerning V-belt and the door lock of the camper. Free of charge!

name: Niksar camping
description: Nice camping site managed by the local municipality. The camping is located at the top of a mountain with views down the valley and is also used during the day as a paid picnic spot. It consists of a field where you can freely put your tent with electricity, camper places and bungalows. Central shower building was in okay condition, but clean. Price for a tent is 30 TL, camper 45 and bungalow around 60 TL, although they were not available at this time. Restaurant at the crossing with the main road is with checking out for a good eggplant, potato and meat kebab.

name: Quiet campsite overlooking the valley
description:
The campsite can be reached by turning off the road heading westwards at 40.849740,32.459121. From there follow the dirt road up the mountain for a couple of kilometers. At the first fork in the road, go left and continue driving until you reach the campsite on tour right hand side with grass tracks going off the road.
The road does not seem to be used very often, we didn't encounter anyone, but heard some goatbells and dogs from across the mountain. The road noise is not noticeable at the site. On the road to the site there is a water point, but it wasn't working when we were there in summer.
4G reception is present but minimal.

name: Waterfountain 20L for 1 TL
description: On the side of the road there is a functional water fountain, 20 liters for 1 TL

name: Melody Beach
description: Hidden gem above the sea with a path to the partly sandy beach for Your own with turqois water. Very remote for good swimming. Steep and narrow access road (You have to push back for some turns). Pension with camping facilities, clean toilet shower and electricity available. Owner speaks some German. We found the beach on maps me, signposted on D400

name: Aslantepe
description:
Behind the Aslantepe mound.
Last bit of road is gravel, might not be suited for bigger vans because narrow with some trees. Road opens up and there is space for parking one to two vehicles. Guardian at Aslantepe said overnight was no problem. Track that takes you there is indicated on maps me. A couple of locals passing by but otherwise very quiet. Nearby house seems deserted.

name: open flat space near entrance to Mt Nemrut
description:
Great overnight spot before or after visiting mt Nemrut.
View up to the eastern terrace of Mt Nemrut. Plenty of space surrounded by rocks. 
Last bit of road up to ruin, approx 3 km, is gravel. Looks narrow from below but is actually rather wide. Can be driven by most vehicles going slow. 
Very quiet both during day and night. Can be windy.

name: St Thomas church
description: Ruined armenian church situated high above the lake with beautiful views. Wonderfully isolated place to visit. Best light for photos  in the afternoon.

name: Small parking platform close to church
description:
With a powerful 2 wheel drive or 4x4 you can drive the track all the way up to the church. Ends in a relatively flat platform. There are no difficult parts but might not fit bigger vans. Nice place for overnight with great view. No one around. Isolated.
Also there are several places to park along the gravel road along the lake. Unfortunately some of the most beach like are littered.

name: Above lake Van shore
description:
Very nice spot though because away from the road, beautiful view, not really any garbage, fairly level spots. We had a quiet night, windy though. 

If it had not been for the millions of tiny insects filling the air after darkness, and I mean armies of insects, it would have been a very nice overnight spot. And it still is but at least during summer time very best to have the possibility to do stuff inside the van after darkness. Not biting insects, they are just in your mouth, ears and food.

name: Picnic area close to a river
description: Several flat spots near the river. Hidden from the road by a small hill with a big turkish flag. Good for one night. Quiet at night. Some locals come to picnic during the day.

name: Harran cultural House
description: Harran’s "cultural center" run by a friendly family.  Possibility of spending the night in front of the house even with a large vehicle.  You might be a bit crowded when you arrive, but you don't have to take their services.  If you decide to take the guided tour (150 TL for the 1.5 hour city tour) ask for Ibrahim, the son who studied archeology.  Possibility to eat on site and fill up your water tank for free.

name: creek side camping
description: creek side camping below dam, spaces parking along creek with shade. access road gravel also suitable for big rigs 2x2.

name: Merkez Veteriner Kliniği / Vet. Hekim / Mustafa DÜLEK
description: Veterinary. The Dr. speaks English. We did a blood sample here, which he send to the EU certificated Laboratory in Ankara for the rabies antibody test which is needed for entering the EU.

name: Çavdar Thermal Hostel
description:
Perfect hostel to visit Pamukkale (one kilometer away). 
Attended by its owner, a fantastic man, very friendly and concerned about making you feel comfortable.
The hostel room (actually it is a hotel) has only 3 beds, the kitchen inside the room and in the bathroom... a bathtub with thermal water!!!!
The hotel also has a mini pool that if you come from traveling by motorcycle in summer, will make you feel like in paradise!
Price of the bed in the hostel 55 liras, price of the double room 120 liras with air conditioning.

name: Dam site parking
description: Parking lot at the gölpinar hidid baraji dam site. Easy access, even parking at the location. Very quiet, perfect for an overnight stay and rest.

name: Picknick area near Tokat
description: Picknick area about 10km away from Tokat. We spent one quiet night here. During the day some locals around for picknick. Toilets available, but not very clean - okay for one or two nights. Running water. Trees for shade. Muezzin wakes you up at 4.45 in the morning.

name: harbor parking
description: Camping around the local fishing harbor. Spacious flat area on both sides, access road also suitable for large rigs.

name: Kiyiköy Harbor/Beach
description:
You can camp on a big grass field (vehicles and tents) or on the gravel/grass car park between beach and harbor. Both cost 10TL per day/night. 

On first sight there is no obvious reason why one would like to stay there. Busy during the day and in the evening, a lot of rubbish, no shade, mosquitos and street dogs. However, we found it to be an authentic experience, mix a bit with the people and we got in touch with quite a few locals as well as Turkish tourists. Quite at night and morning, beach with nice swimming for yourself in the morning, little restaurants around.

name: In the fields, about 2 kms away from D330
description:
Between two fields where of course you should only position yourself if they have been harvested.  Beautiful 360 ° view.  Small road (paved) very close but insignificant passage.  The only passage are the sheep, the goats, the dogs and the shepherd! We wanted to find a location near the dam but it is impossible to access it because it is surrounded by barbed wire.
Poor 3G signal.

name: parking near trabzon
description: parking area in a small local fishing harbor, good access just below the restaurant parking.

name: on a kind of peninsula
description: Small beach with a beautiful view of Lake Egiridir and a few trees, if you can go to the end (photo 1).  For large vehicles, you will have to stop before (GPS point given) because of the trees (photo 2).  But there is also room before and you can go to the end on foot.

name: Özel Trakya Hastanesi Hospital / PCR Test
description: Hospital with PCR- and antigens rapid test- Sampling area. PCR Test costs 170 TL. You need to pick the test up in the Hospital, in front of the laboratory. Easy to find. Well organised. Result was ready in 1:15 hour! Staff speaks English. I can recommend this place!

name: Flat valley
description: Flat valley near the castle. Along the small river. There is nobody, only a dog on the morning. very quiet, no mosquitos. but no shade. 4x4 needed

name: quiet place next to gravel road
description: nothing fancy but worth to add: clean, flat, fresh air, great view. the campsite couple kilometers before declined us for camping

name: next to highway on a new lake. quiet
description: you can see this mini damm from the highway. average litter, flat, quiet, fresh water well. nice place but we had some gun shooting at night probably because of shakales. we put a strobe light out to be safe. also local people here at night during the week.

name: Water point
description: three water connections 2 for hose 1 to fill up water bottles

name: Lake site camping/picnic area
description: Good accessible private established camping area. Very quiet, plenty of trees for shaded parking. 25 TL per night.

name: KOCAYAYLA
description: Big municipal camping and picnic area with barbecues, hot showers, electricity and drinking water. It is forest and meadows. Open all year round. The price is 30 liras per camper including electricity. The key for hot showers is at reception between bungalows. It is cool even in hot summer.

name: park
description: large park with no visitors. filled with ants but enough places that are concrete to put your tent.

name: Abant Cadırlık Kamp Alani
description:
Nice campground on a small hill next to beautiful Lake Abant and the surrounding National Park.

Campground has plenty places with shade from trees. Terrain is not completely flat. Bathrooms are not clean and not all showers function. There seems to be a small restaurant, but we did not try it. Other restaurant is one kilometer down the road.

name: Manavgat Belediyesi Kamp Alanı (Hotel Boğaz)
description:
Nice camp site behind Hotel Boğaz.

They have 20 places for campers and 20 places for tents. Enough shade from trees. There is grass, but you are supposed to camp on the paved / gravel areas. In the evening, the sprinklers turn on and everything on the grass is soaked.

There is a pool and the beach is on 2 mins walk away. They have three washing machines you can use for a small fee.

We paid 100 tl for one night.

name: Camping Çekirdeksiz Mandalin
description: Lovely new camp site in an old mandarin orchard. Entrance is narrow and trees are small with low branches, so not suitable for big campers (4WD with roof tent is OK). 5 mins walk to the city center of Kemer. We payed approx. 120 TL.

name: Paid parking with a view
description: A beaten earth space with lots of cars parked. We paid 50TL for one night. Amazing views of the Bosphorus river and the city. Very close to the old center. Toilets and sink also present.

name: Easy to reach spot close to lake
description:
Easy to reach spot close to lake.

This spot is located between a street and the lake. Still for me it was not too noisy as it's located underneath the street which is not very frequented at night time.
Plenty of space to park Van's or pitch tents. Besides myself there was just one nice Turkish fisherman.

name: Free parking
description: Free parking lot, dirt track. 20 mins walking to the big mosque, 15 to bazaar

name: Ancient Sardi
description: Ruins of the city that first minted coins—the birthplace of modern currency. We drove past the main entrance, to a short dirt road at the end of the fenced city. Very quiet and no traffic. A few restaurants 10 mins away by walk, which serve food until 7-8pm. Beautiful sunrise.

name: Ladromat King Istanbul
description: Perfect place for self washing. Nice helpful lady. You can park even a big truck in the street. And do your washing. And leave when finished. There is also a parking place at walking distance where you can park and stay for the night.

name: Fountain
description: Fountain of potable water by the side of the road. Shade under a big tree. Really close to the road

name: Garden camping
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.

Hello there. My name is Hasan Yapici. I am also a traveller. This is my home garden. You can camp comfortably and safely. There is a shower and toilet.

name: Kuru Temizleme
description: Full service laundry. Very friendly staff. Wash and dry. 10kg machine. Overnight service.

name: Quiet parking in the woods
description:
Close to the main road, but quiet place.
It’s the parking lot of some interesting underground caves. We arrived at night and stayed until the morning.

name: On the field
description: On a field on the way to Pergamon. Easy access, very quiet. Great to stay for one night. No one around except some farmers.

name: At the river
description: A wonderful nice and quiet place for the night. A bit down at the river. Be careful at rain or when it is very wet. I can imagine it could get swampy, but when we were there it was very dry. There are a lot of birds, also Swans, and frogs. A bit more left, 80 m, is a fantastic place under trees, direct at the water, but for us too small.

name: Thermal pool complex
description:
Big public thermal complex from the university of Bingöl. Several indoor pools with hot water, Hamam, Sauna etc.
Unfortunately men and women are separated, or you take a VIP private pool.
Entrance 20 Lari p.p. Open from 7am till 10pm.
We were allowed to overnight on the parking.
Behind the complex is also a big natural pool, possible to get there by car too, but we didn't check how.

name: Local restaurant
description: Delicious restaurant! Turkish breakfast is much recommended. Tasty and abundant

name: City in the rocks
description: Beautiful ancient dwellings in the mountain rocks. The place is freely accessible (late September), with no one checking. Be respectful and leave no trash

name: Restaurant by the river
description: Restaurant with tables floating on the river. Water mill in view. Tasty local food

name: Breathtaking view (4x4)
description:
Edge of a plateau. View on the whole valley and lots of cone shaped rock houses. Typical Cappadocian chimneys. Accessible by 4x4 easily, but also brave cars with high clearance. To get here, pass by the hot springs nearby and drive up until a gate, then turn right.

Come here by foot anyway, beautiful sight.

name: Village fountains
description: Potable fountains where the villagers refill tanks

name: Agora Camping
description:
Great campsite, parking on the beach if it’s available and it’s open all year.
They also have a few small bungalows.
Biig rigs may struggle but camper vans or 4x4 could park on beach.
Restaurant with great Turkish food (fish & meze) Great hospitality as ever in Turkey and a wonderful chilled vibe when 1 day can easily turn into more.
They even lit fire to create even more atmosphere.
140 Turkish Lira for 2 people and van.
Easy access to sea.
Enjoy it - this is a really great find

name: Wild place near the road
description: Nice place near the road. Quite at night because the road is not very busy.

name: Metal worker
description:
Competent and fair priced. He installed me tail stairs to reach my roof, and a new chimney for the wood stove. Accepted euros (45€ tot).

No English spoken, but understands what you want

name: Over the canyon
description:
Great place with view into the canyon. Take the small road in the south of the northern wild camp an turn left. Much better view.
And much better than the parking lot. Which is not level, not nice and not in nature.

name: Water fountain
description: Close to the lake and ti an area where you can camp freely. Lots of tables for picnic

name: Camping Esen
description:
The camping is located next to the sandy beach, only seperated by a tiny 'beach road'.
There are many pitches for tents under the trees. Toilets (1 European, 1 Asian), showers (cold), sink (cold), fridge, many chairs and tables. 50 TL per person/night with own tent. A few cars might park.
Not sure if a car with roof tent fits, trees are quite low. Restaurant is right next to it.
There are some friendly dogs and cats around.

Overall we liked the place a lot, quiet and relaxing.

name: Moto Life
description: Good quality motorcycle gear, friendly occupants, sometimes English speaking.

name: Accident location
description: Be careful this corner is covered in gravel, while the last few kms are good roads it's fairly unexpected. I had an accident here.

name: Road issues
description: Road had some issues here, the main road was closed redirecting to an offroad hard & steep terrain drive.

name: Field
description: Absolutely great place up the mountain. Not far from the street. The view is so beautiful. Like a painting. You can hear a little bit the sound of the street, but it is no problem. In the night it is quiet and peaceful. Sometimes a shepherd came by, but they are very friendly.

name: Mercedes mechanic
description: Skilled and humble. Honest prices. Fixed my engine problem!

name: Parking by the sea
description:
Gloomy and dreary town. Everyone looks unhappy, buildings are run down. 

That said, this is a place to spend the night. Sound of the waves and lots of wind. No one came to bother. A few restaurants at walking distance.

name: Camping by the river
description: Recently renovated area where locals chill by the river. Easy access by car, and lots of free place to park. Less than 15 walk from the heart of the city.

name: Dogantarla Koyu Yolu
description: Quite place behind the river. A few meters from the town of Dogantarla.

name: Camping Bogsak
description:
The camping is located at the beach. However, it's more for permanent campers. It's quite strict where you can pitch the tents, on the flat but quite rocky ground. Not suitable for vans.
It has cold showers, asian toilets (not very clean and smelly), a sink with cold water.
The owner wanted 100 TL/person/tent, negotiated it down to 75 TL.

For me the price is too high for what you get. But ok if you don't mind the poor quality of the facilities.
