On the left side of the camping is a hotel/restaurant with good food, sandy beach and sun beds.

name: Monastery Mor Gabriel
description:
Nice monastery and worth to visit. We stayed overnight too, at the parking lot. Very quiet. You have to take a guide, but it is free.

Here a short description:
Dayro d-Mor Gabriel was founded in 397 by the ascetic Mor Shmu'el (Samuel) and his student Mor Shem'un (Simon). According to tradition, Shem'un had a dream in which an Angel commanded him to build a House of Prayer in a location marked with three large stone blocks. When Shem'un awoke, he took his teacher to the place and found the stone the angel had placed. At this spot Mor Gabriel Monastery built.

Dayro d-Mor Gabriel is a working community set amongst gardens and orchards, and somewhat disfigured by 1960s residential accommodation. The monastery's primary purpose is to keep Syriac Orthodox Christianity (incl. the original language Aramaic) alive in the land of its birth by providing schooling, ordination of native-born monks.

name: Near  Gumusler Monastery
description: 10 minutes from Gumusler monastery, a few spots in the shade. The place is pretty dirty but, with very good views.

name: Borçka Karagöl
description: 45 tl entrance you can stay how long you want, way is super, nice lake, water and toilet is there, restaurant

name: Huge field at the lake
description: We used this you place on the way to the Iranien border. Very nice. Very peaceful. Very quiet. You see a lot of sheep herds and the panorama is great.

name: Düzen Motor
description: Small garage / workshop for motorcycles and scooters. The owner Zeynal Düzen is very friendly and knows what he does. We made Oil change with Motul Oil (100TL per liter). Also did some welding works. Only speeks turkish but works with google translate

name: Ceri Camping and Restaurant
description: Campground a little bit further away from the mainroad (less road noise). Follow Restaurant Ceri exit. Easy access for all rigs. Also wooden cabins for rent. You camp at the lake. Great views. 40 TL for two with motorbike and tent. Lot of gumtree shade and flat spots. One cold shower, but they do have footstep toilets and the types we use to sit on. WiFi is there, but was themporary out of order. A quiet and peacefull place. We stayed another night. We didn't try the restaurant.

name: Border crossing TR GR
description: Border crossing Edirne Turkey and Kastannies Greece. Due to covid restrictions the only border you can use with a car overland traveling from Turkey to Greece (restrictions as on oct 17 th 2021). I expected a major crossing but it turned out to be a pretty small one. Follow signs Yunanistan from Edirne. Formalities both sides pretty relaxed. We had only 5 cars in front of us but it took more than an hour to get out into Greece. The overall paperwork took not more than 10 minutes. Most of the time, you wait. In Greece they checked our vaccination papers and scanned our plf qr. (Remark: I have his spot not exactly located on the border, but on the leading road from Edirne).

name: SRF Hotel
description: Nice Hotel with security parking (Otopark) included. We payed 160TL for double room for one night, including breakfast. At first they told us 200TL but then we showed booking.com website which sayed 160TL (Genius-discount).

name: Fountain
description: Fountain with four taps. Drinkable water, easy accessible.

name: ADR Performance
description: Really good motorcycle mechanic. Friendly guys and the owner speaks good English. They repair many sports bikes here, and their turnover time is excellent.

name: Ball-bearings, Kugellager Bilyaci
description: All kinds of ball-bearings. From bike to motorbike, to car, to truck. Very friendly and professional staff!

name: Turkcell
description: Finally! - after 3 attempts in Turkcell shops in Edirne - I could buy the tourist welcome pack SIM card. 1 month 20GB Internet for 170 lira. Found the only employee who speaks English. Other turkcell shop quoting different prices.

name: Free parking
description: Big free parking between Ulu mosque and Governor's Building (Agri Valiligi).  It is big enough to find a spot at daytime and almost empty at night. Level and very safe. Toilets of mosque are accessible from parking but it was open daytime only. There is a shower in the mosque but we didn't check it out.  You can walk to city center. Burger King, restaurants and a nice cafe nearby.

name: Gravel pit
description: Nice big flat area surrounded by nature. Not too much wind. No shade. Reasonable cell reception. Good for 1 night.

name: Municipality Campground
description: Edremit Municipality camping. It is open all year round but the showers and loundry are active from April to October. The showers in horse riding part are active all year. Amazing view. There is a cafe serving snacks at horse riding club. It is open all year from 08.00 to 17.00 except Mondays. Price is 50 liras per vehicle and 40 for tents people including.

name: Kemaliye
description: Flat place in front of the river. Quiet night beside the road. Perfect view over the river and the lights of the village.

name: Edge of the Kazikliali canyon
description:
On the edge of the Kazikliali canyon with view to peaks of Aladağlar Park, the view is absolutely fabulous.  Access is easy.
Aladaglar Park is famous for routes to climbing.

name: Parking near St John Basilica
description: Free quiet parking after 5pm. I've been told it's 20TL from 8am but you can talk to Mehmet the carpet seller in front he's nice and speaks English. He will give you tips where to park for free and wifi if you need.

name: Food Market
description: Big and new food market. Chese, grocery, fish, meat and all kind of local pasta, pestil, sweet etc. in good price. They pack in vacuum.

name: Sheltered Bush camp
description: Private spot sheltered from the wind a few 100 meters from the beach. Road will be muddy after rain. Good cell service, no shade. Amazing nature all around.

name: Behind Catalan Baraji
description: Nice place next to the lake. Easy to reach. As usual, very dirty around, but we had quiet night without disturbing.

name: between the bushes
description:
quiet spot. Almost not visible from the small road. 
Not the most romantic place (some powerlines). No shade but lots of bushes. 
We drove there with our 2WD VW T4 when it was wet. 
Excellent 4G reception (at least with Turkcell)

name: Into the woods
description: Great flat space into the woods. If you have 4x4 you can venture a little bit more inside. Very calm spot, alone into the wild. We can hear the main road a little bit but it's not disturbing. If it's raining it would be mud so think about it before getting stuck ;)

name: Calm Spot At The River
description:
The other spot close to this one was a bit more crowded and in November the way to it has been too muddy, but we found this one, which is easy to access.
Directly at the river it has been very calm, just one friendly sheppard came along. It's a big area even for bigger rigs, no trash lies around. Turkcell worked very well here.

name: Super Calm Wild Camp
description: Easy to access spot (a bit mud here and there) and very calm. Nobody came along, Turkcell worked OK

name: Good For One Night
description:
We couldn't find any other appropriate place in the near, which is hidden enough for taking an outside shower, but this place has been calm, easy to access and fairly hidden by trees and bushes. In this month, the place has been pretty muddy, but our small spot was quite good and dry.
Turkcell worked well here.

name: Breathtaking View Close To Yedigöller
description:
We couldn't make it to the Yedigöller itself, as the rest of the path was covered by snow, so we decided to stay here for the rest of the day.
A perfect view and no light pollution granted us some very special Milkyway photographs and even Turkcell worked fairly well.
There are a few spots here, which could be great for a night or more, lots of possibilities for photographing and hiking.

name: Rocky forest
description: Lots of spots to wildcamp, amazing surroundings. 1200 meters altitude. Light offroad to get there and little road noise. Good 4G.

name: Yo hill near Harran
description:
Up the hill. Not accessible with big caravan without 4x4 system.
The locals turned a barren hill into a beautiful, lush village green. Visitors are very welcome. Only a few minutes by car from Harran.

name: Öludeniz beach
description:
For tents only (we brought our bicycles). Very beautiful spot, lots of Lycian way hikers that camp here. Sometimes there's music from the beach bars, so you might want to bring earplugs. We normally like to camp as isolated as possible, but this place was surprisingly cool and we totally fell in love with it! We met lovely people and spend 4 nights instead of the planned one night. In the mornings you wake up to the water rushing, untill noon you are sheltered from the sun by the mountain shadow. We left our tent and bikes during the day, felt very safe. On the beach there is cold water showers. 

How to get there: When facing the beach, go all the way left over the boardwalk and than further over the sand, around the rocky wall that seems to be the far left end of the beach. When you walk around the tip of it over the beach, you enter the area that is dedicated for camping (officially allowed).

Ps. Go paragliding and scuba diving, you won't regret it!

name: Deyrulzafharan Manastırı parking
description: Deyrulzafharan Manastırı parking. Quite place near Mardin city.

name: Good place, if you won't find anything else
description:
At first we checked out the place on the tip (small peninsula), but it was completely full of billions of small flies.
As time has gone by, we needed a place for the night, which is this one.
Not really leveled, but tidy, calm, with lots of space, even for bigger rigs and a grassy/stony surface.
The view is nice and also Turkcell worked pretty well.
Easy to access, no 4x4 needed

name: Water tap next to road
description: High pressure water tap right next to the road. And the view is awesome, too.

name: Koy Kahvalti
description: Nice filling Turkish breakfast sitting by the river for 55 TL including tea. See photo attached.

name: Lakeside
description: Beautiful nature and lake. Lots of space to find a spot. Very quiet, some locals fishing in a few spots around the lake.

name: Water fountain
description:
Water fountain by the side of the road. 
Good drinking water!

name: Sanko Park AVM
description: Parking lot next to a mall. Found parking space everyday here. Near a park, quiet. The mall has Migros (grocery), cafe with wifi and many shops.

name: Parking behind Van Lake in Erçis
description:
Parking behind Van Lake. Near there are a park because of it, there are music but it is not very annoying.
There are a Steak house restaurant at 100 metres.

name: The real eden
description: Alternative for the other place, higher up the mountain. Little quiet campspace, maybe a bit difficult to get your car level.

name: Gümrük Hanı
description: Caravansérail old style. Good place to drink a tea or even better try pistachio coffee (Menengic Kahvesi).

name: Wild camp with Ararat mount view
description: Quiet place with views of Mount Ararat.  During the day shepherds are seen in the area.

name: Motorcu Osse
description: Might be in the street behind or front. mechanic for motorcycles. Good guys and know what they are doing. The head mechanic Osman is skilled and helps you right away. They don't speak English but you can translate and make them understand.

name: Near Border to Iraq
description: We found this nice place, because in the evening we didn't want to enter the border to Iraq and it was a good decision. The place has been good so far, very easy to access and with a nice view to Silopi. Here and there a car came along, but nobody was interested in us. Just a little bit of trash was lying around.

name: Close To Midyat
description: Easy to access place, in the middle of the fields. Nobody came along, super quitet here, without any trash. Midyat was nearby (where we wanted to make a PCR-Test the next day)

name: Taşucu Şubesi
description: ATM where you can withdraw USD. Very useful if you want to go to Lebanon.

name: Med Star
description: Here is where to buy your ticket if you want to travel by ship from Turkey to Lebanon. They accept bicycles on their ships. But I don't know about cars or motorbikes.

name: Tires
description: Great place to buy new tires or repair. We bought 2 tires for our truck and repaired 1. Very good prices and service.

name: Dam
description: very nice place. we stay 2 nights very quiet a lot of photos really lovely place.

name: fill gas bottle
description: At this place  we asked if they should fil ours French gas bottle of 13kg. The fist answer was no, but after the guy said he could transfer 12kg from his bottles. So we accept and we fill ours 2 bottles.

name: Auto Japan Çerkezoğlu Otomotiv
description:
Place to buy parts for Mitsubishi, Isuzu, Kia, Hyundai, Mazda, Nissan and Honda.
We found several Parts for our Mitsubishi L300 and they were very helpful to determine the right parts for our car.

name: Erciyes Ski Resort Parking
description:
A parking lot at the Ski Resort of Erciyes. We slept here one night and it was no problem at all. Its good for winter time because the other spots are not accesible or pretty exposed.
Toilets can be used at the Skilifts.
Snowboard ant Ski rental is available. Snowboard an boots for 130 tl full day. Full equipment for 320 tl a full day. Skipass 20 tl for 1 day.

name: ipek (laundry) çamaşırhane
description: Laundry service where you can bring your cloth and let them wash and dry. We payed 35 tl (2.33 Euro at the moment) and it took him around 3 hours but the machine was free at this time. There is only one washing machine and one dryer.

name: Cag Elektron
description: An electronic store where you can find several switches and buttons. Also cable and other electronic stuff is available. The whole street has several electronic stores with good prices (payed 15 TL (1 euro) for 10 switch buttons). The owner speaks some english and can help you.

name: Pizza Locale
description: Place where you can order vegan pizzas. There are also normal pizzas.

name: Utucini Laundry
description: Laundry - wash and dry 50 tl per machine

name: Unpaved road and parking at the cliffs
description: An unpaved road along the cliffs with a couple of parking spaces, with a fantastic view. No need for 4x4, but your car or van should not be to big. Some local fisherman and locals, very quiet at night

name: quiet spot with a good view next to the road
description: A nice flat spot with a beautiful view, close to Kale. It was very quiet because at Kale the road is blocked (Jan 2022). They are making a new road. And there is no detour. The military police came by to check on us. No problem. 4G is not so good in the car.

name: High above Tortum Golu
description: Great over night spot high above the lake. Wonderful views. Quiet except for the prayer call at 5 am. No one and nothing around. Drive through the village in up hill direction, you can use Mapsme for the first part, and continue uphill along a dusty gravel road. You arrive at an open space with plenty of space for parking the vehicle. Rocky sandy ground.

name: Otopark Titus Tünneli
description: Good flat spot right next to the Jandarma, so it is safe sleep. Across the road there is a small beach. Perfect for visiting the Titus Tüneli park (15 tl). Good 4g reception

name: Paved parking at Merkez Park
description: A very quiet parking between two parks, right next to the water. It is paved. To access the parking you will go underneath some bridges, with no height indication. I think 3 Meters should go. Good starting point to visit the city by foot.

name: big picnic area
description: A big and nice picnic area in the forest directly at the sea, watertaps and tables everywhere. Toilets also available. Security. You can camp with your tent. We‘ve paid 35 tl / €2.30 February 2022. And almost no rubbish in the park.

name: Huge parking next to the beach
description: A large flat unpaved parking space next to the beach, if you want, you can drive to the big sand nose at the end. No need for 4x4. Very windy. The main road to get here is blocked due to turtle protection. PLEASE take the backside of the village to get here. Unfortunately the locals ignoring the road block….

name: Calypso camper parking
description: Wifi, camper parking, big camper accessibility,  free water, electric for 3.usd,camping gets locked up at 11pm so it's super quiet!  Amazing food at the restaurant. Nice people. Beachfront!!!

name: Pullu Kamp Alani
description: A camping picnic recreational site from the municipality of Anamur. Lots of shade directly at the sea. We‘ve paid 40tl, €2.55, March 2022. For a campervan. Electricity available but cost extra. The watertaps didn‘t work. Great view and quiet. Good spots for tents!

name: Wild Beach Plaji
description:
We saw that place from street, because others had been already directly at the beach. But we‘ve decided not to stay at the beach cause of our weight. At the end of that beach is like a tent and also a natural toilet. It’s a quite and nice place, where it’s possible to stay for one or more nights. Great for the kids; playing also if it was raining all the time outside.
Don’t forget to take your rubbish away! There are bins. Unfortunately before we came lots of people already seemed forgot where that rubbish belongs to

name: Temple of Artemis
description: This is one place of the seven churches. In front of the entrance you can find fresh water.

name: Idyma Kalesi
description: This is a really quiet place next to an ruin of a castle which becomes rebuilted and Olivetrees. Perfect if you travel with children, because place to run and climbing on trees. Good place to spend one or two nights. Short walk to lovely tavernas at the riverside.

name: Inisdibi Cd.
description: Here you can get clean water which tastes well directly next to the street.

name: Just to the night
description: We parked for the night next to this children's play area.  Nothing special, clean place, calm night

name: Delicious Turkish food
description: Already 2 times we came to eat at Ozler 19 restaurant. The food is really delicious, they have a lot of options and the price to 4 persons today was 170 Tl. Good price.

name: Goksu park
description: A huge park, with a lake, several restaurants, children's play area and many picnic tables with 24/24 surveillance.  There are several parking lots all at 5TL.  We stayed several nights and it was always very quiet.  There are also many points with water.  Definitely recommend.

name: Parking place below Madrasah
description: There's a big paved parking space near Madrasah. Looks like there was a summer cinema at this location, but it is now abandoned. Possible to walk up to Madrasah to visit.

name: Huge parking next to playground
description:
Huge area full of campers next to a playground. Free, no shadow, easy access.
Toilets available at playground (free), big Migros supermarket in walking distance.

name: Çetin Dizel Servisi
description: This Diesel engine, transmission and suspension repair shop can fix any issues you have with your diesel vehicle. Don’t worry if you don’t have the part Kerim the owner will find it for you.

name: AtaMoto
description: KTM workshop that can do all big bikes. Ahmet the owner is a very experienced overlander himself. recommended.

name: happy Turkey
description: cool beach place, quiet, good view, bins, no free dogs.

name: ATA Hotel
description: Large and cheap hotel with swimming pool, restaurant, breakfast included and secure underground parking for motorcycles

name: Ilica Veteriner Klinigi
description: This veterinary helped us without complications to take our new family member (a dog, a little puppy) to go with us to germany. He vaccinated and made the papers which allows us to take him with us. He speaks English. He also offers all you need for the dog. Open everyday.

name: Erciyes ski resort
description:
This is the ski resort Erciyes. Ski pass is paid per lift ride. There is no day pass with unlimited runs.  You can buy different packages of lift rides and you can also share one card with other people. The two of us shared one card with 30 rides for 260Tl and skied from 9am to 3pm. 
Also at all four gates you can find a rental shop for euipment. We rented skis, boots, poles and helmet (obligatory) at the Tekir gate in a shop called „Karmen“ for 160Tl pP.

name: Hotel Aluca
description: Very nice hotel with big rooms and ensuite. Lovely hot shower and very comfortable bed. Clean and modern. PET FRIENDLY. We stayed with our 3 dogs, no extra cost, very friendly to animals. Breakfast included. We are on motorbikes, there was an Otopark very close by to leave them overnight. Street parking is possible as well. Cost for us 2 people) was 350 TL ($US 24 at the time). Definitely recommend. Lots of restaurants within 5 minutes walking.

name: Tatvan Hospital
description: Good place to do PCR for going to Iran. They were very quick and nice, cost was 170 TL. Did the test at 12 noon and got the result via WhatsApp in the evening.

name: FIAT Professional
description: Fiat Professional Service and spare parts

name: perfect beach
description:
really good place out of tourist season.
quite, beautiful water, sand, outside table, bin. We slept here one night, we made a fire and everything ok.

name: Ejder Hotel
description: Clean comfortable rooms, friendly staff. TL 250 per night including breakfast. Parking for motorcycles right in front of reception.

name: Türkiye Bankasi
description: One of these three ATMs has a dollar sign on it. Here you can get dollars for border crossing to Iraq. ATM got me the needed amount in 100$ bills

name: happy fontain
description: drinking water on the off road with beautiful view

name: lost paradise
description:
perfect place if you want to be alone ! 
we slept here 2 nights and we just saw a shepherdess! OK for 2 cars, view on the sea and mountains, drinking water 500m far. if you have some food, we can stay here easy many days ! beautiful sunset, hiking, walk on the beach.. enjoy at this place!

name: Varol Pension
description: Great little pension with 2 apartment rooms. Excellent secure bike parking. Old guy who runs the place is friendly but speaks little English. basic but clean and comfortable. 250TL per night. Cafés and small supermarket very close by. Walking distance to Troy ruins

name: Cunda Bade Otel
description: Nice clean and comfortable rooms, friendly owners. Very nice place to stay. Bike parking under awning in front of the hotel. Off season price TL350 no breakfast.

name: selimiye place
description: parking just front the sea, we slept here one night out tourist season ( 26 march), quite, beautiful.. we eat at the BAHTIYAR PANSIYON, 150LT for 2 persons! really good and friendly!

name: Mehmet fontain
description: big drinking water natural fontain in à beautiful village

name: Tuncay Pension
description: Friendly owners and clean comfortable rooms. No bike parking but in the more expensive (600TL) Naza hotel just 50 metres or so away the very nice owner will let you park there behind locked gates...if you ask nicely!😜 Off season price of Tuncay Pension TL 300 with breakfast.

name: Shah Sultan Ozturk
description: Great place to stay with clean comfortable rooms and parking for motorcycles. Owner is Australian Turkish guy Adam. Super friendly staff. Walking distance to Hierapolis and restaurants etc. TL300 with breakfast (off season)

name: Truck Tire Repair
description: Experienced staff (trained by Michelin). Some English and French speaking. Their storehouse for new and used tires was filled quite well.

name: Talas
description: Very nice place for camping , look at the photos , you can go further to the mountains from the highway

name: Dove Hotel
description: Clean and comfortable rooms with safe bike parking inside the hotel. 280TL with breakfast off season.

name: Kose Pension
description: Safe bike parking inside. friendly staff. clean comfortable rooms. close to food and sights.

name: Top view
description: This is the place which many campers coming for stay , great view when balloons are flying os like you are in the middle point

name: happy Antalya
description:
big free parking with trees and bins.
we slept 2 nights here, it's not the most sexy place but that's do the job. restaurant, 2 commercial gallery with everything you need and toilets. 10 min from Antalya city, quiet during the night, safe.

name: Near the river
description: We ask a shepherd to sleep here, no problem. A few meters from the road behind the river.

name: Motorhome area in Adana
description:
Big area for motorhomes.

It is located next to old damn in Adana, right next to the river.

A beautiful 20 minutes walk alone the water will bring you to the old town.

name: Next to Harbour
description: Next to the harbour and in front of golf camp. Some barbecues. A little dirty with plastic bags.

name: Kahrahantepe
description: A newly excavated site that rivals Gobeklitepi. Signposted from the town of Dagyani, turn right at the Jandarma station if coming from Sanliurfa.

name: Konya service center
description: This place is the best for repairing all the cars , lots of other repairing shops are here.

name: Ozenler Residence Hotel
description: Silopi has limited choice in places to stay. This place is half the price of the other hotel listed...and it shows. Very basic but tolerable. Try to get room not facing the road. Basement carpark will fit bikes only. Cars etc in front of the hotel. No breakfast TL220.

name: Sound of Nature
description: A good place for camping , flat area as you can see in the pictures, close to road

name: Water source 1200m
description: very good drinking water from the source

name: Oli Change and car repairs
description: very good part selections and oil service

name: Sanliurfa Gullubag Mah.
description:
This is a great place to stay for one and more nights. We had been here for four days. During sightseeing of the city we have parked at the museum for 10 TL, which is perfect to see all the points of interests.
Here we had a great time to relax with our children and our dog. Before you enter here you should make sure, you have everything you need, because there are no services around; you have to drive about 10-15 minutes. Please make also sure, that you take your rubbish away; there are no bins!
As an advice; enter at daylight because it might be difficult for your motor home to enter that place.

name: Flood plain
description: Quiet, easy access spot with a beautiful view of Mt Ararat. Hidden from the highway. Stayed one night, two Shepards stopped to talk. Both were friendly and we shared a coffee. We hiked to the top of the ridge line to the north for a beautiful panoramic view.

name: Isik motor Honda MC mechanic
description: Changed head bearings on my Africa twin. Has big Honda bikes. seems like good mechanic.

name: Outside of Yesiluzumlu
description: Large open space with a number of trees off the road between Uzumlu and Ortakoy on the road to Denizli. Space for multiple tents/campers/motorhomes. Locals have clearly used it as there are a number of fire pits. Plenty of water cooling points on the roadside nearby. No other facilities.

name: Altinoluk
description: Wooded area with olive trees between the highway and the sea. Pebble beach as well as grassy area for camping

name: EVREN Otel
description: Cheap, but clean and well kept inside, parking for 3 or 4 motorcycles. not secure behind gates, but out of sight on the Hotel premises next to the front door

name: Pamukkale wood
description:
at 10km to Pamukkale, perfect place for sleep free and quiet. we slept here one night and everything ok. 
the internet "turkcell" is not the best one but it works.

name: Next to the road
description: Country road, we spend the night in a small driveway behind an abandoned house.  Quiet night a few meters from the road.

name: Geyikli
description: Hillside overlooking bay. Flat parking area for vans and more secluded grassy areas for tents under the trees. Lots of dogs.

name: kula park
description: big parking with toilets ( not the best one but they do the job), flat, quiet, perfect place for start hiking, at 15 min of Kula. Internet Turkcell works slowly.. 2 nights here and no problems.

name: Tabiat Parki
description: Big nature/picknick park in the forest. All a bit run-down, but nice camp spot in the pine forest. Very quiet despite it being weekend. Taps with running water and ok toilets. No shower, but there’s a little mosque with washing facilities if need be. Was charged a hefty 64TL for one person and car.

name: Crater pool
description: Romans built a circular pool (hot tub?) high up inside this volcanic crater. Legends. Some ruined towers overlooking the plains far below. The last stretch of the track was still blocked by snow when I was there, but looks like an epic camp spot if you can make it here during the warmer months. It’s a fun track, but would definitely recommend 4x4 only. Sharp turns on loose gravel. Follow the track in maps.me starting at 37.3298, 33.1982.

name: Mountain pass
description: If you go from Köprülü canyon to Beysehir Gölü or vice versa, Google will lead you over this pass, because the detour is big. Beautiful unpaved mountain track, but if you go this way after winter, check if the pass is open. Mid April I still had to turn around.

name: Kargi Han
description:
A nicely unrestored caravanserai. Gated but unlocked. 
Serious logging and road construction going on in the area.

name: Tazi Canyon Hill
description:
A large beautiful open field in the pine forest on top of the hill near Tazi Canyon. 
Coming from direction Köprülü canyon, when the paved road comes to a green gözleme stall, it splits. Left is the unpaved road down to the viewpoint. Right is to Gaziler. Instead, take the small track UP the hill opposite the gözleme stall and along the left of the big tin roof at 37.2443, 31.1848. 
Spotted a toilet and sink down near the stall. 
Very quiet. Turtles roam the forest. 

The friendly family at the stall kindly asked to be very careful with fire since the devastating forest fires they had further east from here. 
From this field a marked trail due west leads to viewpoint #2 where the tour groups don’t go. Shepherd said the cliff had already taken five of his goats, so be careful.

name: Adam Kayalar
description:
Area with interesting rock formations. “Adam Kayalar” translates to “man rocks”. 
Actually a really nice unpaved track through the rocks. Narrow turns at some points, so wouldn’t do it with a big rig. It makes a great half-day loop from Tazi Canyon to Selge via Gaziler. Above Selge, there are several cattle gates on the road that you have to open and close.

name: Peninsula
description: Big forested peninsula. Surprisingly unused currently. Plenty of possible camp spots at the far end. Many tracks so I’m guessing ATV rides in summer season.

name: Laundry service near Izmir
description: Near Izmir, laundry service. 35 tl each machine

name: ulubat lake
description:
big parking with beautiful view on the village and lake. some locals people come here in the evening but it's quiet during the night.
the weather was not good for us but I think it's really beautiful with the sun!

name: Orient Camping
description: Very natural place. The owner do cottages from wood by himself also let customers work. Very creative, very special and rustic. Rent a small wooden house, for tents, motorhomes not too big, because lot of shadow/trees. Pool for hot days.

name: To the mountain oludeniz
description: Its nice and flat space over the mountain which is great and silenced, there is dusty road to here and just 10 minutes away from the last hotels and road ,  great ocean view

name: upholstery work
description: All kinds of upholstery work.  We did all the mattresses in our van and added an armrest for a very affordable price.

name: Works in steel and aluminum.
description: Works in steel and aluminum.  We made a box at a very good price. Good quality and faster service.

name: iznik lake
description: big parking or you can park under the trees, or you can park in the grass. aqua drinking near the mescin, little bit noisy but it's ok. view on the mountains or lake.

name: Customer stickers
description: A good quality costumer sticker. Very friendly people and good prices

name: Camp Geyik
description: Small and quiet campsite with space for some vehicles on a slightly sloping field. Also nice cabins for rent and spots for tents. Toilets are super clean and showers are amazing. There’s a large fully stocked communal kitchen you can use and living room with comfy armchairs. Social vibe. We paid 6 euro p.p.p.n. so Lira price depends on the exchange rate. Open in winter. All campsites in this valley are mainly climber oriented (Sep-May), so summer is off-season. We ended up here because nearby Josito wouldn’t accept non-climbers. Same for Flying Goat camp. You could also try Rido camp nextdoor.

name: Merecedes Benz
description: Official Mercedes service for vans and trucks in Izmir.  Attentive and they solved the problem with the stabilizer bar and the handbrake.

name: Marmaris
description: This place is about 10 minutes away from the city but it's good to camp , the road is dusty but clear , nice view to the ocean and city , some people trekking and crossing in the day but still quiet at night

name: Sarniç Piknik Alani
description: Public park with a lot of places to park and tables for picnic, WC and water taps. There are some bars inside.

name: Green Erek
description: Decent hotel for a stop over if you are going east. nice room, good breakfast. spacious parking. The hotel is next to the highway. We paid 350 Lira for two persons one night, incl breakfast. very friendly staff.

name: Field
description:
perfect place in the middle of nowhere. 
beautiful view, really really quiet, only you, the field and the sing of birds. we slept here one night, pay attention on the dirty road because sometimes it was muddy.. we have 2wd and it was OK.

name: Parking near the sea
description: Paid parking, 18tl per day.  Quieter than the free one that is two kilometers away.

name: Fountains
description: This is one clean and most probably unpolluted spring out of many along this road, especially on its SE descent towards Bergama. The locals drive here in droves to fill their water containers with spring water.

name: Beach
description: Green area in front of the beach, a few kilometers from Güre.  Residential area with few people at the time we visited.

name: Next to the water reservoir
description: Small reservoir with a parkings space near the water surrounded by nature. About 1km fron the road.

name: Sea side ruins
description: Neat place for camping on an elevated level to the ocean! Beautiful view from top. Rocky road, but should be manageable with every typ of car. No houses around, enough space for tents.

name: Nitro Bisiklet
description: Professional bike repair mechanic. Responsible and trustworthy.

name: Ekincik Kamping
description: The best camping place on bay. You can stay in your own tent, caravan also they have rooms. They offer a nice breakfast and they have a bar next to the beach.

name: On the hill overlooking the valley
description:
The place is situated on a small plateau, overlooking the valley. It has great views at sunset! 
Your navigation is not going to find it. Drive to these coordinates (38.8844242, 27.7765666) and follow the gravel road or use the satellite picture of Google Maps. 4x4 might not be necessary, but it's only suitable for small vehicles like pickups, vans or 4x4s

Enjoy it, and leave nothing behind.

Thebluelandy

name: Camping close to foça
description: Kind of an official wild camping site without any facilities or else whise… Two pebble beaches below. Might be crowded in summer! Quite windy spor as well. Otherwise very comfortable, beautiful view and close to foça!

name: Place at lake
description: This is a calm place at the end of a lake. We spent one night an can recommend this place. No shade.

name: Beach Camp
description: A lot of camping Opportunities close to the beach. Clean, not as crowded as the other beaches. Don‘t trust Google Maps Navigation, better have a look at satellite pictures. 4G.

name: Directly at the ocean
description: A lot of spaces directly at the beach. A little tough road, but should be possible with any car! Seems to be a popular camping spot also for locals in summer.

name: Parking full of local campers
description:
Very convenient place for long-term stay. Big parking, a lot of permanent local caravans and motorhomes (but not frequently visited by locals, only a few actually live there, they rather come to hill on weekends).
Incredible air quality, park nearby, toilets available. Short walk to bus stop to the centre. Small Migros in 2 mins walking, huge shopping mall 10 min walking.
Stayed there for approximately 6 weeks, noone bothered us. Recommended if looking for relatively long time place to stay. But few nights also ok.

name: Fiat Professionell
description:
We‘ve bought some missing parts for our Camper. No problems. Helpful and friendly.

———————————————-

Vertragshändler Fiat. Reparatur und Ersatzteile.

name: Hakki Atamulu Kültüri Parki
description: Nice spot to stay for a night. Lots of amenities like WiFi, playground, picnic places, sports equipment, and also water and toilets. May be in summer pool is also useable. It’s quite near to the centre. In the evening there are some young people who might be noisy, but not as long. Have been here for one night. Got our recommendation.

name: Safranbolu View Oldtown
description:
A great place to stay for one or more nights with a great view over the old part of the town. Here are no services, only water.
We‘ve enjoyed that stay very much with our 4 children and our dog.

name: Mesire Alani Freizeitpark
description: A really great place to stay also if doesn’t look like that for the first view. They offer picnic places, toilets, water and in saison restaurant. A little market you can reach after a 5 minutes walk. The special of that park is a mini zoo with playgrounds and sport facilities. In the museum you can see the history life of Kayseri - entrance free for all that offers.

name: Hidden Bay
description: Good Alternative for crowded campsites nearby, 4x4 only.

name: Free CYCLIST campsite
description:
Contact the owner, Adnan, on warmshower.
Private Garden arranged with a shed where you can lock your bike, shower, sink. The owner is really nice and an old cyclist!

name: Gas Bottle seller
description:
Here you can buy blue gas bottle. 
30tl cost empty bottle, deposit

name: water fountain
description:
Fountain is hight debit, locals come take some water here too.
You have car space just in front of the fountain.
Maybe possible to hook a hose.

name: Oh be camping
description: Good Camping, electriciti, Hot water, moetorcicles are welkoming, nivel people

name: Water at a cemetery
description: Clean place and good pressure to hook up a hose.

name: Hidden stone book.
description: The large quarry is located directly on the D 965.  We stood by the river.  The area is not visible.  You are very protected.  Very good for one night.

name: Drinking water - Günay Vural Hayratı
description:
Perfect drinking water source directly on the street, good pressure, two taps. No screwing connector, but just a pipe-like faucet, hose can be connected with bare pipe adapters.
Good taste, cars can be parked directly next to the taps.

name: Dead-end Track with Lake View
description:
This is a great spot, about 50m above the lake. It‘s a bent gravel track cut into the rocky hillside with a made, level gavel platform giving plenty of space. It’s a dead end, unsure about its purpose.
Some shade from the pine trees but pretty much free views over the lake. You cannot be seen from the road. Some road noise but distant. Some rubbish but picked up quite a bit of it.
Only a weak Turkcell signal.

name: Beautiful spot amongst old trees
description: While driving south through the mountains this was the first place we had any cell service for quite a few kilometers. 2 bars of LTE with Turkcell at the top of the dirt track. Very quite and lots of parking spots. The road up is a little steep and bumpy but we made it with front wheel drive fine. Might be tricky when wet.

name: Another view for baloons
description:
Much easier accessible (imo) than the spot few hundre meters north, the same dirt track, but at least it's short and goes downhill if you go back, so should be doable even in wet weather with big rigs.
Nice morning view to baloons on one side and to the castle on the other side (don't miss night lights, quite remarkable)

Doesn't look flat, but one can establish quite level position on the ground.

Was incredibly dirty when I came here, 3 burnt ground places with few meters from each other. Probably in good weather some locals might come here, but on cloudy Saturday evening there was noone except one NL camper next to me.

Very good Turkcell LTE.

name: Mekanik Servis Rize
description: We had to do some maintenance for our car and found this place. They specialise in Land Rover (discovery) but service all car makes. Even with the language barrier communication was easy and they were very friendly. The owner showed us the tea fields with a small tour with his car. When we came back they completely washed our care as a gift. Very friendly and helpful service!

name: Tekirdag
description: Turkcell phone shop in shopping centre at this location to buy SIM cards. Very helpful.

name: Ani World Heritage Car Park
description: Ani is fairly close to Kars in that bit of Turkey bordering Georgia and Armenia.  Ani was a former Armenian capital many centuries ago and its buildings now have World Heritage status.  Remote location, few trees, very poor villages caring for goats cows but stunning spot with views across to Armenian snow capped mountain ranges.  The large flat car park has stunning views.  We asked at ticket office if we could overnight and it was agreed.  We will visit the site in the morning before driving on to Georgia.  There are toilets outside the site near the car park which are open at least up to 7pm and open at 8am.  I went to look at 7.30pm when everyone had left and they appear to be unlocked.  They are new but poorly cared for.  There is a cafe which is not open out of hours. You need to check when site is open as may be snowbound in winter and may not be open. The space is flat, cobbled and suitable for big rigs.  Easy to turn around.   Has a CCTV camera which makes it more secure and some lighting in car park.  There is a water fountain a few kilometres before you reach the car park listed separately.  You would need to fill water containers from taps.

name: Lavanta Tatil Köyü
description: Its a great place for rest and relax between the mountains. There are tiny houses (bungalow) , campground available. Bungalows are clean, have hot water and comfy. There is an air conditioner as well at all of the bungalows. Camping area have clean restrooms and bathroom and hot water available. There is a running restaurant as well. Safe area. Must stay, very peaceful.

name: Kilyos Natural Life Park - Kilyos Dogal Yasam Parki
description: It is a caravan and tent camping area. Two sections are apart frqom each other. It is in between the forest, facilities are in construction (May 2022). Camping section is 150mt away from sea.

name: Euromaster Antalya Ugur Sehin
description:
A super tire dealer, never before has anyone been so committed to replacing tires.  I wish that in Germany too. 

———————————————————————

Ein Super Reifen Händler,noch nie war jemand so engagiert beim Reifentausch. Das wünsche ich mir in Deutschland auch.

name: Unnamed site
description: Very nice spot tucked away at the end of a dirt road only accessible by adventure bike or 4wd. Is right next to a bay with clear water, would be fantastic in summer, there is a campfire spot already there.  Couldn't adjust star rating but would have given it 4.

name: Idebessos ruins
description: These ruins are pretty incredible, sarcophagus's in good condition everywhere. Well worth a look camping could even be possible.

name: Secluded beach
description:
Very secluded beach, there are some houses nearby but they appear to be in the process of being built.

There is a small parking area down by the beach. The beach has it's own (cold) shower.

Beautiful small road on the way here, perhaps not suitable for ultra-wide vehicles but the road quality is good.

name: Public Campsite
description:
It is a free camping site. To reach it, after you leave the road at Zakkum restaurant and go all the way down and straight for around 700m (don't turn left, in the curve to the left you have access to the hiking).) You can have access to shower and toilet by paying for it to the neighbors. You can access the Butterfly valley hiking  in 500m. The way back with a motorhome is a bit difficult because of the inclination and slippery.
Shower 15TL and WC 4 TL at neighbours house.

name: Halıdere
description: near the sea, good for spending a night. potable water, picnic tables and incredible view of the gulf. you can watch sun rise and sunset

name: Beach camping
description: This place is near the village and you can  camp free of charge, also there is a small supermarket where you can buy water. We stayed for 1 night and the local people are friendly.

name: Günübirlik Kamping
description: it's near the beach clean place also free , doesn't have rest room but it's a building construction you can use it.

name: Plateau
description: Forest. At the top of the road. Grass, pine trees and a lot of place where to camp.

name: Quiet secluded spot near highway
description: Stayed here one night on our way. It is a pretty location and secluded. A few cars passed but none during the night. There a little creek easily accessible. It is possible to get here with all kind of vehicles.

name: Turtle heaven
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts reported in this location. Please use caution.

Great spot to camp. It is really quiet and we didn't see anybody for the day and night we stayed here. Many turtles and some curious cows though. In the area there are many military units but this place is secluded from that. You should be able to walk down to the river and a lot of firewood present. 
If our electrics didn't break down we definitely would have stayed for more nights.
Also great (safe) surrounding for kids to play.
Its a dirt road in good condition but probably not for big vehicles. Preferably 4wd but in dry weather should be fine with any car.

name: Toyota Service
description: Toyota Dealership, very helpful with Service on Our Landcruiser. Top friendly service advisor Muhammed and mechanic Ahmet. recommended!! Mehmet, owners son speaks good english.

name: Termal bayramhacı kaplıca
description: Old natural hot pools with indoor and outdoor pools and a hot showering area. You can park here overnight in the car park and use the hot pools for 100lira per adult (kids half price). There are clean toilets you can use and a spring water tap. The whole place is a bit decrepit but the people are relaxed and friendly. There is a restaurant but we didn’t try it. We were actually aiming for the nearby campsite but it didn’t seem to be open and a local directed us down here instead. If you park at the end of the car park under the trees you have a lovely view of the lake.

name: Automot 4x4 service
description: Friendly 4x4 specialist mechanic (he offroads in a Patrol and Cherokee himself). No English but gets on fine with google translate. Serviced our land cruiser and fixed an issue with the diff for us. Also provides lots of tea!

name: Wild campsite with views
description: Flat site for tent. Flat area with shade and views, plenty of space for camping, access only for bicycles or motorcycles

name: Dead end near ocean
description: Beautifully situated place at the end of a dirt road.  The driveway is narrow, only suitable for small off-road vehicles and bikes.  It was very quiet, there were no disturbances.

name: Artabel national Park
description: Very nice  wild campsite in the middle of high peaks, rivers, lakes and waterfalls. Perfekt for hiking and bear spotting :) . The street is ok but not paved- also possible for big rigs- just the part in the Village is a bit narrow and sharp but possible.

name: Nuri Park Hotel
description:
200 TL for single 
300 TL for double 

Room are nice and clean 
it's give wifi
free parking
it's possible to store bicycle

name: next to the river
description:
Location by the river. On the Iraq border. Shadow of trees. calm. no internet

emplacement au bord de la rivière. sur la frontière Irak. ombre des arbres. calme. pas de réseau

name: little shelter and table
description:
Near a small and very quiet road
It give water 1 km from here if you come from west.
Gravel parking in front
Here it's give a tape but no water ...

name: Extreme Park camping
description: nice small campground next to the Extreme theme park. I paid 80 TL for 1 tent and my motorcycle. There are trees for hammocks. Pretty quiet at night, except for some dogs barking. The WiFi does not reach the campsite, but there is a few cafes and restaurants nearby.

name: Antalya customs office
description:
Customs office 

1. If you leave Turkey by flight and park your car, you need to get a paper from any customs office approving that you leave your car behind and that they can confiscate it when you don’t come back in time. If you don’t, there might be a fine when you eventually exit the country with your vehicle. 


2. if you extend your (tourist visa) stay with a temporary residence permit (ikamet), you also need to extend your car’s permit at any customs office. Application for the ikamet needs to be done before expiry of the tourist visa. After application it may still take many weeks before you receive the ikamet card, even though your visa expired, but that’s no problem as long as you have the proof of application. Nevertheless, (this) customs office wants to see your ikamet card AND extension of the car permit needs to be done BEFORE expiry. This means you need to apply for your ikamet well before expiry of your tourist visa so you receive it in time or these guys will fine you for extending your car permit too late.

name: Ordu water sport centre
description: This is an athelete trailer park for a new sports centre.  Room for 20 trailers and an additional 20 caravans.  Has clean toilets, hot showers, electrical hook up at standing for free, water to each spot and is brand new.  Currently no charge for its use.  Has CCTV.  Has two guards.  Not pretty but on the sea and free.  Already well used.  We asked guard for cost and he said no payment.  Lots of picnic tables and all facilities.Young trees so no shade.  Great if you are passing through.  Not a destination!

name: campplace with spring and toilet
description: a parkingplace to camp with fresh water and a toilet. small tents have also space under the trees

name: Parking near old town and museum
description:
Small parking close to a playground. 5 min walking to old town. Quite at night. Big rigs can fit, but it's some steering...
Water at the playground.

name: Mola Organic Camp
description: Nice little Camp on a vegetable farm. Owners are very friendly. We paid 200,- for 2 people.

name: akdamar alabalık tesisi camping
description:
Picnic/ camping with a restaurant cooking only local fish, they have prefab cabins too. The cabins are rough but comfortable with their own bathroom.
Local people visits the place for picnics in the weekends.
200TL for a cabin, 80 for a tent

name: campplace with spring and toilets
description: campplace with spring and toilets. some tabels and a playground for kids. big trees for shade

name: Butterfly valley
description: Found a tap by the view point of butterfly valley. Unsure if it is drinkable.

name: Delmece Plato / Delmece Yaylasi
description: Country side. Natural plato appropriate for camping. There are local houses that also give service in drinks and basic foods.

name: Manzana Camping
description: I am adding this as a separate entity as the new owner is no more affiliated with Havuz the previous place part of a hotel. The restaurant and the pool is now operate separate and there is plenty of space for all type of vehicles to park. The bathrooms are a bit rundown but still functional. Stayed here for two nights and it was great. We did not try the restaurant.

name: Star Hotel Apart
description:
Paid 200 TL for a single 
Nice place, clean and spacious room (35m2)
Nice view on Mt Ararat
2 min Walk to walking street  
It give space to store bicycle inside
Ham and Turkish bath next door 40 TL

name: Antalya area
description: Campsite with great views. Some pines. At 100m of a quite road.

name: Peaceful spot on hilltop next to collapsed eind turbine.
description: Beautiful spot on hilltop with views all around. You can drive there easily (also with 2WD) using the gravel road leading to the white base of a former wind turbine. Turkcell reception.

name: Parking Area
description: As in many places in this area, this parking has been taken over by local caravans that seem to be permanent. It is an option but for sure not the best one if you are looking into a quiet night!!

name: Koprukoy Deliçermik Creek
description: A picnic area next to a former thermal bath (not in service any more). children playground, picnic tables, toilets and drinking water. A guy comes to collect 10 TL for a family to stay there at a table the afternoon. No problem to pitch the tent for the night. very quiet, away from every house.

name: Mountain source
description: Fresh drinking water on the middle of a parking lot. Comes directly from the mountains. People come to fill up their bottles.

name: Quarry
description: Very big area at an abandoned quarry. It’s close to the highway but you don’t hear it very much. It’s very private and most of the 100 potential spots here can’t be seen from the street. There are no dogs at all, so you can let your dog run freely without any worries. It’s accessible with any vehicle. With “Turkcell” you’ve got full reception.

name: At the dam wall
description: If you visit Pergamon, this is the perfect place to sleep over. Big flat area behind the dam wall. We had nice wind, so it felt not that hot. A bit of rubbish around but you have a beautiful view over the dam. (We asked the guys at the small gate to sleep over)

name: Akören Göleti Dam.
description: Nice and private place between hills on small water reservoir. Accessible through track to some farms. Not too many level spots. Very quiet. Only a few cars passed. Lots of flowers. No Turkcell reception.

name: Remote sea side camp
description:
Beautiful sea side camp with small beach nearby. Located and the end of a gravel road leading downward from a plateau. Surrounded by steap rock walls. Completely quite at night, few visitors during day.
Road is in good condition made of course and sharp gravel. Could be used with any vehicle if you are careful. Going there with big rigs might be quite adventurous (Turning only at the end of the road).

name: Just before National Park/Emli Vadisi
description:
Nice camp spot just in front of Ala Daglar National Park boundaries. At the entrance to Emli Vadisi.
Water from well directly on site and with trees providing shade. Big rigs might park beside the trees.

name: Dursun Motosiklet
description: Motul oils and service area available. You can do your own work here.

name: Dogus Hotel
description: No motorcycle parking but can park on the footpath directly in front of the reception. Clean rooms and good breakfast. A bit expensive at TL400 though

name: Secluded spot with valley view
description: Great views over the valley from the roof tent. Undisturbed and reasonably flat (lots of stones around for fine-tuning). Very quiet. Reasonable network speed with TurkCell.

name: OTOPARK Isletmeleri Numune Kapali
description:
An official underground  garage with video-controlled parking lots. 
Available are long term tariffs. Car 1 month= 120 TRY

Accessible also for bigger/ higher cars, Vans or buses.

name: Teachers House
description: Nice, clean rooms. Breakfast included TL330. Motorcycle parking right in front. Plenty of food and attractions nearby.

name: Petrol Ofisi
description: For cyclists, this is a friendly petrol station where you can camp on the grass or under a gazebo in the parking lot.  wifi, wc, they even let me use the small kitchen. Strong thunderstorms. These guys are so friendly.

name: Huzur Camping
description: Camping at the sea, lots of trees for shade. Facilities basic but clean. Washing machine available. Friendly owner. You can swim in the sea but there are a lot of plants.

name: Bolu
description: We needed to find washing machines and or a service wash.  Found this on Google but not quite accurate in terms of location.  Very friendly and helpful

name: Ipekyolu Otel
description: Excellent bike parking in underground secure basement. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Breakfast included TL360

name: Makara Çadir Camping
description:
Nice camping close to the sea. The friendly owner didn't speak English but called his brother who did. The camping has mostly
 cabins and tents for rent. For our car with roof top tent they removed some chairs and tables to make space. There is a pool, bar and washing machines. Lots of threes and shade.

name: saray hotel
description:
250 lira for 1 person room including breakfast
bicycle parking inside
fast wifi

name: Hotel Terzioglu
description: If you really must stay in Hopa this is an ok place. off street parking, clean comfortable rooms 3.5 Star. If coming from Georgia you're better off heading towards Ardahan. there's beautiful lodges up in the mountains.

name: Martyr Ahmet Gilic source
description: Water source with tap - drinkable straight from the source

name: Flat grassy spot
description:
Flat grassy spot behind some hills. So separated from the road. 
Quiet at night with a nice star sky. 
In the Morning one friendly cow shepherd come by. 
Also big rigs fits here very easy.

name: Emre Restaurant
description: This is a real family run eatery. Come here for homemade food. Authentic dishes prepared and served with a smile!! You can find it easy , it is the only one that is full with locals and people that work in Kas.

name: View over Pamukale valley
description: Secluded spot in an opening between pine trees. Fantastic view over the valley. Quiet and good cellular LTE speed.

name: Sultanlar Otomotiv
description: We came here after breaking the frame of our sidecar and shock absorber. While waiting for new shock absorber, the owner Mustapha let us come and use all tools in workshop. He helped us to change chain kit and fixe lots of stuff on our sidecar. We have lunch with the team in office. We are not back on the road now but this is for sure a safe place to stop if needed. It’s an car workshop but I am pretty sure they will help anybody like us on a motorcycle or bike

name: Tap next to the traffic light
description: Water Tap with good pressure next to the traffic light.

name: Beyond Turtle Beach
description: Just a bit further down than the previous point here. The sand is hard enough to drive on, no 4x4 needed. No shade though. Local long time caravans had reserve the few spots.

name: Forest Lake Caravan Camping
description:
New campground, some gras fields and gravel fields. no shadow but new and clean sanitair. 
A tent and two person cost 125tl

name: Manastir beach
description:
Nice beach, sand quite clean, the rest like everywhere. There is a restaurant and bar at the end. The road to access is very beautiful but twisted and narrow, 
Place enough for 10. Some locals in the weekend.

name: Iztuzu Beach
description: Got here as it was recommended by an excursion guide. This is a view point over Iztuzu Beach, popular for 4x4 tours. After the sun sets we were completely on our own. The road to here is a bit washed out but still possible without 4x4. Maybe a bit more difficult after rain.

name: Warda Otomotiv „Total“
description:
Friendly older man who knows all about oil, filters and their replacement/change. He does the change right in front of his shop and has all kinds of oils and filters in stock.  Also some screws and stuff like that in stock. 
Friendly, quick and cheap.

name: Marmaris view point
description: Not sure if our GPS was correct but we came to find the other place added here ,we ended up camping in this one. There is better shade and they seem to open a log trail that runs straight through the other spot. Nice and quite night and as usual a bit of garbage.Great views. It is marked as a view point on mapsme

name: Kebaplar
description: Authentic Iskander and Adana kebab. On the back of the Marina otopark. Full with locals.

name: Beautiful spot at the shore of a dried up lake.
description: Easy accessible and beautiful views, between olive orchards and dried up lake. Very welcoming locals: farmers on their tractors working on the former lake, cow shepherds. You can camp next to the little boats that were left here. Turkcell reception.

name: Osmanaga Koyu Plaj/beach
description: At the (almost) end of a asphalt/dirt road, many places under pine trees with a small beach. Lots of (super) yachts to watch. Mostly locals camping. Tranquil.

name: Konya Parking
description:
Parking without height limit. 
Good location to park the car and explore the city center/market/bazar. 
3 hours - 10 Lira

name: olive field near Saklikent
description: A quiet spot near a big olive tree, close to an olive field. Along a gravel dirt road, about 300m from asphalt road. Can be reached with 2wd when dry, when wet please check before entering. Only for small rigs. Mobile internet from turkcell available.

name: Rusty Garage Marmaris
description: Rusty garage left of the dinghy workshop. Don't let the rusty facade fool you. Here is a good mechanic if you need to do works on leafspring, (drum) brakes, gears or diffs. If not, there are plenty of other workshops here too.

name: Knidos
description: At the end of the peninsula in Datca this is the sight of ancient city of Knidos. There was a 20TL entrance that is suspended for the moment because of works on site. Beautiful sea to swim. Ideal as a day trip from Datca or an overnight.

name: Clean and cheap hotel
description: Very cosy hotel for a stopover in the middle of a small town with safe parking right in front of the hotel. Rooms range from 200TL upward. We stayed in a double room with ensuite for 250TL.

name: Nice forest next to main road.
description: From the main road, where is the abandoned gas station, there is a track. In 500m there are some sites with grass and plans. Very quiet site only a very cordial pastor with its 400 goats

name: Kepez municipality picnic area
description: Lovely shaded picnic area with large trees, watersource and garbage container. Not quite level. Hardely seen from the road. Quiet night. We were directed here by a local. Recommended!

name: Ark Hostel and Camping
description:
Nice hostel and café with unobstructed view of Mt. Ararat. The owner is super friendly and easy going.

The campsite is under construction and will be available in the next few weeks. Although there is a small patch for a tent or two.

There is a shop, cafe, indoor, and outdoor self-catering facilities (kitchen), hang-out upper deck space, garden, wifi.

name: Water Well
description: Drinkingwater, delivers easily 100 liters per Minute from three outlets

name: Beautiful spot green mountains
description: This is a really beautiful spot in the green mountains, very peaceful. To reach this spot you have to pass a very small village, after the last house you have to drive up a small dirt track for about 500m. It’s a rocky road but we did it easily with 2wd. After this you will see a grassy ‘flat’ spot. Some friendly locals passed by. We had a perfect night. Enjoy!

name: Green field
description: If you come from the east, you will pass the spot on your right side (you will see a big field) the first traffic lights you see, you have to make a sharp turn to the right and you follow a small street all the way straight and you will come to the field. On top there are also some picknick huts, here are also toilets. A lot of choice to find a good spot. Not the most romantic place but it was little bit further from the main road so the traffic was not so loud. It was very quiet, not many people passed.

name: Turan Oto
description: Very nice and reasonable priced mechanic. He and his staff fixed my Landcruiser (blown turbo). He can do most cars, and if not, he will find the right garage for you. Be sure to ask for Ishak. The site is in a business park for car repairs, body work, parts etc., so everything can be done there. Ishak doesn’t  speak English but everything fine with Google translator. He is a trustworthy person. The street in the business park is: 30121 Sk. His phone is +90 544 576 99 88, mobile and WhatsApp.

name: Uzunkum
description: A very proper family owned place extremly proper. Directly on the beach. The lady speaks a little bit German. Great view.

name: Overlooking Akbuk
description: There are plenty of places to camp in this area. Akbuk is depending 100% on local tourism so it was fun to hang out with locals on vacation. Plenty of other caravans around but no facilities. The town is a bit more than a kilometer away for supplies. A bit of uneven ground but we manage to find a level spot.

name: At lake side
description: Quiet camping spot just at the border at the lake. A bit tight to get through the pine trees to get there but we managed. Some locals come during weekend but depart by evening time. All alone during night. A park ranger passed by in his truck and just waved to us so no issues in parking overnight.

name: Quiet spot next to the road
description:
Lovely place with water under some trees.
It's a flat area behind a rock wall. It’s next to the road but quiet. You are not visible and there are no houses. Sometimes some sheep come to drink on the spring.

name: Caravan parking behind building
description: The owner offers parking overnight (50TL). You can park behind the hall, so you can have a nice view and it is not so loud. In the hall there are toilets. It’s also possible to park your car here to visit the town. (10 minutes walk uphill).

name: Mardin Karavanpark
description: The operators are very nice people.  Helpful and there day and night.  Very simple shower and toilet project.  The price for us was 100TL including electricity.  All visitor information is correct.  Great starting point for visit Mardin.

name: Cesme-Chios Otopark
description: We were allowed to overnight here. No facilities but the guard was really nice offered us tea and show us the toilets in the marina.

name: Melenagzi plaje
description:
Ground for parking caravans, cars... you can pinch a tent maybe. If not follow the coast and there are many Wild Campings on the beach, and really cheap established campgrounds. There's an amazing restaurant beside, you can dinner fish. Quiet out of season as always. 
A great solution if caught you the night, no beach but you can swim.

name: Sahil camping palanin yeri
description:
Established campground. Basic but really friendly, the owners are amazing. They help you with everything. Beach to swim. Hot shower.  No restaurant but many around. Supermarket 3 minutes walking.  
 1 person and tent 100 turkish liras per night.

name: Ancient trail to Zigana
description: Wild camping just in to the way. Water and grass. Good view but exposed to wind.

name: Baliklama Balik Lokantasi
description: Local fish restaurant. All fresh, you choose, low prices.

name: Sahin Tepesi
description: AMAZING KEBAB! Made with fire, after all day riding offroad without eating...

name: Potable water
description: Next to the road a watertap with good pressure.

name: Grassy Black Sea Camp Spot
description:
we found a small track off the main coastal road, which led down to a nice grassy area by the black sea. the track is quite steep and a bit bumpy, but should be fine for most vehicles - you can easily assess it for yourself before going down. 
there is a good area for camping and also a flat bit of concrete which we used for a dinner spot in the shade. 
the track may be used for beach access so we left it clear. 
some houses just nearby - nobody bothered us. I don't know if this is private land or not.

name: Roadside
description: Easy to reach tap between Göreme and Kayseri

name: Moto Bulut
description:
Professional Motor bike mechanic. 
Helped us very quickly  with an engine problem. 
He is only speaking Turkish but with Google translate it will work. He will help you with your bike.

name: Snowdora Hotel
description: Fantastic place to stay out of the ski season Nov-Apr, TL 400, excellent breakfast. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Great cafe right on the premises that's cheap and good. Safe secure parking for bikes and vehicles, definitely recommended.

name: water source
description: nice place to fill up your tank. strong flow. no tap.

name: Gold Otel
description:
Great place to stay if you're planning to ride the Dark Canyon. Large, clean rooms with friendly staff. Sok directly downstairs, parking for all sized vehicles behind the hotel. Great little town with restaurants etc. Worth a night. 
TL250 per night including breakfast

name: Dereiçi Camping ve Restaurant
description:
Small nice campsite with Restaurant and very nice owners and good toilet and shower.
Price 150 Tl per night.

name: TSOF Motel
description: Motel from the Turkish driver's and automobile federation, it's located behind the service area, a private single room with a bathroom cost 100TL with breakfast included. Decent wifi, huge parking area and they are kind enough to let you park your motorcycle hidden inside the motel facilities. The service area has a gas station, restaurant with a mini market and a Starbucks as well.

name: Tokat Royal Otel
description: Very friendly owners, clean comfortable rooms. TL350. Motorcycle can park inside the building just have to come up a single step. Tokat is actually worth a night. Lot's of things to see.

name: nice source with strong current
description: nice source with strong current. nice source with strong current.

name: Sefine Hotel
description:
I was looking for an hotel to spend a night before crossing the border with Iraq.
not much in the area but found that one.
It is a new hotel, very clean, AC and hot shower working.
There is no parking but you can park in front, they have security cameras.
I paid 13 euros for a single room with breakfast included. Staff doesn't speak English but are very friendly!
Would recommend

name: Under the bridge
description: Literally under the bridge.  Flat site with the possibility of bathing and with good views.  Pretty clean for being Turkey.  Quiet road.

name: Samsun Kampi
description: Turkish Red Crescent camp but with about 18 rooms also available. Beachfront and definitely worth a stay. Can be a little noisy, but acceptable. Fit any size vehicle. Enter from the main road, not the beachside road. Ask for Halil. No English. Shops, restaurants bars coffee etc. all close by. TL300 for room. Sleeps 4.

name: Beach front
description: We find it when we were on the way to sea camping area , there is a place like a park but no one use it and infront of the beach , the train crossing sometimes but it’s really quiet

name: water source
description: strong source beside the highway heading west.

name: Roadsideide
description: Coming from Batumi, turn left immediately at the roundabout.  Good water pressure.  Probably drinking water network.  The locals drink it.

name: Arya Camping
description: Well organized camping for tents, vans, caravan and moto bikers. Showers are clean and have hot water. Restrooms are clean as well. There are tents available as well if needed. The owner and personal are very friendly. Very close to beach for swimming. There is a shade area for tents. Suggested! Owner’s name is Kadir.

name: Uygulama Oteli
description: Similar to the network of Teachers Houses this is a government run place that offers clean comfortable rooms with parking for all sizes of vehicles. Directly opposite the beach and restaurants etc. TL 200 single, 300 double. Recommended.

name: Anka Business Park Otel
description: Very close to Mototriple if you're needing work done on your bike. Clean comfortable and very nice rooms from 3-500TL. Walking distance to restaurants etc. Metro 10 minutes walk. 6 stops to Kadikoy. Definitely worth staying here if you want a nice place outside the city madness. Bike parking outside Otel or the great guys at Mototriple will let you keep your bike there. Definitely recommended.

name: near the Gavurkale Aniti
description:
Little spot at the end of the road.  Can only be reached with four-wheel drive.
Very quiet and beatiful landscape.

name: Mototriple
description: First class service, very professional and absolutely fantastic people. Highly recommended. Stay in the nearby Anka Business Park Otel I've added also. Short walk apart and close to metro train to Kadikoy. Highly recommended.

name: Yorgun Tekel Bayii Beer Shop
description: Searching non alcoholic beer we Fonds a Shop with a wide Selektion of real beer.

name: Cinaroglu Tekel Bayi Beer Shop
description: searching for non alcoholic beer we Fonds another selection of real ones :)

name: Wild camping near a small pond
description: Beautiful spot near a small pond. Reachable on a small gravel road. No traffic and not so far from the main road. Also suitable for Vans.

name: Oto Yedek Parca
description: This is the hangout for the local overlanders club. Great bunch of guys. This is NOT a mechanic but they're connected to everyone in the area. If you have any problems these guys can help.

name: wild Camping at lake
description: nice spot with many big areas. area ist graveled but you will find a place for your tent. we stayed here with two moto and to tent. in the evening some local fisher came and had a chat.

name: wildcamp near the lake
description: Little spot near the lake, in the fields.

name: lonely camp in the hills
description: We found this spot by searching for a stop heading to ankara. It's up the hill following a gravel-road (4x4 is not needed but recomended) with a little bit of shadow. there are diffrent places to stay, but this is quiet flat. We stayed with a Defender, but bigger cars may also fit on this spot. It is very calm, the street might be heared a litte bit. The only one who passes is a sheperd with his sheeps in the morning, but he didn't bother us.

name: Fountain
description: Big fountain in the center of ENEZ city. Restaurant owners nearby are very friendly and will even provide hot water.

name: nice place in canyon
description:
This is a dead end, you have to come from south. Nice place in the middle of nowhere. Small river possible to have a bath. During the week you are alone. Not much rubbish.
Needs some ground clearance to come here. Big rig is no problem. 

good Vodafone reception.

name: Sirnak Kaymakam Cesme
description: 42°C inside our vehicle and the tamarc is sticking to the tyres like bubble gum. So we are really happy to enter this shady place with good food.

name: great site on the river
description: On the other side of the road, access from a small metal bridge or road from a bridge to a secondary road.  Shady site, restaurant and super at 100m.  Quiet with some friendly neighbors.  Access only for motorcycles or bicycles.

name: Alıçlı
description: Picnic place, playground and shady spots near the river Çoruh

name: Danzi Camping and Caravan
description: Wi-fi,free parking for customer car, Tiny House,Breakfast,Cafe,laundry,shower,River,camping

name: Public water taps in Narince
description:
At the entrance of Narince, on the road coming from Aydinpinar, there are few water taps with nipples, perfect for filling-up the onboard tanks of campervans.
According to locals, it's drinking water.

name: The view over Pamukkale valley
description: Nice wild place for camping under pinetrees, we were alone here. Beautiful views over Pamukkale valley and you can enjoy nice sunset here.

name: Ekincik Public Campsite
description: You park on roadside with view on the fisherman boats, beach at walking distance, very quiet. Fee.

name: Amasya Riverside road
description: A few parking spots in this quiet street next to the river. Very central. We stayed one night.

name: Tahpur Mountain access over Ortaklar valley
description: Over 3000 meters camp with beautiful views of whole Kaçkar range, mostly over the clouds. Access through steep zigzag-road. Requires 4wd and not for bigger trucks. Only for months of july-august-september. The other months the road will be closed because of snow. For experienced camper drivers.

name: Hindiba Doga Evi
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.   

How About retreat in woods, seeking peace and serenity in nature?
Located on Yedigöller (Seven Lakes) road, where a small stream passing through and with a four season-one of a kind flora, Hindiba Nature House is an ideal destination for the ones who wish to spend an alternative and quiet holiday.

If you've missed walking among fresh fragrant flowers and trees, exercising in nature, falling asleep in a hammock while reading your book, taking hundreds of photos while playing with bugs and plants; camping all together, finding a little bit of privacy with your sweetheart, wallowing in the grass with kids, singing around the campfire, longing for a retreat, spending a day without tv, playing with cats&dogs, chasing chickens; participating in new and different workshops, discovering new skills and potentials in you, listening to your inner voice, moreover if you need to rest and renew your mind, body and soul Hindiba Nature House is the perfect place for you!

Hindiba Nature House is an ecological living space where the city rush and stress is far away; an alternative holiday spot for the ones who wants to rest in nature, where you have options to stay in seperate stone and wooden houses or in tents. Aiming to provide a nature-friendly and sustainable environment, we are hosting projects that fit this purpose and several events in various fields like personal development, body, awareness, art, hobby, etc.

There is a small stream of water flowing across the stone and wooden houses which each are unique and full of surprises; this stream follows you from the very moment you wake up, companies you while drinking a cup of tea, joins you with a chit chat and relieves all your worries. It's her duty. The only thing that you need to do is having a rest! Do yourself a favour; enjoy the peace & confort and this beautiful nature that has a very rich regional flora and a unique landscape in all four seasons.

And of course there is something that matters a lot for all of us: There is a saying, "the path to happiness is through your stomach".
