Here is Mengen, the land of talented cooks who are famous with their legendary culinary arts, and yet we have a very merry kitchen indeed! We cook delicious meals for you using the vegetables and fruits that we grow in our ecological garden, or with the goods that we supply from other ecological and regional producers in Hindiba Nature House. Moreover, for the ones who miss the taste of nature we produce seasonal and regional delicacies that you can take along with you and share with your friends&family.

By the way we don't forget vegetarians and vegans. There is allways a choice for everyone in Hindiba Nature House.

If you want a retreat away from the city-life and wish to have nature as a part of your life we are here waiting for you. Located on Yedigöller road, close to Mengen region / Kıyaslar village; just 2 hours from Ankara, and 4 hours from İstanbul.

Whether it's summer or winter we'd always be delighted to welcome you in Hindiba Nature House!

name: Oto Tanisman - Workshop, Tyres, Parts
description: Spare Parts, Oilchange, Tyres and Repairs in Idil.We bought a new Radiator Cap and had to wait until the Motor cools down. We were invited for a tea under shady tree. Very friendly and helpful.

name: the river
description:
You can stand directly on the river.  There are a lot of trees for shadow.

The water is cold.

name: Drinking Water Mardin
description: According to locals drinking water out of a pipe.

name: water source
description: water source. Not much flow but clear and cold water.

name: Kuru Temizleme Express
description: Washing and drying for expensive 200 TL.

name: Bella Kamp
description: Camp site with lots of space, bungalows for rent and amenities (toilets, hot showers). Small restaurant (we did not try) on the ground. No stray dogs. Shops and other restaurants close by (100 - 500 m). Nice beach 200 m. For our camper van with 2 people the friendly guy wanted 300 Tl incl. electricity. I managed to pay 250 Tl without electricity.

name: nice place near the road
description: Little spot, 50m away from the street. Also for big rigs. Little network. Quiet during the night

name: Running Water
description: Water with good pressure. On the right side direction west.

name: Nehir Evi Düzce
description:
Beautiful quiet campsite surrounded by forest right on the river. 
The place is within a rafting center with a pretty cafe and restaurant. 
They have a campsite in the back on a wide meadow with some shade options. 
Costs 100TL per night per person.

name: Water pipes
description: Water out from some pipes with a picnic tree at a scenic route.

name: Istanbul
description: 3rd source on the route between Eskikatha and  Subasi.

name: Route D925
description: End of the old unpaved pass road. turn down here to the right, cross the bridge. You will find enough spots.

name: place near the road
description: Flat spot near a quite road. Wonderfull sunset. 4G internet. Restaurant 200m

name: kanlıkavak parkı
description: the place has a nice view near the park. you can use the toılet of the cafe. the flower garden next to it helps about water. so close to the city center, restaurants cafes are very close

name: place for the night
description: coming from agri you turn to the right on the road to kazli.the next small path to the right ist your destination. go to the end a great place for the night

name: Water point
description: Water point. Water can be used for drinking. There is a small parking area.

name: Farm village near mosque
description: Water tap with happy children around. Seems clean. We filtered the water.

name: Caves north/West of Dögan
description: Open Air museum. Nobody but farmer and his goats and mules here. Watering trough, but I wouldn’t drink it. Very very Nice and clean spot. Leave it the same way.

name: PTT Gölbaşi
description:
Just in case you need an HGS stripe you can buy it here close to the highways. As usual you have to pull a number. But to be directed to the right desk, you have to select a theme from the menu. We asked the guard to pull one for HGS. One of the employes speaks English and we were forwarded to her when our number was displayed.  

In Turkey there is no possibility to pay toll at the gates of the highway. All the gates read you number plate automatically and if you don’t have an barcode “HGS Stripe” with enough deposit on it for the last stretch you drove, than it recognizes your car in a database. You have 14 days to balance it. When you don’t balance, it within it makes a fine on your account. When you want to leave the country with your car, and your HGS is not balanced, you have to pay a fine. Even higher when you don’t have an HGS.

It is not possible to pay online. It is possible only for Turks. You have to go to an PTT Office (Post) to pay. There you have the next problem as a traveler: PTT is open only from Monday to Thursday. If you need it on Friday to Sunday…. You find some rare ones closed to highways. This have other opening hours. So this is why this PTT is very useful. It is directly on an highway junction, so you can reach it easily and it is open longer.

name: former otokar urartu,now efe otomotiv
description: the old otokar is really good but the specialist is now the new name of the garage efe

name: Pine forest.
description: There are several access roads to get up here from the highway. lots of places to pull off an camp. The road was freshly graded, but due to the incline I'd say it's 4wd recommended.

name: Square in a mountain village
description: A place near the expressway, on the outskirts of the village, perhaps a square, with access via a narrow asphalt road.  The site is level and is paved with interlocking paving. There is a source of drinking water in the place with the possibility of filling canisters.

name: odabas Oto
description:
Land Rover mechanic. We were directed here by the Land Rover sparepart shop already mentioned on Ioverlander. Only did a small job but it seems like a very reliable and experienced little garage. They work only with Defenders and they rebuild them from Land Rover parts as well. The mechanic's son is an engineer and he speaks good english, he works with his father in the garage some days. The garage is situated in a large garage complex. Second floor. 
Open also on Saturdays. https://instagram.com/odabas.oto?igshid=YmMyMTA2M2Y=

name: open rocky spot along the river
description: Uzungol is a heavily touristy and and ugly place. We arrived from the deserted highland above and were quite shocked. The  canyon is beautiful, though. Not easy for free camping though. And you have to drive 7-8  km away from Uzungol before feeling in nature. This spot is just of the road along a gravel track. You are visible and in season some traffic but quiet at night except from the rushing river. You can reach the river for water.

name: parking area for trail to Kackar Dagi, above mountain village
description:
A widening in the rough road between the Ayder Valley and Camlihensin Valley. wonderful view towards high mountains and towards the village. 
You are visible from all around but no one bothered us. A couple of villagers with their livestock passed by. A few cars passed by but not a road with a lot of traffic. Rather bad condition. Access to the river.

name: Kizil Kilise. The red Church
description:
Get out of Ihlaras turist trap, and into the agricultural area on the Easter part of the Sivrihisar village. St. Gregorius (the founder of the Orthodox Church) lived here late in his life, after his death this Church was build in his memory. 
What a historical place to sleep. 
And no litter. Please leave it the same way.

name: simple place
description: meadow close to the highway. No services.

name: fresh water
description: a tube hanging down from the green vegetation. Local confirms clean fresh water. Does not run with high power but ok.

name: Eriza Boutique Hotel
description: Super friendly and reasonably priced hotel in the centre of Erzincan. With safe parking (bikes and cars), comfortable rooms, AC,  WiFi and good breakfast. English speaking owner who is incredibly helpful to travellers. Recommended!

name: Sheltered from the wind in Turkey's highlands
description: Quite a simple place, between mountains and fields.  Only for small cars, preferably four-wheel drive depending on the season.  Small spring from which you can purify water.

name: Aydinlar Oto
description:
Recep is a really professional car mechanic. He can do all kind of cars. But the main brands are:

VOLKSWAGEN, AUDI, SEAT, SKODA

We drove from Tbilisi back to Turkey because we got no spare parts for VW there.

But Recep even has a spare part shop.

name: Mountain Camp
description:
This mountain and surrounding area is rush in remote camps. lots of disused logging and mining roads. Some 2wd friendly and some not. 
High elevation to get out of the heat. 
This particular pin is on a lightly used forest track. 4wd recommended.

name: small spring with fresh water
description: A spring in the form of a small pond.  The water comes fresh and cold from the rock.  many locals stop here to fill their bottles

name: mesut usta
description: perfect electrcian for cars.repaired my inner ventilation the motor.there are two mesut usta.take the smal coming from mardin the second

name: In the Canyon by the river
description:
Very nice setting by a clear river under old trees. There are many places and there’s a spring with fresh water. This area is heavily used as a picnic spot by the locals. So unfortunately area is littered with garbage.
We cleaned a spot and enjoyed the beauty of the canyon.

name: look in a valley
description: its a place for a small camper like mine,toyota landcruiser.go up the dusty road,you will ha ve on the left a small place view into the valley.great

name: Çataldağ Göleti lake/reservoir
description:
a side track of the gravel road around the lake, which leads you to the lake shore. 
quite place out of sight of the main road.
in the morning had a farmer come by with his cows and a local fisher but no complaints.
Ideal for small tents or a small 4x4 or van, not for big rigs and the slope is a bit steep and not level so that can be an issues for campers.
the road is gravel and has some bumps so a bit of ground clearance is handy.

name: hammam marmara
description:
little hamam, friendly people. 170(10€) tlira for 2 persons, each 50 for hamam with also sauna, and 35 scrubbing, soap wasch, and massage.
we could go bot of us in and we where lucky that nobodies else was there that time (6pm).

name: In the middle of the wood
description:
The other place very close it's no more possible, but in one kilometer inside the wood, there is a nice place with shadow and very good phone signal. 
Only 4x4.

name: Cinar Hotel
description: Nice and clean hotel just across the street from the bus station. Looks like a 2 or 3-star hotel. €18 per person/night with breakfast. Safe outside parking for cars, bikes. Very basic English.

name: Smuggler and thief area
description: Do NOT come here. We had a horrible experience because 5 men came in the dark with weapons and baseball sticks and wanted to rob us. We drove away as quickly as possible and finally escaped. The civil police stopped us on the way and brought us to the police station where they gave us a safe place to stay for the night. They said that the area 100km around Diyabakir is not safe at all at night and tourists should only use big highways and not sleep on a field at night.

name: Entrance Vazelon Monastery
description: Next to the road there’s a narrow, steep walking path to Vazelon Monastery. Park next to dirt road. 4x4 might be necessary.

name: Water fountain
description: Water fountain next to the road. You can park in front. Local people told us it’s drinking water.

name: Little forest in the mountains of Sivas
description: Lots of places to camp between the trees and some locals are around to do their Picknick and barbecue

name: Kilistra
description:
Good flat spot in the front of ancient rock houses (3BC). Locals suggested this spot.
Till sunset it can a little be crowdy, after that you’ll be on your own. Just a pair of dogs roaming around. If you camp right under the chimneys you’ll have plenty of cover from the sun in the morning. Down the road towards Lystra you can find different picnic spots with fountains and toilets.
Easy access, no need of 4wd/enduro.
Enough mobile signal, not full.

name: Double water fountain next to street
description: This fountain has a good water pressure but you have to bring buckets because attaching a hose is not possible. We don’t know if it’s drinking water but it looked very clear, didn’t smell and was cold.

name: Green heaven
description: It is a wildcamping spot close to the city center of Beyşehir. Is it safe and secure and there is a lot of space between the trees to put a tent on a flat surface. You are close to a wonderful path next to the lake.

name: Yedi Göller
description: Great spot at the end of the road. There is a shelter with old toilets inside. The scenery is great! Very nice spot. Loose rocks the final part of the road 4x4 nice to have but some clearance will do.

name: Roadside
description: There is a sign to go to the right. Perfect to fill the tank with your own hose. Good pressure

name: unknow
description: with an adaptor for  bigger hose,a tank can be filled

name: wild valleys
description:
Along the road that descends from the plateaus, in the midst of wild valleys and immersed in peace; easily accessible by all veicles.
It is right next to the road, but there is no traffic, just a few rare locals with motorcycles. Close to a river (dry when we passed) offers a place for a few tents or a camper.
Some locals in the surrounding area spend the night in tents with the herds of cows, they are very friendly. No problem.

name: Cengilli
description: Nice spot with a view of Lake Cengilli to the north and the mountains to the south.  The road to get there from the D965 is paved at the start and turns into a nice track.  Worth the detour if only for the glimpse of life in the villages crossed and the work in the fields.

name: Sülüklü Göl Nature Reserve
description: This was one of our favourite spots in Turkey! Sülüklü Göl is a beautiful turquoise lake, you can go hiking, there is water and semiclean toilets. It is a very safe place because there is a guard and barrier and other Turkish families come with their tents. We spent a quiet night and paid 140TL for entry and camping with our van.

name: Lake Van
description:
On the shore of the Lake. It’s one of the unspoiled spots. Only a little garbage, very quiet. At day there were some families but it’s a very large beach.
Turkcell LTE available

name: Low 2 garage landrover defender repair
description: Great workshop to get repairs done on your defender or other 4wd vehicle. Ayhen is the owner and a super mechanic. He doesn’t speak english but there’s always somebody around who does. He completely rebuild my engine because of a crack in the cilinder. Honest and fair prices. Mobile Ahyen is +90 533 667 18 98

name: unknown
description: wmith a hose and adoptor you can fill the water tank of the camper

name: Spot near the beach
description:
Perfect spot a few meters above the beach.
Quite, no rubbish, mostly alone, perfect and clean water.

Don't forget: Just TAKE photos and LEAVE only footprints 😁

name: beautiful spot in a small bay
description:
Nice spot in a small bay. Very quite. Only some locals. 

A lot of trash, so don't forget to take trash from the others with you 😉.

name: Drinking water
description: Right side, directly near the street. Perfect water

name: Beautiful spot in the cliffs
description:
Beautiful view over the Black Sea. Not much rubbish here. Very quite.
4x4 absolutely recommended 😉

name: Veterinarian
description:
Veterinarian
We needed the health certificate for entering the ferry to Ukraine

name: Georgia Camping
description: Beautiful meadow area right on the beach.  Nice, English speaking owner, new shower system.  WiFi.  120TL per night

name: Drinking water
description: Good drinking water, right next to the street

name: Stone and Sand Dessert in the front of ararat
description: Hidden and quite place with nice panorama. From the village next to, there is no road just sand and stones. With low tire pressure is think is also possible without 4x4

name: Balabanağa Çiftliği Camping
description: Campsites and restaurant on 500 years old historic farm. Campsites on 4000m2 grass area. You can stay your tents and caravans.

name: Ilisu dam
description: large esplanade with a view of the dam lake.  calm even if the road is close because road with little traffic and spot behind a hill.

name: On the way to the travertins
description: nice spot in a very beautiful valley.  beautiful space by the water with a beautiful view.  easy access.

name: Close to Perre Antik Kent
description:
Nice platform next to an old oil well.  View of the Nemrut Dagi in the distance, and the surrounding countryside.  Very calm.
Only a few miles from Perre Antik Kent site and much better than the site car park to stay overnight and visit early the next morning.

name: former seafoodfactory
description: huge place ou ca fid a place direct tothe sea

name: Gazientep motorhome area
description: new brand new motorhome area on the other side of the pond compares to the old one.  Toilets, showers, washing machine and dryer.  Refrigerators, freezers, hotplates, microwave ovens and sinks in a large room accessible to all.  Electricity and water at each location.  Free for the first two days.  Very clean as brand new.

name: North of Kirikhan
description: Not many places to stop to sleep in this great plain.  Here, quiet parking at the foot of a beautiful aqueduct and a mausoleum.  some locals come to visit and picnic during the day and evening but no one at night.

name: crop field
description: very quiet place near Beydeğirmeni, accessed by a dirt road from the main road, you don't need a 4x4 but you need a vehicle high off the ground. some peasant working the fields. we asked and they said there is no problem camping. better after the grain harvest.

name: Best kebab restaurant ever!
description:
They have a huge kebab circling around and it's a very fast and clean restaurant. They keep going around with little sticks of freshly cut kebab. Great service great taste :) 

They road you drive coming from Georgia is amazing by the way! Cruising through gorges and canyons, little traffic.

name: Great camping spot, remote and further on the best view of turkey
description:
Google map has stopped showing the road a while ago but use Google satellite to continue. Camp around here where there is a big tree and continue by foot towards the top of a ridge. Keep going and Then see the best view of Turkey :) 
Road is accessible by 2wd although maybe last bit is a bit challenging.

name: Darvaza Fire Crater
description: Behind a peak, from which you have a beautiful view at night

name: Tolkuchka Bazaar
description:
Open from 7:00- 15:00 
Big parking lot. A lot to see
It s interesting. You can see also part with animals selling ( camel, cow, chicken...)

name: Ak Altyn Hotel
description: Camping at parking of Ak Altyn hotel in Ashgabat. Secure and no costs. Only toilet no shower

name: Alaja Farm
description: Camping at Alaja Farm in Geodeke. We did hore riding here and slept on the farm. No costs for camping. Only toilet.

name: Bushcamp Gas Crater
description: Bushcamp at Darwaza gas crater, nice spot. No facilities, yurts with something to drink

name: Gas Crater
description: Gas crater with water

name: Gas Crater
description: Gas crater with mud, you can see the crater from the main road and walk or drive there

name: Darwaza fire crater
description: Darwaza fire crater, still burning since 1980

name: Diesel
description: Diesel in Ashgabat

name: Diesel
description: Konye Urgench. Diesel at last gas station before border Uzbekistan.

name: Sowda Market
description: Sowda market. Sells bier and water. Black market.

name: Independence Monument
description: Independance monument in Ashgabat

name: Old Urgench
description:
Unesco site Old Urgench

21/entry
7/photo permit

name: Hotel Aziya
description: Huge rooms. Communist style. Best value in town. 50$/night

name: Truck Stop
description: Truck stop with restaurant, toilets and water. Noisy at night, but safe place to stay for one night.

name: Wild camp off road
description: Just off main road on a sandy track and near a graveyard.  Can be noisy with trucks and trains but seems to quieten down during the night.

name: Bush camp near Merv
description: Wild camp area- easy hard dirt road in, well hidden from road and surrounded by hills and trees.

name: Wild camp 30km north of Saraghs border
description: Sandy track to flat and well hidden camping behind low hills.  Road is quite busy so earplugs help.

name: Kamil supermarket
description: Kamil is a big supermarket with everthing you need and maybe have missed

name: near bridge ( road is not yet ready)
description: when its wet after raining ,be careful!, site of the river, quiet spot, fischerman fisching big fisch.

name: Diesel
description: Badly  needed diesel after a horrible road from Ashgabat.

name: quiet wild site close to border
description: Drive into a little dirt track for about 200m. Between the bushes is a nice quiet spot to park the car. Flat, like the surroundings.

name: Diesel Asgabat
description: Petrol station with diesel. They won't fill extra jerry cans.

name: TNO station
description: Official TNO station, on the way from Derweze gas crater to Ashgabat. You can fill up jerry cans as well. Going north, the next station is 275km.

name: TNO gas station
description: Diesel is available at this TNO starion.

name: wild camping one hour from Ashgabat
description: open field near maintains. Not the best place but quite and not to far from Ashgabat.

name: Abiwert
description: Historical city , has toilet . No english description . Russian visitors.

name: Squarecamp
description: Big parking-coutyard between old hihg rusian buildings and a new parking-carwash.  Empty in night, always quiet. Near the Rusian Bazar, another comercial center (toilets) and 2-3 goods restaurants (menu in english) in the other side of the green avenue. Also there are children plays.

name: Diesel before / after Uzbekistan
description: 1,35 manat / l. in May 2018. Last chance for Diesel before Uzbekistan.

name: Border Lotfabad / Artyk
description:
Border Iran - Turkmenistan
We arrived shortly before the border closed. Took us about 2 hours to get through.

Iran out was easy, nothing to pay. One of the officials guided us, because there are no signs. Note: You get your Carnet stamped just before the exit gate.

Turkmenistan in: you need some time and a lot of money. Customs check was very casualy. They ask, how much USD/EUR you carry. Required documents for our dogs: pet passport, health certificate + 12 USD fee per dog.
Other costs: Transit Visa with invitation letter provided: 55 USD p.p., stamp fee: 10 USD man, 14 USD women, fees for car (Toyota Landcruiser): 127 USD 
We didn't get a GPS!

name: Historical City
description: Drive off the tarmaq before you reach the parking and follow the grey gravel track around the ruins of the ancient city. Suitable for 2wd. Quiet place, out of sight from the road.

name: Desert camp
description:
Just drive around the barrier and 
choose your site. There are bushes and dunes for cover.

name: Parking of the museum
description: We stayed at the parking of the museum near the mausolea in center of town. Asked permission to the ticket salesman who had to phone someone else first. No charge. Nice view with sunset.

name: bazaar & black market money exchange
description: all you will ever need can be found here, get rid of your surplus manat

name: Halk Market
description: Supermarket with lots of choice also coffee, but no beer.

name: road to Merv complex
description: Take this road to acient Merv complex, the ticket office is further down this road.

name: ticket office and museum
description: here you can buy a ticket, 21 manat per person. The museum is really small and does not give much information, but you can buy a information booklet for 30 manat.

name: Sandy
description: Loose sandy track east of highway behind hills looks ok if you need to stop for the night.

name: Farap border
description:
Crossed from Turkmenistan into Uzbekistan. Easy crossing, but still an hour or two altogether, especially slow at the Uzbek side. You are asked how much cash money you have with you and if you have a drone or any “unnamed aerial device”. 
Showing Carnet if you have one will make things easier for them with all the car information on it. Car was barely opened and customs dog sniffed around, but that was all. Nothing to pay. Small insurance booths after the border, but also possible in Bukhara. Money changer on Uzbeki side gave bad rate for Turkmen Manat, but nobody will change them if you take them into Uzbekistan, just tourists heading the other way if you’re lucky.

name: Motorcycle shop
description: Small "motorcycle shop". You can ask for fuel, the guy brings bottles of 91 octane. He asks 6000 per liter but if you negotiate you can pay the normal price which is about 3700

name: Car wash
description: Ok carwash, and important to clean your car to avoid the police from fining you for a dirty car. We paid 40 manat for our Hilux.

name: Lake view
description: Wild camping next to the Hanhowuz Reservoir. Locals wash their trucks at this point in the lake. Quiet at night but a lot of Moskitos. During the day some of traffic on the dirt road.

name: Hotel Gurlushyk
description: Hotel recommend in the most guides. They’re renovating the rooms. No AC, no breakfast, no wifi. But you can pay in Manat. 120 Manat p.P.

name: Diesel 5500 Sum
description: We got 40l Diesel here for 5500 Sum/Liter

name: Ruhubelent
description: Diesel and petrol, small shop next to gas station.

name: Little shop, first North of Serakhs.
description: After 80+ km on the empty bumpy road this is the first shop you will find. It is part of a regular house in the crossing. They have cold water!!!

name: Syyahat Hoteli
description:
booked online, Price told was 60 USD, upon arrival they asked for 37 USD for a single room. Cheap place and cheap quality. Good enough to use as first stop in Turkmenistan and name in visa application. Don’t expect much.
Safe parking for motorcycle though. No internet.
Only USD - no Euros or Manat!

name: Kuwat Hôtel
description: Cheapest hotel in Ashgabat, US$15 pp, very friendly but not much English spoken.  You can park your motorcycles inside but not a car.  There is a kitchen, laundry.  Fridge in your room, A/C and a TV.

name: Bank: draw USD
description:
You can draw USD cash from Visa or MasterCard maybe also Maestro. Bring your Passport! 3% comission.

Go to counter 31, 32, 33. Wave your Passport to jump the queue. There you have to pay with your card. They will direct you to two more counters that will check something until they pay out in fresh USD Notes.

Around the corner there are 24 hours open ATMs that accept VISA card and spit out Manat (Bank course, presumably)

name: Shokomindsa Café / Bakery
description:
Nice Café / Bakery. Good quality food.
I had breakfast for 25 Manat

name: Garagum Ulag / VW dealer
description:
A Volkswagen, Skoda, Seat and Audi Dealer and service station.
Many other dealerships nearby.
We could use their facilities to repair our clutch. The parts were available from Stock.

name: Günes Café
description: Family run restaurant with fresh food. We are both vegetarian and the owner prepared turkmenistan style potatoes for us. It doesn’t really look like a restaurant from the outside. ;) Super friendly Turkmen family!

name: TIR parking
description: Parking with toilets and showers for truckers to spend the night. It is free and guarded. There are some shops and restaurants around, but they were closed when we arrived around 10pm.

name: Gurgench Hotel
description: Basic rooms, we (10 people) bargained and got a bed for 5 USD or 70 manat in a room with many beds (not bunked). Hot water and clean, looks like a hospital but good for spending one night after wild camping at Darvaza.

name: Shirgin hotspring
description:
Hotspring in a small hut next to the road.
1.5x2m pool, warm water. Not european standard for cleanliness, but o.k.

Paid 1 suomi per Person.

name: Fuelstation Zong
description:
Look for a small building labeled "GAS A3C".
Its from a tank but will be delivered in buckets. The lady lives close by, ask around.

name: British Pub
description: A reasonable approximation of a British pub. Not well labeled from the outside but it's definitely here.  Pints for 8 Manat - not too bad if you're on the black market conversion from the Russian Bazaar next door.

name: Ferry Port
description: From the main road, follow the signs to the International Seaport, and continue until you see the signs for "ro-ro vehicle and ro-ro pax". Park in the huge plaza opposite the control tower and adjacent to the port gates.  Go up the short stairs to the gold and white building and you can buy tickets from the windows inside.  if there's no boat talk to the man in room 140 and give him a copy of your passport and vehicle registration. Keep checking back often!

name: Beyik Yupek Yoly (Port Hotel)
description: Hotel in the same building as the ticket office.  Brand new and very nice.  Single for $30, double for $60. Breakfast included. They told me they do not call you when the boat arrives so after you manage to buy your ticket best to enter the port and clear customs and immigration and wait there.  (Note there are no facilities on the other side, bring lots of food and water!) Hotel only has 25 rooms so it may run out fast. their number is +993 243  49610

name: Altyn Zaman Hotel
description: Good hotel where the TIR truckdrivers stop. Fair price. I could bargain a deluxe room including breakfast for 10 USD. But I think this was extraordinary because all the standard rooms were taken. The restaurant is open late and serves nice food and has beer ;-). And there is WiFi too.

name: bazar - money exchange
description:
Here you can change dollar for manat.
we had 18 manat for 1 dollar

name: wild camp behind old citadel
description: located behind the very old building (probably citadel). hidden from the road and very quiet. see nobody except dogs on the morning. lot of place. ground is some sand. ok for 2WD vehicle but a bit muddy after rain.

name: Kow Ata underground hotspring/lake
description:
Wonderful detour on our way towards Asgabat! Kow Ata is a 75-meter big underground lake, 55 meters below the surface. You can enter for 50 manat per person, walk down the cave and swim in the lake. Since it’s fed by a hotspring, it’s always 36 celsius. Very cool experience :)

We drove with a transit visa and gps and clearly deviated from our assigned route. We passed multiple checkpoints and had no issues.

name: Coffee House restaurant
description:
Not just coffee, big food menu. It’s mentioned in the (old) Lonely Planet. Decent food, fresh and good portions. For the vegetarians: vegetarian lasagna! Interior is pretty tacky, but don’t let that scare you. 

They also serve breakfast. Menu headlines are in English.

name: Arch of Neutrality
description: Arch of Neutrality. There are a lot of parking spaces here, if you’re looking for a place to spend the night outside the city, we’re pretty sure this place will be deserted. For the record: we stayed at Ak Altyn so no first hand experience.

name: Wild camp south of Esfarayen
description: Nice quiet and hidden spot off the highway. There’s a good road/track going west, it’s not on maps.me. Take a dirttrack to the right close to the GPS coordinates and, you can park behind the hill or drive a bit further to a plateau with more space. There’s a small stream next to the campspot.

name: view point
description: If you go to the 7th Floor balcony and enjoy the skyline of asjchabad.

name: Diesel & petrol
description: We got diesel here , not so easy to find because most fuel stations have only petrol.

name: Immigration service (exit visa)
description:
We went there to ask for an exit visa because we entered to the country on the last day of our visa. So impossible to reach the Iran border on time.
You just need your passeport and hand written letter of the reason why you ask for an exit visa. They will dict to you what to right to whom. Then you need to wait at least 24h. We came first time in the morning and then next day after 2pm. Next step is to go the bank (iOverlander) to bring back the receipt. We had 5 more days !

name: Bank (exit visa)
description: When you go inside, take the stairs to the 1st floor and go to the 3rd door on your right. Then follow the guy outside to the left side of the building until the end, here you will pay and get your receipt. It was full of people in there !!! But he brung us directly to the gate. We had to pay 55$ dollars for the visa and 2$ for the bank service per person.

name: Free parking
description:
We slept just in front of this cheap hotel. One guy whose working there is speaking very good english. We ask him to receive the phone call from the immigration office and that was no problem.
You can take a small room (single bed) if you want with private bathroom for 70 manats (4.2$ on the black market) or a double bed for 130 manats (7.7$ on the black market)

name: truck stop
description: Big parking free for trucks. After or Before the border. Possibility shower, wc and restaurant.  Good for one night, very quiet.

name: MAN / I.T.S. Garage
description: Great and cheap place to get things fixed!!! We drive a bus (Benz 614). We needed a New thermostat for the engine. They found a second hand for us, but advised to buy a New one. Took us to different stores till they found the right one. While installing it they discovered the distribution belt was ripped. They took us again to different stores till they found the right belt. In the mean time the changed the airfilter and fixed a few problems with our lights.  Everything  took about 3,5 hours, cost 300 manat (aprox 17 USD) incl. the materials. Great guys. One spoke just enough English. And we were invited for diner with the manager. Lateron we found out they are trained by MAN Diesel in Germany. And they service other countries in the region.

name: Bicycle mechanic
description: Good bicycle mechanic. Changed my broken spoke easily (for 28inch wheel)

name: Turn off to gas cratet
description: On this point the track to the gas crater starts. It is clearly marked in maps.me as well. It should be possible with a 2wd as well.

name: Yangykala Canyon
description: Certainely the most impressive site in Turkmenistan. Huge breathtaking area.

name: Kemal Ata
description: Lost mausoleum in the Balkan desert where erosion or dried-up lava created stone balls of about 1m diameter. The fresh water source attracts a lot of animals.

name: Gözli Ata shrine
description: This pilgrimage site offers basic rooms and shared toilets, but we had a good sleep and anyway other than camping I don't think there is any other option far around :-D

name: Petrol station
description: I didn't pay attention what kind of fuel they sell here, but it's the only petrol station we have seen in the area.

name: Restaurant Balkanabat
description: A welcome stop after the desert road, with a good variety of food.

name: Hotel Candybil, Ashgabat – Avoid!
description:
We needed a good rest and a hot shower and this place felt like a good option with a large private parking area that looked quite safe.
The hotel is very dilapidated. There was no water at all in the bathroom and we could not even close the curtains in the bedroom! 
We asked for another room and the bored staff at frontdesk said that all rooms were fully booked even though the hotel was obviously empty. (A very North Korea feeling in this place...)
Also, we were dying of thirst and saw a few bottles of lovely Borjomi in a fridge, but the lady pretended that they had lost the key to the fridge! When she understood that her life was in danger, she quickly found the key! lol

The rooms are totally overpriced and they charge double for foreigners...

name: sandy track beside street
description:
several spots along a sandy track. The main street is 200 m away but you can hide in the hills. There is some noise from the street and train line but not very bad. 

The track starts around here: 38.1716 / 62.86161

name: Park with play ground
description: Nice park with play ground for children. Near a restaurant with good foods ! River just near. Quiet after 11pm. Possibility to fill your tank water : Ask to the restaurant.

name: Parking next to the street
description:
Parking lot next to the street, in the back of a shop and a small café.
Quiet at night, no fees, no one bothers you.

name: Lebap Regional Museum
description:
Very interesting museum about Turkmenistan - politics, economy, arts, history, nature and especially lots of information about the ancient Silk Road.
They even have a real-life-size reconstruction of a Silk Road Village.
A lady guided us through the rooms. Descriptions partly in English.
Entrance: 17,5 Manat/person
Opening hours in general: 9-18h

name: Best place in town?
description:
We checked all restaurants. Most were closed or looked run down.
Here we finally got Pelmeni soup and beer!

name: Cafe
description: Cafe and small shop next door to gas station

name: Swimming pool in the river
description: Very beautiful river near the road. Swimming swimming swimming :)))

name: Historical area of Merv
description:
Best place to stay overnight at Merv. Parking area at Erk Kala, some trees for shadow, sunset on top of the ancient walls.
Absolutely quiet, just jakals...

name: Zaton beach
description: Parking at a small beach area. They allowed us to stay overnight for free, gate is closed during the night and the areal is guarded. Swimming is wonderfull if it is hot, entrance fee for two people is only  1(!) Manat. Night is absolutely quiet.

name: Central Market
description: All you need, also changing money at the main entrance. 1 Euro for 18 Manat

name: Little shop
description: Small shop with cold drinks, snacks and toilets.

name: Little shop
description: Small shop with cold drinks and any kind of groceries. You can see it from the road, just after the big white yurt and a big building.

name: Restaurant Oguz (good WiFi)
description: Good place for free WiFi connection. Quite a fancy looking restaurant with WiFi. WiFi works good, ask staff for password. Unfortunately I couldn't connect to my VPN, but it's useful to look up information on websites which are not blocked. We ate a good burger (25 manat), ceasar salad (20 manat) and a very steak (50 manat), currently black market rate is around 17.5 manat for 1 dollar. Good price-quality rate.

name: Exchange money (in shop)
description: We exchanged our Turkmenistan Manat for Uzbekistan Sum at a reasonable black market rate (1 Manat = 476 Sum). It's in a small grocery shop next to the entrance of the bazar. If you face the entrance of the bazar it's the first shop on the left, just ask the ladies in the shop. We used Google translate in Russian to communicate with them, they were very friendly.

name: Cheap hotel
description: Cheap Sovjet-style hotel with reasonable room rate. We were with 2 persons; seems like you pay per person (70 manat per person), so our total room price is 140 manat. Current black market rate is about 17.5 manat = 1 dollar. Our room has 3 beds, balcony and old air-conditioning. Shower not very warm water. Not super clean, but acceptable.

name: aladdin coffee and food
description: Very good Occidental style coffee, nice decoration. Excellent international and local food. For 5USD we had a very big and good lunch. Take the "frappuccino", it's just like in the pictures... miam!

name: Cafe near main road to Uzbekistan
description: Cafe on the road from Mary to Turkmenabat. Restaurant sells water, ice creams & dinner. You can camp there if you eat at the restaurant.

name: Etaz Pub
description:
Bar and restaurant, has pizza, burgers, sushi, pasta, salads, all kinds of liquor, beer (including miller and tuborg). Fair prices, 30 Manat for a pizza.
English Menu!

name: Empty car park at the UNESCO site 'Old Nisa'
description: Small car park at the entrance to the ruines of the ancient settlement Nisa. It has a gate, but all the time open, and a ticket counter, but unstaffed. It's green around and quiet at night and the air is fresh enough to sleep well in the hot season.

name: Parking lot near indoor ferries wheel
description: Between the big indoor ferries wheel and the Monument to the Turkmenistan Constitution there are two big parking lots on a road that almost no one seems to use. It seems to be the parking for the large and beautiful park. We stayed at the one closer to the ferries wheel. Apart from the fact that the parking lots are illuminated at night we didn't experience any sort of disturbance. Quiet night in the city. Suitable for any kind of rig. There are even grassy areas for tents (potentially).

name: Diesel
description:
We thought Diesel is available at every station because the price is displayed everywhere but it's not at every station.
They have Diesel here and are friendly, highly frequented station.

name: behind mall
description: parking of a bank opposite hotel YRSGAL. Big mall on the other side of the building. Shade according to place and Sun. Additional information went to Merv yesterday, no shade, came back here for the night. Very nice and cheap Turkish restaurant at the top of the mall. Fruit & veg bazar nearby. Friday night some music up to 11pm not too loud.

name: OVIR
description: this is the place (custom) where you can have the 15 days car visa extended. cost 10 som. Take collective taxi number 4 at Mac Do land's opposite the bazar. Ask to get off at the Afghan bazar. Come back with taxi number 4 or 3 or 1. Obtained 10 days extension without any discussion.

name: Welding shop Yura
description: Little welding shop. Very helpful. Yura welded the frame of one of our motorbikes. And in the end he absolutely did not want any money. It was a gift from him for us. A big thumbs up for Turkmen hospitality :-)

name: Turkmenpost (postal service)
description: Postal service Turkmenistan. Good chance to get packages from Turkmenistan internationally. Time will tell if it will arrive.

name: Täze Güne
description: "big shopping mall." has a decent size grocery store, restaurant with wifi, kids playground, make your traditional turkmen traditional dress, clothes stores, souvenirs, toilets... We could park our van in front of the bulding for the night. Next to a main road so a bit noisy but not overcrowded. Next to a bazar.

name: TIR parking
description: Parking lot for big trucks. We stayed here one night. Flat area, quite dusty.

name: Wild Desert Camping
description: We used this spot in a pinch after arriving late into Turkmenistan from Uzbekistan. Solid enough spot: follow a small dirt track from the main road (a bit sandy at points but quite okay on the whole), then there are many points to turn off and set up camp, depending how far you’d like to drive. A bit visible from the road, but hidden enough I’d say. We didn’t drive super far in. Made a fire. Nice spot.

name: Old Nissa UNESCO Site
description: Old Nissa ruins, an important city in the bygone Parthian Empire. Fairly interesting to see, and not far from Ashgabat. We paid 52 Manat for two people, including photography rights. Worth a stop!

name: Wild Desert Camping
description: Hidden spot not far from the main road between Turkmenbashi and Ashgabat. Not a lot of camping on this route, perhaps...quite an established highway. But here there is a small dirt track (no sand) that leads out into the desert, and finally past a small hill of sorts, behind which it is fairly easy to hide a vehicle/tent. Flat spots. Nice sunsets. There are a handful of other turn offs in the area, but maybe not quite as hidden.

name: Cattle market - camels
description: Here is the place for camels in the cattle market. Sunday morning.

name: TIR parking
description:
Parking for trucks just before/after the border, turkmen side, with associated facilities such as toilets, water, cafe. It was much more quiet than expected at night because the border only opens at 8.00, so almost no truck move before 7.30.
I first parked with the other trucks but then police wanted me to move to be separated from them.

name: Gas filling station
description: Very friendly stuff, filled up pur bottles immediately. European System.

name: Public parking
description: Open terrain next to residential area with new houses.

name: Public parking
description: Open terrain between major roads.

name: Public parking
description: Next to sand dunes at village boundary.

name: Bush Camp
description: Beach far away from Dubai. View spoiled by concrete poles of unfinished access road to second palm island.

name: Public parking
description: Parking next to beach.

name: Kite Beach
description: Public beach next to kite surfing beach. Very clean toilets, beach showers and water at kite surfing club. Call for prayer of two competing mosques nearby included in the deal.

name: Public parking
description: Street in industrial area near airport.

name: Public parking
description: Mega Mall Shopping Parking also for BigRig.

name: Public parking
description: Parking next to beach, busy with touring cars in the evening.

name: Beach Parking
description:
Probably best option just before or just after border to Saudi. On public beach parking. Quitte place.
It is a private beach, not a public beach, locals said. You should not camp in the fenced area.

name: Al Hili Marine Services
description:
Arrange your ferry crossing to Iran here! Just be here 1 of 2 days before the crossing. Very easy and good service! Paid around 650 usd for 2 persons + car. Gound floor Al Ikhlas Tower.

Opening hours 8:00 till 16:00 Sunday to Tuesday (unsure if opening hours on weekend is the same)

name: Etisalat Phone & Internet
description: Buy pre-paid SIM here. Very helpful staff, with German passport it is possible to get local pre-paid conditions.

name: parking corniche ras al khaimah
description: parking with locals coming at night. close to the sea. close to a mosque with water tank with good water. cheap pakistani restaurants and shops in walking distance.

name: sharja beach
description:
nice white beach with bikini bathing possible. showers and toilettes. beach guards. overnight outside the beach possible. during our stay no sleeping on the beach allowed. we had to change to the nearby parking. internet close to the aquarium.
Potable water at old mosque or toilet rooms.

name: Abu Dhabi
description: Car park in the city

name: Al Sufouh 1
description: Huge parking on a beautiful quiet beach. Camping for caravans/campers and trucks not allowed though. Might still be okay for a night or two. In the weekends busier. Nice skyline at night. No toilets.

name: Al Ain
description: Cheers: drink store with soda, beer, wine and liquor

name: Camel Race Track
description: Just outside the official car park of Abu Dhabi camel race track. Good to watch either a camel race or training.

name: Dubai City
description: Car park near Hilton Palace Hotel, near to a mosque.

name: Sharjah Desert
description: Quiet place in the desert.

name: Wild Camp
description: good for one night, if you start late in Abu Dhabi and can't make it to some of the well known places in Dubai like Soufouh or Jumeirah Beach

name: LuLu Parking
description: Parking for big Trucks behind LuLu Hypermarket

name: Oman Hatta Road
description: 3 Kms away you can find Indian restaurants and also EMARAT petrol pump which has a toilet facility.

name: Duty free shop with alcohol
description:
Hidden at the warehouse 3. You can buy alcohol when you enter, too.
Not cheap, but the only possibility in Sharjah. Be careful, it is forbidden to have alcohol in the car (but nobody checked).

name: Liquor store in Hilton Hotel
description:
Here you can buy beer, wine and hard liquor.
Not cheap, but not so many other possibilities.

name: Parking at the Al Ain Zoo
description:
Huge parking area of the zoo, nice and quiet, roaring of lions in the night.
Toilets of the zoo can be used during the opening hours without entrance fee.
The zoo is quite ok. 3G with Etisalat SIM.

name: Parking at the fishmarket
description:
Parking lot at the harbour and fish market (you can buy fish and let it prepared), on the other side of the road is a fruit and vegetable market.
Toilet for women in the market, for men outside. Not too loud.
3G with Etisalat SIM

name: Water and showers
description:
Perfect showers and toilets for bicyclists.
Its possible to stay here overnight, but it is quite noisy.

name: Parking at the inner bicycle roundabout
description:
Parking lot at the beginning of the bicycle track. In the desert with some construction areas around. Raod in sight and to hear, but ok. Some airplanes.
Wonderful, clean showers and toilets, water.
3 G with Etisalat SIM.

name: Shopping mall
description: Small shopping mall where you can buy supplies. Also mobile phone shops but no sim cards.

name: ADNIC
description: Here you can get TPL-insurance for your car. Land Rover Defenderfor 30 days 350AED

name: Murad Zahi Pakistan Restaurant
description: Delicious Pakistani Baloch food here. mutton biryani(rice) or chicken curry both with 10 AED. Free parking outside.

name: the "everything" store
description: Supermarket with everything and extremely low price.

name: Liwa desert
description:
big area very quiet when there is no festival. beautiful 
dunes

name: Camel race track
description: quiet at night and early on the morning you can see camel race or training

name: Al wathba cycle track
description: if you want to ride bicycle on the desert! severals track start 8 to 30 km.  if you dont have yours you can rent bicycle for 30 dh/h

name: Iran ambassy
description:
open 8h30 to 12 sunday to thursday .
easy to take the visa in two days if you have your autorisation number, insurance, passport copy and one picture
250 dirhams in cash
FOR RESIDENTS only

name: Jebel Jais
description: quiet place in a wadi. Nice walk. Theres a toilet building with water here.

name: main gate
description: get the vehicle report here. wanted to take 150dh but in the end was 20dh for the inspection report

name: customs office
description:
get the customs sorted here. collect all required stamps, first window 22 for some stamps. 
then after inspection at Main Gate (outside) present the report at window 32. they will stamp the CPD paid 90dh
then go to window 4 give them deliver orders document to recieve bill of entry, paid 40dh

name: Al Fares shipping company
description:
Shipped a motorcycle from here to Jordan as was unable to obtain transit visa through Saudi Arabia. Paid 2200 Dirham including insurance. Service takes 10 days via land transport.
Professional service.

name: Al Aqah Beach Camping
description: large beach,  passable also for size vehicles. 4x4 only close to the water necessary. No wc or water or electricity.

name: Abandoned ghost town
description: Abandoned Fisher town. Great spot to explore and even camp. No facility or anything to expect here.

name: UAE exit at Khatam
description:
If you cross the border with a Carnet de Passage, don't bother with customs. Ask for Latifa Mohammed, she was the only customs offer who knew what to do. 

The entire border was empty and we were sent to every single building until we found someone who can help us. The passport exit fee of 35 Dirham per person has to be paid before exiting the border.

name: Hatta (east) border crossing
description:
Hatta boarder crossing. Make sure to stop at the customs building 1km before the immigration check point to get your carnet stamped when leaving UAE. It is easy to miss as there is no gate. You can get mandarory Oman TPL insurance for your vehicle at the rest area between the border checkpoints. There are a couple of offices. We paid 250 AED for 3 month for a 12 ton camping truck at vision insurance  (1 month would have been 200 AED). 
On the Oman side make sure to tell the customs officials exactly where you need the CDP stamped as they are not that familiar with the process. When doing visa on arrival tell the immigration official how many days you want before. They first wanted to only give us 10 days but quickly changed it to 30. 

We had no problems bringing our dog along, but did not take him out at either of the border installations.

name: Iran Consulate
description:
Bring your visa grant notice (RN), 250 Dirham and your passport. No pictures needed - but women need to wear hijab in the embassy. 
You need to have a health insurance valid in Iran. They will only accept it if the 4 letters IRAN are written on it. If you can’t show that, you need to buy iranian insurance at the embassy. 
Opening hours 8-12
Tourist visas are for RESIDENTS only - for overlanders (if you do not entrer by plane with visa on arrival at an Iranian airport) they only offer 7 days transit visa : Muscat, Oman is the place to get your visas

name: abandoned mosque
description:
official parking for BBQ and camping. but around the corner abandoned stone groove with buildings.  good access with bicycle.  cars can park before.
now still water in the tanks available.

name: NMT Shipping
description:
Building name: The Palladium here is the shipping agency located. They organized Ro/Ro shipments. All over the world, but specially middle east/Africa/Asia. Very competent staff. 
We ship our big truck camper from Jebel Ali to Djibouti.

name: electric house
description:
cover from the wind behind the house. 
so you could camp in the tent on the way to sharjah 
possible to charge your phone 
water from nearby plantation at the road,  was not allowed to camp at the plantation

name: Decathlon
description: Get your new camping gear here! Big Decathlon selling mostly sport-related stuff, but also camping gear. They also sell mountainbikes and kayaks.

name: jebel hafeet mountain
description: This place is a low temperature zone at nights may it be summer or winter. there's no public toilet facilities, but there's a restaurant which provides toilets,it opens at 8 am and closes at 1am. one can cook and barbecue here.

name: Al Wathba wetlands
description:
Some locals advised us these wetlands. You’ll find over 4000 flamingos here. There’re 2 hiking trails: 3km and 1,5km. No entrance fee. 

There’s a birding shelter where you can get really close to the pink flamingos.

name: Fossil Dunes
description: Fossilized dunes, nice stop close to the camel race track, wetlands and bicycle route. 2wd track. You could camp here, it’s quiet but also close to a military area.

name: Sand dunes camp
description:
Not expected to find such nice sand dunes, so close to Abu Dhabi. The area is wedges between a militairy airbase and military shooting range, so almost no buildings and people. Dunes are perfectly white and 10m high at max. Very very quiet. We only heard some tanks practicing the next day, 5km away on the shooting range.

There’s good 3G signal. Just follow one of the dirt tracks from the road, towards the dunes. 4wd is recommended.

name: Saluki Motorsport
description: A great Workshop for each brand of 4x4 vehicles. They have a huge experience in building racing buggys and have their own rallye team. So, they know what they are doing. They really helped us with a bent chassis. We highly recommend this place. English speaking manager Martin was very helpful and friendly.

name: Public beach Al Mirfa
description: Good location to spend the day and also the night. Parking area at the beach, swimming possible. Clean toilets and showers. Quiet during the night.

name: Dalma Mall
description: Giant Shopping Mall with a big Carrefour Supermarket

name: Snoopy Island beach camp
description:
Just a stone throw away from Snoopy Island - a snorkling hotspot - you find some resorts. The beaches between these resorts are public and camping is allowed. You can park right on the sand, 5 meters from the sea. 

The friendly beach security guy came over a couple of times. Wonderful quiet spot and you’re swimming between coral and colourful fish! 

Drive over the gravel and down to the beach. You’re hidden from the road since the beach is located a bit lower.

name: Hatta Wadi Hub camp & activity
description:
Hatta Wadi Hub opened late 2018, it’s a caravan site, a camp site, a lodge and an activity centre (mountain bikes, water slides, axe throwing and a lot more). 

Camping is free, next to the water slide. You can use the very clean toilets and showers with hot water in the main area. There are cafes and food trucks as well. 

Quiet at night. We’re told it gets busy on weekends and holidays. Nice place to stay, camping at Hatta Dam is not allowed so this makes for a good alternative. 

To get here, take the 5 towards the border and get off at the Wadi Hub sign.

name: Hatta Dam
description:
Hatta Dam and reservoir is a nice stop if you’re taking the border here. The drive through the mountains is very scenic. You can also rent kayaks and paddle around the reservoir. A kayak is 60dh for an entire day.

There are signs stating camping is not allowed, you can camp for free at Wadi Hub.

name: Border post for residents only
description: This border post between UAE and Oman is only for residents.

name: near "la mer"
description: Huge flat area at the sea Next to "La mer". Actually ideal Spot with Toilettes and showers nearby but whole Night constructionwork going on.

name: Liwa eastern desert
description: The dunes are highest around the eastern part. From Himeem is a perfect asphalt and dirt track that goes all the way to the Saudi border, you’ll find it on maps.me. Plenty of campspots along the way!

name: Abu Dhabi wetlands
description: Follow the dirt road - check maps.me - west out of the city. There’s loads of wetlands and canals along the road. It’s a favorite spot for locals to camp and fish. Splendid city views! Very nice and quiet.

name: Djibouti Embassy
description:
Since Djibouti cancelled the visa on arrival late 2018, we had to get a visa here. Process is very easy and straightforward. Show up before 12:30, provide 2 photos, fill in a form and pay 105 dirham. 

You can pick up the visa on the same day after 14:00. We got a 30 day visa. They asked for a plane ticket, we didnt have one and they didnt bother.

Mind you: this is the new address of the embassy, they moved in April ‘19. The addresses on Google are not correct :).

Update: when we arrived in Djibouti, you could get a visum on arrival at the airport, but it’s much slower and more expensive. Your choice!

name: China Mall
description: China Mall, a lot of cheap shops where you can buy everything. Not as big as Dragon Mart in Dubai, but ok

name: UAE Customs Office at Al Hatta for Carnet de Passage
description: Feb 2019: Get your Carnet stamped here for exiting UAE before driving on to passport control (quick and easy)

name: Oman car insurance at Hatta border
description: Quick and friendly service; OMR 25 for 3m/big rig (Feb 2019)

name: Al Ain Ahlia assurance
description:
Assurance camping car 
120€ for 2 months

name: Lounge Laundry
description:
Self service laundry. Very clean. The manager is very helpfull. 
It’s cost 250 AED for 10 machines.

name: Fishing shops
description: More than 5 shops for fishing supplys and it's cheaper.

name: Bader Al Emarat camping shop
description: one of the biggest camping shop in the UAE and all camping tent and supply available in the shop.

name: ZAWRA
description: beach camping spot good for camping and fishing.

name: Potable Water at Mosque
description: Potable water at mosque close to the desert cycle path

name: Border to Oman / Emirates
description: No border crossing for other nationalities than Emirate and Oman.

name: Border for all travelers
description: Border where all nationalities can cross.

name: Watersource
description: Filtered poable water at the boarder between Emirate de and Oman

name: Abu Dhabi Park
description: We spent one night in Abu Dhabi Park. It is located near the Grand Mosque and the embassy district. Traffic noise day and night. In the evening the parking was completely filled (November), but no annoyance.

name: Water Tap Abu Dhabi Park
description: The Locald drink from the Tap. You can connect your hose to the Tap if you have an Adapter but you need about 45 meters of hose. Alternatively you can drive through the walkway closer to the water in the early morning, when nobody is around.

name: Pic-nic-site at public beach
description:
An extended pic-nic site along the public beatch with some shelters and tables and open beach. The locales come here, so it is not so calm but the locals say that it is safe here. Nice view. 4G reception.
Locals told us, that the iOverlander site north of the port is private land.

name: no trespassing to the island without permission!
description: no trespassing to the island without permission!

name: Drinking water at the end of the town!
description:
Go in to the right wide of the waiting drinking water trucks.
It's medium pressure but good quality!
a11a0half inch thread!

name: road closed for tourists
description: open gas fields, road closed for tourists!

name: Wadi Shawka
description: Nice little wild camp behind mountains near road to border. On gravel road on the side there are two flat spots. Car with High clearance recommanded, its a bit rocky. We ask locals on the camel farm nearby if its ok for them if we sleep here.

name: Road closed for Tourists
description: you can pass this roads direction to the Saudi border (90/95) only with special permission!

name: Heartland Recreational Vehicles
description: Camperstore and Workshop. Glen from the Philipines is the responsible and competent foreman with best technical knowledge, for a really very very fair price! www.heartlanduae.com

name: kite beach
description: Long sand beach, locals come for picknick, fishing and kiting here. Be awarded from the tide!

name: sudan embassy
description:
To apply for a tourist visa you need letter of invitation from a tour agency in Sudan first. We used George from akropole hotel khartoum (acropolekhartoum@gmail.com). You have to book a room (€100) and than they will give you the letter for "free". 
With this letter you go to the consul and take a number for visa at counter 3. (visa section) The man at the counter they will tell you it is only possible to apply for a tourist visa if you are a UAE resident. If you explain you are travelling and are unable to apply in homeland or at ministery of foreign affairs they will let you see the consul (mister Omer in the office next to the restroom). Bring the letter of invitation, 2 photo's and the filled in form. Put your charm to work and he will make some calls with khartoum to make it work. Go back to counter 3 to give paperwork, than pay at counter 2 (600 AED per visa). The visa is finished the same day (with us it took 1 hour)

name: Entrance Gate Guwaifat Border Exit UAE
description: TRUCK CAMPERS also take the lane for cars and buses and not the lane for commercial trucks.

name: Parking for Exit Process for Truck Campers and Buses
description: Truck campers park here for the exit stamp in your passport, the stamp in the carnet and for VAT reimbursement

name: Car Parking for Exit UAE
description: Park your car here to get the exit stamp in your passport, to get the stamp in your Carnet and for reimbursment of VAT

name: EXIT BUILDING
description:
In this building you will receive the exit stamp in your passport and can get a VAT refund if the invoice has a corresponding barcode sticker.

The Carnet de Passage is not stamped directly here. It is brought to customs and stamped there and brought back again. But you have to tell people where and how they have to stamp it.

name: Border Guwaifah Exit Gate
description: You got two stamped leaflets at the exit control in your passport. One leaflet hand it over at this gate, the second hand it over at the exit gate of the Saudi Border

name: Public sandy beach Al Bidya.
description:
Lots of rubble and rubbish, but the beach and water are clean in the area of ​​the tide.  
Caution: tide can be over 2m here!  Totally quiet at night, a few locals during the day.

name: Kalba Park Beach
description: It is probably one of the largest public beaches in the region.  Very clean because the beach is cleaned regularly with machines.  Campers are not prohibited.  Tents are not allowed any more than pets.

name: Parking space on the side channel to the mangoves.
description:
Parking space on the side channel to the mangroves, with sandy beach. 
Except fishing, nothing is forbidden here.  Fishermen and sports rowers during the day, totally calm at night. 
A first class fish restaurant with local specialties, but not cheap;  also served to the camper.

name: Water tap in front of a mosque
description: water tap on the parking of a mosque. good presure. you can also use a hose.

name: Alhaseer
description: Incredible staff, very oriental food! Try their breakfast ” manager from Sudanesi, knows how to treat hungry guests.

name: Brother's Gas
description: Factory to refill gas tanks.Ours was a Cadac bottle from South Africa. We paid 50 aeD for 5 kg.

name: Exit UAE / entry Oman
description:
Exit point Emirates/ entry point Oman.

Exit Dubai: passport stamp in office left at the gate (60 dirham exit fee) After that we needed to walk back to the customs building, which is located at the entry gate to Emirates. There we received a stamp in the cdp easily.

Entry Oman: straight forward, first stamp in passport (inside office) and from there to customs and cdp stamp. We had a light car search. 

Total process was about 40 minutes, friendly people and straight forward process

name: Truck House
description:
truck wash, grease, oil change and tire service 
good and fair service for big rigs.

name: Abu Dhabi Water Filling Station
description: Big water filling station for trucks. We asked for water at the entrance. We could drive inside the yard. There is a smaller tube and you can fill up your tank or your container. Very friendly staff.

name: Camping
description: Camping with nice big cottages (summer houses). We had the big one for 4 people for just two of us. Maybe not the cheapest one, but with hot water, fast wifi, kitchen, microwave, AC and TV. Very clean. Paid 200 Dirhams for one night. They have very good restaurant here - breakfast, lunch or dinner for reasonable prices, deicious taste, fruity dessert for lunch. Safe, closed place for bike or car, nice helpful staff, kind manager. Close to the port.

name: African & Eastern Alcohol Store
description: If you want to buy beer and wine go here. This African & Eastern Store is open until 10 at night, very nice guys, no need for license, you just buy and go, the zoo wild camp is not far away, we tried the other two places on iOverlander, but did not work out, closed or did not find. Go here, very easy.

name: Union insurance
description: I came here but they don't sell temporary insurance. They sent me to Al Ain Al Ahdia. Very friendly.

name: Fishing Tackle Shops
description: Get your fishing Tackle here! Many shops cheaper than others around.

name: Al Bahia Cannel
description: Good place to stay close to Abu Dhabi and airport. There is a lot of space on both sides of the channel. Can be busy and loud in the evening till late with people coming for BBQ, specially on weekend and holiday. Calm in the morning.

name: Al Shoula Gas Co.
description:
Gas filling station. Paid 75 Aed for 15 kg cylinder refill. 
Opened: 07:00-09:00 or after 14:00. Closed from 09:00-14:00.

name: Touratech Middle East & BYX
description:
Motorcycle accessories, repairs, spare parts, information about the region, trainings. 
Here you can get help for any kind of motorcycle. They can order high quality parts, maintain and repair your motorcycle. Qualified staff and and a friendly atmosphere. Official Touratech Store. 
Heidenau Tires available. 
+971 50 651 0770
+971 56 430 1360
info@touratech.ae
Sat. - Thu. 10 - 22h
Fri. 12 - 22 h

name: Al Fajer Auto Garage
description: A very competent garage, which is also familiar with diesel vehicles. It is a garage and a car parts dealer that works with Toyota, Nissan and Mitsubishi. The operators speak very good English and are helpful. The prices for the work were reasonable. Also the original spare parts were much cheaper than at home in Switzerland.

name: Emirates Gas LLC
description:
Gas filling station. It took them about an hour to fill our Swiss bottle. An adapter of the Euro filling set was necessary. Apparently they are not allowed to sell gas to private persons, only to dealers. Therefore it took so long. On our receipt it says as customer: unknown. 6 Euro for 5kg gas. Pretty expensive.

Opening hours: 09:00-14:00

name: Land Rover Garage Al Nahhas
description: we found this place to replace the breaks of our Defender. The work on all models of LR, easy going, fair prices, clean garage. If you have problems with your Landy call for appointment, speak English very well.

name: African & Eastern alcohol store
description: Here you can buy all kinds of alcohol. Get license in store, don’t forget to bring your passport, valid for 30 days.

name: Etisalat shop
description: Etisalat shop for SIM/ data, inside big shopping mall

name: Baker's Kitchen
description: Typical german bakery, with sourdough bread in different varieties, cakes etc. Also a restaurant with breakfast, lunch and dinner. Very nice and welcoming owners. Recommended. Opening hours 07.00 - 21.30.

name: Sharjah Beach
description: Parking area for Sharjah beach. Perfect stay before or after the ferry. The beach closes at sunset, so all the locals and tourists will leave and you have the parking for yourself. you can hear the street in the night, but NO cars will park next to you with loud music. 24 hours guarded. here we spent 3 nights in total and it was quieter than at the aquarium. Lovely beach for swimming.

name: Parking Al Ain Oasis
description:
Parking on east gate of Al Ain Oasis. It seems like all other people enter the oasis from west side. so this parking was very quite. the road next to it is also not very busy. good to sleep for one night. 
Nice parking guards (24h) who allowed us to stay here. There are public toilets on the opposite side of the street.

name: Ghost City Al Madame
description: In the dunes next to the abbandoned ghost city Al Madame. The city is worth a visit and here is a nice and quite place to enjoy the night. Pay attention, at some places the soft is very soft.

name: Quiet spot near Border
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Vehicle access uncertain

Quiet spot, near the road but out of sight, under a tree, perfect for bicycle touring. 
8km to the border.
Du signal 3G ok

name: Consulate General Turkmenistan
description:
Opening hours: 9:00-12:00 for Visa Service

At the moment (February 2020) they are not allowed to issue Transit Visa. Mr. Orayev was very friendly and helpful. He spoke good English. He contacted the Ministery of Foreign Affairs, but they said at the moment they are not allowed to issue transit visas. We should apply in March in Iran. See picture for contact details. Parking right in front of the embassy.
You would need the following documents to apply for the transit visa (5 days). 
- 1 passport copy
- 2 photos (3×4cm)
- 1 application form (will be handed out at the consulate)
- 1 letter with entry/exit point and route
- copy of Iran Visa
- Copy of Usbekistan visa (or confirmation/screenshot that you do not need a visa)
- pay 10$ 

Wait 7-10 days to get the sticker into your passport or to receive the reference number by e-mail.

name: RV Gulf (Caravan store)
description: Big caravan shop with all kind of stuff you need for your caravan. The also sell water purification liquid (similar like micropure, but called Camco Drinking water Freshener), RV tank cleaner/treatment, adapters,...

name: Near lake Mubazzara
description: Large area where people come for picnic. It's a bit away from the busy area. We've been sent here by the responsible of the security. Not really beautiful  but OK to overnight.

name: Nana RV repair workshop
description:
This is the only place like this you will find in UAE, Oman or Saudi. They fix everything here : water tanks, aluminium and metal work, electrical system, body work on RV and camper.
Call the boss Nana on +971 (0)55 189 6958 and she will help you.

name: Gate with height limitation
description: Gate with height limitation. We did not measure. Estimation is about 3.30 m but without any guarantee. Trucks more than 3.70 m high definitely don't pass.  Cars OK. Campers should also be OK.

name: between mountains and dunes
description:
we spent here a quiet night.
you can see (and hear) the highway.
during the day busy traffic on the dirtyroads and shooting noise out of southern red marked areas.
no service etisalat!

name: Etisalat SIM with original passport, but only with long pants!
description:
They send you away, if you wear short pants!
Original Passport necessary. 
After entrance you take a waitingnumber on the left side for Nr. 11.

name: Spinneys wine, spirits and beer and excellent food.
description:
excellent international foodstore (incl. shop for nonmuslim) 24 h open, but very expensive.
at the corner alcohol shop where you can get nearly everything but twice or triple price as the Ras-al-Kaiman Shop in iO!

name: waterland amusement park
description:
We arrived yesterday with the ferry in Bandar-Abbas, the checked all passengers on temperature. 
We have got a certificate in English, that we are free from corona.
But 80 km west, we are not allowed to stay at the beach, but they brought us to this locked (during corona virus time) amusement park.
Never before we had a whole park allone for us!
Sanitary installation not new but ok. WC, Douche. A lot of wild dogs, but friendly. Bright view on the mangroves. 
You see and hear the road, but we could sleep at night.

name: Eurostar cellar
description: The largest package store is UAE to restock on drinks for the campfire.

name: Al Qudra Last Exit
description: Gas station, bike rental, mosque, toilets, Food trucks, tyre inflation.

name: Gas Distributor
description: for weeks I tried to refill my Australian gas cylinder without success. Jashir came to check out the cylinder, took it with him over night and made some Adapter to fit my bottle. the next day I got it back, refilled. Jashir prefers to be contacted, he will come, check out and deliver. contact +971509972043

name: Off road museum
description:
If you like cars and jeep, this is your place! One of the most impressive cars I have seen in my life!
It is free and worth a visit!
380vehicles wait for you

name: Change money
description: In one of these mobile shops you can change Saudi-emirates money at almost official rate

name: Back packer top 10
description: Clean hostel in different floors. It’s not the best one, but for 65aed in dormitory is ok (if you book by booking it’s even cheaper). There are a lot of parking  underground the building

name: Umm Al Quwain Around the Mangrove
description: Water side camping spots. Flat and opened. It's quiet and relax while still being close to the road. Accessible to all vehicles. Please respect the greenery, and nature. Take your trash with you and eventually pick up the one you find (Too many unfortunately) Be aware that the water isn't deep and not really suitable for swimming.

name: Arrival from Iran
description:
When we arrived at the port, passengers with vehicles had to drive the cars off first. Then we had to wait till all the other passengers were in the customs’ transportation bus. Afterwards, we had to follow the bus to the immigration office, where we did the (passenger) immigration. Then we had to drive back to the dock by our car. Next to the ferry is a small office/container from the shipping company (blue container, Mr. Nasar (he is Indian) will wait for you). There, you will get some documents (costs are around 150 USD) and a small paper, which describes the procedure’s steps (see picture). You can do it easily by yourself as most of the customs‘ staff speaks English and also knows what you have to do next. After each step you get told what to do next and where to go. At three different steps you have to pay a certain amount of money: 20 AED, 90 AED and 145 AED (last is related to your car). In total we paid  255 AED. 

For the whole procedure (from car off the ferry to car out of main gate) we needed 3.5 hours.

name: Al Mawasim Picnic
description: camping gear and equipment and fishing gear.

name: Petrol Station
description: Petrol Station with mini market and camping shop and fast food shop.

name: Wadi Al Hilo Archeological Site
description: Perfect little spot in the car park of the archeological site right next to the recreation of an old watch tower.  Locals around but all waved and smiled.  Goose farm close but that said, super quiet at night and a nice little 20 minute hill to climb if you're up for it.

name: Free Spirit Motorcycles
description: These guys helped us with fixing our motorcycle. very friendly and fast. Contact Bruce (owner): +971558854983

name: Khatt Plateau
description: Khatt mountains are in the large part flat hills spreading over the horizon of Ras Al Khaimah. The off-road trails leading through this landscape will allow you appreciate the raw beauty of nature. The terrain can require some 4×4 driving skills.

name: Beautiful
description:
I would say, this is the most tidy beach since a long time with a beautiful surrounding view. It was very calm, but a few cars came along the wide sandy track, which is easy to access (no 4x4 needed). There are palms and bbq places, benches and small pavillons.
It's a huge very flat and sandy area, even nice for a few nights.

name: Just "WOW"
description:
The ocean on the one side and the hilly desert landscape on the other.
This place along the beach is absolutely stunning. The ocean looks emerald green and there are dozens of off-road tracks through the desert, you're even able to reach the huge flat plateau of one of the hills.
The beach is super tidy, it's very calm here and usually easy accessible. A 4x4 isn't really needed, as long as you won't go too close to the beach, but if you're letting air down of your tires, you'll be fine.

name: Al Wathba artificial lake
description: This new recreation place is set by a small lake. It has barbecue and clean toilets.It can be a bit windy and the weekends full of local families durring the day only though.

name: Jebel Hafeet
description: Although added as an overnight stay here,it is worth also to drive even if you do not stay. The views are magnificent and it can be a nice day out of Al Ain. There is a basic local restaurant and brand new toilets

name: Camping store
description: Great camping store realy cheap. Nice people very helpful. We bought a privacy tent since showers are spartan in UAE.

name: Hatta Wadi Hub free camp
