description: We were send here by the Hatta Wadi Hub payed camp. This is a small recreation place with some barbecue's and an artificial pond. Locals come and hung out at night but not crazy parties. We had a quite night. No facilities here but you can use the showers and toilets in the campground if you need to. Good for a night or two and free.

name: Perfect For Visiting The Mosque
description:
This place has been perfect for visiting the area around, especially the Sheikh Zayed Mosque. At night everything is illuminated here and you're able to access the mosque, by crossing the neon-illuminated bridge.
If you wanna see the mosque from the inside, you need to keep left and walk a few hundred meters, as there's no access, when heading right.
Right you could go for night-photography, then the mosque shines in its full glory.
The place is huge, very flat and super tidy.
Nobody disturbed us here.

name: Good Place
description:
Good, flat, calm, tidy place for exploring the area around.
We stood here for one night, without problems.
Nevertheless the traffic of the main street has been a bit annoying

name: Ajman free beach
description: We came here since the near by Bianky Beach Camp, Ajman is no longer operating. Another typical UAE public beach with many people having barbecues on the beach. Do not come here for a quite night. Local people were happy to meet us and extremely hospitable. A big number of permanent caravans as well. Great for one night!

name: PERFECT 360° View
description:
We loved this huge, very calm and tidy parking lot, with a breathtaking 360° view to the skyline, the ocean/bay and the Emirates palace.
From here it's a short walk for taking breathtaking photos of the surroundings.
We stood here for 3 days and here and there the Police came along and asked us, if we're in need of anything. Standing here wasn't a problem for them, even if this lot was marked as "paid parking", but also the Police said, there isn't anything here for paying.

name: At The Salt Lake...
description:
... but there isn't any lake here... at least not anymore.
Tourists came here and maybe also have been a bit disappointed, nevertheless it's a nice spot within the desert and good for a night.

name: Beach wild camping
description:
Very quite and sort of isolated spot. We got there in the dark but woke up on a nice view of the gulf water. It was a very low tide that day yet, very refreshing.

We would say yes, a 4x4 is very recommended.

name: Adnoc
description: Gas station with all the facilities you can think of like a grocery store, propane tank refill, tire air and car service.

name: Daily Gate Pass arrivals from Iran
description: After shipping your vehicle from Iran to Dubai, you need to buy a daily gate pass here to be able to access the harbour. Cost: 10 AED.

name: Al shwihaat
description: Fresh water nearby the road Free no need for for wheel

name: Oldtimer Motorcycles
description: Motorcycle Shop: with Workshop, large Sales Room for Clothes, Accessories and Travel Gear.

name: Al Osturah Alalamiah Used 4x4 Auto Parts
description:
Scrap Yard: Used Spare Parts for 4x4
050-9966 889

name: Cotton Washing & Gar. Ironing
description:
Laundry with 6 maschines
Prices per maschine:
Cold - 8 AED
Warm - 9 AED
Hot - 10 AED
Dry 40 min - 5 AED

Drying needs more time for a full load.

name: Al Khan Beach
description: Beach to swim in bikini with toilets and outdoor showers. Entry fee is 10 AED but with a recent entry stamp in the passport its free for tourists. Parking is possible in the front of the beach (Gate 1 Al Khan) for free.

name: Shower and Toilets at Al Sahil Beach
description: Free indoor shower and toilets at Al Sahil Beach. Parking across the road for 2 AED / hour (free on friday and public holidays).

name: Al Ain Ahlia Insurance.
description: They provide vehicle insurance. 160 AED for 10 days, 300 AED for 1 month. Easy to arrange in the office. Open on Monday-Thursday and Friday morning.

name: Yard 6 Cabin (Delivery Order pickup)
description:
This is the location of the yard 6 cabin. We needed to pick up our delivery order here.
First you need to get a Daily Gate Pass from 25.35669, 55.37537 (see the PDF from jam.berlin for more details)

name: Bright Travel
description: Will print Color visa print for 2 Dirham

name: Next to a pond on a hill
description: Nice new established small ponds. Very nice, cool breeze and quiet. We came here because the lower informal site is under construction.

name: water at Mosque
description:
Here you get water from the Mosque. Very easy to reach. Good pressure from big and long hose.
Ask people there before you fill up.
Inside is cold drinking water.

name: Terminal for personel shipping
description: If you go separately with your vehicle from Sharjah to Bandar Abbas you have to check in here. (Shipping company in our case is Valfajr)

name: Tuk Tuk restaurant
description:
The best Tom yam and Thai tea ! Plus free WiFi . We went there every day while we where in Abu Dhabi. We saw many
Thai and Asian people as customers. The owner is a really nice Thai gentleman. Highly recommend it !

name: Heavy Duty Garage
description: Workshop Specialized in Offroad and overland modifications for cars

name: Al Quaa Easy Camping point
description: Easy camping point in remote desert area called Al Quaa القوع

name: Home Tree
description: A spot inside the desert where you can find home tree, shade and good break point to relax and have lunch

name: جامع المرفا
description:
It is a mosque for Muslims that is open all the time. I was traveling and looking for a place to rest in. I do not have a tent, only a blanket and a pillow, and I was glad to have it at that time. It was air-conditioned and the toilets were open and equipped with a shower and clean.

هو جامع للمسلمين مفتوح طوال الوقت كنت مسافرا وابحث عن مكان ارتاح فيه وليس لدي خيمه ، فقط بطانيه ومخده
وسعدت لوجوده حينها وكان مكيفا ودورات المياه مفتوحه ومهيئه بدش ونظيفه

name: Dubai Half-desert near bus
description: We took a last bus from the center of Dubai there. Don’t forget to upload enough credit to your bus card!! Place is Maybe ten minutes from bus stop. Sand ground. During our stay there were some workers, we left during the sunrise.(first bus back to Dubai center)

name: on the way to Jebel Jais
description: Nice place to stop, view the surroundings and overnight. 4G internet, quiet at night, no shade. On the way to the top there are more than 10 of these places-some even with toilets.
